name: Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum Gotinsprun
review: A Syrah look-alike, this Zweigelt blend delivers inky blackberry flavors, bacon fat, fine concentration and depth and some rough-and-tumble tannins. A hint of new oak rounds it out a little. Great character. Drink now through 2003. 415 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum
review: Violet and red raspberry flavors fill this to the brim, revealing an alluring creaminess and a crunchy spiciness. A good flush of minerality shows on the peppery finish. Drink now through 2017. 90 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum Dornenvogel
review: Juicy, with concentrated, well-spiced flavors of ripe red peach and ruby grapefruit. Notes of slate and white pepper mark the finish. Drink now through 2016. 175 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Trocken Carnuntum
review: A fruity aroma leads to lavender-accented ripe pear and apple flavors, which feature buttery overtones. Rich and spicy on the finish, with plenty of mineral notes. Drink now through 2017. 780 cases imported.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum Rieden Cuvée
review: A peppery red, with good concentration and a savory edge to the raspberry, blueberry and lingonberry flavors. The snappy acidity and a spicy finish give this verve. Drink now. 75 cases imported.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum Riedencuvée
review: Ripe, with good depth and richness to the dark plum, mocha and mineral flavors. There's plenty of vanilla and spice as well, with a plush finish. Drink now through 2014. 136 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Carnuntum Reserve
review: Gorgeous character of smoky blackberry and vanilla is married to a medium-bodied, lean frame sporting good acidity. Well balanced, with moderate tannins. Drink now through 2000. 330 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum
review: Crisp and spicy, with green apple, pear and melon flavors that feature sour white cherry notes, which extend on the finish. Drink now. 938 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum
review: Rich and smooth, with a lively underpinning of acidity, this white offers lentil and grapefruit notes that linger on the refreshing finish. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum Dornenvogel
review: A svelte Grüner Veltliner, combining apple, peach and grapefruit flavors reined in by tangy acidity at the end. A crowd pleaser. Drink now through 2003.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum Riedencuvée
review: The fresh-crushed sour cherry and red plum flavors feature notes of savory herb and spice. The inky finish turns ripe and brooding. Drink now.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum Riedencuvée
review: This has good density to the dark plum, blackberry and dried cherry flavors, accented by notes of espresso and Asian spice. Dark chocolate on the finish. Drink now.

name: Blauer Zweigelt Qualitätswein Carnuntum Dornen Vogel
review: Delicious, packed with blackberry character, rich texture and firm structure. Concentrated, with a good finish. Drink now through 2002. 330 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum
review: Cherry, cedar and tobacco flavors feature prominently in this medium-bodied, firm red. It's lively, with moderate tannins and a lingering, cedary finish. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Carnuntum
review: Thick and creamy, here's an attractive, apple- and almond-infused white on a round, broad profile. Drink now. 840 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Carnuntum Dornen Vogel
review: Good intensity of spicy, white pepper character, with fresh fruit flavors and crisp acidity. Slightly short finish. 500 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum
review: Offers a fruity aroma, with flavors of ripe peach and blood orange. The finish of meringue, spice and vanilla lingers. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum Dornenvogel
review: Light and fruity, with well-blended aromas and flavors of rose petal, guava and peach. Hints of chocolate and spice grace the finish. Drink now. 38 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Carnuntum
review: A crunchy white, with a grassy component overlaying the lemon verbena and dried mint flavors, which turn ripe on the finish. Drink now. 20 cases imported.

name: Weissburgunder Kabinett Carnuntum
review: Broad-shouldered for Pinot Blanc, with appley, floral and nutty flavors, firm acidity and a long finish. Try with seafood or chicken. Drink now. 580 cases made.

name: Weissburgunder Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum Classic
review: Lightweight and crisp in style, with grapefruit and apple notes. Fairly rich through the midpalate, then it turns lean, but minerally on the finish. Drink now.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum Dornen Vogel
review: Bright cherry flavors are interwoven with accents of vanilla and spice. Medium-bodied, with good concentration and a lively finish. 415 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum Rieden Cuvée
review: A straightforward red, this offers a pure cherry note with a smoky accent and grainy texture. Not that complex, but good concentration. Drink now through 2006.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum Riedencuvée
review: Bursting with freshly crushed blackberry flavor, this round, fruity red has an easy appeal. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Carnuntum
review: The green apple and ripe lime flavors are a touch tart. Glazed onion notes show on the spicy finish. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Carnuntum
review: A good, solid Grüner displaying a vanilla aroma and the characteristic lentil flavor, this will stand up to food. Drink now through 2002. 250 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum Rieden Cuvée
review: Plum and spice notes introduce this crisp, light-bodied red. It's immediate and refreshing in its appeal. 1,665 cases made.

name: Blauer Zweigelt Qualitätswein Carnuntum Rieden Cuvée
review: Solid, with plenty of grapey, fresh fruit flavors bolstered by moderate tannins and vibrant acidity. 1,665 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Carnuntum
review: Rich, Port-like aromas, followed by a fruity palate that turns lean and astringent. Perhaps food would soften it. 580 cases made.

name: Weissburgunder Kabinett Trocken Carnuntum
review: Not very Sauvignon-like in character, but it's fresh and vibrant with lemon and mineral flavors. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Australia Show Reserve
review: Dark and soft, offering spicy, exotic caramel and pear flavors, remaining plump on the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Australia Show Reserve
review: Dark, ripe and juicy, with a strong minty-herbal streak running through the ripe berry and cherry flavors, finishing soft. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Australia Show Reserve
review: Fresh and slightly grippy with tannin, but has pretty currant and vaguely herbal flavors that echo nicely. Drink now through 2004. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Champagne Dosage Zé
review: Crisp and crunchy, this modest Champagne delivers a citrusy overtone and hints of white peach, lemon curd, salted nut and smoke. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Niagara Escarpment-New York
review: Mature, yet complex and expressive. Perfumed aromas of sweet, slightly decaying fruit, spice and autumn woods. Bright, with intensity and finely integrated tannins. Long finish. Drink now. 626 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Niagara Escarpment-New York
review: A whiff of acetone is almost too overpowering for the dried berry, autumn woods and spice notes. This is advanced for its age, with a silky texture and a nice finish. May be too much for some. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir Niagara Escarpment-New York
review: Already brick in color, this evokes dried flowers, faded fruit and attics in the sunshine. There's a hint of sweetness, but this is dry in the end. Past its prime.

name: Pinot Noir Niagara Escarpment-New York Rhinebeck Clay
review: Cola and tar flavors make up this straightforward, lightly spritzy red.

name: Brut Michigan Champagne
review: Pineapple, fruit cocktail aromas and flavors, with a note of almond extract, slightly cloying, on the finish. 225 cases made.

name: Riesling Lake Michigan Shore Semi-Dry
review: Just off-dry, with some lime and green apple notes and a piney finish. 400 cases made.

name: Muscat Victoria
review: Unctuous and sweet, with generous plum, spice and brown sugar flavors, hinting at coffee beans on the long, round finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Merlot Victoria Reserve
review: Ripe, round and generous, with effusive raspberry, blackberry and cherry flavors. It all hangs elegantly on a supple frame, with velvety tannins and hints of spicy oak nicely integrated into the package. Approachable now. Best after 2000. 600 cases made.

name: Shiraz Victoria
review: Crisp and focused, nicely built to aim its blueberry, pepper and anise flavors to the fore, echoing modestly on the finish. Needs short-term cellaring to settle down. Best after 2002. 300 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Victoria
review: Shows lots of ripe flavor on a crisp frame, offering blackberry, mint and earth notes that linger on the supple finish. Drink now through 2007. 150 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherglen Reserve
review: Ripe and generous, with juicy currant and plum fruit up front, lingering nicely on the supple finish. Drink now through 2010. 250 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz Victoria Brimin
review: Smooth and generous, with soft cherry and tobacco flavors. Echoes plum and spice on the finish. Drink now through 2002. 600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Victoria
review: Bright and refreshing for its citrusy pear and Santa Rosa plum flavors, which reverberate nicely on the lively finish. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Shiraz Rutherglen Parola's Limited Release
review: Dark and peppery, with modest blackberry, cherry and licorice flavors that linger gently. Drink now through 2010. 250 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Rutherglen Reserve
review: Distinctive, with plum, floral and spice flavors and a dried berry note weaving through the firm finish. Drink now through 2010. 250 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Victoria
review: Bright and crisp, with tangy blackberry, tar and herb flavors packed into the finish. Needs to soften. Best after 1999. 200 cases made.

name: Shiraz Rutherglen Reserve
review: Ripe, and a bit hot, with exotic spices mingling with dark berry flavors. Drink now through 2010. 250 cases imported.

name: Merlot King Valley
review: Pleasantly light and fruity, with pretty currant and plum flavors in modest proportions. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Shiraz Rutherglen Parola's Limited Release
review: Broad and spicy, a big, rich, alcoholic red with nutmeg, clove and prune character. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Victoria
review: Ripe and sturdy, with distinct tints of orange and orange-flower to the pear and spice flavors. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Victoria
review: Tries to pack a lot of flavor onto a lean frame, but the flavors tend toward raw wood and lime. 200 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Offers seamless flavors of kirsch, chocolate, dark plum and allspice, fresh and elegant, with a towering structure and intense red berry accents. Unctuous and long on the finish, showing loads of grip. Best from 2030 through 2060. 3,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Offers lovely perfumed aromas and beautiful raspberry and blackberry character, turning to tar, black truffle and wet earth. Full-bodied and medium sweet, with a balance of very chewy tannins and sugary fruit at the finish. This goes on and on. The great 1994 again? Best after 2020. 6,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: A great surprise for the vintage. Displays fabulous concentration and complex character with its layers of very sweet fruit, chocolate and cherry aromas and flavors. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins. Long finish with plenty of grip. Beautiful wine. Best after 2008. 13,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Dark in profile, with warm buckwheat, singed juniper and espresso notes leading off, backed by warm black currant and fig compote flavors. Has heft, but the brambly undertow is easily absorbed through the finish. Approachable, but there's no rush at all.--1997 Vintage Port retrospective (January 2017). Best from 2019 through 2035. 10,000 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old
review: A rich and refined tawny Port, with lush flavors of dried date, glazed apricot, salted almond and butterscotch,supported by zippy acidity. The long, plush finish has mouthwatering citrus notes. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Deep garnet. Very pretty plum and berry aromas, with hints of honey and toffee. Turns to custard. Full-bodied, sweet and fresh. Firm tannins, with elegance and balance. Will age for a long time, but ready. Generous, but subtle. '77/'85/'97 blind Port retrospective. Drink now.

name: Vintage Port
review: This may be one of the greatest Warre vintages ever produced. It is still amazingly crisp and firm. Medium ruby-garnet, with a unique nose of boysenberry syrup, abundant sweet cassis flavors, an excellent balance of velvety tannins and a long finish.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old
review: Graceful, featuring lush and rich flavors of baked pear, caramel, toffee and cream that are long and well-spiced. Cardamom and white chocolate notes fill the elegant and pure finish, with hints of tarragon. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old Otima
review: Very plush, with a buttery essence to the dried white fruit and nutty flavors. Elegantly spiced, featuring a long finish of dried ginger, sandalwood and shortbread. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Extremely impressive, with beautifully balanced, harmonious sweet fruit on the palate. Medium ruby-red, ripe cherry and cassis aromas, medium-bodied, with rich, velvety fruit flavors, full, soft tannins and a powerful finish.

name: Vintage Port Quinta da Cavadinha
review: There's a beautiful nose of licorice, raspberry and mineral. What fruit this has--and there's loads of it, yet this is balanced and refined. Full, medium sweet and silky. Racy and captivating for the vintage. Best after 2015.

name: Vintage Port Quinta da Cavadinha
review: This young Port sneaks up on you and then--bam! Aromas of grapes, flowers and minerals pave the way for a slowly building palate that finishes with a burst of ripe, exotic fruit. Full-bodied, yet very tight and held back. Better than when previously reviewed as a barrel samples. Best after 2008. 7,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Quinta da Cavadinha
review: Features an aroma of sage and honey, with rich, powerful flavors of mocha, wild cherry and spiced currant, flanked by plenty of spicy notes. The elegant finish has hints of sandalwood and brown sugar. Drink now through 2020. 150 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old Otima
review: Well-honed, with a touch of sweetness to the plush flavors of butterscotch, pear tart, almond and vanilla. Orange peel and dried ginger accents emerge on the seductively spicy finish. Drink now. 8,500 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old Otima
review: Fresh, with plenty of vibrant acidity behind the cocoa, vanilla and dried apricot flavors. Spicy and creamy notes linger on the long, broad finish. Drink now. 1,450 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old Otima
review: Roasted sesame seed notes pervade the languid flavors of dried apricot, cherry paste and butter cream. Intense toffee accents show on the supple finish, with hints of Bourbon vanilla. A bit of a throwback, but distinctively rich and complex. Drink now. 825 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Lovely floral aromas of berries, violets and minerals. Full-bodied, with firm tannins and a racy finish. A harmonious yet well-toned Warre. Reminds me of the 1991. Best after 2010. 9,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Ruby-colored, with grape, dark chocolate and plum. Full and chewy. Tannins are still there and need to mellow. Medium-sweet and grapey. A little one-dimensional still, but impressive. '77/'85/'97 blind Port retrospective. Drink now.

name: Vintage Port
review: There is still plenty of fresh, youthful fruit here. Medium ruby-red, with an intense floral and berry nose, medium-bodied, with rich, sweet fruit flavors, medium tannins and a lingering finish. Very good fruit.

name: Vintage Port
review: Deep and complex, with notes of spice, ripe plum and herb swirling through the generous brown sugar and smoke flavors.--1947 horizontal.

name: White Port Fine
review: This is luscious and creamy, with concentrated flavors of baked apple, vanilla, pear and almond tart that feature loads of spicy notes. Honey and crème brûlée accents linger on the long finish. Drink now through 2025. 800 cases imported.

name: Late Bottled Port Bottle Aged
review: This has a mulled spice edge around the core of dark plum, fig and boysenberry preserve flavors. Warm licorice and singed alder accents lurk on the finish. An intriguing mix of mature notes, with fruit that's still gutsy and youthful. Drink now through 2018. 900 cases imported.

name: Late Bottled Port Bottle Aged
review: Supple and mature-tasting, with notes of sandalwood and cedar to the roasted plum and spiced cherry flavors. Minerally finish. 1,400 cases imported.

name: Late Bottled Port Traditional
review: A wine packed with fruit. Real vintage character. Wonderful now. Very grapey, with blackberry and wet earth character. Medium-bodied, with plenty of fruit and a lovely, fruity, medium-sweet aftertaste. Drink now through 2012. 10,000 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port Unfiltered
review: Complex aromas of milk chocolate, sweet berries and flowers lead to a full body, with medium sweetness and a long, caressing finish. This is as fine as an aged Vintage Port. Bottled in 2004 and matured in bottle in Warre's cellars until now. Decant before serving. Should improve with age. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Port Warrior Reserve
review: A fruity style, with luscious plum, raspberry and cherry flavors that are deep and rich. Asian spice and dark chocolate notes linger on the fresh, minerally finish. Drink now through 2025. 11,500 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old Otima
review: A ripe and rich tawny. Loads of caramel, honey and dried fruits, with just a hint of Douro bake, or iodine character. Full-bodied, sweet and very toffeelike on the palate. Long finish. Dying for nuts and Stilton. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old Otima
review: Redolent of dried citrus, glazed apricot and honey cream notes, flecked with hints of tarragon. The finish of toffee displays an intense spiciness, lingering with caramel nuances. Balanced and refined. Drink now. 8,300 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old Otima
review: There's good intensity here, with a racy hazelnut edge alongside the core of singed walnut, sesame, toffee and cinnamon notes. Offers a focused, dry edge through the finish. Drink now. 13,400 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old
review: Medium-bodied, rich and balanced, with a light amber color and plenty of peppery notes to the dried fruit flavors. Features notes of crème brûlée on the finish. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Raisiny and very sweet, with plum and prune aromas and flavors. Medium- to full-bodied, with a slightly hot finish, but should come around nicely. '91/'92 Port retrospective. Drink now through 2014. 6,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Quinta da Cavadinha
review: Fresh and expressive up front, this is a muscular style, especially for the vintage, with a mix of loganberry, açaí and mulberry notes carried by a violet thread. The rich finish gains depth with air, and there's a long echo of warm fruitcake.  Best from 2021 through 2036. 350 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: A serious alternative to vintage Port. Good deep color, with complex aromas of cherry, berry and flowers. Medium-bodied, medium sweet, with chewy tannins and a long, fruity finish. Needs decanting. Drink now.

name: Late Bottled Port Bottle Aged
review: This is well-rounded and mature, offering lovely rose petal and violet notes to the flavors of plum tart, dark cherry and milk chocolate, accented by hints of white pepper, with a sanguine finish. Drink now. 1,850 cases imported.

name: Ruby Port Heritage
review: A rich and ripe style, with well-crafted flavors of dark plum, raspberry and chocolate that offer good grip. The supple finish has smoky hints. Drink now through 2020. 2,600 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old Otima
review: Vibrant and floral, with a soft amber color and raspberry, caramel and dried apricot flavors. Medium-bodied, with a dried plum- and berry-filled finish that shows toffee notes. Drink now. 23,000 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port King's
review: This offers flavors of cocoa powder, plum tart and chocolate that lengthen out nicely with hints of smoke and sandalwood. Pure and fresh on the luscious finish. Drink now. 1,300 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Lots of ripe fruit and licorice on the nose and palate. Medium- to full-bodied, with medium sweetness and a medium finish. Balanced. Slightly disappointing for Warre. Best after 2009. 7,800 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port Bottle-Matured
review: A harmonious, traditional LBV. Chunky and fruity for a 1986, with velvety tannins and a long, sweet berry aftertaste. Medium-bodied. Drink now through 2005.

name: Port Warrior Finest Reserve
review: Forward and direct, with tasty blackberry and blueberry paste flavors, lined with a licorice snap thread. A hint of singed wood lines the finish, giving this a little extra range. Drink now. 10,300 cases imported.

name: Port Warrior Reserve
review: Ripe, featuring exuberant, well-sculpted dark plum and dark cherry flavors. Finishes with chocolate and dried raspberry. Very zesty. Drink now. 16,000 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port King's
review: Lightly smoky, with some saline notes to the sandalwood, cream and dried berry flavors. Supple, showing mocha accents on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port Reserve
review: It's so sweet it hurts your teeth. Complex, tasty tawny boasting dried herb, flan and burnt sugar character and full body. Wild thing.

name: Vintage Port
review: Slightly simple and sweet, but still very good. Deep purple, with fresh violet and berry aromas, full-bodied, with very sweet fruit flavors, full tannins and a medium finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: A solid vintage Port from an unsung vintage. Medium ruby, with clean perfume and black cherry aromas, full-bodied, with silky, sweet concentrated berry flavors and a medium finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: Wonderful fruit on the palate, but slightly one-dimensional. Medium to deep red, with earthy cassis and tomato aromas, full-bodied, with concentrated black cherry flavors, medium tannins and a long, sweet finish. Quite delicate.

name: Port Warrior Reserve
review: The berry and red plum flavors are firm and juicy in this muscular ruby. Cardamom and ginger notes fill the zesty finish. Drink now. 11,100 cases imported.

name: Ruby Port Heritage
review: Plump and filled with blueberry and plum paste flavors, backed by hint of raisin and licorice snap on the modestly juicy finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old
review: Intense aromas of toffee, spice and cigar box. Full-bodied, with lots of soft, plummy fruit and sweet, almost chocolaty flavors. Medium finish. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port King's
review: A bright, forward tawny, with a mix of bergamot, cherry and plum notes, backed by flashes of cinnamon and tea on the finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: This is like a deliciously fresh bowl of fruit. Medium red-ruby with a garnet rim, a nose of cranberries and cherries, full-bodied, with sweet cranberry flavors and a lovely balance of round tannins. A wonderful glass of Port.

name: Vintage Port
review: The extremely hot '34 vintage produced some rich, thick and powerful vintage Port, but this one remains extremely elegant. It is a delight to drink now. Light red with a garnet edge, elegant cherry and raspberry aromas, medium-bodied, with light cherry and tomato flavors and a medium finish.

name: Vintage Port Quinta da Cavadinha
review: Smells like claret, with currants and berries. Medium-bodied, medium-sweet, showing well-integrated tannins and a moderate finish. Best after 2003. 5,500 cases made.

name: White Port Fine
review: This sweet wine has a mellow feel, with dried peach and mango fruit flavors that glide over a honeyed edge. Drink now. 800 cases imported.

name: Ruby Port Heritage
review: A ripe and spicy style, with red plum and briary flavors that take on some savory herbal accents. Offers a short, juicy finish. Drink now. 2,700 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old Otima
review: Beautiful aromas of dried fruits and honey. Medium-bodied and medium sweet, with a lovely freshness and a fruity almond and toffee aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Vintage Port
review: An enchanting wine with soft, sweet cherry flavors. Light to medium red, with a delicate earth and berry nose, medium-bodied, with sweet cherry flavors, a balance of medium tannins and a long, sweet finish.

name: Vintage Port Quinta da Cavadinha
review: This is quite hard for the normally delicate and fruity wines of Cavadinha. Deep purple, with very grapey, floral aromas, full-bodied, with a hard, tannic backbone and a short finish. Very good level of fruit flavors. May still need time.

name: Vintage Port Quinta da Cavadinha
review: Extremely tight and well structured, with a hard backbone and rich fruit flavors. Deep ruby, with a cassis and perfume nose, medium- to full-bodied, with medium tannins and a sweet, balanced, fruity finish.

name: Tawny Port Very Finest Rare Nimrod
review: An amber edge and a delicate core of cherry flavor makes this seem more like a cross between a tawny and a ruby Port than a simple tawny. Despite a touch of bitterness on the finish, it's smooth, elegant and interesting enough to urge a second glass.

name: Vintage Port Quinta da Cavadinha
review: Very fleshy and elegant for a '86 and as good as the impressive '87. It may be one of the best '86s. Excellent deep inky color, with a nose of tar and berries, full-bodied, with ripe, fleshy fruit flavors, full tannins and a gutsy finish. Good grip.

name: Ruby Port Fine Selected
review: Rich and concentrated, with mature leathery-smoky character blending appeal ingly with a deft touch of vivid, youthful plum and spice, focused. Big and powerful, it's a gutsy wine with flair.

name: Ruby Port Heritage
review: Straightforward, offering red plum and dried cherry flavors. Finishes with mocha and some earthy notes. Drink now. 3,500 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old Sir William
review: On the lighter side and not terribly sweet, aiming more for spice and a delicate balance of nutty caramel flavors. A bit hot and spirity on the finish, but a fine way to end a nice meal.

name: Vintage Port Quinta da Cavadinha
review: Long and silky, with plenty of finesse and mellow fruit flavors. Medium ruby, with a nose of currants and perfume, medium-bodied, with tightly knit tannins, medium sweet currant flavors and a balanced finish. A harmonious wine.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old Sir William
review: Fresher style of 10-year-old Port offering nutty, grapey and cedar-spice character, medium body and sweetness and short, slightly hot finish.

name: Vintage Port Quinta da Cavadinha
review: A lean, sharply focused style of Port, not too sweet, with slightly medicinal flavors of cherry and toast, firm tannins and a bit of a tough finish for a port of the vintage. Needs until 1996 to 2000 to soften.

name: Port Warrior
review: Mature and spicy, with firm structure and restrained flavors of chocolate, prune and walnut, balanced and harmonious.

name: Vintage Port
review: A very fresh, clean and delicate Port. Light ruby with a garnet hue, light and peppery on the nose, light-bodied, with fresh cherry flavors, silky light tannins and a sweet finish.

name: Vintage Port Quinta da Cavadinha
review: A little short, perhaps it is simply closed for the moment. Medium purple-red, with aromas of tar, cassis and tomatoes, medium-bodied, with silky, sweet fruit flavors and medium tannins on the finish.

name: Vintage Character Port Warrior Finest Reserve
review: A bit simple, but plenty of attractive berry character with a fresh finish and silky tannins.

name: Vintage Port
review: I have only tasted this wine once, but according to James Symington, whose family owns Warre, the bottle I tried was not a good example. I thought it was more like an old Madeira, slightly oxidized and tired. It was over the hill, but interesting. Garnet with a green edge, slightly nutty aromas with hints of orange peel, very light-bodied, with sweet, nutty fruit flavors and a very light finish.

name: Shiraz Pyrenees Estate
review: Has some strange grace notes, but the main theme is pure blackberry and plum fruit, which persists through the long, fine-grained finish, hinting at ash, anise and sweet spices. Best from 2006 through 2014. 350 cases imported.

name: Torchio Aged Pressings Australia
review: Smooth, round and generous, with more structure than you might expect from a non-vintage red, offering dusky plum and blackberry fruit that lingers on the firm-textured finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2009. 500 cases made.

name: Grand Pyrenees Pyrenees
review: Supple in texture, tangy in flavor, with a zip to the blueberry flavors that translate as lime on the tart finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2008. 1,200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Pyrenees Estate
review: Dense, full and chewy, a mouthful of licorice, blackberry, pepper and firm tannins, echoing the flavors nicely on the finish. Best after 2005. 1,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Pyrenees Estate
review: Gamy, animal flavors overpower the fruit in this rich-textured red. 750 cases imported.

name: Aglianico Sannio
review: A round, gamy red, featuring dark plum notes backed by hints of wild herb and briny olive, with a trim finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Greco Sannio
review: A rich, nutty white, with round stone fruit and light tangerine notes that fall a touch short on the finish. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Falanghina Sannio
review: A fruit-forward version, offering a tangy mix of tangerine and stone fruit that leads to crisp finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Estate Reserve Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Dark and exotic, with notes of fig paste, hoisin sauce, graphite and macerated plum, this stays driven and focused thanks to racy, fine-grained tannins. The lingering finish lets black tea and bittersweet cocoa chime in. A big step up for this wine. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. This wine is labeled as Trilogy outside the U.S. market. Drink now through 2011. 3,500 cases made.

name: Three Cape Ladies Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Streamlined, with waves of black cherry, currant and cassis flavor that build on the lush palate, with additional notes of coffee, vanilla, spice and minerals. Smoky finish lets the fruit smolder. Impressive range and balance here. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Pinotage. Drink now through 2007. 2,000 cases made.

name: Auction Reserve Cape Winemakers Guild Stellenbosch
review: A flashy style, with lots of fig, black tea, spice cake and mocha notes carried by creamy, well-rounded tannins, followed by a long, alluring finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2008.

name: Cabernet Franc Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: A ripe, polished Cabernet Franc, with velvet-textured black cherry and currant fruit beautifully layered with suave toast, aged tobacco, fig paste and a hint of mocha on the dark, alluring finish. Impressive effort. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases made.

name: Estate Reserve Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Loaded with red currant, plum, cocoa and briar flavors, this distinctive wine also unfurls spice, mineral and suave toast elements before gliding to a precise and harmonious finish. Finely crafted. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2005. 5,750 cases made.

name: Estate Reserve Stellenbosch
review: Ripe and muscular, with inviting black tea, fig, bacon and licorice notes giving way to a delicious plum pudding note on the thickly layered finish. Cuts a broad swath. For the hedonist crowd. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. This wine is labeled as Trilogy outside the U.S. market. Drink now through 2011. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Simonsberg-Stellenbosch Professor Black
review: Very rich for a Sauvignon, with lemon curd, straw, fig and peach flavors that are ripe and lush. Yet there's ample stone and mineral underpinning it all, and a fine, zesty finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Three Cape Ladies Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Polished, with dense but rounded tannins framing the ample core of cassis, blackberry and fig paste. Lots of graphite and Lapsang souchong tea notes ripple through the lengthy finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinotage and Syrah. Drink now through 2014. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Three Cape Ladies Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Dense but supple, with very suave, fine-grained structure holding together the black currant, fig and blackberry notes, while black tea, tobacco and iron notes fill in on the long finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinotage, Syrah and Merlot. Drink now through 2011. 8,000 cases made.

name: Three Cape Ladies Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Suave wine, with black and red currant fruit offset by tangy mineral and sanguine notes. Plenty of toast and spice as well, but it's all folded together in a rich, creamy package with a nice tar note on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinotage and Merlot. Drink now through 2006. 6,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: A real solid Cabernet Franc, showing winy currant and black cherry fruit, backed by hints of sweet tobacco, mineral and fig, with a long, pure finish. Very impressive. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Stellenbosch
review: Rock-solid, with a core of dark currant and blackberry fruit lined liberally with inviting tobacco leaf and dark olive notes. The fresh finish shows firm grip, with a hint of singed juniper. Drink now through 2015. 480 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Stellenbosch
review: Very solid, displaying a dark core of mulled black currant and fig paste laced with a snappy tobacco leaf hint and backed by a broad, toast- and loam-tinged finish. Stays defined and fresh. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Estate Reserve Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: A dark, rich style, displaying fig, boysenberry, bittersweet ganache and linzer torte flavors all backed by ample tobacco and licorice notes. The broad, muscular finish is nicely defined, despite its heft. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2011. 2,800 cases made.

name: Estate Reserve Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Focused, with ripe currant and plum fruit, layered with mocha, coffee and bacon notes. The fruit and spice lingers on the fleshy finish, which stretches out nicely, with a black tea note. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. This wine is labeled as Trilogy outside the U.S. market. Drink now through 2008. 3,000 cases made.

name: Estate Reserve Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: A taut, muscular style, with lots of cocoa, vanilla and toast covering the dark currant, black cherry and plum fruit. The focused finish shows nice acidity and brighter fruit, though, so let this develop with moderate cellaring. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2006. 4,300 cases made.

name: Estate Reserve Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Focused red, with taut vanilla, mineral, red currant, truffle and smoke notes. A bit tight in the middle, but the tannins are fine and there's plenty of length, with an extra wave of fruit on the finish, so let this open in the cellar. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. This wine is labeled as Trilogy outside the U.S. market. Best from 2005 through 2007. 4,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Simonsberg-Stellenbosch Professor Black
review: Bright and lemony, with racy gooseberry, grapefruit and floral notes. The long, pure finish really sails on nicely. Delicious. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch Professor Black
review: A richer style, with lemon verbena and kaffir lime notes backed by a juicy, minerally finish where a hint of mâche lingers nicely. Drink now. 8,051 cases made.

name: Three Cape Ladies Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Dark and rich, displaying alluring fig sauce, boysenberry and black tea aromas and flavors that glide along, with ample but integrated toast framing the charcoal- and briar-tinged finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinotage, Syrah and Merlot. Drink now through 2011. 3,000 cases made.

name: Estate Reserve Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: On the high-toned side, with red currant and floral aromas and flavors followed by mineral, graphite and bittersweet cocoa notes. A touch taut, this may flesh out more in the cellar. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2007. 3,000 cases made.

name: Estate Stellenbosch
review: Slightly rugged in feel, with a charcoal frame around the black currant, black cherry and licorice root core, giving way to a tarry-edged finish. Solid, but for fans of the grippy style. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2016. 91 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Old Bush Vines
review: This delivers a nice blast of dark cherry, plum and blackberry fruit flavors laced with a dark licorice note and carried by nice brambly tannins that give the finish good energy. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Old Bush Vines
review: Ripe and focused, with delicious plum sauce, licorice, blueberry compote and fig notes that pump through the toasty, well-integrated finish. Solid grip. Drink now through 2010. 1,825 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Simonsberg-Stellenbosch Professor Black
review: Bright and juicy, with lemon zest, floral and mineral notes followed by a refreshing, crisp finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Simonsberg-Stellenbosch Professor Black
review: Plump up front, with grapefruit and lemon verbena notes, this turns to a crisp, floral- and mineral- flavored profile on the finish. Nicely done. Drink now through 2005. 3,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch Professor Black
review: Lively, with a ripe beam of lemon and pink grapefruit framed nicely by brisk gooseberry and straw notes on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch Professor Black
review: Lively, with a bright core of grapefruit and lemon peel notes backed by mouthwatering acidity. The long, floral-tinged finish lets it all linger. Very tasty. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: The First Lady Western Cape
review: Juicy, with a good core of dark cherry, currant and fig fruit laced with sweet spice hints. There's a lingering plum sauce note on the full-bodied finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Three Cape Ladies Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Features polished edges, with creamed plum and raspberry coulis notes at the core, while warm fruitcake, anise and black tea accents line the finish. Solidly built, with extra purity and elegance that is rare for the grape. Pinotage, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2017. 5,875 cases made.

name: Three Cape Ladies Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: A sleek, polished style, with enticing red plum, currant, fig and mocha notes that glide over supple tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Pinotage and Syrah. Drink now through 2010. 8,000 cases made.

name: Three Cape Ladies Western Cape
review: This is aromatic, with black tea and singed cedar notes leading the way for plush blackberry, black cherry and plum preserve flavors. Nice velvety feel through the coffee-tinged finish. Pinotage, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2013. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: An intense and concentrated Cab with ripe cherry and currant flavors blanketed in a firm, tannic texture. Worth short-term cellaring; the depth of flavor and lingering aftertaste bode well. Drink now through 2000. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Plump, up-front style, with fresh apple, fig and quince notes. Juicy finish is unencumbered by toast. Tasty. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape The First Lady Unoaked
review: A fresh, floral style, with bright green apple, pear and acacia notes that bounce through the unadorned finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Old Bush Vines
review: Friendly mint and milk chocolate notes lead the way, followed by plush blackberry coulis and plum sauce flavors. Shows some weight, remaining open and accessible through the finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Old Bush Vines
review: Juicy plum, blackberry and black currant fruit is supported by licorice snap, toasty vanilla and mint notes. A lightly firm plum skin note marks the finish, but this shows good enough flesh. A solid barbecue wine for fall. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Old Bush Vines
review: Fleshy but persistent, as sage, briar, black currant, braised fig and mineral notes show nice length. This shows a twinge of the grape's rusticity, but it's harnessed in the fruit. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Old Bush Vines
review: Ripe and creamy, with mocha, blackberry, plum and spice flavors that run through the medium-weight, fleshy finish. A very modern style. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Old Bush Vines
review: There's a hint of funk here, but the dense blackberry and black cherry fruit easily wins out. Picks up additional spice and mineral notes on the chewy finish. Drink now through 2002. 1,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch Professor Black
review: This sports a ripe, friendly edge, with kiwifruit, lime and green apple notes all working together against a backdrop of plantain on the juicy finish. A tasty, crowd-pleasing style. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape Professor Black
review: Offers plump lime and kiwifruit notes, with a fresh pink grapefruit hint on the finish. Juicy and lively in feel. Drink now. 6,090 cases made.

name: Shiraz Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Forward, with sweet blackberry and fig fruit. Dark chocolate on the creamy finish, where the fruit lingers nicely. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Three Cape Ladies Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Dark and ripe, with lots of currant, fig and cocoa flavors stretched across fine-grained tannins. Hints of cedar and vanilla on the minerally finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinotage and Merlot. Drink now through 2007. 5,000 cases made.

name: Three Cape Ladies Western Cape
review: Solid, with toasty, broad-shouldered plum, black currant and fig notes. Smoky and fleshy through the finish, this delivers an echo of singed cedar. Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Pinotage. Drink now through 2014. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Quite leafy up front, with pepper and tobacco aromas. Sows more black cherry and currant on the palate. Focused and fresh. For fans of the grape only though, not neophytes. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Very ripe and forward, with lots of showy sweetened butter, glazed pear and piecrust notes. The long, creamy finish lets mango and floral notes chime in. Showy, but a touch blowsy in the end. Two of four samples tasted were corked. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape The First Lady Unoaked
review: Bright and breezy, with a blast of friendly yellow apple and pineapple fruit, backed by a floral-edged finish. Drink now. 13,300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape The First Lady Unoaked
review: Sports yellow apple, dried pineapple and white peach flavors, with a fresh, relatively unadorned finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch Estate Old Bush Vines
review: Offers dark cherry and red currant fruit, mixed with bramble and licorice snap notes. Features a shot of roasted vanilla on the finish, but good energy keeps this honest. Drink now. 6,050 cases made.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch Old Bush Vines
review: Offers prune and treacle at first, but this unwinds to show more vibrant black currant, toast and licorice flavors. Has Pinotage's rustic edge throughout, but does gain some polish with air. Solid, but look for this estate's Cabernet-dominated blends. Drink now through 2004. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Old Bush Vines
review: Juicy, briary fruit--black cherry, plum and currant--with sweet, bacony toast covering the finish. Bit of CO2 still, so give it a quick decanting. Drink now. 2,700 cases made.

name: The First Lady Western Cape
review: Solid, with grilled herb and olive notes at the fore, backed by crushed red and black currant fruit and a toasty, slightly soft finish. This was the better of two bottles tasted. Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Drink now. 13,000 cases made.

name: Three Cape Ladies Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Friendly and forward, with soft black cherry and plum fruit laced with ample toast and dark licorice notes. Offers a toasty, soft, almost gushy finish. Pinotage, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Merlot. Drink now. 5,227 cases made.

name: Trilogy Stellenbosch
review: This has guts, despite its maturing cedar, mineral, currant and coffee flavors. It's ripe and focused, with the flavors lingering nicely on the still-juicy finish. Very solid. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2002. 3,000 cases made.

name: Trilogy Stellenbosch
review: An elegant but concentrated Bordeaux-style red with an intriguing aroma and complex flavors. Enjoyable now, but has the balance, intensity and firm tannins to improve with age. A blend: 60 percent Cabernet Sauvignon, 20 percent Cabernet Franc, 20 percent Merlot. Drink now through 2002. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Western Cape The First Lady
review: Soft, with mint and cocoa notes leading the slightly mulled plum and black cherry fruit. The mint accent lingers through the finish. Drink now. 23,750 cases made.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch
review: Herbal and woodsy elements here, along with a core of bright cherry flavor. It's on the leaner side for Merlot and wrapped in some serious tannins, so give it at least six months to settle down. Best from 2001 through 2004. 1,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Coastal Region Professor Black
review: A fresh citrus core is laced with thyme and sweet pea notes, showing good energy on the finish. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 7,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Stellenbosch
review: Generous oak accents give this bright, fruity red some extra style. Cherry and herb flavors; nutmeg and clove are nicely integrated from the oak barrels in which it was aged. Lingering finish, too. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Deep, dark color and generous fruit flavors; impressive, silky-smooth texture. Moderate tannins, with cherry and currant notes lingering on the finish. Drink now through 1997. 150 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Western Cape The First Lady
review: This offers a briar, mulled currant and light tobacco profile, with a dash of toast on the finish. Tasted three times, with consistent notes. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Old Bush Vines
review: Mixed berry, briar and toast notes mingle in this medium-bodied red, with fresh acidity enlivening the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Rosé The First Lady Western Cape
review: This rosé offers a blast of white raspberry fruit, backed by a light whiff of tobacco on the finish. Drink now. 8,800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Coastal Region Professor Black
review: Brisk and light, with sweet pea, mâche and lemon zest notes. Drink now. 2,750 cases made.

name: Three Cape Ladies Stellenbosch
review: Lots of coffee and prune notes up front, turning a bit crisp in the end, but there's enough lively black cherry in between to keep it in check. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Pinotage. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Trilogy Stellenbosch
review: Starts off slowly, then comes on strong with some good herbal, chocolate and plum flavors. Balanced and ready to drink. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Trilogy Stellenbosch
review: Quite flavorful, balanced toward tartness, showing ample cherry and berry aromas, crisp texture and clean finish. A solid, sturdy red. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: For fans of really robust reds. Tannic and full-bodied, with ripe fruit flavors held in check by a stiff texture of acid and tannin. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Three Cape Ladies Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Lean, with moderate black cherry, dried herb and cedar notes. Turns trim and a touch dry in the end. The better of two bottles. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Pinotage. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch
review: Tart fruit flavors of cherry and cranberry are muddied by earthy aromas and tough tannins. It's awkward and severe. 250 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Washington
review: Fresh and sleek, with pretty pear and floral flavors on an open-weave frame, lingering well. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley Late Harvest
review: Frankly sweet, but balanced with a crisp zing of citrusy acidity integrating the layers of rich honeysuckle, apricot and pear flavors, this Washington white is of impressive quality for so low a price. Drink now through 2009. 2,839 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Summit Reserve
review: Bright and generous, delivering a lively mouthful of currant and berry fruit on an airy texture, finishing with finesse. Drink now through 2011. 1,860 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Subtle, lithe, beautifully focused and appealing for its pure currant and berry flavors, which echo on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2004. 3,270 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Bright and juicy, a harmonious style with grapefruit and pear aromas and flavors, hinting at tobacco as the finish sails on nicely. Drink now. 3,913 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Subtle, refined style offers lovely pear, melon and spice flavors, then finishes with a wisp of oak. Drink now through 2005. 7,612 cases made.

name: Merlot Washington
review: Vibrant and spicy, with ripe currant at the core and hints of red pepper, fresh leather and spice around the edges, lingering against moderate tannins. Drink now through 2017. 2,376 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Dry
review: Bright and focused, offering brilliant apple, citrus and floral aromas and flavors on a mostly dry frame. Beautifully balanced so that the flavor dazzles without becoming cloying or sharp. Drink now through 2005. 1,101 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Late Harvest
review: Ripe, round, sweet and generous with its pear, apricot, orange and floral aromas and flavors, which echo on the sweet finish. Deftly balanced with fine acidity. Drink now through 2004. 4,800 cases made.

name: Riesling Washington Late Harvest
review: Sweet and appealing for its delicacy, offering sweet apple, light apricot and pretty floral aromas and flavors that linger on the balanced finish. Drink now through 2010. 3,913 cases made.

name: Sémillon-Chardonnay Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Soft, silky and smooth. A lovely mouthful of pear, peach and melon, with a touch of tobacco swirling through the lively finish. Drink now. 2,225 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley Late Harvest Varietal Select
review: Sweet and lightly honeyed apricot and spice flavors are elevated by a distinctive remnant note of noble rot. Nicely balanced, too. 2,183 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Bright, lightly sweet and refreshingly crisp, showing off melon and nectarine flavors with floral hints on the silky finish. Ready now. 5,284 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Late Harvest
review: Sweet and fruity, but not unctuous, this enticing white adds some nice floral tints to the pear and grape flavors. Good buy for the quality. Drink now. 5,193 cases made.

name: Riesling Washington
review: Off-dry, with a piney edge to the apple flavors, finishing on a lime blossom note. Drink now. 7,200 cases made.

name: Riesling Washington
review: Soft and fresh, with a grapefruit note adding class to the core, as the apricot and pineapple touches pick up the lightly sweet finish. Drink now. 6,900 cases made.

name: Riesling Washington Late Harvest
review: Soft and sweet, light on balance but with enough acidity to frame the pear, apricot and floral flavors nicely. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Washington
review: Light and sleek, with pretty pear and floral flavors that transform into green tea notes on the finish. Drink now. 1,648 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Washington
review: Crisp and tangy, with zingy acidity against grapefruit and lime flavors. Drink now. 4,200 cases made.

name: Shiraz Columbia Valley
review: Lighter than most Syrahs, with pretty plum and vanilla aromas and flavors, finishing with polish. Drink now. 2,037 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Don't pass up this well-crafted and affordably priced Cabernet from Washington. It's crisp and bright, with juicy blackberry and cherry flavors that keep glowing on the nicely balanced finish, and the tannins are not intrusive. Drink now through 2003. 6,963 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Lean and chewy, flirting with oak up front, but ripe fruit comes bouncing back on the tannic finish, echoing currant and plum. 3,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and appealing for its lilting pear and floral aromas and flavors, lingering on the melony finish. Drink now through 2010. 12,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Bright and jazzy, a juicy Chardonnay with citrus, spice and pineapple aromas and flavors that linger on the lively finish. Drink now through 2003. 1,198 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Bright and fruity in style, with modest pear and spice flavors that expand gently on the lithe finish, this Washington Chardonnay drinks very nicely now, is quite a bargain, too. 8,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Bright and appealing, with spicy pineapple and citrus flavors that keep step through the lively finish. 4,924 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Columbia Valley Dry
review: Crisp and fruity, a dry, lively white wine, with peach and apple flavors echoing on the finish. Drink now. 1,632 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Columbia Valley Dry Varietal Select
review: Fresh and fruity, a lovely mouthful of ripe apple and citrus flavors that remain lively on the soft finish. Drink now. 1,632 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Columbia Valley
review: Off-dry, smooth and silky; shows very pretty apple and apricot flavors, finishing generously. 4,800 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Smooth and lightly sweet; generous peach, pear and delicate pine flavors. Drink while it is fresh. 3,118 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, with fine tannins underpinning some pretty cherry and herb flavors. Lingers pleasantly. Best from 2009 through 2012. 12,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Smooth and ripe, juicy with blackberry and currant flavors, hinting at tar and chocolate on the finish. Drink now. 4,852 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Has an earthy, slightly gamy edge to the roasted meat and cherry flavors, finishing with some refinement. Drink now through 2008. 7,000 cases made.

name: Moscato Washington Late Harvest
review: Soft and light, not sparkly and a bit subdued for a Muscat, but with pretty pear and lychee flavors, lingering sweetly. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Dry Varietal Select
review: Light, dry and refreshing for its refined apple, spice and floral flavors that linger appealingly on the finish. Drink now through 2000. 988 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Pretty apple, fig and olive flavors wrap nicely around a fresh, wiry frame. Has a mineral note on the finish. 1,995 cases made.

name: Sémillon Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Round and spicy, generous with its ripe fig, melon and herbal flavors, picking up a nice hint of nutmeg on the focused finish. Drink now through 2002. 942 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley
review: Ripe flavor, open texture, appealing for its pure berry fruit, which echoes on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2003. 1,776 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley
review: Bright and fruity, with pretty apple and floral aromas and flavors. Off-dry, and generous through the soft finish. Drink now through 2003. 7,366 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley Special Harvest
review: Lightly sweet and delicately honeyed; not rich, but it offers creamy pineapple and floral flavors. Drinkable now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Lean, almost crisp in texture, with appealing berry, spice and smoke flavors that narrow a bit on the finish. Best from 1999 to 2000. 4,402 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: A bit chewy, but it tries to be light and elegant underneath, offering some pretty blackberry and tar flavors. Best from 1998. 4,079 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Round and generous, a full-bodied white that leans distinctly in the direction of fruit, offering bright nectarine and apple on the lively finish. Drinkable now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Columbia Valley Dry Varietal Select
review: Crisp and bright, almost racy, with lemony green-apple flavors and enough melony sweetness to make it feel balanced--and dry. Ready now. 1,291 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: On the light side, off-dry, an aromatic wine with pretty pear and grapefruit flavors, hinting at rose petal at the edges. Drink now. 3,623 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Remarkably fresh and vibrant, off-dry, like biting into a fresh peach with lovely spice and floral overtones. 1,466 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Soft, round and off-dry. Shows polished, Golden Delicious apple and floral flavors. 5,042 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: On the light side, but nicely fleshed out with dark berry and delicate herbal flavors. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Broad and supple, concentrating its plum, currant and tar flavors in a slightly chewy package. Drinkable now. 2,700 cases made.

name: Merlot Washington
review: Light and fragrant, with an earthy, tobacco-scented edge to the raspberry fruit. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Rainier Red Columbia Valley
review: Supple and appealing for the ripe cherry and herb flavors at the center, nicely fleshy as the finish lingers. Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Pinot Noir and Merlot. Drink now through 2009. 3,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley
review: Lightly sweet, with nice apricot notes and fresh pear and citrus flavors. Drink now through 2004. 6,300 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Late Harvest Summit Reserve
review: Sweet, with a satiny feel to the decadent apricot and citrus flavors. Drink now. 1,907 cases made.

name: Riesling Washington
review: Light, open-textured and a bit sweet, offering pretty pear, nectar and floral flavors that linger gently. Drink now. 2,100 cases made.

name: Riesling Washington Late Harvest
review: Sweet and silky, this white shows a tangerine edge to its pear flavors. Drink now. 21,200 cases made.

name: Sémillon-Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Smooth and gentle, its pretty spice, apple and fig flavors in modest proportions yet persisting nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2001. 2,276 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley Late Harvest Varietal Select
review: Sweet and ripe, with peach, pear and floral notes that remain generous through the soft finish. Drink now. 1,745 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley Late Harvest Varietal Select
review: Sweet, but lively enough to keep the nectarine and melon flavors in balance. Ready now. 2,126 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Wild, earthy flavors add interest to this firmly textured red. Features wild berry and floral notes, with a touch of weediness on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 6,100 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: A crisp, firm style that emphasizes ripe blackberry and herbal flavors. Finishes with chewy tannins that need until 2000. A blend: 67 percent Cabernet Sauvignon, 33 percent Merlot. 7,160 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Light and appealing for its laid-back, sunny lemon and pear aromas and flavors. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Columbia Valley
review: Soft and floral, with a rose petal note alongside the modest apple and mineral flavors. Finishes off-dry and ever-so-slightly bitter. Drink now. 2,531 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Soft and floral, with appealing rose petal and gentle peach flavors. 1,270 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: A nice, small-scale Merlot with pretty black cherry and spice flavors that soften on the modest finish. 4,310 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Late Harvest
review: Modest in scope, with earthy, lightly spicy flavors more than fruit, finishing off-dry. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Varietal Select Dry
review: Lean, light and gently fruity, echoing green apple and peach flavors on the finish. Just off-dry. 1,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Columbia Valley
review: Juicy, straightforward quaffer has cherry and rhubarb flavors. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Fresh, like biting into raw fruit, offering pretty melon and mineral flavors on a sweet, smooth frame. Drink now. 7,730 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Light and crisp, with mint and berry flavors, finishing firm. Drink now. 3,344 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: On the light side for a Cabernet, with pretty floral and herbal overtones to the modest black cherry flavors. Drink now. 6,963 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Fresh, with firm tannins around a light core of blackberry and black cherry flavors, narrowing on the finish. Needs food to balance the tannins. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Currant and berry flavors emerge smoothly through a chewy layer of fine tannins, making this approachable now. 4,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Lean and a little chewy, appealing cherry and tarry flavors showing on the finish. Best now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Light, herbal style, featuring modest cherry and sage flavors that pick up earthy notes on the finish. Drink now through 2002. 8,045 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Columbia Valley
review: Bright and juicy, a mouthful of citrus, apple and guava flavors that linger on the open-textured finish. Drink now. 1,551 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley
review: Earthy, somewhat funky style weaves a lifted, balsamic note through ripe cherry and pepper flavors. Drink now through 2007. 2,000 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley Late Harvest Varietal Select
review: Sweet, bright and refreshing. Not typical of a dessert wine, but it offers ripe apricot and peach flavors that linger on the soft finish. Drink now through 2001. 3,782 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Fresh and fruity, with a pine cone overtone to the apple and pear flavors. Drink now. 5,015 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Light and herbal, with a strong mint and sage edge to the strawberry and currant flavors. Tannins are modest. Drink now through 2002. 5,022 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Herbal, cooked aromas and dry, peppery flavors are not immediately appealing, but the nice core of light cherry flavor could emerge with cellaring. Best after 2001. 8,045 cases made.

name: Merlot Washington Varietal Select
review: Light in color and texture, a simple red with pretty leather and cherry notes. Drink now. 2,700 cases made.

name: Riesling Washington Late Harvest
review: Sweet and a bit sugary, with modest pear flavors. Balanced. Drink now. 21,200 cases made.

name: Sémillon Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Light and pleasant for its melon and pear flavors, with hints of tobacco on the finish. Drink now through 1999. 1,822 cases made.

name: Sémillon-Sauvignon Blanc Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Tobacco and herb flavors dominate in this austere but distinctive wine; it finishes a bit flat. Drink now. 1,814 cases made.

name: Seyval Blanc Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Strange medicinal flavors run through this pineapple-scented white, lingering juicily on the finish. Ready now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Columbia Valley
review: Light and soft, with appealing rose petal-scented melon flavors, finishing light and a little sweet. 2,500 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Light and sappy, with a resiny edge to the modest apple and spice flavors. Finishes sweet. Drink now. 3,462 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, spicy and toasty in flavor; a light-weight red with a modest level of plum notes to balance. Drinkable now.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Light, with tough tannins for its size and just enough pretty berry flavors to bring it into balance. Try in 1998. 9,950 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Soft and fruity, with simple apple and citrus flavors. Drink now. 1,848 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley Varietal Select Special Harvest
review: Tries to be crisply balanced, but lacks the intensity to show much fruit up front. Has some nice spicy notes on the finish. 1,786 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Summit Reserve
review: Floral, with an edge of something resembling plastic hose to the apple and citrus flavors. Drink now. 1,960 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Doesn't quite come together, citrusy and sharp, but some raw nectarine flavor follows through as well. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sémillon-Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Sturdy, fresh, floral and medium-weight, finishing slightly bitter.

name: Sémillon-Sauvignon Blanc Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: A sturdy wine showing tobacco and mineral flavors, hinting at vegetal notes on the finish. 1,178 cases made.

name: Syrah Washington
review: On the light side, with a metallic edge to the moderate currant flavors. Drink now. 3,752 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Columbia Valley Dry
review: Has a greenish edge to the dry, spicy flavors.

name: Sémillon Columbia Valley Varietal Select
review: Aggressively floral, with an acidic edge that keeps the flavors from blossoming. 1,822 cases made.

name: Shiraz Bendigo
review: Supple, subtle and distinctive for the way it balances its ripe blackberry and plum fruit against peppery spice and lively but not overwhelming acidity. This has presence. Best from 2008 through 2014. 16,000 cases imported.

name: Memsie Red Bendigo
review: Smooth and generous, a lively style with juicy plum and blackberry aromas and flavors, lingering on the refined finish. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Drink now through 2010. 10,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Bendigo
review: Smooth, round and sharply focused to show off its licorice-infused blackberry and cherry flavors. A hint of pepper makes the finish even more interesting. Best from 2008 through 2014. 15,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Bendigo +
review: Nicely lifted, with a juiciness to the ripe blackberry, coffee and spice flavors, all wafting easily through the minerally finish. Drink now through 2016. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Bendigo
review: Soft, ripe and generous with its pear and peach flavors, lingering with a touch of smoky spice on the finish. Impressive for its purity of flavor and harmony. Best from late this year. 6,000 cases made.

name: Memsie Homestead Bendigo
review: Polished, lively and nicely focused to show off its pretty cherry and sassafras flavors, picking up a welcome floral note as the finish lingers. Shiraz, Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2014. 16,000 cases made.

name: Memsie Red Bendigo
review: Bright and open-textured, with pretty currant and plum fruit at the core, hinting at coffee and pepper as the finish lingers. Syrah, Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2010. 12,000 cases imported.

name: Memsie Red Bendigo
review: Jazzy and snappy, brimming with blueberry, blackberry and bright spicy flavors that skip merrily through the juicy finish. Delicious. Shiraz, Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2004. 7,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Bendigo
review: Big, mouthfilling style has black cherry at the core, shaded with hints of roasted beet, black pepper and licorice as the finish persists against spicy oak. Best after 2007. 16,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Bendigo
review: Flavorful and velvety, a rich mouthful of smoky black cherry and anise flavors that persist nicely on the solid finish. Much better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2005. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Bendigo
review: Crisp and lively, with juicy plum and currant fruit shaded with cedar and herbal notes, lingering against fine tannins. Best from 2009 through 2013. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Bendigo
review: Ripe, open-textured and harmonious, nicely balanced to show its pear and peach flavors, mixing in a touch of creaminess on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 8,000 cases made.

name: Memsie Red Bendigo
review: Ripe and tangy, with a tart edge to the juicy blackberry and fresh grape flavors, softening on the open-weave finish. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2012. 28,000 cases made.

name: Memsie Red Bendigo
review: Supple, generous and appealing for its rich texture and peppery, meaty cherry and sweet leather flavors, lingering nicely on the fine-grained finish. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Drink now through 2010. 10,000 cases made.

name: Memsie White Bendigo
review: Ripe and spicy, with a wet hay edge to the pear, pineapple and cream flavors. Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Roussanne. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Bendigo
review: Bright and lively, with juicy boysenberry and green olive aromas and flavors that lilt through the well-formed, polished finish. Drink now through 2014. 15,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Bendigo
review: A bit grainy in texture, with nicely formed blueberry and plum flavors poking through a layer of firm tannins, finishing with harmony. Best from 2005 through 2010. 10,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Bendigo
review: Dark and juicy, with vivid blackberry and floral aromas and flavors, finishing with firm tannins. Best after 2004. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Bendigo +
review: Smooth and focused, with ripe blackberry and cream flavors on a velvety texture. Plush finish. Drink now through 2016. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Bendigo 5 Rounds
review: Fresh and lively, with juicy dark berry and licorice flavors on an airy texture. The flavors float through the velvety finish. Drink now through 2017. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Bendigo
review: Distinctive fine-grained, lithe style has lovely blueberry and currant fruit at the core, shaded with cedar and spice, with a pickle-barrel note on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Bendigo
review: On the crisp side, with a nice anise note weaving through the peppery berry flavors. Drink now through 2006. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Bendigo
review: Distinctly spicy, with a toasty, exotic character to the green apple and lime flavors, finishing dry and easygoing. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Bendigo
review: Tangy style has a strong mineral note running through the pineapple and pear fruit, finishing with lively acidity. Drink now through 2007. 8,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Bendigo
review: Has an unusual flavor range, offering tangy grapefruit, pear and a hint of spiced walnuts as the flavors play out through the round finish. Drink now through 2005. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Memsie Red Bendigo
review: Crisp in texture, with generous, licorice-scented currant fruit that lingers on the open-weave finish. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Drink now through 2010. 28,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Bendigo
review: Bright and juicy, refreshing for its beet-accented berry and wet earth flavors, lingering nicely. Drink now through 2012. 16,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Bendigo
review: Ripe and juicy, brimming with pure berry and tobacco flavors, finishing on a peppery note. Drink now through 2005. 8,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Bendigo
review: Crisp and lively, with dusky spices around a tight core of coffee and berry flavors. Drink now through 2010. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Bendigo
review: Firm in texture, with nicely focused blackberry, dusky spice and a hint of mocha as the flavors play out against mildly chewy tannins. Best after 2003. 8,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Bendigo
review: A distinctive style of Chardonnay emphasizing spicy tobacco notes. Hints of fig and raisin sneak in on the finish, but the main appeal is the spiciness. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Memsie White Bendigo
review: Bright and juicy, with pineapple and citrus flavors prominent in the mix, finishing with a light dance. Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Roussanne. Drink now. 6,500 cases made.

name: Memsie White Bendigo
review: Light and appealing for its peach and herb flavors, lingering gently. Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon, Roussanne and Chardonnay. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Memsie White Bendigo
review: Soft and fragrant, with a spicy edge to the peach and green apple flavors. Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Roussanne. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Bendigo
review: Ripe and jazzy, with pretty blueberry and plum flavors shaded with a touch of spice. Chewy tannins need until 2001 to settle down. 2,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Bendigo +
review: Features a rich, easy-drinking, chocolate-accented mix of cherry and spice flavors, with toast and spice details lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 10,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Central Victoria +
review: Crisp and lively, lean in structure and peppery in flavor, offering a meaty edge to the dark berry and coffee flavors. Deft. Drink now through 2017. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Bendigo
review: Firm in texture, this chewy wine places its berry and currant flavors under a deep layer of tannins that sort of clamps down on the finish. Best after 2002. 6,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Bendigo
review: Fresh and appealing for its pretty melon and citrus flavors, with just a hint of herb or grass around the edges. Drink now for its youthful exuberance. 6,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Bendigo
review: A sturdy style, with firm tannins and chunky red pepper-tinged cherry flavors, finishing with more cedar and spice than fruit. Best after 2005. 4,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Bendigo
review: On the tart side, with a strong licorice and pepper profile that shoulders past the pruny flavors. Best after 2007. 15,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Bendigo
review: Firm, with a strong gamy note intruding on the juicy red fruit character. Drink now. 800 cases imported.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Bold, rich, complex and concentrated, with layers of smoky oak, ripe plum, currant and cherry flavors that glide across the palate. Intense, with fine tannins, a remarkably complex and well-integrated wine. Drinks well now, but should improve with cellar 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Filled with gorgeous blackberry and currant flavors that swirl through the finish with anise and toast accents. Supple, elegant, superbly balanced, it has the polish to drink now, and the fine-grained tannins to hold well past 2000. 1,216 cases made.

name: Malbec Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Sleek and expressive, light-footed but brimming with plum, spice and savory herb flavors, coming together with polish on the long, open-weave finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,497 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Ripe, pure, focused and beguiling for its balance, offering blueberry, raspberry and plum fruit at the core, layered with hints of red pepper, clove and peach fuzz as the finish extends extraordinarily well. Drink now through 2017. 3,030 cases made.

name: Sémillon Columbia Valley Late Harvest Ice Wine
review: Smooth and silky, rich and sweet, with fig and roasted pineapple flavors that pick up notes of clove and vanilla cream. The finish lingers with polish. Drink now through 2020. 400 cases made.

name: Al's Run Red Blend Columbia Valley
review: Supple and expressive, offering layers of cherry, plum and floral flavors on a sleek frame, finishing with generosity and a touch of crème brûlée. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Grenache, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Drink now through 2022. 412 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
