review: Supple and focused. Appealing for its pure blueberry and currant flavors, shaded with gentle hints of cream, nutmeg and black olive. A beautifully formed red that has miles to go. Drink now through 2012. 3,134 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: A ripe, sweet and silky Washington Cab that has spicy black cherry and currant flavors, and is a fine value. It hints at smoke and mocha on the lingering finish. 1,425 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Sleek and expressive, this is well-modulated and refined to show the ripe blackberry and cassis flavors elegantly, framed by flashes of caraway, dill and red peppercorn that glide together into a polished finish. Drink now through 2019. 5,395 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Round and appealing for its ripe cherry and currant flavors and medium-weight frame, which lets this become expressive as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2016. 4,070 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley Icon
review: Focused, vital and expressive, offering plum and currant fruit that pulses through a layer of fine tannins, finishing with intensity and finesse. Drink now through 2020. 240 cases made.

name: Icon Reserve Walla Walla Valley
review: Firm in texture, with green olive notes and a swarm of tannins embracing the core of raspberry and cherry fruit. Finishes with expressiveness. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec. Best from 2018 through 2022. 240 cases made.

name: Malbec Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Soft and inviting, brimming with plum and currant fruit, with a major hit of black pepper, this comes together deftly as the finish lingers beautifully on the open texture. Drink now through 2018. 1,897 cases made.

name: Meritage Red Mountain
review: Rich in texture, with cedar, green olive and blueberry flavors on a muscular frame, but it's not heavy, just impressively focused to point the flavors to a long, long finish. The fruit echoes strongest. Drink now through 2008. 597 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Brilliantly aromatic and bursting with juicy berry and plum flavors from start to finish. A stylish, beautifully crafted wine that floats its yummy flavors over a silky frame. Tempting now, even better in 1998. 1,640 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Reserve
review: The cinnamon-accented red berry flavors play against meaty notes in this taut, juicy red, with a lingering finish. Offers presence and persistence. Best from 2015 through 2019. 5,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Supple and vibrant, this is distinctive for the white pepper and mascarpone notes that weave through the refreshing plum and currant fruit. Lingers impressively, with gentle intensity. Drink now through 2015. 4,800 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Polished and refined, glowing with currant, blackberry, sage and bay leaf aromas and flavors. Persists impressively on the poised finish. Drink now through 2014. 3,024 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: Sleek and expressive, with ebullient raspberry, red plum and white pepper flavors, mingling harmoniously and floating easily on the velvety finish. Drink now through 2017. 1,217 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: Crisp and juicy, this is almost preternaturally focused to show off its blueberry, plum and blackberry fruit, shaded by hints of mineral and cream as the finish lingers effortlessly against light, crisp tannins. Drink now through 2013. 1,997 cases made.

name: WB Primarius Meritage Columbia Valley
review: Lithe, refined style has layers of wonderful currant, plum and blackberry fruit, shaded with hints of rose petals and thyme flowers, lingering beautifully on the supple finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Petit Verdot, Merlot, Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2015. 356 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Vibrant, refreshing and tight, showing currant and cherry flavors that are nicely shaded with gentle hints of wet, loamy earth and spice. Drink now through 2014. 4,946 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Rich in flavor, filling the mouth with spicy, toasty blackberry, dark plum and caramel flavors, lingering on the beautifully polished finish. Fine tannins should melt with food. Drink now through 2012. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Lean and lithe, generous in flavor, offering a pulsing core of black cherry, blackberry, mocha and gentle herb flavors that linger effortlessly against a bed of fine-grained tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,376 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Sleek and inviting, pulsing with cherry, cinnamon and cream flavors that point through a layer of fine tannins into the long and expressive finish. Offers presence and finishes gracefully. Drink now through 2020. 7,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Sleek, supple and appealing, with welcoming basil and sage accents around a polished core of cherry and spice flavors, lingering easily on the graceful finish. Best from 2014 through 2018. 4,881 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Velvety, generous and open-textured, offering pear-accented currant and mint flavors that linger effectively on the expressive finish. Drink now through 2016. 4,100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley Icon
review: Supple, ripe and succulent, with lovely blackberry, cherry and mint flavors that mingle easily at the core and on the polished finish. Drink now through 2017. 234 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Vibrant and expressive, balancing complex pear, quince and clotted cream flavors on a pinpoint of bright acidity, with a harmonious finish. Drink now through 2017. 4,846 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Reserve
review: A supple and expressive white, this is light on its feet but packed with pear, pineapple and citrus flavors, hinting at almond and walnut as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2019. 3,349 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Spicy and on the lighter side, with nutmeg and caramel overtones around the pear fruit. Comes together smoothly on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 2,589 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Ripe, round, polished and deftly balanced, playing the pear, quince and caramel flavors against lively acidity and a smooth texture. Lingers easily. Drink now through 2015. 1,724 cases made.

name: Malbec Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Polished, refreshing and appealing for its chamomile and floral overtones around a silky core of mixed berry and spice flavors, lingering easily. Drink now through 2016. 1,190 cases made.

name: Mélange Columbia Valley
review: Ripe and plump, generous with its spicy, mocha-scented cherry and blackberry flavors, persisting smoothly through the long, harmonious finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese, Merlot, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2010. 19,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Light and tangy, with tobacco and coffee overtones to the black cherry and tangy balsamic flavors, lingering with persistence. Offers presence and refinement. Best from 2015 through 2018. 5,085 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Ripe in flavor, bright with acidity, tightly packed with cherry, blackberry, herb and cedary oak aromas and flavors, persisting impressively on the long, vivid finish. Best from 2006 through 2012. 1,312 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Rich, smooth and spicy, its fine tannins nicely integrated with the dark plum and black cherry flavor, long and fragrant. Drinkable now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Bright, supple and flavorful, an immediately enjoyable red that displays its vanilla bean-scented berry and black cherry notes on a seductive frame. Ready now. 830 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Lithe and expressive, with blackberry, licorice and black olive flavors on a sleek frame, persisting as the soft tannins wrap around the finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,300 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Reserve
review: This is appealing for its gentleness, offering raspberry, red cherry and soft tobacco flavors that linger on the polished finish. Drink now through 2013. 3,053 cases made.

name: Viognier Columbia Valley
review: Ripe and generous, not as exuberant as some Viogniers but nicely tuned to show off its melon, spice, cream and floral flavors and let them linger gently on the finish. Drink now. 336 cases made.

name: Viognier Columbia Valley Al's Run
review: Polished and inviting, packed with pear, lemon curd, floral and caramel flavors that keep swirling into a long, medium-weight finish. Drink now through 2019. 412 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Columbia Valley
review: Bold, ripe and generous with its spice-scented blackberry, black cherry and cola flavors that expand on the palate. Delicious now, but the fine tannins can help it develop through 2000 to 2001. 267 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Ripe and supple, with pretty plum and currant flavors on a fine-grained background. Has an earthy edge on the finish, but the fruit echoes nicely. Drink now through 2004. 3,248 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Red Mountain
review: Firm in texture, refined in structure, with aromas and flavors reminiscent of plum, cherry, cedar and warm bricks, echoing nicely on the fine-grained finish. Best from 2005 through 2008. 1,571 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and lively, with a creamy edge to the pear and passion fruit flavors, lingering on the deftly balanced finish. Drink now through 2015. 11,400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: A dark, spicy style brings a peppery edge to the modest pear and nutmeg flavors, finishing with silky texture. Drink now through 2011. 17,640 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Smooth, ripe and generous. Not a big wine, but this has pointed apple and pineapple fruit, nicely shaded with hints of cream and spice. The finish lingers well. Drink now through 2011. 12,951 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Looking for a good deal in quality Chardonnay? Voilà. This one's bright in flavor and beautifully focused, with zingy apple, melon, pear and spice flavors that linger effortlessly on the polished finish. Drink now through 2003. 11,116 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Soft, round and generous with its spicy pear and citrus flavors, echoing the pretty parts nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 11,389 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: A bright and zingy style, this Washington white is lively on the palate, with citrus, mineral and pear flavors. Finishes with a nice lime bite that lingers on the racy finish. Drink now through 2003. 14,332 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Strikes a nice balance between fruit, oak and spice, with layers of apple, apricot and nectarine that are framed by toasty oak. Gains intensity on the finish. Drinkable now. 13,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Smooth and polished, with root beer-accented pear and tangerine flavors mingling on the finish. Drink now. 1,380 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Walla Walla Valley Cottonwood Creek Estate
review: Bright and spicy, a nicely sculpted wine that shows facets of pear, spice, vanilla and citrus. Appealing. Drink now. 249 cases made.

name: Icon Reserve Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and lively, polished in texture, with an open feel to the currant and guava flavors, lingering easily against modest tannins. Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Drink now through 2018. 207 cases made.

name: Malbec Columbia Valley
review: Polished and satiny, with a shot of raspberry flavor pushing through the currant, tar and spice core, lingering on the persistent finish. Drink now through 2020. 4,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Broad and expressive, with smoky roasted red pepper overtones to the dark plum and spice flavors, coming together harmoniously against crunchy tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 2,785 cases made.

name: Mélange Columbia Valley
review: A smooth, velvety style offers a core of cherry fruit surrounded by hints of cinnamon, pepper, autumn leaves and mineral notes. The finish doesn't quit easily, but this doesn't come off as a big wine. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese, Cabernet Franc and Syrah. Best from 2008 through 2014. 16,522 cases made.

name: Mélange Founder's Red Columbia Valley
review: Taut and focused, with tightly packed black cherry and savory spice notes, finishing long and harmoniously against nubby tannins. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Sangiovese, Petit Verdot, Syrah, Zinfandel and Tempranillo. Drink now through 2018. 11,865 cases made.

name: Mélange Red Columbia Valley
review: Lithe and distinctive, with a harmonious range of blackberry, raspberry, cherry and spice mingling effortlessly on the light, refined finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese, Cabernet Franc and Tempranillo. Drink now through 2012. 10,000 cases made.

name: Mélange Red Columbia Valley
review: Crisp in texture and beautifully focused to show its rose petal-accented blackberry and cherry flavors, finishing firm and persistent. Cabernet Franc, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese and others. Best from 2009 through 2013. 11,930 cases made.

name: Meritage Red Mountain
review: Firm and chewy, a stylish Merlot blend, packed with juicy currant and plum flavors, with a racy hot pepper and mint streak running through the finish. Best from 2003 through 2007. 630 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Lithe, focused and juicy, with black currant and mineral flavors, lingering nicely on the polished finish. Drink now through 2012. 3,361 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: A little chewy with tannins, but a veritable spice box of aromas and flavors; exotic, with cinnamon, allspice and star anise overtones to the basic black cherry. The finish lingers. Best after 1999. 2,946 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Smooth, elegant and nicely nuanced as plum, blackberry and spice flavors weave through supple textures. Delicious to drink now, but has the stuffing to improve through 1997. 491 cases made.

name: Merlot Red Mountain
review: Firm in texture, with plush cherry and blackberry fruit tightly packed in among the spicy, cedary notes and the chewy tannins. Best after 2005. 2,207 cases made.

name: Merlot-Cabernet Columbia Valley
review: This polished red gleams with raspberry and red plum fruit, framed with hints of coconut, clove and red pepper that linger gorgeously through the silky finish. Drink now through 2014. 4,200 cases made.

name: Merlot-Cabernet Columbia Valley
review: Polished in texture, this is balanced well to show expressive currant, blueberry and coffee flavors, lingering beautifully against refined tannins. Drink now through 2011. 3,965 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Columbia Valley Rosé
review: This gentle rosé is shocking pink in color but subdued in its strawberry and rhubarb flavors. Flavors pick up intensity on the dry finish. Drink now. 1,657 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Columbia Valley
review: This light, refreshing white brims with grapefruit and peach flavors, accented with fresh herb notes on the finish. Drink now. 3,950 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Bright and fruity, with ripe blackberry and cherry flavors prominent on the soft frame, lingering nicely as the finish persists. Drink now through 2011. 1,714 cases made.

name: Viognier Columbia Valley
review: Lovely, open-textured, aromatic stuff, a juicy mouthful of pear, grapefruit, floral and exotic spice flavors, lingering effortlessly. Drink now. 656 cases made.

name: Viognier Columbia Valley
review: Ripe and generous, built to contain rather than explode the flavors, so it focuses its peach, melon, apricot and exotic spice flavors into a bright beam. Drink now through 2000. 204 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Youthful, with blueberry and violet aromas and zesty black cherry and spice flavors that are still finding focus. Drink now through 2022. 7,255 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Firm and focused, with a veil of fine tannins around a plush core of blackberry, currant and green peppercorn flavors, lingering on the expressive finish. Best from 2018 through 2021. 9,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: There's a nice tang to the ripe currant and guava flavors in this fresh and lively red. Drink now through 2017. 25,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Fresh, with focused currant and spice flavors on an open texture. Fine tannins show on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 7,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Featuring grippy tannins, this medium-weight style touches on cherry, cassis, leather and spice flavors, finishing with freshness and vitality. Drink now through 2016. 8,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Light, lithe and lively, balancing its cherry and peppermint flavors against fine tannins, finishing with zip. Drink now. 988 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, with fine-grained tannins around a nice core of bright currant and cherry flavors that meld with spicy oak notes and linger on the harmonious finish. Good now, but might develop more depth by 2000. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Ripe and generous, a mouthful of spicy black cherry and berry flavors, feeling almost thick on the palate. Needs time to open up, at least until 1998 or '99. 1,100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Generous, spicy and chewy, with lavish tannins, exotic flavors and a nice core of berry and cherry notes. Marked by oak, it should be fine by 1998 or 1999. 450 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Broad and spicy, centering on cherry and anise flavors that dance through the generous finish. The tannins are well-incorporated. Drink now through 2020. 9,364 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Bright and jazzy, this features a lively mouthful of blackberry and currant fruit that picks up crisp tannins and floral notes as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2016. 4,700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Reserve
review: On the lighter side, with pretty currant and floral aromas and flavors that glow nicely through a thin veil of tannins, finishing with polish. Drink now through 2014. 4,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Red Mountain
review: A brawny Cabernet, dense with chewy tannins around a solid core of currant, plum and spicy herbal flavors, which linger nicely on the firm finish. Best after 2004. 2,300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Supple and easygoing, with appealing apple and creamy spice flavors. Drink now. 7,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Focused, lively and inviting, with pineapple, cream and toast flavors that dance through a supple finish. Finishes with panache. Drink now through 2018. 16,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: A sleek white, with juicy acidity and flavors of spicy pear and apple, set on a polished frame. Finishes with lithe intensity. Drink now through 2017. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: A crisp, minerally style, with some pizzazz, offering green apple, white pepper and lime flavors that echo on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 24,181 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Fresh, round and generous with its orange-scented pear and spice flavors, lingering on the well-formed finish. Drink now through 2006. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: A lean and intensely focused Washington white. Deftly balanced, showing nice hints of nectarine and pear flavors on the lively finish. 14,808 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Plush, easygoing and loaded with tropical fruit and toasted spice notes. Drink now through 2019. 2,864 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Lean and lithe, showing more structure than flavor, but the hints of pear and toasty spice seem ready to unfurl with cellaring. Best from 2015 through 2017. 2,354 cases made.

name: Malbec Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and lively, bursting with cranberry-accented blackberry and floral flavors, lingering on a transparent finish. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Mélange Columbia Valley
review: Light, tight and vibrant, with juicy currant and blackberry fruit on a deftly balanced frame, persisting on the refined finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah, Mourvèdre and others. Drink now through 2016. 9,511 cases made.

name: Mélange Columbia Valley
review: Supple, generous with its plum and floral flavors, finishing with round texture that firms up nicely as the flavors linger. Sangiovese, Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2005. 7,483 cases made.

name: Mélange Columbia Valley
review: Rich in texture, almost explosively flavorful, more in the mouth than on the nose, bursting with berry, floral and spicy character that lasts and lasts on the generous finish. Sangiovese and Syrah. Drink now through 2006. 8,046 cases made.

name: Mélange Founder's White Blend Columbia Valley
review: Supple and succulent, with easygoing peach and nectarine flavors. Riesling, Gewürztraminer, Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay. Drink now. 2,266 cases made.

name: Mélange Noir Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and deftly balanced, featuring refined currant and plum fruit riding over a background of roasted meat and roasted peppers, with refined tannins wrapping around the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Syrah and others. Drink now through 2017. 12,000 cases made.

name: Mélange Noir Columbia Valley
review: Generous, supple and appealing for its savory-accented cherry flavors, lingering effectively against a mild burr of tannins. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Malbec, Sangiovese, Tempranillo, Petit Verdot, Counoise, Grenache, Mourvèdre, Cinsault, Zinfandel, Pinot Noir, Petite Sirah and Carignane. Drink now through 2015. 25,500 cases made.

name: Meritage Columbia Valley
review: A minty character runs through the dark berry and licorice flavors in this firm but polished red, finishing deftly. Needs time to settle into itself. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Best from 2012 through 2017. 940 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and juicy, with raspberry and cherry fruit, tightly wrapped with fine tannins. Lingers enticingly on a deft frame. Drink now through 2015. 8,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Light and refreshing, with zingy raspberry and mint flavors that linger effortlessly. Drink now. 7,186 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Ripe and generous, but not heavy, with a lovely core of pure blueberry and plum against hints of white pepper and cream. Tannins are a bit gritty, so it needs food. Best from 2007 through 2011. 3,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Soft and plummy, with exotic spice overtones to the pretty fruit flavors, all in a light-textured package. Flavors echo nicely against refined tannins. Drink now through 2004. 3,279 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Firm and focused, chewy yet expressive, with licorice-accented blackberry and wet earth flavors, lingering on the sharply focused finish. Best from 2018 through 2021. 2,251 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Polished and round, with juicy cherry and raspberry flavors packed into a tight frame, lingering with hints of thyme and oregano. Drink now through 2015. 2,400 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Ripe flavors of plum and berry and a velvety texture entice, while the harmonious finish delivers nice touches of smoke and spice. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2003. 1,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Red Mountain
review: Rich and chewy, a firm-textured Merlot with smoky blackberry and currant flavors, finishing with a slightly tough edge. Drink now through 2006. 3,215 cases made.

name: Merlot-Cabernet Columbia Valley
review: Velvety and nicely focused, with green olive and wet earth flavors against a filament of currant fruit, which lingers on the mildly chewy finish. Drink now through 2010. 2,986 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Columbia Valley
review: Light and fragrant, with a tangy lime edge to the pear and floral flavors. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Columbia Valley Rosé
review: Light and silky, with pretty watermelon and lime blossom flavors, finishing dry, with finesse. Drink now. 1,400 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Red Mountain Ciel du Cheval Vineyard
review: Plump and generous with its pretty raspberry and jammy strawberry flavors, which echo nicely on the vibrant finish. Drink now through 2004. 140 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Columbia Valley
review: Light and polished, with pretty pear, floral and tangy lime flavors, picking up herbal notes as the finish lingers. Drink now. 3,003 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Columbia Valley
review: Light and refreshing, with grapefruit and floral flavors singing brightly and lingering well. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Columbia Valley
review: Light and tangy, with juicy pear and grapefruit flavors, finishing on a floral note, lingering nicely. Drink now. 4,050 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Columbia Valley
review: Crisp and bright, with melon, green apple and spice flavors. This is appealingly zingy and develops complexity with each sip. The long finish gives it a nice follow-through. 2,280 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: Velvety, supple style has a lovely core of blackberry and spice aromas and flavors, lingering impressively on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2010. 1,128 cases made.

name: Viognier Columbia Valley
review: Lively and refreshing for its tight balance, offering pear and white pepper aromas and flavors that linger on the deft finish. Drink now. 665 cases made.

name: Viognier Columbia Valley
review: A textbook Viognier, brimming with spicy pear and apricot flavors, staying round and generous through the dry finish. Drink now. 361 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: On the lighter side, but beautifully focused to show off its pretty plum and blackberry flavors, shaded with nice hints of coffee, olive and herb. The flavors last nicely and should develop with cellaring. Drink now through 2005. 1,830 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: A layer of fine tannins surrounds a core of pretty violet-scented blackberry and black currant flavors that linger nicely. Deserves cellaring. Best after 2001. 514 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: This spicy style adds peppery overtones to the lithe beam of lime and greengage plum flavors, finishing deftly. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Light and tangy, this white is crisp with lemony acidity, picking up apple and spice notes on the sharp-edged finish. Drink now through 2013. 14,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Soft and spicy, with a white pepper edge to the pear and tangerine flavors, finishing with a modest level of oak. Drink now. 14,735 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Light and supple, with pretty pepper and cream grace notes to the tangy citrus and pear flavors. Drink now through 2004. 12,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Smooth and fragrant with its pear, vanilla and cream aromas and flavors that linger gently on the supple finish. Nice now. 11,036 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: A bright, ripe and fruity Washington white that offers good flavors for the dollars. A nice thread of spicy oak runs through this to balance it out. Drinkable now. 11,500 cases made.

name: Malbec Columbia Valley
review: A mild grip of tannins underlies ripe currant and blackberry flavors, finishing with a soft texture. Drink now through 2016. 1,900 cases made.

name: Malbec Columbia Valley
review: On the lighter side, with tangy blackberry and floral flavors set on a refreshingly balanced frame. Drink now. 2,100 cases made.

name: Mélange Blanc Columbia Valley
review: Light and silky, with apple and pear flavors, finishing with a touch of almond flower. Riesling, Pinot Gris, Gewürztraminer, Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier. Drink now. 7,200 cases made.

name: Mélange Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and lively, open in texture, with blackberry and red pepper aromas and flavors, picking up an earthy note as the sweet fruit persists on the finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and others. Drink now through 2010. 18,000 cases made.

name: Mélange Columbia Valley
review: Smooth, almost silky, with distinctive overtones of exotic spice and peach to the light core of black cherry flavor. Finish lingers gently. Drink now through 2006. 2,995 cases made.

name: Mélange Founder's White Blend Columbia Valley
review: Bright and tangy, off-dry but playing the peach and citrus flavors against lively acidity. Riesling, Pinot Gris, Viognier, Chardonnay, Gewürztraminer, Sauvignon Blanc and Muscat. Drink now. 1,506 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: A tight, structured effort, with trim, graphite-laced blackberry and wild berry notes that show a gravelly edge, finishing with a clean, pebbly aftertaste. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 155 cases made.

name: Albariño El Dorado
review: Lemon-lime flavors are at the core of this tight, crisp white, with a fresh herbal side and bright acidity on the finish. Drink now. 147 cases made.

name: Auction Reserve BB Cape Winemakers Guild Stellenbosch
review: Dense, but sleek, with ample but fine-grained tannins coursing through while the fleshy plum, fig paste and macerated black currant fruit flavors hang on through the lengthy finish, which is inlaid nicely with tobacco and anise. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2015. 45 cases made.

name: The Jem Stellenbosch
review: This has plenty of power, with a huge core of red and black currant fruit, plum sauce and iron, all wrapped by layers of spice, well-integrated toast and tobacco. A sanguine hint chimes in, helping to stretch out the finish. There's impressive range and depth. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz, Mourvèdre, Merlot, Malbec, Barbera and Sangiovese. Not imported into the U.S. Best from 2010 through 2013. 730 cases made.

name: Auction Reserve Cape Winemakers Guild Stellenbosch
review: Ripe and plush, with mature hints of coffee and aged tobacco moving through the still youthful core of braised fig and macerated currant fruit. Long and plush on the nicely smoky finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec. Drink now through 2011. 50 cases made.

name: Auction Reserve Cape Winemakers Guild Stellenbosch
review: A dark, brooding style, with lots of espresso, bittersweet cocoa, fig, prune and currant paste notes, all laid over muscular tannins. A sweet tapenade undertow drives the finish, which ends with a hint of white pepper. Impressive for its range, though maybe a bit heavy-handed in style for some. Shiraz, Mourvèdre, Petit Verdot and Barbera. Labeled the same as the 2007 CWG auction wine, but the blend is different. Drink now through 2010.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch Auction Reserve Cape Winemakers Guild
review: The juicy apple, fig and pineapple fruit is mixed together at the core, backed by lightly singed hazelnut and warm piecrust notes. Shows good definition through the finish, with a mouthwatering matchstick hint. Drink now through 2014. 40 cases made.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch
review: Large-scaled, with bittersweet cocoa covering dense plum, fig and black currant fruit backed by game, tar and mineral notes. Thick but ripe tannins drive the lengthy finish. Drink now through 2010. 700 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch Kevin Arnold Nadine
review: Very ripe and lush, but well-defined, with mouthwatering fig, black currant and plum sauce notes liberally laced with espresso and graphite hints. The long, dark finish ripples along nicely. Impressive. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2011.

name: The Jem Stellenbosch
review: A dark, brawny style, delivering a mix of sage, olive, black currant and fig paste notes backed by a muscular, loam- and coffee-filled finish. This needs a touch of cellaring to settle in. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz, Malbec, Cabernet Franc, Mourvèdre, Sangiovese and Barbera. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2012.

name: The Jem Stellenbosch
review: A broad wine, with lots of coffee, toast and vanilla leading the way for a core of black cherry and currant fruit. The long, supple finish is driven by the toast, but this has good purity underneath, with hints of mineral and lavender peeking out. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot, Malbec, Mourvèdre, Shiraz and Barbera. Drink now through 2009. 750 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: A rock-solid Cabernet, with good flesh to the currant paste, braised fig, cedar and coffee notes that stay focused and integrated through the toasty finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2010. 4,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: A nicely ripe, rounded style, with pure, freshly cut pear and green melon fruit flavors up front, backed by more floral, pear skin and mineral notes on the finish, which add length and definition. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: Bright and racy, with pineapple and melon fruit offset by fresh acidity and a vibrant, minerally spine. Judicious toast frames the finish. Has nice purity. Drink now through 2008. 2,800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Ripe and full-bodied, with lots of straw and grapefruit pulp notes, but racy and driven too, with fleur de sel, chive and floral notes that add length and zip through the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Rich and stylish, with lemon curd, chamomile, honeysuckle and straw notes that glide through the lengthy, mineral-tinged finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 2,080 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Rich and nicely defined, with lots of lemon verbena, straw, mineral and chamomile notes that race through the elegant, lengthy finish. Drink now. 4,100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Restrained, with a chiseled feel to the salt, lime and chalk notes, which are followed by hints of sweet pea and mache. The nice long, bony finish begs for seafood. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Taut, with cedar, coffee, currant paste and toast notes stretched along a sanguine undertow. Shows both ripe and tangy notes on the finish. Cellaring should help flesh this out a bit more. Drink now through 2011. 4,700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Nice dark currant, loam, licorice and fig flavors run through this structured but accessible Cabernet. Dark fruit and tar hints linger on the finish. Drink now through 2008. 1,600 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: A plump, forward style, with tasty fig, apple and almond notes backed by a long, juicy finish. Drink now. 4,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: Rich and stylish, with fig, piecrust, butter and spice notes that show nice definition through the finish. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Chiseled and pour, with lime, flint and gooseberry flavors that run through a racy finish. Drink now. 3,200 cases made.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch Kevin Arnold Ashleigh Anne
review: Shows a gamy edge on the nose, with bittersweet cocoa, espresso, dark macerated currant fruit and a lingering, toasty finish. For fans of the robust style. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2011. 3,750 cases made.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch Kevin Arnold Michael Ian
review: Shows some funk on the nose, but there are plenty of dense plum, currant, tar, bacon and toast flavors here, with a richly layered finish. A bit heavy on the toast in the end. Cellar to let it sort itself out. Best from 2005 through 2007. 400 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: Reserved, with layers of fig, pear tartine and toast followed by pretty floral hints on the finish. Shows length and balance, and should open up more with brief cellaring. Drink now through 2006. 2,416 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Pecan Stream
review: Ripe and nicely focused, with melon, white peach, blanched almond and yellow apple notes that all mingle nicely through the medium-weight, lengthy finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 2,665 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Tight still, with flint, lime and straw notes harnessed by crisp acidity. Minerally finish. Should open up nicely after brief cellaring. Drink now through 2006. 3,100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Quite toasty, with bittersweet cocoa and espresso notes leading the way for a modest core of braised fig and mulled currant fruit. A cocoa edge takes over again on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Old World-style Cabernet with trim currant, cedar, tobacco and cocoa notes framed by dusty tannins. Relies on focus and length rather than opulence. Drink now. 600 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: Subtle pear and lime flavors, with a firm, minerally finish. Not a blockbuster, but stays with you nicely and would match well with food. Drink now through 2002. 1,500 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Pecan Stream
review: Shows nice citrus peel, white peach and chamomile notes, with a fresh, almost bracing finish. Drink now. 1,600 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch Kevin Arnold Lloyd Francis
review: Quite toasty, offering cedar, mesquite, bacon and cocoa powder notes that hold sway over a core of black currant and plum fruit, with a tobacco-tinged finish. More like Cabernet than Syrah. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 3,750 cases made.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch Kevin Arnold Nadine
review: A very pumped up red that relies heavily on its smoky, cocoa-driven toast. There's some currant and plum fruit here, though it's hard to get to, and it may not emerge fully before all is said and done. Drink now through 2005. 300 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape Pecan Stream
review: This offers nice, weighty lemon curd and grapefruit notes, spiked with a hint of thyme. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch Kevin Arnold
review: Has a bit of the funk at first, but it gives way to black cherry and spice notes, with crisp acidity driving the finish. Needs to round out a bit. Drink now through 2002. 800 cases made.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch Kevin Arnold Katherine Leigh
review: Shows mature cedar and tobacco notes, with medium-weight plum and currant fruit. The smoky finish has a gamy note. The best of three bottles. Drink now. 7,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Dark, brooding profile, with chewy layers of currant, game, grilled beef and tar. Has enough acidity to keep it going, but may seem heavy-handed to most folks. Drink now. 7,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Modern style, with blackberry and blueberry flavors that pick up sweet toast notes along the way. Straightforward. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Flavors of pear and light toast, picking up a grassy note on the finish. It's big, but lacks the zip to truly carry it off. Drink now.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch Kevin Arnold
review: Distinctive and problematic. International in style and well structured, with concentrated black cherry and spice flavors, yet overt, jumbled coffee, chocolate and animal aromas dominate. Drink now through 2002. 1,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Shows herb, cherry and toast aromas and flavors, which stay trim through the moderate finish. Drink now. 700 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Pecan Stream
review: Modest citrus peel and chamomile flavors with a firm edge to the finish. Drink now. 700 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville Moment of Truth Private Reserve
review: Unbalanced, with heavy-handed oaky, charry notes that overwhelm the ripe berry and cherry flavors. 50 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Ripe and stylish, with a hint of toasted brioche melded nicely into the core of lemon shortbread, straw, citrus and verbena notes. The long finish has mouthwatering acidity. Drink now through 2013. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Stellenbosch Circumstance
review: This delivers a rock-solid core of bitter black cherry, dark plum and black currant fruit flavors, inlaid liberally with tobacco leaf and dried sage notes, ending with an alder accent on the finish. Textbook varietal character, in a slightly muscular package. Drink now through 2018. 400 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Seriously Cool
review: Deliciously ripe, with a mix of white peach, pineapple, yellow apple and green melon fruit flavors, gilded with a honeysuckle note through the breezy finish. Drink now through 2019. 800 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Seriously Cool
review: This has a mix of creamy apple and peach flavors juxtaposed with crunchy lime and green almond accents. Pretty honeysuckle notes gild the finish. Drink now through 2017. 750 cases made.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch Circumstance
review: Ripe and solid, with a roasted cedar and chestnut leaf frame to the ample core of crushed plum, blackberry and black currant fruit. A black tea thread adds extra range to the finish. Drink now through 2014. 800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch Circumstance
review: This packs some solid lemon curd, white peach and gooseberry notes at the core, with racy verbena, chamomile and fleur de sel accents on the finish. The heft is matched by ample zip. Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Stellenbosch Circumstance
review: Pretty tobacco, grilled savory, mulled cherry and red currant fruit flavors meld here. Ends with light chalky threads carrying the finish. Drink now through 2018. 900 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch Circumstance
review: Shows a strong minty edge, with loam, cocoa powder and mulled blackberry and black currant fruit. The velvety finish shows a slightly mature feel, but this retains plenty of stuffing. Drink now through 2014. 600 cases made.

name: Circle of Life White Stellenbosch
review: This is engaging, with clementine, yellow apple, dried pineapple and orange zest notes all mixed together and racing through the lively, brioche-tinged finish. Sauvignon Blanc, Chenin Blanc and Sémillon. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch Circumstance
review: Fresh jicama, white peach and floral notes race along here, with a flash of gooseberry on the finish. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch Circumstance
review: Stylish, with light lemon curd and macadamia nut notes that glide underneath the high-pitched gooseberry and honeysuckle flavors. Pure finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Stellenbosch Circumstance
review: Frankly toasty, with dark mocha, espresso and bittersweet cocoa notes followed by chewy dark plum and blackberry fruit. Drink now through 2015. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch Circumstance
review: A juicy and direct white, with a quinine hint lining the Jonagold apple, star fruit and pineapple fruit flavors, revealing a flash of green almond that lingers on the finish. Drink now.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Seriously Cool
review: A fresh, floral-edged version, with a bright honeysuckle note alongside the green melon and green almond flavors. Features a flash of toast but retains a generally breezy feel through the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cinsault Stellenbosch Seriously Cool
review: Light, silky and breezy in feel, this is a pretty, uncomplicated red, with enticing pomegranate, blood orange, shiso leaf and menthol accents carried by a very subtle chalky thread.  Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Cinsault Stellenbosch Seriously Cool
review: Lively, with kirsch, savory and lightly singed menthol hints cruising along, graced by silky tannins. Light in body overall but showing range and persistence. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Circle of Life Red Stellenbosch
review: On the rustic side, with tar, smoldering tobacco and baker's chocolate notes, but also a good core of braised fig and steeped currant fruit. The tarry edge drives through the muscular finish, with a streak of savory herb in the background. Shows nice range, but not for everyone stylistically. Merlot, Syrah, Mourvèdre, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2014. 6,000 cases made.

name: Circle of Life White Stellenbosch
review: Light-bodied but lively, with tasty white peach, mirabelle plum and honeysuckle notes bouncing through. The fresh, breezy finish has a quick zip of quinine. Sauvignon Blanc, Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay. Drink now. 4,900 cases made.

name: Circle of Life White Stellenbosch
review: Tasty melon, almond and green plum notes move along here, with a kiss of brioche on the lively finish. Sauvignon Blanc, Chenin Blanc and Sémillon. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: A lightly toasted style, with a gentle macadamia nut hint guiding the core of white peach, straw and lemon curd. Ends with a slightly creamy edge. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Circumstance
review: A friendly, lightly toasted style, opening with a warm brioche note and followed by creamed peach and melon flavors that culminate in a lingering ginger hint on the finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Circle of Life Red Stellenbosch
review: Juicy, with a bold cassis bush note backed by brambly structure and a hefty dose of singed bay and smoldering charcoal on the slightly roughhewn finish. A gutsy jumble that might be tamed a bit with cellaring. Merlot, Shiraz and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2018. 2,320 cases made.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch Circumstance
review: Slightly taut in feel, with a core of currant and black cherry fruit that is starting to show hints of drying out, laced with dried mint and singed cedar notes through the finish. For old-school fans. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch Circumstance
review: Open-knit, with green apple skin, lime zest and kiwifruit notes backed by a melon rind edge on the finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch Circumstance
review: A tight, trim style, offering red currant and blood orange fruit flavors inlaid with cedar and balsam wood notes that leave a lightly grainy feel on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 550 cases made.

name: Circle of Life White Stellenbosch
review: Offers a light, breezy mix of peach, melon and yellow apple fruit flavors, with just enough zip to hold the lightly toasted finish. Sauvignon Blanc, Chenin Blanc and Sémillon. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Circle of Life Red Stellenbosch
review: Soft and rather mature, with a cocoa powder note over a medley of mint, mulled plum and sweet earth flavors. Hanging on. Merlot, Syrah and Petit Verdot.  Past its prime. 3,000 cases made.

name: Mourvèdre Western Cape Rosé Circumstance Cape Coral
review: Colored a very pale copper, with light dried tea leaf and watermelon seed notes. Clean but not all that complex. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mount Veeder
review: Offering the makings of a great start, with the rustic charm of chewy, extracted dark berry, licorice, underbrush and crushed rock notes, this never quite sheds the dusty veil, but that becomes the persona. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Toasty, spicy cedar notes dominate the ripe red fruit flavors. Well-balanced, with a good dose of firm tannins and a juicy finish. Drink now. 575 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A weak 2003 that's dry, herbal and leathery, with little fruit. 335 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
review: Supple, generous and open-textured, offering mint-accented black cherry, plum and floral flavors that unfurl elegantly on the long, expressive finish. The tannins are nicely submerged. Drink now through 2022. 440 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Ripe in aroma and flavor and tangy in style, with a lively edge to the pure currant and blackberry flavors, which linger effectively against refined tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2013. 240 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Praying Mantis
review: Supple, round and expressive, with orange peel and tea leaf overtones to the ripe plum flavors, finishing with density and fine tannins. Best after 2017. 135 cases made.

name: Viognier Columbia Valley
review: Silky and generous, offering a pretty mouthful of almond-scented pear, apricot and spice flavors. Drink now. 207 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Loess
review: Focused, gritty, earthy and expressive, with a wash of licorice-accented black fruit playing against smoky paprika overtones. The finish embraces the tannins and runs with them. Promises a fascinating evolution. Best from 2016 through 2022. 340 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Pepper Bridge
review: Ripe and round, fleshy but not weighty, brimming with sassafras-accented cherry and guava flavors that linger on the pure, refined finish. The tannins are a bit crisp. Needs some cellaring. Best from 2012 through 2017. 298 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Reserve
review: Firm, vibrant and expressive, this layers its plum and currant fruit with glints of red pepper, tar and dusky spices, lingering on the focused finish. Best from 2015 through 2020. 80 cases made.

name: Cappella Walla Walla Valley
review: Firm in texture, with an open feel to the black cherry, dark plum, floral and white pepper flavors, which persist expressively on the refined finish. Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2016 through 2020. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Forgotten Hills
review: Dense, focused, juicy and balanced to dance deftly over the mildly gritty tannins, this expresses its currant, plum and blackberry flavors with hints of sage and dried flowers. Lingering finish. Drink now through 2019. 190 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Loess
review: Taut, with a vibrant tension between the blackberry fruit and glints of olive, tar and mineral notes, melding smoothly on the expressive finish. Drink now through 2021. 258 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: The chewy texture leads to a generous core of blackberry, black olive and smoke flavors, narrowing to a more polished feel on the evocative, persistent finish. Best from 2014 through 2019. 375 cases made.

name: Cappella Walla Walla Valley
review: Light and silky, playing out its floral, blackberry and mocha flavors on a refined frame, letting it all linger effortlessly. This has grace and a compelling flavor profile. Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2015. 180 cases made.

name: Interlude Columbia Valley
review: Bursting with juicy blackberry and plum fruit, this has a lively feel, with modulated tannins and floral character on the finish. Appealing for its balance. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2015. 1,550 cases made.

name: Interlude Walla Walla Valley
review: Smooth and polished, this beguiling wine offers a plush mouthful of bright raspberry, cherry and chocolate flavors, finishing with a creamy note. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2015. 1,024 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Forgotten Hills
review: Taut, focused and expressive, playing the ripe blackberry and black cherry flavors against sandy tannins and hints of sassafras and black tea on the finish. Best from 2016 through 2022. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Forgotten Hills
review: Supple, focused, elegant and refined, this weaves black olive, green olive and mineral notes through dark berry and wet earth flavors, mingling harmoniously as the finish rolls on. Drink now through 2017. 514 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Loess
review: On the less-weighty side, this is dark in color and flavor, offering black pepper and ripe blackberry flavors. This picks up licorice and spice notes as the finish persists. Tannins are firm, but let the flavors through nicely. Best from 2013 through 2016. 195 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Old Stones
review: Focused, crisp and vital, with plum and spice flavors, shaded with gamy notes as the finish lingers against lightly crunchy tannins. Drink now through 2019. 240 cases made.

name: Tremolo Walla Walla Valley
review: Broad, complex and savory, featuring a mouthful of earthy, loamy black cherry, licorice and watermelon rind flavors that sail into the long and distinctive finish. Syrah and Grenache. Drink now through 2017. 270 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: On the lighter side, this is a subtle style, with supple texture and dark berry and floral flavors that recede gently on the finish. Needs time to gain some flesh. Drink now through 2016. 700 cases made.

name: Cappella Walla Walla Valley
review: Sleek and crisp, with nicely pointed red berry and fresh red pepper flavors that play against modestly scratchy tannins and fine acidity. Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2016. 190 cases made.

name: Interlude Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and vibrant, offering distinctive floral, white pepper and tamarind overtones to the dark berry flavors, mingling effectively on the well-balanced finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2018. 1,375 cases made.

name: Interlude Columbia Valley
review: Crisp tannins wrap around cinnamon-accented dark berry and toast flavors in this supple, generous, savory red, which finishes with a hint of roasted beet. Shows depth and dimension, but not weight. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2015. 859 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and vibrant, offering a lively mouthful of blueberry and plum flavors accented with hints of mineral, chalk and green olive as the finish sails on against refined tannins. Best from 2011 through 2015. 1,054 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Loess
review: Ripe in flavor, this is a minerally style with a distinct floral, peppery component to its berry and spice flavors, lingering against chewy tannins. Best after 2011. 190 cases made.

name: Syrah Washington
review: Supple and expressive, velvety in texture, with juicy flavors of huckleberry, plum and savory spice that keep dancing into a long and detailed finish. Drink now through 2020. 550 cases made.

name: Syrah Washington
review: Crisp and lively, offering boysenberry and anise flavors on a sleek frame. A hint of mineral sneaks in as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2017. 369 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Smooth in texture, an open, refined style that lets the dark berry and licorice flavors come through nicely, playing against savory flavors and silky tannins on the finish. Best from 2011 through 2015. 346 cases made.

name: Interlude Washington
review: Crisp in texture, with tobacco-accented black fruit and spice flavors balanced by firm tannins, showing persistence and harmony. Needs to soften with cellaring. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Best after 2015. 2,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Forgotten Hills
review: Structured and a bit taut, offering notes of boysenberry, dried sage and green tea, framed by firm tannins. Best after 2018. 300 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Loess
review: Dark and tangy, packed with black fruit, red pepper and balsamic flavors, an unusual mix, but a distinctive Syrah. Drink now through 2015. 120 cases made.

name: Tremolo Washington
review: Soft and generous, with pretty guava-inflected cherry and spice flavors on a velvety frame, echoing nicely on the finish. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now through 2020. 300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: A solid, chunky style that plays rich, ripe black cherry, licorice and black pepper flavors over lively acidity, remaining broad and expressive against firm tannins on the finish. Best after 2017. 500 cases made.

name: Prelude Columbia Valley
review: Soft in texture, with ripe pear and quince flavors against hints of tobacco and lemongrass on the finish. Roussanne and Viognier. Drink now. 164 cases made.

name: Prelude Horse Heaven Hills
review: Fresh and soft-edged, with pretty melon and tangerine flavors on a sleek frame. Roussanne and Viognier. Drink now. 360 cases made.

name: Prelude Washington
review: Soft and refreshing, with pear and floral flavors on a polished, generous frame. Orange peel notes add interest to the finish. Roussanne and Viognier. Drink now. 175 cases made.

name: Cappella Washington
review: Firm and focused, layering bright red cherry, dark black cherry, smoke and dark chocolate flavors that play against nippy tannins and acidity on the taut finish. Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2017 through 2020. 245 cases made.

name: Cappella Washington
review: Lithe, crisp and spicy, showing peppery notes to the black fruit and licorice flavors, with a moderate finish. Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best after 2015. 163 cases made.

name: Prelude Horse Heaven Hills
review: Soft and generous, with appealing flavors of orange peel and grapefruit. Roussanne and Viognier. Drink now. 190 cases made.

name: Prelude Washington
review: Polished and expressive, a bitter grapefruit pith edge interrupting the pear and honeysuckle flavors. Roussanne and Viognier. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc North Fork of Long Island Private Reserve
review: This focused red delivers cherry and black raspberry flavors over light, firm tannins, with smoke and herb accents that drive through the lively finish. Drink now. 214 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Fork of Long Island
review: Crisp and juicy, this fresh red shows cherry, berry, herb and light vanilla flavors on a lean frame, with light, firm tannins and biting acidity. Begs for food. Drink now through 2010. 112 cases made.

name: Campania Rosso North Fork of Long Island
review: The tart cherry, mineral and herb flavors are tight and fresh in this lean, lively red. Not muscular, but energetic. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2010. 100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc North Fork of Long Island
review: Soft, with mulled plum, cherry and raisin notes inlaid with slightly overt cinnamon and vanilla notes. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Merlot North Fork of Long Island Private Reserve
review: Plum, chocolate and light tobacco flavors mingle in this round red. The tannins are slightly gritty, but there's good acidity and a fresh, minty finish. Drink now. 192 cases made.

name: Chardonnay North Fork of Long Island Private Reserve
review: Thick and soft, this white offers pear and vanilla flavors with a heavy dose of buttery oak that turns a bit charry on the finish. Drink now. 216 cases made.

name: Merlot North Fork of Long Island Private Reserve
review: This supple red offers light, tart cherry fruit, with herb, menthol and vanilla notes. Lively but a bit candied. Drink now. 56 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River Awakening
review: Soft and round, a lovely mouthfiller, with pear, tropical fruit and sweet spice notes mingling effectively on the satiny texture, lingering well. Drink now through 2011. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River Shades Unoaked
review: A bright, tangy style, with flavors that are reminiscent of a margarita--lime and agave remains lively through the distinctive finish. Drink now through 2010. 17,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Margaret River
review: Lithe and distinctive for its green olive-scented blackberry and plum flavors, which are well-modulated and focused through the lively finish. Drink now through 2012. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Harmonious and well-proportioned, especially for the vintage, with well-integrated currant, blackberry and wild berry fruit that's supported by firm tannins and lively acidity. Finishes with a long, detailed aftertaste. Drink now through 2012. 1,704 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Hints of mature cedary oak, currant, anise and subtle tobacco notes give this a Bordeaux-like presence, with a dash of soy. Supple, balanced and well-proportioned, finishing with a tasty, complex finish. Drink now through 2014. 332 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Sleek and supple, with currant and toasty vanilla aromas and modestly structured cherry, sage and tomato leaf flavors that finish with ripe but firm tannins. Drink now through 2014. 1,404 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Lean, with herb, fresh earth and dried currant flavors that gradually come into focus. Concentrated, with firm tannins and good length. Drink now through 2011. 12,570 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Rustic in style, with a dense, murky core of currant, earth, iron, anise and cedary oak flavors. Young and a bit awkward, it nonetheless is concentrated and structured and at this price is hard to beat. Best from 2004 through 2011. 1,829 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros
review: Distinctive spicy citrus-grapefruit flavors merge with green apple in this crisp, medium-bodied white, gaining complexity on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,832 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Appealing for its red currant aromas and modest plum, cedar and spicy herb notes. Drink now through 2017. 990 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Napa Valley
review: Lemony, with coconut water, pear and stone fruit flavors, set on a medium body, with a crisp, juicy finish. An overtone of tropical fruit and floral details lend this some added charm. Drink now. 418 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: There's some charm to the slightly rustic profile of this wine, which offers firm tannins, a charred element and plenty of roasted herb notes, along with fresh, vibrant cherry and pomegranate flavors. Drink now through 2017. 2,011 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley Carneros
review: Perfumed, with ripe, floral plum and blackberry flavors that are elegant and refined, finishing with spicy notes and light oak shadings. Drink now through 2004. 400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey County
review: A mix of juicy pear and spicy flavors on a medium body, with a lingering finish. Drink now through 2005. 900 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Chewy and ripe, with good depth to cherry, plum and red currant tones that fold together nicely with modest structure and toasty oak flavors. Drink now through 2006. 945 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: The ripe pear, lemon and grapefruit flavors are bright and refreshing, set on a light, crisp body. Drink now. 834 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Delivers ripe, concentrated fig, honey, straw and melon tones, with fine focus and citrus rind acidity lingering on the finish. Drink now. 1,236 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Shows black cherry, spice and hints of leather in the aroma. Flavors are supple but straightforward, with mocha and cassis. Drink now through 2008. 2,359 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros
review: Complex, if on a modest scale, with ripe pear, apple, grapefruit and citrus scents, joined by a pithy edge. Drink now. 1,212 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Pretty cinnamon and spice notes, with bright cherry flavors and a hint of orange peel. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Herb, green been and stalky currant flavors give this a dry mouthfeel and make the tannins stand out. Drink now through 2015. 8,073 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Crisp, with sour cherry, fresh herb and berry flavors framed by vanilla oak and tart acidity. Drink now through 2007. 1,644 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Herbal, with green olive, green bean and mulch flavors, picking up currant tones on a firm tannic finish. 2,160 cases made.

name: Zinfandel-Petite Sirah Sonoma County
review: Appealingly briary and rustic, with zesty plum and smoky licorice flavors that finish with lively tannins and acidity. Drink now through 2017. 196 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Barn Block
review: Dry, lean and austere, with sage, mineral and dried currant flavors that are well-balanced for the vintage. Best from 2007 through 2011. 200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Russian River Valley Marino Vineyard
review: This features plenty of minerally crushed rock and seashell notes, with a core of crisp citrus and apple flavors set on a medium body. Drink now. 110 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Lovall Hills Vineyard
review: Medium-bodied, firm and spicy, with peppery berry flavors that have a nice beef jerky edge on the finish. Drink now. 110 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Alexander Valley
review: Peaches and passion fruit strike a pose here, followed by hints of melon and citrus. The ensemble is a bright, fine balance of tangy acidity and full, fresh body. 960 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Alexander Valley
review: A toasty, tangy mélange of grapefruit, apple and herbs, finishing crisply with a strong hint of Meyer lemon. Brisk and refreshing. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Alexander Valley
review: Showing moderate body and a core of pear, citrus and toasty oak flavors, this is firm and focused. On the finish, it offers bright acidity, with a lemony aftertaste. Drink now through 2002. 870 cases made.

name: Malbec Alexander Valley Rosé
review: Supple and light on its feet, with zesty watermelon and strawberry flavors. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
review: Focused, with excellent intensity to black cherry, currant, olive and herb tones, highlighted by cedary oak, leather and firm tannins. Drink now through 2008. 848 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
review: Layers of black currant, anise, plum, leather and smoke are tightly intertwined. Tannins are powdery. Moderate finish. Drink now through 2004. 270 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Vintage Select
review: Dark and ripe, with black fruit flavors and balanced, toasty notes. There's fleshy texture and good intensity through the finish. Drink now through 2014. 159 cases made.

name: Merlot Yorkville Highlands
review: Sleek and a bit tight, with focused red currant, tomato leaf and mineral notes. Drink now through 2016. 332 cases made.

name: Shiraz Alexander Valley
review: Rich and juicy, with a good dose of acidity. Pretty cherry, strawberry and herb flavors are the hallmarks. Firmly structured, it's good now and should age well. Drink now through 2004. 360 cases made.

name: Viognier Alexander Valley
review: Pretty aromas of honeysuckle, melon and vanilla, with elegant, juicy flavors of stone fruit, mineral and spice that fan out on the finish. Drink now. 736 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Yorkville Highlands
review: Crisp and focused, with appealing cherry, herb and anise flavors. Drink now. 125 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Alexander Valley
review: Racy, ripe with zesty tropical fruit and spicy, vanilla oak, turning complex on the finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Alexander Valley
review: Clean and pure flavors of lemon-lime, mineral and tropical notes. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Alexander Valley
review: Smooth though somewhat restrained, this wine shows pretty pear and citrus flavors in a delicate vein. Drink now. 520 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yorkville Highlands Rosé
review: Crisp and easy to sip, with cherry, herb and spice flavors. Drink now. 140 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Mendocino
review: Intense peach, nectarine and citrus flavors mingle well with sweet hay notes and juicy acidity. Drink now. 11,300 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Yorkville Highlands
review: Passon fruit, lemongrass and lime flavors are vivid and almost pungent in this white. A crisp acidity and terrific green tea aromatics come in on the finish. Drink now. 3,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
review: Cola, spice and herb notes frame the currant and plum flavors, with chewy tannins and a spicy finish. Nice focus and balance. Drink now through 2012. 1,716 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Mendocino
review: Intense, with tart, unsweetened lemonade flavors that are juicy and refreshing. Drink now. 3,329 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Mendocino
review: Lively, with very good intensity to lemon-lime, grass, melon and baby powder nuances. Stays tangy though a tart finish. Drink now. 3,600 cases made.

name: Shiraz Alexander Valley
review: Firm, with chewy intensity to beef, earth, leather and herb tones, wrapped within cedar and solid tannins. Drink now through 2008. 1,326 cases made.

name: Viognier Alexander Valley
review: Smells like roasted peanuts, with firm, ripe melon and dried apricot flavors. Turns delicate with a floral note. Drink now. 626 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mendocino
review: Intense, with a wash of cedar and vanilla wrapped around citrus rind and green pear flavors. Drink now. 1,331 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Mendocino
review: A lively, tart style, with lemon, passion fruit, green apple and grassy notes. Drink now. 1,092 cases made.

name: Shiraz Alexander Valley
review: Concentrated, with a wave of cedary oak framing beef, dried berry and spice flavors. The brawny structure lingers. Drink now through 2006. 1,448 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
review: Firm and tart, with good concentration to the olive, mulch and black currant flavors, framed by plenty of cedary oak and earthy, green-edged tannins. Drink now through 2008. 557 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Yorkville Highlands
review: Toast and smoke notes never quite find the pace with the core of tangy citrus and apple flavors. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: The Triple Play Yorkville Highlands
review: A smoky, bacony style, with wild berry, leather and spice flavors and chewy, rustic tannins. Syrah, Petite Sirah and Viognier. Drink now through 2012. 4,080 cases made.

name: Viognier Alexander Valley
review: Tangy citrus flavors compete against spicy cedar notes. The result is a tart, smoky combination on a light body, with zingy acidity. Drink now. 462 cases made.

name: Viognier Alexander Valley
review: Lightly aromatic, with lemon and orange blossom scents that pick up a trace of green apple and chalk. Drink now. 548 cases made.

name: Merlot Yorkville Highlands
review: Features distinct green bean aromas and flavors. Drink now. 230 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Alexander Valley
review: Flint, earth and citrus notes combine in a tart, tangy package. Drink now through 2002. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Mendocino
review: Lively and tart, with grass, lemon and lime skin tones wrapped in lingering citrus acidity. Drink now through 2005. 2,416 cases made.

name: Viognier Alexander Valley
review: Overt cedary notes give the citrus and apple flavors here a distinctive cidery vibe, with soft acidity and a spicy finish. Drink now. 310 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley Susy's Cuvee
review: Fleshy, with melon, nectarine and vanilla flavors wrapped in loads of tangy lemon. Drink now. 315 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley Susy's Cuvee
review: Tart, with good intensity to straw, grass and lemon peel flavors accented by vanilla.  Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: El Prat Columbia Valley
review: Polished, round and expressive, with an open texture to the dark plum, sassafras and floral flavors, this picks up a minty note as the finish lingers with a touch of pepper. Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2019. 185 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Fort Ross-Seaview Wayfarer Vineyard
review: A riveting style, rich and complex, with enticing aromas that mix zesty wild berry and blueberry flavors with a pleasant edge of earth and savory herbs. Impressively rich, yet graceful. The supple tannins keep reverberating. Drink now through 2024. 880 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Fort Ross-Seaview Wayfarer Vineyard
review: Ultrarich and flavorful, with a tasty mix of tangerine, nectarine, white peach and honeysuckle flavors woven together in a full-bodied style that's broad and expansive, highlighting the core citrus flavors. Ends with a long, juicy, lingering aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Fort Ross-Seaview Wayfarer Vineyard
review: Showcases creamy tangerine- and nectarine-driven flavors, with lively acidity and a pithy citrus skin texture. The elements push through effortlessly, gaining depth and nuance along the way. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Fort Ross-Seaview Golden Mean
review: Fresh, pure, vivid aromas of ripe plum, raspberry and blackberry give this a complex flavor profile, framed by acidity and tannins. Gains length, finesse and grace on a long finish, punctuated by grainy tannins. Drink now through 2022. 280 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Fort Ross-Seaview Wayfarer Vineyard
review: Offering aromas of cedar, graphite, stem and dried berry, this is very compact, dense and chewy, slowly unfolding on the finish and revealing a more supple, graceful texture. Drink now through 2022. 780 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Fort Ross-Seaview Wayfarer Vineyard
review: Combines rich tiers of smoky oak and honey-laced fig and melon flavors. The texture is raw and pithy, suggesting time in the bottle will help. Most impressive on the finish, where the flavors maintain their density, focus and persistence. Drink now through 2019. 820 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Fort Ross-Seaview Wayfarer Vineyard
review: Fragrant, with delicate white flower, peach and honeydew melon notes that gain richness without weight on the finish, where the fruit takes on a perfumed aroma. Drink now. 660 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Fort Ross-Seaview Mother Rock
review: This offers a graceful, supple texture to its firmly concentrated and well-built mix of raspberry, blackberry, cedar and lead pencil. Features a tannic profile. Best from 2016 through 2025. 340 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Fort Ross-Seaview Mother Rock
review: Well-centered on a potent core of dusty, earth-laced blackberry, cedar and crushed rock flavors, giving this a rustic texture. The fruit gushes through on the finish, showing a persistent density. Best from 2016 through 2024. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Fort Ross-Seaview Paige's Ridge
review: Offers complex aromas of cedar, lead pencil and graphite. Very tight and tannic, yet with a seam of finesse, ending with a potent display of dark berry fruit. Drink now through 2024. 110 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Fort Ross-Seaview Golden Mean
review: Dense and powerful, with a potent, complex mix of extracted blackberry, dusty earth and herb, cedar and pencil lead flavors, ending with a massive tannic presence that veers toward dry and chewy. Best from 2016 through 2025. 550 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Fort Ross-Seaview The Traveler
review: Rugged, with a raw, chewy texture. The core blackberry and wild berry flavors are intense and firmly tannic, with snappy acidity that imparts a minerally, wet rock taste and texture. Drink now through 2024. 130 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Fort Ross-Seaview The Traveler
review: Intense and vibrant, with a mix of rich, firm dark berry, cola, raspberry and mocha, this is a big expressive style that's not shy on flavor or tannic muscle, yet there's a sufficient push of acidity to keep it lively. Drink now through 2022. 170 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Fort Ross-Seaview Wayfarer Vineyard
review: Rugged, with a dense, chewy core of blackberry, wild berry and blueberry fruit that's firm and framed by dusty, cedary earth and oak accents. Ends up with an extracted-berry-skin tannic structure. Best from 2016 through 2024. 1,300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Fort Ross-Seaview Paige's Ridge
review: Firm and dense, with a savory note to the rich, mineral-laced core of blackberry, licorice and dried herb, ending with a chewy road-tar coating that's persistent, dry and tannic. Drink now through 2022. 140 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Fort Ross-Seaview Wayfarer Vineyard
review: Displays an effusive, direct fruitiness centered on cherry, plum and wild berry flavors that have a nice touch of spice and mineral, making this ideal for drinking now. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Bright and distinctive for its wild cherry and roasted beet aromas and flavors, wrapping smoothly around a supple core of polished tannins. Savory black olive notes weave through the long, pointed finish. Drink now through 2016. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Rich and round, but nicely balanced to display its plum and spicy oak flavors deftly, with a rich feel to the tannins—but no heaviness—as the finish sails on and on. Drink now through 2015. 1,100 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Rich and wild, with a forest berry, floral and savory range of flavors, echoing the berry and a touch of pepper as they linger effectively on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay McLaren Vale Elevenses
review: Delicate, polished style introduces a creamy edge to the pear and citrus flavors, hinting at toasted bread notes as the finish lingers. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Ripe and supple, a plush textured Cabernet with layers of currant, blueberry, dried cherry and spice flavors, hinting at herbs on the firm finish. Drink now through 2007. 1,000 cases made.

name: Petit Verdot McLaren Vale
review: Ripe and open-textured, with currant and blueberry flavors at the core, with white pepper, sage and floral notes that linger nicely on the slightly gritty finish. Best from 2008 through 2012. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
