review: Solid stuff, with juicy blackberry and currant fruit framed with spicy, earthy notes that mingle with the fruit as the finish persists nicely against firm tannins. Best from 2007 through 2012. 2,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Lean and crisp, with some pretty plum and berry flavors coming through, finishing with a definite touch of sweet oak. Drink now through 2004. 1,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Rich and generous, a big, tannic mouthful of plum, blueberry and earthy spice flavors that get a bit hot on the finish. Best after 2007. 2,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Dense and chewy, with a tannic edge to the licorice and black cherry flavors, finishing with focus. Best from 2010 through 2013. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Bright and refined in style, with pretty blackberry, plum and earth aromas and flavors, hinting at mineral on the well-modulated finish. Drink now through 2005. 200 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Ripe and supple, with dark berry and herb flavors, lingering on the open finish. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Chardonnay McLaren Vale
review: Smoky, creamy flavors run through this nicely balanced white, offering lime and apple flavors on the crisp finish. Drink now through 2002. 120 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: An odd balance of ripe cherry and berry fruit against earthy, decadent notes that dominate the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay McLaren Vale
review: Youthful and fresh, with a lime and pepper edge to the apple and spice flavors. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling McLaren Vale Dry
review: Hard, tart and unpleasant for its searing acidity and chalky flavors. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon St. Helena Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Vineyard
review: Rich, plump and generous, offering lively, fleshy plum, wild berry and black cherry fruit that's sweet, with pretty creamy oak shadings. Drinks easy, yet offers a complex mix of flavors. Drink now through 2013. 122 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon St. Helena Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Vineyard
review: Big, rich, ripe and concentrated, with a mouthful of crushed berry, currant and black cherry fruit that's framed by chewy tannins. Supple midpalate, yet firm and tannic at the end. Drink now through 2012. 480 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Weiss Vineyard
review: Firm and elegant, with spicy currant, light cedary oak, anise and black cherry flavors that are well-focused, with a long, complex finish. Best from 2009 through 2015. 474 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard
review: Ripe, plush and concentrated, yet elegantly styled, with spicy currant, herb, cedar, lead pencil and tobacco. Firms up on the finish, and the tannins add nice traction. Drink now through 2012. 460 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc St. Helena Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Vineyard
review: Ripe wild berry, spice, cedar and tobacco flavors are tasty and generous, with a long, lingering finish and polished tannins. Drink now through 2012. 101 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Weiss Vineyard
review: Well-structured, firm and spicy, with a complex mix of dusty berry, mineral, earth and herbal notes. Smooths out midpalate and then is wrapped in rich tannins. Decant. Best from 2008 through 2013. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard
review: An elegant style, supple and polished, with ripe, rich black cherry, wild berry and currant flavors that are clean, focused and persistent. Ends with fine-grained tannins and herbal flavors that push through. Drink now through 2013. 213 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Hidden Ridge Vineyard
review: Rich, intense and polished, with a deep, concentrated mix of dried currant, herb, green olive, sage and dusty berry, ending with firm, chewy tannins that clamp down tightly. Needs time. Best from 2010 through 2015. 251 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Oakville Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard
review: Offers creamy oak, dried currant and herb notes, with mineral and sage. Turns tight, dry and austere on the palate, ending with a complex, tannic aftertaste. Decant. Drink now through 2011. 240 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Brittan Vineyard
review: Light and bright, with a polished texture and pretty raspberry and strawberry fruit. Delicately spicy on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 223 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Oakville Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard
review: Herb flavors have good intensity, showing juicy plum and currant notes, with spice, cedar and tobacco accents and thick tannins. Drink now through 2012. 96 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Hidden Ridge Vineyard
review: High-toned, with very ripe fruit and hints of cherry cider, currant and wild berry. Medium-weight and balanced, with supple tannins. The best of two bottles tasted. Drink now through 2011. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Blue Farm Vineyard
review: Offers a spicy, minty edge to the mix of berry flavors. Intense and grainy, ending with a cedary oak aftertaste. Drink now through 2018. 263 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills
review: Taut, with notes of forest floor to the dried cherry, berry and raspberry flavors. Slate and spice details show on the crisp finish. Drink now through 2020. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills
review: Attractive aromas of dusty herb and earth lead to a firm core of red berry, licorice and anise flavors. A light creamy note lingers. Drink now through 2020. 440 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills
review: Fresh strawberry, rhubarb and wild berry notes form the core of this red, which is snappy and vibrant, clean and refreshing, with crisp, fine-grained tannins. Drink now. 225 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Nahe Monzinger Frühlingsplätzchen
review: An elegant Riesling that leads with its mineral and spice notes, backed by ripe peach and apricot fruit. Light-bodied, complex and beautifully integrated. Lingers with a spice and stone aftertaste. Drink now through 2025. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Nahe Monzinger Frühlingsplätzchen
review: Redolent of ripe melon, with plenty of well-focused notes of apple, ripe citrus and cinnamon. Candied quince flavors linger on the finish. Fresh and fruity. Drink now through 2030. 70 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Monzinger Frühlingsplätzchen
review: Offers a minerally aroma, with ripe flavors of custard-topped melon. Sweet and sour notes show on the finish. Drink now. 56 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: A chewy, extracted style, with currant, beef, prune, coffee and sage flavors that run through a slightly chunky finish. Has character, but is a bit hard to warm up to. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Edna Valley
review: Simple, earthy citrus and tropical fruit flavors, with toasty oak, turning candied on the finish. Drink now. 190 cases made.

name: Riesling Trockenbeerenauslese Pfalz Deidesheimer Herrgottsacker
review: Has truly great balance in such a wonderfully concentrated, sweet wine. Multi-dimensional nose of honey, spice, tropical fruit and butterscotch; full-bodied, with very intense, sweet and focused honey, botrytis and spice flavors. Great acidity and a superlong finish; has great aging potential. Better in 1995 or '96.

name: Riesling Kabinett Halbtrocken Rheingau Winkeler Hasensprung Charta
Riesling Trockenbeerenauslese Pfalz Deidesheimer Herrgottsacker Geheimrat J
review: More like caramel than wine. An outstanding, intensely spicy, smoky almond and honey character. Full body, honeylike texture, good acidity and a long, sweet finish. Still a little coarse on the finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheingau Winkeler Hasensprung Geheimrat J
review: A big, honeyed wine. Full body, rich texture, firm acidity and stunning concentration. A full, intense finish that opens up to mineral and honey notes. Best after 1997.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr Geheimrat J
review: Really intense and concentrated: just as expected of a top auslese. Has a very pronounced, flinty-mineral character, modest sweetness, medium body and a long, clean finish. Drinkable now, but will take to aging.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Forster Üngeheuer
review: This is round and delicious with all the spice, bread crust, apple, honey character we like in an auslese. Full-bodied and medium-sweet with a spicy finish. Drink now. 127 cases made.

name: Riesling Eiswein Rheingau Geisenheimer Rothenberg
review: Beautiful, with a deep amber color. Very rich and ripe, yet the lemon and citrus character does a good job of preventing it from cloying the palate. Drink now.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Berncasteler Doctor
review: Rich auslese showing honey, peach and spice character. Full in body yet very elegant and balanced with a crisp finish. Delicious now but will improve with age. 172 cases made.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Berncasteler Doctor Geheimrat J
review: Smooth and caressing on the palate, but not quite enough concentration to reach the outstanding mark for this category. Full body, medium sweetness, with spice, mineral and apricot flavors and long finish. Drinkable now, or try aging.

name: Riesling Eiswein Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Kaseler Nies'chen
review: Wonderful balance of spicy, ripe fruit, honeyed sweetness and high acidity. A textbook eiswein. Full-bodied and sweet, with loads of fruit and a long, spicy finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz
review: Slightly better than the Forster Ungeheuer. Extremely focused offering wonderful spicy, mineral, fruity character. Medium-bodied and lightly sweet with a fresh finish. 255 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz
review: Classic, with intensely floral aromas and ripe fruit flavors. Medium-bodied and off-dry, with racy, crisp acidity and a long finish. A classic food wine. Drink now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Forster Üngeheuer
review: This textbook Riesling isn't too sweet and isn't too dry. Extremely clean and well balanced, with a taste of apricot, honey and almond and a long, lovely finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheingau Mittelheimer St. Nikolaus
Riesling Kabinett Rheingau Rüdesheimer Berg Rottland
Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr Geheimrat J
review: A lovely, elegant wine that offers mineral and lemon aromas and flavors. Lightly sweet, with fine acidity and a long, crisp finish. Needs some time to show what it can offer.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Forster Üngeheuer
review: Exciting, sweeter-styled, full-bodied spätlese with masses of spice, mineral and licorice character. It really goes straight for your taste buds. 1,260 cases made.

name: Riesling Eiswein Rheingau Oestricher Lenchen
review: A broad, lush dessert wine, showing plenty of opulent honey and dried apricot notes. Lacks a bit of definition and focus. Drink now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Berncasteler Doctor Geheimrat J
review: Not a huge wine, but classy and racy. Elegant style, with loads of mineral, mint and melon aromas and flavors. An off-dry, medium-bodied white with fine acidity and a long, fresh finish. Delicious now, but will take to a little age.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
review: Fresh and exciting, offering delicate aromas of mineral, peach and apricot. Medium-bodied and lightly sweet, with lovely mineral and biscuit flavors and a clean finish. Quite a serious wine. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz
review: An excellent spätlese in which the sweet and dry elements mix in an elegant, complex package, flavored by peach, almond and a touch of honey. Best after 1995.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Deidesheimer Herrgottsacker
review: A very dry wine that needs to be paired with food; great with Chinese food. Unconventional but well made, with fresh floral and apricot aromas. Medium-bodied and almost completely dry, with spice, citrus and flinty fruit flavors. Has medium acidity and a long mineral and fruit finish.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheingau Rüdesheimer Berg Rottland Geheimrat J
review: This is beautifully balanced. Ripe apple, spice and mineral aromas and flavors come through the medium-bodied frame, and continue on to a long, almost dry finish. Drinkable now, but try aging this.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
review: Crisp, sharp and focused, with nice, rich pear, peach and honey flavors, but rather light in structure for an auslese. The finish gains from a good amount of acidity. Drink now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: A weighty kabinett, with plenty of fruit. Lovely apple, pear and lemon aromas follow through onto the palate. Medium-bodied, with good acidity and plenty of weight. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Rheingau Oestricher Lenchen Geheimrat J
review: This has full grapefruit and pineapple aromas and flavors, showing plenty of extract. Medium body, medium-sweet, with a long and juicy finish. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Berncasteler Doctor
review: Refined, with subtle aromas of mineral and apple. Medium-bodied and lightly sweet, with anise and spice flavors and a medium finish. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz
review: A delicate style, with fresh floral and melon aromas. Medium-bodied and off-dry, with spicy, flinty, fruity flavors and fresh acidity. A little short. Drink now.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
review: Very approachable and easy to drink. Medium-bodied and sweet, with almond and apricot aromas, blanched almond and peach flavors and a light finish. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Deidesheimer Herrgottsacker
review: A delicate Auslese, with attractive honey and spice flavors. More of an attractive honey and spice flavors. More of an apertif style. Lovely, delicate, spicy nose; medium-bodied, with sweet fruit, intense spice and honey flavors and a balanced finish.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheingau Rüdesheimer Berg Rottland
review: On the lighter side for an auslese, but has a good balance of fruit, acidity and sweetness. Has delicate lemon tart and tropical fruit aromas. Medium-bodied, with medium sweetness and plenty of lemon, spice and tropical fruit flavors. Has good acidity; drinkable now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Forster Üngeheuer
review: Bigger than a Kabinett, more like a spätlese. Medium-to-full bodied with sweet rich fruit and a medium finish. A little ponderous and heavy in style. Drink now. 178 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Rheingau
review: This no-nonsense kabinett is well made, but rather modest in size. Shows floral, lemon, almond and green apple aromas. Medium-bodied and lightly sweet, with floral and spice flavors and hints of grass. Drink now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Rheingau Rüdesheimer Berg Rottland
review: A lively kabinett that refreshes your palate. Slightly one-dimensional, with light almond and rich tropical fruit aromas. Medium-bodied, with rich, spicy almond flavors and very firm acidity. A live wire. Drink now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: A lovely, delicate wine that should match well with food. Light-bodied and off-dry, with aromas of freshly cut melons and peaches, plenty of melon flavors and a fresh finish. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheingau
review: Gives more on the nose than on the palate. Medium-bodied and off-dry, with almond, peach, pie crust and lemon-lime aromas and lovely pie crust and spice flavors, but a dull finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Trocken Pfalz Deidesheimer Herrgottsacker
Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Bernkasteler Graben Geheimrat J
review: Lots of mineral character in this wine. Medium body and sweetness, with acacia and melon flavors and a soft, round finish.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz
review: Appealing, crisp and juicy, showing plenty of lime and peach flavors. Fruity and light, leaving a satisfying, fresh aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Rheingau Rüdesheimer Berg Rottland
review: An off-dry Riesling that smells and tastes of ripe apricots. This harmonious wine offers an appealing texture that makes it drinkable now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheingau Rüdesheimer Berg Rottland
review: Good for food with cream sauces. Thick and rich with creamy, apricot, spicy character, full body, off-dry and a soft finish. Drink now. 133 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Forster Üngeheuer
review: Sweet, fruity and attractive, but you wish for a bit more depth on the soft finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheingau Oestricher Lenchen
review: Reasonably well-made auslese with spicy, pie crust, apple character. Medium-bodied and medium- sweet with a fruity finish. Drinkable now. 550 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheingau Winkler Hasensprung
review: Light overall, with lemon, peach, spice and melon aromas and flavors. Medium sweet and balanced, with a light finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
review: Pleasant and soft with attractive flavors of peaches and cream. Medium body; light sweetness and finish. Could use a little more of an aftertaste. 756 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheingau
review: Interesting wine but already fully mature with sweet fruit, roasted almond character. Medium-bodied, medium-sweet and a spicy finish. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Rheingau Oestricher Lenchen Geheimrat J
review: Very rich dried apricot character, but rather mature, full-bodied and high in alcohol. A strange dessert wine for Germany. Also a bit blunt on the finish.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: Crisp, fresh, delicate and quite tart. The vibrant acidity does a good job balancing the sweet, ripe melon and pear flavors. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Deidesheimer Herrgottsacker
review: Has focused, super-clean honey and tropical fruit aromas, but falls short on the finish. Medium-bodied and off-dry, with pineapple and spice flavors. The finish is clean, but short.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
review: A little dull and not giving much on the nose, but there are some pleasant creamy, apple flavors. Medium body; medium-sweet with a short aftertaste.  544 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheingau Rüdesheimer Berg Rottland
Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Berncasteler Doctor
review: Big and bulky. Has ripe fruit character, but lacks the finesse to pull it off. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheingau Rüdesheimer Berg Rottland
review: Rounder and smoother than most in this group. Gold in color, showing decent pineapple and spice flavors and a modest finish. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheingau Geisenheimer Rothenberg
review: You expect more from a wine billing itself as an auslese than this diluted Riesling offers. Has honey, apricot and pear flavors, but the finish is short and watery.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Rheingau Oestricher Lenchen
review: Strange slightly maderized aromas and flavors with some interesting ripe fruit character. 38 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Berncasteler Doctor
review: Very disappointing. Rather flat and unexciting with appley, earthy flavors. 344 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Forster Üngeheuer
review: Somewhat diluted and lacking in fruit. Light-bodied and off-dry, with light grass and lemon aromas. Lacks concentration and flavor. Perhaps made from overcropped grapes.

name: Riesling Kabinett Rheingau Rüdesheimer Berg Rottland
review: Dull. Disappointing for this producer. Another premature dry wine with smoky, earthy, fruity character. Medium-bodied and soft. 300 cases made.

name: Merlot Mendocino County
review: Juicy, if modestly structured. Offers notes of cherry, herb and tea. Drink now through 2016. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendocino County
review: Crisp, light and lively, with generous currant and berry aromas and flavors shaded by a touch of bay leaf and oak coming through on the finish. Very attractive to drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Patriot Mendocino County
review: Offers modest notes of cherry and strawberry, charred pepper and herb. Merlot blend. Drink now through 2019. 738 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mendocino County
review: Exotic peach, pineapple and nectarine flavors won't shortchange you on flavor, but they stray from the typical Chardonnay spectrum. The finish is clean and crisp. A complete and satisfying drink.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendocino County
review: Fresh, fruity and easy to drink. Blueberry flavors and light tannins make it appealing to drink now. Reasonably priced, too. 2,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendocino Limited Reserve
review: A oaky style with vanilla bean and coffee scents, and as you might expect that flavor dominates the fruit underneath, drying out on the finish. Fans of toasty oak should love it. Drink now. 2,669 cases made.

name: Road i Red Mendocino County
review: Simple and generic, with modest cherry and herb notes. Merlot and Syrah. 2,607 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mendocino County
review: Simple and fruity, but priced right. The cherry and plum flavors won't wow you, but it's more than passable, with enough varietal character to call it Pinot Noir. Drink now.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: Shows precision balance between the intense beam of acidity and a range of honeyed fruit flavors, including pineapple, dried apricot and star fruit. Tightly wound now, with a long, lingering finish of apple and spice. Best from 2011 through 2040. 10 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum Cuvée d'Or Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: Very concentrated, this SGN delivers citrus marmalade, honey and spice flavors, all well-integrated into the structure and texture. It's even tactile on the finish, with a pleasant tannic bitterness that tingles around the gums. Best from 2007 through 2025. 20 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée d'Or Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: Super. Extremely concentrated, sweet and intensely flavored with honey, caramel and apricot flavors buoyed by a lighter-than-air texture and lively structure. Great class and length. Drink now through 2012. 5 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Sélection de Grains Nobles
Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: Amazingly fresh and lively, this barely seems sweet, yet it's also concentrated and packed with flavor. Rose and tropical fruit notes are encased in honey, all presented in an elegant manner. Subtle, lingering finish. Drink now through 2022. 75 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Seamless, this is rich with concentrated flavors of dried papaya and guava, glazed apricot, grated coconut and flowers, remaining beautifully balanced by the finely detailed, mouthwatering acidity. Reminiscent of liquid candy, this is hard to stop sipping, showing purity and overall finesse. Drink now through 2033. 10 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: Classic Gewürztraminer aromas of roses, litchi and honey surround a core of stony, minerally flavors in this lavish white. Restrained and impeccably balanced, with a subtle length, this should develop beautifully over the next five years. Drink now through 2005. 40 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Mambourg Cuvée d'Or Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: Rich and smoky, with a subtle core of racy acidity enlivening peach pie, quince paste and orange blossom flavors. It's unctuous, with a thread of minerality that leads to the lingering, honeyed finish. Drink now through 2028. 7 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Cuvée d'Or Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: Round and concentrated, this shows a bracing structure too, acting as a counterpoint to the sweetness. It has a more candied quality to its fruit, with dried apricot, quince and caramel notes. Long, tactile finish. Best from 2007 through 2027. 15 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: The scent of chanterelles sautéing in butter leads into a racy dessert white sporting orange marmalade, dried pear and quince notes that just won't quit. Great balance and expressive, with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2025. 128 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Altenbourg Cuvée d'Or Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: This SGN feels light-weight and elegant, but packs a lot into its refined frame. There's intense, lip-smacking acidity supporting layer upon layer of flavor, with patisserie apple, papaya, fleur de sel and peach compote notes that show hints of marzipan, tarragon and ground spices. A lovely balance of clean, strong form and fine attention to detail, all seamlessly integrated. The long, juicy finish goes on and on. Drink now through 2038. 44 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée d'Or Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: Racy and elegant, this wears its sweetness and intense honey, apricot and pineapple flavors well. It really builds in intensity without getting heavy, ending with a lingering aftertaste of dried apricot and citrus. Drink now through 2025. 11 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: Thick and intense, yet not heavy or cloying, this shows plenty of botrytis, with honey, spice, bergamot and dried tropical fruit flavors. Well-balanced, it continues with the honey note on the finish.  Drink now through 2015. 6 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Intense acidity drives this stylish white, which delicately blends flavors of smoke, candied apple, peach sorbet and blood orange. The light and airy texture belies the wine's power, while showcasing the flavor range. The lingering finish is tinged with lemon curd and brine. Drink now through 2030. 30 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: The light-weight framework and silky texture carries intense tropical fruit flavors of pineapple and guava, with apple pie, orange peel and a touch of hazelnut. The tangy acidity comes across on the tangerine-laced finish. Drink now through 2030. 11 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Vendanges Tardives
review: A profound Riesling, stunning for its nutty aroma, richness and exotic tropical fruit flavors, yet it maintains a gracefulness and cohesion. Extremely lush and caressing on the palate and kept in focus by a discreet structure. Long, long finish. Drink now through 2010. 16 cases imported.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: Great purity of flavor, showing pear, quince, and honey notes, unctuous and concentrated, backed by a moderately firm structure. It's dominated by the residual sugar now, but will improve over time. Best from 2006 through 2020. 10 cases imported.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: About as close as you can get to drinking Mom's apple pie. Baked apples, cinnamon, ginger and honey mingle in this sweet, vibrant dessert wine. Very clean, with botrytis adding concentration and the spice elements, followed by a long finish. Drink now through 2012. 8 cases imported.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Sélection des Grains Nobles
Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: Thick, intense and packed with caramel, honey and apricot flavors matched to an elegant, seamless structure. There's plenty of acidity for balance. It needs time for all the elements to come together. Great finish. Drink now through 2008. 6 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: This is broad, with a smoky accent to the hints of peach, honey and grapefruit peel. Very juicy, showing lots of layers and nice richness, along with a modest, lychee-laced finish. Drink now through 2023. 25 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum
review: Just off-dry, and lush and silky, this features finely meshed vibrant acidity enlivening flavors of candied grapefruit zest, mango, orange sorbet, crystallized honey and smoky mineral. Lingering finish. Drink now through 2025. 60 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: Very pure, with dried citrus, honey and floral aromas and flavors providing an essence of Gewürztraminer character, in addition to spice accents like anise. But it's the harmony and lightweight feeling that makes this stand out. Fine length. Drink now through 2015. 10 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum Vendanges Tardives
review: Vivacious, with a backbone of racy acidity bolstering the finely layered flavors of apricot, mango, tangerine, candied pink grapefruit peel and smoky mineral, with notes of spun honey, lychee and ground spices. Shows great finesse and fine attention to detail, but very appealing for its fruit-forward, tangy character. Lovely to drink now, but should age beautifully. Drink now through 2033. 43 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum Vendanges Tardives
review: Lovely freshness and delicacy mark this intensely flavored sweet white. Dried apricot, rose, grapefruit and spice notes unfold gracefully across the palate, on a luscious texture. The finish evokes honey. Drink now through 2012. 100 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Mambourg Cuvée d'Or Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: A pronounced note of wood smoke runs through this wine, mixing with flavors of pear compote, baked peach, crystallized honey, candied pineapple and orange peel, along with a clean mineral note of hot stone. Rich and creamy, with bright, citrusy acidity for balance and a long, mouthwatering finish that shows a hint of orchard blossom. Drink now through 2028. 26 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Mambourg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Elegant, with a pretty juiciness to the acidity that enlivens the whole wine. Apple and orange blossom notes highlight the ripe apricot and clementine, along with honey, smoke and cream accents. Spicy finish. Drink now through 2020. 20 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Mambourg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Tangy, with ripe blood orange and pomegranate flavors that mix with an underlying smokiness and lots of lychee and spice notes. It's elegant, with seamlessly integrated, juicy acidity and a long, mouthwatering finish.  Drink now through 2028. 25 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Mambourg Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: There's a strong honey aroma and this is more luscious than sweet. The varietal character is muted in lieu of honey, dried apricot and citrus preserve, which melds nicely with the structure. It remains focused through the long finish. Drink now through 2025. 54 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Cuvée d'Or Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: Mouthwatering, offering vibrant acidity and a lightly mouthcoating texture, this lush version displays a fine mesh of baked peach, pear pâte de fruit, candied almond and crystallized honey notes. Delivers a long, lasting finish, with a hint of smoky mineral. Drink now through 2030. 10 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Cuvée Ste.-Catherine
review: Elegant acidity frames this dry, tangy white, and the lacy texture displays white peach, lemon zest, tangerine and smoke notes on the palate. Hints of lanolin and white pepper lay below, coming to the forefront on the long, mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2025. 125 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Altenbourg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: There's a crunchiness to the acidity, providing firm structure and balancing the rich, honeyed tones of ripe apple, pear and peach sorbet, with a touch of beeswax. Showing fine length and excellent balance, this is graceful, with a smoky undertow that lingers on the finish. Drink now through 2030. 20 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Catherine
review: An enticing, seamless white, exhibiting floral, honey, peach and white pepper aromas and flavors. Firmly structured, with a rich texture, it lingers on the finish with a mouthwatering impression. The floral and mineral notes echo in the aftertaste. Best from 2007 through 2018. 150 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Catherine L'Inédit
review: A rich Riesling that's just off-dry, yet retains a grace of form and structure thanks to finely meshed, vibrant acidity. Layers flavors of quince paste, honeycomb and dried apricot with a minerally baseline and hints of aromatic herbs, candied lemon zest and fresh ground white pepper. The finish is long and citrusy. Drink now through 2034. 320 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Catherine L'Inédit
review: Floral and lightly citric, with a lacy texture and concentrated flavors of peach, honey and orange peel. Zesty acidity keeps this lively through the mouthwatering finish. Delicious. Drink now through 2020. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Catherine L'Inédit
review: A beautiful wine. Serious ripeness and obvious residual sugar in this opulent Riesling. With a texture of cashmere delivering the apricot, grapefruit and spice notes, it is seamless and utterly seductive. Juicy acidity emerges on the finish. Best from 2004 through 2012. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Plenty of botrytis here, lending exotic honey, spice and orange marmalade aromas and flavors. It also shows finesse and delicacy, with vibrant acidity offsetting its concentration. Fine lingering finish. Drink now through 2020. 23 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Vendanges Tardives Trie Spéciale
review: A hint of petrol at first gives way to flavors of candied apple and golden raisin, with a touch of pineapple. The clean acidity provides an elegant structure on which the silky texture is draped. The finish is long and lingering. Drink now through 2025. 21 cases imported.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: Extremely aromatic and pure, displaying apple and pear, this is a supple, elegant, racy SGN, very concentrated. A beautiful expression of the grape and the style. This baby will impress even more in the future. Best from 2001 through 2008.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg
review: A subtle note of white truffle adds depth to flavors of dried papaya and apricot, smoke, candied citrus peel and beeswax, while zesty acidity provides fine structure and focus, leading to a long, mineral-tinged finish. Drink now through 2025. 75 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg Cuvée Laurence
review: Luscious and honeyed, with a texture like cashmere and intense flavors of pineapple, vanilla pastry and grapefruit. It starts out full, with the firm structure emerging on the finish. This will benefit from time. Best from 2005 through 2012. 75 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Elegant, with a raw silk texture and fine integration of the delicate acidity, offering ripe flavors of poached white peach, candied pink grapefruit zest and almond financier. Hints of lychee and melon liqueur hints lead to a lovely finish of smoke and spice. Drink now through 2028. 15 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Light-weight and silky, with finely meshed flavors of lychee sorbet, candied pink grapefruit and pineapple that show accents of smoke, spice and sea salt. The lively acidity drives the wine, gaining momentum on the tangy, sea breeze-tinged finish. Drink now through 2028. 18 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Cuvée d'Or Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: Pure nectar. The sweetness is immediate, then the vibrant acidity buoys the honey, apricot and crème brûlée nuances to a long, lingering finish. Very young, this dessert wine needs time to unfold and develop its full complexity. 10 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Cuvée Laurence
review: This harmonious version walks a fine line between lightly sweet flavors of ripe green melon, pear, clover honey and toasted almond, accented by dry and zesty hints of ground spice, herb and smoky mineral. Lacy and elegant throughout, thanks to firm, well-meshed acidity. Drink now through 2023. 530 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Cuvée Laurence
review: A serious Gewürztraminer, this evokes toasted brioche, cinnamon, vanilla and lychee flavors. Almost dry, this is well-balanced and creamy, with mineral and white pepper accents emerging at the end. The aftertaste is salty. Drink now through 2015. 212 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum
review: An elegant example of Gewürztaminer, displaying lots of ripe clementine, apricot, lychee and rose petal notes without being exuberant or over the top. It's all held in check by fine-edged acidity that creates an open, airy texture, with a lingering, smoke-tinged finish. Drink now through 2022. 100 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum
review: An impeccably balanced Gewürztraminer, displaying good richness while maintaining an overall elegance. This is smoky, with honeyed flavors of star fruit, guava, warm spices and orange peel. The well-meshed acidity enlivens the wine through to the lingering, smoke-tinged finish. Drink now through 2024. 100 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum Cuvée Laurence
review: This is delightful. Rich and ripe, yet elegant and harmonious, featuring floral, tropical fruit flavors and a hint of grapefruit peel on the finish. A full-bodied white that's deceptively lithe, it lingers on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 10 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum Vendanges Tardives
review: A pleasant hint of white truffle weaves through flavors of toffee, fruitcake and candied orange peel, while well-integrated acidity provides a lightly juicy edge and good structure. The clean, spice-tinged finish lingers nicely. Drink now through 2020. 60 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum Vendanges Tardives
review: Concentrated and intense, with a very clean expression of botrytis lending spice notes to the grapefruit and litchi flavors. Fine balance, with a touch of bitterness on the finish. Fine length. Drink now through 2012. 100 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Mambourg Cuvée d'Or Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: This fleshy version displays candied grapefruit peel, quince, petrol and lots of herb and spice notes. Light- to medium-bodied, with tangy acidity and a zesty white pepper note showing at the end. Drink now through 2019. 9 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Mambourg Cuvée Laurence
review: Lush yet balanced, with enough acidity to offset the light sweetness and frame the citrus candy, honey and dried rose flavors. Medium-bodied and graceful, it lingers with a honey and citrus aftertaste. Drink now through 2012. 30 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Mambourg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: A delicate version, with a smoky undertow accenting the pretty floral, orange sorbet and white peach flavors. There's good intensity to this, with finely meshed acidity providing balance, but it's all wrapped in an effortless, expressive package, with a mouthwatering spiced finish. Drink now through 2025. 15 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Mambourg Vendanges Tardives
review: A refined version, almost ethereal in texture, showing beautiful integration of the citrusy acidity and flavors of green melon, peach sorbet, candied orange zest and Thai basil. Long and mouthwatering on the minerally finish. Drink now through 2030. 23 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Mambourg Vendanges Tardives
review: Seamlessly integrated, this elegant, lightly sweet version offers rich flavors of ripe mango, baked lychee, quince paste and honey, all balanced by fine-tuned acidity. A vein of smoky minerality adds depth, while accents of candied grapefruit and ginger linger on the lasting finish. Drink now through 2025. 10 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Mambourg Vendanges Tardives
review: With floral and spice overtones, this offers a cashmerelike texture, precise balance and delicacy surrounding a core of honey and tropical fruit notes. A candied fruit and spice aftertaste complete the impression. Drink now through 2012. 10 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Vendanges Tardives
review: On the dry side, this is powerful, showing apricot, rose and grapefruit aromas and flavors, with a vibrant structure. Finishes dry, with a white pepper note. Give it a few years and pair with Münster cheese. Drink now through 2015. 17 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg
review: Lightly honeyed and smoky, this shows pronounced richness and great finesse. The flavors of dried papaya, apricot gelée, toasted almond, melon and candied orange zest are finely layered, displaying mouthwatering acidity and zesty minerality. Drink now through 2025. 60 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg
review: Crackling acidity defines this lip-smacking white, balancing honeysuckle, papaya, candied orange peel and red grapefruit flavors. With a honeyed note and a lot of ripeness to the flavor profile this wine is still dry and tangy, with a smoky note throughout. Drink now through 2025. 100 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Cuvée d'Or Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: Elegant, with whiplash acidity that starts your mouth watering as soon as the wine hits your palate. There's lots of candied orange and apple flavors, with notes of guava, honey and a hint of forest floor underneath. Drink now through 2028. 15 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Racy acidity enlivens this viscous dessert wine, bolstering subtly layered flavors of honey, Golden Delicious, golden raisin and a hint of clementine. It's creamy, with a long, mineral-tinged finish. Best from 2010 through 2018. 9 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Vendanges Tardives
review: This shows a lot of intensity, from the laserlike acidity to the layers of apple jam, quince, crystallized orange peel and golden raisin flavors. A powerful but elegant wine, with a lip-smacking finish that goes on and on. Drink now through 2030. 35 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Vendanges Tardives
review: Hints of pine and lime play off the grapefruit and guava flavors in this spicy wine. A vein of minerality and racy acidity crackles throughout, and this ends with a lingering hint of rose petal. Drink now through 2020. 10 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Vendanges Tardives
review: A classy Pinot Gris, this has finesse and balances its apricot, quince, mushroom and smoke aromas and flavors with bright acidity. It picks up a hint of grapefruit on the lingering aftertaste. Drink now through 2015. 102 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Vendanges Tardives Trie Spéciale
review: A creamy style, with subtle hints of truffle and peat smoke accenting the ripe fruit flavors of mango, yellow peach, papaya and candied orange peel. There's a base of firm, tangy acidity at work, and though well-balanced, this definitely leans toward the richer, honeyed side of the VT range. Ends with a long, mouthwatering mineral finish. Drink now through 2028. 39 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Cuvée Ste.-Catherine
review: Ripe fruit flavors and floral notes of orchard blossoms and honeysuckle run through this finely tuned Pinot Gris, playing off the salty mineral undercurrent, with white peach, almond and candied lemon zest character. A delicate wine overall, with the pieces seamlessly integrated, ending with a long, mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2029. 671 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Altenbourg Vendanges Tardives
review: Silky and focused by vibrant acidity, this wine offers lovely texture and flavors of apricot, Fuji apple, honeysuckle, lemon wax and subtle spice and smoke. Mouthwatering, with a snap of salinity on the finish. Drink now through 2025. 10 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Cuvée Ste.-Catherine
review: Fine texture and balance here, and an overall sense of finesse to the layered notes of ripe apple, green melon, anise, smoky mineral and lemon wax. Racy acidity plays off the lightly honeyed finish. Drink now through 2022. 150 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg
review: A light- to medium-bodied, elegant white, this is dense and minerally, with firm acidity tightly meshed to a smoky underpinning and flavors of fresh-cut Gala apple, verbena and lemon curd, accented by spun honey and white peach hints. Bright and focused, presenting a lasting, saline-tinged finish. Drink now through 2029. 419 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg
review: This elegant Riesling has a refined texture and subtle layers of flavor—starfruit, melon rind, lemon zest and smoky mineral, with a pretty apple blossom note. There's an ethereal quality to the integration of the acidity, resulting in a delicate wine that's not to be overlooked, with more to offer than the first sip suggests. Drink now through 2029. 401 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg
review: Wow. A huge, backward wine, displaying top notes of mango, passion fruit and almond underscored by a massive, minerally structure. Concentrated, complex and long, give this giant until 2000 to open. Really excting stuff. 200 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée d'Or Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Here's a racy, elegant dessert wine that combines apricot, honey and mineral notes with medium sweetness, firm structure and an airiness that almost seems ethereal, but the aftertaste is intense and goes on forever. Best after 1999.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Catherine
review: Lightly floral, fresh and elegant, this is driven by racy acidity and smoky minerality, layered with flavors of apricot, peach skin, pink grapefruit zest, blanched almond and fleur de sel. Shows lovely harmony and beautiful texture. Drink now through 2024. 380 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Catherine
review: Dry, with a laser beam of acidity and a pronounced mineral overtone. Show fine balance, with hints of sea salt and brine accenting the flavors of green melon, star fruit, crunchy white peach, pickled ginger and anise. Zesty finish. Drink now through 2028. 171 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Catherine
review: Well-knit and fresh, there's a quiet intensity to this elegant white, and a floral overtone to the notes of Jonagold apple, white peach, lemon zest, beeswax and toasted almond. Lingering mineral-tinged finish. Drink now through 2025. 140 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Catherine
review: This bright Riesling, light-weight and lithe, with well-defined acidity lending vibrancy to the tightly woven flavors of quince, white peach, lemon peel, tarragon and lemongrass. A salty tang of minerality adds a hint of saline to the wine, and shows on the long, lip-smacking finish. Drink now through 2029. 629 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Catherine
review: This is very perfumed, showing floral and tropical fruit notes; rich, yet countered by its racy structure. Medium-bodied, dry and deftly balanced, yet it needs time to harmonize completely. The long finish reveals its potential. Best from 2005 through 2012. 120 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Cathérine Cuvée du Centenaire
review: Stunning. An incredible young Riesling that offers a panoply of smoke, peach, grapefruit, vanilla and stone aromas and flavors married to a velvety texture and full-bodied structure. Good but lowish acidity and a long finish. Feels more like a white Burgundy. Drink now through 2006. 175 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Catherine L'Inédit
review: Vibrant and finely balanced, this leans toward off-dry, with a silky mouthfeel and honeyed flavors of apricot, pickled ginger, cantaloupe, candied kumquat and guava. Lacy in texture, driven by a vein of smoky minerality that echoes on the finish. 30 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Catherine L'Inédit
review: This is refined and silky, featuring a smoky, mineral-tinged undertow, with apricot tart, creamed apple, honey and pineapple flavors. Finely knit and vibrant, with a pleasing bitterness to the finish of candied grapefruit zest and ground cumin. Drink now through 2025. 45 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: This elegant, finely textured SGN shows fine-tuned balance, effortlessly blending vibrant acidity and an array of flavors—pineapple, white peach and candied orange zest, with hints of dried herb, smoky petrol and ground spice. Drink now through 2024. 5 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Silky, suave and dense with honey, apricot and citrus aromas and flavors, all supported by a vibrant structure. Shows real class and elegance, ending on a lingering honey note. Drink now through 2007. 20 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Vendanges Tardives
review: Very juicy, with ripe tropical fruit flavors of pineapple and mango mixing with hints of petrol and spice and framed by searing acidity. Medium-bodied and full of personality, with a zingy, sweet-tart finish. Drink now through 2014. 35 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Vendanges Tardives
review: Juicy, with laserlike acidity to the candied orange peel, peach pie, honey and lemon candy flavors. It's elegant and lively, with a long, mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2023. 35 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Vendanges Tardives
review: An elegant VT, rich yet beautifully balanced by its vibrant structure, this evokes peach, apricot and ripe apple notes. Offering fine harmony and texture, it glides to a long finish. Drink now through 2015. 81 cases made.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Gorgeous dessert wine, incorporating elements of botrytis that lend an exotic quality to the apricot, honey and citrus flavors. It's almost ethereal, showing a delicacy and finesse that belies its richness and intensity. Beautifully balanced, with a long finish. Drink now through 2010. 6 cases imported.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: A brilliant late-harvest Pinot Gris, bursting with pear, apricot and quince flavors backed by vivid structure and dense texture. Drink now through 2008. 80 cases imported.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Vendanges Tardives
review: Seductive, elegant and seamless in texture, unfolding its dried pineapple, honey and subtle bergamot aromas and flavors effortlessly across the palate. Delightful. Balanced and medium-bodied, it lingers with a honey note. Drink now through 2012. 20 cases imported.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Vendanges Tardives
review: A super late-harvest Pinot Gris, backed by firm acidity, making it a good partner for foie gras. Very harmonious from start to finish, with well-integrated flavors of honey, crème brûlée, apple and grapefruit. Fine length. Drink now through 2006. 25 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg
review: Bright and mouthwatering, with ripe nectarine, candied orange peel, melon and grated ginger flavors, this elegant white is finely knit and silky. Rich spice and smoky mineral details hold sway on the lasting finish. Drink now through 2025. 317 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg
review: Tightly knit flavors of lemon meringue, ripe white peach, melon and candied lime zest wrap around a core of spicy mineral, framed by finely tuned acidity. Lightly mouthcoating, staying finely balanced throughout. Drink now through 2025. 75 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg Cuvée d'Or Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: Sweet and sassy. More honey and apricot today than spice and litchi, but the varietal notes are here, in addition to lively acidity and a rich, unctuous texture without the feeling of heaviness. Drink now through 2005. 6 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg Cuvée Laurence
review: Intense and rich, with a hint of sweetness that carries honey, spice and especially mineral flavors, which are particularly pronounced, from the graphite aroma to the long, salty finish. Drink now through 2012. 75 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg Cuvée Laurence
review: A hedonist's delight. Luscious in texture and expressive, with the grape's varietal notes toned down to reveal tangerine, honey and cream flavors that are in harmony with the structure. It melts in the mouth to a lingering conclusion. Licorice aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 413 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg Vendanges Tardives
review: Just off-dry, with bright, firm acidity and pleasant pink grapefruit, mango and white pepper notes. This shows intensity, and there's good integration of all the pieces. Creamy finish. Drink now through 2018. 60 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg Vendanges Tardives
review: Extremely ripe, showing VT style, offering honey, spice and tropical fruit on an open framework. There's good concentration here, evident from the long finish, with a rich, honeyed aftertaste. Drink now through 2005. 21 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Cuvée Laurence
review: Hints of geranium and verbena waft through the notes of creamed apple, candied fig and orange granita, with hints of crystallized honey, zesty ground ginger and white pepper. This white is backed by racy, mouthwatering acidity, finely meshed with the rich flavors. Smoky finish. Drink now through 2025. 120 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Cuvée Laurence
review: Well-structured acidity backs rich notes of dried apricot and guava, candied lychee, orange granita and orange blossom in this fresh and mouthwatering Gewürz. Drink now through 2022. 75 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Cuvée Laurence
review: This lively, medium-bodied Gewürztraminer delivers finely meshed flavors of kumquat, fleshy yellow peach, cantaloupe and candied pink grapefruit peel, with vibrant acidity that's layered seamlessly in this elegant format. The lingering finish shows a salty tang of minerality. Drink now through 2024. 807 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Cuvée Laurence
review: This shows some richness to the flavors of clementine and candied grapefruit peel, with touches of dried apricot and pine needle. Hints of honey and smoke subtly weave through the seamless texture and resonate on the long finish. Drink now through 2019. 180 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Cuvée Laurence
review: Very rich, this off-dry Gewürztraminer offers a lush texture, candied tropical fruit and honey flavors backed by juicy acidity. It has a great finish. All the elements are there. Drink now through 2012. 130 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Cuvée Laurence
review: A beauty. Lush and exotic, displaying honey and floral aromas and flavors, yet deftly balanced and expressive. Off-dry, yet there's plenty of acidity and a hint of grapefruit peel on the finish. Drink now. 130 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Altenbourg Cuvée d'Or Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: Juicy acidity frames the ripe clementine, quince, mango and candied lychee flavors in this vibrant version. The lively acidity has a zesty edge to it, providing just enough balance for the lush flavor profile. Drink now through 2020. 12 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum
review: A lush white, displaying fine balance and mouthwatering acidity, this is smoky, with accents of candied orange peel and crystallized honey enriching dried papaya, toasted almond, kumquat and melon notes. Features a long, minerally finish. Drink now through 2025. 70 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum Cuvée Laurence
review: The marriage of elegance and the honey, floral character here is unusual for this varietal. A firm mineral support provides length and intensity, while maintaining balance and harmony. Drink now through 2002. 50 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: This elegant Gewürztraminer displays ripe, fleshy tangerine, yellow peach and ruby grapefruit flavors, accented by spice and stargazer lily notes. A pleasant citrus peel note lingers on the finish. This is all about balance. Drink now through 2018.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: Candied and spicy, in a full-bodied yet compact style, here's a dessert wine that wears its floral, litchi and white pepper notes on its sleeve. Lovely lingering aftertaste of honey. Drink now through 2006. 50 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum Vendanges Tardives
review: Loads of botrytis here. Butterscotch, candied citrus and almond flavors never get plodding, and it never gets heavy, despite the richness and concentration. Full-bodied, with good structure and a clean finish. Drink now through 2008. 100 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Mambourg Vendanges Tardives
review: Light on its feet, this combines concentration with an ethereal quality, resulting in fleeting notes of butterscotch, honey, grapefruit and spice. It's well-balanced and moderately sweet. Drink now through 2008. 10 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Vendanges Tardives
review: Interesting notes of petrol and star anise layer the yellow peach, orange zest and grapefruit sorbet flavors in this tangy version. There's firm acidity for structure, with a lip-smacking finish that brings you back for another sip. Drink now through 2027. 30 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Réserve Personnelle
review: Snappy, and well-defined by racy acidity, this offers orange and grapefruit zest accents to flavors of lychee, kumquat and ground ginger; a hint of orchard blossom wafts through to the lasting finish. Drink now through 2025. 180 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg
review: Layered flavors of apricot, almond, star fruit, spice and grapefruit zest mix in this silky white. It leans toward off-dry, but firm, well-meshed acidity and a zesty undercurrent of minerality keep it fresh and focused.  Drink now through 2025. 57 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg
review: A silky, off-dry version, with lush flavors of peach, mandarin orange sorbet, almond, lemon curd and papaya. Offers juicy acidity, creating a mouthwatering impression, with an undercurrent of smoky mineral and spice. A candied note echoes on the clean, minerally finish. Drink now through 2025. 279 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg
review: A rich white that's just off-dry, backed by racy acidity crafting its precision balance. Exhibits honeyed tones and flavors of guava, blood orange, white pepper and cardamom, with a touch of forest floor. The finish is long and silky. Drink now through 2025. 100 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Cuvée Laurence
review: The lush texture is bolstered by tangy acidity and honeyed flavors of dried apricot, star fruit, white pepper and a hint of dried herbs. Elegant and delicious, with a long, spicy finish. Drink now through 2020. 70 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Vendanges Tardives Trie Spéciale
review: Lush and creamy, this blends flavors of ripe apple, guava, candied orange zest, spun honey and a hint of truffle with mouthwatering acidity and clean, minerally salinity, which lingers on the lasting finish. Drink now through 2025. 10 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Cuvée Laurence
review: This rich white is layered with juicy blood orange, red grapefruit, peach and honey flavors. Spice and smoke notes wind through the primary flavors, as does the firm but integrated acidity. Lively and delicious. Drink now through 2020. 75 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Cuvée Ste.-Catherine
review: Refined and elegant, with a lovely, creamy quality to the ripe pear, lemon parfait, dried apricot and spun honey flavors. Shows mouthwatering acidity and a subtle streak of smoke-tinged minerality on the finish. Drink now through 2029. 494 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Cuvée Ste.-Catherine
review: Elegant acidity defines this subtle wine, which bounces between the honeysuckle and apricot character of Pinot Gris and the grape's mushroom and smoke personality, all accented by honey and fleur de sel notes. Intriguing, with a long, dry finish. Drink now through 2025. 125 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Cuvée Ste.-Catherine
review: A pronounced mineral note is accented by dried apricot, grapefruit and lots of white pepper. This is a full-bodied white, with live-wire acidity and a long, zesty finish. Best from 2009 through 2016. 127 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Cuvée Ste.-Catherine
review: The wild side of Alsace. Loads of spice and floral top notes, with tropical fruit, stone and pastry accents underneath. Full-bodied, yet graceful, it starts out off-dry, then the vivid acidity takes over. Needs time. Best from 2004 through 2012. 180 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Cuvée Ste.-Cathérine
review: Wonderful depth of flavor. A combination of stone and citrus fruits mingle with a mineral element and a rich texture, providing complexity and length. There's enough acidity and a fillip of bitterness to keep everything in focus. Drink now through 2007. 150 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Cuvée Théo
review: Open and airy, framing white peach, quince, grapefruit zest and salt flavors. This is very accessible, despite its firm acidity and an overall intensity. The lip-smacking, smoke-tinged finish brings you back for another sip. Drink now through 2022. 230 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg
review: Features seamlessly integrated acidity and a fine mesh to the texture, allowing the smoke- and stone-tinged minerality to shine through. This elegant, mouthwatering Riesling is layered with green melon, apricot, salted almond, apple blossom and lemon wax flavors. Drink now through 2025. 180 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg
review: Racy and medium-bodied, this offers flavors of yellow apple, candied lemon zest, beeswax, blanched almond and lots of ground spice. Lovely precision to the overall balance. Mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2020. 220 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg
review: Just a hint of an intriguing curry note accents the Gala apple, white peach, and lime flavors in this floral, aromatic white. Elegant and well put together, with juicy acidity that leaves a mouthwatering impression on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 240 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg
review: Dense and tightly wound, this isn't revealing all its charms today. The racy structure holds court now, keeping the apple, apricot and mineral flavors locked up. The aromas and long finish hold the key to its future. Best from 2006 through 2012. 230 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Catherine
review: Light-footed and vibrant, this finely meshed white packs abundant green pear, candied grapefruit zest, stony mineral and apple blossom flavors, with hints of lanolin and ground spice on the sleek frame. Drink now through 2025. 333 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Catherine
review: A huge wine, in terms of both richness and flavor. Apricot, pineapple and spice combine with a firm structure and full body, but it's all knees and elbows now; it needs time to integrate. Best from 2005 through 2012. 180 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Catherine
review: A bit shy in aroma today, but concentrated and dense, offering peach, passion fruit, spice and minerals. Has finesse and a firm structure wrapped in a fleshy cloak. Showing a hint of sweetness, it's balanced and finishes dry. Lovely aftertaste of apricot. Drink now through 2008. 120 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Cathérine
review: Broad and rich, this Alsace Riesling serves up a generous ripe apple, honey and peach character on a racy, powerful structure. It's intense and deep, with a long, apple-flavored finish. Would make a nice complement to food, just needs until 1999. 360 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Cathérine
review: Complex and satisfying, this shows the ripeness and richness of the vintage with its apricot, honey and almond flavors. But don't be fooled--there's a firm mineral and acid backbone that will allow this white to develop over the next 3 to 5 years.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Catherine L'Inédit
review: Just off-dry, delivering ripe flavors of clementine, cantaloupe, pear and honey. Spicy, well-placed acidity creates an airy texture and overall elegance. There's a stony undertow throughout, lingering in particular on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 70 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Catherine L'Inédit
review: This is just off-dry, showing honeyed flavors of ripe peach, kiwifruit and a touch of pineapple, with juicy acidity for balance and intensity. Rich and well-meshed, with an overall elegance and a subtle finish. Delicious. Drink now through 2024. 135 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Cuvée Ste.-Catherine L'Inédit
review: Bursting with apricot, grapefruit and floral notes, here's an opulent Riesling that makes a statement, yet remains grounded with a vibrant structure and fine mineral character. Drink now through 2015. 135 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Offers live-wire acidity and subtle flavors of apricot, anise and papaya, with a touch of smoke. A juicy, elegant wine, with a lingering, nut-tinged finish. Drink now through 2019. 15 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Vendanges Tardives
review: An elegant expression of Alsace's late-harvest style, this is just off-dry, with a silky texture and delicately woven flavors of candied apple and pastry that show a touch of toffee and petrol. Snappy acidity frames the wine, providing a lithe structure and fine length overall. Drink now through 2025. 12 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg Vendanges Tardives
review: A luscious late-harvest white that displays the merest hint of kerosene before erupting in apricot, vanilla-custard and orange-peel flavors that are washed across the palate by the balancing, mouthwatering acidity. Very long finish. 8 cases imported.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Cuvée Laurence
review: Unctuous and full-bodied, this vivacious white evokes vanilla custard, pear and lanolin aromas and flavors, all kept focused by a lively structure. Fine length and harmony. Drink now through 2009. 75 cases imported.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Cuvée Laurence
review: Gorgeous Pinot Gris, bursting with apricot, crème brûlée, smoke and mineral character, balancing a fat, fleshy texture with lively acidity and intensity that pumps the flavors through to the long, satisfying finish. Drink now through 2005. 100 cases imported.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Vendanges Tardives
review: Attractive, exhibiting pear, quince and floral aromas and flavors, all cloaked in a silky texture. There's a bright structure and moderate sweetness, all balanced, ending in a vanilla custard and pear aftertaste. Drink now through 2008. 125 cases imported.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Cuvée d'Or Sélection des Grains Nobles
review: A dessert wine with elegance. The nectarine and honey flavors are accented by mandarin orange notes, and though it exhibits texture and richness, the overall impression is one of grace and delicacy. Subtle length. Not imported into the U.S.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Cuvée du Centenaire Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: Deeply colored, this SGN offers a minty aroma, picking up butterscotch and orange notes on the palate. Thick and intense, with botrytis adding an exotic touch, while the firm backbone keeps everything fresh. Good, lingering finish. Drink now through 2005. 14 cases imported.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Vendanges Tardives
review: This displays ripe peach and apricot flavors, with a hint of orange for accent. Very pretty and accessible, but concentrated and underscored with a vibrant acidity that keeps the flavors pulsing through the finish. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2005. 20 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg
review: A silky, off-dry version, offering a subtle weave of creamy apricot, lychee, mango and candied orange peel flavors. There's good intensity to the refined acidity, which finds lovely integration with the honeyed fruit profile. Ends with a lightly smoky finish. Drink now through 2020. 477 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg
review: A bit plumper than some of its peers in the 2008 vintage, but still well-structured by its zesty acidity. This shows ripe fruit flavors of peach, papaya and clementine, with a pleasant bitter note from a hint of grapefruit peel. Spicy finish. Drink now through 2017. 140 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg
review: This Gewürztraminer offers beautiful balance and flavors of honey, ripe yellow peach, orange blossom and star fruit. Bright and elegant, with a lingering, spicy finish. Drink now through 2016. 140 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Altenbourg Cuvée d'Or Quintessence de Grains Nobles
review: Full-bodied and opulent, this has crowd-pleasing spice, honey and sweetness; seems a bit one-dimensional today, but shows good balance and a long, honeyed finish. Drink now through 2004.

name: Riesling Auslese** Mittelrhein Bopparder Hamm Feuerlay
review: The tangy structure lends a feeling of lightness and offsets the sweetness and concentration in this apple- and apricot-infused auslese. Balanced and intensely flavored, it leaves a mouthwatering impression. Drink now through 2020.

name: Riesling Auslese Mittelrhein Bopparder Hamm Feuerlay
review: This delivers a good, stern dose of minerals, in addition to candied apple and a hint of lemon flavors on a rich, soft profile. It needs a bit of age to show more of its complexity. Best from 2006 through 2018.

name: Riesling Kabinett Halbtrocken Mittelrhein
review: Firm and spicy, with good cut to the mineral, gooseberry and wild currant flavors, featuring hints of elderflower. The clean finish is rounded out by notes of white raspberry. Drink now through 2016. 28 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Halbtrocken Mittelrhein Bopparder Hamm
review: The concentrated apple and pear flavors are well-balanced by slate and granite notes. Accents of gooseberry and citrus linger on the crisp finish. Drink now through 2022. 28 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mittelrhein Bopparder Hamm Feuerlay
review: Broad and peachy, with plenty of ripe apple, spice and lemon curd. There is good definition to the slate and sea salt notes on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 20 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Halbtrocken Mittelrhein Schloss Fürstenberg
review: Off-dry, with plenty of mineral as well as apple and a hint of citrus flavors. Well-balanced and lively, with a moderately long finish. Drink now through 2010.

name: Riesling Spätlese Trocken Mittelrhein Bopparder Hamm Feuerlay
review: Lively, with a citrus and mineral quality to the flavors on an elegant, lightweight frame. On the austere side overall, with a short finish. Drink now through 2007.

name: Riesling Napa Valley Carneros Fence Row Block
review: Fresh fennel notes mingle with a core of crisp lemon, lime and apple flavors, showing a lively acidity. Drink now. 388 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Alte Reben
review: Rich and ripe, with creamy, plush flavors of cream, ripe peach and glazed apricot. Seductive notes of quince, pear and spice fill the lush finish. Drink now through 2014. 1,250 cases made.

name: Riesling Eiswein Niederösterreich Schneiderberg
review: Luscious, sweet and fresh, with layers of ripe peach, apricot, pineapple and tropical fruit flavors. Balanced and expressive, with loads of cream, butterscotch and spice notes, which linger on the long finish. Drink now through 2030. 208 cases made.

name: Riesling Eiswein Weinviertel Schneiderberg
review: This has vibrant acidity, and a full range of ripe apple and candied citrus flavors that are fringed by luscious spice, white peach and ripe cherry notes. Best from 2007 through 2015. 125 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Eiswein Niederösterreich Hohenleiten
review: Lush, rich and seductive, with ripe peach, mineral, coconut and cream. A vibrant sweetie that features a long, spice-filled finish. Drink now through 2020. 83 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Halbtrocken Niederösterreich Kugler
review: Really firm and juicy, with intense flavors of peach, apple, citrus peel and smoke. Minerally and spicy on the finish, with white pepper notes. Needs a good pork roast. Drink now through 2012. 167 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Eiswein Niederösterreich Hölzler
review: Fresh, light and delicate, with delicious peach and apricot flavors. Mango and spice on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 125 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Reserve
review: Bright, ripe and juicy, with an array of red peach, pear, currant and spice flavors. The mouthfilling finish features plenty of lush, creamy notes. Drink now through 2011. 250 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Alte Reben
review: A lithe, juicy white, showing plenty of ripe pear, almond and mineral flavors, with peach cobbler notes. Finishes with rich cream and vanilla elements and hints of apricot. Drink now through 2009. 835 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Lieblich Weinviertel Bockgärten II
review: Very peachy-tasting, with concentrated mineral and smoky notes and plenty of spice. Cream and hints of citrus power the ripe finish. Drink now through 2012. 250 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Alte Reben
review: Zesty and juicy, showing lots of grapefruit and green apple, with hints of mango. There's appealing herbal notes, with mineral touches, on the racy finish. A fine match for a pork chop. Drink now through 2010. 833 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Weinviertel Reserve
review: This has a creamy aroma, with ripe flavors of peach, pear and apple and plenty of spice. Finishes with notes of almond and hints of sea salt. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2009.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Lieblich Weinviertel Kugler
review: Light and fruity, with slightly off-dry ripe apple, pear and peach flavors, and a spicy finish. Drink now through 2010. 250 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Reserve
review: A buttery style, with ripe peach and baked apple flavors. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 167 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Halbtrocken Weinviertel Alte Reben
review: An off-dry style, evoking lemon pie, vanilla and grapefruit peel notes. It's balanced on the soft side, with a ginger finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Lieblich Weinviertel Bockgärten II
review: Fat white, with a broad array of spiced apple flavors, and a touch of cider on the finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Kugler
review: Ripe peach and spice flavors finish on notes of canned tropical fruits. Drink now. 167 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Cellar Select
review: Jammy and zesty, with black currant and licorice aromas complemented by dried cherry, tar and pepper flavors. Kosher. Drink now through 2017. 606 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Alexander Valley
review: Kosher. A pretty wine, light but balanced, with sweet oak, pineapple and melon flavors lifted by a pleasing tartness. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County
review: Kosher. Smoky, herbal flavors finish with a cedary bite. A tough wine that needs cellaring. Drink now through 1998. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa County
review: Kosher. Framed with spicy oak notes that detail the pleasant plum and black cherry flavors. Drink now. 772 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Paso Robles
review: Kosher. A fruity style, showing off bright cherry and grape flavors. Mild tannins make this a fine candidate for early quaffing. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Alexander Valley Winemaker Selection Reserve
review: Kosher. Smells good, but fails to deliver on the palate. The ripe pear and apple notes turn watery on the finish, and it lacks concentration and depth. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma County Winemaker Selection Reserve
review: Kosher. Lean and extremely minty, hinting at camphor, with a modest streak of black cherry flavor to keep it more or less in balance. Simple and direct. 1,075 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Paso Robles
review: Kosher. Vegetal, with currant and toasty oak notes that finish with a bitter edge. 5,149 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County
review: Kosher. Thin and bland, with barely any fruit flavors showing. 1,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Rogue Valley Heron Hill Vineyard
review: Supple, graceful style offers pretty, slightly earthy raspberry and cherry flavors that finish harmoniously against fine-grain tannins. Drink now through 2007. 500 cases made.

name: Sémillon-Chardonnay Rogue Valley
review: Lively, juicy and distinctive, focused on grapefruit, tobacco and melon flavors. Lingers enticingly, echoing citrus zest and apricot notes. 50 percent Sémillon and 50 percent Chardonnay. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Chardonnay-Sémillon Rogue Valley
review: Fresh, bright and lively, with a pretty mouthful of lime, nectarine and spice flavors that linger on the slightly raw finish. Best from 2000 through 2002. 400 cases made.

name: Petite Pompadour Pompadour Vineyard Rogue Valley
