review: A supple red, with solid structure and an appealing core of currant and herb flavors that linger on the nicely defined finish. Best from 2000. A blend of Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec. 450 cases made.

name: Chardonnay-Sémillon Rogue Valley
review: A very pretty white, with a spicy-toasty edge to the bright apple and quince flavors, which linger on the solid finish. A blend: 50 percent Chardonnay, 50 percent Sémillon. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Mescolare Oregon
review: Light in texture and jazzy in flavor, with cherry, strawberry, mint and spice flavors that linger on the open-textured finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinot Noir and Nebbiolo. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Petite Pompadour Pompadour Vineyard Rogue Valley
review: Ripe and generous, packing in some nice black cherry and blackberry flavors. Finishes softly tannic. A blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Rogue Valley
review: Brims with typically currant and black cherry flavors, turning tannic on the finish. Try now. 199 cases made.

name: Mescolare Oregon
review: Supple and pretty, with a smoky, cedary edge to the basic blackberry flavor that echoes nicely. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Petite Pompadour Pompadour Vineyard Rogue Valley
review: A solid, firm-textured red, with pretty plum and raspberry flavors echoing nicely on the finish. Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec. Drink now through 2002. 360 cases made.

name: Petite Pompadour Pompadour Vineyard Rogue Valley
review: Firm and chewy, with an earthy-gamy streak running through the black cherry and herb flavors. Needs time to soften. Best after 2001. 450 cases made.

name: Sémillon Rogue Valley
review: Light and crisp, a soft-textured white with pleasant pear and pineapple notes. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Sémillon-Chardonnay Rogue Valley
review: Fresh, open-textured, this is generous with its apricot-scented pear and almond flavors. A blend: 50 percent Sémillon and 50 percent Chardonnay. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Mescolare Oregon
review: This sturdy, flavorful red blend features berry, plum and smoke flavors. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinot Noir, Zinfandel and Nebbiolo. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Rogue Valley
review: Lightly sweet, with pear and mineral flavors on a fragile frame. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Petite Pompadour Pompadour Vineyard Rogue Valley
review: Round and generous, a bit spiky with tannins and shows a vegetal edge, with nice berry flavors at the core. Drink now. 440 cases made.

name: Petite Pompadour Pompadour Vineyard Rogue Valley
review: Lean, crisp and a bit austere, with a tart quality to the berry and smoke flavors. 40 percent Merlot, 30 percent Cabernet Franc, 20 percent Cabernet Sauvignon and 10 percent Malbec. Drink now. 290 cases made.

name: Merlot Rogue Valley Pompadour Vineyard
review: Earthy, gamy flavors dominate in this modest-sized red, which finishes with firm tannins. Drink now. 125 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rogue Valley Layne Vineyard Vintage Select
review: Lean and chewy, toasty, with more caramel and cedar flavor than modest fruit. 360 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Stephanus
review: Vibrant and focused, with powerful flavors of passion fruit, Fuji apple and lilac. Intense fresh-ground allspice notes linger on the crisp finish. Mouthwatering. Drink now through 2020. 168 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Wahre Werte
review: This is developing expressive mature notes of slate and sea salt, with hints of sage that are matched to refined apple, ripe citrus and pear flavors. The creamy finish features hints of tarragon. Drink now through 2020. 56 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Ried Wechselberg
review: Juicy, crisp flavors of sliced green apple, citrus and marmalade are concentrated and well-defined, with a bright, spicy finish. Drink now through 2013.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Alte Reben
review: Ripe, showing supple candied citrus and glazed apricot flavors that are creamy and well-spiced. The finish echoes with golden raisin notes. Drink now through 2016. 56 cases imported.

name: Estate Reserve Paarl
review: The fruit is long gone here, but the brown sugar and licorice root notes that remain manage to be supple enough, thanks to the faded tannins. While it has remained in balance, it's long past due. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Past its prime. 1,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 8)
review: More like a small beerenauslese, this is packed with apricot, orange and honey flavors and botrytis character. Really intense, yet light on its feet and supported by enough acidity to keep it all balanced. Drink now through 2010. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 6)
review: Stunning. Very ripe, exuding guava, honey and apricot flavors matched to a firm, rich structure. Seems held back by a bit of carbon dioxide now, yet shows much ripeness and depth. Best from 2002 through 2006. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 5)
review: A huge nose of apricot, passion fruit and guava, followed by dense tropical fruit flavors that take on a mineral accent. More like an auslese. Needs time. Best from 2003 through 2010. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 9)
review: Very complex. Concentrated and nutty, with distinctive smoke and mineral notes accenting the apricot and orange elements. Rich and broad-shouldered, yet not at all clumsy. Drink now through 2010. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 8)
review: Gorgeous. Dense, rich and vibrant, sporting loads of citrus, including orange nuances matched with mineral and honey notes. Pretty broad for a Mosel auslese. Lacks the length of the best, though. Drink now through 2006. 50 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 9)
review: Serious auslese. Very ripe and sweet, smells and tastes like it has a touch of botrytis, from the apricot, orange and honey character. Ethereal and balanced, packing in a lot of flavor on a sleek frame. Best from 2000 through 2008. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 8)
review: Very ripe, fresh and exotic, with dense, apricot, mango and passion fruit, backed by bracing acidity, which needs to integrate with the residual sugar. Promising. Best from 2001 through 2010. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 4)
review: Give this some time to develop. A very distinctive petrol aroma, while lime, peach and mineral are on the palate, almost chewy it's so dense and unevolved. Fine structure too. Best from 2002 through 2007. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
review: Intense citrus notes of orange, nectarine and lime on a lean, wiry structure. A touch short. Give it some time to settle down. Best from 2002 through 2006. 150 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 3)
review: A slate monster, sleek and precise, guided by a crisp structure and dense flavors of lime, mineral and ripe apple. Intense, it grabs your attention and holds it. Drink now through 2004. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 5)
review: Rich, round and easygoing, with plenty of honey, apricot and slate, good concentration and a smooth texture. The citrus acidity comes out on the finish. Drink now through 2004.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 8)
review: Rich and sweet, with tasty apricot and passion fruit flavors, yet lacks the zip to balance the sweetness. Drink now through 2008. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 7)
review: Juicy and round, like biting into a fresh peach. Lime and mineral accents, yet could use a tad more concentration and length. Drink now through 2005. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 6)
review: A little on the tart side and slightly green in flavor, sporting lime and slate flavors on a delicate structure. Just out of balance today; not up to the best of the vintage. Best from 2001 through 2006. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 7)
review: A crowd pleaser. Reflects a vivid style, boasting peach and citrus flavors wrapped in a juicy texture. Drink now through 2007. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
review: Clean and balanced, this lacks some intensity of flavor, but delivers pleasant apple and mineral notes on a lively frame. Drink now through 2006. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 2)
review: A good effort for the vintage, offering lime and apple flavors on a moderately firm frame. Drink now through 2007. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Trocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Domherr
review: Dry and spicy, offering rich flavors of peach and citrus on a structure leaning toward the soft side. Drink now through 2005. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 14)
review: A noticeably sweet white with marzipan, honey and slate flavors, good underlying acidity and a slightly short finish . Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 6)
review: Dark yellow, extremely ripe-smelling and exotic, with honey, orange and apricot aromas and flavors. Good, but it's top-heavy and alcohol makes the finish hot. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Weissburgunder QbA Trocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: Light, spice- and mineral-tinged Pinot Blanc, showing ripe pear flavors with lively, balanced structure. Ideal for spring and summer sipping. Drink now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Trocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: Lean and austere, with apple, mineral and earth notes. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Classic
review: Tastes sweet, with a spicy, gingerbread accent to the mineral and apple notes, but hollow on the midpalate. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Syrah Russian River Valley Alegría Vineyard
review: Ripe and elegant, spreading out its slightly gamy plum, pepper and berry flavors and well-integrated tannins on a round structure. Drink now. 172 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mount Veeder Random Ridge
review: Full-bodied, with plenty of toasty oak framing a blend of herb, mint, cassis and blackberry flavors. The finish is long, with firm, ripe tannins and just a hint of anise. Best from 2001 through 2005. 380 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Mohrhardt Ridge Vineyard
review: Concentrated and quite firm, with notes of semisweet chocolate and blackberries that finish with slightly tart, herbal tannins. Drink now through 2006. 1,008 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Barrel Fermented
review: Ripe and round, with spicy, earthy notes that add class and depth to the core of pear and pineapple flavors. A graceful wine that has richness without excessive weight. Drinkable now. 934 cases made.

name: Syrah Russian River Valley Alegría Vineyard
review: Nicely packed with currant and blackberry flavors, with reined-in tannins and a generous mouthful of fruit flavor on the finish. Ready now, may be best from 1999 to 2001. 420 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma County
review: Herbal and gamy, with chocolate, spice and black currant notes wrapped within firm tannins. Best after 2002. 682 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: Ripe and supple, with cherry, berry, spice and cedary oak flavors. Has a complex earthy, peppery accent on the finish. 840 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mount Veeder Random Ridge
review: Firm and trim, this shows compact cedar, currant and cherry flavors. Turns crisp and tannic on the finish, where it picks up a nice earthy edge. Best to cellar into 1998. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Mohrhardt Ridge Vineyard
review: Somewhat earthy on the nose, with layers of black currant, licorice, smoke, cassis and tar. Firmly textured, it should mature well in the cellar; drinks well now, too. 548 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Mohrhardt Ridge Vineyard
review: A racy style, marked by exotic oak flavors and dashes of herb and dill. Still, the smoky flavors are balanced by currant and cherry notes that enhance the depth and proportion. 600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Ripe and fleshy, with lush pear, cream, peach and vanilla flavors that fold together with light toasty oak character on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 1,285 cases made.

name: Victory Reserve Sonoma County
review: A sleekly styled wine, sporting cassis, anise and cedar flavors. It's well balanced, with firm but ripe tannins and a moderate finish. A blend: 49 percent Cabernet Sauvignon, 30 percent Merlot, 21 percent Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2002. 218 cases made.

name: Viognier Russian River Valley Timbervine Ranch
review: Tangy, with good intensity to the citrus, butter, herbal and tart apricot flavors. Drink now through 2002. 221 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: Tart, with good depth and concentration to raspberry, earth, vanilla and red currant flavors, folding into supple tannins and lively acidity on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 1,090 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley 100-Year-Old Vines
review: Charged with plum, anise and blackberry flavors, it's got bite on the finish with a pleasing herbal edge. Doesn't sail at the end, but it carries enough weight to make it worth exploring. Drink now through 2002. 110 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley 100-Year-Old Vines
review: Offers flavors that stretch from tart cherry to ripe wild berry and dark fruit. Finishes earthy and with firm tannins. 203 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley 100-Year-Old Vines
review: Ripe, bright black cherry, wild berry and plum flavors. Supple and generous, delicious now, but should hold in the cellar. 193 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Casa Santinamaria
review: Ripe and juicy, with pretty plum and cherry flavors. It loses a bit of its zest on the finish, where it picks up a minty flavor. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mount Veeder Random Ridge
review: Ripe and earthy, a mouthful of flavor in a relatively light- textured wine, echoing spices and plums on the silky finish. Needs until 1998 to loosen up the tannins. 234 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Mohrhardt Ridge Vineyard
review: An herbal style featuring tar, green bean and earthy notes as well as a concentrated core of black cherry, currant and mineral. Finishes firmly tannic. Improves with aeration, so give it time. Best from 2001 through 2006. 560 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: A smoothly textured wine, with hints of vanilla, pear, peach and toasty oak. Finishes with a mild, mineral edge. Drink now. 1,003 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Bright and spicy, a tad bitter, but the fresh green apple and citrus notes harmonize nicely on the finish. Ready to drink. 225 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma County
review: Tight and firm, with a good dose of tannin too, but enough cherry, herb and plum fruit and cedary oak to give it added dimensions. 784 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley
review: Curious, with good concentration to dried black currant, olive oil, earth and herbal flavors. Firm, almost gritty tannin lingers in the finish. Drink now through 2006. 974 cases made.

name: Random Ridge Mount Veeder
review: Ripe, intense and tannic, with crisp currant and cherry-scented Cabernet flavors that are concentrated and focused, but it's so youthful and firm that it needs until 1996 to mellow. Has lots of flavor. A blend of 72 percent Cabernet Sauvignon and 28 percent Cabernet Franc. 347 cases made.

name: Syrah Russian River Valley Alegría Vineyard
review: Somewhat austere at first, with astringent tannins, but the blackberry, blueberry and herb flavors stretch out nicely after a little time in the glass. Best from 2000 through 2002. 453 cases made.

name: Victory Reserve Sonoma County
review: Offers an elegant and appealing array of ripe, mature cherry, currant and plum flavors. Finishes with a dry edge and hints of spice and cedar. 220 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Casa Santinamaria
review: Fairly focused, with jammy blackberry flavors, balanced spice and licorice highlights and a smooth-textured finish. Drink now through 2000. 553 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Casa Santinamaria
review: Ripe and earthy in character, showing juicy plum and wild berry notes and a touch of earthiness on the finish. 625 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Casa Santinamaria
review: Has potential. Offers attractive wild berry and cherry flavors, but right now, it loses some focus on the finish, which should improve with age. 540 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Mohrhardt Ridge Vineyard
review: Black cherry, currant and anise flavors are followed by rich, concentrated mineral and iodine notes, all folding into a plush, ripe frame. For fans of mineral flavors. Drink now through 2001. 437 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Mohrhardt Ridge Vineyard
review: Spicy; ripe plum, cherry and currant flavors are focused and lively, staying with you on the finish. Well proportioned. 464 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Mohrhardt Ridge Vineyard
review: Offers a nice beam of spicy, berry-scented Cabernet flavor framed by toasty, buttery oak notes. Firm, concentrated, focused and rich, with tight tannins. Drink now. 276 cases made.

name: Criolla Sonoma Valley Old Vines
review: This ripe, fruity, medium-weight red offers jammy raspberry, plum and anise aromas and flavors and finishes with a touch of cedar. Has plenty of personality for the price. Drink now. 245 cases made.

name: Criolla Sonoma Valley Old Vines
review: Smooth and generous, with well-defined raspberry and blackberry aromas and flavors, a supple texture and a velvety finish. Drink now. 292 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma County
review: A little chewy, but the minty currant aromas and flavors land solidly around the tannins. Drinkable now. 720 cases made.

name: Syrah Russian River Valley
review: Fine concentration of earthy, leathery fruit and game notes, finishing with dry tannins. Best from 2001 through 2004. 576 cases made.

name: Viognier Sonoma County
review: Almost sweet-tasting, its richness backed by peach, spice and mineral flavors. Finishes clean, though a little short. Drink now. 178 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley
review: Bright and fruity, with spice and herbs to add complexity. Black cherry, raspberry, anise and a touch of vanilla make this an enjoyable quaff. Drink now. 1,142 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mount Veeder Random Ridge
review: An earthy style with racy flavors but it holds together, delivering just enough currant and plum notes to offset the earthiness. 415 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Mohrhardt Ridge Vineyard
review: Lean, toasty and a little jammy, working in a nice range of raspberry, anise and mineral flavors at a modest level. Needs until 1998. 490 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Glen Lyon Vineyard
review: Light and brightly focused, a mouthful of minty, earthy berry flavors that finish solidly, if not with great depth. 215 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Mineral, citrus and apple notes form the core. Flinty mineral flavors persist on the firm finish. Drink now. 1,300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: Simple, with a modest band of spicy pear, citrus and light oak notes, but nothing more. 520 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Barrel Fermented
review: Potently floral and perfumed, with a strong wood and honeysuckle edge that dominates. Gains more fruit on the finish. 450 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley
review: Young and chewy, with firm tannins and an earthy nuance to its currant and berry flavors. Needs time to shed its tannins, though it may always be on the tannic side. 840 cases made.

name: Syrah Russian River Valley Alegría Vineyard
review: Dark, ripe and spicy, with a plum and currant edge, but it it would benefit from greater richness, depth and concentration. 394 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Casa Santinamaria
review: Dark, ripe and intense, with jammy cherry and wild berry flavors that turn supple and earthy on the finish. Drinks well now through 1998. 280 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mount Veeder Random Ridge
review: Firm and tannic, showing a narrow beam of spicy berry flavor. Needs until 1998-2000. 280 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Mohrhardt Ridge Vineyard
review: Robust and full-bodied, with plenty of currant and black cherry flavors and plenty of tannins, too. There's not much oak in this solid and fruity--but young and rough--Cabernet. Best to drink now. 390 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley
review: Charry oak notes almost drown out the crisp, modest black cherry. Finishes with slightly burnt, sour notes. Drink now. 1,875 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley
review: Crisp and trim, with medium-depth herb, tobacco and cherry flavors. 600 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Mountain Herron Vineyard
review: Medium-bodied, with herb, citrus and earth notes. Drink now through 2003. 235 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County 100-Year-Old Vines
review: Dark, with chewy, earthy, extracted blackberry and vanilla notes and a drying finish. Drink now through 2003. 166 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley 100-Year-Old Vines
review: Shows off a tart, wild berry edge, so fans of that style will find it quite pleasing, but it doesn't quite fill out at mid-palate. Finishes with a crisp, simple edge. 143 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: A bit of a tease, with pretty black currant and violet flavors battling with cottage cheese and matchstick overtones. Drink now through 2008. 931 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Barrel Fermented Lot 2
review: Floral and perfumed, with a narrow band of spicy pear and apricot flavors, finishing with chewy oak notes. 590 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: Pretty nectarine flavors are punctuated by unfortunate metallic and bitter notes. It's drinkable, but a bit off. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Mount Veeder
review: Firm, tannic and tough, with a strong vegetal, tomato edge to the berry flavors, not subtle or elegant, but it finishes with nice fruit. Tannic enough to need until 1995. 500 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley
review: Earthy, gamy flavors prevail in this somewhat austere red. Best after 1998. 1,300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mount Veeder Random Ridge
review: Woody, with hints of tea, chocolate and berry emerging from a solid foundation. 410 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Valley Englandcrest
review: Mineral and plum notes seem tired and a bit nutty, with intensely drying tannins. 572 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Barrel Fermented
review: A bit heavy-handed with the oak, which tastes like varnish, marring the pear, apple and citrus notes that are buried beneath the pile of wood. Unbalanced. Drink now. 840 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Old Vines
review: Pungently earthy, with a funky barnyard streak that runs through the flavors. Marginal. 540 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Barrel Fermented
review: Crisp and perfumed, but not in a grapey way. A strange candied edge doesn't help. 800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Crisp and clean. Characteristic grassy aromas and dry, juicy flavors remind us of a good French Sancerre. Should be versatile at the table. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Robertson Philip Jonker The Ring
review: Plump, with a bitter lemon edge to the well-knit pear, peach and melon flavors. A hint of brioche accents the finish. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Robertson
review: Shows good varietal character, with spice, litchi and rose petal notes. Medium-weight, round texture, moderate finish. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Robertson Philip Jonker The Ring
review: Mature, with toasted brioche, creamed apple and honey-roasted almond notes. Flattering, if a touch blowsy in the end. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Muscat de Hambourg Robertson
review: Sweet and grapey yet never thick or cloying, though the alcohol shows on the finish, which turns a little coarse. Try with blue cheeses. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Robertson
review: Smooth and supple, generous with butter and fig flavors, and shows a bit of zip, as well. Finishes with spice notes. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Robertson
review: Ripe apricots and a smoky element ally themselves to a lean structure in this personable, round white. The smoke flavor carries through to the finish. Drink now.

name: Privé du Bois Robertson
review: A honeyed note from new oak adds interest to the lemon and melon flavors in this round, fleshy wine. A flavorful, appealing wine. Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Muscat de Hambourg Robertson
review: Has raisin, coffee and treacle notes that are interesting, but it's a touch coarse and hot on the finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Muscat Robertson Gold
review: Has the floral and spice aromas of a Muscat with basic sweet peach and marzipan flavors. Lacks verve though, turning cloying in the end. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Robertson
review: Dark in color, with mature notes of lanolin and nuts. Hints of grapefruit and litchi, but this is soft and fatiguing already. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Privé du Bois Robertson
review: A flavorful but awkward white with thick texture and buttery overtones that don't mesh well with the tart ctirus flavors. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Robertson
review: A very young Chardonnay that still tastes green and rough. It has a tart apple flavor and hints of butter and earth in the aroma. 1,500 cases made.

name: Privé du Bois Robertson
review: Dry and crisp, but watery in flavor. Simple refreshment; palatable but not interesting. Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay. 2,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Malbec Clare Valley
review: Smooth and focused, with a distinct chalky mineral note adding gravitas to the ripe plum, cassis and spicy orange peel flavors, which persist on the long, expressive finish. The tannins still have a ways to go, but the flavors are so rich, fresh and open-textured that this should just keep getting better.--Australian reds blind retrospective.

name: Cabernet-Malbec Clare Valley
review: Dried herb, straw and earth notes dominate the aromas, and the tannins clamp down hard on the raspberry and currant fruit, with a jolt of acidity on the finish. Feels awkward and out of balance, but there's a lot to this.--Australian reds blind retrospective.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Reserve
review: Very elegant, almost restrained, but in a seductive sense. This has loads of ripe berry, mocha and meat flavors that are seasoned with sandalwood and Asian spice. Creamy finish goes on and on. Drink now through 2010.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Veratina
review: A refined style, with plenty of cherry and currant flavors, balanced by mineral, spice and mocha elements. The elegant finish features smoky and meaty notes. Blaufränkisch, Zweigelt, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2010. 833 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Reserve
review: An alluring aroma of roasted coffee leads to precise, concentrated and well-structured flavors of hazelnut, red plum and dark cherry. Touches of chocolate and mint lengthen out nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2013. 833 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Dürrau
review: Perfumed aromas of dark fruit and spice, with lithe flavors of boysenberry and bitter chocolate and plenty of creamy notes. Shows mocha and hints of cappuccino on the finish. Blaufränkisch. Drink now through 2010. 330 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Burgenland Kalkofen
review: This red features plenty of toasty notes, with fresh-tasting flavors of red currant, green olive and hot stone. Delivers a sumptuous finish of savory herb and spice. Drink now through 2018. 5 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland
review: Pure-tasting, with a surplus of red plum, berry and cherry flavors that are fresh and well-structured. A zesty juiciness powers the finish. Drink now through 2013.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Reserve
review: Vibrant, fruity aromas and flavors of plum, cherry and spice are luscious, with fine-grained tannins. Notes of orange blossom and spice linger with chocolate on the finish. Very Pinot-like. Drink now through 2012. 665 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Dürrau
review: Fresh despite its age, with focused mineral, smoke and dried berry and plum flavors. Lots of tea and spice notes as well, with an enveloping finish of sandalwood and silky tannins, and a touch of game. Blaufränkisch. Drink now.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Dürrau
review: Dense and ripe, with mincemeat, smoke and dark plum flavors. Bittersweet chocolate notes power the sinewy finish. Blaufränkisch. Drink now through 2011. 250 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland
review: There's a deep well of red plum, raspberry and kirsch flavors in this juicy well-structured red. Has plenty of spice, along with hints of black olive and licorice on the long finish. Drink now through 2011. 150 cases imported.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Raga
review: Lively and concentrated, with a nice beam of red cherry and plum flavors, with some syrupy elements. Finishes with ganache notes. Drink now.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Hochäcker
review: Medium-bodied, with berry and dried plum flavors picking up iron and smoke on the crisp finish. Drink now. 3,333 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Hochäcker
review: Red plum and cherry flavors dominate this medium-bodied red. Hot stone, licorice and plum pudding fill the finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Horitschon
review: This is filled with lively red berry, plum and cherry flavors that are backed up by plenty of fresh acidity. There's an intense minerally component on the finish. Drink now through 2011. 3,333 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Reserve
review: Zesty red, with lively and fresh flavors of red plum, raspberry, smoke and spice. Finishes with hints of mincemeat. Drink now. 667 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Veratina
review: Bright and juicy, with flavors of red plum, currant and spiced cherry. Mineral and iron mark the fresh finish. Drink now.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Veratina
review: Very crisp, with plenty of cherry, berry and plum flavors and milk chocolate shading. Licorice and spiced apple notes on the finish. Try with barbecued chicken. Blaufränkisch, Zweigelt, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2009. 830 cases made.

name: Kékfrankos Sopron
review: Bright and fruity, in a straightforward, easy style. Cherry and raspberry flavors get a boost from the bright structure and light tannins. Drink now through 2012. 300 cases imported.

name: Kékfrankos Sopron Balf
review: Plenty of concentrated cherry and blackberry flavors are matched by stiff tannins. The two sides appear to come to a truce on the moderate finish. Best from 2011 through 2014. 100 cases imported.

name: Kékfrankos Sopron Spern Steiner
review: Rich yet supple and ripe, this red displays maturing fruit notes of cherry and blackberry, plus spice and a hint of cedar on the finish. The finish is firm. Drink now through 2012. 50 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Hochäcker
review: Spicy and smoky, with concentrated flavors of dried red fruit and tobacco. The tannic finish features sandalwood notes. Drink now. 24 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Veratina
review: Well-rounded and supple, with berry and red plum flavors and some savory herbal notes on the fresh finish. Blaufränkisch, Merlot, Zweigelt and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Veratina
review: Crisp and focused, with berry, smoke and red plum flavors. Notes of maple and spice on the finish. Blaufränkisch, Zweigelt and Merlot. Drink now. 833 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland
review: Crisp, with red berry and red plum flavors that feature some beefy notes. Savory herb notes on the finish. Drink now.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Alte Reben
review: Firm, with a core of fresh acidity and chewy tannins between the dried cherry and red plum flavors. Short finish. Drink now.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland
review: Firm, offering concentrated dried cherry and raspberry flavors, with spice and smoke notes. Lean finish. Drink now. 70 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Hochäcker
review: Medium-bodied, with herbaceous aromas and plum, dill and dried berry flavors. Clean, minerally finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland
review: Offers beefy and sanguine notes wrapped around dried cherry, berry and mineral flavors. The supple finish features spice and leather. Drink now. 60 cases imported.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Raga
review: Red plum and cherry fill this medium- to full-bodied red. Tea and sandalwood notes enliven the finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Merlot-Syrah Sopron
review: Blackberry and black cherry flavors start out rich, only to be superseded by muscular tannins. A rustic red that needs grilled meats or a stew. Drink now through 2012. 300 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Burgenland Hochäcker
review: Dark-roasted plum flavors are paired to mocha notes in this brawny red. Leathery accents dominate the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch-Merlot Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Franz
review: Dried cherry, herb and wet earth flavors fill this medium-bodied red. Drink now. 105 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland
review: Cherry flavors, with tobacco and herbal notes. Medium-bodied. Drink now. 60 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland
review: Medium-bodied, with cherry and cranberry flavors that end on a crisp note. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Arroyo Seco Late Harvest Auslese
Chardonnay Central Coast
review: The best inexpensive Chardonnay on the market. Pretty, elegant and almost sweet tasting, with lots of ripe fruit flavors and a silky texture that keeps it light on its feet. Spice and vanilla notes linger on the finish. 30,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley Karl Wente The Nth Degree
review: Smooth, rich and fleshy, showing a pretty mix of ripe cherry, currant and wild berry fruit that's spicy and elegant, ending with a long, persistent, lingering fruity finish. Drink now through 2014. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley Karl Wente The Nth Degree
review: Dark, dense, rich and chewy, with concentrated currant, blackberry and roasted plum flavors that are intense and framed by rich, chewy tannins. Despite the wine's size and density, the fruit pushes through on the finish. Best from 2006 through 2012. 300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco Riva Ranch
review: A delicious wine that's elegant and stylish, with rich, sharply focused pear, pineapple and tropical fruit flavors framed by subtle oak shadings that turn toasty on the finish. Enjoy now. 4,900 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast Reserve Arroyo Seco Vineyard
review: Beautifully focused, long and elegant, with fine concentration of fig, honey and toast aromas and flavors that linger enticingly on the finish. Flavors are assertive, but this is a smoothly polished wine. Drink now. 6,150 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco Riva Ranch
review: A rich, creamy style, with complex fig, honeydew melon, spice and light toasty oak. The fruit has a sweet edge, but this is a very complex and appealing style. Drink now through 2011. 44,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Herman Wente Reserve
review: Big, ripe and complex, with loads of vanilla and smoky oak flavors, but also a pretty core of well-focused Chardonnay flavors, with citrus, pear, spice and melon. Complex aftertaste. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Karl Wente The Nth Degree
review: A rich, creamy style, with pretty orange blossom, apple, pear, honeysuckle and apricot flavors that are full-blown yet elegant and refined, finishing with a long, clean, fruity aftertaste. Drink now through 2008. 300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Small Lot 125th Anniversary
review: Mixes fig, honeysuckle, melon and spice in a rich, full-bodied style, with hints of butterscotch, ending with honeysuckle. Drink now through 2012. 172 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco Riva Ranch
review: Ripe, exotic spiced apple cider flavors give this a unique twist, with citrus, mineral and light oak folding in to add depth. Drink now. 44,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco Riva Ranch Reserve
review: Refreshing and delicious, with ripe peach and nectarine flavors that are fresh and lively. Lovely tangerine and papaya notes come through on the finish, where the toasty oak is evident. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco Riva Ranch Reserve
review: Clean, crisp and well focused, with ripe, lively flavors, hints of melon, pear and citrus and a spicy, elegant aftertaste. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco Riva Ranch Single Vineyard
review: Floral, with ripe white peach and nectarine flavors that are fresh and lively. Drink now. 70,305 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Herman Wente Reserve
review: Elegant and refreshing, with spicy pear, tangerine, citrus and smoky oak flavors that add dimension and complexity to the finish. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Herman Wente Reserve
review: Round, spicy and generous, marked by barrel fermentation and aging, finishing smooth and long. Manages substantial richness. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Herman Wente Reserve
review: Strikes a nice balance between intense pear, apple and vanilla flavors. Turns smooth and elegant, with fruit and smoky oak notes on the finish. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Herman Wente Reserve
review: A smooth, creamy wine, with lots of pear, peach, vanilla, grapefruit and honey notes that glide across the palate. Finishes with complexity and grace. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Herman Wente Reserve
review: Has an intense, almost sweet fruitiness that's very appealing, rich and creamy. Earthy in aroma, then opens up with ripe pear, vanilla and honey flavors that linger on the finish. Quite distinctive.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Karl Wente The Nth Degree
review: Well-balanced, with medium-bodied ripe pear, apple and spicy floral scents that are sleek and focused. Drink now through 2012. 600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Karl Wente The Nth Degree
review: Initial creamy vanilla aromas stay with this, giving it an undeniably oaky butterscotch character. Still, there's enough ripe pear and apple-scented fruit to keep it in balance. Drink now through 2007. 300 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Livermore Valley
review: Bright melon aromas and flavors lead the charge in this crisp yet ripe-style white from a long-established California winery. Woven into the blend are lemon, lime, grapefruit and fig elements, all finishing cleanly with a mineral accent. It doesn't get much better at this price. 5,661 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Livermore Valley
review: Crisp, and somewhat elegant, with sharply focused melon, sage and citrusy flavors. Drinkable now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley Charles Wetmore
review: At points this offers a suppleness that lets the dark berry, herb and subtle mocha flavors stand out. Ends up tight, however, with grippy tannins. Drink now through 2028. 12,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco Riva Ranch
review: Fresh and fruity, with nicely defined apple, grapefruit, lemon and pear aromas and flavors that remain fresh and spicy through the lively finish. Appealing to drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco Riva Ranch Reserve
review: Intense, with a earthy, leafy-floral edge to the creamy, buttery pear and apple flavors. The texture is a bit raw, but nothing out of line for a wine this young. Finishes with smoky oak and complex flavors. Drink now through 2006. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Karl Wente The Nth Degree
review: Mouthwatering, displaying a fine acidity to the fresh flavors of citrus, apple and pear, revealing touches of toast and spice on the finish. Delivers solid intensity and focus. Drink now through 2019. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Karl Wente The Nth Degree
review: Fresh and lively, with floral apple, peach and nectarine blossom scents and pure ripe flavors that are elegantly styled, ending with a nice spicy, light oaky aftertaste. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley The Nth Degree
review: The orange and tangerine flavors are intense, ripe and rich, with roasted, toasty notes providing an added dimension. The toasty notes linger on the finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Merlot Livermore Valley Karl Wente The Nth Degree
review: Lots of fruit complexity, with a tapered mix of grapey currant, blackberry and raspberry, with a touch of herb and mocha-laced oak folding in nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 300 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Livermore Valley
review: Features a silky texture, with tangy acidity to balance it. Pretty grass, herb, grapefruit and melon flavors fan out, with a fresh, clean finish. Drink now through 2002. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Livermore Valley
review: Straightforward, with melon, spice and citrus flavors that unfold nicely, finish clean. A good value.

name: Syrah Livermore Valley Karl Wente The Nth Degree
review: Aromas of plum, pomegranate and blackberry carry over nicely to the palate, where they're smooth and polished, picking up a hint of mocha and cedary oak, gaining complexity on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley Charles Wetmore Single Vineyard
review: Possesses more tannins than fruit, making for a rustic, chewy, gravel-edged mix of herb and earth notes. Drink now through 2024. 8,337 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley Charles Wetmore Vineyard Reserve
review: Leans toward the herbal spectrum but has enough currant and spicy Cabernet fruit to maintain interest. The texture is smooth and supple and the flavors linger. Drinkable now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley Charles Wetmore Vineyard Reserve
review: Ripe, supple, flavorful and graceful, with lovely blackberry and currant flavors shaded by herb and mint overtones. Has a velvety texture and tannins, making it ready to drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley Karl Wente The Nth Degree
review: A solid effort, with ripe currant, black cherry and blackberry fruit that has a touch of melted wax and cedary oak on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco Riva Ranch Reserve
review: Well-focused on a core of citrus, green pear and honeysuckle flavors and supported by cedary oak, it offers complexity and depth, though it come up shy of extra dimensions. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Morning Fog
review: Marked by clean citrus and green apple shading, this is enlivened by zesty acidity. A solid effort. Drink now. 150,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Morning Fog
review: Offers flavors of fresh-pressed apple juice, with a rich core of apple and pear. Reveals a pithy edge to the texture. Drink now. 150,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Livermore Valley Crane Ridge Reserve
review: Light, with strawberry and cinnamon flavors and a lingering finish. Drink now. 4,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Livermore Valley
review: Nectarine, lemon and tangy melon flavors have a lively acid raciness that is nicely aligned with the creamy vanilla flavors. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Livermore Valley Karl Wente The Nth Degree
review: Well-crafted, with a ripe, complex core of black cherry and wild berry fruit that turns supple and polished on the finish, coming up a bit short on the aftertaste. Drink now through 2009. 300 cases made.

name: Sonata Small Lot Central Coast
review: Aromatic toasty and spicy oak notes frame ripe wild berries, plum and cassis flavors. Good intensity, balance, and length, with pleasantly firm tannins. Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2013. 350 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noir Arroyo Seco
review: Ripe, smooth and creamy with spicy vanilla and cherry tinged fruit that turns soft and fleshy on the finish. Drinks well now. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley
review: Smoke, spice, coffee and toast blend nicely in this lighter-styled Cabernet. The finish is herbal, fresh and clean. Drinks well now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley
review: A sturdy California wine that offers a lot for a fair price. The solid, beet-scented berry and herb flavors pick up interesting notes of spice and pickle barrel on the finish. Drinkable now.  28,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley Charles Wetmore Vineyard Reserve
review: A weedy, herbal style that also serves up a core of currant and earth flavors, all of which add up to a nice wine with flavor. Firm tannins on the finish, but as 1989s go this one is probably about as good as it gets. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco Riva Ranch
review: Smooth and satiny, wrapping its light pineapple and pear notes around a core of spicy, toasty flavors. Finishes with a flourish. Ready now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco Riva Ranch
review: Smooth and silky, with elegant pear, spice and honey notes, medium-bodied and well crafted.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco Riva Ranch Reserve
review: Delivers more flavor than grace, with ripe tangerine and peachy flavors leading to a toasty oak layer. Drink now. 5,400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: This California white is ready to drink, with pleasant fig, pear and citrus flavors that come together subtly on a soft frame. A very nice wine, and its price tag invites you to give it a try. 40,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: A crisp, slightly coarse texture, but appealing pear and apple flavors. Drinkable now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay San Francisco Bay
review: Ripe, with a beam of green pear, apple and pineapple tones. Concentrated fruit flavors linger with coconut oak and citrusy acidity on the finish. Drink now. 41,667 cases made.

name: Merlot Livermore Valley Crane Ridge Reserve
review: A tight band of plum and black cherry flavors leads the way, backed up by smoky oak and a smooth texture. Finishes with an herbal grip. Drink now through 2003. 3,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Livermore Valley Karl Wente The Nth Degree
review: Juicy and easygoing, with plum and tobacco aromas and cherry and herb flavors. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Central Coast
review: Smooth, with butter, grass, lemon curd and nectarine flavors. Vanilla notes are nicely focused through the tangy finish. Drink now. 7,100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Livermore Valley
review: Spicy, smooth pineapple and herb flavors extend into a generous finish. Value-priced and drinkable now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Livermore Valley Shorthorn Canyon
review: Pleasant herbal tea notes grace this wine, with pretty wild strawberry and raspberry flavors. Smooth and light-bodied, with a pleasant citrus tang on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 15,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley
review: Ripe plum and earth tones are accented by toasty oak nuances and supported by a hearty frame. Drink now through 2005. 12,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley Charles Wetmore
review: Strong oak influences add spicy cedar, tobacco and chicory flavors, with a trim band of currant and black cherry on a medium frame, followed by a smoky finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley Charles Wetmore Reserve
review: Funky, with leathery and earthy flavors that overshadow the currant and plum notes. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Fresh and spicy, with pleasant apple, pear and nutmeg aromas and flavors that remain light and fragrant through the finish. Drinkable now. 80,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Morning Fog
review: Spicy Gewürztraminer- and Riesling-like aromas are clean and refreshing, with a vibrant pippin apple flavor. Drink now. 55,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Livermore Valley
review: A smoky, oaky wine, it serves up cassis, tea and licorice flavors. While not totally harmonious, it's still quite tasty, and has a good price, too. Drink now through 2002. 2,741 cases made.

name: Merlot Livermore Valley Crane Ridge
review: Rings true for the varietal, with herb, currant, cherry and berry flavors that finish with light, toasty oak shadings. 9,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Livermore Valley Crane Ridge
review: An oaky, earthy style that gets more intersting with every sip, revealing more ripe cherry and plum flavors. Finishes with soft tannins. Drink now through 1998. 3,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Livermore Valley Crane Ridge
review: Smooth and supple with tarry currant, herb and tobacco notes. Finishes with firm, dry tannins, but enough fruit pours through to keep it interesting. Ready now. Drink now to 1998. 4,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Arroyo Seco Riva Ranch Single Vineyard
review: Fading already, with pleasant earth and dried berry notes that make this serviceable if uninspiring. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Arroyo Seco Riverbank
review: A whiff of petrol mingles with ripe peach and candied apricot flavors, showing notes of black tea and a juicy finish. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Manages to offer enough concentration to avoid being watery. The melon, apricot and apple flavors are attractive. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Livermore Valley
review: Shows juicy lemon-lime notes, with some herbal grassiness on the finish. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Livermore Valley
review: Simple and soft, with a hint of apple and a pleasant grassy edge. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Livermore Valley Louis Mel
review: Direct, with a citrus and melon focus, spicy notes and a slightly coarse finish. A modest acidity in the background keeps this light on its feet. Drink now. 8,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Livermore Valley Louis Mel
review: Fresh, green herb flavors head toward fresh jalapeño notes, with tart citrus and juicy peach notes. Drink now. 8,400 cases made.

name: Syrah Livermore Valley
review: Cola, cherry and pomegranate flavors have fine focus and tangy tannins, with lingering cedar undertones and earth notes. Drink now through 2006. 20,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Livermore Valley Smith Bench
review: Soft and juicy, with modest mocha-cherry, herb and cola flavors. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Blanc de Blancs Arroyo Seco
review: Offers a few extra dimensions inthe cherry and spice notes, but comes across as simple and clean. It's pleasant now. 450 cases made.

name: Brut Arroyo Seco Grande
review: Austere and lemony with tart, earthy pear and citrus notes. Balanced with flavors that stay with you on the finish. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley
review: Leans toward the earthy, leathery spectrum, turning dry on the finish. A good 1991 that's ready to drink.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley Charles Wetmore Vineyard Reserve
review: Smooth and mature-tasting, with tobacco, herb and leather aromas and modest plum and chocolate flavors. The moderate tannins are well integrated. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco Riva Ranch Reserve
review: Dominated by oaky coconut overtones, picking up herbal and vanilla flavors. Drink now. 18,700 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley
review: Floral and citrus notes are refreshing and herbal, with a clipped finish. Drink now. 45,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Morning Fog
review: Earthy pear and golden apple flavors have a twinge of citrus bitterness. Drink now. 55,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Arroyo Seco
review: Light, with jammy flavors of berries, cherries and orange peel, finishing with a pleasant toastiness. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Central Coast
review: A juicy little red, not particularly strong on Merlot character, but it's soft and easy to drink, with notes of cherry cola, vanilla and fresh dill. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Livermore Valley Sandstone
review: Soft and rather simple, with notes of cherry and herb. Drink now. 10,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Monterey
review: Soft and easy to drink, with floral tropical fruit aromas and flavors. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Livermore Valley Karl Wente The Nth Degree
review: Tight and herbal and more than a little twinge of green, with chalky tannins and faint wild berry notes. A floral, perfumed note gives it some charm. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley
review: An herbal style with smoky tobacco notes that turn austere and tight. Could use a little more generosity and depth. Fades out on the finish. Drinkable now through 1997. 15,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley Southern Hills
review: Tangy fruit flavors are herb-tinged, with cedar and cola notes on a simple frame. Drink now. 78,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon San Francisco Bay
review: Dried herb and cola notes blend with simple cherry and spice flavors, ending with dry, cedary tannins. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon San Francisco Bay
review: Supple, with modest intensity to green olive, currant and herb tones, with soft structure and oak tones. Drink now through 2006. 33,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Light and straightforward, with modest apple and vaguely toasty flavors. Drinkable now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Arroyo Seco
review: Shows pleasant cherry and spice aromas and flavors, with underlying herb notes. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Herman Wente Reserve
review: Soft, fleshy, with generous Chardonnay fruit, a touch of honey on the finish, round and delicate. Drink it now.

name: Merlot Arroyo Seco Sandstone
review: Thin and simple, with muted cherry and herb aromas and flavors. Drink now. 28,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Livermore Valley Crane Ridge
review: Simple and distinctly herbal, with modest cherry and spice notes. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Livermore Valley Crane Ridge Reserve
review: A bit out of whack, with pronounced vanilla and toffee from toasty oak alongside modestly tannic green bean and earth notes. Drink now through 2005. 6,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Arroyo Seco Riverbank
review: Sweet and simple, with delicate floral notes and soft stone fruit and herb flavors. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Central Coast
review: A bit funky, with herb and grapefruit notes that carry through to the slightly green finish. Drink now. 3,736 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Livermore Valley
review: Tart and tangy, with good intensity to grass, hay, grapefruit and sandalwood character. Drink now through 2005. 10,984 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Livermore Valley
review: Simple and sturdy, with a cooked flavor streaking though the modest pear and apple fruit. Drinkable now.

name: Sémillon Livermore Valley
review: Straightforward, sturdy, with floral overtones and some ripe fig flavors sneaking in on the finish. A bit thick in texture, but a solid wine, drinkable now.

name: Syrah San Francisco Bay
review: Offers straightforward boysenberry and spice flavors, with underlying medicinal notes. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Brut Arroyo Seco
review: Full-bodied, spicy and perfumey, a bit chunky instead of elegant, but it has enough restraint to make an attractive apéritif.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley Charles Wetmore Reserve
review: A fruit-juicy wine with a healthy dollop of charry oak. Redolent of Bing cherry and smoke, with a short finish and firm tannins. 7,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon San Francisco Bay Charles Wetmore Reserve
review: Roasted herb, berry and smoke flavors are simple, finishing with gritty, drying tannins. 3,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Livermore Valley Crane Ridge
review: Lean and tart, with plain cherry and tobacco aromas and flavors. 12,000 cases made.

name: Merlot San Francisco Bay Crane Ridge Reserve
review: Simple, a hint earthy and bitter, showing slight cherry and herbal aromas and flavors. 22,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Arroyo Seco Reliz Creek Reserve
review: Tart and slightly musty, with modestly tannic sour cherry, black cherry, floral, earth and red currant flavors. 1,200 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noir Arroyo Seco
review: A good, sturdy, full-bodied wine. Shows clean, ripe fruit flavors with a touch of cherry and good balance.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Central Coast
review: Definitely in the herbal style, with straightforward flavors of cherry, and bay leaf and moderate tannins. Smooth.

name: Pinot Noir Arroyo Seco Reliz Creek Reserve
review: Mature in color, with a thin band of peppery flavors. More like red table wine than Pinot Noir. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast Reserve Arroyo Seco Vineyard
review: Lean and spicy, tart and turning a bit harsh and sour on the finish, echoing nutmeg and pear flavors that should emerge nicely with some cellaring. Drink 1990-91.

name: Pinot Noir Arroyo Seco Reliz Creek
review: Offers simple cherry cola aromas and flavors, finishing with dry, herb-tinged aromas. 7,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Livermore Valley Raboli Vineyards
review: Rough, stemmy and a bit austere, but enough ripe cherry and raspberry aromas and flavors come through on the finish to make it appealing.

name: Riesling Arroyo Seco Late Harvest November Harvest Reserve
review: Not as smooth, sweet and opulent as the deep golden color suggests, and lacking the richness and honeyed fruit flavor one expects in this type of wine. Only hints of honey come through on the finish. 905 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley
review: Tutti-frutti cherry flavors swim in a simple, lightweight wine. 5,625 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Arroyo Seco Reliz Creek Reserve
review: Color is light and browning, with thin, peppery, weedy flavors. Misses the mark by a wide margin. Best to avoid. 2,500 cases made.

name: Ruster Ausbruch Burgenland Saz
review: Spicy, with a rich amber hue and flavors of glazed apricot, baked pineapple and ruby grapefruit. There's plenty of sea salt and spice on the luscious finish. Furmint and Gelber Muskateller. Drink now through 2014. 91 cases made.

name: Furmint Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: A medium-bodied, spicy white, featuring luscious pear and apple flavors, with notes of ginger and dried apricot. French vanilla accents mark the finish. Drink now. 60 cases imported.

name: Furmint Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Vogelsang
review: Fresh-cut apple flavors and glazed quince notes are clean and well-balanced in this white. Rich, yeasty accents enliven the spicy finish. Drink now through 2014. 20 cases imported.

name: Gelber Muskateller Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: An aromatic white, with spicy red peach flavors and white currant notes. Supple finish. Drink now. 60 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Bandkräften
review: Quite crisp, with rhubarb and red plum flavors. Blaufränkisch. 275 cases made.

name: Intelligent Design Cuvée Santa Barbara County
review: Fresh and vibrant, with zesty wild berry and blueberry flavors that are pure and refreshing, ending with a juicy aftertaste. Grenache, Syrah and Petite Sirah. Drink now through 2018. 388 cases made.

name: Intelligent Design Cuvée Central Coast
review: Simple yet pleasant, medium-weight, with spicy white pepper and cranberry flavors that are pure and easy to drink. Carignan, Grenache, Cinsaut, Petite Sirah, Mourvèdre and Pinot Noir. Drink now through 2014. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Juicy red berry, cherry and plum notes are supple in texture and pure in flavor, presented in a straight-ahead style, ending with a lingering, persistent aftertaste. Drink now through 2023. 250 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Light in color, but intense, focused, complex and balanced. Medium- to full-bodied, with delicate floral, snappy black cherry and dark berry notes that linger. Drink now through 2013. 355 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Balletto Vineyard
review: Medium-bodied, delicate and complex, with spice, a hint of pepper, wild berry and sage, gaining depth and definition. Lively acidity and nice tannins. Drink now through 2014. 291 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Offers a supple, elegant mix of sour cherry and blueberry flavors. A vinegary touch around the edges draws notice. Drink now. 175 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hellenthal Vineyard
review: Trim, dry and savory, with modest plum and black cherry fruit that offers a touch of mineral, sage and herb, gaining depth on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 262 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Salzgeber Vineyard
review: Fresh earth, black cherry and blackberry fruit is a bit rustic and chewy, with minty-herb notes and drying tannins. Drink now through 2012. 157 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Blue Ridge
review: A tangy mouthful of Pinot, with black cherry, five-spice, plum and crushed stone flavors wrapped in subtle oak and low-key tannins. Drink now through 2008. 150 cases imported.

name: Riesling Great Southern
review: Tart and tangy, with a brisk range of tea-scented lime and apple flavors, finishing with gusto. Drink now through 2012. 1,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Western Australia
review: Bright, dry and fragrant with floral and mineral overtones to the green apple fruit, lingering well. Drink now through 2010. 800 cases made.

name: Shiraz Western Australia Two Steps
review: On the lighter side, but juicy with red berry and pomegranate fruit, remaining modestly intense as the finish lingers against polished tannins. Drink now through 2013. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Western Australia Book Ends
review: Crisp and vibrant, with a savory edge to the red berry and spice flavors, finishing with a deft balance, fading slightly. Drink now through 2017. 2,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Western Australia
review: This lighter style offers red fruit and spice flavors on a smooth, open-weave frame. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Western Australia
review: Firm, tannic and dense, with red pepperaccented cherry and herb flavors, opening out into a less weighty structure on the finish. Best from 2013 through 2016. 1,200 cases made.

name: Shiraz Western Australia
review: Bright and peppery, with a slight gamy edge to the cherry and spice flavors, lingering easily. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Western Australia
review: Light and tangy, with juicy acidity to balance the ripe currant fruit, shading toward chalk on the finish. Drink now through 2013. 500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Australia Zeepaard
review: Light and pretty, with floral lemon and mint flavors that glide gently over the palate. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Western Australia
review: Ripe, with a tangy, almost tart edge to the ripe currant, berry and green olive flavors. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Australia Unwooded
review: Light, juicy style has a refreshing level of acidity and pretty pear and lime flavors. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Sémillon-Sauvignon Blanc Western Australia
review: Grassy style has lots of sweet pea aromas and flavors. Finishes with a citrusy note. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon Western Australia Zeepaard
review: Soft and smooth, with a minty edge to the mild cherry flavors. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Californ
review: Smells dank and charry, with a sulfuric edge to the citrusy flavors, made more complex by a snappy, sodalike spritz. Odd, but works as a quaffer. Retails for $16 for four cans. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay North Carolina Barrel Fermented
review: Subtle pear and toast flavors, still has plenty of life despite its age, with a lingering finish of spice and mineral notes. A fine effort. Drink now. 620 cases made.

name: Vidal Blanc North Carolina
review: Well-crafted dessert wine for this hybrid grape variety. Smooth and full-flavored, with honey, caramel and ripe pear flavors blending fairly elegantly. Still, way overpriced. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Chardonnay North Carolina Barrel Fermented
review: Surprisingly lively despite its ripeness and butter notes. Flavors of pear, lemon and ripe apple, with spice accents. Won't win any contests for finesse, but still delicious. Drink now. 615 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yadkin Valley
review: Juicy and friendly, with pear and butter notes backed by a hint of yellow apple. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Vidal Blanc Yadkin Valley Late Harvest Lilly B
review: Frankly sweet, with maple, orange and clove hints that show focus through the finish. A touch heavy. For those with a real sweet tooth. Drink now. 45 cases made.

name: Chardonnay North Carolina Silver Creek Vineyards
review: A ripe-tasting wine with buttery and creamy flavors that are appealing if a bit overpowering. Smooth and satisfying. Drink now. 74 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yadkin Valley Barrel Fermented
review: Medium-bodied, round, soft and slightly sweet, with butter and pear notes that linger on the finish. Drink now. 228 cases made.

name: Seyval Blanc North Carolina
review: A nice, rich white if you can get past the pronounced earthy-grapey character of this French-American grape variety. Barrel-fermented style, with buttery aromas, full body and a lingering finish. Drink now. 855 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc North Carolina
review: A good, basic white with appealing grapefruit and herbal flavors and some nice spicy notes on the finish. Drink now. 485 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Carolina
review: A bit astringent, but still very juicy and fruity with some good, dark cherry and plum flavors and a touch of spice. Drink now. 561 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Carolina
review: Fairly light, and a bit tannic with roasted flavors and aromas, this also has dark cherry flavors and good spiciness on the finish. Drink now. 406 cases made.

name: Chardonnay North Carolina Barrel Fermented
review: Has a strong aroma and flavor of pineapple, which remains fresh and gives the wine a nice focus. Drink now. 615 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yadkin Valley Barrel Fermented
review: Quite forward, with heavy graham and honey notes guiding the soft apple and melon flavors. Drink now. 228 cases made.

name: Vidal Blanc North Carolina Botrytis
review: Crisp and appley with some tobacco notes in it as well. Well-structured and semi-dry this wine leaves a nice, clean taste on the palate. Drink now. 1,252 cases made.

name: Chambourcin North Carolina
review: Ambitious from its dark purple color to its overtly sweet, smoky nose, this has a grapey exuberance, with sweet black cherry and cracked pepper flavors. A good picnic wine. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay North Carolina
review: Straightforward, with caramel and smoke flavors and buttery notes on the finish. Drink now. 989 cases made.

name: Muscat Canelli North Carolina
review: A pleasant, fruity wine with peach and apple flavors, tobacco notes on the finish. Fairly light-bodied. Drink now. 110 cases made.

name: Yadkin Fumé Yadkin Valley
review: Fresh and crisp, with basic lime and peach flavors. Seyval Blanc. Drink now. 375 cases made.

name: Chambourcin North Carolina
review: Clean and easy, with straightforward grape flavor. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay North Carolina Barrel Fermented
review: Heavy-handed, with oaky flavors and apple notes. Finishes with a touch of bitter almond. 575 cases made.

name: Merlot North Carolina
review: Sweet dill lying over cherry, and it comes back in spades on the finish. Hard to warm up to. 1,000 cases made.

name: Muscat Canelli Yadkin Valley
review: Light and sweet, with candied lime and canned pear flavors. It's clean, but very simple. 117 cases made.

name: Viognier North Carolina
review: Peachy up front, but turns toward a lemony note on the abrupt finish. 410 cases made.

name: Muscat Canelli North Carolina
review: A mix of butter and tinned tangerine juice flavors, turning a bit cloying in the end. 270 cases made.

name: Port Yadkin Valley Jack's Legacy Red
review: Soft, with modest molasses and brown sugar notes, followed by an earthy hint on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon. 50 cases made.

name: Seyval Blanc North Carolina
review: Dilute, with tart lime flavor and a chive note on the finish. 1,100 cases made.

name: Riesling North Carolina
review: Fresh and slightly sweet, but there's a metallic or plastic note that detracts from the overall presentation. 820 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc North Carolina
review: This thick, heavy-handed white could almost pass for a barrel-fermented Chardonnay. Deep gold in color, with butter and vanilla aromas but very little fruit flavor. 420 cases made.

name: White Gamay North Carolina
review: An innocuous rosé, with only modest strawberry and watermelon flavors. 409 cases made.

name: Merlot North Carolina
review: Airy menthol and tea flavors, with a tart, dry finish. Past its prime. 525 cases made.

name: White Gamay North Carolina
review: This semi-sweet rosé, though drinkable, is rendered unappealing by an odd flavor, like pickled beets. 1,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Carolina
review: Awkward and almost medicinal-tasting, with dark cherry and menthol flavors. 245 cases made.

name: Chardonnay North Carolina
review: Almost amber in color with a slight diesel-like aroma. Overdone with buttery, oaky flavors that aren't backed up by fruit. 1,100 cases made.

name: Vidal Blanc North Carolina
review: This viscous white is marred by burnt, bitter flavors; it lacks fruit and finesse. 2,280 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Carolina
review: Library release. Eerie, molasses color, with muddled brown sugar and unpleasant, murky herbal notes. Past its prime. 750 cases made.

name: Eternity South Eastern Austral
review: Bubbles are a bit coarse in texture, with a candied edge to the lemon flavors. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Syrah Bennett Valley
review: Pure, rich, dense and concentrated, with a muscular mix of dark berry, black licorice, spice, tobacco and cedar, yet for all its full-bodied torque, the fruit is gorgeous and long on the finish. Best from 2013 through 2024. 105 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Bennett Valley
review: Vibrant blackberry and blueberry fruit is front and center, with shades of nutmeg and baking spices adding dimension. An oak presence folds in, adding yet another nuance. Drink now through 2021. 125 cases made.

name: Syrah Bennett Valley
review: This is tightly wound for now but reveals a rich, layered core of blueberry and blackberry fruit flavors, with accents of black licorice, tar, smoky sage and cracked pepper. Best from 2017 through 2023. 177 cases made.

name: Syrah Bennett Valley
review: Fresh, ripe and vibrant, with tight, rich, concentrated wild berry, black cherry, mint and black licorice, ending with a persistent though closed finish. Full-bodied, firm and tannic. Needs aeration. Best from 2010 through 2016. 245 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Bennett Valley
review: RIch, even weighty, with a dense core of earth-scented blackberry, licorice, savory underbrush and cedar flavors, making for a complex, full-bodied effort, supported by full tannins. Drink now through 2022. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Bennett Valley
review: Firm and compact, with tarry, stony blueberry aromas and dense, smoky plum and white pepper flavors. Finishes with lean tannins. Drink now through 2022. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Bennett Valley
review: A charry oak element imparts a heavy aroma and texture, but not at the expense of the tea- and cherry-laced fruit flavors. Comes across as disjointed. Perhaps the oak is simply too much. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 148 cases made.

name: Celebration Darling
review: On the crisp side, with red currant, dill and tobacco notes that stay taut through the finish. Hard to warm up to. Cabernet Sauvignon and Cinsault. 3,000 cases made.

name: Côte Blonde Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara
review: Pure, ripe and delicious layers of pomegranate, boysenberry and black cherry are supple in texture, yet supported by firm, ripe tannins and good acidity, with a long, persistent finish. Syrah and Viognier. Drink now through 2022. 165 cases made.

name: Côte Blonde Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara
review: Shows ample power and finesse. Racy aromas of currant, licorice and smoke open to concentrated flavors of boysenberry, cedar and pencil lead, finishing with ripe but firm tannins. Syrah and Viognier. Best from 2017 through 2022. 589 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley
review: Bold, ripe and concentrated, with rich currant, black cherry and blackberry fruit that's well-centered, elegant and balanced, finishing with a long, complex, fruity aftertaste. Drink now through 2012. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County
review: Delicate and fragrant, with subtle ripe cherry, raspberry, spice and anise flavors, ending with an enticingly earthy aftertaste. Drink now through 2019. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills
review: Notably elegant and graceful, with delicate wild berry, raspberry, spice, mineral and floral scents that are well-proportioned. Maintains finesse on the long, detailed finish. Drink now through 2021. 235 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County
review: Smooth and creamy, with layers of spicy fig, apricot and honeydew melon that are clean, pure and persistent, lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 228 cases made.

name: Red Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara
review: A luscious and supple red, with rich, beefy notes to the ripe dark plum and cherry tart flavors. Mocha and dark chocolate details show on the moderately tannic finish. Drink now through 2020. 844 cases made.

name: Syrah Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara Côte Blonde
review: A rich and gutsy red, exhibiting dense, extracted dark berry, game, campfire smoke, tobacco and cedar notes. This is deep, persistent and tannic, yet the flavors push through on the complex, lingering finish. Drink now through 2024. 253 cases made.

name: Syrah Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara Côte Blonde
review: A savory style, offering rich dark berry, dried herb, cedar and spice notes, with touches of stewed tomato and dried herb woven within. Layered finish. Drink now through 2020. 247 cases made.

name: Fletcher's White Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara
review: A tropical coconut-custard note adds some richness and complexity to the core of pear, peach and citrus flavors. The smooth body is balanced by crisp acidity, with a floral, spicy finish. Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier. Drink now. 479 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills
review: This lengthens out nicely with red cherry, hoisin sauce and dried raspberry flavors that are backed by fresh acidity. Portobello mushroom accents on the well-sculpted finish with plenty of minerality. Drink now through 2020. 754 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: A crisp style, with excellent depth and concentration to lime peel, lemon, grass and green apple notes. Taut, tangy flavors will soften with a bit of cellaring or food. Drink now through 2005. 1,150 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Ynez Valley
review: Offers tangy lime and lemon notes, with green apple details. Very fresh and lively. The acidity keeps the flavors jumping. Drink now. 903 cases made.

name: Fletcher's White Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara
review: Minerally, offering sea salt notes that mingle with the lemon, lime and grapefruit flavors. A floral accent and citrus zest hints impart extra detail. Medium-bodied, showing a pleasant acidity. Sauvignon Blanc, Viognier and Chardonnay. Drink now. 212 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Tangy, with focused lemon cheesecake, Key lime and guava flavors. A surge of grapefruit, passion fruit and grass gains momentum on the juicy finish. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Delivers a concentrated burst of earthy lemon-lime, mineral, grapefruit, green apple and grass flavors that stay vibrant and tart on the focused finish. Drink now through 2007. 1,135 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Fragrant and intense, with a bright beam of citrus, floral, passion fruit and tangy apple flavors. Drink now. 240 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley
review: Smooth and well-proportioned, showing complex loamy earth, dried berry and currant fruit, with mineral and dusty sage notes. Full-bodied, with dry, herb-laced tannins. Drink now through 2012. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County
review: Clean and graceful, with medium-weight pear and citrus notes and a bitter, pithy edge on the finish. Drink now. 369 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County
review: Offers a subtle mix of ripe pear, peach and nectarine that gains intensity. Drink now through 2019. 250 cases made.

name: Côte Blonde Santa Ynez Valley
