review: Plump and quite ripe, with notes of berry cobbler, dusty herb and caramel. Syrah, Viognier and Roussanne. Drink now through 2021. 900 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Tangy, juicy flavors of lemon, apple and peach have a touch of pineapple and plenty of refreshing acidity. Drink now. 2,400 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Zingy acidity keeps the citrus, fig, green pear and herbal flavors lively and refreshing, finishing with a cleansing aftertaste. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Bright and lively, with fine intensity to lemon, tart grapefruit and grass tones underscored by bracing acidity. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Côte Blonde
review: Berry, mineral and spice notes are nicely balanced and intense. The tannins are tight and the flavors focused. Drink now through 2010. 123 cases made.

name: Merlot Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara
review: Lean and rather densely packed, more of an Old World style, with notes of herb, tart cherry and tobacco. Drink now through 2020. 749 cases made.

name: Merlot Santa Ynez Valley
review: Red currant, raspberry, earth and herb notes have fine depth and inviting texture framed by toasty oak and firm tannin. Drink now through 2006. 550 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara
review: The tangy lemon-lime, melon and green apple flavors are light and refreshing, with a crisp, minerally finish. Drink now. 1,026 cases made.

name: Viognier Santa Ynez Valley
review: Trim, with herbal accents to the subtle pear, citrus and spice flavors. Good structure, with a very spicy almond skin finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sta. Rita Hills Bentrock Vineyard
review: The fruit is moderately ripe and straightforward. Short on focus and persistence. Drink now. 625 cases made.

name: Merlot Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara
review: Zesty if rather herbal, with notes of currant and spice. Drink now through 2016. 705 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara
review: Modest melon and stone fruit flavors are appealing, fresh and juicy. Drink now. 1,192 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Concentrated, with a sweet and sour blend of tart citrus, honey and grass tones. Not so balanced, but serves up a mouthful of flavor. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley
review: Wild berry and dusty herbal notes taste a bit stewed and drying, finishing with an odd mushroom note. 400 cases made.

name: Viognier Santa Ynez Valley
review: Thin and dull, with slight aromas of citrus and fennel, and lean, coarse flavors. 550 cases made.

name: W blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: A listless blend of Roussanne and Viognier, it offers flat and earthy aromas and lean, slightly bitter flavors. 250 cases made.

name: Grenache Western Australia
review: Round and lively, with blackberry and floral aromas and flavors galore, finishing with some heat. Drink now. 1,007 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Bright and refreshing, a light style with verve and pretty red cherry and spice flavors. Drink now. 950 cases made.

name: Syrah Horse Heaven Hills Surfer Discovery
review: Fresh, vibrant and expressive, with spicy blueberry and plum flavors set on a velvety frame. A nice zing of acidity propels the finish. Drink now through 2018. 133 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Southeastern New England
review: This full-bodied white offers heavily oaked flavors of toast, hazelnuts and butter, with ripe flavors of melon and pear as well, and enough lemony acidity for balance. An ambitious wine that needs food to show its best. Drink now through 2002. 2,200 cases made.

name: Brut Southeastern New England Cuvée RJR
review: Elegant, crisp-textured and restrained in flavor, this is appealing and refreshing. It has subtle cherry and citrus flavors and great balance. Drink now. 604 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Southeastern New England Silver Label
review: Crisp, with plenty of apple flavors and a zippy finish. Clean, well made and balanced, with a complementary touch of spice. Drink now. 2,072 cases made.

name: Blanc de Blancs Southeastern New England
review: Good in a mature style, showing nutty, smoky flavors and a firm, dry texture. Austere at first, but improves as you sip. Drink now. 103 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Southeastern New England Gold Label
review: Pleasant and fruity, with good peach and green apple flavors, and a clean finish dominated by appealing herbal notes. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Southeastern New England Gold Label
review: A reduced aroma is followed by appealing toasty, tobaccolike flavors with a hazelnut accent. Drink now. 236 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Southeastern New England Noble
review: Semi-sweet, dominated by apricot and pear flavors. Not deep or intense, but still pleasant, with plenty of acidity. Try with a light dessert. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Blanc Southeastern New England
review: An admirably dry rosé that's clean, crisp and lightly fruity--a step up from the average white Zinfandel. Drink now. 345 cases made.

name: Blanc de Blancs Southeastern New England
review: Still lively, this exuberant sparkler delivers green apple and pear flavors in a mouthfilling mousse. A perky aperitif. Drink now through 2002. 286 cases made.

name: Brut Southeastern New England Cuvée RJR
review: This muscular sparkler delivers an aggressive mousse and assertive flavors of toast, butter and apples. It's a bit clumsy, but can stand up to poultry and rich fish dishes. Drink now. 695 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Southeastern New England
review: This is fresh and lively, offering citrus and floral aromas and flavors, with a dry and tangy impression in a light-bodied style. Drink now. 549 cases made.

name: Brut Southeastern New England Cuvée RJR
review: Has a mix of lemon and brioche notes, turning a bit tart in the end. Still, clean and refreshing. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Southeastern New England Gold Label
review: A bit heavy-handed with butter and spice flavors, and only modest fruit flavors. 236 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Southeastern New England Silver Label
review: Just past its peak now, with a tart, piney note creeping in on the remnants of the pear fruit. 3,600 cases made.

name: Brut Southeastern New England Cuvée RJR
review: An average sparkling wine with simple apple flavors, slightly coarse texture. 1,040 cases made.

name: Blanc de Blancs Southeastern New England
review: Tart and applelike, with cidery flavors. Coarse finish. 303 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Southeastern New England Silver Label
review: Buttery-tasting, but a tart, almost tinny flavor makes it a bit unbalanced in the end. 781 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Southeastern New England Silver Label
review: Thin and tart, with lemon and herbal flavors and aromas. 780 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Southeastern New England Silver Label
review: A ripe style, though a bit coarse and astringent on the finish. Where's the fruit? 2,072 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Southeastern New England Imperial Sec
review: A serviceable sparkler, but a bit off-kilter. Has a cheesy-doughy aroma, sweet-and-sour flavors. 141 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Noirs Southeastern New England
review: An awkward sparkling wine whose raw cider and grapefruit flavors outweigh the fine effervescence. 134 cases made.

name: Brut Southeastern New England Cuvée RJR
review: If the flavors were as refined as the creamy texture, this would be quite nice, but the fruit is tired and cidery. 737 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Southeastern New England
review: Not much aroma, flabby up front, then some shrill, lemony notes take over on the finish. 3,500 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Southeastern New England
review: Tart, with green apple and tealike flavors. 547 cases made.

name: Signature Reserve North Fork of Long Island
review: A cloying red wine, with an overt green bell pepper flavor to it. 536 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Southeastern New England
review: Flat and uninspiring; like biting into an overripe apple. 846 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Reserve
review: Bright and breathtakingly pure in flavor, with marvelously focused berry and cherry flavors on a crisp, firm frame. The flavors last and last, even if they get a little peppery on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 175 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Reserve
review: Bright in flavor, elegant in structure, with juicy apple and pear flavors up front, weaving in nice spice and mineral notes as the flavors echo. Drink now through 2003. 263 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Croft Vineyard Reserve
review: Light and appealing, with earthy black cherry flavors that float easily over the solid finish. Drink now through 2003. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Temperance Hill Vineyard
review: Light and jazzy, with stawberry jam and raspberry flavors shaded with a vegetal undertone. Finish is firm. Best from 2003 through 2006. 203 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Light and crisp, with modest melon and citrus flavors. Drink now. 999 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Melrose Vineyard
review: Light and appealing for its pretty cherry and spice flavors on a polished frame. Drink now. 324 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light, fruity and appealing for its bright berry and distinctly herbal flavors, including a minty note on the finish. Drink now through 2002. 650 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Abbey Ridge Vineyard
review: Very light in color and flavor, with a polished texture supporting pretty raspberry and sassafras flavors. Drink now. 175 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Reserve
review: Tight, tough, tart and tannic, it's not charming but has some solid flavor to it. Try in 1999. 198 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Reserve
review: Light and earthy, with floral and apple flavors that finish with a rough edge. Drink now through 2001. 200 cases made.

name: Troublemaker Blend 1 Paso Robl
review: Offers spicy wild berry, raspberry, black cherry, tobacco and cedar flavors. Full-bodied, ending with a complex finish. Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Drink now through 2015. 4,000 cases made.

name: Annadel Gap Vineyard Sonoma Valley
review: A floral note gives way to ripe peach and nectarine flavors in this round and lush version, with a fleshy texture and a juicy finish. Dried mango and orange zest accents add aromatic intensity. Roussanne, Viognier and Chardonnay. Drink now. 102 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Sangiacomo Vineyard Roberts Road
review: A zesty expression of citrus, green apple, pear and spice flavors, with light oak in the background. Gains depth and dimension while retaining a fresh, crisp presence. Drink now through 2021. 289 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma County Annadel Gap Vineyard
review: Jazzy oak adds to the aroma and texture, with smoky toasty notes. The core berry flavors are trim and focused, with good persistence. Drink now through 2022. 1,150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Valley Rosé Annadel Gap Vineyard
review: Lively and easygoing, with appealing watermelon and strawberry flavors. Drink now. 102 cases made.

name: Legend Proprietary Red Sonoma County
review: Lean and rather taut, with modest raspberry, dried sage and spice flavors, finishing with grippy tannins. Syrah, Grenache, Mourvèdre, Zinfandel and Tannat. Best after 2018. 1,560 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Valley Annadel Gap Vineyard
review: Trim and narrowly focused, with modest notes of raspberry, crushed stone and herb. Drink now through 2026. 550 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California
review: A good value in Pinot Noir, this is lightly fruity, with herb, cherry and cola flavors that linger on the palate. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley Haynes Vineyard Reserve
review: The menthol notes stick out, but this is an enjoyable Pinot Noir, with decent black cherry and spice notes. Tannic enough to drink now or cellar. 440 cases made.

name: Barbera El Dorado Ritchie Vineyard
review: Very light in color and flavor, with appealing strawberry, watermelon and spice aromas and flavors. Best slightly chilled. Drinkable now. 300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay El Dorado
review: A bit heavy-handed with the oak, but still manages to hang in balance. Offers plenty of pine and spice notes, with ripe pear and melon nuances. Drink now. 950 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California
review: Only a faint hint of Pinot Noir character is evident in the plummy flavor. An otherwise simple, decent red table wine. 450 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California
review: Light and floral, with modest hints of rhubarb, strawberry, rose and green leaf aromas and flavors. Finishes simple. Drinkable now. 700 cases made.

name: Benjamin's Cuvee Sierra De Montserrat Vineyard Placer County
review: Easy-drinking, with a mix of crushed rock and dried berry that ends simply. Syrah, Barbera, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 230 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles
review: Ripe and jammy, with cinnamon and raspberry aromas and zesty flavors of caramel, spice and toasted herb. Drink now through 2019. 189 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Paso Robles
review: Streamlined, with fine intensity to currant, black cherry and hazelnut flavors. Vibrant, refreshing tannins and cedary oak linger on the harmonious finish. Drink now through 2009. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Paso Robles
review: Distinctively herbal, with sage and bell pepper notes to the currant and wild berry flavors. Touches of leather and spice appear on the finish. Plush tannins. Drink now through 2022. 900 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Elgin
review: Dark, but silky and fresh, featuring delicious crushed cherry and plum fruit laced with spice and tea notes. The perfumy finish has good latent acidity to stretch it out. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Coastal Region
review: A forward, slightly riper style, with grapefruit pulp and lemon verbena notes that fade a touch on the loose-knit finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Walker Bay
review: Mature, with graham, heather honey and light browned butter notes leading the way for soft fig and pear flavors. Hanging on, but pushing it, as the finish turns a touch blowsy. Past its prime. 10,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino Flagship
review: The ripe, juicy plum and black cherry flavors are focused and lively. Firm tannins and good length on the finish. 443 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino Flagship
review: Sleek and elegant, displaying a pretty core of spice, earth, oak and raspberry flavors that are complex and concentrated. Finishes with a smooth texture and fine length. Delicious now through 1997. 275 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino Flagship
review: Light and appealing, with light raspberry and wild berry aromas and flavors that persist into a lively finish. Has a refreshing purity about it that comes through from start to finish. Drinkable now. 243 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino
review: Firmly tannic, with a supple wild berry and blueberry flavor profile that's pleasing. Drinkable now. 1,251 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino
review: Displays an intriguing array of wild raspberry and blueberry flavors that are firm and tight and tannins that grip on the finish. The oak notes turn gamy on the finish, but altogether it's a solid effort. Drink after 1995. 975 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino
review: A crisp, light, polished wine, with a nice thread of mature spice and berry flavors. Pleasant to drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino
review: Tannic in texture, but light in flavor, with slightly earthy overtones to the modest berry flavors and nice oak notes weaving into the finish. 800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Rogue Valley
review: Light in texture, a deft style that emphasizes steely apple and peach flavors, with leesy overtones to the finish. Drink now through 2011. 420 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah Columbia Valley
review: Exuberant in flavor, this is juicy with black currant, blueberry and licorice flavors that persist against crisp tannins. Best from 2010 through 2015. 1,300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Ripe, lush and spicy, with a rich core of pear, peach and nectarine flavors kept alive by crisp acidity. Has a smooth, creamy texture and a long, full, lingering aftertaste. Drink now. 3,470 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Rich, concentrated and silky, with a solid core of ripe, concentrated pear, apple, honey and spice notes that are tight and well focused. Riper and bolder than most '89s; a fine value. Drink now. 9,700 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Intense without being showy, good candidate to cellar until 1991. Has crisp, clean apple flavors, chewy concentration and a lasting aftertaste. Slightly earthy aromas add complexity.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Complex and flavorful, with toasty, buttery oak overshadowing the spicy pear flavor underneath; it's rich and focused and the flavors linger. Ready now. 5,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Well oaked and polished, with attractive cherry, wild berry and plum flavors that gain complexity and finesse through the finish. Drinkable now, even with the tannins. 2,500 cases made.

name: Fumé Blanc Sonoma County
review: Smooth and distinctly herbal, adding in minty notes that carry through the finish against a citrus-and-pear background. Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Chenin Blanc. 2,600 cases made.

name: Malbec California
review: A tightly wound wine, with charred, herbal, plum and spice flavors. A bit on the lean side, yet with punch. It's screaming for a rare steak. 450 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: Crisp in style, with zingy acidity and decent currant and black cherry flavors that linger on the finish. 375 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Fresh and lively, with ripe, rich melon, pineapple and apple-tinged fruit flavors that offer good depth and intensity, finishing with a touch of vanilla and pear. A balanced and flavorful wine. Better than an earlier bottle.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley
review: Despite hard-edged tannins, pretty plum, chocolate and currant flavors come through. Drink now. 1,440 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley Norse Vineyard Reserve
review: Firm and compact, with medium-weight spice, vanilla and black cherry flavors that linger on the finish. Drinkable now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Good intensity and depth for the vintage, with a complex core of honey, pear, vanilla and spice, turning elegant on the finsh. 6,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley
review: Here's a tart, firm, medium-weight Cabernet with good raspberry and cherry flavors. Not rich or generous, but satisfying in a lean style and well balanced. Drink now. 1,450 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley
review: Very complete and elegant, but the heavy oak tends to dominate the cherry and currant flavors. Not a wine for long-term aging. Drink now. 3,045 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley Norse Vineyard Private Reserve
review: Firm, tight and tannic, with a solid core of currant, chocolate and coffee flavor that is intense and concentrated. Tastes tart and acidic on the finish. Hold until 1993 to '95 before drinking. 925 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Light and elegant, with pear, citrus and oak flavors that are well proportioned, but thin out on the finish, where the oak dominates and earthy flavors show. Drink now. 4,900 cases made.

name: RS Reserve California
review: Full-bodied and moderately tannic. Pepper and spice notes accent the rich core of fruit flavors in this firm, rugged style. Plum and cherry aromas linger on the finish. Drink now. 2,775 cases made.

name: Viognier California
review: Marked by spicy notes, this serves up a modest band of pear and peach flavors but turns simple on the finish. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley
review: Light and fairly fruity, with berry aromas and modest tannins. Tastes almost sweet, with an unusual honeyed characteristic. Drink now. 3,795 cases made.

name: Fumé Blanc Dry Creek Valley
review: Crisp and focused, with more green apple and spice flavors than varietal herbalness, finishing with more almond than anything else. A pleasant wine that's simple and drinkable. Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon. 2,770 cases made.

name: Merlot Vin de Pays d'Oc
review: Robust and fruity, with pepper, plum and currant flavors. Has a nice, gamelike note woven into its moderate structure. A blend of French and California grapes, made by a California winery. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese California
review: Pale in color, pallid in flavor, vaguely cherryish. 450 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Simple and correct Zinfandel that offers modest fruit, but it could use a little more zest and concentration, and the flavors could be a little brighter.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Abundant, crisp fruit flavors fill this medium-bodied, slightly underdeveloped Chardonnay. Young, well-made and straightforward.

name: Merlot Dry Creek Valley
review: Tries to be ripe and broad, but comes a little off balance, citrusy at the center and chewy at the edges. Best from 1997. 1,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel California
review: Rather ordinary, with light notes of meat and cherry that are thin and watery. 4,000 cases made.

name: RS Reserve California
review: Lean and tart, with a firm backbone of acidity and tannin that makes it seem austere rather than generous. 3,400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc California
review: Herbal, oaky and banal. Finishes with a cloying quality. This producer's Malbec is much better. 475 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley
review: Plenty of tannins in this black cherry and tobacco-flavored wine. Try it now.

name: Quintet California
review: Medium-bodied, peppery in aroma, light in flavor and plenty mature now, this red wine has simple carrot and berry flavors. 2,560 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley
review: Smells extremely smoky and weedy, but there's some currant and vanilla on the palate. Medium-bodied and tannic, balanced and smooth.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley Norse Vineyard Private Reserve
review: Rich and full bodied with decidedly herbal and vegetal flavors that miss the mark. Very dry and tannic on the finnish.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Jon Boat
review: Deliciously rich and creamy, both in flavor and texture, with tiers of ripe fig, honeydew, apricot and lightly smoky, toasty oak. This keeps opening flavor doors on the long, satisfying finish. Drink now. 581 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Pleasant Hill Vineyard
review: Engagingly complex and distinctive, this features a tidy core of rich, layered flavors woven with ripe plum, black cherry, blackberry and floral scents. Most alluring is the long, detailed finish that keeps revealing subtle flavor nuances. Drink now through 2021. 122 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Pleasant Hill Vineyard
review: A rich, deeply fruited style, with a firm core of black cherry, wild berry, currant and raspberry flavors. Powerful and graceful, unfolding with touches of loamy earth, cedary oak and anise. Drink now. 725 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Walala Vineyard
review: Balances oak and rich fruit, with ample plum, blueberry and blackberry flavors supported by smoky, toasty oak. A compelling mix of fruit and wood, presented in a graceful style. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Phoenix Ranch Vineyard
review: A rich, gusty expression of Syrah, with bells, whistles and chewy tannins. The core flavors of dark berry, pepper, leather, espresso and mocha smooth out on the finish. Should only get better with time. Best from 2015 through 2026. 158 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros El Pajaro
review: Luscious, with spice, floral, lemon zest and toast details to the delicate pear, peach and nectarine notes. A bright acidity gives this a refreshing finish. Drink now through 2018. 250 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Pleasant Hill Vineyard
review: Tight and firm, with spicy cola, fresh earth, mineral and dried berry fruit that's compact and concentrated, fanning out nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Dark-colored, with a core of rich, well-centered plum, blackberry and wild berry flavors, accented by floral scents and ending with an intense mix of focused red and dark fruits. Drink now through 2023. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Jon Boat
review: Rich and intense, with firm dark berry, cedar, loamy earth and crushed rock notes, graced by touches of perfumed plum, raspberry, blackberry and cherry that give this a supple, gentle edge. Drink now through 2024. 675 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Phoenix Ranch Vineyard
review: Dense and chewy, this is tightly wound, with rich dried currant, mineral, graphite and pepper flavors. Full-bodied and concentrated. The core flavors are intense and persistent, with a long, juicy finish. Best from 2010 through 2017. 250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Jon Boat
review: Smooth, rich and creamy, with rich vanilla and spicy pear flavors. Easy to enjoy, long and persistent on the finish. Drink now. 508 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Pleasant Hill Vineyard
review: Fresh and lively, with aromas of lavender, violet and wilted rose, this gains a pleasing mix of earth-laced raspberry and blackberry flavors, persisting on the long, complex finish. Drink now through 2021. 585 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Coast Guidici Family Vineyard
review: Enticing wild berry, plum, spice and pepper turn more austere on the finish. Vibrant and concentrated, this finishes with a persistent mix of complex flavors and firm tannins. Drink now through 2011. 200 cases made.

name: Viognier Russian River Valley Catie's Corner Vineyard
review: Elegant, with honey and floral overtones to the peach and pear flavors. A supple texture and a refreshing edge of acidity complements the details of spice, mineral and citrus zest that echo on the long finish. Drink now. 240 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Bella Vigna Vineyard
review: A classy effort, sleek, tight and focused, with a trim beam of spice, pepper, wild berry and dried herb. This is refreshingly lively and spicy, ending with a long, detailed finish. Drink now through 2020. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Jon Boat
review: Generous and graceful notes of ripe plum and black cherry are woven into a fabric of crushed rock and gravel, giving this a distinctive flinty edge. Drink now through 2020. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Jon Boat
review: Appealing and graceful, this smooth, supple offering shows pleasant ripe plum, wild berry and black cherry fruit that's delicate and well-integrated, ending with firm, ripe tannins. Drink now through 2018. 580 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Taylor's Folly
review: The upfront rich, savory, cola-laced raspberry and plum notes are appealing, shaded by fresh-turned earth and smoky oak elements. Succeeds at every turn, ending with dusty tannins. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Phoenix Ranch Vineyard
review: Dense and tightly wound, with blackberry and licorice aromas and taut flavors of currant, flint and black olive. Tannins tighten the finish. Best from 2018 through 2023. 300 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Phoenix Ranch Vineyard
review: Intense, with focused flavors of game, spice, dried currant and berry. Dense and concentrated, this is built for short-term cellaring. Proves most interesting on the finish, where the spice and berry accents remain fresh and lively. Drink now through 2021. 176 cases made.

name: Viognier Russian River Valley Catie's Corner Vineyard
review: Highlighted by a floral honeysuckle note, this is spicy and toasty, with a touch of vanilla bean to the peach and melon flavors at the core. Impressive for the suppleness and juicy finish. Drink now. 490 cases made.

name: Viognier Russian River Valley Catie's Corner Vineyard
review: Rich and smooth, with a juicy edge to the tropical notes of mango, melon and papaya, gaining extra dimension from the details of roasted nut, floral, toasted coconut and spice. Harmonious on the long finish. Drink now. 162 cases made.

name: Viognier Russian River Valley Catie's Corner Vineyard
review: A refined, nuanced wine, offering plenty of ripe pear and fig flavors and spicy tobacco, fennel and floral notes. Very lush and richly textured, with a good backbone of acidity to keep the details gliding along. Drink now through 2014. 200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Jon Boat
review: Intense and full-bodied, with a dense core of green apple, tropical fruit and cedary oak. Reveals a twinge of bitterness and ends with a raw texture. Should improve with time. Drink now through 2020. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Pleasant Hill Vineyard
review: The aromas of black licorice, blackberry, savory herb and loamy earth are supported by a firm if gritty texture. This is long and persistent on the finish, and a good bet to benefit from cellar time. Drink now through 2022. 450 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Pleasant Hill Vineyard
review: Sleek and elegant, with a pleasant mix of earthy sour black cherry, herb and light cedary oak. Ends with a pretty beam of fruit, lively acidity and firm tannins. Drink now through 2011. 220 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Bella Vigna Vineyard
review: Tightly wound, intense and concentrated, with herb, smoky oak, cola, dried berry and sage flavors that are rich and focused, with lots of spice and a rich, full-bodied texture. Drink now through 2008. 42 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Jon Boat
review: Focused on a rich core of loamy earth and berry, giving this a distinctive edge. Ends with a solid dose of cedary oak. Drink now through 2023. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros El Pájaro
review: Presents an appealing mix of subtle hazelnut, melon, fig and apricot flavors, ending with a complex, layered finish. Drink now. 121 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Jon Boat
review: Smoky, toasty, herb-laced oak is at the center of flavor, texture and tannins here, making this a murky presentation where wood trumps fruit. Drink now. 1,700 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Terra De Promissio
review: A bit skinny in the midpalate, leaving the dusty, savory wild berry and floral scents on their own in the middle, where they count. Drink now. 260 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Phoenix Ranch Vineyard
review: Tart berry, pepper and roasted herb form the core flavors in this tightly bound wine. Medium- to full-bodied and firmly tannic. Needs aeration. Best from 2012 through 2018. 250 cases made.

name: Viognier Russian River Valley Catie's Corner Vineyard
review: Perfumed citrus and peach flavors have an appealing whiff of petrol, with mineral and spice accents. This is slightly rich, showing focus and intensity. Drink now. 175 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Pleasant Hill Vineyard
review: Marked by savory dried berry, mineral and loamy earth notes, this is full-bodied and well-made, but comes up short on flair and is a bit flat. Drink now through 2016. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Bella Vigna Vineyard
review: A trim, earthy style, featuring fresh earth and clay notes. Modest dried berry flavors are full-bodied and balanced, but this comes up short on flavor and depth. Drink now through 2017. 300 cases made.

name: Viognier Russian River Valley Catie's Corner Vineyard
review: Extremely tangy, with peach and apricot flavors set on a light, crisp body, with floral and lemongrass aromatics. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hirsch Vineyard
review: Smoky, charred oak overrides the dried cherry fruit. 75 cases made.

name: Viognier Russian River Valley Catie's Corner Vineyard
review: Unpleasantly bitter, with pithy citrus, cedar, white pepper and coarse pear flavors. 175 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hirsch Vineyard
review: Despite some pleasant floral cherry aromas, it turns thin and sour, ending on a bitter note. 185 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Yakima Valley
review: Crisp and lively, with silky smooth, mocha-scented raspberry and blackberry flavors that last on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: Offers a range of pretty raspberry, cinnamon and vanilla flavors that glide smoothly across the firmly textured frame. Best from 1999. 75 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley
review: Smooth and polished, with spicy, tomato-accented berry flavors that linger on the lively finish. Drink now through 2009. 202 cases made.

name: Madeleine Angevine Puget Sound
review: A sturdy wine with soft edges and appealing pear flavors. Has a touch of violet to its character. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Lemberger Yakima Valley
review: Light and tart, with modest vinous flavors. Ready now. 270 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: Earthy, with a sharp edge to the berry flavors, a touch of astringency on the otherwise juicy finish. 220 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville
review: This serves up a complex medley of ripe plum, blackberry and cola notes. Excellent balance, depth and concentration, with a long, intricate finish that shows off a touch of cedary oak. Drink now through 2012. 1,489 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville Reserve
review: Deep, rich and concentrated, with a center of currant, anise and herb with spice, mint and juniper notes. A bit raw and tannic, but not out of line for a young wine. Finishes with a burst of fruit. Drink now through 2011. 1,490 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District
review: Austere and clipped, with dry leathery tannins holding the upper hand over an earthy currant and mineral core of flavors. Drink now. 1,700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Harmonious, spicy and elegant, wrapping its spicy, cedary plum and black cherry flavors gently around supple, fine tannins. Appealing to drink now, but could improve through 1999. 543 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Rich and round, a generous portion of pear, citrus and spice aromas and flavors that remain lively through the long finish, folding in a lovely note of honey. Drink now through 2005. 1,551 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Crisp and lively, with black cherry, plum and smoky black pepper flavors, finishing with a touch of sweet oak. Drink now through 2006. 3,600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley
review: Ripe and rich, showing smoothly integrated pineapple and citrus flavors with a buttery accent. Hazelnut and spice flavors haunt the long finish. Best after 1996. 995 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley
review: Smooth and rich, sporting a distinct black pepper and dusky spice undertone to the buttery pear flavors. Drink now. 576 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Firm structure, fine texture, solidly filled with ripe berry and currant fruit. Finishes with a peppery note as the flavors linger. Drink now through 2005. 4,003 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Ripe and polished. Distinctive for its pure currant and black cherry flavors delicately shaded with herb and spice. Refined tannins could use cellaring. Best from 2001 through 2005. 2,900 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Ripe and generous, with a zingy streak of acidity running through the sweet black cherry, plum and exotic spice flavors. Finishes with firm tannins. Best from 1998. 1,332 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley
review: Round and generous, a lively mouthful of raspberry, cherry and tobacco aromas and flavors laced with juicy, citrusy acidity to balance the firm finish. Needs time. Best from 2004 through 2006. 1,706 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley
review: Ripe, supple and spicy, balancing its berry, plum and red pepper flavors on fine-grained tannins and an open texture that invites many sips. Drink now through 2004. 1,000 cases made.

name: Viognier Yakima Valley
review: Ripe and round, distinctive for the orange blossom note floating around the pineapple, pear and orange flavors. Has richness without weight, and a long finish. Drink now through 2005. 700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Yakima Valley
review: Lean, firm and appealing for its juicy blackberry flavors, which echo on the slightly green finish. Drink now through 2006. 355 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Light and silky. A wine of lovely texture and delicately etched currant, blueberry and spicy vanilla notes. Appealing now, best from 1999. 1,330 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: A solid Syrah, packed with pretty berry and plum flavor, which rides over and past the firm tannins that assemble around the finish. Feels like it has plenty of room to grow. Drink now through 2007. 821 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: Ripe and generous, with lots of red plum, black cherry and tar flavors that finish bright and with plenty of richness. Drink now through 2001. 642 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley
review: Supple and generous, with blueberry, plum and vanilla flavors that linger on the reasonably plump finish. Drink now through 2006. 2,012 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Firm and ripe, with a peppery edge to the black cherry, blackberry and currant at the core. Needs to sort out the firm tannins. Best after 2000. 1,053 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: Lean, firm and juicy, packing its berry and herbal flavors into a narrow beam that gets a little tannic on the finish. 762 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Bright and jazzy, with nice apple and citrus fruit shaded with gently spicy oak. Drink now through 2004. 2,162 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley
review: Ripe, round and a little grassy at the edge, an earthy white that unfolds some nice nectarine and apple flavor on a smooth frame. Drinkable now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Broad and velvety, focusing its blackberry and toasty chocolate flavors. Drinkable now. 800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Yakima Valley
review: Bright, tangy and generous with its lemon, herb and pepper flavors. Just the thing for a grilled chicken sandwich. Drink now. 939 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and vital, with bright blackberry and floral flavors that point into a juicy finish. Drink now through 2015. 950 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley
review: A solid red with rich texture, solid blackberry and mineral flavors and a soft-grained finish. Best from 1998 or 1999. 388 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and lively, with apple, spice and earth flavors in equal measure that linger gently on the finish. Drink now. 1,551 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: On the light side, with dark flavors on a soft frame, featuring modest black currant and berry notes and dusky herbs on the firm finish. Best after 2002. 2,400 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Smooth and polished, this is appealing for its soft, spicy currant and berry flavors that linger on the gentle finish. Drink now through 2002. 2,296 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Rich in texture, a gamy edge adding character to the minty prune and spice flavors. Drink now through 2008. 1,979 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Yakima Valley
review: Firm in texture, with pear eau-de-vie aromas and pretty fig and peppery cream flavors. Drink now. 840 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, with modest cherry and smoke flavors on a medium frame. Balanced, but not showing a lot of concentration. Drink now through 2003. 1,053 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: This crisp-style Cabernet shows a distinct personality, picking up a gamy, animal edge, finishing with modest intensity. Best from 1999 through 2002. 1,330 cases made.

name: Lemberger Columbia Valley
review: Light, crisp and peppery, with a bright streak of blackberry flavor. Finishes with a racy acidity. Drink soon. 254 cases made.

name: Lemberger Yakima Valley
review: Light and fresh, with pretty strawberry flavors that linger on the smooth finish. Drink now. 538 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Yakima Valley
review: Firm in texture, with earthy, slightly muddy flavors peeking through the modest cherry and herb notes at the core. Drink now. 390 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Yakima Valley
review: Light, with dark fruit flavors in modest proportions. Drink now. 432 cases made.

name: Viognier Yakima Valley
review: Broad and odd, with smoky, spicy overtones to the orange peel and pear flavors, finishing with a touch of pepper. Drink now. 854 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Yakima Valley
review: Light and spicy, a creamy-textured Sauvignon Blanc with low-level pear and vanilla flavors at the finish. 1,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Tangy, strongly herbal. Drink now through 2005. 3,315 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Soft and flabby, with modest pear and white pepper flavors. Drink now. 2,082 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Earthy, stalky flavors sneak into the mix of pear and spice to make this an unusual, if not especially charming, Chardonnay. 2,027 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Has a sour edge that makes it less than enticing.   2,500 cases made.

name: Viognier Yakima Valley
review: Light, flat, innocuous.   1,195 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Maritime Vineyard
review: A gorgeous wine, rich, smooth and seamless, with layers of complex creamy cherry, wild berry and plum shaded by mocha-laced oak that is neatly integrated. The tannins are ripe and supple, the aftertaste fascinating. Drink now through 2010. 545 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hellenthal Vineyard
review: Hints of cedar and sandalwood in the aroma lead to a firm, tightly wound, richly flavored and notably complex wine. The core flavors are built around ripe cherry, plum and raspberry, and they're elegantly styled, ending with a pretty dash of vanilla-tinged oak. Drink now through 2009. 291 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Marimar Estate Vineyard
review: Well-crafted, deep, intense and layered, with tiers of mocha-laced blueberry, raspberry, licorice and subtle nutmeg notes that retain a delicate mouthfeel on the long, sustained finish. Drink now through 2023. 190 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Marimar Estate Vineyard
review: Offers wonderful earthy complexity, with pretty toasty oak, dried currant and black cherry fruit that's supple, elegant, well-proportioned and full-bodied, ending with a long, layered finish. Drink now through 2014. 286 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Maritime Vineyard
review: Delightfully rich and complex, with wonderful intensity to the vivid, savory black cherry, wild berry, fresh earth and anise notes. Tightly wound, it gains momentum on the finish, keeping a tight focus on the fruit flavors. Best from 2008 through 2012. 539 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hellenthal Vineyard
review: A tremendous effort. Smooth, ripe, rich and flavorful, with a supple, elegant core of ripe cherry, plum, wild berry and nutmeg flavors, finishing with a cola and chocolate aftertaste.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Fresh and vibrant, with delicate, vivid cranberry, black cherry and raspberry fruit that's lively and complex, ending with a refreshing aftertaste. Drink now through 2011. 1,100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hellenthal Vineyard
review: A very impressive '98. Rich, earthy and pleasantly decadent, with lots of plum, black cherry, anise, leather, mineral and sage unfolding on the long, rich, complex aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 488 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hellenthal Vineyard Young Vines
review: Big, bold, ripe and complex, featuring tiers of ripe cherry, plum and wild berry, shaded by pretty, toasty oak and mineral flavors that come through on the finish. Has a measure of finesse and grace. 180 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain Reserve
review: A big, rich, sturdy style, packed with gravelly dark berry, graphite and crushed rock flavors, showing assertive, herb-laced tannins. This gains depth and a shade of complexity from new wood seasoning. Drink now. 249 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Well-oaked, with mocha and toasty oak flavors competing with ripe, rich, vivid wild cherry, finishing with a flash of oak but also rich, vivid fruit flavors. Drink now through 2009. 427 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Maritime
review: This charming, delicate Pinot offers savory, dried herb and forest floor notes, with black tea, mint and blackberry flavors slowly unwinding. Gets more interesting by the moment. Drink now through 2023. 382 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Maritime Vineyard
review: Aromas of ripe plum, blackberry, cedar and spice turn elegant and supple on the palate, with smooth tannins and good length. Turns delicate, with excellent balance. Drink now through 2010. 420 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Maritime Vineyard
review: Lots of enticing aromas of blackberry, raspberry and wild berry, with pretty floral scents. It tastes ripe and rich, with a vibrant backbone of acidity and firm, integrated tannins. Drink now through 2009. 480 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain Purple Label Piedra Hill Vineyard
review: A big, rich, chewy style, featuring a beam of cherry, blackberry and plum fruit, imparting good lift midpalate on. Tight and backward, this may always be on the woody side, but there's plenty to admire and look forward to. Drink now through 2025. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain Purple Label Piedra Hill Vineyard
review: Firm and spicy, this is full-bodied, supple and trim, with dried currant, sage and herbal scents. It's easy to approach for a young wine, with gentle tannins. Drink now through 2015. 416 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Ripe and zesty, with a tasty range of wild berry and blackberry fruit that's well-defined. Turns elegant and supple on the palate, with enough tannin to merit short-term cellaring. Drink now through 2008. 1,467 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hellenthal Vineyard
review: The aromas of mocha, dark berry, cola, black tea, anise and dried herb fan out pleasantly. Intense, focused, persistent and lingering on the finish, this ends slightly raw. Drink now through 2023. 241 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Maritime
review: This greets with spicy, toasty oak aromas, then folds in spicy black cherry, mineral and cedar notes. Elegant and medium-bodied, with a complex touch of graphite and anise. Drink now through 2014. 740 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain Bronze Label Piedra Hill Vineyard
review: Intense, with a core of dark berry, mocha, dried herb and dill, ending with a long, savory aftertaste. Intense and less oaky than the Purple Label bottling. Drink now through 2025. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain Piedra Hill Vineyard
review: Vivid, zesty ripe blackberry and raspberry fruit has a touch of mineral and anise. Full-bodied and racy, with a nice balance and a Zin-like berry flavor that's distinctive. Drink now through 2015. 421 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain Piedra Hill Vineyard Purple Label
review: An herbal style that shows off green and black olive flavors, with notes of dried currant, spice, leather and sage. Full-bodied, ending with firm, chewy tannins, yet the flavors hold true. Drink now through 2020. 150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain Purple Label Piedra Hill Vineyard
review: A streak of earthiness runs through this rich, full-bodied wine, with shades of dried currant, leather and underbrush. Best from 2011 through 2016. 196 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Reliant on smoky, toasty oak to extend the flavors, this is supple and easy to enjoy, with tight, firm nuances of sassafras, licorice and wild berry. Drink now. 1,056 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Exhibits fragrant floral and earthy aromas, with dried black cherry and plum notes that are medium-weight, supple and spicy, ending with a nice touch of anise. Drink now through 2013. 1,566 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hellenthal Vineyard
review: Smooth and polished, with a core of racy wild berry, cherry candy, plum and blackberry fruit, with floral-mushroomy aromas that build to a delicious aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 575 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hellenthal Vineyard
review: Black cherry and cedary, toasty oak aromas lead to an intense, well-concentrated, firmly structured wine, supported by lively acidity and firm tannins. The core of plum and black cherry shows depth and concentration. Needs a little time. Best from 2003 through 2007. 539 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Marimar Estate Vineyard
review: Elegant and spicy, with loamy earth, dried berry, floral and spicy sage notes. Balanced and moderately rich, with medium depth and good length. Drink now through 2012. 460 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Maritime
review: Dry and savory, this is slow to build its flavors, which are fresh and vibrant, with dried berry, currant and mineral. Medium-bodied, ending with a clean, delicate finish. Best from 2012 through 2020. 494 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Maritime
review: Ripe plum, blackberry and black cherry fruit turns rich, spicy and fleshy. Well-focused, with mineral and anise notes. Drink now through 2012. 710 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain Piedra Hill Vineyard
review: Rustic and earthy, a sturdy effort marked by dried berry, mineral, cedar and tobacco notes on the palate, where this is chewy and diffuse, losing its focus. Still, a solid bottle of Napa Cabernet from Howell Mountain. Drink now through 2020. 150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain Piedra Hill Vineyard
review: Firm, tight and marked by complex loamy earth, plum and dried currant flavors that pick up tobacco and espresso notes. Drink now through 2015. 196 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: This tight and tannic version offers spice and floral aromatics, with dried berry and earth flavors. Best from 2014 through 2021. 470 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Fragrant, delicate and spicy, with strawberry and delicate cherry fruit that's medium-bodied, ending with subtle flavors and finesse. Drink now through 2013. 2,458 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Rich and grapey, with vivid blackberry and wild berry flavors that are intense and concentrated, finishing with integrated tannins and a plush fruity aftertaste. Drink now through 2009. 1,360 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Ripe and aromatically complex, with juicy red cherry, plum and anise flavors that pick up touches of rhubarb and earth on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 235 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hellenthal Vineyard
review: Wild berry, smoke, dried herb and savory underbrush flavors are at the core. The tannins are mild but evident on the finish, where they're spicy and minerally. Ends stemmy. Drink now. 312 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hellenthal Vineyard
review: Mature in color, but the flavors are ripe and fresh, with zesty cherry and plum notes. Picks up traces of earth and anise on the finish, where the tannins are smooth. 176 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Umino Vineyard
review: Marked by loamy earth, cola, sage and dried berry, this is rich and deep. Yet it's an earthier style than previous vintages, reflective of the cooler year. Drink now through 2011. 330 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hellenthal Vineyard
review: Light-colored, with simple cherry and strawberry flavors that are appealing but lack some richness. Drink now through 2002. 730 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hellenthal Vineyard
review: Firm, with cedary oak flavors overriding the core of herb-laced black cherry and forest floor-type flavors, turning tannic. Drink now through 2002. 493 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Maritime
review: While the core of raspberry and creamy oak is appealing, the grittier, biting tannins are not. Very enjoyable but the dryness of the tannins is a concern. Drink now. 504 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Maritime Bill and Joan's Special Selection
review: A savory mix of cherry and strawberry-rhubarb notes turns simpler midpalate. Retains its focus and should gain after another year. Best from 2012 through 2017. 95 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Umino Vineyard
review: Loamy earth, a touch of leather and dried berry and currant fruit form the core flavors in this full-bodied Pinot, which some will find too earthy. Drink now through 2013. 294 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Light in color and in weight, with herb, cherry, wild berry and simple spicy notes, finishing with tame tannins. Drink now through 2002. 389 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hellenthal Vineyard
review: Focused on a modest, simple mix of ripe strawberry and raspberry flavors. Medium-bodied, fading on the finish. Drink now. 235 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hellenthal Vineyard
review: Loamy earth, dried berry, sage and underbrush give this an earthy personality. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. Drink now through 2012. 267 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hellenthal Vineyard
review: Light in color, with plum and berry notes of modest concentration and complexity. Turns simple on the finish. 550 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Marimar Estate Vineyard
review: Medium-weight, with earthy dried cherry, plum and herbal scents that end up on the simple side. Drink now through 2015. 245 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Maritime
review: Marked by woodsy, herbal and savory berry flavors that are pleasant and earthy, medium-bodied, and ending with a claylike aftertaste. Drink now through 2014. 876 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Umino Vineyard
review: Trim and medium-weight, with modest loamy earth and fresh blueberry fruit that has an herbal edge. Drink now. 246 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Austere, with tar, rose petal and dried berry flavors that are lean and trim. Drink now. 2,430 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Little Billy
review: Light all around--in color, body and depth--with an herbal edge to the cherry and berry notes. Drink now through 2000. 175 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hellenthal Vineyard
review: Shows modest loamy earth, smoke and clay flavors with dried berry notes. Drink now. 242 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Marimar Estate Vineyard
review: Simple cola, sassafras and rhubarb flavors fade on the finish. Drink now. 274 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Light and uncomplicated, with modest tea and wild berry flavors. 450 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Late Harvest Diosa
review: Honey and spice notes cosset dried apricot and pineapple flavors in this unctuous white, which is quite sweet, but with electric acidity that gives it balance. The tangy butterscotch finish brings you back for another sip. Drink now through 2015. 618 cases made.

name: Fatalis Fatum The Hamptons Long Island
review: Crisp and focused, this red offers juicy cherry, pomegranate, floral and light vanilla flavors in a supple texture, backed by light tannins and fresh acidity. Balanced and vibrant. Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2018. 343 cases made.

name: Late Harvest Descencia Long Island
review: Unctuous, with a mix of apricot jam, glazed peach and dried nectarine notes, backed by a maple-tinged finish. This has the zip it needs for support. Riesling and Chardonnay. Drink now through 2020. 264 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island Lambardo
review: Fresh and expressive, this red delivers juicy cherry, cranberry and red plum flavors, with smoke, floral and mineral accents. Light, firm tannins support the polished texture. Balanced and harmonious. Drink now through 2018. 202 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Long Island Cassango
review: Black cherry and plum flavors show good depth in this firm red, supported by chewy tannins and accented by toast and lead pencil notes. Floral and smoke accents linger on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 101 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Late Harvest
review: This white has an appealing sweetness, but it's lighter, crisper and fresher than most dessert wines. It shows pear, coconut and pineapple flavors. Drink now. 353 cases made.

name: Extra Brut Rosé The Hamptons Long Island Noblesse Oblige
review: The pale pink color of this sparkler is delicate and elegant, as are the flavors, with discrete notes of berry, floral, vanilla and smoke. They float in a frothy, evanescent mousse, quickened by crisp acidity. Drink now through 2014. 348 cases made.

name: Merlot Long Island The Grapes of Roth
review: This supple red is maturing nicely, with cherry, espresso, anise and mineral flavors mingling over well-integrated tannins. A bit austere, yet elegant. Drink now through 2008. 200 cases made.

name: Merlot North Fork of Long Island Roanoke Vineyards
review: An alluring note of cedar mingles with ripe plum, dried herb and tobacco notes in this generous red, which has a rich texture, with well-integrated tannins and enough acidity for balance. Drink now through 2014. 150 cases made.

name: Merlot North Fork of Long Island Roanoke Vineyards
review: This smooth, solid red offers plum, menthol, coffee and licorice flavors, with well-integrated tannins and balanced acidity. Stays lively through the tangy finish. Drink now through 2009. 148 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island Premier Cru
review: This red shows fine structure, with ripe, fresh fruit flavors of cherry and plum, backed by firm but well-integrated tannins and a good balance of acidity and oak. It's not a blockbuster, but delivers harmony and character. Drink now through 2008. 141 cases made.

name: Merlot-Cabernet Franc-Cabernet Sauvignon Long Island Fatalis Fatum
review: This supple red delivers focused flavors of black cherry, espresso, coffee and smoke, with light, firm tannins and crisp acidity. Expressive and graceful. Drink now through 2014. 669 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Long Island Landius
review: This expressive red delivers harmonious flavors of tart cherry, light herb, bitter chocolate and spice. Supple, with moderate tannins. The bright acidity keeps this lively and focused. Drink now through 2018. 150 cases made.

name: Rosé Summer in a Bottle Long Island
review: This dry rosé has depth and grip, with cherry, strawberry and refreshing bitter notes that mingle over firm acidity. Well-balanced, showing enough structure for food. Merlot, Chardonnay, Cabernet Franc and Gewürztraminer. Drink now. 5,700 cases made.

name: Trebbiano The Hamptons Long Island
review: This lively, exuberant white shows fruity flavors of quince and pineapple. Bright bright lime and tangerine acidity and a touch of spritz keep this fresh and focused. Drink now. 154 cases made.

name: Trebbiano The Hamptons Long Island
review: This solid white has a dense texture and firm acidity, with flavors of pear, straw and citrus. Fresh and focused, featuring enough weight to match with richer dishes. Drink now through 2016. 238 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Blanc The Hamptons Long Island
review: Pastry dough and baked apple aromas and flavors are generous in this frothy sparkler, while keen acidity keeps this balanced and lively. Well-knit and focused. Drink now. 565 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Long Island Caya
review: This offers a loamy frame around a core of gently steeped cherry and plum fruit notes, steadily giving way to a smoldering tobacco edge on the finish. Solid, fleshy, smoky feel throughout. Drink now through 2017. 588 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc The Hamptons Long Island Caya
review: Smoky, toasty notes frame the cherry and tobacco flavors in this savory red, featuring light, firm tannins and fresh acidity, with accents of black olive and fresh herbs. Drink now through 2017. 346 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Fork of Long Island Roanoke Vineyards
review: This ambitious red is full-bodied, with muscular tannins and plenty of smoky oak. There's a core of ripe plum fruit, accented with mint and tobacco. Drink now through 2009. 97 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Descencia Botrytis
review: Viscous and sweet, this dessert wine shows an amber color, flavors of pumpkin, honey and spice and a vibrant acidity that keeps it lively. Drink now. 99 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Perle
review: Rather broad and creamy in feel, with a toasted hazelnut note leading off, followed by creamed yellow apple and melon flavors. Shows a buttery edge on the finish, though this stays elegant enough. Well done for the style. Drink now. 921 cases made.

name: Fatalis Fatum Long Island
review: This has mellowed already, with gentle mulled spice notes along the edges of macerated plum and black cherry fruit flavors. An ample tobacco leaf accent is well inlaid on the finish. Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2017. 515 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island Christian's Cuvée
review: Singed cedar and coffee notes serve as the frame, while lightly steeped plum and blackberry fruit flavors form the core, melding through the loam-accented finish and picking up a persistent tobacco accent. Drink now through 2017. 273 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island Lambardo
review: This maturing red shows a nice balance of cherry and plum fruit, with notes of tobacco, leather, mint and spice. This has firm, light tannins and a chewy texture, but stays clean on the finish. Drink now through 2013. 401 cases made.

name: Rosé Long Island
review: This firm rosé delivers tangy flavors of berry and kumquat, with notes of spice and fresh herbs. Lively, presenting some depth and grip. Drink now. 17,200 cases made.

name: Rosé Long Island
review: This pretty, pale rosé offers refined flavors of berry, citrus and spice. Crisp and lively, with a floral note on the finish. Merlot, Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 11,710 cases made.

name: Rosé Summer in a Bottle Long Island
review: This pale rosé delivers lively flavors of berry, watermelon and spice, with crisp acidity supporting the light, racy texture. Crisp, focused and refreshing. Drink now. 1,530 cases made.

name: Rosé The Hamptons Long Island
review: This rosé marries a full, smooth texture with delicate, lively flavors. Berry, spice and light herbal notes are carried by fresh acidity, but the finish is smooth and pretty. Merlot, Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 9,416 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Long Island
review: Crisp and focused, this white offers fresh flavors of peach, fresh herbs and flint. A bit shy, but shows some intensity, with mouthwatering acidity and a floral finish. Drink now. 1,134 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Long Island Caya
review: Soft on the edges, though the core of plum and cherry fruit has nice depth. A light tobacco note weaves throughout, giving this some range. Drink now. 487 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Long Island Cassango
review: Black cherry, toast, tobacco and loamy flavors mingle in this firm, crisp red. Presents a supple texture but remains focused through the herbal finish. Drink now through 2017. 146 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Estate Selection
review: This ambitious white shows ripe fruit, concentration and sophisticated oak. It's a bit heavy-handed, but makes an impression. A muscular match with rich foods. Drink now. 454 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Late Harvest
review: Honey and golden raisin flavors shine in this thick, sweet white, while tangerine acidity keeps it balanced. Pretty and juicy. Drink now. 276 cases made.

name: Extra Brut Rosé The Hamptons Long Island Noblesse Oblige
review: The color of this bubbly is more copper-gold than rose, and the flavors taste more like an old white than the red fruits typical of rosé. But the toast, hazelnut and smoke flavors have appeal, and the mousse is fine. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Extra Brut Rosé The Hamptons Long Island Noblesse Oblige
review: This austere sparkler offers firm acidity and a bracing mousse. This is quite refreshing, but notes of cherry and pomegranate sneak into the finish, bringing you back for another sip. Drink now. 417 cases made.

name: Fatalis Fatum The Hamptons Long Island
review: Black cherry, dark chocolate and light herbal notes mingle in this medium-bodied red. Fresh and supple, featuring modest tannins and good acidity. Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Barbera. Drink now through 2012. 589 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island Christian's Cuvée
review: Smoky, toasty notes frame black cherry and loamy flavors in this snappy red. Light, firm tannins and crisp acidity impart structure, while spice and floral accents linger on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 154 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island Premier Cru
review: This balanced red is supple, but with some intensity. Black cherry, cedar, spice and tobacco flavors mingle over light, well-integrated tannins, and the finish is spicy and clean. Drink now through 2007. 158 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Long Island
review: Fragrant with pear, peach and chamomile, this gentle white follows through with a soft texture and round flavors of pear, lanolin and white tea. It has just enough acidity for balance. Drink now. 430 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Long Island
review: This has the bracing crispness of an Italian Pinot Grigio, with grapefruit, herbal and mineral notes. A hint of spritz adds life. Drink now. 253 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Long Island Landius
review: This offers a mix of sassafras, licorice root, mulled cherry and well-singed cinnamon notes, with the cinnamon hanging through the finish. Good flesh, and a pleasantly smoky, woodsy feel throughout. Drink now. 215 cases made.

name: Rosé Grandioso Long Island
review: Crisp and clean, this racy rosé offers quince, kumquat and spice flavors, supported by tangy acidity. Focused and refreshing. Drink now. 606 cases made.

name: Rosé The Hamptons Long Island
review: This pale, snappy rosé is crisp and bone dry, with bright berry and light herbal flavors and a clean, lively finish. A mouthwatering aperitif. Merlot, Chardonnary, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 4,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Long Island
review: This crisp white rides vibrant acidity and a touch of spritz, offering modest apple, grassy and citrus flavors that are fresh and focused. A bright aperitif. Drink now. 1,025 cases made.

name: Trebbiano The Hamptons Long Island
review: This polished white offers persimmon, lime and grassy flavors in a smooth texture, with a tangy acidity. Drink now. 233 cases made.

name: Brut The Hamptons Long Island Christian Wölffer Cuvée
review: This expressive sparkler shows mature flavors of toast, honey and ripe pear, harmonious and well-integrated, though more exuberant than refined. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc The Hamptons Long Island Caya
review: Black cherry, black raspberry and dark chocolate flavors mingle in this round, soft red. Has some depth and stays fresh. Drink now. 196 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Long Island Claletto
review: Inky in color and syrupy in texture, this red is thick and heavy, with black currant, raisin, sanguine and espresso flavors. More like Sherry than table wine, but there's impressive concentration.  Drink now through 2010. 118 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Fork of Long Island Roanoke Vineyards
review: Bright and fresh, with black cherry, plum, licorice and coffee flavors. Medium-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and lively acidity. Contains Cabernet Franc and Merlot as well. Drink now through 2012. 175 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Perle
review: This has a buttery note draped over a rounded core of creamed melon and pear fruit flavors, ending with a slightly languid feel. The butter wins out in the end, but this will have fans for the easy appeal. Drink now. 786 cases made.

name: Fatalis Fatum Long Island
review: Cherry and bitter plum fruit is lined with singed cedar and tobacco notes. The direct finish lets the cedar edge linger longest. Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Drink now. 463 cases made.

name: Late Harvest Laica The Hamptons Long Island
review: This sweet white delivers dried pineapple, vanilla and spice flavors, with a generous texture and enough acidity to stay lively. Vignoles and Riesling. Drink now. 160 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island Estate Selection
review: This gentle red shows a good balance of plum, coffee and light herbal flavors, with well-integrated tannins. Cedar and smoke notes linger on the finish. Drink now. 634 cases made.

name: Riesling Long Island The Grapes of Roth Virgin Berry
review: Peach, quince and pine notes mingle in this generous white, showing a plush texture and a touch of sweetness balanced by tangy acidity. Drink now. 149 cases made.

name: Roanoke Vineyards Blend One North Fork of Long Island
review: This supple red offers wild berry, sanguine and game flavors that show real personality, with vivid acidity and enough tannin for grip. Expressive. Malbec, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2011. 148 cases made.

name: Rosé Long Island
review: This dry rosé delivers modest strawberry and watermelon flavors, with a touch of herb and smoke. Round on the palate, with just enough acidity for grip. Merlot, Chardonnay, Cabernet Franc, Pinot Noir, Riesling and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 20,200 cases made.

name: Rosé The Hamptons Long Island
review: The subtle pale pink color of this dry rosé gives way to more forthright flavors of berry, grapefruit and mango. A bit thick on the palate, but crackling acidity keeps it refreshing. Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. Drink now. 9,070 cases made.

name: Rosé The Hamptons Long Island
review: Bright and juicy, this dry rosé jumps with berry and lemon-lime flavors. Fresh and lively. Drink now. 2,377 cases made.

name: Rosé The Hamptons Long Island
review: This lively, dry rosé marries firm acidity with a full body, giving it the stuffing for food, along with berry, watermelon and citrus flavors. Drink now.

name: Brut The Hamptons Long Island Christian Wölffer Cuvée
review: This vibrant sparkler shows an exuberant mousse, with crisp citrus and green apple flavors and accents of toast and smoke. Tart; best with food. Drink now through 2008. 335 cases made.

name: Brut The Hamptons Long Island Christian Wölffer Cuvée
review: Delicate and flavorful, this brut offers crisp apple and lemon notes on a lightweight frame. Drink now. 360 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc The Hamptons Long Island
review: Cherry, chocolate, tobacco and spice flavors mingle in this medium-bodied red, with moderate tannins that support a syrupy texture. The finish is slightly sweet but clean. Drink now. 1,652 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc The Hamptons Long Island
review: Firm and focused, this red offers black cherry fruit framed by plenty of coffee and smoke flavors. Oaky but stays balanced. Drink now through 2010. 711 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Long Island Cassango
review: Good dark cherry and plum fruit flavors are carried by relatively burly tannins, giving this a slightly rugged feel overall. Ample cedar and tobacco notes imbue the finish with a mature edge, but there's enough stuffing here to see if this mellows a bit in the cellar. Drink now through 2017. 289 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Estate Selection
review: This polished white offers mature flavors of baked apple, piecrust and smoke, with accents of ginger and yeast. It still has a firm backbone. Drink now. 668 cases made.

name: Classic White New York
review: This firm white shows apple, smoke and herbal flavors over crisp, citrusy acidity. Tart and refreshing, a bit austere, but well-balanced for food. Chardonnay, Riesling and Gewürztraminer. Drink now. 2,177 cases made.

name: Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon Long Island Claretto
review: A thick, slightly syrupy texture carries the ripe, sweet flavors of blackberry, plum and vanilla, with toasty and meaty accents. This soft red has just enough acidity to stay lively. Distinctive. Drink now. 189 cases made.

name: Riesling Long Island The Grapes of Roth
review: This round white offers juicy peach, guava and lime flavors, softened with a touch of sweetness but showing enough acidity for balance. A refreshing aperitif. Drink now. 467 cases made.

name: Rosé The Hamptons Long Island
review: This pale, dry rosé offers expressive flavors of berry and tangerine enlivened by juicy acidity. Shows a slightly hard-candy character, but this is still refreshing. Merlot, Chardonnay, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 6,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc North Fork of Long Island Roanoke Vineyards
review: Cherry, berry, herb and earth flavors mingle in this soft red. Well-integrated, with just enough acidity to stay lively. Contains 9 percent Cabernet Sauvignon and 3 percent Merlot. Drink now. 148 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc The Hamptons Long Island
review: This supple red shows sweet cherry, herb and tobacco flavors, with light, firm tannins and a crisp edge of acidity. Drink now through 2007. 545 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Long Island Cassango
review: This lean, firm red shows cherry, espresso and char flavors over slightly gritty tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it lively. Drink now through 2010. 13 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Reserve
review: Dried apple, toast and hazelnut flavors are showing maturity, but a tangy acidity keeps this lively, bringing out pineapple fruit on the finish. Drink now. 2,020 cases made.

name: Classic White Long Island
review: The pear and apple flavors show a mellow fruitiness in this round white, with enough sweet-tart acidity to stay lively. A bit candied, but still fresh and clean. Pinot Blanc, Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Riesling. Drink now. 1,485 cases made.

name: Classic White New York
review: This aromatic white is fragrant with peach, lychee and honey, but is less expressive on the palate, showing firm, citrusy acidity and light peach flavors. A nice aperitif. Riesling, Gewürztraminer and Chardonnay. Drink now. 672 cases made.

name: Classic White New York New York
review: This light, crisp white has a steely character, with modest green apple fruit and lively, citrusy acidity. Refreshing and palate-cleansing, this makes a fine match with oysters. Drink now. 2,477 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island
review: This crisp, medium-bodied red offers tart cherry, herbal, smoke and light earth flavors over light, firm tannins. A bit lean, but balanced and refreshing. Drink now. 2,070 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island Reserve
review: This soft red offers gentle black cherry, bitter chocolate and toast flavors that mingle nicely and linger on the finish. Drink now. 1,637 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island Reserve
review: This supple red offers crisp cherry flavors with a light herbal edge and a smoky note from oak. It's balanced and accessible now. Drink now. 1,604 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Long Island
review: This assertive white offers a core of ripe pear fruit with accents of toasted almond and ginger ale. It has enough heft to match with food. Drink now. 135 cases made.

name: Roanoke Vineyards Blend One North Fork of Long Island
review: This red shows some power, with muscular tannins. The flavors lean toward charry oak and herbal notes, with modest plum fruit. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2008.

name: Roanoke Vineyards Blend Two North Fork of Long Island
review: This plush red is dominated by tarry, tobacco oak flavors, with just enough ripe plum fruit for balance. The tannins are firm. Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2008. 100 cases made.

name: Rosé The Hamptons Long Island
review: This dry rosé is a lovely pale pink, light-bodied and crisp, with hints of berry and citrus and a clean, tart finish. Modest but refreshing. Chardonnay, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 4,012 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Blanc The Hamptons Long Island
review: This light-bodied bubbly shows green apple and lime flavors, with notes of honey and spice. Still fresh and quite lively. Drink now. 535 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island La Ferme Martin
review: This full-bodied white shows tart grapefruit and green apple flavors, which jostle with smoky oak. A bit clumsy, but might harmonize with food. Drink now through 2007. 4,725 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Perle
review: Toast and smoke aromas and flavors dominate apple and tobacco flavors in this maturing white. This has a polished texture and firm acidity, with enough structure for food. Drink now. 670 cases made.

name: Roanoke Vineyards Mareo Tulio North Fork of Long Island
review: Cherry, kirsch, herbal and vegetal notes mingle in this medium-bodied red. Expressive, but lacks harmony. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2011. 405 cases made.

name: Rosé Grandioso Long Island
review: This dry rose delivers berry, herbal and smoky flavors in a polished texture. Nicely integrated, but turns a bit herbaceous on the finish. Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Chardonnay. Drink now. 136 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island
review: This wine offers smoke, butter and vanilla notes that take the lead over apple and pear. It has enough acidity to stay lively, but the finish is slightly bitter. Drink now. 2,124 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island La Ferme Martin
