review: Smoky, toasty aromas follow through to the palate of this lean white, where a beam of apple and citrus emerges. Crisp, even austere, but has the grip for food. Drink now. 3,426 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island Estate Selection
review: Soft and supple, this maturing red offers balanced flavors of light cherry, cedar, leather and mint. Drink now. 630 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc The Hamptons Long Island
review: Simple, showing modest berry and toast flavors, firm tannins and an herbal finish.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Estate Selection
review: This mature white offers baked apple, toast and smoky flavors on a round frame. A well-knit wine, but lacks freshness. 670 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Reserve
review: Though firm acidity keeps it lively, this white shows rather bland flavors, with notes of apple, beer and toast. 2,041 cases made.

name: Merlot Long Island La Ferme Martin
review: Thin, with light cherry, herb and earth flavors and slightly drying tannins.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Reserve
review: Smoky, toasty oak aromas and flavors dominate, but a rich core of pear and melon fruit flavors keeps this white balanced and fresh. It has the stuffing to match with food. Drink now through 2005. 1,527 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Late Harvest
review: Apricot and honey flavors are rich and spicy in this sweet white. Has enough acidity to bring you back for another sip. Drink now. 164 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Late Harvest
review: This sweet, viscous dessert wine offers rich honey, candied pineapple and toffee flavors, with enough acidity to keep it lively, and a long, spicy finish. Best after 2003. 125 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island Premier Cru
review: This generous red is rich with ripe cherry and berry fruit flavors, overlaid with plenty of sweet, toasty oak. It has good density and definition, while maintaining freshness. For fans of oak. Drink now through 2007. 100 cases made.

name: Brut The Hamptons Long Island Christian Wölffer Cuvée
review: Fine balance and harmony here. Rich and toasty, this sparkler delivers bold flavors of apple and citrus and a hint of earth that lingers on the finish. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island
review: Supple black cherry and berry flavors, nicely framed by toasty oak, with enough tannin to match well with food. Drink now through 2004. 2,535 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island Estate Selection
review: Lean and focused, showing cherry, tobacco and cedar notes, somewhat like Bordeaux in style. Needs food to bloom, but has balance and structure. Drink now through 2006. 670 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island Estate Selection
review: Soft and smooth, this polished red offers well-focused floral, berry and cherry flavors, with smoky accents and well-integrated yet very firm tannins. A nice balance of delicacy and firmness. Drink now through 2002.

name: Brut The Hamptons Long Island Christian Wölffer Cuvée
review: A tasty sparkling wine, very fruity, showing apple and cherry flavors on a well-integrated, lively structure. Well done. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Estate Selection
review: Smoky and lean. This crisp, focused white shows citrus, mineral and light herbal flavors. It's rather austere, but should blossom with food. Drink now. 1,220 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Estate Selection
review: There's an intriguing earth and grilled hazelnut note in this ambitious Chardonnay, before the mature, baked apple flavor takes over. Medium-bodied. Drink now. 545 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Estate Selection
review: Fans of oak will love the coconut, vanilla and cream flavors of this rich, smooth white. It has good concentration and still is fresh, with well-integrated acidity, but there's not much fruit to balance the oak. If that matters. Drink now. 275 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island La Ferme Martin
review: Well-knit, with focused citrus, fig, smoke and toast flavors and a lively acidity that keeps it fresh.  Drink now. 4,600 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island
review: Soft and rather delicate, yet still fruity and quite refreshing, this balanced red shows ripe cherry, spice and light chocolate flavors with soft tannins and a pretty, floral finish. Not a blockbuster, but it brings you back for another sip. Drink now through 2001. 1,300 cases made.

name: Brut The Hamptons Long Island Christian Wölffer Cuvée
review: This generous sparkler offers baked apple and bread dough flavors with assertive bubbles and a spicy finish. Can match richer dishes. Drink now. 335 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc The Hamptons Long Island
review: Toasty oak adds backbone to this light but balanced red. Cherry and light herbal flavors are focused and linger on the finish. Drink now. 175 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island Estate Selection
review: Plum and coffee flavors are ripe in this balanced red. Tannins are firm, the finish clean. Not a showboat, but will match well with food. Drink now through 2003. 635 cases made.

name: The Hamptons Long Island Rosé
review: This juicy rosé shows complex berry, spicy and herbal flavors that make it a good match for food. Drink now. 1,630 cases made.

name: Brut The Hamptons Long Island Christian Wölffer Cuvée
review: Round and soft, this sparkler shows generous flavors of ripe apple, pear and light toast. The mousse is full and soft on the palate. Not quite crisp enough for an aperitif, but has the weight to match with food. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island
review: Plush and soft, this round white offers hazelnut, nutmeg and ripe melon flavors, well integrated and deep. Though quite oaky in character, it has enough acidity to balance. Drink now. 1,950 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Reserve
review: Still bright, with lime and apple notes and a crisp, but ripe finish. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Reserve
review: This lean white offers mineral and light herbal flavors, with keen acidity that turns a bit tart on the finish. A refreshing complement to richer dishes. Drink now. 1,300 cases made.

name: Merlot Long Island La Ferme Martin
review: Charry and herbaceous flavors frame a core of cherry fruit. The tannins are firm, the finish fresh. Better with food. Drink now through 2005. 2,850 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island
review: A medium-bodied red, with cherry and herb flavors and tobaccolike notes on the finish, which has good length. Drink now. 2,230 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island Estate Selection
review: Goes for the gusto, with a huge dose of dark, sweet toast, but it overwhelms the ripe fruit and comes off a bit heavy-handed and charred in the end. For fans of the style. Drink now. 390 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island Reserve
review: Vanilla and cinnamon oak accents dominate the sweet cherry fruit in this soft red. It's generous but lacks structure. Drink now through 2004. 1,120 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir The Hamptons Long Island
review: This light, supple red shows typical flavors of cherry, spice and bitter herbs. Balanced and clean. Drink now. 185 cases made.

name: The Hamptons Long Island Rosé
review: This dry rosé has cherry, smoke and herb flavors, crisp acidity and enough body to handle lighter dishes. Merlot, Chardonnay and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc The Hamptons Long Island
review: Smooth, with clean cherry flavors that give this supple red an easy-drinking appeal. Drink now. 224 cases made.

name: Merlot Long Island La Ferme Martin
review: Shows the bell pepper, herbaceous side of Merlot, with some currant and tobacco leaf notes on the finish. Clean and ripe, but the style is not for everyone. Drink now. 1,530 cases made.

name: The Hamptons Long Island Blush
review: This pale pink wine offers light, fresh strawberry flavors. Clean and crisp, it's simple but balanced and refreshing. A good aperitif. Drink now. 1,010 cases made.

name: The Hamptons Long Island Rosé
review: Good dry rosé, with watermelon and rose petal hints, and a crisp finish. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island La Ferme Martin
review: This austere white offers toasty and smoky oak flavors, backed by modest apple and firm acidity. Its structure makes this a good match with food. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Reserve
review: Buttery aroma and baked apple flavors here, but there's enough acidity to keep it interesting. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Merlot The Hamptons Long Island Estate Selection
review: This smooth red offers cherry and berry fruit with plenty of vanilla and toasty oak. It's harmonious, if a bit candied. Drink now. 224 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc The Hamptons Long Island
review: Light, with some leafy, cola notes and a smoky finish. 172 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir The Hamptons Long Island
review: This supple red is maturing now, showing earthy, leathery notes over modest dried cherry fruit. It has some Pinot character. 30 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc The Hamptons Long Island
review: Grape jelly aroma, with rhubarb flavor and an odd sweet-sour tomato finish. 175 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island
review: Shows some fuller, nutty notes on the nose, but verges on cidery on the palate, finishing tart. 1,395 cases made.

name: Chardonnay The Hamptons Long Island Reserve
review: Melon and toasty flavors mingle with a slightly cheesy note in this round white. It's soft and straightforward. 1,700 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Long Island
review: A bit muddled, with some root beer, tea and brown sugar flavors that are barely hanging in there. Past its prime. 138 cases made.

name: The Hamptons Long Island Rosé
review: Like dilute rose water, finishing on a bitter, shrill note.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Julia
review: Intensely fruity, with concentrated kirschlike aromas and flavors. There's impressive balance and structure that carries the refined raspberry and red plum notes, with plenty of fine-grained tannins. Spicy finish. Blaufränkisch, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2013. 583 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Trocken Eisenberg Béla-Jóska
review: A medium-bodied red that shows complexity and depth, with moderate tannins serving as a spine for ripe flavors of currant, black cherry and tobacco. Drink now through 2019. 212 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Pfarrweingarten
review: Crushed red fruit and spice flavors dominate this fresh, zippy red. Red plum and berry notes are accented by hints of beef and mint. Blaufränkisch. Drink now through 2012. 1,083 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Trocken Südburgenland
review: A charming red, this is nicely balanced, with violet aromas opening up to a range of red fruit flavors and notes of bay leaf and black olive. Drink now. 154 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Pfarrweingarten
review: Medium-bodied, with good focus to the red cherry and spice flavors, which extend on the finish with notes of hot stone. Blaufränkisch. Drink now. 833 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Julia
review: A straightforward red, with plum and berry flavors, accented by smoky notes. This has a short, mocha-filled finish. Blaufränkisch, Merlot and Canernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 833 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Firm, with a good balance of plum, cherry and smoked meat flavors. Spicy finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Ice
review: Offers energetic apricot, quince and peach flavors, lined with a note of candied orange peel. Sweet and viscous, but racy too, with good cut and length. Drink now through 2016. 375 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Ice
review: Bold, spicy and nicely focused, with delicious quince, orange marmalade, ginger and dried apricot notes racing along from start to finish. Sweet and lush, but well-defined. Drink now through 2014. 957 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Ice
review: Racy and very tangy, with superfresh citrus peel, quince, candied grapefruit and fresh-cut ginger notes that drive through the lengthy finish. Drink now through 2010. 472 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Ice Wine
review: A classy dessert wine, exhibiting sweet-tasting floral, apricot and vanilla that's deftly integrated with the vibrant structure. Just a hint of earth on the long finish. Drink now through 2004. 1,703 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Select
review: This has surprising depth for the vintage, exhibiting notes of anise, apple and bergamot that drive along nicely, backed by a juicy, engaging finish. Drink now through 2013. 1,457 cases made.

name: Vidal Blanc Finger Lakes Ice
review: Intense, with dried apricot and orange notes that stay racy and mouthwatering, along with a sweet backing of maple and candied citrus peel flavors. Good length. Drink now through 2010. 329 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Bright and tangy, with yellow apple, melon rind and jasmine notes laced with an echo of wet straw through the finish. Drink now through 2018. 620 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Very fresh, with good cut to the apple, green almond and plantain mix, showing a lingering bitter grapefruit edge on the finish. Drink now. 354 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Caywood East Vineyard
review: Lively, with lots of anise, yellow apple and dried lemon peel notes that ripple through the energetic finish. Drink now through 2018. 497 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Caywood East Vineyard
review: Jasmine and honeysuckle notes lead the way, followed by yellow and green apple fruit. The finish is lined with a brisk melon rind edge. Drink now through 2015. 900 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Select
review: Ripe, with a light ginger frame around the flattering yellow apple fruit and honeysuckle notes. The broad, open-knit finish shows a clearly sweet edge, remaining fresh enough. Drink now. 1,820 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Select
review: A ripe version, with a range of apple, pear and quince notes that push through the plump, flattering finish. Shows good concentration. Very solid. Drink now through 2012. 1,005 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Select
review: Shows the ripeness of the vintage, with a broader feel to the green almond, fig and pear flavors, followed by a note of melon on the juicy, mineral-tinged finish. Very friendly. Drink now. 490 cases made.

name: Vidal Blanc Finger Lakes Ice Wine
review: Thick and juicy, with genuine concentration to the peach, apricot and pineapple flavors. Solid length, with a nice tangy hint to keep you coming back. Delicious. Drink now through 2003. 2,470 cases made.

name: Vignoles Finger Lakes Ice Wine
review: Very sweet and bracing at the same time, showing intense rhubarb, honey and green leaf flavors. Thick, yet stays fresh and clean on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 1,538 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes Dry
review: Light and fresh, with bitter grapefruit and citrus oil notes backed by a flash of peach on the tangy finish. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Finger Lakes Reserve
review: This offers ebullient black cherry fruit and spice notes, with a fresh, lightly toasty finish. Supple and lengthy. Nicely done. Drink now. 244 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Juicy and direct, showing good zip to the yellow apple, fennel seed and Meyer lemon notes. Stays bracing through the finish, with a hint of talc. Drink now through 2013. 1,035 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: A tangy, dry style, with nice cut to the lime, slate and green apple notes. There's good snap on the finish. Drink now. 940 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: A crackling, dry style, with slate, jasmine, green apple and floral notes that stay piercing and driven through the finish. Drink now through 2011. 815 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Ice Wine
review: Tangy maple, orange peel and spice notes are kept lively by juicy acidity in this focused, medium-weight dessert wine. The juicy texture hangs nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 737 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Select
review: Juicy and fresh, with lightly off-dry white peach and lime notes laced with a hint of fig. This has a pure, lingering finish. Drink now. 303 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi Dry
review: Juicy and focused, with a racy core of red and green apple fruit, laced with hints of anise and honeysuckle. The lively finish has off-dry hints, but stays bouncy. Drink now. 2,884 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi Dry
review: Broad and forward, with soft-edged apple, pear and piecrust notes. Shows an anise edge on the finish. A touch shy on zip, but should appeal to fans of the riper style. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi Dry
review: Concentrated but not showy, with a citrus oil edge to the quince and pear fruit, which then hangs through the pear skin-tinged finish. Drink now. 880 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi Dry
review: Plump, with nice quince, fig and almond notes, all offset by a firm note of anise and good fresh acidity that adds length to the finish. Drink now. 906 cases made.

name: Riesling-Gewürztraminer Seneca Lake Fathom 107
review: Fresh ginger, lychee and pink grapefruit notes mingle. A light zing of bitter citrus through the finish imparts spine. Drink now. 405 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Crisp, but ripe enough, displaying good snap to the mix of red and black cherry fruit, damson plum and maduro tobacco notes. Stays lively on the finish. Drink now. 533 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes Unoaked
review: A light, unadorned style, with white peach and yellow apple fruit notes gilded with a floral twinge through the refreshing finish. Drink now. 803 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Finger Lakes Reserve
review: Good dried cherry, cinnamon and dark tea notes lead to a firm, spice-tinged finish. Drink now. 291 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Bright and breezy, with lime, honeysuckle and kiwi notes on a lithe frame. Drink now. 1,293 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Ice Wine
review: Nice freshness here, with apricot, pineapple and floral notes. Medium-bodied finish. Drink now. 1,168 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Select
review: A soft and forward style, with pear and quince fruit flavors backed by a note of yellow apple on the finish. A little shy on zip, but the fruit profile is tasty. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi Dry
review: Nice bright style, with lime and slate hints working with fresh apple and floral notes. Drink now. 1,952 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes Reserve
review: Soft but fresh, with good pear and apple notes, a light touch of brioche and a hint of honeysuckle on the open-knit finish. Drink now. 214 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes
review: What we like in Gewürztraminer, with fresh fruit and floral aromas and slightly sweet flavors that become more complex as you sip. Has great balance and appeal. Drink now.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes Semi Dry
review: Light-bodied, with a friendly off-dry edge to the chamomile, verbena and peach flavors. Drink now. 360 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes Semi Dry
review: Off-dry, offering soft, candied grapefruit peel, lychee and green apple notes that stay lively on the finish. Drink now. 480 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Finger Lakes Ice Wine
review: Very crisp and tart beneath the outer veneer of sweet honey and apricot flavors, rather like a sour lemon candy. Refreshing and appealing. Drink now. 270 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Finger Lakes Reserve
review: Shows good varietal character, with pleasant cherry, berry and spice flavors. On the light side but still lively, with pleasant tea and spice notes on the finish. Drink now.

name: Vignoles Finger Lakes Ice Wine
review: Nice juicy peach, pineapple and apple pie flavors, with a medium-weight, frankly sweet finish. Drink now. 442 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Soft, with friendly cherry and raspberry fruit backed by a light shading of roasted vanilla on the finish. Drink now. 502 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Light, but with good varietal notes of black cherry and tobacco, with dusty tannins on the finish. Drink now. 810 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Cassis and tobacco leaf aromas give way to a crisply textured wine, with ripe black cherry notes and firm acidity on the finish. Drink now. 720 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes Rosé
review: This has a good crunchy feel to the mix of pomegranate and white cherry fruit. Offers a light herbal thread on the finish. Drink now. 1,700 cases made.

name: Meritage Finger Lakes
review: Plum, pepper and spice notes work in this hearty red, with a slightly firm, smoky edge to the finish. Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now. 725 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Ice
review: Chamomile and quinine notes lend a tangy edge to the candied lemon and grapefruit peel flavors, finishing with a hint of Meyer lemon. Slightly coarse on the finish. Drink now. 1,044 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Ice
review: Sweet and forward, with tangerine, clementine and green fig notes. This was the better of two bottles. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi Dry
review: Friendly, with a rounded, easy feel right from the start that lets the creamed green apple and pear notes meander through the modest finish. Drink now. 2,700 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi Dry
review: Light-bodied, with an off-dry feel to the watermelon, lime candy and green apple notes. Drink now. 2,368 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi Dry
review: This generous white delivers ripe melon and spice flavors, with a noticeable sweetness. A bit soft, but easy to drink. Drink now. 1,231 cases made.

name: Vidal Blanc Finger Lakes Ice
review: Very tangy, with lots of sweet-and-sour interplay among the flavors of candied orange peel, lime and maple, laced with green tea and quinine notes. The slightly coarse finish needs to settle down a touch. Shows character, though. Drink now. 862 cases made.

name: Vidal Blanc Finger Lakes Ice Wine
review: Smells great, like grilled nuts and honey, then an earthy note emerges on the palate. Sweet, with tart acidity as a counterpoint. Drink now through 2003. 1,318 cases made.

name: Vignoles Finger Lakes Ice Wine
review: This simple sweet wine has appealing orange peel and anise flavors. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes Barrel Fermented
review: Rounded, with friendly pear and apple notes and a modestly buttery finish. Drink now. 414 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes Grace House
review: Toasty oak notes are pleasant, if dominant, but there's enough green apple flavor to carry this crisp, round white through a clean finish.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes Reserve
review: Round and forward, showing butter, apple and pear notes, with a buttery finish. Drink now. 293 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes Unoaked
review: Quite buttery from the start, with modest creamed pear and a flash of pineapple. The buttery edge takes over again on the finish. Drink now. 271 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Finger Lakes
review: Grapey, spicy aromas and nearly dry flavors of apple and herbs make this an interesting, complex white that is evolving well with age. Could use more harmony, but is balanced and drinkable. Drink now.

name: Meritage Finger Lakes
review: Slightly snappy cherry, pomegranate and plum fruit is covered by a veneer of roasted vanilla. Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now. 988 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Crisp, and slightly tinny, with modest lime and green apple notes. Drink now. 1,450 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: A bit blunt, but with a fresh core of apple and citrus fruit, this dry white has enough structure to match with food. Drink now. 584 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Crisp and austere in aroma and flavor, this dry Riesling shows richness midpalate, where the subtle peach and apple notes emerge. Lean, citrusy finish. Drink now. 523 cases made.

name: Vignoles Finger Lakes
review: This juicy, off-dry white serves up lively orange and floral notes reminiscent of Muscat, but with more body and generosity. A refreshing quaff. Drink now. 1,049 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: A bell pepper note runs through the cherry fruit, with a slightly firm finish. Drink now. 965 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Finger Lakes
review: Shows a leafy edge, with a streak of tobacco running through the modest mulled cherry fruit. Drink now. 290 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes Barrel Fermented
review: Light-bodied Chardonnay, with some earth and pear notes. Finishes on a simple buttery note. Drink now. 751 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes Semi Dry
review: Has an off-dry feel, with light lime and pear flavors. Drink now. 1,107 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: An austere style of Riesling that's marked by smoky aromas, mineral and earthy flavors, and a narrow band of tart fruit flavors that reminds us of lemon and grapefruit. Clean and bracing in balance, but not very flavorful. Drink now. 290 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Finger Lakes Select
review: Crisp, with modest pippin apple and lime flavors. Drink now. 664 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Offers modest pippin apple and lime flavors, with a light but fresh finish. Drink now. 968 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Good black cherry fruit is covered with a slightly firm layer of bacony toast. Has weight and length, but lacks some purity. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Sparkling Riesling Finger Lakes
review: Shows pear, candied apple and watermelon notes, with a fruit-cocktail finish. A bit cloying, but could be used as a base for punch. Drink now. 430 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes
review: Light and dry, with delicate floral and grapefruit aromas and flavors. A low-profile wine that has refreshing character. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Finger Lakes
review: The Riesling character of peaches is there but a bit diluted, and the full-bodied wine needs more acidity to balance the sweetness. Drink now.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi Dry
review: Earth and mineral notes mingle with apple and melon in this focused, lively white. Off-dry, it has a citrus and herbal finish. Drink now. 1,346 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes Dry
review: Dominated by lemon-lime flavors, with some decent acidity, and a pinelike aroma.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes Semi Dry
review: Slightly sweet, with candied aromas and flavors evoking marzipan, nectarine and mint. Round and simple, getting a little washed out on the finish. 710 cases made.

name: Melody Finger Lakes
review: This juicy white offers simple, slightly candied apple and orange flavors, but stays fresh and clean through the finish. 1,017 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Finger Lakes Reserve
review: Shows banana and Bing cherry aromas and flavors, before heading to a rustic finish. 555 cases made.

name: Ravat Blanc Finger Lakes Ice Wine
review: Attractive aromas of spice, créme brulée and tobacco give way to orange and honey flavors. There's character and complexity, but it lacks harmony. 600 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: Modest apple and lime flavors, fading a bit on the finish. 960 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi Dry
review: Light, and slightly candied, with lime and watermelon notes backed by a hint of fruit cocktail on the finish. This was the better of two bottles. 5,000 cases made.

name: Vignoles Finger Lakes Late Harvest
review: Modest peach and pear notes give way to vegetal, oniony notes on the finish. 380 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes
review: Bland and has little fruit. The acidity makes this a good palate cleanser, but it lacks Gewürz character.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes Dry
review: Very light, with modest lime flavor. Clean but not much here. 389 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes Dry
review: A lively Gewürztraminer, delivering its litchi and rose flavors in a slightly dilute presentation. Turns to menthol on the finish. 387 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Round and full in body, this shows a mix of exotic flavors—pineapple, banana and vegetal—that add up to less than the sum of its parts.

name: Pinot Noir Finger Lakes Grace House
review: Light and soft, with simple cherry, tea and butter hints. 294 cases made.

name: Seyval Blanc Finger Lakes Barrel Fermented
review: Has a green apple aroma, but tastes more of onion skin and celery. Finish is a tad dilute. 414 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes Reserve
review: A strong herbaceous flavor dominates the ripe pear and melon fruit. Intense and flavorful, if lacking finesse and grace.

name: Merlot Finger Lakes
review: A silky texture carries light berry and herb flavors, kept fresh by a lively acidity. A charry note mars the finish. 647 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Finger Lakes
review: A charred character is the hallmark of this rough wine, overriding the faint red cherry flavors.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes Barrel Fermented
review: Strong oak flavors turn gluey and interfere with the ripe pear and melon notes. Decent Chardonnay. 2,800 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes Dry
review: Faint litchi aroma, with a shallow palate of tinned lime, turning dilute on the finish. A second bottle was badly flawed. 210 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Finger Lakes Ice Wine
review: Gives you a bold, exotic ride, but doesn't quite get you home. An odd mixture of honey, candied cherry and cabbage flavors, sweet and tart at once. 290 cases made.

name: Seyval Blanc Finger Lakes Barrel Fermented
review: A bit angular, with some onion and herbal flavors, and a bit rough in the end.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes Grace House
review: Rather earthy and smoky in flavor, with a creamy flavor that needs more fruit and freshness to support it. Drinkable but dull. 900 cases made.

name: Seyval Blanc Finger Lakes Barrel Fermented
review: Broad, almost coarse, but the lime, melon and earthy flavors are pleasant, and there's enough acidity to keep it interesting. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Murky, with earth and mushroom notes that aren't entirely clean. 411 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes
review: Vegetal aroma, with a tinny, hollow palate and finish. Weak. 585 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Shows a smoky aroma and flavor, with some faint peach flavors, too. Quite tart on the finish.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Emits a whiff of rotten egg, with a trim, tart palate and finish. This was the better of two samples. 835 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes
review: Lean and rustic, with a whiff of egg followed by a sharp palate. 365 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes Barrel Fermented
review: Extremely oaky, overwhelming the fruit, and harsh on the finish. Overly mature, out-of-balance and funky in the end.

name: Seyval Blanc Finger Lakes Barrel Fermented
Chardonnay Finger Lakes
review: Odd vegetal and egg aromas echo on the palate. Turns harsh in the end. 790 cases made.

name: Vignoles Finger Lakes Ice
review: Shows charred orange peel and cloying duck sauce notes (like in the packets from Chinese restaurants). Very awkward. 800 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Siefersheimer Heerkretz
review: Distinctive, with floral and herbal aromas giving way to candied orange, apricot and mineral notes in this luscious white. It seems like botrytis is giving an exotic edge, with an almost sweet-tart character. Fine length. Drink now through 2028.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Siefersheimer Höllberg
review: Rich, sumptuous and featuring well-defined flavors of apricot, pineapple, spice and mineral. Remains bright and lively, despite its power, ending with a long, resonant aftertaste. Drink now through 2020.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Heerkretz
review: Powerful, with a smoky essence to the ripe apple and baked peach flavors. There's lots of minerality as well, with a dense spice-filled finish that ends on a honeyed note. Best after 2040.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Siefersheimer Höllberg
review: An intense version, exuding dried apricot, pineapple, spice and mineral notes. Tastes like botrytis, with its spicy sweetness and lush texture, yet there's good cut. Has a concentrated aftertaste of apricot and honey. Drink now through 2024.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Siefersheimer Höllberg
review: Focused and pure, this Riesling pulses with apricot, mandarin orange, grapefruit and mineral flavors. It's delicate and well-balanced, with persistence and a long finish. Drink now through 2022. 1 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Gold Cap Rheinhessen Siefersheim Vom Porphyr
review: Crisp and direct, with a glistening acidity to the grapefruit and gooseberry flavors, boasting a chiseled texture. Touches of sea salt and sage honey emerge on the bracing finish. Powerful and pure-tasting. Drink now through 2020. 1,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Heerkretz GG
review: A juicy version, redolent of apricot, pear and spice flavors, matched to luscious spice and honeyed notes. Rich and pure midpalate, presenting a finish that lingers with dried ginger and allspice details. A vibrant, elegant dry-style Riesling. Drink now through 2019. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Höllberg
review: Features a spicy aroma, with concentrated flavors of red peach, grapefruit and green apple flanked by bracing sea salt and mineral notes. Firm midpalate, delivering a powerful finish that takes on smoke and candied yam accents. Drink now through 2020. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Höllberg GG
review: A ripe and lush version, offering intensely fruity and pure flavors of peach, dried apricot and mango. This shows dried savory herbal notes midpalate, ending with a rich and well-spiced finish. Drink now through 2020. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Siefersheim Heerkretz
review: A keen edge of acidity keeps this dry white crisp and lively, despite its rich texture. Peach, passion fruit and pungent mineral notes abound as this glides to a long, complex finish. Drink now through 2017.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Heerkretz GG
review: Balanced on a knife's edge, this sports focused acidity and touches of richness to the pippin apple and tangerine flavors. Notes of savory herb show on the vibrant finish. Drink now through 2018. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Höllberg
review: There's lots of exotic spicy overtones to this powerful dry Riesling, which features concentrated apple tart, gooseberry and glazed citrus flavors. Long and spicy on the complex finish. Drink now through 2020.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Siefersheimer Vom Porphyr
review: Ripe, with an opulent texture offset by vibrant acidity providing a setting for the apricot, pineapple and mineral flavors. Firms up on the long, crisp finish. Drink now through 2018.

name: Riesling Spätlese Gold Cap Rheinhessen Siefersheimer Heerkretz
review: A white marked by verve and laciness. Peach, nectarine, passion fruit and grapefruit flavors have cut and presence as this unfolds to a lingering finish. Drink now through 2028. 3 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Heerkretz
review: Floral, apple and peach aromas and flavors are brought into focus with the vivid structure. Light-bodied and intense, with fine harmony and a long, mouthwatering finish. Best from 2012 through 2022.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Höllberg
review: Creamy and plush, with long, rich flavors of red peach, apricot and baked apple. Lots of vanilla and spice notes mark the lush finish. Drink now through 2030. 5 cases imported.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: A powerful dry white, with rapierlike flavors of crushed stone, gooseberry and lemon curd. The long finish is powerful, with restrained notes of mineral and spice. Drink now through 2017. 200 cases imported.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: Light-bodied, but fresh and lively, sporting lemon, apple and white peach flavors. A stony element lurks under the surface. There's fine spicy length. Drink now through 2016.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Siefersheim Vom Porphyr
review: A crisp and minerally white, with concentrated Fuji apple, nectarine and Bosc pear flavors, supported by fresh acidity. Citrus zest and mineral details show on the finish, accented by saline hints. Drink now through 2022. 1,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Siefersheim Vom Porphyr
review: Shows some honeyed notes to the rich dried peach and glazed apricot flavors. Well-structured, with plenty of juiciness on the finish, accented by dried mint and tarragon hints. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Siefersheimer Heerkretz
review: A ripe, full-bodied style, sporting apricot, quince and grapefruit flavors. It's a bit pinched on the finish now, but all the elements are there, it just needs time to integrate. Best from 2010 through 2020.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Heerkretz
review: Smoky and rich, delivering baked peach, ripe apple and spice notes. Powerfully juicy on the rich finish, with hints of anise and cream. Drink now through 2030. 15 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Siefersheimer Heerkretz
review: A mix of beeswax, apricot and quince, this white offers plenty of charm up front, revealing its firm structure on the finish. All the elements are there for a balanced, harmonious wine in time. Drink now through 2018. 9 cases imported.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: Ripe citrus and glazed apricot flavors give this good lift, showing plenty of minerality midpalate. Very spicy on the crisp finish, with lingering notes of lemon curd. Drink now through 2017. 3,000 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: Driven by powerful spiced apple, pear tart, nectarine and ripe citrus flavors that take on a rich smokiness. Well-structured, with plenty of snap on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 3,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Heerkretz GG
review: Intense minerality, with flavors of lavender, elderflower and Fuji apple, and some of creamy notes. Lush finish is long and airy.  Drink now through 2018. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Höllberg GG
review: A touch off-dry, with plenty of dried green herbal notes to the intense citrus, green apple and grapefruit flavors. Plenty of savory accents on the crisp finish.  Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Höllberg GG
review: A touch austere, with well-defined apple and citrus flavors that feature some savory herbal notes. Presents a forward acidity, especially on the finish, where white pepper and slate details chime in. Drink now through 2016. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Siefersheim Höllberg
review: A firm, pungent white, offering apple, grapefruit and mineral flavors. This is on the lean side and a tad less complex than its peers, with a clean, dry finish. Best from 2011 through 2017.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Siefersheimer Vom Porphyr
review: Ripe, with plenty of smoky accents to the dense and well-spiced grapefruit, green peach and blood orange flavors. Hints of underbrush and slate show on the structured finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Siefersheimer Vom Porphyr
review: A mélange of grapefruit, apricot and herbal flavors highlight this full-bodied dry Riesling. It lacks a little precision overall, with a loose-knit finish. Drink now through 2012. 10 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Siefersheimer Vom Porphyr
review: This is full of citrus and spice notes, like dried orange peel, cinnamon and white pepper. It's broad and powerful, with a fine acid structure and moderate, tactile finish. Drink now through 2010.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Siefersheimer Höllberg
review: Good weight and balance, showing apricot, vanilla cream and grapefruit notes matched to a crisp structure. It lingers with a minty accent and refreshing acidity. Drink now through 2025. 6 cases imported.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: A minerally style, with some flinty notes to the flavors of green apple and ripe citrus, which feature a subtly oily texture. Dried sage accents on the finish.  Best after 2018. 2,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Heerkretz
review: Shows a crisp intensity to the ripe citrus, green apple and kiwifruit flavors, with saline notes. The languid finish is filled with slate and flinty accents. Drink now through 2016. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Siefersheimer Vom Porphyr
review: Firm and crisp, with lots of mineral and graphite accents to the white peach and pippin apple flavors. Tangerine on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 20 cases imported.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: Lemon curd, wild herb and ripe lemon flavors provide verve in this white, with notes of red currant on the finish.  Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: Firm in texture, with green flavors pushing past the ripe berry character, finishing with a grip of tannin. Best after 2011. 600 cases made.

name: Riesling Washington Whispering Tree
review: Sleek and lightly sweet, with pretty pear and green guava flavors that linger on the finish. Drink now. 2,300 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Waiheke Island te motu
review: Firm in texture and pure in flavor, centering around lovely currant, plum and delicately spicy flavors that remain vibrant through the supple finish. Best from 2000 through 2010. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Waiheke Island te motu
review: Firm in texture, generous with its gently spicy berry and cherry flavors, finishing with fine tannins. Best after 2002. 1,250 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Waiheke Island te motu
review: On the light side, with earthy, dusky spice notes mingling with modest berry flavors, and finishing with a tang of acidity. Drink now through 2005. 494 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Hawkes Bay
review: Plenty of chocolate, oak and berry character, with a hint of barnyard; medium body and light tannins. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Nelson
review: Rich-textured, with juicy pear, passion fruit and spice flavors mingling nicely through the finish. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Riesling Nelson
review: Light and clean, with lots of pine resin and floral overtones to the green apple fruit. Finishes with a refreshing lift. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Nelson
review: Serves up a generous range of grass, grapefruit, quince and mineral flavors. Deft lemon-lime acid dances through the finish. Drink now. 6,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Nelson Spinyback
review: Fragrant, with very good concentration to rose petal, quince and lively passion fruit flavors underscored by a persistent honey note. Drink now. 560 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Nelson
review: On the light side, with pretty raspberry and herb flavors that linger nicely on the finish. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Nelson
review: Gooseberry and fresh-cut grass notes are highly aromatic in this light-bodied white, with plenty of vibrancy to the Key lime and passion fruit flavors. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Nelson
review: Crisp and lively, with bracing acidity and citrusy apple flavors. Drink now through 2004. 300 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Nelson
review: Charred, toasty notes give some traction to the plum and berry flavors, with touches of cigar, forest floor and dried herbs on a firm body. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Nelson
review: Redolent of green peppers, lively and silky in the mouth, with lime and vegetal flavors. Drink now. 1,200 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Nelson Spinyback
review: Fragrant, with lively grapefruit and passion fruit flavors that finish with sweet pea and mint notes. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Nelson
review: Made in a toasty style, with intense tangerine and lemon flavors, as cedar and charred herb notes dominate on the finish. A bright acidity keeps this refreshing. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Peach and apple flavors are fresh and juicy, accented by notes of white flowers, with a peppery finish. Drink now. 14,086 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Dry, stony, not as tart as some, its apricot and tropical fruit notes creating a welcome generosity around a lively core of mineral and lime flavors. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Marlborough Botrytis
review: Very ripe and sweet, but balanced with zingy acidity, showing honeyed apricot and apple tart flavors, complete with buttery crust, on the sweet and tangy finish. Drink now through 2008. 200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Lovely aromatics make this attractive, offering green olive and grapefruit scents. It gets a little tart on the finish, but it just needs a little food to balance. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Lime, grapefruit and lemon zest flavors are bold and spicy, with mango and yellow apple accents. Tangy acidity. Drink now. 29,673 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Marlborough
review: Lightly sweet, with generous litchi, grapefruit and rose petal aromas and flavors. Slightly bitter, but the sweetness covers it nicely. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Light and spicy, with a smoky edge to the lime and bread dough flavors. Not a typical Sauvignon Blanc, but it should pair well with a lot of different foods. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright and crisp, a juicy white with a touch of celery in the minty-citrus mix. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Canterbury-Marlborough
review: Light on its feet, distinctly peppery in flavor, with ripe berry and currant fruit lingering on the open-textured finish. Drink now through 2007. 7,000 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Marlborough
review: Lighter style, with pleasant grapefruit and rose petal aromas on a minor scale. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Canterbury
review: Light, tight and crisp, with scratchy tannins around a modest core of blackberry fruit. Best after 2003. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Waipara Premo
review: Smooth, round and beautifully focused, offering a gorgeous mouthful of nutmeg- and cream-accented currant and blueberry flavors, expanding and sailing effortlessly through the long, expressive finish. Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Waipara Premo Reserve
review: There's a lovely tropical edge here, with mango and pineapple flavors gracing the core of lemon, apple and peach notes. Smooth and graceful, but with plenty of power and juiciness, finishing with spice and lemon thyme details. Drink now through 2020. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Waipara
review: Lemon, grapefruit and lime flavors are smooth and juicy, with appealing fleshy melon, orange and pear notes. Shows good concentration, finishing with a whiff of orange blossom. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Waipara
review: Bright and juicy, with dazzling grapefruit and pineapple flavors, finishing with polish. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Waipara Premo Dry
review: Light and airy, this delicate wine shows lovely peach, melon and lime flavors that linger on the clean, dry finish. Drink now through 2012. 300 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Waipara Valley
review: Crisp and lean, with lemon-lime and pear notes that linger effortlessly on a light body. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Waipara Valley
review: Savory white pepper and toasted herb notes mingle with berry and cherry flavors on a soft frame. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Waipara Valley
review: Juicy apple, pear and citrus flavors have a honeyed, toasty overtone and accents of cider on the finish. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Canterbury Premiere Reserve
review: Distinctive, creamy, rose petal and orange character, full body and a silky texture. No great aging potential, but delicious.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Premiere Reserve
review: A fresh, clean Sauvignon with celery and grapefruit aromas and flavors and crisp acidity.

name: Pinot Noir Adelaide Hills
review: Shows maturity already, with a brick color and pretty black cherry and earthy spice flavors, finishing with a fine layer of gritty tannins. Drink now through 2001. 155 cases made.

name: Shiraz Heathcote Eagles Blood
review: Amazingly supple, generous and distinctive, with a range of mineral flavors enhancing the red berry and dark plum fruit, which expands exponentially on the long, sharply focused finish. The tannins are well-submerged. Best from 2009 through 2015. 550 cases made.

name: Shiraz Heathcote Eagles Blood
review: Dense, juicy and fragrant with ripe cherry, cherry blossom, plum and assorted spices, building up impressively on the palate, finishing with plenty of muscle but some real refinement as well. Best from 2007 through 2020. 55 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Heathcote Eagles Blood
review: Bright and jazzy, with a nice silky edge to the vibrant cherry and blackberry fruit, shaded with cola and coffee hints, persisting on the refined finish. Best from 2011 through 2016. 250 cases made.

name: Shiraz Heathcote Eagles Blood
review: Bright and lively, a juicy mouthful of blueberry, red plum and white pepper flavors, finishing with the merest hint of a tarry note. Attractive now, but it should gain depth with cellaring. Drink now through 2012. 34 cases made.

name: Shiraz Heathcote Eagles Blood
review: Features fleshy and bold black cherry flavors, with a whiff of fresh spearmint and black licorice. Fresh earth and leather accents gain momentum on the finish, where the tannins firm up. Drink now through 2025. 350 cases made.

name: Shiraz Heathcote Eagles Blood
review: Its gamy character will not appeal to all tastes, but the basic structure is lively and the finish provides blueberry, iris and spice flavors that linger. Best after 2007. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hirsch Vineyard
review: Uncommonly dark, rich and exotic, truly distinctive, showing wild berry, black cherry, anise and vanilla flavors. Color and richness of the fruit may throw you, but this is wonderfully complex and  compelling. 50 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley
review: Smooth, ripe and creamy, with a bright, ripe core of pear, apple, citrus and melon flavors, it turns even more complex on the finish, where the flavors fan out and linger. Drinkable now, but holding into 1998 won't hurt. 875 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Ynez Valley Sanford & Benedict Vineyard
review: Tart, with a green edge to the pineapple, citrus and guava notes, but once past the bracing acidity the flavors show remarkable depth and concentration. Can stand short-term cellaring. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Olivet Lane Vineyard
review: Bright, distinctive and spicy, with ripe berry and currant underpinnings. The flavors sail into a beautifully integrated finish. Intense and concentrated. Drinkable now. 51 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: A lean, crisp style, with a band of lemon and grapefruit-scented flavors that zip across your palate. Best to cellar a year or two to let it fill out. 950 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Intense, bright and sharply focused, with tart citrus, pineapple and pear notes that lead to a pretty, nectarine-laced finish. 585 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard Q Block
review: A shade denser and more compact than the other bottling, it delivers ripe plum and currant flavors on the finish. Modest tannins make it approachable now. 225 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Filled with flavors of pear, spice, honey and nectarine. Perhaps in time a little more polish and finesse will develop as well. 950 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Ynez Valley Sanford & Benedict Vineyard
review: Clean and correct, showing a trim band of leesy pear and light, toasty oak shadings. Comes across as an elegant, understated white. 120 cases made.

name: Lagrein San Luis Obispo County French Camp Vineyard
review: Dark colored and deeply concentrated, with ripe yet tart blackberry, wild berry and spicy floral aromatics, this is a potent young wine packed with pomegranate. Drink now through 2009. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: A racy style. Shows peppery, wild berry and black cherry flavors that are supple and elegant, finishing with a spicy aftertaste. Ready now. 285 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Ripe and zesty, this is exotic in style, with tart, meaty, sour cherry and wild berry flavors that push the limits for Pinot Noir. It's dark, concentrated, young, peppery and intense; best to cellar into 1998 or '99. 72 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Bright and lively, with fresh, ripe, elegant cherry, strawberry and plum notes, picking up a leathery edge on the finish when the tannins kick in. Drinkable now. 225 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Closer to Syrah than Pinot. Has lots of pepper and roasted berry character and a soft, almost plush finish. Distinctive, dark and concentrated. May be best around 1997. 225 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Ripe and focused, with lively cola, rhubarb and black cherry flavors framed by tight tannins and oak shadings. Youthful and tight. The finish is long, complex and lingering, with a blend of oak and fruit flavors. Drink now through 2000. 50 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard Q Block
review: Complex and distinctive, with a mix of high-toned cherry, rhubarb, roasted herb and red bell pepper. Spicy, full-bodied and ending with firm tannins. Drink now through 2013. 110 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard Q Block
review: Dark, ripe, rich and complex, with black cherry, herb, tea and spicy flavors that turn smooth and supple. Finishes with a tinge of herb and a vegetal note. Drinks well now and through 1999. 295 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard Q Block
review: Young, tart, tight and exotic, with lots of spice, wild berry, black cherry and spicy oak flavors that are well focused and show lots of meaty, leathery nuances. Best to cellar into 1998 or 2000. 72 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard Q Block
review: Austere but still quite flavorful, a more tightly reined-in style that shows lots of detail to the flavors. Picks up black cherry, herb and minty notes, finishing with a tannic, slightly coarse edge. 175 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard Q Block
review: Gutsy and flavorful; a mouthful of plum and currant flavors extends into a solid, slightly tannic finish. Drinkable now. Q Block is a section of Bien Nacido Vineyard that is primarily planted with the Pommard clone. 25 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Builds up with supple cherry, earth and berry flavors, with hints of spice and mushroom, then firms up on the finish, where the tannins are quite evident. Drink now through 2004. 390 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard N Block
review: A touch earthy and gamy with a smoked bacon and leathery, picking up a hint of plum and cherry-laced fruit, which has to work to emerge through the tannins. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hirsch Vineyard
review: Unusual. Truly exotic in its spicy character, this has a tart, tightly wound core of wild blackberry flavor with hints of clove. Not a typical Pinot Noir, but shows good concentration. 98 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Santa Barbara County
review: Marked by complex spice, plum and pepper notes, it shortens up on the finish and turns tannic, so cellaring into 1998 is advised. 165 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Broad and buttery, already tasting mature and woody, finishing with a sense of sweetness. Earthy and distinctive, seems a little out of whack. 550 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Rita Hills Melville Vineyard
review: Light color, with spicy, minty, tealike flavors and a core of wild berry and cherry fruit that's a bit stemmy. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Shows the typical leathery edge from this vineyard and is tight and tannic now. Best to let this age for two to four years, when the cola and rhubarb flavors may be brighter and more compelling. Drinkable now. 130 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hirsch Vineyard
review: Intense and tannic, with racy blackberry, wild berry and cherry flavors that are young and vibrant, but in need of short-term cellaring. This is a somewhat worrisome wine whose future is in doubt. 120 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Olivet Lane Vineyard
review: Lean and narrow, with a crisp band of spicy Pinot Noir flavors, but nowhere near as opulent and concentrated as what Williams Selyem makes from this vineyard. 51 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard N Block
review: Strays out-of-bounds for Pinot Noir, with intense spicy, racy vegetal flavors, wild berry, tomato and minty notes--take your pick. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard N Block
review: More like a Syrah. Tart and earthy, pushing beyond fruit into beefy herb, oregano and spritzy metallic flavors that dominate the remaining earthy cherry flavors. Tough love.--California Pinot Noir retrospective.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Decadent, gamy flavors run through the ripe cherry, anise and prickly vinegar character. A very distinctive wine that tastes as though it might have remnants of malolactic fermentation flavor.--Pinot Noir Challenge.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: The color is already fading in this, turning light brick-red at the edges. Sure enough, the aromas are a bit simple (floral, mushroom) and the texture crisp, with green apple and unripe cherry flavors. Light-bodied, tart finish.--Pinot Noir Challenge.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Winemaker's Selection
review: Lean lemon-lime flavors feature an aggressive acidity, which imparts a juicy edge to the mineral, herb and citrus zest accents. Drink now. 36,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Spicy, with clove and nutmeg accents to the core of raspberry coulis, cranberry and cherry flavors. Sleek, juicy and persistent on the finish. Drink now through 2025. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Fresh herbal accents of lemon verbena and thyme add a fresh green note to the core of citrus and melon flavors. Juicy on the finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: An appealing squirt of lime juice gives the melon and mango flavors a fresh, juicy edge. Drink now. 4,500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain
review: Tight and sharply focused, with a wonderful core of currant, wild berry, mineral and spice flavors. Delivers the goods with richness, concentration, length and complexity. Best to cellar into 2000. 120 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain
review: A subtle, supple style from Howell Mountain, with polished cherry, currant, herb and cedary notes, holding tight focus on the finish, where the tannins turn elegant. Best from 2000 through 2008. 325 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain
review: Elegant for Howell Mountain, with ripe, complex currant, black cherry, mineral, sage and cedary oak flavors, picking up touches of clay and toasty oak. Forward and appealing now, this appears to be a midrange wine. Best from 1999 through 2005. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain
review: Firm and tight, a sleek, structured style, with spicy, cedary currant and leathery overtones. Gains richness and depth while maintaining its focus and sense of elegance. Drink now through 2010. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain
review: The most agreeable of the White Cottage reds, this starts out supple and firm, with expansive red berry, plum and currant fruit, leading to black licorice and cedar notes as this tightens and firms on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 441 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain
review: Tough and angular, it provides a solid array of supple coffee, mocha, currant and plum, with herb and anise notes, turning supple at midpalate, though firming up nicely on the finish. Needs aeration. Drink now through 2009. 425 cases made.

name: Celestia Howell Mountain
review: Dark and dense, with aromas of black currant and loamy earth joined by firm, complex flavors of plum, espresso and cedar, finishing with gritty tannins. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2013. 110 cases made.

name: Risa Napa Valley
review: Pushes ripeness to the edge of pruny, with rich, juicy plum and wild berry flavors to match, showing a supple texture. Tannins are ripe and well-integrated. Best from 2004 through 2012. 700 cases made.

name: Risa Napa Valley
review: A sleek and elegant style, with ripe, racy, earthy blackberry and wild berry fruit that shows a measure of earthiness and a touch of stemminess. Needs time for the tannins to soften. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2004 through 2012. 600 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: There's a fleshy note to the peach, melon and Bartlett pear flavors in this white, with details of citrus zest and floral aromatics. It's all nicely wrapped up in a focused, juicy package. Drink now. 515 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Howell Mountain
review: A savory style, marked by tobacco leaf, dried herb, mineral and dried currant. Full-bodied, balanced and varietally true, holding its flavor on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 120 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain
review: Herb, cedar, dill and dry currant and berry flavors form the core of this full-bodied effort. Turns austere and tannic on the finish. Drink now through . 648 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Howell Mountain
review: Supple and charming, with blackberry, herb and olive flavors that are harmonious and balanced. Cedary oak, cocoa tones and firm tannins fold through the finish. Drink now through 2009. 650 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Risa
review: Mixes ripe, dried currant with flavors of anise, black licorice and game meat that are rustic and earthy in a pleasant enough way. Full-bodied, ending with savory fruit flavors. Drink now through 2015. 678 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Homestead
review: Simple aromas of dill and cedar lead to supple plum and berry flavors that are pleasing, if tilting toward herbal, sweet-and-sour notes. Drink now through 2017. 103 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Reserve
review: This elegant Chardonnay has a good, bright, flinty edge despite its age, with pretty pear, apple and fig notes. Stylish presentation, with balance and length. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Viognier Monticello
review: Nicely focused, with peach, tangerine and green melon notes and a fresh, floral-tinged finish. Drink now. 942 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Virginia Unfiltered
review: Pretty black cherry and floral notes, with a touch of vanilla on the slightly firm finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Reserve
review: Spice and floral notes, with a crisp, flinty finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Virginia
review: Light and crisp, with white peach and floral notes. Quick finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Virginia
review: An herbal style with green pepper and berry flavors. It's a bit spritzy, too. 100 cases made.

name: Petit Verdot Monticello
review: This has airy sage and cherry notes, with a hint of cherry pit and light spritz on the finish. 445 cases made.

name: Cuvée des Champs Virginia
review: Flat root beer and dry licorice root notes. A murky, dull wine. Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. 125 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco
review: Slowly gains richness and depth, with green apple, pear, lemon and lime notes, ending with pithiness and light tannins. Drink now. 1,400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands
review: Presents a lively if muddled mix of mint, savory herb and wild berry flavors that works as a red table wine, less so as a Pinot Noir. Drink now. 1,400 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Maria Valley
review: Leather character dominates, with roasted herb, black fruit and earth tones. Drink now through 2006. 225 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County
review: Burned, charry flavors overwhelm the butter notes in this strange wine. 250 cases made.

name: Chantepierre Washington
review: Chunky, with modest cedar-tinged berry flavors, edging toward tobacco and herbs on the finish. Drinkable now. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Washington
review: Light, soft and mature, modest berry and plum flavors echoing against the spicy overtones. Drinkable now. 500 cases made.

name: Chantepierre Washington
review: Lean and a bit tannic, herbal notes mingling with the modest plum and spicy prune flavors. Best after 1995. 500 cases made.

name: Chantepierre Washington
review: Light and lean in flavor, with touches of jam and spice and a sweet finish. Drinkable but simple. Drink now.

name: Chantepierre Washington
review: Earthy, herbal and swampy; misses the mark with its thin tobacco and spice notes. Drinkable, but you can find much better.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Saunders Vineyard
review: Ripe and inviting, a firm-backboned, creamy-textured, oak-scented masterpiece, offering opulent raspberry, cherry, vanilla and spice flavors and nice hints of pepper and butter on the long finish. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Floral and citrus notes announce this zingy wine, rich in bright grapefruit, lemon-lime and melon flavors, with a tasteful touch of grassiness on the finish. The ensemble is complex, spritely and inspiring. 2,040 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Russian River Valley
review: A New Zealand look-alike, with a burst of fragrant passion fruit, grass and grapefruit flavors. Ripe nectarine tones supply the bass line, with fruit intensity that keeps pumping through the finish. Drink now. 2,950 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Alexander Valley
review: Shows off ripe fruit flavors aplenty, with smoke-accented plum and cherry notes, and has finesse and grace that make it quite appealing. Drink now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Saunders Vineyard
review: Ripe, firm and intense, with a tight, focused core of spicy, peppery Zinfandel flavors that take on a raspbery and cherry edge. Wonderful depth and persistence of flavor; tasty now, but can stand cellaring to soften. 180 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Has generous, lively fruit, with layers of rich, ripe, pineapple, pear and apple flavors and subtle oak shadings that are long and full on the palate. A pleasant mouthful of Chardonnay that lingers. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Myers Limited Reserve
review: At this youthful stage the toasty oak flavors override the spice and pear-laced Chardonnay fruit, but it holds together on the finish where it gains complexity. 472 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Appealing for its balance and focus, offering aromas of red currant and tobacco leaf and supple flavors of black cherry, pencil lead and spice. Drink now through 2015. 1,987 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Alexander Valley
review: Ripe and flavorful with its pretty cherry and wild berry accents; finishes with firm tannins and a spicy floral edge. Drinkable now. 200 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Limited Reserve
review: Intense and lively, with a ripe, spicy core of Zinfandel fruit that echoes cherry, raspberry and plum, finishing with firm tannins and crisp acidity. Should hold in the cellar until 1995. 480 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
review: Smooth, soft and pleasant, with grapey flavors that persist on the finish. Not very complex, but it has enough appeal to be worth drinking through 1997 or 1999. 393 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley
review: Ripe and generous, with very good richness to pear, peach and cream tones, accented by spicy oak that folds into a generous finish. Drink now. 3,447 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Solid, with a complex core of ripe pear, apple and melon flavors and finishing with a dash of oak. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Myers Limited Reserve
review: Bright in flavor, open-textured, with appealing apple, pear and spice flavors that echo on the soft finish. Drink now. 410 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Myers Limited Reserve
review: Tart, crisp green apple and pear notes add a hint of lemon and citrus. Well crafted; ready now. 426 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc California
review: Bright, fruity and utterly charming, unfolding its melon, mint and pear flavors with grace and style. Ready now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Classically old-school, with plum aromas and hints of tomato and herb, followed by well-focused cherry and underbrush flavors that finish with firm tannins. Drink now through 2013. 3,006 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: A full-bodied wine, redolent of fig, fresh pea, melon, hay and citrus. Weighty on the palate, it nonetheless finishes with a fresh, clean edge. Drink now through 2002. 1,350 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Russian River Valley
review: Concentrated, with herbal highlights of thyme and rosemary to the lemon, melon and nectarine flavors. Finishes with a refreshing punch of acidity. Drink now. 2,730 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Russian River Valley
review: Peach, citrus and yellow apple flavors have a pleasant musky quality, with a ripe, full body, plenty of tangy acidity and good persistence on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley
review: Easygoing, with black pepper, beef, blackberry and a hint of smoky leather. Rich and elegant flavors linger on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 1,980 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: Another solid Zinfandel from White Oak. This one's ripe, rich and intense, with a tight core of cherry and raspberry-scented flavors, finishing with a peppery, oaky edge that adds dimension and depth. Intense enough to cellar until 1995. 1,200 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: Very solid, full-bodied and deeply flavored, packed with ripe blackberry and raspberry flavors that linger on the finish. Firmly tannic but not overpowering. Drink now.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley
review: A well-built Zin, with a chunky core of cherry and menthol flavors, finishing with a firmly tannic edge. Try now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Alexander Valley Myers Limited Reserve
review: Straightforward apple and melon flavors have hints of vanilla and spice. A young, tight, focused wine that has a sense of harmony. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Myers Limited Reserve
review: A resinous note to the bright apple fruit gives this supple Chardonnay a jazzy feel. Easy to drink, and pleasing. 411 cases made.

name: Myers Limited Reserve Sonoma County
review: Fresh and grapey, featuring cassis, black cherry, wild berry, tar and herb, finishing with firm, well-integrated tannins. Needs time to develop. Best from 2000 through 2005. 430 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Starts with lemon flavors, picking up grapefruit, grass and mineral notes. Drink now. 1,300 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc North Coast
review: Ripe and intense, with tart lime skin, lemon, melon and grass character that will show best with food. Drink now. 5,005 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Russian River Valley
review: Peach and citrus flavors are crisp and clean, with touches of nectarine and yellow apple joined by herbal tea on the finish. Drink now. 1,736 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Russian River Valley
review: Offers bracing acidity, with lemon-lime flavors and a pungent note of grass and jalapeño. Direct and juicy, with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now. 5,838 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Russian River Valley
review: Tangy, with good intensity to the Key lime and lemon meringue flavors. Juicy, lingering finish. Drink now. 4,875 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Russian River Valley
review: Concentrated, with an array of tart nectarine, candied grapefruit and melon flavors. Lively citrus acidity, vanilla and a hint of onion peel shape the finish. Drink now. 2,775 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: A touch brambly, with a core of spice and cherry flavors and a berry note on the finish. Can stand cellaring into 1998. 600 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Limited Reserve
review: Lean and tarry, with a band of cedar and spice flavors followed by cherry and wild berry. Dry on the finish; could use short-term cellaring to soften. 406 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Alexander Valley
review: Firm and compact, with chewy tannins and just enough black cherry and berry flavors to hold your interest. Best after 1996.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
review: Medium bodied, with appealing plum, cherry and cedary oak. Nothing fancy, but well made. 584 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
review: Forward and pleasing, with cedary currant, spice and oak flavors that are compact and ring true for Cabernet. A bit austere now, but may be more alluring with a year or three in the cellar. Drink after 1995.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Myers Limited Reserve
review: Very tight and tannic in structure, but the ripe, sweet cherry flavors underneath promise a much better wine if it's cellared beyond 1993.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County
review: Very ripe, generous, chunky and a bit awkward now, but it offers plenty of currant and plum aromas and flavors. Has a vegetal edge that should make this more complex as it ages. Best after 1995.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Focused and spicy, offering a good combination of ripe pineapple and pear flavors, with spicy oak nuances. Lively, full-bodied and flavorful. Enjoy now through 1993.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Chunky, with good concentration to lime skin, cantaloupe, vanilla and crisp lemon flavors. Drink now. 744 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Saunders Vineyard
review: An earthy, spicy Zin, with tar, pepper and wild berry flavors that lose their focus at mid-palate. Drinkable now. 228 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: Firm, tight and gamy, with wild berry, cherry and plum flavors. Drinkable now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Limited Reserve
review: Marked by a mint-menthol character at first, but it picks up pleasant wild berry and cherry notes and firm tannins. Drinkable now. 625 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Alexander Valley
review: Fresh, fruity, lively and youthful, with crisp acidity, cherry and plum aromas and soft tannins. A medium-bodied wine to drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
review: Despite ample ripe, spicy and exotic wild berry and cherry flavor, it turns simple and loses its focus and intensity on the finish. Drinkable now. 621 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Tasty grape jam flavors mingle with toasty oak notes on a chewy frame. Drink now. 3,674 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Poplar Ranch Private Reserve
review: A pleasant, well-oaked wine with intense ripe pear, spice and nutmeg flavors. Could ultimately be more complex. 250 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Russian River Valley
review: The tangy lemon-lime flavors have plenty of herbal accents, especially on the hoppy, crisp finish. Drink now. 2,730 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Russian River Valley
review: Grassy, featuring fresh herb notes up front, with light-bodied and crisp flavors of lemon, lime and melon. Drink now. 1,537 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Russian River Valley
review: Citrus, pear and peach flavors have a slightly candied edge, with soft acidity and a slight herbal note with modest intensity. Drink now. 2,930 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Marked by lean, earthy grapefruit and citrus flavors, but not much in the way of ripe fruit. 3,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Monarch Vineyard
review: Concentrated, with fresh sage, green been, tomato vine, plum and black cherry flavors wrapped within toasty oak and firm tannins. Drink now through 2005. 1,700 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma County
review: Light, spicy and lean, with pear and herb flavors that soften on the finish. Drinkable now.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Poplar Ranch Private Reserve
review: A touch earthy and astringent, with just a hint of light pear and oak coming through. 250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Myers Limited Reserve
review: Ripe and round, a fruity wine that wraps its pear and pineapple flavors with a blanket of vanilla-tinged oak. Flavorful and easy to drink. Nice tension between fruit and oak. Could use more complexity.

name: Zinfandel Alexander Valley Church Vineyard
review: Has a wild berry streak in it, with an unripe edge. Overall, a rustic style that hangs together well. Drinkable now. 203 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
