review: Slightly brushy aromas and generally unripe flavors. Lean and somewhat unfriendly in texture and flavor. Drink now through 2006. 614 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Fruity and straightforward, with pineapple, floral and spice flavors. Not very sophisticated, but a good, fruity wine.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Crisp and zesty. Lively fresh-squeezed lemon and green apple flavors make this an appealing wine to smell and drink now. Made in a light style .

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma County
review: Crisp in texture, showing simple, spicy aromas and flavors and a pleasant touch of vanilla on the finish. Not very varietal, but nice enough.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Poplar Ranch Private Reserve
review: Has a bitter edge to its bright apple flavor, making it feel a bit raw. Try in 1998. 458 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: A spicy wine, with ripe pear and apple flavors that turn simple and uninspired. Good quality, but it's hard to get past the first glass.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Myers Limited Reserve
review: A good, pleasant wine that blends modest fruit flavors, spice and butter for a complete but not concentrated package.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma County
review: Unapologetic Sauvignon Blanc: crisp and herbal in flavor, light in body and texture and clean on the finish. Refreshing and straightforward.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: A clumsy wine whose wood and fruit flavors don't marry: the pear is marred in bitter oak. 3,100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Lean berry and herb flavors fall toward a stemmy, gritty style. 6,160 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Alexander Valley
review: Hard and oaky without a core of fruit this lean, austere, thinly flavored wine lacks soul. Drinkable, but there are much better wines on the market.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Light and refreshing for its bright, peppery apple and guava flavors. Ready now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Unwooded
review: Simple and straightforward, soft enough to feel a bit sweet, with modest pear and spice flavors. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Laureate Cave Hill Reserve
review: Very complex and complete, with fresh, snappy plum, wild berry and fresh earth flavors, complemented by firm, ripe tannins that veer toward black licorice, anise and savory herb nuances, maintaining focus.2005 California Cabernet blind retrospective (September 2015). Drink now through 2020.

name: Claret Napa Valley
review: Intense and concentrated, with cedar- and dill-nuanced oak flavors wrapped around a tight, compact core of herb and earthy currant flavors. While hard and tannic, the flavors are deep and persistent on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Best from 2004 through 2012. 1,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Lots of spicy notes, with ripe, complex apple and pear, preserving the fruit purity and eschewing oak, leaving an elegant, polished, fruity aftertaste. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Perfumed, with flavors of ripe fruit, nutmeg, cinnamon, pear, fig and melon, this is complex and elegant, with a long, spicy finish. Drink now through 2001. 1,080 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Marked by ripe fruit flavors and a spicy, Muscat-like edge, its pear, hazelnut and nutmeg flavors are elegant and well focused. Very appealing and ready now. 1,370 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Crisp and bright, with lively peach, pineapple and floral aromas and flavors that focus sharply on the finish, resulting in a long, appealing aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Claret Napa Valley
review: Bordeaux-like. Offering hints of maturity, bridging youthful, earthy currant, mineral and sage with anise and graphite, it's chewy and concentrated, full-bodied and firmly tannic. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2014. 400 cases made.

name: Claret Napa Valley
review: Dark, firm and concentrated, with rich, plush currant, chocolate, blackberry and herbal-cedary flavors supported by tightly wound tannins that coat the palate. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Best from 2006 through 2012. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Well-centered, with spicy currant and blackberry fruit that firms up nicely, ending with crisp acidity and tannins and an intriguing light toasty oak note. Drink now through 2012. 1,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Laureate
review: Very ripe and racy, with zesty wild berry, dried currant and black cherry fruit that's also quite firm and tannic, providing good structure and focus as well as enough intensity to cellar short-term. Best from 2010 through 2015. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Fresh and snappy, with a trim, tight beam of mineral, green apple, citrus and spice. Mouthwatering on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Chablis-like, built on green fruit, tasting of apple, pear and melon flavors that are clean and vibrant. Medium- to full-bodied, ending with a citrusy and minerally edge. Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Sleek, with a pithy lime, nectarine and citrus edge to the flinty green apple notes. An appealing style that hones in on the fruit and avoids oak as a crutch. Drink now through 2013. 800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Sleek, with tangy peach and nectarine flavors that are fresh and lively, with vibrant acidity that keeps the flavors dancing. Drink now. 620 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Weaves together an appealing band of herb and citrus-laced pear, oak, apple and spice flavors, finishing with a leafy edge and a hint of earthiness. Drink now through 2005. 1,030 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Durant Vineyard
review: This spicy style overlays nutmeg, cream and pepper notes over rich cherry and sassafras flavors, lingering expressively on the polished finish. Has presence and length. Drink now through 2022. 144 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Broad and spicy, with blueberry and plum flavors at the core, showing hints of licorice and smoke as the firm tannins lend structure to the long finish. Needs cellaring to gain flesh. Best from 2018 through 2024. 853 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Chehalem Mountains Lia's Vineyard
review: Light and lithe, with nubby tannins wrapped around creamy red cherry and raspberry flavors, showing a hint of crushed rock that lends a savory note to the elegant and persistent finish. Drink now through 2020. 71 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Appellation Series
review: Firm and focused, yet light on its feet, aiming a beam of dark berry, cherry, herb and tar flavors through a layer of slightly scratchy tannins. This all comes together with refinement on the finish. Best from 2012 through 2018. 388 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Expressive violet and cherry aromas open to well-structured red plum, clove and savory tea flavors that finish with refined tannins. Drink now through 2024. 525 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Lithe, with a supple feel to the red berry, cinnamon and nutmeg flavors, lingering gently as the finish hovers. Offers impeccable balance and grace. Drink now through 2017. 1,668 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Chehalem Mountains Lia's Vineyard
review: Ripe and vibrant, with fine tannins and transparency. The flavors are centered on blackberry and licorice, finishing harmoniously and impressively long. Drink now through 2020. 119 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Appellation Series
review: Light and spicy, with distinctive clove and caraway overtones to the cherry fruit, lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 239 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Guillen Vineyard
review: This savory style weaves sassafras and tree bark notes into red berry and cherry flavors, finishing with brightness and distinctive character against fine tannins. Best from 2019 through 2024. 424 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills White Rose Vineyard
review: Lighter and more transparent than most 2014s, this brims with raspberry and red cherry flavors on a sleek frame, finishing with polish and presence. Drink now through 2022. 698 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light and spicy, this is aromatic with clove and mace overtones to its raspberry and lime flavors, remaining lively and persistent as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2017. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Chehalem Mountains Appellation Series
review: Light and fragrant, offering blueberry-tinged currant and spice flavors that ride on polished tannins through a refined finish. Drink now through 2017. 269 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Quiotee's Lair
review: Light and silky, with raspberry and strawberry notes lilting through the lean, crisp structure. Drink now through 2011. 371 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Estate
review: Lithe, polished and appealing for its graceful balance and easy-to-like cherry, blueberry and mint flavors, lingering gently on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 198 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills White Rose Vineyard
review: Light and delicate, with modest raspberry and tea leaf flavors that linger on the deft finish. Drink now through 2014. 308 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills White Rose Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, with a bite of tannin around a tight core of black cherry and herb flavors, pushing into the fine-grained finish. Best from 2013 through 2018. 176 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley The Neo-Classical Objective
review: Light and floral, with cherry, guava and citrus flavors on a lively frame, finishing with presence. Drink now through 2020. 545 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Winemaker's Cuvée
review: Firm in texture and bright in flavor, with raspberry, red pepper and floral character on a zingy frame, lively through the finish. Best from 2018 through 2022. 625 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Winemaker's Cuvée
review: Firm in texture, with a streak of orange peel and spice running through the modest blackberry and coffee flavors, lingering gently. Drink now through 2018. 48 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Quiotee's Lair
review: Light and fragrant, with a leathery edge to the pretty raspberry flavors, lingering softly. Drink now through 2011. 853 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Firm and chewy, with gritty tannins gripping the blueberry and earthy spice flavors, persisting on the refined finish. The tannins need time to resolve. Best after 2016. 1,094 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Chehalem Mountains Luciole Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, with grainy tannins around a lean core of spicy plum flavors, finishing with a mix of fruit and earth. Best after 2016. 140 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Appellation Series
review: Very light, with a cinnamon spiciness adding interest to the modest cherry flavors. Lingers delicately. Drink now through 2015. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 834 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills White Rose Vineyard Whole Cluster
review: Tight, with a tannic, tobacco-infused edge to the modest raspberry flavors, finishing on an earthy note. Drink now through 2014. 124 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Chehalem Mountains Lia's Vineyard
review: Light and velvety, with a cooked edge to the cherry and herb flavors. Drink now through 2017. 240 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills White Rose Vineyard
review: Light, taut and modest in scope, with red berry and spice notes pushing through the firm tannins. Best after 2013. 123 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Anderson Family Vineyard
review: Tart and lean, with modest notes of cherry, mineral and herb. Best after 2017. 172 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light, crisp tannins underline the modest tea leaf-accented berry and earth flavors. Drink now through 2016. 582 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Chehalem Mountains Luciole Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, with chewy tannins around a light core of cherry and allspice flavors, tightening on the finish. Best from 2015 through 2017. 230 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Anderson Family Vineyard
review: Light and tight, with grippy tannins around a modest core of cherry, oregano and wet earth flavors. Needs cellaring to soften. Best after 2015. 141 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Winemaker's Cuvée
review: Light and earthy, with loamy notes more prominent than fruit. This comes together on the delicate finish. Drink now through 2016. 99 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County Estate
review: Earthy, gamy flavors prevail over the otherwise attractive raspberry and floral flavors, which battle it out on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Guillen Vineyard
review: This tart, light-weight style offers a tight structure, with a steely edge to the blackberry and tomato leaf flavors, lingering on the savory finish. Comes up short on fruit. Best after 2015. 265 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County Quiotee's Lair
review: Strong gamy flavors pervade this wine, which also has solid raspberry and floral flavors. The gaminess wins. Drink now. 238 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Greg's River
review: Awful, with gamy, metallic flavors that don't quit.   147 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: Fresh and lively, with good slate, lime and quince notes and a bouncy finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: Fresh, with driven lime and slate notes backed by a bright green apple note. This has a tangy, tasty finish. Drink now through 2010. 527 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Red Label
review: Ripe and forward, with good apple, cinnamon and anise notes backed by a round, modestly juicy finish. Drink now. 325 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes
review: Firm, with pink grapefruit and lemon zest notes that stay bracing through the bitter almond-tinged finish. Drink now. 322 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes
review: Green apple and lime fruit is offset by a hint of grapefruit, with a light-bodied finish. Drink now. 147 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Finger Lakes
review: Cherry and tobacco notes lead to a fresh, persistent finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Finger Lakes
review: Bright cherry fruit is laced with spice and red currant hints. Slightly firm finish, but stays fresh enough. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Late Harvest
review: Frankly sweet, with good peach and apricot notes that stay just fresh enough on the finish. Drink now. 235 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Finger Lakes
review: Light and crisp, with good thyme and lemon notes, followed by a fresh finish. Drink now. 447 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Finger Lakes
review: Forward, with a slightly muddled edge to the cherry and rhubarb notes, followed by modest spice hints on the rounded finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Fumé Blanc Finger Lakes
review: Soft, with whiffs of straw and white asparagus backed by a dash of butter on the finish. Drink now. 130 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Finger Lakes
review: This shows crisp herb and lime notes, with a very quick finish. Drink now. 220 cases made.

name: Chardonnay-Pinot Grigio Finger Lakes
review: Light, with modest peach and pippin apple notes. Drink now. 130 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Moon Shadow
review: A touch blowsy, with modest green plum and pineapple notes. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 345 cases made.

name: Fumé Blanc Finger Lakes
review: Lean, with chive and lemon notes that stay slightly curt through the finish. A touch too herbal in the end. 120 cases made.

name: Chardonnay-Pinot Grigio Finger Lakes
review: Light, with modest butter and faint melon notes, turning a bit tinny on the finish. 458 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County Unoaked
review: Fresh, fragrant floral scents carry over to the palate, with hints of pear, spice and honeysuckle. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: California
review: Appealing for its light-bodied, easy-drinking, crisp acidity and straightforward notes of lemon-lime, peach, melon and spice. Sauvignon Blanc, Chardonnay, Pinot Grigio and Viognier. Drink now. 22,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio California
review: Tangy peach and apple flavors are light and refreshing, punctuated by spice and floral notes, with a crisp, mouthwatering acidity. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Tangy citrus and mineral flavors feature spicy orange peel notes on a medium body, with enough acidity to keep this balanced. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Moscato California
review: The peach, floral and spice notes are modest, set on a light body, with a juicy finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Black Label
review: Light and lively, with a direct, refreshing lemon-lime core. Drink now. 5,550 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Leonardini Vineyard
review: A wonderful orchestration of ripe, plush, polished Cabernet fruit. Round, fleshy, elegant and stylish, with creamy red currant, plum and black cherry fruit that's still sharply focused, with hints of truffle and mushroom on a long, lingering finish.--1996 California Cabernet retrospective. Drink now through 2012.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: An immense effort, dark, rich and deeply concentrated, packed with layers of rich currant, chocolate, mocha, cherry and herbal nuances. Finishes with a powerful, persistent aftertaste, rich, ripe tannins and wonderful complexity. Best from 2003 through 2012. 12,280 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Supple, elegant style, mint rampant on a field of currant, subtle, cedary, harmonious. Great concentration without great weight, absolutely delicious now, but there's enough tannin to hold it 10 years or more. Try it around 1992-93.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Morisoli Vineyard Reserve
review: Remarkably complex and concentrated, with an appealing core of currant, black cherry, vanilla and spice. Finishes with smooth, polished tannins and a wonderful sense of harmony. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Leonardi Vineyard
review: Aging quite nicely, this is still rich and pure, with plenty of blackberry, wild berry, dried herb and cedary oak flavors, showing subtle spice and floral scents. Ends with a solid push of ripe, juicy fruit.2005 California Cabernet blind retrospective (September 2015). Drink now through 2022.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Leonardini Vineyard
review: An ultrarich, deeply concentrated, richly flavored wine, loaded with complex currant, spice and black cherry, hints of plum, framed by toasty, smoky oak. A plush, chewy but polished style, thick and flavorful from start to finish. Best from 2000 through 2010. 260 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: A wonderful mix of spicy wild berry, black currant, sage and mineral flavors. Full-bodied and slow to unfold, but expansive, gaining depth and richness on the finish, with a grainy, minerally aftertaste. Drink now through 2019. 2,280 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Silver Anniversary Reserve
review: Smooth, rich and fleshy, with concentrated currant, mineral and blackberry fruit that's supple and engaging. Well-proportioned, ending with dusty, cedary oak that adds a nice dimension. Best from 2008 through 2013. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford Morisoli Vineyard Reserve
review: Young, dark and concentrated, with sharply focused currant, black cherry, plum and spicy flavors, smooth, supple tannins and a long, rich aftertaste. Tempting now, but worthy of cellaring, too. Best after 2002. 2,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: A young, bright and well-focused Merlot, unveiling a rich, complex core of currant, black cherry, cedar and toasty oak flavors. Notable for its length and concentration, it finishes with a long, lively aftertaste. This California red is approachable now, will be smoother in 1999. From a winery worth watching. 4,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Leonardini Vineyard Reserve
review: Bold, ripe and delicious, with tiers of rich plum, currant and black cherry flavor, smooth, polished tannins and a rich, deep aftertaste, where the flavors linger on and on. Drinks well now but worthy of cellaring, too. 560 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Wonderful purity of flavor, built around a solid, concentrated core of intense black cherry and blackberry fruit, with hints of cedar, sage, ansie and cassis flavors that are focused and long on the finish, ending with a rich, fruity aftertaste. Best from 2005 through 2012. 18,860 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Leonardini Vineyard
review: Rich, intense and full-bodied, this is aging very well, exhibiting dried currant, herb, mineral, sage, dusty berry and cedary oak. Turns supple and layered on the finish, where this gains more depth and complexity.—1999 California Cabernet blind retrospective (2009). Drink now through 2014. 240 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Morisoli Vineyard Reserve
review: Still showing ample oak, with rich dill, kirsch, blackberry and black cherry fruit that's intense and concentrated, if short on polish and finesse. Ruggedly tannic, but the fruit works through.--1993 California Cabernet retrospective. Drink now through 2006. 1,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Explosively flavorful on a razor's edge of fine acidity, a zingy panoply of green apple, passion fruit, lime and green chili pepper notes that keep breezing their way through the lively finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Vivid, with fresh, grassy green notes to complement the juicy lemon-lime core, accented by a hint of pineapple. Drink now. 460,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Pear, peach and apricot flavors are spicy and smooth, with a juicy finish and plenty of intensity, finishing with Meyer lemon zest. Drink now. 170,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright and lively, balancing its floral lime aromas and flavors against hints of guava, pineapple and sweet pea; finishes tart, but nicely rounded off. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright and juicy, gleaming with lime-scented apple and passion fruit flavors, which echo nicely on the zingy finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: A bright, juicy wine, showing good intensity to the Key lime and kiwifruit flavors, with lively, detailed notes of green melon and citrus. Light-bodied and smooth. Drink now. 75,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Tart, with bright lime and green pear aromas and flavors that point nicely through the zingy finish. Drink now. 100,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: This open-textured style appeals with its generous pear and passion fruit flavors, mingling nicely on the polished, refined finish. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: A core of wild raspberry and strawberry flavors are very pure and focused, with plenty of tobacco, spice and cedar details firming up on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Serves up very good intensity to crushed stone, black pepper and cherry flavors, with fresh herbs, cedary oak and a lively, lingering structure. Drink now through 2009. 6,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Offers a good mix of grass, lemongrass and lime flavors up front, with melon notes, a fleshy body and a refreshing finish. Drink now. 52,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Lemony, offering melon, peach, lemongrass and mango details that are ripe, fleshy and easily refreshing. Drink now. 74,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Racy style offers pear and black pepper aromas and flavors, finishing with a tart edge. Drink now. 20,700 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Taut, with very good intensity to plum, black cherry and cinnamon flavors framed by cedary oak. Spice accents and green tea shape the finish. Drink now through 2010. 6,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Crisp and juicy, with anise-scented currant and plum flavors on a racy frame. Tannins don't get in the way. Has a sense of refinement. Best from 2000 through 2004. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Smooth and juicy, with grapefruit, green apple and lime flavors that have a peppery, herbal edge and vivid acidity. Drink now. 140,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Light and jazzy, with pretty herb and melon flavors up front and a nice hint of citrus on the finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: The green apple and citrus flavors have a crunchy acidity and a peppery, lemon verbena freshness. Drink now. 130,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Grassy, with good intensity to tart lime juice and bell pepper flavors. Drink now. 65,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Earthy, sour flavors needle themselves into the mix of red cherry, cinnamon and tangy, almost citrusy character. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: On the firm side. A light wine with chewy texture and raspberry and cedar flavors, which echo lightly on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 3,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Tart, with grass, jalapeño and dried lime skin flavors. Drink now. 90,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Light and fruity, with pretty raspberry and toasty, smoky notes. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Columbia Valley Haig Family Estate Lake Roosevelt Shores Vineyard
review: Offers a polished texture, with lovely transparency to the floral berry flavors, edging toward a weedy accent on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 200 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Lake Roosevelt Shores Vineyard
review: Fascinating, this has both red pepper and blueberry currant flavors vying for attention, riding over very fine tannins as the finish persists nicely, reflecting some white pepper notes. Drink now through 2012. 160 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Lake Roosevelt Shores Vineyard
review: Firm and ripe, offering blueberry and currant fruit shaded with layers of sage, mint and wet earth. Lingers with refined tannins. Best from 2009 through 2014. 160 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Hyde Vineyard
review: Strawberry flavors mingle nicely with cola and herb notes, with slightly firm tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2001. 295 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Hyde Vineyard
review: Smoky, with a tarry edge, its fruit character is light and simple, with grapey flavors, hints of dried cherry and plum. Drink now through 2001. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: A simple, cherry-flavored wine. Fading fast, however. 250 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley Haynes Vineyard
review: Not especially varietal. Chunky, with currant, lavender, mint and pine notes that get a bit clipped on the moderately tannic finish. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley Haynes Vineyard
review: Sweet-tasting strawberry, spice and toast notes are pleasant on a medium frame. Drink now. 361 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley
review: Big, rich, ripe and graceful, with layers and layers of dense blackberry, cherry, plum, game and peppery spice flavors that linger on the long, generous, firm finish. Impressive now, but give it time. Best from 2006 through 2012. 740 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley
review: Bright and juicy, a lively mouthful of spicy blackberry, pomegranate and watermelon flavors, lingering on the jazzy finish, hitting a meaty note as the fruit lingers impressively. Drink now through 2010. 596 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
review: Lithe and focused, offering coffee- and olive-scented currant and tar flavors, lingering on the polished, satiny finish. Manages to feel aristocratic and down-to-earth at the same time. Drink now through 2015. 957 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley
review: Ripe and rich, with a tarry edge to the juicy plum and dried blueberry flavors. A big wine, this has a muscular feel as the tannins submerge themselves under the fruit and the finish rolls on beautifully. Drink now through 2013. 1,100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Broad, generous and distinctive for its currant and plum flavors and panoply of spices, showing hints of nutmeg, clove and pink peppercorn as the finish waxes and wanes. Best from 2010 through 2015. 488 cases made.

name: Viognier Columbia Valley
review: Feels subdued at first, but the fresh flavors of pear, carambola and flowers well up nicely at the finish and persist into the second and third sip. This Viognier has more elegance than most. Drink now. 420 cases made.

name: Viognier Columbia Valley
review: Rich, ripe and spicy, a blast of pear, nectarine, floral and nutmeg clove aromas and flavors that whizzes through the long, generous finish. Drink now. 397 cases made.

name: Viognier Walla Walla Valley
review: Smooth and spicy, with pretty violet and pear flavors mingling with lychee and grapefruit character on the refined finish. Drink now through 2012. 456 cases made.

name: Viognier Walla Walla Valley
review: Ripe and round, but not over the top, a lively mouthful of lime- and coconut-scented pear and nectarine flavors, lingering on the polished, harmonious finish. Drink now. 336 cases made.

name: Viognier Walla Walla Valley
review: Rich in texture and generous with its apricot, pear and dusky spice flavors, which echo on the round finish. Drink now through 2005. 198 cases made.

name: Viognier Walla Walla Valley
review: Broad and spicy, with strong clove and pepper notes weaving through the pineapple and pear flavors, balanced with tangy acidity. Drink now. 162 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
review: Despite firm, coarse tannins, this has ample black cherry and sweet red pepper flavors at the core, finishing with persistence. Best after 2005. 250 cases made.

name: Merlot Walla Walla Valley
review: Rich and spicy, with cedar, green olive and tarry notes working around the blackberry flavors, persisting on the finish. Drink now through 2008. 862 cases made.

name: Narcissa Red Walla Walla Valley
review: Distinctly floral, with an earthy edge to the violet and currant aromas and flavors, finishing with firm tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best after 2008. 2,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
review: Aims for a transparent claret-style feel and gets a sort of light-textured character, with cherry and spice flavors that seem to hover over the finish. Drink now through 2010. 710 cases made.

name: Syrah California Social Commentary
review: Firm, with beef, herb, berry and cola flavors. Brawny tannins clamp down on the cedary finish. Drink now through 2008. 1,300 cases made.

name: Viognier California Get Lucky!
review: Fragrant, with good depth to honeysuckle and nectarine flavors. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Brut de Noir Willamette Valley Sans Année
review: Crisp and spicy, toasty, with ginger and allspice notes adding interest to the lemony flavors. 750 cases made.

name: Brut Oregon
review: Tastes quite dry and austere, with tart lemon and grapefruit flavors that almost seem green. A decent drink, but rough edged. 460 cases made.

name: Brut Oregon Grand Cuvée
review: A lean, crisp, austere style of sparkling wine, with green apple and grapefruit rind aromas and flavors that are slightly bitter on the finish.

name: Brut de Noir Willamette Valley Sans Année
review: A nice doughy nose and light fruit flavors are marred by a bitter finish. Not well balanced overall, but drinkable. 460 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Sawmill Creek Vineyards
review: Modest in scale, but with good focus and zip to the mix of yellow apple, chamomile and white peach notes. Drink now through 2018. 100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes Sawmill Creek Vineyards Reserve
review: Tangy cherry and cranberry flavors are mixed with flickers of herb and tobacco. Stays on the crisp side through the finish. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Adelaide Hills
review: Light and zingy, with passion fruit notes running through the lively green apple and floral flavors, gliding into a bright and refreshing finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Adelaide Hills
review: Bright and peppery, with juicy plum and berry flavors sliding in behind the up-front, spicy flavors, lingering on the lively finish. Drink now through 2015. 2,300 cases made.

name: Riesling Adelaide Hills
review: Fresh, open-textured and light, with a peppery streak running through the pear and citrus flavors, lingering gently. Best after 2016. 500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Adelaide Hills
review: Tangy, with pear and lime flavors that dance around a crisp backbone. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Adelaide Hills
review: Crisp, with fine tannins around a lively core of currant, plum and black tea flavors, persisting into a vibrant finish. Needs time to soften the chalky tannins. Best after 2017. 2,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet Adelaide Hills Tom & Mitch
review: The wild berry flavors have fresh herbal and briary accents, set on a sleek frame, with polished tannins. Drink now through 2027. 10,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Adelaide Hills
review: An odd duck, tart but dense, with tarry, licorice flavors more prominent than the dark fruit. Finishes with a dried tomato note. Best after 2016. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Adelaide Hills
review: Green herb and vegetal notes clip the plum flavors, with raw, drying tannins. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Finger Lakes Private Reserve
Seyval Blanc Finger Lakes Private Reserve
Altus Spumante Arkansas
review: Sweet bubble gum aromas and flavors turn surprisingly delicate and charming, seeming more like pear and tropical fruit. Similar to an Italian Asti Spumante. Finishes clean, fruity and sweet. Drink now.

name: Muscat Arkansas di Tanta Maria Altus
review: Sweet, with flavors that remind us of bubble gum and orange or nectarine. The texture is odd, gritty rather than smooth.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Arkansas Mountain
review: Ripe but cooked aromas and flavors characterize this soft-textured wine, hinting at green bean on the finish. Still, impressively fruity for a 13-year-old wine.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Wien Nussberg
review: Very honeyed and structured, with intense grapefruit, apricot, fig and white chocolate flavors. Fresh and lively as well, with a lovely finish of candied citrus, honey and spice. Not imported into the U.S. Neuburger, Pinot Blanc, Riesling, Grüner Veltliner and others. Drink now through 2018. 20 cases made.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Wien Nussberg
review: A delicious TBA with intense flavors of apricot, citrus and musky botrytis, matched to a lush texture and focused by a vivid structure. Long finish with a caramel aftertaste. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2010.

name: Beerenauslese Wien Nussberg
review: Exotic and seductive for its coconut, apricot and orange notes displayed on a lithe, delicate frame. Not that concentrated as dessert wines go, however it has lively, refreshing acidity and it's all balanced. Drink now through 2005.

name: Riesling Kabinett Trocken Vienna
review: Sleek, spicy and exciting with a lovely silky texture and zingy fruit character. Medium-bodied, with fine acidity and a long finish. A very good Riesling.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg
review: A ripe, extroverted style, perhaps even botrytized, offering apricot, mango and pineapple flavors. It's balanced on the soft side, with enough acidity and a hint of grapefruit peel on the finish. Drink now through 2008.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Rieden Cuvée
review: A beautifully defined Riesling displaying floral, lime and tropical fruit aromas and flavors, a medium to full body, vivid structure and a mouthwatering finish. Best from 2000 through 2005. 330 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Herrenholz
review: Elegant Grüner Veltliner, showing grapefruit, spice, licorice and mineral flavors on a firmly structured, rich frame. Just lacks length on the finish to be outstanding. Drink now through 2003.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Select
review: Unctuous plum and mulberry flavors are spicy and feature notes of hoisin sauce. The long finish echoes with cherry pie and plum pudding accents. Very expressive. Drink now through 2016. 21 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg Alte Reben
review: Good concentration, with fresh flavors of citrus, honey, melon and fig and a mouthwatering finish of spice. Well done. Grüner Veltliner, Weissburgunder, Sylvaner, Neuberger and Zierfandler. Drink now through 2008. 100 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg Alte Reben
review: Reduced aromas of hard-boiled egg, but there's a serious wine underneath. Rich, solidly structured and full of intense pear, fig and spice notes. It's medium-bodied, but heady, and should develop well over the next few years. Best from 2003 through 2006.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg Alte Reben
review: Superb. Full-bodied and concentrated, yet the peach, lentil and grapefruit flavors are delineated by the electric structure. Richly textured, and crisp on the finish, this would be ideal with stuffed roast pork. Drink now through 2005. 300 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Wien Wiener Gemischter Satz Nussberg
review: Rich, with a honeyed aroma, and flavors of baked pear, apple tart and marzipan. Tarragon cream notes on the smoky and minerally finish.  Drink now through 2018. 170 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Rieden Cuvée
review: A gorgeous wine, ripe, with peach, apricot and citrus flavors all woven into a smooth texture and tensile structure. The finish picks up mineral notes. Drink now through 2004. 450 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Select
review: Exotic, offering tropical fruit, apricot and honey aromas and flavors up front, rich and round, followed by a wave of refreshing acidity that cleanses the palate and keeps the flavors pumping. Drink now through 2004. 155 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Vienna Grand Select
review: Rich, oaky and stylish, displaying nutmeg, fig and smoke aromas in addition to appley fruit, this is a very good version of the international style. Firmly structured and dry, it should pair well with food. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2001. 125 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Herrenholz
review: Rich, ripe and smoky, with plenty of power and structure behind the ripe peach, ruby grapefruit and lentil flavors. The finish is creamy. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Leicht & Trocken
review: Gorgeous Grüner. From the complex peach, lanolin and tobacco aromas to the crisp, minerally finish, this has good structure and balance and an immediate appeal. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg
review: Pure slate in aroma, this is packed with lentil, grapefruit, almond and white pepper flavors, all displayed in a rich, firm structure. Good lingering finish, with some heat. Drink now through 2004.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg Alte Reben
review: A ripe, smoky white, exhibiting rich, baked peach and apple tart flavors, with a powerfully spicy finish. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg Alte Reben
review: Exotic. Tropical fruit nuances of mango, guava and papaya mark this exuberant, full-bodied white, which has a firm structure and turns leaner on the finish. It needs a bit more time to integrate. Grüner Veltliner, Weissburgunder, Sylvaner, Neuberger and Zierfandler. Best from 2005 through 2008.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Wiener Gemischter Satz
review: Redolent of fresh-cut apple, with ripe citrus notes and hints of dried fig. The lush finish reveals accents of anise and a strong spicy component. A field blend of Grüner Veltliner, Weissburgunder, Welschriesling, Chardonnay and others. Drink now through 2017. 2,000 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Wien Wiener Gemischter Satz
review: A medium-bodied white, with plenty of juiciness to the baked-apple and pear tart flavors, this is lightly spiced, with zesty acidity on the finish.  Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Jungenberg
review: This starts out crisp and well-defined with peach and apple flavors. It picks up a richness midpalate that lasts through the lingering peach and white pepper finish. Nice harmony. Drink now through 2008.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Select
review: Ripe and succulent in texture, displaying peach and nectrarine flavors and a lemon note on the finish. Well-balanced and lingering on the aftertaste. Drink now through 2005. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Vienna Hills
review: Firm, with a ripe, smoky edge to the pear, pastry and apricot tart flavors. The lush finish is balanced and well-structured, with an accent of cream. Drink now through 2017. 28 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Grand Select
review: Well-made in an international style. A very oaky yet very serious white, firm and youthful, with apple and pear shaded by clove and nutmeg accents. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Herrenholz
review: A spicy, supple style, offering baked apple and pear tart flavors, with plenty of smoky notes mixed in, followed by a juicy finish. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Herrenholz
review: Tropical, offering passion fruit, guava and peach aromas and flavors up front, then a white pepper note emerges. Like two different wines today, with bright acidity, then the tropical fruit comes back on the finish. Drink now through 2006.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Herrenholz
review: Tasty, displaying a fine balance between the quince and grapefruit notes, lush texture and bright acidity. It's light in weight and lingers nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 300 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Herrenholz
review: A delicious Grüner Veltliner from start to finish. Lean and intense, with focused apple, white pepper and grapefruit notes that persist through the lingering finish. Drink now through 2002. 300 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Kaasgraben
review: A ripe style, with lots of pear, baked apple and peach flavors. The well-seasoned finish features white pepper and hints of curry. Drink now. 333 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Preussen
review: A ripe style, with smoky overtones to the ruby grapefruit, pear and peach flavors, followed by hints of white chocolate on the finish. Drink now. 5 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Preussen
review: This lush white shows a smoky allure, with ripe flavors of mineral, white pepper and peach that extend on the creamy finish. Drink now through 2009. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Select
review: Elegant red cherry and dried berry flavors are smooth and well-spiced, with hints of sandalwood on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 5 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Wien Select
review: A spicy and refined red, with notes of sandalwood to the red cherry and plum flavors, which are supported by medium-grained tannins. Crisp finish.  Drink now.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien
review: This white is crisp, almost austere, showing flavors of citrus and green apple that extend with spicy notes on the minerally finish. Grüner Veltliner, Welschriesling, Weissburgunder, Chardonnay, Neuberger, Traminer, Sauvignon Blanc, Zierfandler and Roter Veltliner. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg Alte Reben
review: A tasty white, rich and fruity, with peach and orange flavors, ending with a hint of grapefruit peel. It's all on a crisp structure. Neuburger, Weissburgunder, Welschriesling and others. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Rosengartl Alte Reben
review: Peach cobber flavors dominate this ripe, easygoing white. Cream and spice linger on the finish. Drink now. 5 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Wiener Gemischter Satz
review: This sports firm flavors of green apple, pear and spice, supported by crunchy acidity. Notes of ripe citrus show on the spicy finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Süss Wien Preussen
review: A lilting, off-dry white, with plenty of baked apple and ripe peach flavors. Butterscotch, spice and cream fill the finish. Drink now through 2009. 125 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg
review: Soft yet generous, with pretty peach, apricot and mineral notes that glide smoothly together. Smoke and spice lengthen nicely on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Preussen
review: Ripe, with rich, spicy overtones to the baked peach and ripe apple flavors. Shows hints of apricot on the finish. Drink now. 5 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Vienna Hills
review: Hints of richness to the ripe peach and baked apple flavors that are accented by interesting notes of nutmeg and allspice, with a fresh finish. Drink now through 2015. 50 cases imported.

name: Blauburgunder Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Select
review: Delicious Pinot Noir, more in a New World style given the rich texture and soft berry, herbal and earthy notes. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kabinett Trocken Vienna
review: Offering a little more character than is usual for an Austrian Chardonnay, with mineral, honey and straw notes highlighting the apple and melon flavors. Crisp finish. Ready to drink.

name: Chardonnay Kabinett Vienna
review: Well-made Chardonnay. Broad apple and nutty aromas and flavors, rich texture, with a lively structure that keeps the whole presentation fresh and interesting. Definitely a food wine. Drink now through 2000. 1,250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Select
review: Quite oaky, sporting vanilla and spice accents, but also ripe apple and pear flavors. Good richness too, which absorbs the oak on the end, leaving a harmonious finish. Drink now. 150 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Vienna Herrenholz
review: Reveals a ripe, exotic note that adds an extra dimension to the herb and pear flavors. Good weight, concentration and length add up to a tasty wine. Drink through 1997.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Herrenholz
review: Medium-bodied and crisp, with green pear, citrus and herb flavors. Crunchy fennel notes on the finish. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Herrenholz R
review: Focused, with a nice crispness. Grapefruit and lentil flavors dominate, with mineral notes on the clean finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Jungenberg
review: This '99 white trades bright flavors for richness and weight, offering broad, subtle nuances of celery and white pepper. It's balanced, with a citrusy finish. Drink now through 2002. 100 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg
review: Plush, with bright flavors of crunchy apple, spice and hints of lime. The snappy finish features lentil and herb notes. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg
review: Less expressive, yet there's more fat here, with nice peach and lentil flavors from start to finish. Well-balanced and harmonious, tailing off a little on the finish. Drink now through 2006.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg
review: Atypical in style, using new oak, and it works. Rich and creamy, displaying vanilla, clove and nutmeg topnotes over peach and pepper flavors. Mineral accents come to the fore on the finish. Drink now through 2002. 10 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg Alte Reben
review: Firm, with concentrated ripe apple, peach and apricot flavors. Finishes with notes of butter and spice. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Wiener Gemischter Satz
review: This ripe white features lots of peach and glazed apricot flavors. Creamy midpalate, with plenty of smoky notes on the finish. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Wien Wiener Gemischter Satz
review: This crisp white features a snap of citrus and green apple flavors, with some minerally accents. Hints of white pepper show on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Vienna Select
review: Inviting talc and rose petal aromas, hints of peach and apple and a firm minerally structure that turns lean and austere on the finish. Drink now through 2000. 80 cases made.

name: Blauburgunder Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Select
review: Elegant and lively, this Pinot Noir has density to back its core of cherry and licorice flavors. Well balanced and long, it draws you back for more. Drink now through 2002. 275 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Select
review: Offers some attractive, apple, peach, toast and vanilla aromas and flavors, married to a rich texture. Just a note of bitter grapefruit emerges on the finish, along with toasty oak. Drink now. 830 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Herrenholz
review: Bright and crunchy, with green apple, citrus and almond flavors. Smoke and spice season the finish. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Kaasgraben
review: Ripe and peachy tasting, with notes of grapefruit, lentil and white pepper. The broad finish has a big, smoky element. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg
review: Ripe and flamboyant, this Grüner Veltliner offers tropical fruit accents in addition to its lentil and white pepper notes. Interesting flavors, if soft in structure. Drink now through 2005. 50 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Vienna Hills
review: There's plenty of toast, peach and spice notes in this medium-bodied white, which has a soft finish of lemon curd and smoke. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg Alte Reben
review: Juicy, with peach, mineral and grapefruit flavors followed by white pepper and spice on the crunchy finish. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Rosengartl Alte Reben
review: A ripe style, with some butter notes to the baked apple and spiced white plum flavors. Notes of lemon meringue appear on the slightly honeyed finish. Drink now. 83 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Rosengartl Alte Reben
review: Features ripe peach flavors, with dried apricot notes and hints of chamomile. Golden raisin and spice accents flash on the finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Wiener Trilogie
review: A firm red, with a meaty overtone to the plum and berry flavors. Lots of French roast notes mark the finish. Zweigelt, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Vienna Select
review: Offering loads of tropical fruit, citrus and vanilla flavors with searingly high acidity, this is appealing, though it doesn't really scream Chardonnay. Needs food. Best from 1999 through 2002. 500 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Herrenholz
review: Mineral and ripe peach flavors fill this medium-bodied white. Finishes with some smoky notes. Drink now. 166 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Leicht & Trocken
review: Bright and peach-flavored, with plenty of lively acidity for support. Delicious as an aperitif or with light foods. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Preussen
review: Medium-bodied, offering peach flavors and apple notes, with a spicy finish. Drink now. 208 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Vienna Hills
review: Soft and ripe, showing peach, gooseberry and marzipan flavors that finish with citrusy notes. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Rosé de Pinot
review: Fresh-cut melon notes are interspersed with dried cherry and smoke. Ripe finish. Drink now.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Wiener Gemischter Satz
review: Firm and filled with notes of slate and sea salt. Finishes with plenty of crunch and spice. A field blend of Grüner Veltliner, Weissburgunder, Welschriesling, Chardonnay and many others. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Lieblich Wien Nussberg
review: Fruity and a little sappy, with peachy flavors. Finishes with ripe pear and spice. Drink now. 291 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg
review: Very juicy, crunchy and a tad cloying, with apricot flavors and some herbal and spice notes, which linger on the finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Riedencuvée
review: Soft, with ripe apple and glazed citrus flavors.  Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Riedencuvée
review: Crisply structured, yet compact in its range of flavors, offering white peach, apple and earth notes in a light-bodied package. Drink now through 2005. 200 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Classic
review: Austere in style, this firmly structured Chardonnay offers ripe apple, citrus and mineral elements, followed by a moderate, stony finish. Drink now through 2001. 1,375 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Leicht & Trocken
review: Very spicy, like white pepper, along with lentil and peach nuances; soft, easygoing white. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg
review: A basic white, with peach and apple flavors and a spicy finish. Drink now. 667 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Bisamberg Alte Reben
review: A touch tart, with lemon-lime flavors and some stony notes that extend on the finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg Alte Reben
review: Offers baked apple flavors, with hints of smoke and bacon fat on the slightly candied finish. A field blend of Grüner Veltliner, Riesling and others. Drink now. 1,667 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Wiener Trilogie
review: A touch charry, with smoke and dried red fruit flavors. Zweigelt, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Halbtrocken Wien Nussberg
review: Tastes off-dry, with modest peach and apple flavors, followed by some spicy notes on the finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Riedencuvée
review: Peachy flavors, with onion and herb notes. Straightforward. Needs sausages to match with. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Herrenholz
review: Austere, with almond and herb flavors, this has medium weight and structure without a lot of flavor intensity. Picks up a nectarine note on the finish. Drink now. 580 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Herrenholz
review: A hint of burnt match on the nose, but the palate reveals lentil, earth and herb notes. Medium-bodied and high in alcohol, which gives it a slightly coarse finish. Drink now through 2002. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Classic
review: A light-bodied, lively Chardonnay, with modest flavors of apple and earth and a brief finish. 830 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Herrenholz
review: Austere, with only modest unripe apple and herbal flavors. 165 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg Alte Reben Reserve
review: Modest white, with pear and almond flavors. A touch cloying on the finish. Neuburger, Pinot Blanc, Riesling, Grüner Veltliner and others. 165 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Wiener Gemischter Satz
review: Tart, with citrus flavors and dusty gravelly notes. Turns a touch bitter on the finish. Grüner Veltliner with Welschriesling and Sauvignon Blanc. 667 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Halbtrocken Wien Jungenberg
review: A strange mix of herb and slight peach flavors that don't add up to much. Not imported into the U.S.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Vienna Herrenholz
review: Very perfumed, floral aromas, with flavors of green bean. Thin and awkward. 330 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Nussberg Alte Reben
review: Awkward, with aromas and flavors of cider and sulfur, mixed in with pear and grapefruit notes. Neuburger, Pinot Blanc, Riesling, Grüner Veltliner and others. 375 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Riedencuvée
review: Very herbal, with onion and ripe apple flavors and some smoky notes. 375 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wien Select
review: A distinctive black pepper note pervades this otherwise floral- and citrus-flavored white. Out of character for the varietal, finishing weakly.

name: Vintage Port
review: Full-bodied and rich for the vintage. Light to medium red with a garnet edge, a rich cassis nose, medium-bodied, with very rich flavors, balanced tannins and a lovely, long finish.

name: Douro Valtorto
review: This has plenty of crisp red berry flavors, with smoky notes. The finish feature hints of roasted meat. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: This is a gutsy wine with rich, focused fruit flavors. Medium ruby, with a very fresh cassis and black cherry nose, medium-bodied, with sweet coffee and cherry flavors and medium tannins on the finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: This is one of the very best '58s available. Medium ruby with a garnet edge, very delicate floral and grapy aromas, light- to medium-bodied, with lovely cherry flavors, great balance and a medium finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: A wonderfully elegant and well-made wine from an unheralded vintage, like a young '67 Cockburn. Deep ruby, with a lovely grape and violet nose, medium- to full-bodied, with grapy black pepper flavors, medium tannins and a long finish. Very attractive balance. Best from 1994 through 1995.

name: Vintage Port
review: Surprisingly good, with an impressive richness and intensity of fruit on the palate. Medium red with a garnet edge, a lovely spicy berry and chocolate nose, medium-bodied, with very sweet, round fruit flavors and a firm backbone. Will improve with age.

name: Vintage Port
review: A powerful and lean wine. Medium red, with a slightly roasted coffee nose, medium-bodied, with roasted chocolate and rich fruit flavors, quite tough on the finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: A very good '78 with excellent aromas. Ruby-red, with rich, ripe, grapy, floral aromas, full-bodied, with lots of ripe fruit and black pepper flavors, very sweet, with plenty of backbone.

name: Vintage Port
review: Very elegant and well-balanced. Medium ruby with a red hue, lovely chocolate, coffee and mahogany aromas, full-bodied, with round, velvety fruit flavors, medium tannins and a long finish. Much drier than the house's usual vintage.

name: Vintage Port
review: This has attractive roasted coffee aromas and flavors in a more forward style than many of the top '85s. Deep ruby with a purple edge, a bitter chocolate and coffee nose, full-bodied, with a velvety mouth-feel, medium tannins and a sweet finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: A well-made wine from a weak vintage. Medium ruby-red, with a perfumed violet nose, medium-bodied, with very sweet, round fruit flavors, good acidity and lovely balance.

name: Vintage Port
review: Starts out well but fades quickly. Medium red-garnet, with a leather and chocolate nose, medium-bodied, with sweet milk chocolate flavors, light tannins and a medium finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: Not up to this house's standards. Forward, medium garnet, coffee on the nose, medium- to light-bodied, with coffee and slightly burnt fruit flavors and a light tannic finish.

name: Vintage Port Quinta do Retiro Novo
review: Clean and aromatic, with floral and berry character. Medium-bodied, sweet and round, with light tannins and a fruity finish. Lacks a bit of grip.   Score range: 85-88

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Tri Leopard Vineyards
review: Smooth and supple, medium-bodied, with cedary currant, plum and blackberry flavors that are harmonious and polished. Drink now through 2005. 480 cases made.

name: Auxerrois Pennsylvania
review: Some tinned lime aroma and flavor. Light, short, slightly sweet finish. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Pennsylvania
review: Piney, resinous aroma. Dilute and vapid on the palate. 300 cases made.

name: Shiraz Heathcote Springflat
review: Bright and juicy. A different profile from most Aussie Shiraz, offering ripe red cherry and pomegranate flavors against refreshing acidity and nicely sublimated tannins. Drink now through 2014. 2,100 cases made.

name: Shiraz Heathcote Duck Muck
review: Dark flavors of cherry have an edge of sharp acidity and alcohol. A strong peppermint and licorice component adds to the blackberry and tar that lingers impressively on the finish. There's a lot going on here, but it's not going to appeal to everyone. Best from 2007 through 2015. 200 cases made.

name: Shiraz Heathcote Springflat
review: Vibrant and a bit racy, with lively acidity playing against rich, dense black cherry, tobacco and wet earth flavors that linger on the focused finish. Drink now through 2016. 68 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Heathcote Springflat
review: Firm and juicy, a lively mouthful of pure currant and blackberry flavor sailing on fine-grained tannins, finishing with impressive length. Best from 2006 through 2015. 256 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Heathcote Springflat
review: Rich in color and texture, with black pepper scents wafting through a plush core of raspberry, cherry and spice aromas and flavors, echoing beautifully on the polished finish. Drink now through 2008. 2,400 cases made.

name: Shiraz Heathcote Springflat
review: Extremely dark in color, peppery in flavor, with exotic spice overtones to the blackberry and plum fruit, all of which lingers on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2012. 2,200 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Malbec Heathcote Yellow Hammer Hill
review: Lip-smacking good, this has impressive depth to the cherry and sweet leather flavors, remaining fresh and vibrant as the finish kicks off and lingers expressively. Drink now through 2018. 68 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Heathcote Springflat
review: Has impressively ripe flavors, dripping with blackberry, plum and anise on a steely frame, finishing with Victoria's distinctive crispness. Give it time to develop. Best from 2004 through 2010. 1,200 cases made.

name: Shiraz Heathcote Springflat
review: A picture of elegance. From the fresh and pure violet, raspberry and dark chocolate aromas and flavors and lithe framework to the lingering finish, this Shiraz shows a restrained style for Australia. Drink now through 2003. 450 cases made.

name: Yellow Hammer Hill Heathcote
review: Ripe in flavor, with silky texture and a jangly mix of game, cherry and sweet leather flavors, finishing round and likable. Shiraz and Malbec. Drink now through 2006. 50 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Deep Cove
review: Bright, polished and plush in texture around a generous core of black cherry and smoke flavors, persisting nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 1,350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: Light and tangy, with a zippy lime note weaving through the blackberry and currant fruit. It all persists appealingly on the finish against a fine burr of tannins. Best from 2010 through 2014. 4,420 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: Vibrant and fragrant, with a chewy texture to dried and fresh wild berry, violet, semisweet chocolate and crushed stone flavors. An Asian spice undertone adds interest, with firm tannins shaping the herb-tinged finish. Drink now through 2010. 4,414 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: Intense and focused, featuring plenty of fresh herbal shadings to the core of black cherry and raspberry notes, with a firm, fleshy texture and cedary overtones. Drink now through 2022. 6,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: Light and crisp, with pretty cherry and floral flavors that zing through the deft finish. Drink now through 2013. 6,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Marlborough Botrytised Reserve
review: Sweet and silky, with pretty pineapple, tangerine, honey and spice flavors and just a hint of a vinegar note on the finish. Has a sense of balance and elegance. Drink now through 2010. 400 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: A crisp and juicy mix of strawberry, rhubarb and cherry flavors, lightly spiced with cinnamon and accented by fresh loamy earth, mineral and tobacco hints. Harmonious and supple, with a lovely, lingering finish. Drink now through 2023. 8,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Fragrant, with a wonderfully effusive minty note that adds an air of elegance to the smooth strawberry, raspberry and cherry flavors. This has a great finish that ties all the fresh flavors together. Drink now through 2016. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Reserve
review: A smooth, supple red offering black cherry, loam and spice notes that show hints of fresh ginger, herb and cola, all coming together in a beautiful chorus on the juicy finish. Drink now through 2022. 600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Reserve
review: Juicy and vibrant, with terrific bright cherry, pomegranate and strawberry notes that have accents of toast, spice and mineral on the long, lingering finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Marlborough Botrytised Reserve
review: Sweet and unctuous, with lovely honey, floral and mineral flavors that herald a rich core of apricot and white pepper, nicely balanced with a thread of citrusy acidity. Drink now through 2005. 500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright and lively, delivering an effusive mouthful of pineapple, lime and apricot that remains refreshing and balanced through the finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Fleshy and ripe, with very good intensity to guava, pink grapefruit, grass and wet stone flavors. Tart lime juice acidity streamlines the fruit through a minerally finish. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Beautifully balanced, silky and polished, with vibrant flavors of passion fruit, citrus and pear that linger enticingly on the bright finish. 8,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Bright wild strawberry flavors have white flower and pepper accents and a hint of orange zest in this appealing and juicy red, which is smooth on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Home Block
review: Smooth and velvety, a harmonious wine with pretty blackberry and plum flavors, hinting at mineral and spice as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2014. 550 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Reserve
review: Very spicy, with taut tannins and plenty of clove notes to the cherry and plum flavors. Tomato leaf, fresh earth and orange peel hints emerge on the long finish. Drink now through 2025. 600 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Nicely done, with Asian pear, lemon-lime, ripe peach and melon flavors that have a terrific fleshiness, with bright acidity and plenty of nuances. Drink now. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: A panoply of classic Sauvignon flavors, starting with lime, gooseberry and passion fruit and picking up green mango notes as the light, deft finish goes on. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright and citruslike, with tangy passion fruit and nice herbal overtones. Lovely balance for drinking now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Reserve
review: Smooth and refreshing, with lemongrass and lime zest accents to the citrus, green apple and melon flavors. Bright and refreshing, showing pretty aromatics. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Reserve
review: Bright and tangy, with a nice open texture under juicy lime, apple and melon flavors, which echo beautifully on the generous finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Reserve
review: Different from most Marlborough Sauvignon Blancs--riper, rounder and marked by spicy oak--offering a lovely balance of spice and bright, citrusy-pear fruit, and finishing with elegance. Drink now through 2003. 250 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Reserve
review: Unusual for New Zealand with its spicy, barrel-fermentation flavors and polished texture. There's enough racy herb and citrus notes to keep it interesting, and it finishes with style. Drink now through 2000. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Rich, succulent flavors of black cherry have hints of mineral, herb and fennel, as white pepper details ride along a smooth, juicy frame. Drink now through 2015. 750 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Plenty of herbal, bay leaf, geranium and white pepper aromatics give this wine plenty of charm, leading to cherry and cranberry flavors on a supple frame. Drink now through 2017. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Fresh and herbal, with lemongrass and lemon verbena overtones to the direct, juicy core of citrus and ruby grapefruit flavors. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Mouthwateringly juicy, with lime, papaya and fresh-cut grass notes, leading to a crisp green apple finish. Drink now. 36,667 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: A salty, crunchy mix of lime, green apple, melon and lemon flavors, bright and refreshing, with a whiff of fresh herb notes on the finish. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Vividly juicy, with mouthwatering flavors of lemon, limeade and green apple. Extremely refreshing. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Terrific green apple, pear and grapefruit notes are vibrant and juicy, following through to a nice touch of green papaya and citrus peel on the finish. Drink now. 4,500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bracing, with a fine beam of intensity to tangy lime, grapefruit and savory mineral flavors. Grass and lead pencil accents extend through the finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Crisp and refreshing, lively with lemon, herb and apple flavors, which echo on the juicy finish. Drink now. 22,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Light, crisp and zingy, with pretty black pepper-scented pear and citrus flavors, which linger on the balanced, tangy finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Reserve
review: Intensely juicy, offering ripe peach and nectarine flavors accented by orange zest and apricot notes, with a vivid, juicy finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Features intense herbal notes of sage and thyme up front, making way for trim berry and cherry flavors, with touches of orange peel. Offers crisp acidity and firm tannins. Drink now through 2023. 3,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Pear, apple and nectarine flavors show a juicy lemon streak set on a smooth, crisp body, with dried honeysuckle aromatics. Drink now. 27,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Distinctive for its spearmint-scented lime and mineral flavors, lingering on the surprisingly refined finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Lean and crisp, with bay leaf and juniper overtones to the citrusy flavors. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Juicy and lively, with citrus, apple and floral flavors, finishing with distinctive, peppery onion skin notes. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Reserve
review: Opens with a fresh-cut jalapeño note, fading into clean and crisp lemon-lime flavors, with good intensity. Finishes with a juicy white grapefruit accent. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Marlborough
review: Lean and juicy, with flavors of ripe pear, peach and apple, floral accents and a spicy finish accented by a touch of almond skin. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: The toasted herb and forest floor notes are savory, adding a peppery accent to the crisp currant and cranberry flavors. Balanced and fragrant. Drink now. 5,040 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Reserve
review: Crisp, with onion skin and spice flavors and a peppery finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Plenty of melon and canteloupe flavors here, with a hint of grassiness; it has clean acidity and a lemony finish.

name: Chardonnay Marlborough
review: The ripe peach and orange notes have a honeyed overtone, finishing with coarse acidity. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Home Block
review: Soft, with good intensity to strawberry, red cherry and mineral flavors. Drink now through 2007. 400 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Modest in scope, with tangy white grapefruit flavor but not a lot of it. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Offers generous texture and crisp acidity to tart green apple, grass, onion and lemon tones. Drink now. 10,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Home Block
review: Tart and tangy, with plenty of cedary oak framing grass, lime skin and green apple flavors. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Reserve
review: Stewed bell pepper, grass and wax flavors are a bit clumsy, with herb notes and lemon acidity in the finish. Drink now. 600 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Marlborough
review: Thick, simple and slightly overdone with loads of oak, some fruit and a lot of alcohol.

name: Gewürztraminer British Columbia
review: Slight spice and litchi aromas and tangy acidity are backed by peach and melon flavors. Somewhat weighty on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Okanagan Valley
review: Hard to cozy up to the earth and tinned pear notes. 250 cases made.

name: Merlot Okanagan Valley
review: Oak dominates, from the sweetish, sawdust aroma to the dry, astringent finish. 280 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Medium-weight, racy, with cherry, berry and cola notes and simple, spicy tannins. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Saralee's Vineyard
review: Medium-weight, with delicate tea, cola and dried strawberry flavors, finishing with ripe, round tannins. Drink now through 2003. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma County
review: Straightforward, with peppery plum flavors and light oak shadings. Simple and easy to drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Paso Robles Cheval Sauvage
review: Beautifully silky texture supports a gentle array of spice, orange peel, black cherry and currant flavors. Harmonious and supple through the very long and enticing finish. Delicious now, it feels as though it can develop through 2005.--Pinot Noir Challenge.

name: Pinot Noir Paso Robles Cheval Sauvage
review: Mature, with a complex array of ripe plum, black cherry, wild berry and spice flavors. Toasty oak notes come through on the finish, where the flavors turn even more complex. 193 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Edna Valley Late Harvest
review: Sweet and rich, this offers a ripe, succulent mouthful of spicy apricot, pineapple and fig flavors that keep swirling through the rich, silky finish. Beautifully made, it's approachable now, but may further develop through 2000 to 2010. 418 cases made.

name: Chardonnay San Luis Obispo County
review: Ripe and toasty, with generous pineapple and pear aromas and flavors shaded with smoke, vanilla and butter flavors on the finish. Very full and fine, with lots of concentration. Drink now or in 1993. 3,222 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Santa Barbara County Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Ripe, almost opulent, and supple. Has a rich texture and marvelous pear, spice and honey flavors. This is ready now. 40 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Smooth and creamy, with a spicy edge to the ripe pear, peach and vanilla notes. Develops elegance and complexity on the finish. 12,943 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Coast
review: This is complex, displaying a mix of ripe cherry and raspberry flavors, with mineral and loamy earth notes that have a savory herb edge. Full-bodied, focused and long on the finish, with the right mix of acidity and tannins. Drink now through 2012. 76,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County Unbridled
review: Distinctive, pure blackberry and wild cherry fruit is focused, delicate, medium-bodied and complex. Full-bodied and tight, with minerally tannins. Drink now through 2013. 1,780 cases made.

name: Syrah Central Coast
review: Complex and well crafted, with a spicy, wild berry and earth accent. Finishes with soft tannins and a sense of elegance. Delicious now. 863 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Paso Robles
review: A supple wine that shows layers of coffee, spice, plum, currant and herb. The finish lingers nicely with hints of earth and anise. It's smooth and accessible now, should last awhile. 6,573 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Paso Robles
review: Packed with intense fruit flavor reminiscent of cassis liqueur. Ripe and full-bodied, but not too tannic, relying on the concentrated fruit and herb flavors for its power. Drink now to '96. 2,070 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
