review: Ripe, creamy pear and melon-scented Chardonnay flavors combine with toasty oak. Turns complex and elegant on the finish, where the fruit shines through. Drink now through 2000 . 10,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Smooth, supple and nicely balanced earth, caramel and citrusy pear flavors persist on the finish. Drinkable now. 10,394 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Rich and full-bodied, with layers of butterscotch, pear, melon and spice flavors. Round and complex, finishing with a touch of oak that turns to nutmeg. Drink now. 7,700 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Coast
review: Smooth and mellow, perked up by a racy accent to the herb, cherry, anise, smoke and earth flavors. Finishes with a fleshy aftertaste. Ready now. (Price upon release).--1990 California Pinor Noir horizontal.

name: Pinot Noir Central Coast Cheval Sauvage
review: Elegant and lively, with a pretty, spicy edge to the tea leaf, plum and cherry flavors. Finishes with dashes of strawberry and spice. Can stand a year or so of cellaring; try in 1998. 189 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County Cheval Sauvage
review: Supple, ripe and balanced, displaying pretty plum, cherry, cola and spice notes. Enticing to drink now; should age through 1997. 180 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles Unbridled
review: Ripe and spicy, with a juicy, supple core of blackberry, raspberry and cherry flavors. Finishes with crisp, firm tannins, suggesting it needs short cellaring. 200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Rich, intense and full-bodied, with spice, baked apple, melon and creamy pear notes that are fresh, clean and vibrant. Drink now through 2014. 65,061 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Supple and stylish, with fine balance to the pear, lemon, floral and nicely integrated toasty oak overtones. Pleasant acidity keeps it fresh through the finish. Drink now through 2005. 23,962 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Offers an appealing core of pear, apple and hazelnut flavors that fold together on the finish. Young, tight and a bit on the tart side, it can be cellared into 1998.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard Unbridled
review: Firm, intense, ripe and juicy, offering fresh green apple, pear and citrus flavors that are pure, full-bodied and persistent. Ends with a pithy, lemon peel aftertaste. Drink now through 2014. 1,000 cases made.

name: Malvasia Bianca Monterey
review: Spicy and somewhat exotic, with peach and tangy citrus, ginger and clove notes. Displays bracing acidity, nicely tempered with a touch of sweetness. A fine match for Asian flavors. Drink now. 3,117 cases made.

name: Merlot Paso Robles
review: Tangy, with blueberry and boysenberry tones that stay lively through the finish. Drink now. 28,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Paso Robles Cheval Sauvage
review: Ripe and smooth, almost plush in texture, with bright raspberry, chocolate and anise aromas and flavors that meld smoothly on the finish. Tannic enough to indicate cellaring until 1995. 470 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Monterey County
review: Crisp and clean on the palate, delicate, with hints of honeysuckle, melon and citrus. Finishes with a flinty note. Drink now. 2,800 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Monterey County
review: Spicy and full-bodied, with an array of anise, pear, fig and melon notes, turning rich and complex on the finish. Good price. 3,376 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Coast
review: Boasts a nice, ripe core of plum and cherry flavors with a slight tangy accent. Drinkable now, but can age a few years, too. 9,053 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Coast
review: Smooth, inviting and polished. Generous plum and black cherry aromas and flavors persist through the harmonious finish. Drinkable now through 1997. 8,700 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Cheval Sauvage
review: Presents a rich core of herb- and rhubarb-laced red berry and black tea notes, well-balanced and ending with a firm backbone of dusty berry. Drink now through 2021. 912 cases made.

name: Viognier Central Coast
review: Features fresh peach and nectarine flavors at the core, showing good intensity and details of spice and lemongrass. Robust, with a juicy finish. Drink now. 704 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Paso Robles
review: Nicely focused, with a refreshing bit of tartness to black currant, plum and roasted herb flavors. Finishes with lively tannic structure and nicely integrated oak tones. Drink now through 2006. 12,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon San Luis Obispo County
review: Complex and well balanced, serving up a pleasant core of cedar, cherry and currant flavors before the tannins kick in. Drink in 1998.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: This open, likable wine offers lots of exotic tropical fruit aromas and flavors, a smooth texture and ready drinkability. Butter and oak notes make it more interesting on further sipping. 6,200 cases made.

name: Dolcetto Central Coast
review: Young, tight and a bit on the tart side, with an earthy streak to the wild berry flavors. Can stand short-term cellaring to soften a bit. 275 cases made.

name: Malvasia Bianca Monterey
review: Lively, with soft green apple, litchi and peach flavors. A fun wine that would pair well with a spicy dish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Malvasia Bianca Monterey
review: Fragrant and spicy up front, the wine is dry but filled with lush fruit. Peach, apple and litchi are backed by almost-searing acidity. Fun. Drink now. 2,208 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Monterey
review: Ripe and generous with its mineral flavors, which weave between the orange and pear notes to make a delicious wine. 3,650 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County
review: Compact and focused, with earthy black cherry, nutmeg and spice flavors supported by crisp, lively acidity and firm, fine tannins. Balanced and drinkable now to '98. 8,100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County
review: Delicate and elegant with rich, concentrated spice, plum, earth and cherry fruit with crisp, lively acidity and ample tannins for aging. Lots of fruit complexity and a zesty finish.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Cheval Sauvage
review: Vivid and juicy, offering a core of black cherry fruit and plum flavors, with spicy accents and tannins firming on the finish. Drink now. 744 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Rita Hills Cheval Sauvage Ashley Vineyard
review: Vibrant, with excellent intensity to black cherry, currant and spice flavors. Subtle licorice and cedary oak weave through the lively tannins and herb tones that frame the finish. Drink now through 2008. 593 cases made.

name: Syrah Paso Robles Unbridled James Berry Vineyard
review: Verging on overripe, with dried blueberry, black cherry, chocolate and pomegranate flavors. Brawny, gripping tannins clamp down with cedary oak on the finish. Drink now through 2008. 220 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles
review: Excellent value. Nicely focused, with ripe raspberry, plum and baked cherry pie flavors. Vanilla, modest tannin and acidity fold into the finish. Drink now through 2006. 7,935 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Paso Robles
review: Plenty of cherry, cola and vanilla aromas, with a soft texture and juicy flavors. Drink now. 22,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Displayes crisp, fresh notes of apple and citrus set on a light and refreshing body, with a lemony finish. Drink now. 35,838 cases made.

name: Malvasia Bianca Monterey
review: Fresh and appealing for its buoyant pear, spice and honey flavors. Drink now. 1,339 cases made.

name: Merlot Paso Robles
review: Ripe and zesty, with plum and roasted herb aromas and red currant and exotic Asian spice flavors. Drink now. 37,306 cases made.

name: Merlot Paso Robles
review: A nice red wine with some pretty currant flavors and a slightly vinegary streak running through the otherwise solid finish. Best in 1999. 20,206 cases made.

name: Merlot San Luis Obispo
review: Firm and compact, displaying a tight band of cherry, herb and currant flavors and finishing with ample tannins; best after 1996. 10,157 cases made.

name: Negrette Cienega Valley
review: Deeply colored, with ripe, supple berry, currant and spice flavors that are complex and hearty. Drink now. 182 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Coast
review: A touch earthy and cedary, this lean, trim wine has spicy cherry, earth and leather flavors that shorten up on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 17,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Coast
review: Lean and racy, with spicy cherry, herb and wild berry flavors that are true to the area. Cellar short-term to soften its wild, rangy flavors. 16,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Coast
review: A tight, firm Pinot with a compact profile of cherry, herb and currant flavors and aromas. Drinks well now, but should age well short-term. 2,700 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Paso Robles Cheval Sauvage
review: Of the two bottles tasted, second was much the better, showing more fresh raspberry and wild berry character mingling nicely with good acidity and supple tannins. Medium-bodied, focusing more on fruit than terroir, this is a pleasant, clean and pure Pinot Noir to drink now, but it's not up to the standards of most wines in this flight.--Pinot Noir Challenge.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County Cheval Sauvage
review: Broad, ripe, rich and spicy, with a solid core of cherry, cola, rhubarb and spice flavors that turn smooth and silky until the tannins kick in on the finish. Balanced and ready to drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Viognier Central Coast
review: Crisp and juicy, showing ripe apricot and nectarine aromas, with notes of spice and mineral on the finish. Drink now. 2,526 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles
review: A pleasant claret-style that features ripe cherry, pepper, spice and cedary oak flavors, all in a streamlined, not-too-tannic style. Raisin and Port nuances on the finish only add to the flavor spectrum. Drink now through 1997. 460 cases made.

name: Malvasia Bianca Monterey
review: Bright and open-textured, appealing for its apple, honey and spice flavors that echo smoothly on the finish. Drink now. 664 cases made.

name: Merlot Paso Robles
review: Intense, with dried currant, mineral and tangy cherry flavors. Tart berry notes and firm tannins linger. Drink now through 2006. 41,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Coast
review: Lean and tight, with a spicy, peppery edge to the cherry and berry flavors. Drink now. 8,382 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County
review: Its dry, earthy, tannic edge and fading fruit flavors spell maturity. Picks up a hint of orange peel on the finish.--1986 California Pinor Noir horizontal. Drink now.

name: Zinfandel California
review: Medium in weight, with pleasant flavors of herb, currant and berry and a spicy finish. Drink now. 1,144 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles
review: Aromas of kirsch, plum and cola precede peppery, high-alcohol flavors. Drink now through 2004. 3,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Lively, with tart lemon and pineapple flavors. Refreshingly crisp. Drink now through 2004. 21,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Clean on the palate, with bright, lemony flavors. Finishes moderately, with a hint of toast. Drink now. 20,064 cases made.

name: Merlot Paso Robles
review: Offers modest cherry, spice and toasty herb notes. Drink now. 23,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Paso Robles
review: Cassis, black cherry and leather come to mind. Tannins are a bit rough, and the finish is moderate with a hint of spice. Best from 1999 through 2002. 13,360 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Monterey
review: Broad, spicy and scented with vanilla, with a fruity pear flavor sneaking in on the finish. Ready now. 2,700 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Monterey County
review: A Chardonnay look-alike, with vanilla, butter and pear flavors that linger on the finish. Drink now through 2002. 4,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Coast
review: Lean and distinctly herbal, with toasty cherry flavors that lead to a tight and tannic finish. Drink now. 13,716 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Coast
review: A bit lean, with roasted herb and currant and firm tannins. Drink now through 2005. 28,000 cases made.

name: Viognier Central Coast
review: Pretty aromas of honeysuckle and orange blossom with an elegant structure and rather simple flavors. Drink now. 594 cases made.

name: Arneis Central Coast
review: A soft, low-key sort of wine with dusky pear flavors, finishing with a touch of mineral character. Drink soon. 274 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Paso Robles
review: Pretty lean on the palate, with light blackberry and coffee notes. Though the texture is refined, oak seems to be the dominant flavor. 4,800 cases made.

name: Merlot Paso Robles
review: Tart and juicy, with modest cherry, dill and mineral notes. Drink now. 26,533 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County
review: An elegant wine, with fresh strawberry, earth and cherry fruit of moderate depth and intensity. Well balanced, somewhat tannic and ready to drink now to 1993.

name: Chardonnay San Luis Obispo County Wild Horse Vineyards
review: Tart and crisp, with flavors centered around grapefruit, but some honey and floral flavors on the finish lend complexity. For those who like 'em lean.

name: Malvasia Bianca Monterey
review: Spicy aromas and sappy flavors characterize this fresh, simple white. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay San Luis Obispo County Wild Horse Vineyards
review: A good wine with floral aromas and light pear and apple flavors. Texture is slightly rough from tannins and acidity, but it's lively.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County
review: Provides a wide range of spicy cherry and berry flavors, with what appears to be a good dose of volatile acidity and oak. Tea, spice and vinegar notes come through on the finish. 5,600 cases made.

name: Merlot Central Coast
review: Very soft but also tannic, showing gorgeous plum, cherry and smoke aromas but turning mushy on the palate. A pleasant wine that lacks the depth to develop much.

name: Merlot Central Coast
review: Very earthy, rustic and wild, with leather aromas and extra-ripe fruit flavors that are almost overwhelming. Heavy on the oak and tannins. Not a wine for everyone but sure is flavorful. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Cheval Sauvage Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Dominated by stale, stewed berry flavors. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Paso Robles
review: Very jammy with ripe cherry and spicy flavors and tar and vegetal nuances that offer depth but not much finesse. Has nice structure and it's drinkable but not very exciting.

name: Chardonnay San Luis Obispo County Cheval Sauvage
review: Dense and vegetal, with celery, pear and spice flavors that turn to canned vegetables on the finish. Marginal quality. 432 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Ranges
review: This sleek and silky white exhibits pretty pear, green apple and floral aromas and flavors that glide smoothly through the long finish, where they echo enticingly. Drink now through 2017. 4,200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Central Ranges
review: Bright and jazzy, with vivid red berry and cherry fruit, hinting at cinnamon and licorice notes as the finish lingers easily and expressively. Drink now through 2018. 4,200 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Central Ranges
review: Bright and juicy, with Santa Rosa plum and grapefruit flavors, hinting at chamomile as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2018. 8,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Central Ranges
review: Lean and pointed, this is an upright wine, with mineral accents of clay and loam set against dark berry fruit, lingering deftly. Drink now through 2019. 8,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Edna Valley
review: A garnet color, with light-weight cranberry, cedar, gravelly earth and dried herb notes persisting throughout. Drink now. 5,300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Vin de Pays d'Oc
review: Crunchy apple flavors and lemon-lime notes give this a chewy crispness. Snappy finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Viognier Vin de Pays d'Oc
review: A crisp, fresh white, with peach and apple flavors, followed by citrus and mineral notes on the finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Vin de Pays d'Oc
review: Medium-bodied, with red berry and pepper flavors. Short finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Vin de Pays d'Oc
review: Mature-tasting, with dried cherry and plum flavors, and some brown sugar notes on the finish.  Drink now. 33,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Vin de Pays d'Oc
review: Firm, with sour cherry flavors and notes of underbrush, which linger on the finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Vin de Pays d'Oc
review: Mature aromas and flavors of dried cherry and marzipan dominate this well-structured red. Minerally finish, with spicy notes. Drink now. 33,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Vin de Pays d'Oc
review: Effusive buttery aromas and flavors make this a rather awkward one-note wine.  Drink now. 33,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Vin de Pays Vignobles de France
review: Firm, with some tarry notes to the cherry and berry flavors. Short finish.   5,000 cases made.

name: Cinsault-Shiraz Coastal Region
review: A hollow wine, with faded fruit and a dry woodsy feel around the edges. 750 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Centered on a zesty core of red plum and raspberry notes, this is complex on a modest scale, maintaining focus and persistence. Drink now. 3,153 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Waipara Valley
review: Crisp lemon and green apple flavors are bright, with details of white flower and green tea. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Waipara Valley
review: Strawberry and cherry flavors have an herbal, weedy side, with crisp, slightly chalky tannins. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Cupids Arrow
review: Bright, with a dark cast to the fruit and spice that burrows through a light layer of tannins and expands on the finish. Focused and refined. Drink now through 2015. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Elevation
review: A peppermint note rides over the peach and guava flavors in this bright white. A distinctive style that calls for another sip. Drink now. 15,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough The Infamous Goose
review: Lively and bright, with very good intensity to the tangy lemon-lime, crushed stone and grass undertones. Drink now. 7,500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Cupids Arrow
review: Tart, with very good intensity to the wild berry, green tea, plum and cedar flavors. Drink now through 2009. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough The Infamous Goose
review: Tart, with good intensity to grass, citrus and green bell pepper flavors. Drink now. 10,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Cupids Arrow
review: Floral, minty flavors are more prominent than fruit in this tart style. Drink now. 12,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Rosé Vin Gris
review: Cherry and tangy berry flavors have good intensity. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Vibrant, with a peppery note to the tart cherry and wild strawberry flavors, delivering a touch of citrus peel and a crisp finish. Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: The spicy melon, pear, grapefruit and green apple notes are intense and juicy, with traces of white flowers on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Timothy
review: This deep, dark and generous version is focused and expressive, offering a mouthful of black licoriceaccented blackberry and currant flavors that jet through the long, lithe and deftly balanced finish. The fine tannins stay out of the way. Drink now through 2022. 260 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Reserve
review: This has nice presence, playing the orange peel and mineral aspects against ripe, focused black currant and blueberry flavors. Comes together harmoniously against refined tannins on the long finish. Drink now through 2022. 250 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Timothy
review: Sleek and refined, with pretty cherry, spice and loamy earth flavors set on a narrow-gauge frame, lingering intently. Drink now through 2017. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Timothy
review: Firm in texture, this sturdy style shows peppery accents to the currant and blueberry flavors, lingering against crinkly tannins with presence. Best from 2017 through 2022. 293 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Open Claim Vineyard
review: Bright and refreshing, with apple, pear and grapefruit flavors on a sleek frame, lingering easily. Drink now through 2018. 137 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River
review: Ripe, generous and powerful, this deftly balanced wine brims with quince, apple, pear and tropical fruit flavors, shaded with hints of pepper and cream. Lingers on the long, complex finish. Drink now through 2017. 460 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River
review: Ripe and supple. A lovely mouthful of pear, apricot and lime flavors, tangy with citrusy acidity that balances the finish harmoniously. Drink now through 2011. 700 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River Reserve
review: Grapefruit and melon flavors are rich, bright and juicy, with accents of peppery white flowers and spice on the finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Margaret River Reserve
review: Tangy, with plenty of herb and cedar accents to the wild berry and cherry flavors at the core. Features a firm backbone of tannins and an edge of minerality. Drink now through 2026. 400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River
review: Light and appealing for its balance, offering citrus and nectarine aromas and flavors in a delicately spicy frame. The gentle finish lingers well. Drink now through 2009. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River Two Passions
review: Crisp and vivid, with toasty overtones to the lean core of lemon and peach flavors. Spice and cedar notes linger on the finish. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley
review: Distinctive, with ripe raisin and rhubarb flavors and plenty of oak. A bit clumsy on the finish, where the oak and fruit collide rather than embrace. 250 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley
review: Tastes harsh, green and tannic, with very little fruit underneath. Oaky tannins and flavors dominate. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Western Cape
review: A solid but simple Cabernet, with light plum and cherry flavors, mild tannins and a pleasant, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Cinsault-Ruby Cabernet Western Cape
review: Like a Beaujolais, this light, appealing red has fresh plum and strawberry flavors and a soft texture. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Tart, with an earthy aroma and neutral flavors.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Not much here, with an earthy aroma and only a faint apple flavor.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape Barrel Selection
review: A ripe, toasty style, with a buttered edge to the quince, creamed pear and yellow apple fruit flavors. Stays exotically ripe through the finish, but keeps its definition and freshness. Drink now through 2013. 50 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Bot River Barrel Select Reserve
review: Almond, brioche, creamed peach and glazed pear notes are well-layered, offering a flattering feel on the toasty finish. A crowd-pleaser. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Bot River
review: Well-focused, with a frame of licorice snap around a core of lightly steeped plum and blackberry fruit. Singed vanilla bean and warm raisin notes line the finish. Drink now. 750 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Bot River
review: Shows a slightly woodsy edge, with cedar and alder notes weaving around a core of steeped plum and blackberry fruit, ending with a slightly chewy briary edge. Drink now. 600 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Bot River Barrel Select Reserve
review: Offers a mix of plump plum, blackberry, briar and mocha notes, with the mocha edge hanging on the fleshy, friendly finish. A bit pumped up, but will have fans for sure. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Bot River
review: Lively, with damson plum and red currant fruit, offset by a tangy iron note. Reveals a bright floral edge on the finish. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Bot River Barrel Select Reserve
review: A plush, toasty style, with mocha, blackberry paste and plum sauce aromas and flavors driving along, followed by a charcoal hint framing the finish. A crowd-pleaser. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Warrant Barrel Selection Walker Bay
review: Has a nice mix of polished toast, currant, black cherry and vanilla flavors, which are allowed to linger on the sweet, plush finish. Nicely done. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2003. 450 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc-Merlot Walker Bay
review: Ripe black cherry and currant fruit, with sweet smoke and tobacco hints on the finish. Nice flesh and juicy texture. Drink now. 800 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Walker Bay Barrel Selection
review: Modern style, with dark plum, currant and briar flavors and a rich, smoky finish, where the grape's rustic side peeks in just a bit. Drink now through 2004. 750 cases made.

name: Pinotage Walker Bay Barrel Selection
review: Fleshy and ripe, with dark cassis and plum flavors, plus game and sanguine hints on the smoky finish. Drink now through 2002. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc-Merlot Bot River
review: Offers tobacco, green pepper and coffee notes, with a modest core of red and black cherry fruit to back it up. The fresh, lightly crisp finish has modest toast. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Bot River
review: A core of black cherry and black currant fruit is lined with hints of charcoal and briar in this direct red. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Walker Bay
review: Mint, violet and grape aromas and flavors mingle in this medium-weight red, with a polished, toasty finish. Rather direct, and almost sweet on the finish, but solid. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Bot River
review: Shows a slightly mature hint, with tobacco and cedar notes emerging from the core of blackberry and black currant fruit. Cedary details linger gently on the finish. Drink now. 350 cases imported.

name: Warrant Barrel Selection Walker Bay
review: A touch mature already, with cedar and sausage notes, this has firm, chewy tannins, tobacco, briar and currant flavors. Solid, if a bit square. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Franc-Merlot Bot River
review: Soft, with mature notes, featuring accents of mint, steeped currant, mulling spice and roasted vanilla bean that meld through the coffee-tinged finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Bot River
review: Features a bouncy mix of mint, blueberry and linzer torte aromas and flavors, followed by a dose of toasty vanilla. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Bot River Osiris Barrel Selection
review: Slightly rustic on the edges, with chunky black cherry and currant fruit framed by toasty bay and tobacco notes. Drink now. 168 cases imported.

name: Warrant Barrel Selection Walker Bay
review: Sinewy, with a tangy side to the black currant and prune flavors. Cedar and vanilla bean on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc-Merlot Walker Bay
review: Moderate herb, pepper, cherry and black cherry flavors mingle in this light-bodied red. Soft finish, with dusty tannins. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walker Bay
review: Has maturing chestnut and cedar notes running through the black cherry and briar flavors. Slightly trim finish. Drink now.

name: Directors Blend Bot River
review: A light, tangy style, with crunchy-textured notes of white peach, lime and green almond. Chenin Blanc, Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay. Drink now. 150 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Walker Bay
review: Rustic, with beef, plum, chestnut and earth flavors backed by a slightly chewy structure. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Walker Bay Barrel Selection
review: Offers plum, briar and cocoa flavors, with a slightly rustic finish. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Bot River Lot 1982
review: This gives a direct beam of lime and kiwifruit notes that turn a touch shy on the finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Bot River
review: Maturing, with mulled plum, cinnamon, mint and tea notes all melding through the supple finish. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Franc-Merlot Bot River
review: Has a pronounced tobacco leaf note giving way to light blood orange and dried cherry flavors and a mildly cedary spine through the finish. Drink now. 448 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Franc-Merlot Walker Bay
review: Crisp, with black cherry and tobacco notes. Hint of herb on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Bot River
review: On the leaner side, this shows modest kaffir lime and white peach flavors, laced with a hint of tarragon. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Walker Bay
review: Light and forward, with good red cherry and vanilla notes. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Walker Bay
review: Firm and taut, with black cherry, toast and game notes. Edgy, slightly raisiny finish. Drink now. 800 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Bot River
review: Trim, with modest dried cherry and damson plum fruit flavors lined with mild savory and white pepper notes. Light, slightly tangy edge to the finish. Drink now. 224 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Franc-Merlot Walker Bay
review: Has sweet maraschino cherry fruit, with a hint of tobacco and a moderate finish. The fruit verges on cloying in the end. Drink now. 1,050 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walker Bay
review: Mature, with dried currant and cedar notes. The rustic finish has a rhubarb note. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Bot River
review: Forward, with modest white peach fruit backed by a faint herb hint. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Bot River
review: Clean and quick, with basic lime and chive notes. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Bot River
review: Cedar and dried vanilla bean notes give way to softening plum and currant fruit that loses some intensity on the finish. A stretch to release this now. Past its prime. 250 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Walker Bay Reserve
review: Moderate fruit here, with some lemon and white peach notes, turning tart and fading quickly on the finish.

name: Pinotage Walker Bay Barrel Selection
review: Mint, rhubarb and prune flavors are offered up in this slightly clumsy red that turns meager in the end.

name: Sémillon Walker Bay
review: Very mature, even a bit past maybe, with graham cracker, fig and persimmon flavors that lose their vivacity on the quickly fading finish. A touch dilute in the end too.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Walker Bay
review: Dilute, with only tart, lemony acidity on the finish. 1,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hunter Valley Reserve
review: Ripe, spicy and generous with its orange peel-scented pear and nutmeg flavors, supple and rounded on the finish as the flavors echo nicely. Drink now through 2003. 3,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Hunter Valley
review: Light and graceful, more delicate than powerful, with pretty raspberry, blackberry and black pepper flavors that linger gently on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Hunter Valley
review: Earthy, gamy flavors weave through this firm, full-bodied, round, ripe red; some pretty plum and raisin notes give balance on the finish. Best from 2000 through 2003. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hunter Valley Reserve
review: Strongly floral, so much so as to interfere with the pretty citrus and apricot flavors. Finishes a tad sour. 7,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Hunter Valley
review: Spicy, with a thin bead of plum and berry flavor losing out to a green, resiny edge. 5,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Hunter Valley
review: Herbal, vegetal flavors overcome the modest fruit; not the range of flavors destined to please too many palates. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Guadalupe Vineyard
review: Fresh and tangy, lively with cherry and mint flavors supported by limelike acidity, this has presence and deftness. Drink now. 650 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light-footed and sleek, with delicately crisp tannins wound around a core of black tea and orange peel flavors, finishing with an apricot note. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light and tight, with earthy flavors more prominent than fruit notes. Best after 2016. 8,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Horse Heaven Hills Reserve
review: Firm and chewy, with spicy notes around a core of floral plum and apricot flavors. The unusual profile persists against the layers of fine tannins on the finish. Best from 2015 through 2020. 500 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and relatively light, with pretty raspberry and floral flavors that linger easily on the open-weave finish. Drink now. 3,200 cases made.

name: Blazing Red Columbia Valley
review: Light, fresh and appealing, with raspberry and white chocolate flavors, picking up a coconut note as the finish subsides. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 3,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Horse Heaven Hills Reserve
review: Gamy, earthy flavors prevail over the dark fruit in this medium-weight Cabernet. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Reserve
review: Ripe, smooth and creamy, with a sense of elegance and finesse. The toasty pear, spice and nutmeg flavors gain complexity and nuance on the long finish, where honey and butterscotch characteristics take over. A new wine that features Jed Steele as consultant. 500 cases made.

name: Merlot Lake County Reserve
review: Lean, light and spicy, with a strong toasty oak component to the flavors, which otherwise show some nice berry and currant notes. Deftly balanced, this should age well through 1997.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Clear Lake
review: Bright, fruity and distinctive, a lively wine with layers of appealing apple, pear, spice and grapefruit aromas and flavors. Offers lots of immediate pleasure, and it should keep improving through 1995. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Clear Lake
review: Refreshing, with a bright beam of intensity to the passion fruit, honeysuckle, tangy lemon-lime and freshly mowed grass flavors. Will show even better with food. Drink now through 2003. 2,800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Clear Lake
review: Somewhat herbal on the nose, though on the palate it serves up ripe fig, pear and apple. Light-textured, the wine finishes moderately, with a hint of citrus and honey. Drink now. 1,680 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Lake County Reserve
review: Grass, lime and passion fruit flavors are pure and refreshing, with a spicy quincelike note on the finish. Drink now. 23,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Clear Lake
review: A fully ripe, plum- and prune-flavored Zinfandel, displaying toasty oak accents and an almost sweet finish. Soft on tannins and full on flavor. Enjoy now through 1995. 980 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Crisp and spicy, with ripe apple, pear, honey and vanilla notes, turing complex and elegant on the finish, where the oak folds in nicely. Very well made. 6,185 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Ripe, full-bodied and figgy tasting, this powerful wine has straightforward flavors and a touch of vanilla on the finish. Solid and likable.

name: Zinfandel Clear Lake
review: Bright and fruity, with a firm texture and focused blackberry and black cherry aromas and flavors. The round texture and vanilla-scented finish makes it drinkable now. 1,150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clear Lake Private Reserve
review: A coarse one. Mouthpuckering tannins reveal only modestly ripe fruit and cedar. Pleasant enough. 499 cases made.

name: Fumé Blanc Reserve Clear Lake
review: Smooth and polished, spicy and fresh like a Chardonnay. 759 cases made.

name: Merlot Clear Lake
review: A tight, crisp, fruity Merlot that's youthful, lively, fresh and moderately tannic, with a nice core of raspberry flavor livening it up. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Lake County Reserve
review: An oaky style with toasty, buttery flavors dominating, but enough cherry, currant and spice notes to keep it balanced and interesting. Finishes with firm tannins; ready now through 1998. 500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Lake County Reserve
review: Lean and refreshing, with very good focus to grass, grapefruit and lime skin tones that finish with a crisp note. Drink now through 2005. 2,400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clear Lake
review: A ripe and smooth medium-weight wine that offers generous currant and plum aromas and flavors. Drink now. 2,700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Lake County Reserve
review: Straightforward and appealing for its cherry and fresh herbal fruit. Drink now. 490 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Clear Lake
review: Fruity and straightforward with its anise-scented grapefruit and melon flavors. 1,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clear Lake
review: Has a tart green edge to the pleasant currant, cedar and black cherry flavors. Best from 2000 through 2003. 1,374 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Lake County Reserve
review: Straightforward citrus and apple flavors, with modest intensity, good acidity and hints of buttered toast. Drink now. 16,000 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Clear Lake Dry
review: Light and crisp, with pleasant peach and pine aromas and flavors. Simple and refreshing; tastes like it's just off-dry. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Simple, peach and citrus flavors blend nicely, with a vaguely sweet finish. 1,360 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: A sturdy, fresh, fragrant white with spicy apple flavors. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Clear Lake
review: Soft and sweet-tasting, with a honeyed, caramel tinge to the citrusy fruit. 1,383 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Floral and spicy, almost like a Riesling; soft-textured with a polished feel, sweet on the finish. 1,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Reserve
review: Earthy, metallic flavors pick up enough nice apricot notes on the finish to save it. 840 cases made.

name: Merlot Clear Lake
review: Pleasant and light-textured, with modest herbal, strawberry and cherry flavors. Drinkable now. 5,119 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Lake County Reserve
review: Crisp, with grass, lemon-lime and talcum powder flavors.  Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Lake County Reserve
review: Fragrant, with orange blossom, espresso bean and currant flavors that fold into earthiness and lively structure. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Clear Lake
review: Simple, with toast, strawberry and spice flavors. A pleasant, straightforward wine, but the chunky, oaky finish is a bit awkward. Drink now through 2000. 575 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Clear Lake
review: Intense and tannic, with drying fruit flavors that have an earthy, briary edge. Drink now. 2,023 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Clear Lake
review: Earthy and hot, this shows some simple cherry flavors but lacks balance and focus. 878 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clear Lake
review: Simple and oaky with the wood flavors masking the raspberry-scented Cabernet fruit. Soft tannins make it drinkable now. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mendocino County
review: Woody and cedary; lacks sufficient fruit to be interesting. Drinkable, but there are far better. 1,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Swartland
review: The toasted vanilla, cherry and red licorice notes lead to a modest finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Swartland
review: Direct, with white peach and yellow apple skin notes. Open-knit finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Swartland
review: Open-knit, featuring green plum and white peach flavors, with a flash of shortbread on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Swartland Rosé
review: Light, with brisk watermelon notes and a flicker of dried strawberry on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Swartland
review: Direct, with plum and cherry pie notes, delivering a flash of licorice on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Swartland
review: The cherry and strawberry notes lead to a high-toned finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Winemaker's Red Blend Australia
review: Strikes a lovely balance between juicy cherry and berry flavors and a toasty, spicy, cedary overtone, all set on a sleek, easy-drinking frame. Shiraz, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2030. 20,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light and sleek, with a polished texture to the raspberry and cinnamon flavors, persisting easily on the lithe finish. Drink now through 2019. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light and tangy, with bright cherry and floral flavors, finishing with an open texture, zippy acidity and good presence. Drink now through 2021. 2,810 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Lithe and polished, with pretty red berry and floral flavors, finishing with moderate density. Drink now through 2020. 7,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley
review: Light and zippy, with grapefruit and pear flavors on a tangy frame. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Chinon Rosé de Saignée
review: This has plump strawberry and watermelon notes, offset by fresh, floral and mineral streaks on the finish. Very tasty. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Vigneti delle Dolomiti Prendo
review: Clean and fruity, with apple and honey character. Medium-bodied, with a fresh, crisp finish. Drink now. 16,700 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Vigneti delle Dolomiti Prendo
review: Creamy and appley on the nose, with hints of pear. Full-bodied, with some fruit, but a little dull on the finish. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Thibaud's Cuvée
review: Light and tangy, with a remarkable transparency allowing the red berry, cherry, peppermint and subtle spice flavors to come through brightly, all coming together cohesively on the long finish. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Triple Black Slopes
review: Fine-tuned tannins and flavors create harmony in this light-footed but richly flavorful red, playing cinnamon-accented raspberry and cherry fruit against wet earth and cocoa on the finish. Best from 2016 through 2022. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Pierre Léon
review: Firm in texture, with juicy red berry and red cherry flavors cutting through the veil of tannins, picking up cinnamon and clove nuances as the finish lingers. Best from 2012 through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Triple Black Slopes
review: Fresh and zesty, brimming with black cherry, floral and mineral flavors, persisting impressively on the deftly balanced finish. Drink now through 2018. 550 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Triple Black Slopes
review: Focused, distinctive and generous with its vivid currant, blackberry, pepper and violet aromas and flavors, which pop through a fine layer of tannins. It all lingers effortlessly on the expressive finish. Best from 2010 through 2015. 393 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Triple Black Slopes
review: Lithe and silky, the refined tannins carry gorgeous cherry, plum and blackberry flavors as they sail through the long, elegant finish. The firm texture wants cellaring. Best from 2008 through 2013. 454 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Emery
review: Lithe and open-textured, offering well-focused cherry, dark plum and floral flavors on a generous frame. Offers a light-footed finish, with fine tannins. Drink now through 2023. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Emery
review: Sleek, open-textured and distinctive, with plum and red currant fruit. Shadings of orange peel and cardamom add to the complex, polished finish. Drink now through 2022. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Kiana
review: Distinctive, spicy, complex and inviting, featuring a curled-up ball of blackberry, cherry, Earl Grey tea and spice flavors, pushing against refined tannins into a long and reverberating finish. Best from 2017 through 2022. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Terres Basses
review: Taut, focused, sleek and inviting, with blueberry, currant, pepper and floral flavors, lingering easily on the lively finish. Best from 2018 through 2022. 650 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Terres Basses
review: Sleek and lively, dripping with black cherry, guava and chai tea flavors, coming together smoothly on the long, reverberating finish. The polished tannins don't get in the way. Drink now through 2022. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Aliette
review: Sleek, transparent and silky in texture, offering black cherry, espresso and subtle smoke notes on a delicate frame, lingering easily and expressively. Drink now through 2018. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Aliette
review: Soft tannins surround a lithe core of red berry and cinnamon flavors, showing intensity as this extends into the lovely, refined finish. Needs time to incorporate the tannins. Best from 2014 through 2018. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Aliette
review: Focused and broad, with generous cherry, tobacco and peppery toast flavors mingling well on the long, deftly balanced finish. Drink now through 2016. 793 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Aliette
review: This has a nice sense of delicacy, offering pretty plum and currant fruit, with espresso and baking chocolate overtones that hover enticingly over the long, refined finish. Drink now through 2016. 676 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Aliette
review: Distinctive. Firm, with chewy tannins around a plump, generous core of blackberry, cherry and tar flavors, lingering on the beautifully focused finish. Drink now through 2012. 530 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Aliette
review: At the center, a lovely cascade of blackberry, cherry and other dark fruits, positively glowing against a firm bed of fine-grained tannins, persisting on the generous finish. A beautifully modulated wine, neither too big nor too lean. Tasted from a bottle with a screw-cap closure. Drink now through 2013. 799 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Dijon Clone 114
review: Deep, concentrated style of Pinot centers around pretty blackberry and currant flavors, shaded with hints of mint and white pepper. Has all the pieces on a velvety frame, just needs time to let it all come together. Best after 2001. 72 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Emery
review: Lithe, silky and layered, with sweet plum and berry fruit over some subterranean smoky and meaty notes, finishing long and refined. Drink now through 2013. 609 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Kiana
review: A lithe red distinctive for its red berry, cherry and delicate spice flavors on a focused, elegant frame. Needs time to polish the tannins. Best from 2013 through 2017. 580 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Kiana
review: Lithe and distinctive for the meaty, toasty undertones to the red berry and spice flavors, lilting on the long, light-textured finish. Drink now through 2015. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Kiana
review: Lithe, round and open-textured, offering a seductive mouthful of peppermint-accented plum, currant and espresso flavors, lingering on the transparent finish. Drink now through 2015. 606 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Kiana
review: Light and spicy, with cinnamon and nutmeg overtones prominent among the ripe currant flavors, lingering on the fine-tuned finish. Drink now through 2014. 344 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Kiana
review: Broad and zesty, with lively floral and white pepper-accented black cherry flavors that course through the long finish against fine tannins. Once it settles in, this should be something. Best from 2008 through 2013. 620 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Pierre Léon
review: Bright, brash and juicy. A lively mouthful of cherry, cinnamon and bittersweet chocolate flavors rocketing through the racy finish. Have it now with food or watch it develop. Best from 2007 through 2012. 1,329 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Pierre Léon
review: Silky, refined and generous with its finely detailed cherry, plum and subtle spice flavors, which persist into the delicately structured finish. Has plenty of room to grow. Tasted from a bottle with a screw-cap closure. Best from 2006 through 2011. 1,656 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County Aliette
review: Remarkably elegant in structure, with refinement to the lively blackberry, raspberry and subtle spice flavors, all of it lingering effectively as the finish persists. Drink now through 2010. 942 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County Kiana
review: Has delicacy, refinement and pointed flavors, offering raspberry and red plum fruit, shaded with white pepper and floral notes on a lively frame, echoing the flavors nicely as the finish persists. Drink now through 2007. 631 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Aliette
review: Focused, expressive and juicy, with cherry, raspberry and toasty, spicy flavors, coming together harmoniously against refined tannins and lingering effortlessly. Drink now through 2022. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Aliette
review: Light and tangy, with juicy cherry, raspberry, white chocolate and spice flavors, coming together seamlessly on the lively finish and lingering against fine tannins. Drink now through 2021. 700 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Pierre Léon
review: Firm, sleek and focused, layering currant, blueberry and cream flavors with hints of pepper and cedar. Finishes with point and length. Best from 2018 through 2022. 3,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Oregon
review: Ripe, round and generous, with lovely pear, apricot and mineral aromas and flavors that remain juicy and lively through the finish. Has depth and distinction. Drink now. 1,130 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Willamette Valley
review: Lively, silky and refreshing for its pear, citrus and green almond flavors, dancing brightly through the finish. Drink now. 1,064 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Bright and juicy, with pineapple and melon flavors that persist into the long, vivid finish. Drink now. 5,684 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Yamhill-Carlton District
review: Smooth and silky, blanketing the palate with almond-scented pear and nectarine fruit, lingering well. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Jory Hills Vineyard
review: This firm, chewy style glows within, offering cherry and cinnamon flavors on a taut frame, finishing with a light step but real intensity. Best from 2017 through 2020. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Jory Hills Vineyard
review: Lively, focused and elegant, with well-defined red berry, cinnamon and white pepper flavors on a sleek frame, finishing with firm tannins that recommend this to cellaring. Best from 2016 through 2019. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Crisp in texture, a bit raw around the edges but it's bursting with spicy blackberry and cherry flavors, hinting at an herbal note as the finish sails on. Drink now through 2012. 5,745 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Broad and generous, with extrafine tannins framing a bold core of olive-scented blackberry and cherry, finishing on a smoky note as it all lingers impressively. Drink now through 2010. 4,407 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Aliette
review: Light and crisp, showing a delicate rose petal overtone to the strawberry and red cherry flavors, lingering on the lithe finish. Drink now through 2012. 524 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Aliette
review: Lithe, supple and generous with its cherry and rain-on-slate flavors, hints of toasty oak sneaking in on the fine-grained finish, the flavors persisting well. Best from 2007 through 2013. 545 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Aliette
review: Packs a lot of flavor into a racy, high-energy package, offering wild berry, cherry, anise and sassafras flavors that linger on the jazzy finish. Impressive now, but feels like it needs until 2000 to 2002 to settle down. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Dijon Clone 113
review: An elegant, harmonious Pinot with generous flavor in an open-weave texture, emphasizing raspberry and spice flavors, which linger nicely on the supple finish. Drink now through 2006. 90 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Dijon Clone 777
review: Rich and velvety, aromatic with red cherry, plum and floral aromas that carry through to the smooth-textured palate. A harmonious wine that balances its rich flavors with a subtle frame. Drink now through 2008. 73 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Emery
review: Fresh and vital, with a light burr of tannins around a restrained core of currant and spice, lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Emery
review: Velvety, with pretty red and black cherry notes competing for attention behind a veil of tannins. Lingers gently. Drink now through 2016. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Emery
review: Light and fragrant, with a pleasant waxy edge to the cherry and blackberry flavors, lingering on the refined, expressive finish. Drink now through 2014. 795 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Emery
review: Broad, ripe and focused, this blasts its orange peel-scented black cherry flavors through a layer of crisp tannins to finish well. There's plenty of power, but this should gain subtlety with time. Best from 2009 through 2016. 602 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate Cuvée
review: Bright, jazzy and appealing for its pure currant fruit, incorporating hints of wet slate, toast and licorice as the finish persists impressively. Drink now through 2018. 3,040 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Jory Hills Vineyard
review: Light and lithe, displaying a pretty range of cherry, black tea and chocolate flavors riding over refined tannins. The finish lingers with nice intensity. Drink now through 2018. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Kiana
review: Ripe and lively, with juicy currant, blueberry and white pepper flavors bouncing easily over fine tannins and extending into an expressive finish. Drink now through 2014. 802 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Pierre Léon
review: Fresh and vivid, with tightly focused plum and guava flavors that play against lively acidity and polished tannins. Finishes with zip. Drink now through 2017. 2,800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Pierre Léon
review: Polished, round and appealing for its cascade of plum, currant and mineral aromas and flavors, skipping easily through superfine tannins on the long, expressive finish. Drink now through 2015. 1,451 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Terres Basses
review: Polished, refreshing and juicy, offering red berry and black cherry flavors, with a delicate touch of pepper that dots the i's as the finish lingers easily. The tannins have a light grip. Best from 2013 through 2017. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Terres Basses
review: Smooth and spicy, with orange peel and allspice overtones to the blackberry and cherry flavors, narrowing the beam on the finish and letting it ride nicely. Best from 2009 through 2016. 393 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Terres Basses
review: Has a lovely, light, silky texture and a welcome smoky, minerally character to the plum and blackberry fruit, lingering on the gentle finish. Tannins are well-integrated. Drink now through 2013. 456 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Triple Black Slopes
review: Lithe, vibrant and generous with its mineral-accented blackberry and white pepper flavors, lingering on the focused, pointed finish. Best from 2010 through 2014. 448 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County Emery
review: Rich and piercing flavor, with a peppery note and tangy edge to the dark cherry fruit at the core, finishing with fine tannins and solid length. Drink now through 2007. 313 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Emery
review: Taut and focused, with blueberry and currant flavors behind prickly tannins. Finishes with generosity and point. Best from 2018 through 2022. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Emery
review: Light and sleek, with a tart edge to the red berry, currant and hibiscus flavors, coming together harmoniously against fine tannins on the finish. Best from 2015 through 2018. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Gisèle
review: Relatively light in structure, with fine tannins around a glowing core of cherry, cinnamon and cream flavors, persisting into a long, vivid finish. Best from 2016 through 2020. 7,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Kiana
review: Fresh and pleasantly pointed, with crisp tannins on a medium frame, offering lively, generous cherry and floral flavors that persist into a deftly structured finish. Best from 2017 through 2021. 600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Pierre Léon
review: This has presence and a vibrant range of red berry, black cherry, plum and spice flavors, set on a light, transparent, glassy foundation, lingering gently. Drink now through 2020. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Willamette Valley
review: Bright and appealing for its delicacy, with pretty green apple and melon fruit that lingers on the refreshing finish. Drink now. 1,051 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Willamette Valley
review: Fresh and invigorating, with juicy grapefruit and green melon aromas and flavors that just don't quit. Yummy stuff, finishing dry. Drink now. 747 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Willamette Valley
review: Fresh, focused and flavorful, jammed with pretty apple, honey and spice flavors, finishing lively and generous. Drink now through 2003. 1,700 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Yamhill-Carlton District
review: Polished and dry, with hints of leather and spice around a silky core of peach and melon fruit. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: A smooth, silky Pinot Gris offering pretty melon and pineapple flavors that linger gently on the finish. Ready now. 2,912 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Soft, broad and aromatic, with lots of nectarine, grapefruit, honey and almond flavors mixing up enthusiastically as the finish persists. Drink now. 3,173 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Supple, round and generous with its peach, cantaloupe and perfumy, citrusy overtones, finishing silky. Tasted from a bottle with a screw-cap closure. Drink now. 5,050 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Smooth in texture and vibrant in flavor, offering a soft mouthful of ripe blackberry and plum flavors, finishing with a smoky edge. Drink now through 2014. 7,964 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Big, rich and powerful, a muscular Pinot Noir that pours out its black cherry, cedar and spice flavors, finishing with a touch of bitterness amid the fine-grained tannins. Somewhat dense style, it wants cellaring. Best after 2003. 1,888 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Dijon Clone 113
review: Vibrant and intense for a '97, showing lots of exuberant blackberry, currant and plum flavors on a supple, elegant frame. Fine tannins can use cellaring. Best from 2000 through 2005. 50 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Emery
review: Ripe and generous, offering a chewy mouthful of black cherry, blackberry, wet earth and pepper, lingering against crisp tannins. Best from 2011 through 2014. 780 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate Cuvée
review: Light and airy, with a tang to the balance and the flavor profile, offering lime flower accents to the berry flavors, lingering refreshingly. Drink now through 2016. 4,300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Kiana
review: There's a bite of tannins around the fresh plum and currant fruit, with a transparency to the flavors that persists on the long, refined finish. Drink now through 2013. 795 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Kiana
review: Earthy, cinnamon-scented, with plenty of cherry and mineral flavor at the center, persisting nicely on the polished finish. Best from 2007 through 2012. 594 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley La Solitaire
review: Ripe, round and generous with its black cherry and currant flavors, shaded with bitter chocolate and bay leaf notes as the flavors linger intensely. Approachable now. Best after 2002. 117 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Pierre Léon
review: Firm, with flavors of black cherry and floral notes packing in nicely and an odd hint of horseradish livening up the finish and making it more interesting. Best after 2007. 1,645 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Pierre Léon
review: Generous and open in flavor on a firm frame, with black cherry, earth and mushroom notes swirling through the finish. It finishes smoother than it starts. Drink now through 2005. 1,307 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Terres Basses
review: Broad and earthy, with a mineral edge to the cherry and tobacco flavors, echoing nicely against lightly crisp tannins. Drink now through 2014. 451 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Triple Black Slopes
review: Firm tannins support ripe cherry, raspberry and spice flavors that dance smoothly, gliding through the refined, toasty finish. Drink now through 2015. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Estate Cuvée
review: Light and velvety, with juicy, guava-accented berry and spice flavors that pick up steam on the open-weave finish. Drink now through 2017. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Pierre Léon
review: Firm in texture and light-footed, with raspberry and spice flavors on a lively frame, persisting against crisp tannins. Best after 2017. 2,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Terres Basses
review: Earthy, stony notes step past the reticent cherry fruit as the firm tannins polish up and smooth out on the extended finish. A savory style that needs time to develop. Best after 2016. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley
review: A pretty wine, favoring grace over power, with spicy pear and hazelnut notes echoing on the smooth finish. Drink now through 2001. 620 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Estelle
review: Sturdy, juicy stuff, a lovely mouthful of fresh pear, mint, spice and subtle wood flavors that echo nicely on the rambunctious finish. Drink now through 2003. 272 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Willamette Valley
review: Light and sleek, with pretty grapefruit, hay and green apple flavors, lingering well. Drink now. 1,160 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Willamette Valley
review: Light and crisp, offering nectarine and walnut flavors that echo nicely against a slightly drying texture on the finish. Drink now. 1,160 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Willamette Valley
review: Silky and round, a big, generous wine brimming with pear and Meyer lemon flavors that linger on the lively finish. Drink now. 117 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Yamhill-Carlton District
review: Light and lithe, with a gentle feel to the pear and minty flavors, lingering on the delicate finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Light, open-textured and appealing for its melon and citrus flavors, finishing with some extra zip. Drink now. 3,731 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: There's a spicy edge to the pear and balsamic flavors in this savory white. Drink now. 3,771 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Light and fragrant, with fresh pear and spice flavors, finishing on a citrusy note. Drink now. 4,854 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Light, supple and generous with its nectarine and melon fruit, lingering gently on the soft finish. Drink now. 5,684 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Soft and spicy, a pretty mouthful of melon and allspice flavors, finishing with a refreshing tang of citrus that lingers. Drink now. 4,197 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Ripe, generous and disarmingly appealing for its melon, almond, rose petal and spice flavors that linger on the generous finish. 2,700 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Bright and refreshing, a bit raucous in texture for such a light wine, but it has plenty of pretty black raspberry and floral flavors. Drink now through 2005. 4,146 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Lithe, open-textured and generous with its currant fruit and hints of black pepper, silky through the finish. Drink now through 2009. 3,774 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Has more ripeness and richness than most '95s, more layers than most too, showing toasty black cherry and anise flavors that persist on the solid finish. Has enough tannin to need cellaring until 1999. 1,300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Aliette
review: Light and tight, with a grip to the modest black currant and licorice flavors, lingering delicately. Best from 2012 through 2016. 775 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Aliette
review: Dark and dense in color, but not overwhelmingly rich in flavor, with pretty blueberry and cherry aromas and flavors, fine tannins and a harmonious finish. Best from 2003 through 2008. 1,345 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Aliette
review: Light, supple in texture and especially appealing for its bright currant and blackberry flavors that linger on the delicate finish. Remarkable for its persistence and delicacy. Drink now through 2002. 730 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Croft
review: Crisp and bright, with a core of blackberry and currant wrapped in a layer of fine-grained tannins. Flavors last on the generous finish. Drink now through 2005. 264 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Emery
review: Light and fragrant, with a peppery edge to the berry and herb flavors, lingering gently on the refined finish. Best from 2013 through 2017. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Emery
review: On the tart side, but fleshy enough to show some nice raspberry and cinnamon flavors, finishing with a graceful structure and a touch of floral character. Best from 2006 through 2011. 657 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Pierre Léon
review: Vibrant, open-textured and distinctive, with savory, earthy undertones around a core of cherry and raspberry fruit, hinting at chocolate as the finish lingers. Best from 2014 through 2018. 950 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Pierre Léon
review: Bright, with a silky feel underneath the fine layer of gritty tannins. The raspberry and cherry flavors come through on the open-weave finish. Drink now through 2013. 2,631 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Pierre Léon
review: Smooth and ripe, showing juicy cherry and spice flavors, with hints of orange peel and chalk sneaking in as the finish persists against fine tannins. Best from 2010 through 2014. 2,433 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Pierre Léon
review: Supple, with pretty cherry and raspberry flavors, hinting at floral and spice notes as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2012. 714 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Pierre Léon
review: Strikes a lovely balance between ripe, pure black cherry and plum flavors and fine, chewy tannins, making for an approachable wine that could pick up more depth with cellaring. Best from 2000. 891 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Terres Basses
review: Light on its feet, with a savory edge to the cherry and white pepper flavors, narrowing on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 550 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Triple Black Slopes
review: Firm and lightweight, with a crisp core of dark cherry and tar flavors, finishing with clarity. Drink now through 2012. 449 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County Pierre Léon
review: On the crisp side, with juicy blackberry, currant and white pepper flavors on a lean frame, finishing with fine tannins. Drink now through 2005. 2,150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Aliette
review: Light and refreshing, this delivers pretty raspberry and clove flavors on a sleek frame, with fine tannins underlining the spicy finish. Drink now through 2018. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Kiana
review: Lithe and expressive, this medium-weight and spicy red shows nutmeg and clove overtones to its dark berry flavors, finishing with a tang of acidity. Drink now through 2018. 600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Triple Black Slopes
review: Light and spicy, with sweet exotic notes around a light core of berry and floral flavors, finishing with panache. Drink now through 2017. 500 cases made.

name: Gamay Noir Willamette Valley
review: Bright and effusive in flavor, but feels less frivolous than most Gamay. Has intensity and a slight bite of tannin to add a serious edge to the strawberry and cherry flavors. Drink soon. 1,160 cases made.

name: Gamay Noir Yamhill County
review: This Gamay has more stuffing and brighter fruit flavors than most '95 Oregon Pinot Noir. A lively and generous drink with some actual richness and charm. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Willamette Valley
review: Light and fresh, with pretty pear and floral flavors, finishing with a citrusy zing. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Yamhill County
review: Soft, fresh and lively, with pretty citrus-scented pear and vanilla flavors, which echo nicely on the polished finish. Drink now. 1,512 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Light and tangy, with an herbal note weaving through the apple and citrus flavors, echoing nicely on the finish. Drink now. 4,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Ripe, vigorous style emphasizes pretty pear, honeysuckle and almond flavors, which linger nicely on the round finish. Drink now. 3,559 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Yamhill-Carlton District
review: Light and sleek, with modest pineapple and green apple flavors playing against lively acidity. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Meunier Willamette Valley
review: Rich and supple, this has lovely blackberry and plum flavors on a velvety frame, and the fruit persists on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 502 cases made.

name: Pinot Meunier Willamette Valley
review: Fresh and jazzy. A lively mouthful of blackberry and black cherry flavors that remain crisp and vivid through the finish. Drink soon. 420 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Jory Hills Vineyard
review: Fresh, inviting and tangy, with delicacy to the Pinot Grislike flavor profile. Darkens a bit on the finish, lingering well against crisp tannins. Drink now through 2019. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Aliette
review: Smooth and easygoing, with modest berry and cherry flavors, finishing with an attractive floral note. Drink now through 2011. 748 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Aliette
review: Riper than most '95s, with a solid range of black cherry, floral and spice flavors that linger nicely on the firm finish. Ready to drink. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Coleman
review: Firm in texture, with spicy blackberry and black pepper flavors on a chewy frame. Needs time to soften the tannins. Best after 2002. 304 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Dijon Clone 115
review: Extra-firm in texture, a crisp style that emphasizes spicy, chocolaty cherry flavors on a medium-weight frame. Needs time to soften the tannins. Best from 2003 through 2007. 98 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Emery
review: Silky, with pretty cherry and spice flavors on a gentle frame, finishing with enough acidity to keep it juicy. Drink now through 2011. 346 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate Cuvée
review: Light and fragrant, with caramel, root beer and white pepper hints around a modest core of dark berry flavors, lingering against mild tannins. Drink now through 2016. 4,400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Kiana
review: Light-footed and light in color, with pretty berry and orange peel flavors that linger on the firm-textured finish. Best from 2014 through 2017. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Kiana
review: Firm in texture, generous with its cherry and smoky, tarry flavors, lingering well on the extended finish. Best from 2005 through 2009. 555 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley Vercingetorix VX
review: Fresh and lively, with peach and sunny slate aromas and flavors that remain juicy through the finish. Drink now. 126 cases made.

name: Viognier Willamette Valley Late Harvest
review: A stunner. Rich, ripe and generous, with tiers of nectarine, pineapple, honey and caramel flavors that remain rich and harmonious. Has a hint of pepper on the deftly balanced finish. Drink now through 2004. 160 cases made.

name: Brut Willamette Valley Grower Series
review: Rich and luxurious, with floral baked apple and cinnamon roll aromas and complex flavors of Asian pear, ginger and candied almond. Drink now. 450 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Tualatin Estate
review: Plush and ripe, with fragrant black cherry and toasty spice aromas and supple raspberry, pepper and tea flavors that glide toward polished tannins. Drink now through 2023. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Elton
review: Smoky, toasty and complex, with dark berry and pepper flavors on a velvety frame, opening up into a fleshy finish. This has depth and intensity without excess weight. Drink now through 2022. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate
review: Savory cherry aromas open to deep, well-knit dark plum, smoky herb and spice flavors that linger toward refined tannins. Drink now through 2022. 16,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Founders' Reserve
review: Light and silky, with pretty orange peel-accented raspberry and mulberry flavors, hinting at tea and tobacco leaf as the finish lingers easily. Drink now through 2018. 4,600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Signature Cuvée
review: Light and sleek, with pretty cranberry, pear and floral flavors on a polished frame, lingering enticingly on the long, deftly woven finish. Drink now through 2020. 374 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Tualatin Estate
review: Polished, expressive and taut, with blackberry and cherry flavors that unfurl easily on a sleek frame, lingering on the extended, coffee-accented finish. Drink now through 2021. 427 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vintage 42
review: Sleek and focused, with savory cherry aromas and harmonious raspberry, spiced cinnamon and floral tea flavors. Drink now through 2024. 200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Dijon Clones Estate Vineyard
review: Rich and satiny, wrapping its generous pear, pineapple, nutmeg and vanilla flavors in a polished frame. A harmonious wine that strikes an elegant balance but still delivers plenty of flavor. Drink now through 2005. 664 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Founders' Reserve
review: Supple, gentle, ripe and well-mannered, wrapping its ripe berry and plum flavors in just enough firm tannins to suggest this still has room to grow. A touch of toast and herbs makes it interesting. Drink now through 2009. 987 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Hoodview Vineyard
review: Soft, velvety style emphasizes its blueberry and currant flavors, which echo harmoniously with spice and white pepper notes on the round, generous finish. Drink now through 2006. 124 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon OVB
review: Ripe and focused, generous with its spicy currant and blackberry flavors, sliding in some nice, earthy notes and a touch of licorice. Distinctive and smoothly balanced. Delicious now; best in 1998.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Bernau Block
review: Fresh and vibrant, with juicy raspberry and black cherry fruit under a layer of peppery spice and light tannins, finishing with tingly acidity. Drink now through 2017. 825 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate
review: Light and fragrant, with some density to the black cherry and fresh orange peel aromas and flavors, weaving in a brewed tea note as the finish persists against refined tannins. Drink now through 2018. 3,379 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Hoodview Vineyard
review: Polished, open-textured and generous with its blackberry, plum and delicately earthy-spicy flavors, which linger effortlessly on the round, modestly tannic finish. Drink now through 2006. 330 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Karina Vineyard
review: Smooth in texture and ripe in flavor, with beautifully focused blackberry and black pepper character, which lingers elegantly on the open finish. Drink now through 2006. 174 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Signature Cuvée
review: Fresh and light, with cinnamon-accented red berry flavors balanced on a slightly nubby texture. Comes together harmoniously. Drink now through 2017. 691 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Signature Cuvée
review: Supple, with a savory mineral edge to the ripe cherry and cassis flavors, finishing on a dark note. Has style and grace. Drink now through 2017. 498 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Tualatin Estate
review: Bright and crisp, draping the juicy cherry, raspberry and floral flavors in a blanket of fine tannins, coming together with deft balance as the finish persists with precision. Drink now through 2022. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Tualatin Estate
review: This red is subdued but distinctive, offering orange flower and tangerine peel notes that show light guava fruit accents. Finishes with finesse. Drink now through 2017. 792 cases made.

name: Riesling Willamette Valley
