review: Light and sweet, with fresh pear and citrus flavors gaining extra nuances of fresh ginger and white pepper. The finish lasts nicely, carrying its sweetness with grace. Drink now through 2022. 19,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon Founders' Reserve
review: Soft, supple, harmonious and spicy, offering hazelnut-tinged pear and honey flavors that linger gently on the finish. Drink now. 2,157 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon Shea Vineyard OVB
review: Fresh and carefully crafted, with citrus and spice flavors lingering on the nicely focused finish. Has style and grace, and it should fill out through 1999 to 2000. 1,095 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Vintage 40
review: Tangy, with a savory edge to the pineapple, apple and maple flavors, finishing with finesse. Drink now through 2019. 120 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Peach and honeysuckle aromas lead to pretty nectarine and spice flavors. Drink now. 26,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Freedom Hill Vineyard
review: Has ripe plum and currant flavors and surprisingly tart balance on a firm, focused frame. Give it time to develop. Best after 2004. 517 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Hoodview Vineyard
review: Light in weight, firm in texture, distinctive in flavor, with earthy, toasty, tobacco-scented blackberry and tar notes that persist on the finish. Best after 2005. 475 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate Vineyard
review: Ripe, plummy and spicy. Broad in structure, with fine tannins around a plump core of fruit that lingers on the finish. Drink now through 2013. 2,534 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate Vineyard
review: Supple and decadent, with earthy plum and tea-leaf flavors that linger nicely on a racy finish, generous and elegant. Drink now through 2006. 905 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Founders' Reserve
review: Lean and taut, with tea leaf and orange peel overtones to the vibrant red plum flavors, skipping past refined tannins as the finish persists. Best from 2016 through 2020. 2,600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Joe Dobbes Signature Cuvée

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Joe Dobbes Signature Cuvée

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Signature Cuvée
review: Crisp, with a sleek texture, finishing with a sharp jolt of acidity. The flavor profile skews dark, with black cherry and red plum notes lingering on the finish. Needs cellaring to come together. Best from 2015 through 2018. 390 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Tualatin Estate
review: A delicate and pretty wine, with rose petal and strawberry aromas and modestly complex cherry and spice flavors. Drink now through 2021. 950 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Tualatin Estate
review: Light-footed, with pretty strawberry and raspberry fruit in moderate proportions, hinting at peppermint and wet earth as the finish sails on. Drink now through 2018. 1,073 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Whole Cluster
review: This has a sense of plushness and generosity, with density but not weight, offering black cherry and cassis flavors on a polished frame. Drink now through 2019. 30,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Whole Cluster
review: Smooth and generous, with a green edge to the dark plum and wet earth flavors, finishing with a silky texture and deft balance. Drink now through 2019. 26,035 cases made.

name: Riesling Oregon Dry
review: Dry, crisp and vibrant for its tart grapefruit, apple and floral aromas and flavors that keep singing on the finish. Delicious now, may be best from 1999. 2,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Willamette Valley
review: Bright and lively, this is jazzy with pear, peach, citrus and floral flavors, sweet but balanced with bracing acidity. Drink now through 2015. 15,133 cases made.

name: Riesling Willamette Valley
review: Soft and appealing, brimming with peach and floral character, nestling easily into the long, off-dry finish. Drink now through 2013. 24,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Willamette Valley
review: Light and refreshing, offering a delicate style that hides its sweetness with lively acidity, playing its lemon and grapefruit flavors artfully. Drink now through 2013. 20,414 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon
review: Crisp and light, it's a wine of delicacy, grace and pretty apple and caramel flavors that linger on the finish. 5,979 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon Founders' Reserve

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Dijon Clone
review: Light and deftly balanced, playing pear flavors and stylish earthy-leesy nuances against a silky texture. The finish lingers gently. Drink now through 2017. 1,610 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Estate
review: Focused and lightly savory, with appealing apple and tropical fruit notes. Drink now. 828 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Estate
review: Tangy, with lime and lime blossom overtones to the apple cider and spice flavors, persisting nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 557 cases made.

name: Muscat Willamette Valley Semi-Sparkling Frizzanté
review: Light and sweet. A lovely, bright mouthful of pear and litchi flavors that remain refreshing through the finish. Drink now. 1,330 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Light and tangy, with crisp lemon undertones to the peach and floral flavors, lingering easily. Drink now. 14,470 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Light and fresh, brimming with nectarine and melon fruit, lingering on the open-textured finish. Drink now. 24,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Smooth and silky, with pear and melon flavors riding harmoniously over the dry finish, echoing nicely. This integrates its elements especially well. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Lively, almost crisp, with subtle almond and rose petal overtones to the flinty pear flavors. Drink now. 16,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Burger Vineyard Reserve
review: Ripe and round, smooth and beautifully polished, with plum, prune, berry and vanilla flavors all balancing on the finish. Drinkable now. 3,084 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate
review: Crisp and tangy, with firm tannins around the ripe cherry and mint flavors, pushing past the grip on the finish. Best from 2016 through 2020. 15,222 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate
review: This is crisp and minerally, with stony aromatics that lead to flavors of black cherry and red plum on a lean frame, lingering with refinement and intensity. Best from 2015 through 2018. 13,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate Vineyard
review: Plump and generous, with rich cherry and chocolate flavors that float nicely over fine-grained tannins. It finishes with a touch of green and a firmer texture than it starts with. Drink now through 2006. 750 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Joe Dobbes Signature Cuvée
review: Supple, round and generous with its black cherry and blackberry flavors, shaded with hints of tea leaf and spice. Finishes firmly enough to want cellaring. Drink now through 2008. 968 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Karina Vineyard
review: In a well-mannered, harmonious style, it focuses on peppery currant and blueberry fruit, echoing nicely on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2005. 112 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vintage 40
review: Light and spicy, with the transparent color signaling a spicy, floral berry profile that wells up gently into a lithe finish. Drink now through 2019. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Whole Cluster

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Whole Cluster Fermented

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Whole Cluster Fermented
review: a light and jazzy red, displaying pretty cherry and raspberry fruit on a deftly balanced frame, lingering nicely. Drink now through 2014. 12,125 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Eola-Amity Hills Elton
review: Light, smooth and toasty, with a silky texture playing against the creamy, oak-infused pear and caramel flavors. Modest in scope and lingering gently. Drink now through 2017. 186 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon
review: Generous and fruity, this pretty mouthful of pear and citrus flavors is shaded with spicy oak notes. Drink now. 5,721 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon
review: A crisp Chardonnay, light and bright, with pretty lime and nectarine flavors. Drink now through 2001. 4,143 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon
review: A supple, spicy Chardonnay offering a nice range of melon, green apple and honey flavors, with a tinge of caramel on the smooth finish. A very nice price for all you get, from an Oregon winery to watch. Drink now. 9,788 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon
review: Ripe, round, lightly spicy with oak surrounding the honeyed pineapple and pear flavors. Smooth and generous on the lengthy finish. Drinkable now. 2,839 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon Canary Hill Vineyard Reserve
review: Lean in texture, bright and spicy in flavor, with a lemony pear streak that maintains liveliness through the finish. What it lacks in intensity is made up for in deftness. Try now. 450 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon Dijon Clones Elton Vineyard
review: Bright and lively, a bit tart but nicely layered with pear and tropical fruit flavors that echo nicely on the oak-tinged finish. Drink now through 2006. 337 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon Founders' Reserve
review: Ripe and vivid in flavor, letting its peach, pear and nutty spice flavors swirl effectively on the lively finish. Nice now. 608 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Estate
review: Crisp in style, with lively, lemon-accented apple flavors, finishing with a creamy note. Drink now through 2015. 552 cases made.

name: Dry Rosé Willamette Valley
review: Dry, with a salmon color and a hint of rooibos tea to the pear and orange peel flavors. Syrah and Tempranillo. Drink now. 596 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Oregon

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Soft and open-textured, with pretty pear, honeydew and floral aromas and flavors, lingering nicely. Drink now. 14,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Light and supple, with pretty, spicy pear and apricot flavors, finishing with some roundness and unexpected generosity. Drink now. 14,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Enticing stuff, fresh and lively, with almond-scented pear and melon flavors that hang on through the soft finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Soft, generous and fragrant with melon, almond and apple flavors that linger gently on the finish. Appealing now. Drink soon. 7,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon Founders' Reserve
review: Soft and round, lying easily on the palate, showing pineapple, pear and white pepper flavors that last nicely on the finish. Drink now. 431 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Bright and racy, with juicy pear, clove and lemon flavors on a lively frame. Drink now. 23,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Light and easygoing, with pretty pear and green melon flavors on a sleek frame. Drink now. 21,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Light and tangy, with pretty pear and green melon flavors, finishing tart. Drink now. 5,054 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley Vintage Selection
review: Bright and refreshing, juicy with melon, pear and citrus aromas and flavors, which linger nicely. Drink now. 4,085 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Bright and juicy, with firm tannins surrounding a lively core of blackberry and spice flavors that linger nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 19,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: The supple, spicy style emphasizes nutmeg and mineral overtones to the solid black cherry flavors. Not a big wine, but it's graceful and inviting. Drink now through 2005. 15,800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Estate Vineyard
review: Earthy, tarry, smoky flavors predominate in this firm, full red. Has intensity, but will it develop charm? Best after 2005. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Founders' Reserve
review: Soft and ripe, gentle. Lovely blackberry and cedar flavors linger spicily on the generous finish.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Whole Cluster
review: Lively, jazzy, youthful style brims with cherry and dark berry flavors, framed with fine-grained tannins. Drink it while it's fresh. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light, with firm tannins and spicy, earthy character. Cherry flavors come in softly, but this is a savory wine that needs time to develop. Best from 2012 through 2016. 12,190 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Bright and deftly balanced to show off its pretty strawberry and floral flavors on a light frame. Drink now through 2012. 25,127 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate
review: Supple, polished and appealing for the cherry and bay leaf flavors, finishing with gentle insistence. Drink now through 2019. 9,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Founders' Reserve
review: Red berry flavors shows an earthy edge, poised against polished tannins. Drink now through 2013. 1,285 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Hannah
review: Light in color and body, with pretty, orange peelaccented red berry fruit that lingers on a delicate finish. Drink now through 2018. 311 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley O'Connor Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, with fine tannins surrounding tart berry and cherry flavors. Peppery, floral notes chime in on the tart finish. Best after 2001. 410 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Tualatin Estate
review: Light, tight and spicy, with a peppery edge to the red berry and earth flavors, focusing narrowly through the deftly balanced finish. Best from 2012 through 2017. 322 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Whole Cluster

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Whole Cluster Fermented

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Whole Cluster Fermented
review: Light, polished and fragrant, showing more spice than fruit, with a mocha-nutmeg overlay to the modest berry and orange peel flavors. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Whole Cluster Fermented
review: Light, refreshing and appealing for its plum and bright berry flavors, finishing smooth. Drink now. 16,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Willamette Valley
review: Soft and moderately sweet, with pretty pear and floral flavors that hint at apricot as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2019. 19,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Willamette Valley
review: Light and gently sweet, with pear and spice flavors on a polished frame. Lingers pleasantly on the finish. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Willamette Valley
review: Lightly sweet, with a tangy edge to the ripe pear and lychee flavors, finishing with some length. Drink now. 16,600 cases made.

name: Riesling Willamette Valley
review: Soft and moderately sweet, with pretty pear and floral flavors, finishing with delicacy. Drink now. 21,354 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon
review: Light, a bit tart and earthy, but it fleshes out nicely into a modest, well-crafted Chardonnay that lets its flavors echo on the subtle finish. Drink now through 2006. 3,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon
review: Bright and fruity, with lingering green apple, pear and spice flavors. A charming white that offers lovely fruit notes right through the finish. 1,600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon Elton Vineyard Reserve
review: Lean and smoky, with a toasty, slightly tarry edge to the bright green apple flavor. A bit tart; try now. 844 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon Estate Founders' Reserve
review: Open-textured, fresh and pure, with pretty pear and spice flavors lingering on the lively finish. Drink now. 378 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon Founders' Reserve

name: Chardonnay Oregon Shea Vineyard OVB
review: Smooth and spicy, striving for an elegant style that results in polished, subtle flavors that extend into a long, delicate finish. Drinkable now. 608 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Dijon Clone
review: Wet earth and almond notes compete against a core of ripe pear and citrus flavors in this medium-weight Chardonnay. Drink now through 2018. 1,600 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Oregon Founders' Reserve
review: Bright and fruity, dry in texture and generous with its pear and melon flavors. Drink now. 298 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Crisp and lively, juicy with lime and melon flavors, finishing on the tart side. Needs food. Drink now. 6,560 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon Founders' Reserve
review: Fresh and appealing for its melon and pineapple flavors, finishing graceful. Drink now. 875 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Light and sleek, with almond and almond blossom scents to the pear fruit, finishing with good lift. Drink now. 26,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Bright and refreshing, with a resiny edge to the peach and melon flavors, finishing soft. Drink now. 21,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Light and sprightly, with green apple, melon and guava flavors that linger on the crisp finish. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light, open in texture, with pretty currant and green olive flavors, lingering gently. Drink now through 2009. 16,731 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Smooth and gentle, with pretty red currant and white chocolate aromas and flavors in modest proportions, lingering well. Drink now through 2008. 18,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light and appealing, showing off its smooth berry and beet flavors. Finishes with polish. Drinkable now. 2,750 cases made.

review: Light and fragrant, this delicately framed Pinot Noir has pretty plum and currant flavors that linger gently on the finish. Texture is supple, making it approachable now. Best from 2000 through 2002. 2,403 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Founders' Reserve
review: Chewy and tannic, but bright currant and berry flavors come through strongly on the generous finish. Drinkable now. 209 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Freedom Hill Vineyard
review: Light, soft and velvety, with pretty currant and spice flavors that echo nicely as they linger on the finish. Drink now. 567 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon OVB
review: Velvety texture, nicely focused currant and berry flavors, gently tannic finish. Approachable now. 630 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Whole Cluster

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Whole Cluster Fermented

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate

name: Chardonnay Oregon
review: Earthy apple and spice flavors on a medium frame, finishing with a cidery note. Drink now. 3,081 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Light and tangy, showing citrus and pear flavors at modest levels. Drink now. 29,280 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley Founders' Reserve

name: Pinot Noir Oregon

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Whole Cluster
review: Amazingly ripe and generous, this smooth mouthful of black cherry and exotic spice flavors is already showing some depth. Drink now through 2000. 5,650 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate
review: Light in color and light-footed, with prominent notes of orange peel and tea that linger on the finish against mildly grippy tannins. Drink now through 2015. 10,533 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate Vineyard
review: Light and lively, with a creamy blanket around a tangy center of raspberry and a hint of pepper. Drink now. 1,004 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Founders' Reserve
review: Tart in texture, with sharply focused blackberry and peppery-floral aromas and flavors that linger on the finish. Best after 2001. 2,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Karina Vineyard
review: The light, compact style emphasizes pretty black cherry and spice flavors on a smooth, polished frame. Drink now. 260 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Signature Cuvée
review: Lean, with a cedary edge to the modest berry flavors, lingering softly. Drink now through 2014. 494 cases made.

name: Riesling Oregon
review: Pleasantly light and fruity, with pretty peach and melon flavors. Finishes on the dry side. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Oregon Dry
review: Soft and generous, this isn't really sweet but bright, with apple, peach and floral flavors that linger nicely on the off-dry finish. 2,400 cases made.

name: Riesling Oregon Dry
review: Bright and lively with apricot-scented peach and apple flavors, generous and fresh. Tasty now through 1997. 1,651 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oregon OVB
review: Smooth and generous with its berry and slightly earthy flavors, finishing a little chewy. Drink now. 417 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Oregon
review: Lightly sweet, with modest spice and pineapple-grapefruit flavors. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Firm and appealing for its pretty black cherry and caramel notes that echo on the round finish. Drink now through 2001. 13,100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Smooth in texture and tasty. Slightly candied raspberry and plum flavors lead into a fine finish. Drinkable now. 1,517 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Whole Berry Fermented
review: Light and fruity like a Beaujolais, this is a supple wine with nicely nuanced strawberry and watermelon notes on a modest scale. Drink soon. 8,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Margaret River
review: Crisp in structure, turning silky as it spreads out its pretty currant and plum flavors, shaded with bay leaf and herb. Has a solid feel and should develop nicely with cellaring. Drink now through 2006. 128 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Margaret River
review: Generous with its herbal, tobacco and blackberry flavors that linger on the supple finish. A sturdy, stylish wine that promises better things by 1999 to 2000. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Margaret River
review: A lighter style of Shiraz, this still has plenty of berry and anise flavors packed into it, with hints of mint and mineral on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 128 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Margaret River
review: Rich and overripe, but earthy, with leathery aromas, prune and tobacco flavors and pepper notes. Full-bodied and tannic, with lingering chocolate and coffee flavors on the finish. An extreme style that may not appeal to everyone. Drink now.

name: Verdelho Margaret River
review: A sturdy white wine with earthy apple flavors lingering on the round finish. Drink now. 64 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Margaret River
review: Lean in texture, almost bitter in flavor; tough, with little grace or charm. Has enough fruit notes sneaking through on the finish to suggest it might come around by 1997.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Jezebel
review: Light-footed, with firm tannins circling a core of blackberry and floral flavors, lingering on the deft finish. Best from 2017 through 2020. 2,975 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Brauneberger Juffer
review: Very floral in aroma, offering violet and rose notes that give way to peach and nectarine on the palate. Juicy and harmonious, with a light body and a lingering finish. Drink now through 2035. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer-Sonnenuhr
review: Creamy and succulent, this boasts peach, apricot and mango flavors, with hints of lime and mineral. Bright and concentrated, with a lilting, graceful finish. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer
review: Pure, offering apricot, lime and slate aromas and flavors. There may be botrytis, judging from the concentration and spicy character, yet this remains light and delicate, with a refreshing finish. Drink now through 2020. 2,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer
review: Pure and focused, hinting at cumin and coriander notes, along with smoke and peach. Light, yet balanced and lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2012.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer
review: Bright and juicy, here's a Riesling that combines delicacy and intensity. Peach, apple, citrus and stone aromas and flavors remain persistent and linger on the gentle finish. Drink now through 2018. 224 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer (AP 4)
review: Round and fleshy, reeking of slate with accents of vanilla and cream, this is a big kabinett, almost opulent, backed by a solid structure and a dense texture. Be patient with this baby. Drink now through 2005.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Brauneberger Juffer
review: Clarity and succulence mark this rich Riesling. Peach, spice and mineral aromas and flavors are well-integrated with the structure and texture. Expands nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2025. 200 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer (AP 11)
review: Rose, slate and red berry aromas and flavors mark this exotic Riesling, whose structure is moderately firm. It picks up a tactile sensation on the finish, yet lingers pleasantly, with a licorice aftertaste. Drink now through 2012.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Brauneberger Juffer
review: Still a bit yeasty, with cinnamon and pastry notes accented by orange and peach. Needs a little time to find its balance; there's more bass than treble now. Best from 2010 through 2020. 500 cases imported.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel
review: A sweeter style, displaying peach, nectarine and lemon notes. This has great cut, with a bright, tangy aftertaste. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: Really focused from start to finish. A strong herbal note marks this delicate Riesling, whose sleek structure and intensity provide length and dimension. Drink now through 2010.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer
review: Rich, round and on the sweeter side, showing peach and apricot notes on a compact frame. More like an auslese. Good length, but less expressive today. Drink now through 2007.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer (AP 4)
review: This is full of mineral and spice notes matched to a firm, elegant profile. Dense and light on its feet at the same time, this has the intensity and balance to age gracefully. Long, creamy finish. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer-Sonnenuhr
review: A little CO2 lifts the herb, peach and slate notes today, lending freshness and an edge. There's fine underlying structure, density and length. Enjoy now for its freshness or wait six years. Drink now through 2015. 330 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer-Sonnenuhr (AP 6)
review: Very exotic, exhibiting honey, apricot and citrus. Starts out rich and powerful, then the firm backbone washes the palate with bracing acidity. Needs time to come together. Best from 2001 through 2006.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer
review: Plenty of tropical fruit—mango, passion fruit—join the apricot and citrus aromas and flavors in this lush kabinett. It's balanced on the soft side, yet fresh, with a lingering finish. Drink now through 2012. 380 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer (AP 3)
review: Plenty of slate and floral aromas highlight this light- to medium-bodied white. It picks up an almond note, turning firm on the finish. Drink now through 2010.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: A lush, broad style, evoking honey, dried apple and quince aromas and flavors. It's offset by a streak of acidity. Drink now through 2012. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer (AP 5)
review: Ripe, yet underscored by a firm structure, the almond, passion fruit and honey glide across the palate. There's density and expression, ending in an aftertaste of tropical fruit and mineral. Best from 2001 through 2008.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer-Sonnenuhr
review: Broad, showing a lush, cozy edge to the lime, almond, fennel and mineral flavors, with bracing acidity beneath. Drink now through 2006.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer-Sonnenuhr (AP 10)
review: Forward and open-knit. Purity of fruit is the hallmark of this '97 auslese, offering light peach, slate and lime flavors, with moderate structure and a modest finish. Drink now through 2003.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer-Sonnenuhr (AP 10)
review: A lush, tropical style, showing ripe pineapple, mango and dried apricot flavors and a mouthful of honey on the rich, sweet finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer (AP 10)
review: Here's an open, accessible Riesling, ripe and soft, offering peach and floral aromas and flavors. Moderate length. Drink now through 2008.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: A creamy style, with peach, vanilla custard and lime flavors and bright acidity to match. It thins out a little on the tasty finish. Drink now through 2009.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer (AP 1)
review: Juicy and concentrated, this QbA shows apricot and passion fruit on a lively backbone of acidity. A touch on the sweet side, but simply delicious. Drink now through 2002. 275 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer
review: Compact, with a sweet-tart character. The dried apricot and orange flavors lack clarity, tailing off on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer
review: This is reserved, offering modest apple, citrus and mineral notes. It's rich, yet needs a little time to stretch out. Tails off on the finish. Best from 2008 through 2018.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: There are tasty peach and lime notes here, but also an earthy streak, which upsets the purity slightly. Still, it is delicate, balanced and typical of the Mosel style. Nice crisp finish. Drink now through 2008.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer-Sonnenuhr
review: Sweet and juicy, this white features peach and apple on a racy structure. Plenty of fruit, but the sweetness and acidity need to knit. Best from 2003 through 2008.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer-Sonnenuhr
review: For those who like them big and fat. An opulent, gooey, honeyed wine, featuring plenty of dried apricot and honey aromas and flavors. Rich and succulent, but a bit soft and, yes, very sweet. Drink now through 2000.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer-Sonnenuhr (AP 5)
review: Elegant and a bit simple. The honey and apricot flavors marry nicely to provide straightforward drinking pleasure. Try now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer (AP 7)
review: Subtle, with green apple, wet hay and earth flavors. Starts slowly, but kicks to life on the tart, juicy, vibrant finish. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer-Sonnenuhr
review: Quite appealing, offering vanilla, peach, pineapple, wet earth and mineral flavors. A soft, round, easy-to-drink spätlese that can be enjoyed now.

name: Riesling QbA Halbtrocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: Off-dry, with a soft structure and spicy notes.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer (AP 11)
review: Like chewing on a soft candy; this light, off-dry kabinett should make for easy before-dinner sipping. Lacks the backbone to stand up to food.

name: Gewürztraminer Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee
review: A study in contrasts. Amazing balance of lush texture and racy acidity meshes in an ethereal package, making this TBA elegant and seductive. Delicious apricot, spice, honey and caramel flavors with accents of botrytis, followed by a long finish. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee
review: A luscious sweetie, with layers of baked apple, piecrust, peach cobbler and apricot flavors. Oozes cream and spice on the long, fresh, enveloping finish. Stunningly rich and flavorful. Drink now through 2025. 75 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee
review: Superb. Intense aromas and flavors of chocolate, coffee bean and orange peel mark this rich dessert wine. The lively structure keeps it all focused and long. Hard candy aftertaste. Drink now through 2008.

name: Gewürztraminer Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee
review: Loaded with butterscotch, orange peel and delicate spice flavors. Quite ripe and rich, with plenty of elegance and a nice complexity. Has staying power and sings on the finish, with glazed apricot notes. Drink now through 2020. 90 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee
review: Thick and rich, offering plenty of botrytis nuances of honey and citrus along with its smoke and crème brûlée flavors. Though lush, it's all held in check by snappy acidity. Drink now through 2010.

name: Sämling 88 Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee
review: Very elegant, with superrich, pure flavors of ripe peach, glazed apricot and loads of spice. The long, balanced finish of guava, butterscotch and passion fruit gives this an extra dimension. Refreshingly sweet. Drink now through 2020. 90 cases imported.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Goldackerl
review: Thick and spicy, this shows intense sweetness but also lively acidity, which provides a perfect backdrop for the grape, floral and fig flavors. Great concentration and expression of flavors, just a tad cloying on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 250 cases made.

name: Welschriesling-Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Goldackerl
review: Aromatic sweetie, with grapefruit and lime aromas extending to the full-developed palate, rich with apricot, ripe pear and spice. Smooth and lush, with a clean finish of butter and honey. Drink now through 2015. 90 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee
review: Classic Gewürztraminer flavors of litchi, honey and spice in a dessert style. It tastes moderately sweet courtesy of the vibrant structure and retains a sense of elegance. Terrific finish. Drink now through 2008. 220 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee
review: Delicious. This starts out round and lush, with honey and apricot notes, then the snappy acidity kicks in, pushing the flavors and leaving a mouthwatering tang. The flavors evolve into caramel hard candy by the lingering finish. Drink now through 2009.

name: Pinot Gris Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee
review: Showing some smoke and clove notes in addition to honey and orange, here's a viscous, concentrated dessert wine with good acidity to balance the sweetness. Beautifully integrated, with a fresh, lingering finish.

name: Schilfwein Neusiedlersee Opitz One
review: Offers a fresh, lively mix of red cherry, melon and peach flavors accented by notes of glazed citrus, with a dash of salt and pepper. There's lots of mineral and orange zest on the finish. Zweigelt. Drink now through 2015. 116 cases made.

name: Schilfwein Neusiedlersee Opitz One
review: This traditional Austrian sweet wine has elements of fresh berries, but also caramel and nut flavors, presented in a lively, elegant manner. Fine balance and length, with an aftertaste of grilled almonds. Zweigelt. Drink now through 2010.

name: Bouvier Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee
review: Sleek and sumptuous, with vibrant acidity keeping it all focused. Butter, apricot and spice notes prevail, ending with a mouthwatering tang. Drink now through 2009.

name: Eiswein Neusiedlersee
review: More like a TBA, unctuous and exuding caramel, honey and dried apricot flavors. There's enough acidity it keep it from cloying, but it's balanced to the soft, sweet side. Welschriesling. Drink now through 2008.

name: Neusiedlersee Opitz One
review: Smooth and sophisticated, with new oak bolstering the structure and adding vanilla to the caramel and nut flavors. Fine balance and a long finish make for an attractive sip. Zweigelt and Blaufränkisch. Drink now through 2008.

name: Sämling 88 Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee
review: Pungent and concentrated, a mix of sweet honey, apricot, citrus and spice notes on a lively frame, resulting in a very attractive dessert wine. Fine length. Drink now through 2008. 185 cases made.

name: Schilfwein Neusiedlersee Opitz One
review: Seductive sweet berry, cherry and ripe plum flavors are given a boost by decadent cream notes, with subtle hints of beef and soy and a long, spicy finish. Zweigelt. Drink now through 2012. 12 cases made.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Goldackerl
review: This shows mature characteristics, with some ripe citrus and melon flavors and notes of petrol. Well-structured, with tropical fruit notes on the zesty finish. Welschriesling and Scheurebe. Drink now through 2012. 108 cases made.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Goldackerl
review: An unctuous style, evoking grape, spice and herb notes that suggest a more aromatic grape variety along with Riesling. It has depth midpalate and shows balance, with a fresh finish. Welschriesling and Scheurebe. Drink now through 2010.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Goldackerl
review: An elegant dessert white. Loads of orange, honey and pineapple mark this rich yet lively TBA. Its firm backbone gives it a sense of grace; it ends with an aftertaste of hard candy. Welschriesling and Scheurebe. Drink now through 2006.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Goldackerl
review: Intense apricot, honey and botrytis components from the get-go, yet retains a sense of harmony. The racy acidity keeps the sweetness in check in this young, vibrant TBA. Delicate honey finish. This needs time. Best from 2000 through 2010. 250 cases made.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Opitz One
review: Incredibly sweet and rich, this is a red dessert wine with tempting figgy, nutty aromas, sweet, plummy flavors and a long finish. Drink now through 2010. 80 cases made.

name: Welschriesling-Scheurebe Beerenauslese Neusiedlersee Goldackerl
review: A creamy dessert white, with ripe pear, red orange, chamomile and honey flavors followed by a long finish of piecrust and spice. Drink now through 2015. 258 cases made.

name: Muskat Ottonel Schilfwein Neusiedlersee Weisser Schilfmandl
review: Very focused, structured and exuberant, with ripe peach, spice and decadent floral flavors. Creamy, resinous finish is filled with smoky notes. Drink now through 2015. 145 cases made.

name: Schilfwein Neusiedlersee Opitz One
review: A rare style, this offers intense sweetness matched by lively acidity and bitter cherry flavor, creating a distinctive and appealing dessert wine. It's elegant, favoring finesse over concentration. Zweigelt. Drink now. 110 cases made.

name: Welschriesling-Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Goldackerl
review: Shows a lot of raisin character along with some very ripe melon notes, but there's good underlying acidity. Lacks the concentration of the best of the vintage, however.

name: Zweigelt Schilfwein Neusiedlersee Opitz One
review: Quite spicy and meaty, with cherry flavors and a panoply of toasty notes that turn just a tad astringent on the finish. A distinctive dessert wine from red grapes. Drink now through 2010. 90 cases imported.

name: Beerenauslese Neusiedlersee Goldackerl
review: Peaches and cream, with touches of honey, give plenty of lift to this sweetie. Very fresh and spicy on the finish. Welschriesling and Scheurebe. Drink now through 2012. 770 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Eiswein Neusiedlersee
review: Lush and creamy, with a concentrated array of ripe peach, apricot and butterscotch flavors. Spicy finish. Drink now through 2015. 50 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Graacher Himmelreich
review: This auslese has an extra dimension. Round, yet balanced by bright acidity. Flavors of apricot and vanilla are at the core, with orange and stone dancing around them. There's an overall sense of harmony, with a creamy texture and a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2035. 7 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst
review: Sensational. Reserved on the nose, it begins to unfold on the palate and just keeps coming at you in waves. The peach, apricot and honey flavors are perfectly balanced, and there's intensity and power in reserve. Beautiful expression of both Riesling fruit and its German vineyard site. Best from 2002 through 2015. 55 cases made.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst
review: A thoroughbred. Sleek and racy, this BA evokes citrus, slate and honey, yet hardly seems sweet. It packs dense flavors of lime, passion fruit and kiwi into its lissome frame and just keeps building on the palate to a never-ending finish. Best from 2002 through 2012.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Graacher Domprobst (AP 10)
review: Crystal clear and lush to boot, this auslese delivers apricot, honey, lime and slate flavors, which ride the vibrant structure through the finish, where they remain focused and persistent. Drink now through 2038. 5 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Graacher Himmelreich
review: Ethereal, with flavors of white peach, Asian pear and Honeycrisp apple all wrapped with a gauze of light cream and spice. The glistening finish is delicate, with vanilla bean and mineral notes that gently linger. Drink now through 2045. 67 cases made.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst
review: Lively, sticky and sweet, displaying loads of lemon, lime and honey character. Full-bodied with a wonderfully long, sweet finish. Drinkable now.  62 cases made.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst
review: A remarkably balanced BA that has plenty of everything: lots of finesse, lots of acidity and lots of ripe apricot and honey character. Ends with a seductively creamy, mineral-flavored finish. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Eiswein Mosel Graacher Himmelreich
review: Very pure, offering the apricot, peach, lime and mineral flavors of an auslese, yet more concentrated and sweet. It's elegant and driven by a vibrant structure. Nice lingering aftertaste. Best from 2012 through 2035.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Graacher Domprobst
review: Shows impressive structure, with plenty of minerality and juiciness to the peach, dried apricot and wild plum flavors, featuring interesting notes of fresh-cut kiwifruit. Bracing finish. Drink now through 2040.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Graacher Domprobst
review: Racy, exhibiting apple, pear and grapefruit flavors, with a hint of earth. A fine match between the intensity and light-weight profile, boasting equilibrium and a long aftertaste of pâte de fruit. Best from 2015 through 2030.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Graacher Domprobst (AP 17)
review: Crisp and delicate, evoking candied lime, vanilla and a hint of black currant backed by racy acidity. Scores points for freshness and vivacity more than richness. There's fine length, with a long aftertaste. Drink now through 2038. 15 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Graacher Himmelreich
review: A crisp version, full of dried savory herbal notes woven into the flavors of fresh-cut apple, dried citrus and flint. The lip-smacking finish lingers with accents of lemongrass. A pure and crystalline style. Drink now through 2040.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst
review: Lovely fresh fruit, very clear and focused, evoking peach, passion fruit, lime and flowers on a delicate profile. The finish lingers nicely with a lip-smacking impression. Drink now through 2020.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Graacher Domprobst
review: Rich, ripe and juicy, featuring concentrated flavors of baked peach, apricot and pear tart. This oozes glazed citrus as well, with plenty of honey, cream and spice mixed in. The vibrant finish is quite minerally. Best from 2012 through 2027. 80 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst
review: Classy and seamless offering layers of silky, sweet, ripe fruit. Full-bodied with fabulous honey, apple, creamy flavors. Long, long finish. Drinkable now. 25 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Graacher Domprobst (AP 01)
review: This has a lacy texture behind the intense green apple, apricot and gooseberry flavors that feature a bracing acidity. The fresh, juicy finish shows fennel and spice notes. Best from 2016 through 2036. 119 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Graacher Domprobst (AP 11)
review: Racy and layered, with plenty of dried mango notes to the golden raisin, baked apple and melon flavors. Sleek, presenting a vivid structure that echoes with savory herbal accents. Currant and lime details chime in on the finish. Drink now through 2040. 43 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 14)
review: This is intense. Botrytis brings an element of concentration to both the flavors and structure. Apricot, rhubarb and citrus notes are at the core and the bracing acidity keeps it light on its feet. Needs time to integrate. Best from 2009 through 2025. 25 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 14)
review: This just keeps coming at you. Subtle, yet it builds on the palate, courtesy of the vivid acidity that sets the stage for the layers of apricot, lime and slate flavors. Really crunchy and long on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 40 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 18)
review: Tropical fruit flavors, orange blossom and a velvety texture are the hallmarks of this young Riesling. It's nicely balanced with a vibrant structure and long finish. Drink now through 2020.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich (AP 12)
review: An almond aroma segues into honey and apricot flavors in this compact Riesling. It's concentrated, with a firm structure, so give it a little time to unwind. Best from 2008 through 2022.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Graacher Domprobst
review: Powerfully crisp, with fresh and juicy lemon cake, green apple and citrus flavors. Hints of sage show on the snappy finish, which features plenty of mineral notes. Drink now through 2024. 125 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Graacher Domprobst
review: Taut and nicely framed, with plenty of dried savory notes to the firm flavors of crushed stone, dried apple and pastry. Hints of anise emerge on the powerfully zesty finish. Drink now through 2032.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Graacher Domprobst
review: Pure and racy, this features plenty of quince and gooseberry flavors that are flanked by rich, smoky notes. The fresh finish features citrus peel and spice. Drink now through 2025. 296 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Graacher Himmelreich
review: Lush and vibrant, with well-structured flavors of green apple, lemon-lime and kiwifruit. Racy acidity shows midpalate, with a finish of light smoke and cream. A very pure-tasting style. Drink now through 2035.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Graacher Himmelreich
review: Silky and sleek, with mineral-infused peach, ripe apple, lemon curd and peach tart flavors, backed by plenty of fresh citrus zest notes. Pastry and spice details emerge midpalate, with a bright, juicy finish. Drink now through 2040. 56 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Wehlener Sonnenuhr
review: Offers alluring savoriness to the racy apple, ripe citrus and green peach flavors. Fresh acidity gives this plenty of punch, with tarragon notes that vibrate midpalate, followed by a minerally finish. Drink now through 2040. 750 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Wehlener Sonnenuhr
review: An interesting bouquet of orange blossom announces this firm, well-structured spatlese, which feature glazed apricot, ripe citrus and baked peach flavors. The vibrant finish is juicy and fresh-tasting. Drink now through 2040. 55 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 9)
review: Racy, with verve and intensity matched to a lightweight frame. There's a sense of grace and understated power driving the peach, lime and above all, slate flavors. Terrific finish. Drink now through 2015. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Graacher Domprobst
review: Broad, with cream-filled flavors of Fuji apple, red peach and lemon curd. This also features plenty of ruby grapefruit notes, with a long finish of white cherry and orange zest. Best from 2014 through 2030. 20 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst
review: Some real concentration in this very rich auslese, showing spice, ripe apple and apricot aromas and flavors. Full in body and packed with fruit all the way to the finish. Drinkable now. 29 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Graacher Himmelreich
review: Elegant and minerally, with a lacy structure behind the light peach, apricot and passion fruit flavors. Melon and tangerine linger on the bright finish. Drink now through 2024. 124 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Graacher Himmelreich
review: Intense aromas and flavors of slate give this plenty of punch, with notes of fresh-cut apple, glazed citrus and peach pie. Long and lush on the rich, spicy finish. Drink now through 2026. 223 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Graacher Domprobst (AP 12)
review: A firm edge of acidity defines the feel of this sleek white and also sharpens the grapefruit, apricot and slate notes on the palate. Combines charm and precision. Has a nice mouthwatering finish. Best from 2010 through 2030. 52 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Graacher Domprobst (AP 5)
review: A round white, with a soft profile, yet plenty of structure as well. Apricot, sweet spices and a touch of lime are accented by stone flavors. Succulent, long and fresh on the finish. Drink now through 2030. 25 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Graacher Domprobst Fuder 10
review: Features a broad, appealing mouthfeel, with vibrant flavors of cherry and dark currant that feature plenty of peachy accents. Creamy at midpalate, with a mineral and sea salt finish. Drink now through 2035. 80 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Graacher Himmelreich
review: Precise and elegant, combining a silky texture with vibrant structure. This provides a backdrop for its apricot, pineapple and slate flavors. Fine, lingering finish. Drink now through 2030. 49 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Wehlener Sonnenuhr
review: Racy, with Golden Delicious apple and glazed citrus flavors that are well-structured and fresh-tasting. Mineral and spice notes give this good cut on the crisp, airy finish. Drink now through 2020. 60 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 11)
review: Racy and well-delineated, this Riesling evokes pure apple, white peach and mineral aromas and flavors. It's intense and balanced, with a youthful green edge, but also long and ethereal. Best from 2008 through 2020. 280 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: What a gorgeous Riesling. This German white has intensity, extract and length, with floral, lime and peach aromas and flavors that hang together beautifully on the sleek acid-and-mineral framework. Drink now through 2005. 112 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 10)
review: Exotic, showing orange and guava notes, all well-defined by its bracing structure. Fine intensity from start to finish in a brisk, racy style. Drink now through 2012. 80 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 14)
review: This is zippy, with the vibrant structure supporting the apricot, mango and orange notes. It's more up-front at this stage, with a refreshing finish. Drink now through 2018.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 8)
review: Elegant, with a vibrant structure supporting its apricot, orange and mineral flavors. Maybe a touch of botrytis resulting in a honey accent, but very clean and long. Drink now through 2018. 20 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: Lean, elegant and vivid. The citrus, peach and mineral notes dance in an open, airy structure, ending in a mouthwatering finish. Best from 2003 through 2010. 50 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: A racy, tightly wound '97, exhibiting lime and mineral aromas and flavors. Densely textured and concentrated, with excellent length and the structure for aging. Best from 2002 through 2009.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Graacher Domprobst
review: This is succulent and underscored by a mineral streak, which lends support for its peach, apple and lime zest flavors. Harmonious and tangy, offering a lingering slate aftertaste. Drink now through 2024. 150 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Graacher Domprobst
review: Rich and juicy, with a vibrant structure keeping the peach, lime and slate flavors lively and persistent. Textbook, with the length to be outstanding. Best from 2011 through 2020.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Graacher Domprobst (AP 16)
review: Concentrated peach, slate and dried apricot flavors remain persistent and linger nicely. This is balanced on the rich side, with a submerged structure. Best from 2009 through 2022. 72 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Graacher Himmelreich (AP 9)
review: On the sweet side for the category, yet with fine structure. Mango, honeydew melon and slate flavors are persistent and linger nicely, with a tangy finish. Drink now through 2022. 48 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Wehlener Sonnenuhr
review: There's a firm edge to the acidity in this sleek white, which heightens the apple, pear, lime and slate flavors, finding balance with requisite flesh in the texture. Best from 2011 through 2019.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 22)
review: Gorgeous aromas and flavors of spice, lime and pie crust set against a sinewy structure. Mineral accents weave throughout, leaving a refreshing aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: Rich and concentrated, suggesting a mango flavor with accents of mandarin orange and mineral. Silky and balanced, on a light-bodied frame, this ought to win anyone over to Riesling. Drink now through 2012. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
review: Fine citrus and mineral notes here, on an open, moderately concentrated yet firm structure. It finishes with a tangy lime aftertaste. Drink now through 2008.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel
review: Ample and juicy. Peach, orange blossom and slate flavors are etched into the vibrant structure. It all adds up to an appealing presentation. Drink now through 2018. 76 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Graacher Domprobst (AP 10)
review: An intense, racy style, delicate and peppered with floral, lime and Granny Smith apple flavors. The finish is long and understated. A bit lean, but electric. Best from 2012 through 2024.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Graacher Domprobst (AP 5)
review: Pungent, almost grassy, with herbal aromas offset by apple and nectarine flavors. This is open-knit and supported by a racy structure, with a long, mouthwatering finish. Best from 2011 through 2022.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst
review: A racy, mineral-etched version, tight and dense, and focusing its lime and apple flavors on a light-weight frame. Ripe green apple aftertaste. Best from 2004 through 2010.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 10)
review: This shows the citrus side of the flavor spectrum, offering orange, nectarine and lime notes accented by mineral. It's a touch shrill now, with a vivid structure, but has intensity and length. Best from 2008 through 2020. 180 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 11)
review: Very tasty. Plump and amply proportioned, with a bright structure focusing the peach and citrus notes. Forward and open, yet with a mouthwatering finish and good intensity. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 12)
review: Bright and juicy, exhibiting floral, talc and guava notes on an open framework. It has concentration and picks up a tangy acidity on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 12)
review: Floral in aroma, turning to peach and mineral on the palate, this '98 spätlese is round and delicious, showing concentration and depth, ending with a crisp note of citrus. Drink now through 2005.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 12)
review: Lovely piquant acidity adds kick to the lime, mineral and spice aromas and flavors in this elegant '97. Good concentration, and fine length on the finish. Best from 2002 through 2008.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst
review: A hummingbird. Crisp and well delineated, this '98 excites the palate with its brisk acidity, carrying the lime and mineral notes to a long finish. Best from 2001 through 2010.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 13)
review: (Auction wine). Added ripeness lends a tropical note to the honey and apricot aromas and flavors in this rich, sweet '97 auslese. Vibrant acidity supports everything, though there's not a lot of nuance to the flavors. Drink now through 2006.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: Very focused, this white displays bright pear, peach and mineral flavors and a bracing acidity. Fine length. Give it a year or two to integrate. Best from 2007 through 2020. 50 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich (AP 16)
review: A tasty, peach- and lime-infused '03, succulent and lively, with a slight astringency on the finish. Drink now through 2018.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Graacher Domprobst
review: Pure and minerally-tasting, with good cut to the ripe apple, pear and white fruit flavors. Hints of tarragon mark the fresh finish. Drink now through 2022. 397 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Graacher Domprobst (AP 7)
review: A creamy texture and an orange Creamsicle flavor highlight this tasty Riesling, which is ample yet bright and leaves a lasting impression of peach and citrus. Drink now through 2019. 19 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Graacher Himmelreich
review: Well-framed, with crisp and savory flavors of green apple, white peach and dried apricot. Intense acidity lingers on the rapierlike finish. Drink now through 2020.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Graacher Himmelreich
review: A very fluid white, whose apple and nectarine flavors match effortlessly with its vibrant structure. Firms up on the finish, with a mouthwatering impression. Best from 2011 through .

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Graacher Himmelreich (AP 2)
review: A juicy, almost crunchy style, yet with plenty of detail to the lime, nectarine and mineral flavors. This is light-bodied and mouthwatering, with a fresh finish. Drink now through 2019. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst
review: Mineral and juicy peach and citrus notes hold court here. It's snappy, clean as a whistle with a long, stony finish. Drink now through 2018. 350 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 16)
review: Firm and focused, showing lime and slate notes, etched into a framework as smooth and hard as ice. Drink now through 2004. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: A racy style, with a strong mineral streak along with flavors of citrus and apple. Good length. Still needs time to really sing. Best from 2008 through 2020. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: A mix of apricot and herbs highlight this rich, forward Riesling. Balanced and concentrated, it picks up a little astringency on the finish. Nice mouthwatering impression. Drink now through 2012.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel
review: This is plump and juicy, yet also displays well-defined peach, apple and mineral flavors. Balanced with moderate length. Drink now through 2014.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Graacher Himmelreich
review: Lemon-lime flavors dominate, with notes of chamomile, ginger and anise in the mix. Dried tropical fruits on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 222 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 13)
review: A slate-driven, lighter-than-air version of Mosel Riesling, showing lime and peach. Long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2008. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 9)
review: Clear and focused, this is a well-balanced Riesling with a bright structure driving the apple, peach and citrus notes. The lively structure is a foil for its supple texture. Fine length. Drink now through 2018. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 9)
review: Very pure, exhibiting lime and peach notes on a round profile. This is balanced with intensity and shows some grip on the finish. Drink now through 2008.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: A touch spritzy on entry, otherwise smooth and rich, like liquid key-lime pie with a mineral undercurrent. It's bright and lively, with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2005.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: Richness of texture and harmony are the highlights in this white; its apple, peach and mineral flavors are subdued, yet there's weight and density, a long finish and well-integrated, racy acidity. Best from 2000 through 2006.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
review: Creamy and balanced, offering vanilla custard, peach and mineral notes matched to an open, moderately concentrated frame. Delicious now and should get even more so over time. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 14)
review: A straightforward, delicious auslese, delivering citrus and peach notes in a rich, open style. Juicy acidity keeps the sweetness in check and refreshes on the finish. Drink now through 2006.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 6)
review: Delightfully crisp and alive, yet the lime and apricot flavors taste diffuse. As a result, it misses slightly on the overall presentation. Still, an attractive Riesling. May just need time. Drink now through 2008. 50 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Graacher Domprobst
review: Green apple, lemon-lime and fresh-cut pear flavors give this plenty of freshness, finishing with notes of dried mint and basil. Drink now through 2016.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Graacher Himmelreich
review: Juicy and full of peach and apricot flavors, which feature minerally notes and hints of cream. The crisp finish is marked by ruby grapefruit notes. Drink now through 2015. 200 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 8)
review: A compact, angular '97 kabinett, unrevealing today, but with richness, concentration and a red fruit character. Firm acidity provides backbone and verve. Best from 2000 through 2005.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
review: Slim and focused, this offers floral, banana and vanilla-custard aromas and flavors, slightly candied in character, with a balanced presentation. Drink now through 2010. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel
review: Minerally, off-dry flavors of peach, smoke and spice feature plenty of zest and lift, with apricot preserves on the rich finish.  Drink now through 2016.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer (AP 1)
review: Balanced, crisp and full of peach, apple and lime flavors, this white is focused and juicy. It ends with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2010. 580 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer (AP 2)
review: Fresh and grapey, this bursts with peach, nectarine and lime flavors. It's rich, but gets livened up by a blast of acidity. Textbook Mosel charm. Drink now through 2010. 450 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: Bracing, yet balanced and rich too, this washes its peach, lime and mineral notes easily across the palate. Lightweight and fresh, leaving a tangy, mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2005. 350 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Graacher Himmelreich
review: Vibrant, juicy and crisp, with a racy structure to the apple, lime, gooseberry and mineral flavors. Pronounced acidity lingers on the finish, which features orange zest and spice notes. Best from 2012 through 2020. 60 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 10)
review: This seems to have the structure, though the flavors aren't as crisp and vivid. Peach and lime notes mingle. Drink now through 2010.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 15)
review: Shy in aroma, this white displays ripe apple, peach and vanilla notes, all moderately concentrated. Very elegant, it shows detail and ripeness, with a mineral finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 4)
review: Closed, tightly wound and unevolved, this has grapefruit and mineral yet it's not that expressive at this stage. Fine creamy richness underneath. Best after 2000.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: There's a tanginess here, along with floral, anise and peach notes, all on a delicate framework. It's balanced, with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2012.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst
review: A sleeper that now shows only a fraction of what is to come. A bit closed, with earthy, minerally apple and anise flavors. Crisp, with good acidity structure for a 1992. Drink now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
review: The juicy apple, lime and mineral flavors are more prevalent up front than on the finish. It could use more intensity of flavor to cover its bracing structure. Drink now through 2009. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Wehlener Sonnenuhr
review: Mint or rosemary and banana aromas mark this delicate, vibrant '98 Riesling. Virtually reverberates on the palate, carrying the peach, lime and herb flavors to a moderate finish. Drink now through 2003.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: Lovely peach notes are framed by a vibrant structure, all beautifully balanced and long on the finish. Drink now through 2003.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: A delicious QbA with a lot going for it: very good concentration, with ripe, appley flavors and vibrant balancing acidity to offset the richness, and a density that offers promise for the future. Well done. Drink now through 2003.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst
review: Sweet, spicy, fruity character, medium body, medium acidity and a fresh finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 10)
review: Reserved today, this nonetheless exhibits good concentration, density and structure, with vibrant acidity, although the apple, herb and peach flavors remain muted. Best from 2000 through 2005.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 3)
review: Banana and tropical fruit scents mark this '98 Riesling, whose brightness and elegance carry through to the firm finish. Drink now through 2003.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 7)
review: A solid white with apple and peach aromas and flavors, richness and concentration, and plenty of appley acidity on the long finish. Drink now through 2004.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: Well-integrated, this '99 white has vibrant acidity and a rich, round profile supporting its citrus and slate flavors. A touch of SO2 now, but age or aeration should take care of it. Drink now through 2004. 380 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: Focused, crisp and very fruity, offering floral and lemon aromas and apple and pear flavors. Not rich, but well balanced. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst (AP 2)
review: This white is reticent in its peach and lime flavors, with a slightly coarse texture. Light-bodied, it's still a very good example of Mosel Riesling. Drink now through 2008.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst
review: Delicate, off-dry and light in style. Shows pretty, ripe pear and melon notes and a long, mineral-flavored finish. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling QbA Halbtrocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: A solid Mosel QbA, this shows power along with grapefruit, almond and earth flavors. Drink now through 2003.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst
review: Crisp, succulent and well balanced, with a refreshing apple and citrus character that brings a bit of sparkle to the juicy finish. Try now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst
review: Surprisingly round and soft for a Mosel, with apple skin character. Medium in body and medium-sweet with a fruity finish. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Hochgewächs Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Domprobst
review: This frankly sweet, light, soft wine offers nice pear, green apple and melon flavors. Drinkable now.

name: Crozes-Hermitage Cuvée Anniversaire 1980-1990
review: An extremely vegetal style that's thin on the finish. Smells and tastes like green beans and onions; not what we look for in a Rhône. 500 cases imported.

name: Malbec Columbia Valley Gamache Vineyards
review: Focused and sleek, this drips with mineral notes set around a core of black oliveaccented red berry and spice flavors. Complex and inviting, showing depth and a distinctive profile. Impressive length. Drink now through 2020. 225 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley Sara's Vintage
review: Distinctively spicy, with hits of cardamom and star anise to the supple blackberry fruit, persisting with refinement on the long finish. Drink now through 2017. 130 cases made.

name: 2 Spires Chris' Vintage Columbia Valley
review: Broad and open-textured, with blackberry, mint and licorice flavors, coming together harmoniously on the sharply focused finish. Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2020. 225 cases made.

name: 2 Spires Columbia Valley
review: Rich and polished, this red is layered with black cherry, dark plum, black tea and spice flavors that pulse through the generous and focused finish. Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2020. 350 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Supple and expressive, with silky fruit underneath a sandy texture, offering cherry and raspberry flavors accented by hints of mint and cream. The finish persists gracefully. Best from 2017 through 2021. 270 cases made.

name: Viognier Columbia Valley
review: Sleek and polished, with pretty pear, peach, floral and spice flavors that play against tangy acidity as the finish lingers beautifully. Drink now through 2018. 610 cases made.

name: Bishop's Blend Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and vital, with distinctive mint and sage nuances around a fleshy core of cherry and red plum flavors, lingering easily against refined tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2020. 460 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley
review: Supple, expressive and generous with its green olive-accented blackberry and blueberry flavors, finishing with plush texture and persistence. Drink now through 2020. 160 cases made.

name: Viognier Columbia Valley
review: Bright and tangy, rich in texture but zippy, with Meyer lemon peel-accented pear and spice flavors, finishing harmoniously. Drink now through 2019. 605 cases made.

name: 2 Spires Columbia Valley
review: Taut and focused, with juicy plum and pomegranate flavors playing against savory green tea and spice notes, lingering on the finish. Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2020. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Columbia Valley Tres Bien
review: Velvety, round and expressive, with minty notes weaving through the black cherry and toast flavors, finishing with harmony. Best from 2017 through 2020. 164 cases made.

name: Malbec Columbia Valley Gamache Vineyards
review: Focused and well-built dark berry and lead pencil aromas lead to a taut finish. Drink now through 2021. 420 cases made.

name: Malbec Columbia Valley Gamache Vineyards
review: Fresh and expressive, polished, with red berry and pomegranate flavors weaving through dark plum and spice notes, finishing with presence. Drink now through 2020. 336 cases made.

name: Malbec Columbia Valley Gamache Vineyards
review: Polished, open-textured and expressive, with plum, floral and cocoa flavors that glide into a medium-weight finish and persist nicely. Drink now through 2019. 254 cases made.

name: 2 Spires Gideon's Vintage Columbia Valley
review: Lithe, polished and appealing, with spicy, smoky blackberry flavors on a lean, tangy frame. Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2016. 354 cases made.

name: Sur La Mer Columbia Valley
review: Dark, focused and peppery, with crinkly tannins around a generous core of cherry and plum fruit notes gliding into an open-textured, well-formed finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Best after 2017. 325 cases made.

name: Bishop's Blend Max's Vintage Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and lively, with dark flavors on an open frame, echoing plum and spice on the finish. Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Best from 2013 through 2016. 500 cases made.

name: Sur La Mer Bean's Vintage Columbia Valley
review: Dark and spicy, shading the blackberry and plum fruit with tar and grilled meat flavors, tightening up with tannins as the finish persists. Should improve with cellaring. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Best from 2015 through 2020. 323 cases made.

name: Sur La Mer Billy's Vintage Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, with a grip of tannins around a solid core of blackberry and pepper flavors, finishing chunky. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Best after 2014. 250 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley Jennifer's Vintage
review: Lithe, with crisp tannins around a lively core of blackberry and white pepper, lingering nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 112 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, this lighter style delivers a mild crunch of tannin against pleasant dark plum and cherry flavors, lingering quietly. Drink now through 2019. 260 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Red Willow Vineyard
review: A green edge adds interest and tang to the fresh blackberry and spice notes at the center of this crisp Syrah. Finishes quietly. Drink now through 2020. 290 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Bill
review: Shows a hint of blanched almond, followed by straw, honeysuckle and lemon verbena notes. A light kiss of smoke helps the finish linger. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Colchagua Columbine Special Reserve
review: A solid, fruit-driven red that displays notes of cherry and black raspberry woven with hints of smoke and wild herb on the floral finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Columbine Grand Reserve
review: Modern style, with fruit-driven blackberry and cassis flavors covered by a veneer of sweet vanilla and toast. Drink now through 2004.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Columbine Special Reserve
review: Features a saline note to the dark currant and spiced plum flavors, featuring some herbal accents. Hints of chocolate appear on the finish. Drink now. 2,900 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Bill Limited Edition
review: Nice silky texture, with alluring black cherry and roasted sage notes accented by hints of smoke and tobacco. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Columbine Special Reserve
review: Forward, with crushed cherry and plum fruit laced with toasty spice notes. The toasty edge lasts through the fleshy finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Cuvée Claire
review: Minty currant flavors, bordering on stemmy in its tannic backbone, which gives the flavors a greenish edge. Still, the acidity is crisp. Best from 2009 through 2014. 331 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Albamar
review: Sleek, with fresh cherry and red currant fruit laced with a subtle vanilla streak. Ends with a bright finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Alto Vuelo Reserve
review: Light and floral, with good gooseberry and straw notes that linger on the finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Albamar
review: Zesty and light-bodied, sporting crisp pineapple, citrus and fresh-cut herb notes that linger in the chalky finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Albamar
review: On the herbal side, with chive and time up front, followed by asparagus and lime notes. Open-knit. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Columbine Special Reserve
review: Racy, offering strong herb, asparagus and citrus peel notes. Brisk finish. Drink now. 7,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Casablanca Valley Albamar
review: Shows good direct yellow apple, hazelnut and verbena notes, with a light-weight finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Albamar
review: Fresh, with nice snap to the chive, lime and salt notes. Tangy finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Colchagua Valley Columbine Special Reserve
review: Shows herb and pepper notes up front, followed by a light-weight core of cherry and red currant fruit. Lightly firm finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Curicó Valley Columbine Special Reserve
review: Shows a slightly rustic mix of grilled herb, crushed currant and dark olive notes. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Columbine Special Reserve
review: Light straw, herb and sea salt flavors give way to modest lemon and melon notes that fade in the finish. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère Chile Alto Vuelo
review: Shows lots of pepper and herb aromas, with light-weight red cherry and plum fruit and a soft, herbal finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.
