name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Albamar
review: Very light, with singed cedar and earth notes taking over from the slightly airy cherry fruit. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley
review: Pungent grass and chive aromas are followed by moderate herb and lemon flavors. Easy finish. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Casablanca Valley Albamar
review: Light, with yellow apple fruit offset by a hint of tarragon. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Columbine Special Reserve
review: This has a modest earthy hint weaving through the briar, black cherry and toasty vanilla notes. There's a twinge of herb on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Carmenère Colchagua Valley
review: Frankly herbal, with only a wisp of black cherry underneath. Slightly stewy tea leaf edge to the finish. 7,000 cases made.

name: Chablis Bougros Côte Bouguerots Domaine
review: Broad, powerful flavors of lemon, lanolin and quinine ride the bracing structure to a long, stony conclusion. Shows balance and length, building from start to finish. Drink now through 2023. 100 cases imported.

name: Chablis Bougros Côte Bouguerots Domaine
review: Melon, apple, stone, seashore and earth aromas and flavors ride the vivid structure, finishing long. A grapefruit peel note lingers. Shows some flesh, too, delivering terrific balance and drive. Drink now through 2024. 100 cases imported.

name: Chablis Les Clos
review: Classy Chablis that stands as a monument to the '00 vintage. So elegant and refined, powering its way across the palate with a fireball of intensely concentrated lime, kiwi, pineapple, dried herbs, freshly cut grass and spices. Seemingly endless finish. Tempting now, best to cellar. Drink now through 2015.

name: Chablis Les Clos Domaine
review: Sweet spice hints accent the green apple, greengage plum and mineral flavors in this lean, laserlike white. Lanolin and spice accents linger on the fresh, persistent aftertaste. Drink now through 2023. 120 cases imported.

name: Chablis Les Clos Domaine
review: Clean and focused, with apple, lemon, yellow plum and mineral notes riding a firm structure. This is balanced, showing a chalklike texture and a savory element on the finish. There's fine clarity and loads of power in reserve. Best from 2013 through 2025. 200 cases imported.

name: Chablis Vaudésir
review: Classy, racy and subtle, a connoissseur's wine. Not an opulent style and it' s very tight and closed now, but the mineral quality and an attractive, pronounced oaky, vanilla character show through. A lemony note emerges on the long finish. Best after 1997. 100 cases imported.

name: Chablis Bougros
review: Oyster shell, stone, apple, melon and lemon flavors highlight this intense Chablis. Firm and long, with a resounding aftertaste of mineral. Best from 2018 through 2025. 150 cases imported.

name: Chablis Bougros
review: Great harmony in this subtle, seductive white Burgundy that unfolds its charm with graceful flavors of toasted nuts, butter, honey, lemon and ripe fruit. Full-bodied and creamy, with a powerful, intense finish. Tempting now, but wait. Best after 1998. 400 cases imported.

name: Chablis Bougros Côte Bouguerots
review: Offers apple, lemon and stone flavors, backed by a firm structure. Lean and taut, yet balanced, persisting through the long finish. Best from 2019 through 2025. 100 cases imported.

name: Chablis Bougros Domaine
review: Lean and bracing, offering lemon, apple, honey and flint flavors matched to a vivid structure. Incisive and intense, leaving a chalklike feel on the palate. Best from 2016 through 2028. 150 cases imported.

name: Chablis Bougros Domaine
review: Firm and compact, with a kernel of citrus, apple and vanilla waiting to be unlocked. Well-balanced, this should fatten up a little with time. Best from 2009 through 2020. 80 cases imported.

name: Chablis Fourchaume
review: This white reveals richness and breadth, with a hint of spice framing the apple, melon, yellow plum and mineral flavors. The terrific finish keeps pumping out the fruit and stone notes. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases imported.

name: Chablis Les Clos Domaine
review: Bright and tangy, offering lemon, apple and stone flavors, with a hint of spice. Though rich, the vivid acidity lends a racy feel. Mouthwatering finish. Best from 2016 through 2024. 100 cases imported.

name: Chablis Les Clos Domaine
review: A linear, tightly wound white, with apple, melon, lemon and stone flavors. This is intense, balanced and long, offering a steely, chalklike finish. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases imported.

name: Chablis Les Clos Domaine
review: This is both rich and elegant, with floral, lemon cake, apple and mineral aromas and flavors. Balanced and classy, with a long, mouthwatering aftertaste. Best from 2012 through 2022. 200 cases imported.

name: Chablis Les Preuses Domaine
review: An enticing mix of apple and green plum notes, with a hint of seashore and spice, mingle with the bright structure in this white. There's a slight grain to the texture, and this ends on the tart side, yet there's plenty of substance midpalate. Needs time. Best from 2012 through 2024. 100 cases imported.

name: Chablis Montée de Tonnerre Domaine
review: There's richness to the green plum, apple and lemon flavors, with lively acidity emerging on the finish. Intense and long, complemented by a mineral element. Drink now through 2022. 100 cases imported.

name: Chablis Vaillons Domaine
review: Clean, pure and refreshing, with lemon, apple and mineral flavors that mesh seamlessly with the incisive structure. Finishes with precision and flintiness. Best from 2011 through 2021. 109 cases imported.

name: Chablis Valmur
review: Class act. Beautiful terroir in thisfull-bodied, firm, structured and flavorfulChablis. Offers mineral, matchstick and smoke,moves on to ripe fruit, and finally delivers adeft dose of toastiness on the balanced finish.Tempting now, but will improve. Drink now through 2010.

name: Chablis Valmur Domaine
review: Elegant, with light thyme and chive elements accenting lemon and earth flavors. Taut and racy, with notes of chalk and mineral on the lengthy finish. Best from 2016 through 2024. 100 cases imported.

name: Chablis Valmur Domaine
review: Very clean and lemony, yet with roundness and flesh on the palate. Lemon cake, apple and mineral are the main flavors, with hints of flowers and spice. There's a long, flinty, mouthwatering aftertaste. Best from 2012 through 2024. 91 cases imported.

name: Chablis Vaudésir Domaine
review: There's fine intensity to the fresh lemon, oyster shell, apple and stone aromas and flavors as this white rolls across the palate. Beautifully balanced and expressive, with a refreshing finish. Best from 2011 through 2024. 96 cases imported.

name: Chablis Bougros
review: Very creamy, with honey, lemon and stone aromas and flavors enmeshed in the lush texture. It's restrained and taut today, building on the palate to a nice crescendo, but should open even more with time. Best from 2006 through 2012.

name: Chablis Bougros Côte Bouguerots Domaine
review: An expression of chalk and mineral from the get-go, this white also offers apple, lemon and yellow plum notes. There's tension, between the savory mineral component and the vivid structure. Offers fine, stony depth on the finish. Best from 2012 through 2024. 117 cases imported.

name: Chablis Bougros Côte Bouguerots Domaine
review: On the austere side, with a steely temperament and a taut structure guarding the apple, lemon and mineral flavors. This has depth and length, so be patient. Best from 2012 through 2023. 100 cases imported.

name: Chablis Bougros Domaine
review: This rich white's supple texture softens the acidity and frames the lemon pie, yellow plum and grapefruit flavors. There's a savory hint on the finish, where a chalklike feel lingers. Best from 2012 through 2022. 80 cases imported.

name: Chablis Domaine
review: A racy, steely version, boasting lime blossom, green plum, chive and mineral flavors. Clean and persistent, with a lingering finish of green fruit and stone. Drink now through 2020. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Chablis Les Clos
review: Like a ballerina dancing Swan Lake. Full of sinewy finesse, it tip-toes along the palate with amazing grace. Full-bodied, with compact mineral, earth, honey, vanilla, pear and cream flavors. Great harmony on the finish. Tempting now. Best after 1999. 415 cases imported.

name: Chablis Les Clos Domaine
review: On the lean side, with lemon, melon and yellow plum flavors, bolstered by bracing acidity. The finish is incisive, leaving a mouthwatering impression. Drink now through 2023. 115 cases imported.

name: Chablis Les Clos Domaine
review: Refined and elegant, this exudes floral, herb, lemon and mineral aromas and flavors. Harmonious and long, yet tightens up on the finish. Best from 2009 through 2020. 215 cases imported.

name: Chablis Les Preuses Domaine
review: Spicy aromas give way to peach, melon and mineral flavors in this powerful white, with just a hint of vanilla. Builds to a long finish, showing balance and determination. Drink now through 2020. 100 cases imported.

name: Chablis Montée de Tonnerre
review: What opulence and amazing texture! Velvety as can be, this full-bodied, oak-aged Chablis coats your palate with lush, creamlike character. Lovely spice, mocha and butterscotch flavors combine with pear and apple tart flavors to make it smooth. Fairly forward. Drink now through 2005.

name: Chablis Montée de Tonnerre Domaine
review: Clean, well-defined and lemony. Lean and racy now, with green apple and mineral notes emerging on the finish, this should gain complexity and harmony with age. Best from 2009 through 2018. 90 cases imported.

name: Chablis Montmains
review: Shows classic Chablis character delivering plenty of mineral, seashore and lemon aromas and flavors, with a little melon and plum. Firm and steely, this is a bit severe now, but balanced. Should develop nicely. Best from 2010 through 2018. 600 cases imported.

name: Chablis Montmains Domaine
review: Lean yet juicy, with lemon and green apple flavors buoyed by the vivid structure. Shows fine balance and length. Drink now through 2019. 350 cases imported.

name: Chablis Vaudésir Domaine
review: This starts out with a blast of peach, lemon and apple fruit, before a dry, chalky feel takes over in tandem with the steely structure. There's nice austerity and a mouthwatering finish. Best from 2011 through 2021. 50 cases imported.

name: Chablis Vaulorent Domaine
review: There's a little oak influence to this white, but it melds well with the clean lemon, floral and mineral flavors. Steely and firm, finishing like spring water running over stones. Best from 2012 through 2021. 180 cases imported.

name: Chablis Bougros
review: Nice touch of toasted oak in this medium-bodied, fairly ripe Chardonnay. Bone-dry with pear tart, bread dough, ripe fruit flavors. The finish suggests there is enough stuffing for it to become silky with time. Best from 2004 through 2008.

name: Chablis Bougros Domaine
review: An alluring oyster shell, iodine scent draws you in, while apple, melon and grapefruit flavors hold your interest. This is vibrant, with a sharp acidity on the finish. Best from 2013 through 2020. 80 cases imported.

name: Chablis Domaine
review: A focused, lemon-, apple- and melon-flavored version, with accents of seashore and stone. Leaves a mouthwatering finish that lingers well, echoing citrus and stone elements. Drink now through 2023. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Chablis Domaine
review: A bracing white, whose flavors of green apple, lemon and mineral are etched in the racy structure. Steely in the best sense, this ends with a lingering flourish of mineral. Drink now through 2016. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chablis Fourchaume
review: A harmonious white, with peach, apple and lemon flavors. The vibrant acidity imparts focus and staying power, with a mineral aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases imported.

name: Chablis Fourchaume Vignoble de Vaulorent Domaine
review: Green plum, apple and lemon notes are enhanced by a vanilla accent. Firm and tight, with a crisp, mouthwatering finish. Elegant and structured. Best from 2012 through 2020. 180 cases imported.

name: Chablis Fourchaume Vignoble de Vaulorent Domaine
review: An attractive white, this offers plenty of mineral, with apple, peach and honey flavors. Concentrated and balanced, with a sense of place and a long, lingering finish. Best from 2008 through 2018. 280 cases imported.

name: Chablis Grenouilles
review: Good pear, fruitcake and mineral character in this clean Chablis. Focused, with a smoky edge and some honey in the aftertaste. Medium-bodied, it grows on you as the balance becomes obvious on the attractively intense finish. Drink now through 2010.

name: Chablis Les Clos
review: Tastes a bit disjointed now, with a slight rusticity, but it powers through the palate, delivering intense fruit flavors and mineral character. Full-bodied, it leaves a clean, pure path on the finish, proving it has concentration. Best from 2005 through 2012.

name: Chablis Les Clos Domaine
review: A distinctive aroma of sandalwood leads into flavors of vanilla, peach and melon in this balanced white, which has good cut, just needs time to shrug off the initial oak influence. Best from 2018 through 2024. 120 cases imported.

name: Chablis Montée de Tonnerre Domaine de la Maladière
review: A silky beauty.This full-bodied, ripe and oak-treated Chablis seduces you with its smooth texture, round mouth-feel and terrific combination of mineral, toasted bread, cedar, vanilla, cream and fruit flavors. Elegant and focused on the finish. Best after 1997. 300 cases imported.

name: Chablis Montmains Domaine
review: There's a fine balance between the vibrant structure and richness in this white, allowing the grapefruit, apple and stone flavors to shine. The long, lemony finish leaves a clean impression. Drink now through 2018. 250 cases imported.

name: Chablis Vaudésir
review: Classy and refined, with a silky midpalate that is both firm and seductive. Shows concentration and intensity, with mineral, ripe fruit and good acidity. Long, smoky finish. Best from 2005 through 2015.

name: Chablis Vaudésir Domaine
review: Trim and athletic, with a sleek profile reigning in the green apple, lemon and flint notes. Juicy and bright, offering a chalky feel on the long finish. Drink now through 2019. 100 cases imported.

name: Chablis Vaulorent Domaine
review: A core of stony white peach, apple and lemon flavors is wrapped in a fleshy embrace in this sleek white. Vibrant, lingering with a stony element. Drink now through 2024. 155 cases imported.

name: Chablis Vaulorent Domaine
review: This is dense, with tangy acidity driving the fruity range of apple and citrus flavors. A mineral element emerges on the long, mouthwatering aftertaste. Best from 2016 through 2025. 200 cases imported.

name: Chablis Bougros Côte Bouguerots Domaine
review: On the austere side, this white exhibits flavors of green apple, lemon and grass,with hints of stone. Racy and firm, with a mouthwatering essence. Best from 2018 through 2024. 100 cases imported.

name: Chablis Bougros Domaine
review: This light-footed white delivers apple, stone and spice flavors that are intense and long. Vivid acidity keeps this defined, while the fruit and mineral elements persist. Drink now through 2018. 150 cases imported.

name: Chablis Bougros Domaine
review: An apple flavor and a sharp lemon note run through this round white, which tightens up on the finish, with a hint of vanilla and lemon. Fresh and long. Best from 2013 through 2018. 85 cases imported.

name: Chablis Bougros Domaine
review: Green plum, cut grass and chive flavors mark this tightly wound white. A mineral note emerges as this plays out on the sharply etched finish. Needs time. Best from 2012 through 2022. 80 cases imported.

name: Chablis Champs Royaux
review: A stony undertow keeps the ripe peach, lime and floral flavors grounded in this white. Offers fine complexity and length, with a citrusy aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 5,500 cases imported.

name: Chablis Champs Royaux
review: A hint of thyme and chive perks up the melon and grapefruit flavors in this crisp white. ending with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Chablis Domaine
review: This is delicate, featuring lemon, herb and stone flavors lifted by the fine acidity. Touches of seashore and oyster shell add depth as this coasts to a clean finish. Drink now through 2018. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Chablis Domaine
review: Lemon-lime, melon and stone flavors grace this balanced white, with a texture that borders on viscous. Shows fine harmony and length overall. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chablis Domaine
review: This elegant, racy white has flesh to buffer its vivid acidity. Notes of apple, lemon and mineral show purity and persistence as this glides to the long, mineral finish. Best from 2011 through 2018. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chablis Domaine
review: An apple-scented white, with melon, green plum and mineral flavors. Bright, with a lively structure and a very long finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chablis Fourchaume
review: This white is all about balance, lending a seamless impression that envelops the flavors of apple, yellow plum and oyster shell. Long and refreshing on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 200 cases imported.

name: Chablis Fourchaume
review: A taut, elegant white, with lemon, apple and mineral flavors well-integrated with the firm structure. There's a beam of energy here that carries through to the lingering aftertaste of flint. Best from 2011 through 2018. 225 cases imported.

name: Chablis Fourchaume
review: Ripe notes of peach and pear are backed by juicy acidity and a mineral, chalky element. A hint of herbs and savory accent make it complex. Lingering finish. Drink now through 2015. 600 cases imported.

name: Chablis Fourchaume Vignoble de Vaulorent
review: Elegant and refined, with power firing underneath a layer of mineral, wet stone, vanilla bean, apple and pear complexity. Kicks in with lime and toasted notes on the long, classy finish. Best from 2005 through 2015.

name: Chablis Les Preuses
review: Tasty, yet also shows a sense of place. Ripe, almost tropical, and spicy notes give way to yellow plum, herb and mineral flavors. This has a firm structure underneath the baby fat and needs time to come together. Best from 2010 through 2020. 180 cases imported.

name: Chablis Les Preuses Domaine
review: Rich and concentrated, lending a roundness to the profile with peach, lemon and vanilla flavors. There's nice harmony and length, with a mouthwatering finish. Best from 2011 through 2018. 105 cases imported.

name: Chablis Montée de Tonnerre
review: Very yummy Chablis, thick-textured and packed with honey and lemon character. Full-bodied, with creamy, pear tart notes on the slightly toasty finish. Drink now through 2005.

name: Chablis Montée de Tonnerre Domaine
review: Oak spice lends clove and nutmeg tones to this rich, almost viscous white. Underneath are notes of seashore, green apple and lemon. Attractive overall, but needs a little time. Best from 2012 through 2020. 80 cases imported.

name: Chablis Montmains
review: Offers a mix of lemon and mineral aromas and flavors accented by honey and spice. Very elegant and harmonious, this lingers lazily on the pure finish. Mouthwatering. Best from 2011 through 2020. 250 cases imported.

name: Chablis Montmains
review: A generous version, displaying lemon cake, vanilla and melon notes, all backed by a vivid structure. Subtle, yet with a long, mouthwatering aftertaste. Drink now through 2015. 250 cases imported.

name: Chablis Montmains
review: Floral, lime and lanolin aromas and flavors signal this smooth white. There's bright acidity underneath to keep it all lively and focused. Nice stony aftertaste. Best from 2009 through 2016. 600 cases imported.

name: Chablis Montmains
review: There's good intensity to the tobacco, green apple and mineral flavors in this balanced white, which is rich and firm at once, with a hint of vanilla on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 1,250 cases imported.

name: Chablis Montmains
review: Creamy, medium-bodied and beautifully integrated, this unwinds with apple, lemon and mineral aromas and flavors. It's elegant and focused.  Drink now through 2009.

name: Chablis Montmains Domaine
review: Lemon, apple, mineral and floral notes mingle in this elegant white. The vivid structure keeps this focused and drives the long aftertaste. Drink now through 2023. 350 cases imported.

name: Chablis Montmains Domaine
review: Fresh and harmonious, showing apple, lemon, floral and stone flavors, with a hint of grass. Stays lean and crisp on the mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chablis Montmains Domaine
review: Lean and taut, this white offers yellow plum, green apple and lanolin flavors, showing intensity and concentration, with a long finish. Drink now through 2021. 250 cases imported.

name: Chablis Vaillons
review: Clean and focused, with delicious ripe fruit in an elegant, medium-bodied package. There is some silky, fat texture to this balanced wine, with lemon, spice and tropical flavor intensity on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Best from 2004 through 2010.

name: Chablis Vaillons Domaine
review: Rich and round, offering good cut to the lemon, apple and floral aromas and flavors. Harmonious, lingering with a refreshing finish. Drink now through 2021. 150 cases imported.

name: Chablis Vaillons Domaine
review: Rich, with lemon custard, ripe apple, yellow plum and mineral notes mingling in the fleshy texture. A firm structure keeps this focused and long. Drink now through 2016. 80 cases imported.

name: Chablis Valmur
review: Clean and focused medium-bodied Chablis, with ripe fruit, honey, tropical flavors. Quite fat and thick in texture, with the flavors going on and on. Drink now through 2007.

name: Chablis Vaulorent Domaine
review: A touch of oak adds light vanilla accents that round out this bracing white. Flavors of green apple, quince and lemon ride the steely backbone to a long conclusion. Best from 2017 through 2023. 200 cases imported.

name: Chablis Vaulorent Domaine
review: Lemon, melon, green tea and wax notes mingle in this white. There's a juicy feel and hint of tannins on the long, mineral-laden finish. Best from 2013 through 2015. 180 cases imported.

name: Chablis Vaulorent Domaine
review: Round, with apple and lemon flavors, firming up toward the finish. Though balanced, this lacks the intensity and length typical of this site. Drink now through 2018. 180 cases imported.

name: Chablis Domaine
review: This is fresh and steely, with lively acidity underlining the lemon, apple and mineral flavors. A mouthwatering tang marks the finish. Drink now through 2014. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chablis Domaine
review: Lean and crisp, revealing green apple, herb and earth notes allied to a firm structure. This is creamy midpalate, before a grapefruit peel note elevates the finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chablis Fourchaume
review: Aromas and flavors of elderflower, peach and melon are the highlights of this accessible white, which has good acidity for balance and a lingering finish. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases imported.

name: Chablis Fourchaume
review: Wonderful Chablis terroir in this idiosyncratic white. Packed with flavors, it delivers mineral, lemon, pear, spicy oak and oysterlike notes. Medium-bodied and intense. Drink now through 2005.

name: Chablis Fourchaume Vignoble de Vaulorent
review: Oak is subtle, but this needs time for the terroir to emerge. Shows density and apple and mineral notes on a balanced, medium-bodied frame, with a long finish. Drink now through 2012.

name: Chablis Les Clos Domaine
review: High-toned, showing lanolin, vanilla and citrus aromas and flavors. This is firm, but a bit tight now, with a compact finish. Needs time to harmonize. Best from 2009 through 2020. 270 cases imported.

name: Chablis Les Preuses
review: A bit heavy-handed in the oak department, with bark, toasted wood and spices dominating the fruit. A bit tough on the palate, but it might soften with age--there is enough ripeness to expect it to come together. Best from 2004 through 2008.

name: Chablis Les Preuses Domaine
review: A tasty white, featuring honey, apple, peach and grapefruit flavors. Balanced, with a fresh grapefruit peel note on the lingering finish. Drink now through 2015. 100 cases imported.

name: Chablis Montmains Domaine
review: Apple and lemon flavors are accented by herbs and bitter grapefruit in this sleek, stony white. Cleanses the palate with acidity on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 250 cases imported.

name: Chablis Vaillons Domaine
review: Lanolin and spice aromas, then lemon and mineral flavors are buoyed by a vibrant structure in this firm, linear white. It's intense, building nicely on the palate, with a lingering aftertaste. Drink now through 2010. 200 cases imported.

name: Chablis Vaudésir Domaine
review: There's a juiciness to this white, though it stays firm and on the lean side. Green apple, green plum, lemon and spice flavors prevail. This is long, with an edge of mineral on the finish. Best from 2013 through 2020. 100 cases imported.

name: Chablis Blanchot
review: Distinctive butterscotch and caramel character masks the fruit a bit, but there's good balance overall. Full-bodied, with wonderful midpalate silkiness. Lacks the length to score outstanding. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2005.

name: Chablis Bougros Côte Bouguerots Domaine
review: This combines flesh and structure, a backdrop for its green apple, pear and citrus notes. Compact on the finish, featuring an expression of mineral. Best from 2013 through 2020. 120 cases imported.

name: Chablis Bougros Domaine
review: A nice tight focus courtesy of the acid backbone keeps the melon and yellow plum flavors in check. A lemony accent emerges on the finish. Best from 2009 through 2018. 230 cases imported.

name: Chablis Champs Royaux
review: Peach, melon and earth flavors mark this rich, bright white. Offers an herbal hint as this winds down on the finish. Drink now. 5,500 cases imported.

name: Chablis Champs Royaux
review: A fresh, steely version, displaying apple, lemon and mineral flavors. Fades quickly, but has a fine sense of place. Drink now. 5,500 cases imported.

name: Chablis Champs Royaux
review: Lean and bracing, with vivid acidity underlining the green apple, lemon and mineral notes. Though rich, the freshness in this version wins out in the end. Drink now through 2018. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Chablis Champs Royaux
review: A tightly wound, bracing white, featuring lemon and Granny Smith apple flavors, which lead to a chalky feel on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Chablis Champs Royaux
review: Apple, melon and mineral notes mingle in this vibrant, balanced white, which lingers with a Granny Smith flavor and a mouthwatering impression. Drink now through 2012. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Chablis Champs Royaux
review: Round, with peach, yellow plum and a hint of mineral. A firm structure keeps this focused, with a hint of lemon zest on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Chablis Champs Royaux
review: The apple, peach and mineral flavors play off the vibrant structure, while the texture remains smooth and generous. Has good regional character. Drink now through 2012. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Chablis Fourchaume
review: Shows nice green fruit and mineral notes, but this could use more intensity. The vibrant structure keeps it refreshing. Bring on the oysters. Drink now through 2013. 225 cases imported.

name: Chablis Fourchaume
review: Round and fleshy, this shows a lactic note, with hints of honey and apple. There's not as much mineral as I would like, but this needs time to integrate. Best from 2008 through 2014. 200 cases imported.

name: Chablis Fourchaume Vignoble de Vaulorent Domaine
review: Well-defined flavors of spring blossom, melon and wet stone on the attack, allied to a firm, elegant frame. Has a good crisp profile, with moderate length. Drink now through 2016. 225 cases imported.

name: Chablis Grenouilles Domaine de la Maladière
review: Tight, hard, and solidly structured. A terroir wine that has notes of wet earth and mineral. Big and almost rustic, a grand cru with tons of personality but also a sense of balance, with good concentration of fruit and honey notes. Best after 1998. 100 cases imported.

name: Chablis Les Clos Domaine
review: Ripe orchard fruit graces this soft white, picking up a grapefruit peel bitterness by the finish. Shows moderate concentration and length. Drink now through 2018. 200 cases imported.

name: Chablis Montmains
review: Pleasant. Fresh and succulent, bursting with lemon, honey and freshly cut grass notes, mingling spice and gingerbread tones, there is plenty to like in this medium-bodied Chablis, especially the ripe fruit. Drink now through 2006.

name: Chablis Vaillons Domaine
review: Oyster shell and iodine aromas join melon and apple flavors in highlighting this fat Chablis. Typical but for its round profile and moderate length. Drink now. 110 cases imported.

name: Chablis Vaudésir
review: A fresh wine with good ripe fruit. Medium-bodied, displaying some intensity as the pear, toasted bread, mineral notes kick in at midpalate and propel forward to a lingering finish. Drink now through 2005.

name: Chardonnay Maipo Valley Espino Gran Cuvée
review: Ripe style, with good length to the butter-filled flavors of dried tropical fruit, baked apple and spice. Fingers lingers with butterscotch notes.  Drink now. 1,330 cases made.

name: Chablis
review: Focused, in a polished, pure style, offering lemon, apple and an underlying chalk note. Tightly wound, with a long, bracing finish.  Drink now through 2007.

name: Chablis
review: Clean and crisp, with a fresh and lively fruit character. Lots of citrus, honey, and mineral in this pretty wine. Drink now through 2006.

name: Chablis Beauroy
review: Racy and ripe. Medium-bodied, it powers its way forward, delivering layers of ripe fruit while remaining clean and fresh. Ends with citrus, honey and a mineral touch. Drink now through 2004.

name: Chablis Bougros
review: Appealingly fresh and ripe. Full-bodied, with a zesty personality, it delivers sweet-tasting fruit and salty crackerlike notes. Kicks in with firm acidity on a finish full of vitality. Drink now through 2004.

name: Chablis Champs Royaux
review: Delicate aromas and flavors of lemon, green apple and mineral are focused by the acidity in this round, fruity white. Shows balance and moderate length. Drink now through 2012. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Chablis Fourchaume
review: A smooth example, yet with good grip underneath, sporting apple, peach and light honey notes. Balanced and appealing. Drink now through 2010. 600 cases imported.

name: Chablis Fourchaume
review: Ripe and rich. Tasty, zesty, vibrant and full-bodied, it's a bit tough in texture. Tastes slightly overoaked, showing citrus, honey and toast notes on the finish. Drink now through 2005.

name: Chablis Les Clos
review: Very elegant. Good concentration midpalate buffers the bracing acidity in this medium- to full-bodied white. White flowers, lemon and flint flavors mingle through the lingering finish. Best from 2004 through 2010.

name: Chablis Les Preuses
review: Full-bodied, oak-aged Chablis, showing mineral, wet stone and salty, shellfishlike aromas. Coats the palate and sails to a beautifully balanced finish. One negative: The fruit flavors are a bit muted. Drink now through 2007.

name: Chablis Les Preuses
review: Ripe, rich and harmonious, with a distinctive floral note. Medium- to full-bodied, with lovely honey and ripe fruit flavors and a long, intense finish. An elegant, balanced and lovely wine through and through.  Best after 1997. 300 cases imported.

name: Chablis Montée de Tonnerre
review: Superclean, a lovely Chardonnay delivering crisp, lively fruit and citrus character. Balanced, with a greenish bite on the finish. Drink now through 2005.

name: Chablis Vaillons
review: Young, fresh and sweet-tasting. Medium- to full-bodied, this charmer has ripe pear, citrus and lots of honey. Delicious and uncomplicated, it's well worth the hunt. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2003.

name: Chablis Bougros Côte Bouguerots
review: Lovely Chablis, with pretty ripe fruit and floral aromas. Medium-bodied, delivering grassy, green apple and a touch of honey character in the citrusy aftertaste. Drink now through 2005.

name: Chablis Champs Royaux
review: Melon, lemon and mineral notes swirl around a vibrant core of acidity in this white. Falls a bit short on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 6,500 cases imported.

name: Chablis Fourchaume Vignoble de Vaulorent
review: Clean, focused and racy, showing modest apple and lemon flavors upfront that shut down quickly. The finish has a slight astringency. Drink now through 2006.

name: Chablis Les Lys
review: Frisky and breezy, made in a superfresh style. Medium-bodied, with good ripe fruit and an attractively supple mouthfeel. Turns chewy on the long finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2004.

name: Chablis Montmains
review: Distinctive buttery style, with a hint of butterscotch, folded into a smooth texture and nice citrusy backbone. Medium-bodied, with a vibrant finish. Drink now through 2004.

name: Chablis Vaudésir
review: An oaky grand cru, with butter, butterscotch, vanilla bean flavors dominating its fruit and terroir. Full-bodied, very ripe, as silky textured as any Chardonnay. Drink now through 2000. 725 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Maipo Valley Espino
review: Shows lots of beefy overtones to the dried cherry and berry flavors. Leafy notes emerge on the finish. Drink now. 1,325 cases imported.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley Libération
review: Broad and aromatic, bursting with plum, currant and blackberry fruit, picking up savory pepper and leather notes as the finish plays against mildly gritty tannins. Drink now through 2023. 111 cases made.

name: Courageux Columbia Valley
review: Firm and spicy, with licorice and pepper overtones to the dark berry flavors, riding a crisp texture through the refined finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2019. 256 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Firm on the palate, with tannins that are a touch drying. Flavors lean toward wild cherry, plum, spice, cedar and herb, all framed in toasty oak. Moderate finish. Best from 2000 through 2005. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Ripe and expressive, with a rich mouthful of currant, red plum, blackberry, spice and mint playing against vibrant acidity and finishing with a gloriously open texture. Shows presence, depth and persistence. Best from 2016 through 2022. 384 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Fleshy, open-textured and expressive, with tangy raspberry, cherry and grapefruit peel notes melding into a generous beam that lingers impressively. Drink now through 2024. 225 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light and sleek, this version shows good transparency to its ripe black cherry and blackberry flavors, which linger with gentle meaty notes on the polished finish. Drink now through 2021. 368 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Vivid and open-textured, lacing hints of orange peel and black tea through the pomegranate and raspberry fruit, finishing with deftness and complexity. Drink now through 2018. 290 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: This polished, velvety red is appealing for its juicy black currant, red plum and spice flavors, which play against a layer of crisp tannins. Best from 2014 through 2018. 343 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Despite some firm tannins, this has an open texture, with a good range of currant, loam and spice flavors that emphasize harmony over power. The finish lingers enticingly. Best from 2008 through 2012. 440 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Firm in texture, with gritty tannins around a somewhat decadent core of plum and toasted oak flavors. Needs time to come together. Best after 2011. 497 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: A rich core of focused, concentrated currant, black cherry and plum flavors balances beautifully with finely integrated tannins, marking this as a potentially magnificent wine with cellaring until 1995 to 2000. Has the muscle and grace to evolve into a majestic wine, even though it has the fruit to drink now. 11,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Gold Label
Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Still very young, concentrated and dryingly tannic, but the ripe cherry and strawberry fruit peeks through the tight structure. Very tight and tough now, but the length of the finish and beauty of the fruit bodes well. Try it around 1995.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Benchland Series
review: A rich, expressive style, with a deep core of opulent flavors built around fig, melon, apricot and butterscotch. Ends with a flash of buttery oak. Drink now through 2021. 3,368 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Benchland Series
review: A strong effort, featuring a rich core of licorice-laced blackberry and wild berry notes, with touches of cedar, tobacco leaf and crushed rock. Firms nicely on the finish, where the tannins are a presence without being overbearing. Drink now. 1,838 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Intense and concentated, a rich but compact Cabernet with crisp acidity and firm tannins. Pretty cassis, toast and vanilla flavors are enticing. Drinkable now. 13,595 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Minty, woody, lean and bright, with ample tannins but otherwise silky of texture and highly polished, with ripe blackberry and cassis fruit that echoes forever on the finish.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Bench Blend
review: Offers a rich, complex fruit basket of fig, apricot, melon, green apple and citrus flavors, folding together in a stylish manner, with a good focus and a long finish, accented by a pithy citrus texture. Drink now. 3,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Delivers an elegant, zesty core of red and dark berry flavors, with currant and cherry highlights amid licorice and spice accents. Ends with fine-grained tannins that reverberate elegantly. Drink now through 2027. 13,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Gold Label
review: Hill's first, and in many ways his finest, this remains a ripe, intense, flavorful wine--if a bit past its prime. No longer exhibits the opulent fruit it did at age 10 or 12, but still quite flavorful, with meaty currant, anise, cedar and a touch of leather.--1978 California Cabernet retrospective. Drink now through 2000.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Silver Label
review: Very deep and concentrated, almost dense fruit, with ripe plum, cherry and cassis flavors and a perfumed nose. It's wearing plenty of oak and tannins, but they're not harsh or overdone, just well integrated into the wine. Finishes with great intensity.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Reserve
review: Ripe, complex and generous, with a marvelous interplay of toast, butter and smoke notes against the rich pear and pineapple flavors, turning spicy and elegant on the finish. It all weaves together nicely; drinkable now. 32,700 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Reserve
review: A bold, concentrated wine, with vivid pear and butterscotch aromas and flavors in harmonious balance, the lively acidity on the finish adding zest to the silky-smooth texture. Drinkable now. 23,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Gold Label
review: A major Cabernet with great concentration and structure. Tart cherry, anise and plum flavors are backed with firm tannins and acids in a smooth, polished style.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Openly fruity and friendly, this is creamy, rich and full-bodied, layered with fig, melon, apricot and spice. Holds its focus and ends with a long, pure finish. Drink now through 2015. 15,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Fragrant, fresh, clean and delicate, this offers fleshy peach, nectarine, citrus and tangerine flavors, with a complex, layered finish. Drink now through 2015. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 15,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Fragrant fig, honeysuckle, pear and floral scents are rich, full-bodied, focused and balanced, showing a subtle touch of butterscotch. Drink now through 2012. 14,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Reserve
review: One of the better William Hill wines of late, this is smooth, ripe and harmonious, with complex pear, fig, melon and citrus notes.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Reserve
review: Ripe and redolent of butterscotch, concentrated and complex without being weighty, balancing a toasty character against elegant, ripe pear flavors, all of which carries through cleanly on the finish.

name: Bench Blend Napa Valley
review: A graceful, elegant and understated style, offering spicy dark berry, cigar box, gravel and anise. Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Drink now. 4,145 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Inviting and complex, featuring a firm mix of red and dark berry flavors and subtle earthy, gravelly notes, ending with tight, well-defined tannins. Best from 2019 through 2029. 17,455 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A woody presence gives this red a restrained character, overshadowing a pleasant mix of dark berry fruit that's supple and graceful. May improve with time. Drink now through 2024. 19,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Aura
review: Tightly framed, with cedary oak, mushroom, currant and plum flavors that firm up on the finish. Best from 2000 through 2008. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Bench Blend
review: Well-built, with a solid structure and vivid flavors of raspberry, blackberry and wild berry fruit, showing touches of dried herb and cedar. Drink now through 2024. 1,580 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Benchland Series
review: Pure and juicy, with a core of dark berry and crushed rock flavors, smoky, toasty oak and a touch of graphite, all of which suggest short-term cellaring, as the texture is still edgy. Best from 2020 through 2032. 17,455 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Gold Label
Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Supple and harmonious, with a rich mix of red currant, black cherry, wild berry and blackberry, shaded by vanilla-scented oak. Ends with chewy tannins. Best from 2009 through 2012. 550 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Smooth, ripe and complex, with lots of currant, cedar, plum and spice flavors that are rich and well focused. Just the right amount of tannins. Give it another year or two; start drinking from 1999 to 2001. 6,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Green olive and herbal notes tend to obscure the modest currant and berry fruit in this smooth-textured, appealing wine. Has the stuff to improve through 1997.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Offers a complex mix of creamy, vanilla-scented oak and snappy, fresh green apple, melon and honeysuckle flavors, folding together on the finish, where this shows a pithy edge. Drink now. 34,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Tight, firm and focused, still a bit green, with intense, tart pear and apple flavors; light oak shadings on the finish add dimension.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Bench Blend
review: Complex and alluring, with creamy vanilla and butterscotch notes set over a core of green apple and citrus. Full-bodied, deep and persistent. Drink now through 2019. 1,900 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Reserve
review: Lots of pure, ripe fruit, with hints of apple, melon and pear. Crisp and focused, gaining complexity on the finish, where the fruit is married happily to light toasty oak. Drink now through 2009. 4,480 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Ripe and fleshy, with plush texture to black currant, black cherry and fresh sage flavors. Plenty of toasty oak folds into modest tannin on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 25,166 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Tight and firm, with herbal leanings backed by anise, blackberry and cassis notes. Toasty oak frames the ensemble, which finishes moderately. Best from 2001 through 2008.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Goes for elegance, and packs a lot of sweet berry, currant and cedar flavors into a lean and lively package. Approachable now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Aura
review: Supple and balanced, with a dry, tannic core of mineral, currant and berry flavors that clamp down on the finish, leaving dry tannins and a cedary oak aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Bench Blend
review: Intense and complex, with a mix of cedary dark berry and gravelly earth, this is a bit muddled and dusty on the dry finish. Drink now through 2024. 4,400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Firm, with chunky flavors of roasted and fresh herbs, currants, olives and leather. Herbal tones, toasty oak and firm tannins carry through the finish. Drink now through 2007. 4,510 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: A very successful '89 that's balanced and flavorful, showing bright, lively currant, black cherry and herb flavors, but is also tannic and tightly wound. Best to cellar until 1997 or so. 11,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa County Silver Label
review: Delicate and understated, showing floral pear, spice and nutmeg flavors that are well focused, intense and balanced. Drinks well now.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Steers a steady course, with orange and citrus notes accenting the ripe pear and apple fruit, ending clean and pure. Drink now. 29,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: A refreshing style, with ripe pear, lemon and hints of citrus flavors that persist on the clean, crisp finish. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: A wine of polish and finesse. A touch earthy up front, before the core of pear and vanilla-scented Chardonnay flavor works in. Turns supple and silky on the finish. 34,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Fruity, with a flinty citrus accent to the ripe pear and apple flavors. Finishes with a clean aftertaste.

name: Grenache Santa Barbara County
review: Simple yet pleasant, this is a lighter style that shows off tasty strawberry and wild berry flavors. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County
review: Stewed plum and strong herbal notes overtake this wine, with muddled red berry flavors. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Clone 777
review: An elegant style, with ripe, fine-tuned cola-sassafras, black cherry and spice notes that are full-bodied, focused, long and complex on the finish, where this turns pleasantly earthy. Drink now through 2013. 720 cases made.

name: Pedro Ximénez Jerez Don Guido Solera Especial 20 Year Old
review: Features a dense core of mulled prune, warm ganache and black pudding flavors, with hints of toasted caraway, buckwheat and black sesame filling in the background. The viscous finish rolls along slowly, showing a molasses echo at the very end. Drink now. 920 cases made.

name: Amontillado Jerez Jalifa Solera Especial 30 Year Old
review: Green tea, ginger, caramel, roasted almond and dried orange peel notes are layered together, with piercing acidity driving the lengthy finish. This has depth and zing. Drink now. 125 cases made.

name: Manzanilla Sanlúcar de Barrameda Don Zoilo Collection
review: Bright and pure, with a floral edge amid the mix of lemon peel, salted butter and straw notes. The long finish offers scintillating cut and drive. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Oloroso Jerez Dry Sack Solera Especial 15 Year Old Medium
review: Exotic, with date, fresh fig, brown bread and toffee flavors that glide along, carried by roasted sesame, honey-roasted peanut and candied ginger notes. Stays bright enough for balance, with a bitter almond detail threading the finish. Drink now. 1,300 cases made.

name: Palo Cortado Jerez Dos Cortados Solera Especial 20 Year Old
review: Shows lovely energy, with racy, finely beaded acidity carrying mouthwatering bitter orange, salted caramel, singed almond and green tea notes. Ends with a long, refined note of bitter almond. Exhibits great range and cut. Drink now. 390 cases made.

name: Pedro Ximénez Jerez Don Zoilo Collection 12 Year Old
review: Warmed buckwheat and toasted caraway notes lead the way, followed by melted baker's chocolate, steeped prune and Turkish coffee notes that all rumble through the dense, tongue-coating finish. A muscular PX. Drink now. 3,344 cases made.

name: Amontillado Jerez Dry Don Zoilo Collection 12 Year Old
review: Orange pulp, salted caramel and singed almond notes race along here, accented by sweet and dry hints, though the drier side wins out in the end. Well-focused, with a mouthwatering edge lingering. Drink now. 2,109 cases made.

name: Oloroso Jerez Don Zoilo Collection 12 Year Old
review: Very bright, with orange blossom, peach pit and cardamom notes leading to accents of bergamot, dried persimmon and ginger. The long finish shows a flicker of sweetness, but stays dry and nervy overall. Drink now. 1,172 cases made.

name: Manzanilla Jerez Medium
review: A sweet Manzanilla. It's attractive, with honey and smoke notes verging on malt whisky, and a kick of alcohol on the finish. The aftertaste is long and complex, with walnut, coffee and chocolate accents. Drink now. 300,000 cases made.

name: Manzanilla Sanlúcar de Barrameda Don Zoilo Collection
review: High-pitched, with a bracing, chalky spine that pierces the core of fleur de sel, slivered almond, chamomile and quinine notes. An echo of lemon curd hangs on the racy finish. Drink now. 867 cases made.

name: Oloroso Jerez Solera Especial 15 Year Old
review: A hint of burnt rubber gives way to chocolate, fig and caramel in this sweet Sherry. There's enough complexity for interest, and a powerful, bitter walnut finish. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Fino Jerez Pando
review: Open-knit and refreshing, with lemon pith, talc and bitter almond notes streaking through, ending with a bone-dry, taut finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cream Jerez Canasta
review: Friendly toffee, roasted almond and lightly baked peach flavors form the core here, with subtle raisin and toasted peanut notes on the finish. Drink now. 98,000 cases made.

name: Fino Jerez Pando
review: A textbook fino, with a fleur de sel edge around the flavors of blanched almond, dried chamomile, white peach and citrus oil. Offers a taut, dry, racy finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Jerez Dry Sack Medium
review: Plump and on the sweet side, with golden raisin, date, pear eau-de-vie and peach melba notes, backed by a light twinge of bitter almond that keeps this honest. Drink now. 87,000 cases made.

name: Oloroso Jerez Solera Especial 15 Year Old
review: An oloroso in the sweet style, leaning toward the caramel, toffee and honey end of the flavor spectrum. Almost a bit flat until the palate-searing finish jangles the senses. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rochioli Vineyard
review: Has it all. Combines richness with power, finesse, depth and concentration. Packs in lots of ripe, juicy plum, black cherry, spicy, toasty oak and finishes with a long, rich aftertaste. Drink now through 2004.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Summa Vineyard
review: Dark, ripe, rich and potent, with a distinctly spicy edge to the blackberry and black cherry flavors. Amazing depth and finesse.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Pure and simple, a delicious Chardonnay. Rich in flavor and body, with a silky smooth texture and a bounty of spicy pear, apple, peach and hazelnut. Wood stays out of the way in this opulent young wine. Drink now through 2002.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: A delicious wine. Minty, deep, rich and concentrated, with layers of plum and raspberry, a long, long finish.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rochioli Vineyard
review: Shows tremendous complexity, with a pretty interplay of vanilla-tinged oak notes and lots of currant and black cherry flavors. Long finish.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rochioli Vineyard
review: Delicious wine, ripe, smooth and juicy, with tiers of plum, black cherry, anise and spice. Amazingly elegant, complex and delicate.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: A triumphant effort. A touch of smoky, matchstick-scented oak quickly works its way into main core flavors of ripe pear, apple, honeydew melon and honeysuckle, picking up a rich, smoky finish on the aftertaste and revealing uncommon depth and complexity. Drink now through 2007. 104 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Hawk Hill Vineyard
review: Fresh and vibrant, with lively citrus, pear and nectarine flavors that are delicate and focused, building intensity and depth on the finish. Ends with a long, intricate and multifaceted finish. Drink now through 2012. 218 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Bucher Vineyard
review: Rich and complex, with tight, dense, loamy earth, raspberry and wild berry fruit that's fresh and vivid. Well-focused and full-bodied, ending with wonderful complexity and intensity. Drink now through 2017. 548 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Eastside Road Neighbors
review: Delightfully complex and classy, with ripe plum, black cherry and raspberry aromas. Firm, loamy tannins give the flavors traction. Full-bodied and intense, yet elegant and delicate. Drink now through 2018. 334 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rochioli Vineyard
review: A wine of great subtlety and finesse, with slowly unfolding black cherry, berry, vanilla and spice. The texture is smooth and polished; the finish long and lingering. Most impressive is the finish, where the flavors fold together nicely. Drinks well now, but should only get better between 1999 to 2003.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Williams Selyem Estate Vineyard
review: Beautifully crafted, intense and vibrant, displaying zesty wild berry, raspberry and red and black licorice notes. Full-bodied and focused, gaining depth and richness. Drink now through 2022. 184 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hirsch Vineyard
review: Remarkably complex and flavorful. Rich, supple, concentrated, loaded with plum, cherry and wild berry flavors. Long, satisfying aftertaste.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Bacigalupi Vineyard
review: This rich, layered and beautifully focused Zin shows raspberry and lavender aromas that open to supple and plump flavors of boysenberry, cracked pepper and herbes de Provence. Drink now through 2021. 377 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley
review: Opulent and creamy, with complex fig, date, marshmallow and earthy citrus notes that are beautifully balanced, supple and harmonious, finishing with a long, silky aftertaste. Drink now through 2009. 375 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley
review: Bold, superripe and oily. Rich in banana, fig, pear and spicy vanilla flavors, it's a mouthful from start to finish. Drink now through 2003. 144 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Ferrington Vineyard
review: This red is deliciously pure and complex, with ripe, rich black cherry and raspberry fruit that's spicy and detailed. Deftly balanced. The finish features a minerally edge and a creamy oak overlay, which leaves this mouthwatering. Drink now through 2020. 699 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Ripe, rich, smooth and supple, very complete, with lots of berry flavors and a silky texture, long on the finish.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Wonderful perfumed aromas of ripe Pinot, rose petals, black cherry and plum, this wine makes a statement about how polished and elegant Russian River Pinots can be, with its soothing, caressing texture. The finish brings the core Pinot flavors to the forefront, with a long, luxurious aftertaste. Drink now through 2008. 445 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Quite seductive, with supple oak, cherry, wild berry and spicy nuances. Impressive for its delicacy and finesse.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Smooth, ripe, rich and polished, loaded with ripe plum and cherry-laced flavors. Still young and tight, impressive for its length.--Williams Selyem vertical. 780 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Eastside Road Neighbors
review: This gorgeous wine is rich and supple, displaying ripe, plummy black cherry and blackberry fruit that's intense and spicy, pure and focused, with a long, pure, lingering finish. Drink now through 2020. 584 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Olivet Lane Vineyard
review: Full-bodied, rich and complex, with lovely aromas and plum, cherry and oak flavors. An impressive Olivet Lane bottling.--Williams Selyem vertical. 600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Riverblock Vineyard
review: Firm, dark, rich and concentrated, with layers of ripe plum, black cherry, blackberry and spice. Delicious aftertaste. Best from 2001 through 2009. 875 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rochioli Vineyard
review: Silky-smooth in texture, bright, rich and concentrated, with lively black cherry and plummy flavors. Wonderfully perfumed aromatics add complexity and dimension. The last Rochioli Vineyard bottling. Tasty now. Best from 2001 through 2007. 256 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Westside Road Neighbors
review: Dark purple-red, very rich and complex, with concentrated wild berry and blackberry fruit flavors that are firm and dense. Impressive for its depth and focus; the flavors pick up a plum and boysenberry note on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 656 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Westside Road Neighbors
review: Scents of black cherry and blackberry jam lead to a ripe, intense, firmly concentrated wine that has excellent acidity and tannins, giving it a great structure. But most impressive is the finish, where the flavors push through with a rich concentration of flavor. Drink now through 2010. 573 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hirsch Vineyard
review: Intense and vibrant, with a vivid display of earthy raspberry, wild berry and blackberry, revealing nuances of anise, fresh earth and mineral, finishing with a remarkably complex and satisfying finish. Best to cellar short-term. Best from 2005 through 2012. 675 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Forchini Vineyard North Flats
review: Zesty and still lively, delivering explosive pepper and boysenberry aromas that lead to rich, layered cherry tart flavors, with notes of cinnamon and smoke. Aging beautifully.—1991/2001 California Zinfandel blind retrospective (December 2010). Drink now through 2014. 425 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Anderson Valley Ferrington Vineyard
review: Bold, rich, exotic yet refined style, with buttery fig, apricot, pear and touches of lemon, all turning elegant, smooth and graceful on a long, detailed finish. Drink now through 2006. 244 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley
review: Beautifully crafted and deftly balanced, with a complex mix of ripe, spicy pear, a touch of pineapple and a hint of citrus, ending with a dash of hazelnut. Supple, rich and creamy, it zooms along on the finish, caressing the palate. Drink now through 2008. 308 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Fresh floral, citrus, green apple and tangy lemon-lime notes taste as good as they smell. Full-bodied, elegant and balanced, with lively acidity and a long, clean finish, showing a hint of mineral and oak on the finish. Drink now through 2013. 226 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: A rich, opulent style, with layers of honeysuckle, fig and a hint of honey that run deep and long, with an intense, elegant, concentrated finish. Drink now through 2009. 325 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Intense and vibrant, with complex, concentrated pear, nutmeg, citrus and spice flavors that are a bit raw on the finish, but it packs in loads of flavor, turning creamy and buttery on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 170 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Drake Estate Vineyard
review: Balanced to a T, offering complex pear, anise, vanilla and butterscotch hints, with a firm, pithy backbone of acidity. The long aftertaste reverberates. Drink now. 405 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Heintz Vineyard
review: Intense and concentrated, with a mix of tangy citrus, cedary oak, grapefruit and green apple. Full-bodied, with a pleasant earthy edge, adding to its complexity. Drink now through 2016. 274 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Hirsch Vineyard
review: Fragrant, with floral, honeysuckle, melon and pear aromas. Ripe, rich and full-bodied, with pretty, well-defined fruit flavors, hints of fig, nutmeg, pear and citrus, gaining depth and nuance on a long, intricate finish. Drink now through 2006. 173 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Ferrington Vineyard
review: Combines ripe black cherry, spice and currant notes with cedary oak flavors. It all folds together nicely with a complex aftertaste and firm tannins. Drink now or cellar short-term. First Ferrington Vineyard bottling by Williams Selyem. 147 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Wonderful fragrant aromas of flowers and ripe cherry and wild berry, which transfer over to a smooth, rich, polished style that caresses the palate, turning silky and delicate. Finishes with vivid black cherry and blackberry fruit and touches of vanilla and spice. Drink now through 2008. 3,275 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Marked by complex spicy, loamy earth, dried lavender and dried berry notes, this Pinot is full-bodied and tight, gaining richness and depth on the finish, where the flavors show a plummy minerality. Drink now through 2020. 286 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Delicious. Elegant and spicy, delicate style, with vibrant, succulent black cherry and raspberry flavors that are rich, intense and concentrated, turning elegant and supple on a long, lively finish. Drink now through 2009. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Intense and sharply focused, a smooth, elegant, graceful style with a silky texture and long, layered display of ripe cherry, blackberry and raspberry tinted fruit. Sufficient fine-grained tannins for cellaring. Drink now through 2008. 252 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Smooth and polished, supple and harmonious, nicely perfumed, with cherry and wild berry flavors that are young and vibrant.--Williams Selyem vertical. 555 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Flax Vineyard
review: This charming effort is plump and generous, with polished, lingering supple black cherry and blueberry fruit. Drink now through 2020. 487 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Olivet Lane Vineyard
review: Dark, ripe and distinct for its rich, exuberant black cherry and blackberry flavors, it turns supple and polished, with a long, full finish. Drink now through 2005. 1,400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Olivet Lane Vineyard
review: Juicy, with pretty, supple plum and black cherry flavors, a cola accent on the finish. Impressive for its texture and finesse.--Williams Selyem vertical. 980 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rochioli Riverblock Vineyard
review: Very rich and concentrated, this delivers layered flavors built around ripe plum, wild berry and black cherry, joined by wilted rose and spicy aromatics that are still a little diffuse, yet offer plenty of depth and complexity. Best from 2013 through 2022. 562 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rochioli Riverblock Vineyard Twenty-Fifth Anniversary
review: Complex aromas of black cherry, raspberry and floral berry blossom have a touch of light oak and a hint of anise and sage. Firm and concentrated. Best to cellar short term. Best from 2008 through 2013. 679 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rochioli Vineyard
review: Rich, supple and polished, with lots of ripe plum and wild berry flavors and gentle, supple texture.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rochioli Vineyard
review: Corked this time, but in true form it's a classic, with a deep, rich, complex core of cherry, currant and plum flavors, turning silky.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Remarkable for its rich, deep, complex chocolate, cherry, toast and vanilla flavors that are smooth and concentrated, backed with toasty oak and firm, supple tannins. It glides across the palate. Elegant and stylish, delicious to drink now, but should improve through 1993. 597 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Coastlands Vineyard
review: This beautiful mix of complex flavors shows smoky, toasty oak accents to the ripe plum and raspberry flavors. Deftly balanced, intense and focused, ending with a mouthwatering minerality. Drink now through 2020. 292 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Coastlands Vineyard
review: Wonderful balance and purity of flavor, showing off its cola, wild berry, sage, mineral and toasty, cedary oak flavors. Drink now through 2005. 265 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Coastlands Vineyard
review: Distinct with its pepper notes. Firm, complex and concentrated, with black cherry and wild berry flavors moving to the forefront. Has enough tannin to cellar short-term. Best from 2001 through 2008. 630 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Coastlands Vineyard
review: Ripe, smooth and polished, with a silky texture and lots of pretty plum, black cherry, spice and berry flavors that glide across the palate. Finishes with a long, complex aftertaste that reveals tremendous concentration. Drinks well now, but can age into 2000.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Coastlands Vineyard
review: Smooth, rich and smoky, with a pretty toasty oak accent to the plum and cherry flavors. Turns elegant and spicy on the finish.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hirsch Vineyard
review: Pure, rich and harmonious, with an expansive core of ripe plum, raspberry, fresh earth and mineral, tightening up on the finish. Drink now through 2023. 401 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hirsch Vineyard
review: Offers lots of wild berry and cherry flavors, picks up an exotic toasty oak edge and finishes with a long, full aftertaste. Can stand cellaring. Best from 1998 to 2002.--Williams Selyem vertical. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Peay Vineyard
review: Tightly wound, intense without being overbearing, with dense mineral, black cherry and wild berry. Sharply focused and deeply concentrated, the finish is rich and persistent, with wonderful detail and length. Drink now through 2009. 340 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Precious Mountain Vineyard
review: Wonderful balance and purity of flavor, with pretty scents of rose petal, blackberry, raspberry, fresh earth and a touch of nutmeg from oak. This wine combines elegance and finesse with ripe, vivid yet delicate flavors that caress on the finish. Drink now through 2008. 266 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Precious Mountain Vineyard
review: Dazzling fruit complexity, with a range of black cherry, wild berry and plum. Holds its tight focus and finishing with a gush of flavors. Hints of clove and light oak add extra flavor nuances. Drink now through 2007. 211 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Precious Mountain Vineyard
review: Seductive oak leads to a complex, elegant core of ripe, tasty, exotically spicy plum, black cherry, currant, sage and mineral flavors that sail on a long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2006. 211 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Terra De Promissio Vineyard
review: Pure, fresh and rich, with vivid raspberry, wild berry, boysenberry and floral notes imparting a good mix of flavor and structure. Ends with a dash of black licorice, gaining on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 406 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley
review: Beautifully crafted with layers of bright, ripe, spicy raspberry, cherry and vanilla flavors. Intense and lively through the long, full, lingering aftertaste. Enough tannin to age, but drinkable now while it's youthful and vibrant. 335 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Bacigalupi Vineyard
review: Everything you're looking for in a Zinfandel: richness, complexity, balance and zestiness. Aromas of black raspberry, licorice and pepper lead to supple flavors of huckleberry, sage and toasty caramel. Drink now through 2014. 255 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Forchini Vineyard North Flats
review: This dense, richly structured Zin exhibits black raspberry and spice aromas and layered, well-structured flavors of plum, Chinese spice and licorice, which linger toward ripe but firm tannins. Drink now through 2017. 189 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Papera Vineyard
review: This sleek red is jammy and bold, with youthful fruit. Floral raspberry and mineral aromas lead to layered, supple boysenberry, caramel and spicy sage flavors. Hard to resist now, but should benefit from a few more years in the cellar as the wine gains focus. Drink now through 2020. 412 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Ripe and full-bodied, with rich pear, fig, vanilla and apricot notes that are creamy-textured, ending with a burst of honeysuckle and anise. Drink now through 2020. 278 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Offers a tight beam of ripe pear, melon, citrus and wet stone notes, with floral aromatics and spicy cinnamon-nutmeg flavors that unfold gracefully, echoing nutmeg and spice. Drink now through 2015. 288 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Elegant and refined, with a subtle mix of pear, spice, toast and apple flavors that fold together nicely. It all turns smooth and complex on the finish. 206 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Drake Estate Vineyard
review: Zippy acidity keeps the flavors dancing in this sleek, stylish Chardonnay. Elegant and deftly balanced, offering subtle nutmeg, cedar, green apple and green pineapple flavors, giving this just enough depth and complexity to maintain interest. Drink now through 2020. 331 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Olivet Lane Vineyard
review: A seductive style, built on fruit purity, with a core of green apple, melon, light citrus and light oak. Shows surprising purity and subtlety of flavor. Drink now. 267 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Ferrington Vineyard
review: A ripe, opulent style, smooth-textured, with rich cherry, raspberry and blackberry jam flavors. Finishes with a long, complex aftertaste and just a trace of heat. Tannins are fine-grained and integrated. Drink now through 2008. 513 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Ferrington Vineyard
review: Dark and ripe, brimming with complex plum, black cherry and raspberry flavors that are rich and sharply focused. Best from 2000 through 2004. 88 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Ferrington Vineyard
review: Ripe and juicy, brimming with black cherry, earth, mushroom and berry flavors. Tightly focused, dense and concentrated. Drink now through 2002.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Ferrington Vineyard
review: Well focused, plush and concentrated, it's an impressive '93 for its color and depth of plum and cherry flavors.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Central Coast
review: Taut and snappy, with firm, ripe blueberry and blackberry fruit that's subtle and engaging, gaining depth and velocity on the finish. Best from 2013 through 2022. 822 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Enticing aromas of ripe cherry, raspberry, graham cracker and toasty oak. Deftly balanced and smooth, textured. Long, rich, elegant aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 2,074 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Fragrant and delicate, with pretty fruit and floral aromas, matched by ripe, rich cherry, wild berry, plum and raspberry fruit. Keeps its focus, the long finish interspersed with earth and anise flavors. Drink now through 2007. 739 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Serves up lots of ripe, rich, concentrated black cherry, wild berry, plum and spice flavors. Deeply complex and concentrated, finishing with a minty note.--Williams Selyem vertical. 501 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Rich and intense, deeply flavored, with a core of ripe black cherry, plum, currant and berry, firming on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 531 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Ripe and forward, with juicy plum and cherry-laced Pinot Noir flavors. Long and lingering.--Williams Selyem vertical. 317 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Flax Vineyard
review: Firm in texture and structure, this is full-bodied, intense and concentrated, with layers of black cherry, wild berry, mineral, anise and spice. Tightly wound, so cellar time is appropriate. Best from 2010 through 2016. 586 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Litton Estate Vineyard
review: Trim and spicy, with fragrant, delicate blueberry and black cherry fruit. This is medium-bodied, pure and focused, ending with refined flavors. Drink now through 2014. 148 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Olivet Lane Vineyard
review: Benefits from a kiss of creamy oak, with a supple texture and flavors built around ripe raspberry, black cherry and subtle earth notes. Gains on the finish. Drink now through 2021. 224 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Olivet Lane Vineyard
review: This fragrant, delicate style exhibits a rich black cherry and blueberry core of flavors that lend a measure of finesse and refinement. Ends with a subtle mineral, loamy earth note. Drink now through 2020. 191 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Riverblock Vineyard
review: Dense and chewy, with a well-focused core of plum, cherry and wild berry. Best to cellar into 1998 to 2001.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rochioli Riverblock Vineyard
review: A subtle, understated style, with creamy cherry, wild berry, plum and spice notes that are delicate and spicy, ending with a long nuanced finish. Drink now through 2015. 623 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rochioli Riverblock Vineyard
review: A rich, supple, graceful, harmonious style, with ripe, plum, black cherry and raspberry fruit that's well-centered, with a hint of creamy, nutmeg-shaded oak. Young and engaging, it finishes where it began, with succulent fruit flavors and just the right touch of tannins. Drink now through 2008. 306 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rochioli Riverblock Vineyard
review: A wine of substance, depth, complexity and richness, built around a core of ripe plum and black cherry, with hints of mineral, anise, sage and wild berry. A seductive style that should improve with another year in the bottle. Drink now through 2007. 577 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Westside Road Neighbors
review: Intense and well-focused on vivid wild berry and raspberry flavors, with a wild, racy edge that's expansive and gains depth and nuance. Best from 2013 through 2023. 933 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Westside Road Neighbors
review: Very complete, complex and balanced, with subtle cherry, plum and raspberry fruit that's supple and graceful. Medium- to full-bodied, gaining depth and richness on the finish, where the flavors linger. Drink now through 2020. 968 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Williams Selyem Estate Vineyard
review: Complex, featuring a mix of anise, black licorice, sandy earth, smoky oak, blackberry and currant flavors, all running deep and persistent. Long on the finish, with well-integrated tannins. Drink now. 547 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir San Benito County Vista Verde Vineyard
review: Well-structured, smooth and complex, with a rich, concentrated core of vibrant black cherry and blackberry fruit that gains amplitude on the finish, with hints of sage, spice and nutmeg adding flavor dimensions. Drink now through 2009. 860 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: This spicy Pinot delivers black cherry, plum and raspberry notes. This is medium- to full-bodied, and delicate, with silky tannins and a long, pure finish that's quite attractive.  Drink now through 2018. 1,186 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Starts out gamy and a touch peppery, but doesn't stray too far from its core of dense, ripe plum, black cherry and raspberry-laced fruit. Finishes with firm tannins. Best from 2001 through 2006. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Finely knit, supple in texture, with elegant, understated flavors that gently unfold. A most elegant and sophisticated wine.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hirsch Vineyard
review: Distinctive and assertive. Rich, intense and concentrated, with layers of black cherry, wild berry, plum and mineral that are backed by mouthcoating tannins. Best from 2003 through 2008. 1,159 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Precious Mountain Vineyard
review: This Pinot mixes subtle, caressing plum and raspberry flavors with a firm backbone of acidity and tannins. Medium-bodied and cleansing. Drink now through 2020. 285 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma County
review: Delicious display of Pinot, with its smooth, fleshy texture and complex array of ripe plum, raspberry and black cherry fruit. It turns silky on the midpalate and finishes with a wonderful array of flavors. Drink now through 2007. 1,063 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Bacigalupi Vineyard
