review: Balanced and well-focused, showing an elegant sense of complexity, with aromas of raspberry and blueberry and flavors of wildflower, pepper and herbs. Drink now through 2021. 252 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Bacigalupi Vineyard Twenty-Fifth Anniversary
review: Intense and juicy, with wonderful fruit purity and an elegant sense of restraint. Offers fresh boysenberry, spice and anise notes, with fine tannins that build to a tart, cedary finish. Drink now through 2011. 352 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Forchini Vineyard South Knoll
review: Rich, ripe and jammy, with spicy cherry pie aromas and layered flavors of boysenberry, underbrush and cracked pepper. The tannins are ripe but a bit rustic. Needs time. Best from 2014 through 2019. 224 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Russian River Valley Drake Estate Vineyard
review: Polished and pinpoint-focused, featuring bright lemon and mineral aromas, with vibrant citrus, blanched almond and mineral flavors. Drink now through 2015. 25 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley
review: Rich and extracted, with well-focused layers of fig, apricot, melon and toasty oak. Young and a bit raw, it turns complex, with a long, intricate finish. Drink now through 2006. 382 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Offers a pleasing mix of rich, assertive peach, anise and savory herb notes, touching on butterscotch. Most impressive is the long finish, which gains depth and length. Drink now. 322 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Fresh, with a zesty grapefruit and citrus vitality to the pithy green apple and pear notes, clean and spicy. Ends with a dash of honey. Drink now. 451 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Core flavors are centered around citrus, tangerine and nectarine, with touches of pear, fig and light toasty oak. Gains complexity and nunace, and holds its stated 16 percent alcohol quite well, even if there's a trace of heat on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 115 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Drake Estate Vineyard
review: Rich and creamy, with fig, honeysuckle and honeydew melon notes shaded by light, toasty oak. Still a bit raw, but clean and persistent. Drink now through 2019. 439 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Drake Estate Vineyard
review: Displays a mix of citrus, honeysuckle and hint of butterscotch on a medium body. Pure and lively, this is more engaging with every sip. Drink now through 2017. 304 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Hawk Hill Vineyard
review: A flinty, citrus-laced effort, with a tangy pink grapefruit edge to the pippin apple flavors. Fans of pure, ripe Chardonnay, absent evident oak, will find this especially appealing, as it ends with a snappy apple pie freshness. Drink now through 2017. 296 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Hawk Hill Vineyard
review: Floral, honeysuckle, spice and leesy, pithy citrus peel scents are full-bodied on the palate, with lively acidity and spice and citrus notes. Gains depth and complexity on the finish, where a pleasant minerality folds in. Drink now through 2014. 287 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Hawk Hill Vineyard
review: Rich yet understated, with cedary oak wrapped around ripe pear, spice and melon flavors that are still a bit woody, but nothing that time in the bottle shouldn't resolve. Drink now through 2010. 290 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Hawk Hill Vineyard
review: Aromatically complex, with ripe pear, fig, spice, citrus and honeydew flavors that are broad and mouthfilling. Shows off a nice touch of hazelnut-scented oak, too, with a rich, concentrated aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 243 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Hawk Hill Vineyard
review: Well-oaked, rich and concentrated, with a creamy dill accent adding dimension to the ripe fig, apricot, vanilla and honey notes, finishing with a long, complex aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 290 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Hawk Hill Vineyard
review: A rich, full-bodied, wonderfully crafted wine, with complex creamy pear, light toasty oak, fig, melon and hazelnut flavors that turn elegant and polished on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 344 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Heintz Vineyard
review: Exhibits a complex mix of wet stone, honeysuckle, fig and smoky oak, gaining depth and dimension on the long, full finish. Drink now through 2014. 261 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Ferrington Vineyard
review: Pure and snappy, with tight, vivid raspberry, anise, spice and blueberry flavors, maintaining focus and gaining depth. Drink now through 2020. 726 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Ferrington Vineyard
review: Delicious, with ripe cherry and raspberry jam flavors that are rich and polished, deep and complex. Finishes with a long, intricate aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 392 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Ferrington Vineyard
review: Tight, young and tannic, with hints of floral, berry and dried cherry. Cellar into 1999.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Central Coast
review: Very rich, complex and concentrated, with earth, anise, wild berry, cherry and citrus notes. Acidity gives it a vibrant backbone, and the finish is intense and focused. Drink now through 2008. 976 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Ripe and flavorful, with layers of plum, cherry and wild berry; still tight, with enough tannin to merit cellaring.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Tasted from magnum. Dark, ripe and intense, with a citrus accent to the racy blackberry flavors. Would benefit from additional aging.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Offers a solid core of rich dark berry and raspberry that is firm and tight, easing up a little before ending with subtle rose petal and earthy notes. Drink now through 2021. 266 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Ripe and rich, with creamy oak and lots of plum, blackberry and cherry character, turning tannic and sophisticated. Best from 2000 through 2006. 805 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Already showing a touch of browning, but pretty, with exotic pickle barrel and slight vinegar notes folded in with the persistent currant and plum flavors. It all comes together nicely on the finish, where the tannins are close to resolving.--Pinot Noir Challenge. 863 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Allen Vineyard
review: Smoky and tarry, with a strong anise and herbal edge to the ripe cherry flavors. Best now through 2000.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Eastside Road Neighbors
review: This exhibits a mix of dense, rich raspberry and wild berry that evokes classic Russian River Valley Pinot, running deep and persistent on the long, full finish. Drink now through 2022. 881 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Flax Vineyard
review: Well-focused, tight and compact, with a rich mix of earthy currant, black cherry and wild berry fruit that's clean and refreshing, with a long, lingering aftertaste. Drink now through 2011. 700 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Riverblock Vineyard
review: Takes a while to develop, but once the core of cherry, berry and spice unfolds, it reveals more complexity and nuance, with hints of tea, cedar, anise and oak on the finish. Best into 1998.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rochioli Riverblock Vineyard
review: Fresh and snappy, with fresh, vibrant raspberry, plum, crushed rock and wilted rose, showing both firm structure and supple texture. Impressive length. Drink now through 2020. 479 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rochioli Riverblock Vineyard
review: A rich, creamy, delicate style, with vivid blackberry, tea, creamy oak and fresh earth and mineral flavors that reveal its nuances sip by sip, finishing with firm tannins and a smoky edge. Drink now through 2008. 520 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rochioli Vineyard
review: Boasts a complex, intriguing array of ripe plum, cherry, cola, spice and anise, not especially dense but distinctive and elegant, long on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 210 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rochioli Vineyard
review: Mature but holding, with a tarry, herb and earthy edge to the currant and plum flavors. Best soon.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Westside Road Neighbors
review: Assertively tannic and gutsy, with vanilla-laced oak, racy blackberry and wild berry flavors, pretty floral scents and a finish vibrant with crushed rock and graphite minerality. Best from 2015 through 2022. 904 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Westside Road Neighbors Twenty-Fifth Anniversary
review: Floral, lavender and rose petal scents are richer on the palate, with plum and black cherry flavors. Tight and compact, this provides a glimpse of what lies ahead on the finish, where the fruit joins the mineral and fresh earth scents. Drink now through 2011. 876 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir San Benito County Vista Verde Vineyard
review: Tight, with an herbal edge to the dusty berry, plum and black cherry flavor. Finishes with finely integrated tannins, excellent balance and a touch of anise. Drink now through 2008. 290 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir San Benito County Vista Verde Vineyard Twenty-Fifth Anniversary
review: Ripe and plump, with rich plum and black cherry flavors that are complex, elegant and well-integrated. Drink now through 2011. 672 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Spicy red cherry, plum and rose petal scents are delicate and elegant. Medium-bodied, with a touch of candied cherry. This ends as it begins—delicate and elegant—gaining nuance and finesse. Drink now through 2014. 1,308 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Trim, compact and delicate, with detailed cherry, mineral, sage, herb and plum flavors shaded by a hint of toasty oak on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 1,175 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Lots to admire in this smooth, broad-flavored red, with a tasty core of plum and raspberry, touches of cherry and spice, finishing with a stewed plum aftertaste. Lively acidity gives it excellent structure and a long finish. Drink now through 2008. 1,895 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Smooth and harmonious, with pretty tea and sage accents to the spice and cherry flavors.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Coastlands Vineyard
review: Intense, with firm acidity propping up the citrusy wild berry and black cherry flavors. Softens a bit on the finish, but given its vibrancy, it's best to cellar short-term. Drink now through 2007. 428 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Hirsch Vineyard
review: Tightly structured, through it quickly reveals remarkable depth and complexity, with firm tannins wrapped around a rich, earthy core of black cherry, plum, anise, mineral and spice. Finishes long and intense. Best to give it a year in the cellar. Best from 2002 through 2007. 598 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma County
review: A touch waxy, with dried cherry, spice and earth notes, but finishes with a long aftertaste. A blend of Rochioli and Iron Horse vineyards.--Williams Selyem vertical.

name: Pinot Noir Yorkville Highlands Weir Vineyard
review: A supple, graceful style, with pure and vivid notes of delicate plum, raspberry and black cherry, displaying fine depth and persistence. Drink now through 2019. 589 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yorkville Highlands Weir Vineyard
review: A mix of supple black cherry and blackberry fruit supported by firm tannins and lively acidity, it offers excellent structure and length, ending with a pleasant minerally, gravelly aftertaste. Drink now through 2009. 480 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Bacigalupi Vineyard
review: Focused and well-structured, but still briary at heart. Aromas of raspberry and fresh sage combine with zesty flavors of cherry, white pepper and grilled anise. Drink now through 2023. 278 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Bacigalupi Vineyard
review: Briary and well-structured, with blueberry and spicy oak aromas accenting jammy raspberry and licorice flavors, lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 188 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Bacigalupi Vineyard
review: Big, bold and ripe, displaying cherry pie and fresh anise aromas that lead to supple, layered and lingering flavors of black raspberry and toasty vanilla. Drink now through 2016. 225 cases made.

name: Adagio Virginia
review: Coffee and smoky notes frame the black cherry and herbal flavors in this expressive red. Features a savory character, supported by grippy tannins and balsamic acidity. Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2016.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Acte 12 of Sixteen Nineteen
review: Lean and lively, with a definite splash of oak aroma that slowly evolves toward grapefruit and apple on the finish. Nicely balanced. Drink now.

name: Adagio Virginia
review: Ambitiously toasty, but with a good core of plum sauce, blueberry and briar notes. A toasty edge then takes over on the finish. Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 123 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Acte 12 of Sixteen Nineteen
review: Bright, flinty style, with pippin apple and pear notes left unadorned by toast. Clean finish. Drink now. 1,509 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Reserve
review: Smooth and generous, with appealing vanilla-scented pear and peach flavors, turning soft and delicate on the finish, although the flavors linger nicely. Drink now.

name: Gabriel Archer Virginia
review: Soft but focused, with dark plum and warm currant sauce flavors laced with lightly firm tobacco and pepper notes. There's a nice fleshy edge on the finish. Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Drink now. 786 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Virginia Trianon
review: On the toasty side, but with solid plum, currant and tobacco notes as well. The fleshy finish lets the toast take over, but isn't hard-edged. Drink now. 494 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia John Adlum
review: Clean, with modest toast giving way to fresh apple and melon hints. Nice, crisp finish. Drink now. 2,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Reserve
review: Light-weight mix of stone fruit and floral notes, with a nice hint of peach pit on the finish. Drink now. 444 cases made.

name: Viognier Virginia
review: Broad, but with good definition to the lemon peel, grapefruit, apricot and floral notes. There's also a nice persistent finish. Drink now. 275 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Acte 12 of Sixteen Nineteen
review: Medium-weight, with peach and melon notes that have good depth and texture on the finish. Drink now. 1,696 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Reserve
review: Plump and friendly, with a buttery edge, but features good melon, peach and apple fruit for balance. Soft, round finish. Drink now. 462 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Reserve
review: A soft, buttery style, but restrained, with good yellow apple and pear flavors for balance. Nice length. Drink now. 395 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia John Adlum
review: Soft, with modest melon and butter notes and a clean, easy finish. Drink now. 3,090 cases made.

name: Riesling Virginia Dry Samuel Argall
review: On the lean side, with lemon peel and floral notes followed by a zesty finish. Drink now. 914 cases made.

name: Vidal Blanc Virginia Late Harvest Dominion Wine Cellars
review: Aromas and flavors of orange peel and spice make this interesting. Balanced and straightforward, with a clean finish. Drink now. 420 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Acte 12 of 1619
review: Soft and forward, relying on a buttery edge to carry its modest melon and almond notes. Drink now. 725 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Acte 12 of Sixteen Nineteen
review: Mature and mellow, displaying soft, buttery pear and fig notes, lively acidity and balance. Sandalwood and vanilla accents linger on the finish. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Glebe Vineyard
review: Big, bold and in your face, with plenty of butter, clove, nutmeg and peach character. All up-front, with a broad structure, it finishes short. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Reserve
review: Straightforward, in a rich, buttery style, this Chardonnay delivers pineapple and nutmeg flavors that give way to oaky notes on the finish. Drink now.

name: Vidal Virginia Late Harvest
review: Glazed tangerine and orange flavors are backed by butter and maple notes. Starts well, but is a touch cloying on the finish. Drink now. 73 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Ratcliffe Vineyard
review: Vanilla and apple flavors are pleasant but a bit candied in this straightforward, silky white. Finishes clean. 165 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Reserve
review: Thick, mature and overblown. Has buttery, oaky aromas and flavors but not much fruit. Drinkable, but simple. 650 cases made.

name: Two Shilling Red Virginia
review: This medium-bodied red has a juicy aroma and sweet cherry and fruit flavors. Finishes on a cinnamon note. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Acte 12 of Sixteen Nineteen
review: A flavorful but extreme Chardonnay that emphasizes nutty, oaky, earthy flavors over fruit. Heavy. 5,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Acte 12 of Sixteen Nineteen
review: Floral aromas are distinctive, but the cooked apple flavors are sweet and rather cloying in this thick white. 989 cases made.

name: Plantation Blush Virginia
review: Odd-colored, more orange than pink, but shows conventional "blush" flavors of cherry and strawberry, both quite sweet and crisply tart. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Virginia Reserve
review: A mix of menthol and rhubarb, with a slightly tart, tomato finish. 870 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia John Adlum
review: Rich and extroverted, but odd flavors. Has strong nut and butterscotch aromas and a thick texture, but only earthy, funky flavors. 4,900 cases made.

name: Gabriel Archer Reserve Virginia
review: This soft red shows light plum and rather vegetal flavors. Rustic and a bit dull. 599 cases made.

name: Governor's White Virginia
review: A bit muddled, with a mix of sweet apple and apricot flavors. 25,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Reserve
review: Has odd, tanky, matchstick aromas. Dull and dilute on the palate and finish. 915 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia John Adlum
review: Rich in texture but lacking in fruit flavor, this has an odd floral and earthy character. 4,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Snake River Valley
review: Polished and expressive, with juicy dark berry, bittersweet chocolate and floral character that glides over fine tannins and extends into a generous finish, lingering with finesse. Drink now through 2017. 195 cases made.

name: Riesling Snake River Valley Dry
review: Soft and slightly sweet, with pretty pear and spice flavors that linger on the light finish. Drink now. 94 cases made.

name: Riesling New Mexico D'oré
review: Off-dry style, with some pine and floral hints, and a candied lemon peel note on the finish. Drink now.

name: Mélange New Mexico White
review: Clean and crisp, with very faint lime flavor that fades quickly on the finish. Verging on neutral. Sauvignon Blanc and Malvasia. 950 cases made.

name: Quatro Private Reserve New Mexico
review: Dried out, with roasted tomato flavor and an astringent finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Syrah. Past its prime. 134 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Leelanau Peninsula Reserve
review: Moderate green apple and lemon notes. Slightly tart finish. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Leelanau Peninsula
review: Candied ginger nose, turning dull and sugary on the palate. Feels flat. This was the better of two bottles. 110 cases made.

name: Shiraz Geographe The Black Dog
review: Ripe and juicy, a tangy Shiraz with lively blackberry, currant and white pepper flavors, showing plenty of intensity and depth, finishing firm. Best from 2004 through 2010. 1,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Western Australia The Dog
review: Supple, open in texture, with lots of pretty blueberry, plum and currant fruit up front, shaded with licorice and black pepper as the finish persists impressively. Drink now through 2012. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Geographe
review: Supple and generous, with black cherry and dried currant flavors that linger on the dark finish, hinting at cocoa and pepper as the fruit echoes. Drink now through 2008. 1,200 cases made.

name: Shiraz Geographe
review: Smooth, refined and lithe, with chocolate-scented blackberry and herb flavors. Drink now through 2005. 1,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon Geographe
review: Earthy and green, but lively enough to keep it zingy. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula Tulum
review: Bright and tangy, with juicy apple, lime and apricot aromas and flavors that linger on the finish, along with a nice touch of spicy oak. Drink now through 2006. 800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula Tulum
review: Bright and lively, with jazzy pear, lime and mineral flavors on a polished frame. Drink now through 2005. 700 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula
review: Generous, beautifully proportioned and velvety, brimming with dark berry, coffee and licorice flavors that keep echoing through the long, elegant finish. Drink now through 2007. 2,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Mornington Peninsula
review: Bright and juicy, brimming with citrus, white peach and delicate herb flavors, which also echo beautifully on the lean-textured finish. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula Unoaked
review: Crisp, tangy style offers a nice range of lemon, melon and floral flavors, which persist into a finish balanced by lively acidity. Drink now. 4,550 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Rich and intense yet elegant, with plenty of ripe, exotic pineapple, citrus and honey notes and a gentle oak texture. Elegant, long and juicy on the finish. An excellent value. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula Unoaked
review: Bright, zingy style focuses on lime, apple and floral flavors, finishing light in texture and ebullient in flavor. Drink now. 3,800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Mornington Peninsula
review: Light and crisp, with modest citrus and mineral aromas and flavors, finishing with a touch of herb. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mornington Peninsula
review: A lighter style of Cabernet, as expected from this cool region, but with no excessive herbal character to mar the sweet currant and berry fruit. Picks up a hint of cedar on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 2,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula
review: Very light, with a candied edge to the raspberry and floral flavors, which linger nicely. Drink now. 1,350 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: This is a wine for Riesling lovers, with peach and floral aromas and a touch of the pine resin flavor that characterizes good Riesling. A balanced, harmonious wine. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa-Alexander Valleys
review: Doesn't disappoint. A full-flavored, broad-textured wine, with plenty of plum and cherry aromas, more modest flavors and moderate tannins. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula Tulum
review: Soft, even a bit flabby, awkwardly balanced with tangy acidity, creating a strange, sweet-sour sensation. 750 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Very ripe style with fresh berry and cherry flavors but there's also a slight cough syrup flavor that detracts from the flavor and overall quality.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley
review: Ripe, plush and generous, with plum, blackberry and currant flavors. A thread of acidity runs through the flavors and keeps them lively and makes them persist impressively through the fine-grained finish. Spicy oak notes weave through the aftertaste. Drink now through 2005. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Yakima Valley
review: Soft, succulent and inviting, with ripe pear and floral flavors, lingering gently. Drink now. 1,050 cases made.

name: Riesling Yakima Valley
review: Lightly sweet, with pear and apricot flavors on an open-weave texture, finishing with refinement. Drink now. 2,700 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Yakima Valley
review: Bright and polished, offering pretty pear, almond and almond flower flavors on a sleek frame, lingering well. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Yakima Valley
review: Sleek and refreshing, with lively grapefruit and green guava flavors set on a polished frame. Drink now. 473 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Yakima Valley
review: Light and tangy, with greengage plum and lime flavors on a zippy frame. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Yakima Valley
review: Soft and quiet, with modest pear and floral flavors, finishing lightly sweet. Drink now. 1,502 cases made.

name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine Il Vigneto
review: The sweetness is balanced by a tart acidity, giving this beeswax-, honey- and citrus-flavored dessert white a racy feel. Fine, tangy finish. Think fresh fruit tarts. Drink now through 2012. 800 cases made.

name: Vidal Blanc Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Racy, with butterscotch, apricot and honey aromas and flavors that etch on the palate. Good concentration and length. Try with a fruit tart. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2002. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Niagara Peninsula Reserve
review: Seductive aromas of spicy cherry introduce a silky, cherry- and berry-flavored red that has chewy concentration, purity and firm structure. Maybe a bit too firm on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2000.

name: Chardonnay Niagara Peninsula Beamsville Bench Reserve
review: Broad and appealing, this white offers baked apple, spice and earth flavors on a medium-bodied framework. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Niagara Peninsula Reserve
review: Vanilla and clove notes accent an apple flavor in this spicy white. It starts well, losing intensity midpalate before a toasty note returns on the finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Niagara Peninsula Sur Lie
review: An unoaked style, combining melon, gooseberry and wax notes in a medium-bodied frame. It's a bit short on the finish, yet enjoyable. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Niagara Peninsula
review: A straightforward, fruity red, with a touch of acetone aroma marking the berry fruit. 350 cases made.

name: Merlot Niagara Peninsula
review: Laced with herb and olive notes, this light red tastes underripe, with a spicy accent on the finish. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Niagara Peninsula Reserve
review: There's decent black cherry and chocolate notes, but strong diesel and earth aromas and flavors dominate and the finish is dry. Not imported into the U.S.

name: Chardonnay Niagara Peninsula Reserve
review: This has seen better days. Smells smoky, and the oak has taken over the fruit. Not imported into the U.S. Past its prime. 750 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley
review: Ripe and velvety, a glowing core of ripe plum and spice flavors lingering on and on as the finish sails on a sea of fine tannins. Has impressive purity of fruit and style, the sweet, ripe flavors seductive to the end. Best from 2007 through 2020. 64 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley
review: Round, rich, polished and distinctive for its smoky plum and dried cherry flavors that tumble over the palate with intensity but no roughness or edginess. A welcoming wine, harmonious and balanced, but it seems poised to develop a lot more as it ages. Drink now through 2020. 64 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley
review: This has real presence, offering ripe aromas and focused blueberry, plum and hints of coffee on the palate. The flavors sail over superfine tannins through a long, generous finish. Drink now through 2015. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley
review: Ripe and generous, shining a bright beam of blackberry, anise and pepper flavors through a layer of very fine tannins. Finishes plump and round. Drink now through 2007. 2,300 cases made.

name: Sémillon Barossa Valley
review: Broad in texture, with zingy acidity to balance the creamy, lanolin-accented pear and citrus flavors. Drink now through 2012. 200 cases made.

name: Sémillon Barossa Valley
review: Dry, tangy and harmonious, a nice mouthful of lime-scented apple and citrus leaf flavors, finishing with pizzazz. Drink now through 2007. 128 cases imported.

name: Sémillon Barossa Valley
review: Soft and juicy, a broad-textured wine, with distinctive melon, pear and dry grass aromas and flavors, keeping a rich feel through the finish. Drink now through 2005. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sémillon Barossa Valley
review: A soft, aromatic style, showing the distinctive lanolin note of aged Sémillon, with green pepper and fig flavors that last on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Barossa Valley
review: Mint and earth dominate the berry flavors in this firm-textured red, framing the flavors with chewy tannins on the finish. Best after 2003. 1,500 cases made.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale The Hundred
review: Dark and peppery, oozing with blackberry, licorice and spice flavors on a sleek frame. Supple in texture, lingering against refined tannins. Drink now through 2020. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Broad and generous, with a peach note running through the dark berry and black plum flavors, playing against refined tannins as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2020. 1,200 cases made.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale
review: This red is lithe, supple and appealing, offering blueberry, white pepper and floral flavors that hint at guava on the long and expressive finish. Drink now through 2021. 900 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Polished and expressive, with an appealing red berry glint to the mix of blueberry and spice flavors, finishing gently but persistently. Drink now through 2018. 600 cases imported.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale The Tithing
review: Sleek and polished, with black cherry and blackberry flavors climbing aboard a racy structure that lifts the finish with lively acidity, offset by a bit of heat from alcohol. Shows the potential to develop in bottle. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Viognier McLaren Vale
review: Tight and focused, with a spicy note prominent among the blueberry and dried apricot flavors, coming together harmoniously. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases imported.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale
review: Sleek, juicy and light-footed, offering strawberry and spice flavors that linger pleasantly. Drink now. 450 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Viognier McLaren Vale
review: Firm tannins underlie the soft-textured, tobacco-scented currant and loamy earth flavors. Finishes gently. Best after 2015. 1,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Frankstein
review: This beautiful expression of Riesling exudes the ripeness of the '96 vintage in its quince, spice and passion fruit flavors, backed by a tender structure. A nice creaminess midpalate adds depth. Drink now through 2004. 350 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace
review: A dry Riesling, with a layer of spice and licorice accenting the mineral, grapefruit and juicy apple notes. Shows nice balance between the crisp acidity and pure fruit flavors. Drink now through 2013. 30,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Muenchberg
review: An aromatic white, with a pine note accenting the Gala apple, clementine and lemon curd flavors. There's subtle, juicy acidity and a modest finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Cuvée Guillaume
review: Extremely ripe, showing pear, apricot and violet married to a soft framework that dissipates on the finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Tradition
review: Dry and tangy, with Gala apple, kumquat and yellow plum fruit, showing hints of ground spice and stone. Modest finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Réserve Spéciale
review: Rich and vibrant, this is full of forward apricot and quince flavors, turning firm; still tight on the finish. Drink now through 2001. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Réserve
review: Crisp and balanced, offering almond, pine forest and mineral aromas and flavors. Firm and steely, with a lemon finish. Drink now through 2003. 700 cases made.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace
review: Ripe fruit cocktail aromas and flavors are married to a bright structure. Picks up some almond and beeswax accents, with a firm, slightly austere finish. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Réserve
review: Modest litchi and apricot flavors are diffuse, despite the lush texture. Finishes short. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Melange Yakima Valley
review: Ripe and generous, a powerful mouthful of blackberry, currant, herb and a touch of exotic spices making this an attention-grabber. Has richness and extra dimensions of flavor that need time to evolve. Cabernet Sauvignon with 4 percent Merlot. Best from 2000 through 2005. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Corral Creek Vineyard
review: Ripe, exotic style weaves threads of chocolate, coffee and Oriental spices through the cherry and black currant flavors on a supple frame. Has the length, intensity and polished tannins to warrant cellaring. Best from 2003 through 2008. 84 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Spring Valley Vineyards
review: Crisp, almost bracing style has flavors that emphasize minty-herbal notes around a core of dark cherry and licorice. It's exotic, and the flavors persist through the velvety finish. Drink now through 2008. 181 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley KIipsun Vineyards
review: Firm, chewy style has a solid core of black cherry and black pepper flavor, hinting at mint and herbs on the solid finish. Has tannins to lose. Best after 2002. 279 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Klipsun Vineyard
review: Bright and flavorful, featuring zingy blackberry and herb notes, tannins closing down on the finish. Give it until 1997 or 1998. 200 cases made.

name: Malbec Yakima Valley Crawford Vineyard
review: Crinkly tannins hardly get in the way of the bright raspberry and floral flavors, which dance deftly through the lively finish. Drink now through 2016. 184 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley Klipsun Vineyard
review: Bright and pretty, with lively blackberry, blueberry and bayleaf aromas and flavors, and a fine layer of tannin on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 289 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley Klipsun Vineyard
review: Bright in flavor, firm in texture, with lovely blackberry, currant and chocolate notes persisting impressively on the finish. Approachable now, but the tannins will benefit from cellaring. Best after 2000. 75 cases made.

name: Syrah-Mourvèdre Naches Heights Wilridge Vineyard
review: Taut, juicy and savory, with spicy, woodsy overtones to the dark berry flavors at the core, this red has presence, lingering well against fine tannins. Drink now through 2019. 135 cases made.

name: Viognier Yakima Valley Rosebud Vineyard
review: Polished, with orange and violet overtones to the pear and cream flavors. Lingers pleasantly. Drink now. 366 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Klipsun Vineyard
review: Firm and focused, showing a bright beam of red cherry, raspberry and spice flavor that lingers on the velvety finish. Best now. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Klipsun Vineyard
review: Intensely grapey, but also intensely gravel-like in flavor, with a strong minty edge to the ripe currant and black cherry flavors. Has lots of personality, not all of it immediately likeable. Try in 2000. 200 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley Klipsun Vineyard
review: Crisp in texture but exotic in flavor, with an array of spice notes to season the focused blackberry flavors. It's all packed in there, waiting for time to smooth it out. Try in 1999. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Yakima Valley Crawford Vineyard
review: Lively and refreshing, with a silky texture surrounding the pear, almond and citrus flavors. Drink now. 374 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Crawford Vineyard
review: Ripe and generous, a mouthful of black cherry, pepper and spice on a smooth texture; immensely appealing but a little soft around the edges. Tempting to drink now, while the fruit is fresh. 150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Klipsun Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, bright in flavor, featuring pretty berry and plum notes around a spicy core. Has more up-front than on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 233 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Klipsun Vineyard
review: Earthy, gamy notes slide in among the ripe currant and herb flavors, making this distinctive if not to every taste. Best from 2000 through 2004. 135 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Klipsun Vineyard
review: Smooth and generous, playing out its plum and currant flavors over a supple frame. Tasty now, but it doesn't feel like an ager. 200 cases made.

name: Merlot Walla Walla Valley Spring Valley Vineyards
review: Firm in texture, with fine-grained blackberry and currant flavors that echo nicely on the balanced, harmonious finish. Drink now through 2004. 177 cases made.

name: Nebbiolo Red Mountain Klipsun Vineyard
review: Light in color but robust in flavor, with nice berry and tar flavors and fine texture that are reminiscent of Nebbiolo d'Alba. Drink now through 2004. 226 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Elephant Mountain Vineyard
review: Firm, aromatic with berry and floral character, gaining a cedary, coffee bean edge on the narrow finish. Best after 2006. 214 cases made.

name: Melange Columbia Valley
review: Earthy, gamy notes spin through this crisp, angular red, offering tomato and meaty flavors that linger on the firm finish. Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2007. 240 cases made.

name: Merlot Red Mountain Klipsun Vineyards
review: Rich, almost thick in texture, with a gamy note running through the anise-scented black fruit flavors. Best after 2003. 224 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley Crawford Vineyard
review: Grapey, herbal flavors dominate this open-textured, appealingly generous wine. Ready now. 200 cases made.

name: Merlot-Cabernet Franc-Cabernet Columbia Valley Melange
review: Youthful and lively, raw in texture, with sturdy berry and herb flavors that pick up a pleasantly earthy note on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 177 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Klipsun Vineyard
review: Youthful, exuberant fruit flavors in a raw texture. Showing as many floral and stalky notes as fruit flavors at this stage. Give it until 1998. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Red Mountain Klipsun Vineyards
review: Firm in texture, with gamy flavors that compete strongly against the red cherry and cedar character. Best after 2008. 265 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Corral Creek Vineyard
review: Supple and spicy, with coffee notes around the soft core of cherry and mint flavors. Drink now. 193 cases made.

name: Vintage Estate Red Dessert Wine Columbia Valley
review: Bitter almond and cherry flavors rise up from this moderately sweet, dessert-style wine. Not as heavy or alcoholic as most Port. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz, Tinta Cao and Souzao. Drink now. 92 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Crawford Vineyard
review: Grapey, minty flavors dominate up front, turning earthy and chewy on the finish. Best from 2000. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Klipsun Vineyard
review: Gamy, spicy, herbal and other exotic flavors make this an acquired taste, but it hangs on with supple structure and a certain generosity. May be too weird for some. Drink now through 2004. 138 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Crawford Vineyard
review: Good texture and balance, but some wild, fruity flavors, reminiscent of Concord grapes, make this an odd duck. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Crawford Vineyard
review: This odd combination of grapey and floral flavors is unusual for Cabernet. It's strange, but certainly drinkable. 200 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Klipsun Vineyard
review: Has a wild, floral, almost soapy flavor that obscures the otherwise pretty Merlot flavors. Seems off-kilter now, although it may improve by 2001 to 2003. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Rattlesnake Hills Elephant Mountain Vineyard
review: Earthy, gamy flavors overshadow the fruit.   178 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Lodmell Vineyards
review: Gamy, earthy flavors predominate.   184 cases made.

name: Nebbiolo Red Mountain Klipsun Vineyards
review: Way too tannic and acidic. 140 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Corral Creek Vineyard
review: Light, earthy, almost dirty-tasting, with sour notes on the finish. 211 cases made.

name: Riesling Clare Valley Polish Hill River
review: This lively, distinctive Riesling has grapefruit, nectarine and mineral flavors that persist into a juicy, generous, dry finish. A stylish wine with amazing intensity and deftness. Drink now through 2012. 2,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Diane's Reserve
review: Loaded with rich, jammy fruit, carried by an underlying structure. Aromas of baked cherry and toasted spice lead to lively flavors of raspberry, licorice and smoky cracked pepper. Drink now through 2018. 124 cases made.

name: Riesling Clare Valley Polish Hill River
review: Dry and open-textured, emphasizing fruit, tasting of apple, quince and a touch of cashew, lingering effortlessly. Has a great future ahead of it. Drink now through 2010. 600 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Carl's
review: Big, ripe and zesty, with bold cherry pie and licorice aromas and vibrant wild berry, cassis and cracked pepper flavors that finish on a lively, sweet note. Drink now through 2016. 596 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Ken's Reserve
review: This ripe, zesty red displays black cherry and cracked pepper aromas, following through to rich, supple flavors of black raspberry, mocha and licorice. Drink now through 2017. 124 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Nolan
review: Vibrant and zesty, with bold huckleberry pie aromas and appealingly briary black cherry and smoky sage flavors. Drink now through 2017. 190 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Sawyer Vineyard
review: Laserlike in focus, with black cherry and sage aromas and concentrated yet ripe plum, pepper, licorice and mineral flavors that take on depth at the end. Best from 2009 through 2011. 1,400 cases made.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Polish Hill River
review: Crisp in structure, with peppery blackberry and juicy cherry flavors that persist through the supple finish, firming up with fine tannins as it all echoes. Drink now through 2008. 100 cases imported.

name: Red Dry Creek Valley
review: Zesty and sleek, with cherry and spicy red pepper aromas that lead to appealingly juicy and supple black raspberry, cracked pepper, caramel and toasty sage flavors. Zinfandel, Petite Sirah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2015. 330 cases made.

name: Syrah Dry Creek Valley Dorothy's Vineyard
review: Firm, intense and spicy, this is tightly wound and distinct for its dried ripe blackberry, mineral, sage and underbrush notes that end with dry, zesty tannins that give the flavors traction. Drink now through 2018. 350 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Alexander Valley Bramble Creek
review: Rich and jammy, showing under-lying good structure. Aromas of black cherry and toasty caramel lead to succulent, ripe flavors of plum jam, anise and sage. Drink now through 2017. 298 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Carl's Reserve
review: Zesty and appealingly briary, with smoky sage and wild berry aromas and layered flavors of huckleberry, toasty licorice and freshly cracked pepper. Tannins kick in on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 180 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Carl's Vineyard
review: Zesty and loaded with personality, offering briary and smoky berry aromas and ripe huckleberry, white pepper and bacon flavors that are wrapped in lively tannins. Drink now through 2014. 571 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Ken's Reserve
review: Zesty and vibrant, with plum and toasty dill aromas and ripe but complex black cherry, smoky sage and pepper flavors. Drink now through 2014. 120 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Molly's
review: Bold, ripe and well done for the style, offering jammy black raspberry and toasted spice aromas and focused, zesty blackberry and smoky anise flavors. Drink now through 2024. 373 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Molly's Vineyard
review: Ripe and zesty, with plum and smoked meat aromas and plush black raspberry, licorice and dried sage flavors that finish with briary tannins. Drink now through 2015. 489 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Carl's
review: For those who like them jammy and superripe, this offers aromas of blackberry jam, licorice and white pepper that lead to zesty flavors of baked cherry and jalapeño. Drink now through 2021. 459 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Diane's Reserve
review: Brooding and ripe, featuring blueberry and tar aromas, with concentrated flavors of plum, smoky sage and cracked white pepper. Drink now through 2015. 117 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Molly's
review: Jammy and plump, with blackberry and semisweet chocolate aromas and ripe, racy flavors of raspberry, grilled anise and pepper. Drink now through 2024. 542 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Molly's
review: This is quite ripe and jammy, loaded with cinnamon and raspberry fruit, accented by toasted anise, sage and pepper details. Drink now through 2018. 620 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Molly's
review: Sleek and jammy, offering wild berry and caramel aromas, with focused, ripe raspberry, toasty sage and anise flavors. Drink now through 2018. 471 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Molly's Reserve
review: Briary and jammy, with a core of succulent black raspberry fruit and appealing notes of licorice, underbrush and black pepper. Drink now through 2018. 124 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Molly's Vineyard
review: Ripe, jammy and zesty, with cherry pie aromas as well as notes of lush, layered plum, licorice and toasty vanilla. Drink now through 2014. 620 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Reserve
review: Big, ripe and burly, this wins you over with sheer chutzpah. Shows aromas of wild berry and cracked pepper beef, with jammy, layered black cherry, licorice and toasted sage flavors. Drink now through 2011. 600 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Sawyer Reserve
review: Ultraripe and jammy, but luscious, with smoky black cherry aromas and soft blackberry cobbler and spicy licorice flavors. Drink now through 2015. 190 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Sawyer Vineyard
review: Supple and jammy, offering cherry pie and licorice aromas and ripe wild berry, cinnamon and cracked pepper flavors. Drink now through 2015. 440 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Sydney
review: Ripe and loaded with jam, this delivers aromas of baked cherry and smoky spice, which lead to bold and zesty raspberry and jalapeño notes. Finishes with some briary heat. Drink now through 2016. 540 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Rockpile The Guest
review: Bold and ripe, with baked cherry and smoky sage aromas and zesty raspberry and anise flavors that finish with lively tannins and a touch of heat. Drink now through 2014. 220 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley Polish Hill River
review: Ripe and round, with a tangy bite of acidity and peppery herb notes running through the ripe currant and cherry flavors, lingering on the finish. Best from 2006 through 2012. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Polish Hill River Gallery Series
review: Ripe, complex style weaves earthy, cedary and gamy notes through the blackberry, black plum and mint flavors. This one has an aristocratic feel, and echoes the flavors on the finish. Best from 2002 through 2010. 2,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Polish Hill River
review: On the crisp side, generous with its pomegranate-scented berry and cherry flavors, finishing with a cedary edge. Best from 2005 through 2010. 800 cases made.

name: Wilson Family Dry Creek Valley
review: Zesty and appealingly ripe, with cherry pie aromas and lively raspberry, caramel and walnut flavors. Zinfandel, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2016. 447 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Not shy in terms of ripeness, with zesty and jammy flavors of raspberry, grilled anise and spice. Drink now through 2018. 496 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Ripe and juicy, offering smoky cherry aromas leading to zesty raspberry, cracked pepper and sage flavors. Finishes with slightly rustic tannins. Drink now through 2016. 1,017 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Buzz
review: This ripe and jammy version packs in flavors of baked cherry, black licorice and smoky bacon. Drink now through 2022. 385 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Carl's Reserve
review: For fans of jammy and ripe Zins. Aromas of raspberry jam and toast lead to zesty black cherry, caramel and spice flavors. Drink now through 2017. 124 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Carl's Reserve
review: Jammed with cracked pepper and baked cherry aromas, which lead to ripe, racy flavors of jammy plum, smoky sage and dill. Drink now through 2015. 120 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Carl's Vineyard
review: Ripe, dense and jammy, showing cherry pie and licorice aromas and racy plum, roasted rosemary and cracked pepper flavors. Drink now through 2015. 540 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Carl's Vineyard
review: A bruiser that's all power and no finesse, with bold plum and spice aromas, an inky color and concentrated blueberry, smoky sage and licorice flavors. Best from 2010 through 2015. 1,184 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Diane's Reserve
review: Jammy and superripe, this is a wine you'll either love or hate. Loaded with personality, this offers smoky black cherry aromas and rich flavors of baked berry cobbler and spice. Drink now through 2016. 124 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Diane's Reserve
review: Very ripe and jammy, with baked cherry and sage aromas and racy framboise and cracked pepper flavors. Nicely done for the style. Drink now through 2014. 120 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Diane's Reserve
review: Briary and superripe—a style some will enjoy—with roasted sage and boysenberry aromas and jammy, well-structured wild berry and peppered beef flavors. Heat and tannins grip the finish. Drink now through 2013. 201 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Ellie's Old Vine
review: Ripe and appealingly rustic, with baked cherry aromas and zesty flavors of wild berry and smoked pepper. Drink now through 2015. 596 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Ellie's Old Vine
review: Sleek, ripe and jammy, with cherry pie aromas and zesty raspberry, vanilla and licorice flavors. Drink now through 2014. 380 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Ellie's Old Vine
review: Ripe and zesty, with smoky wild berry, licorice and cracked pepper aromas and briary, cooked cherry flavors. Drink now through 2015. 570 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Ken's Reserve
review: For fans of racy, ultraripe Zinfandels, this offers baked berry and toasty vanilla aromas, with jammy black cherry and spicy caramel flavors. Drink now through 2018. 99 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Molly's Vineyard
review: Briary and very ripe, with aromas of wild berry and smoky sage and complex flavors of black cherry, licorice and cracked pepper that finish with heat. Drink now through 2013. 302 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Rockpile Reserve
review: Plump and soft, loaded with jammy raspberry and toasted spice flavors. Drink now. 361 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Sawyer
review: Ripe and jammy, with smoky baked cherry aromas following through to zesty raspberry, toasted anise and sage flavors, which carry some heat on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 620 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Sawyer Vineyard
review: Sleek and zesty raspberry, spice and cola aromas and lively boysenberry, dill and mineral flavors that linger on the slightly rustic finish. Drink now through 2014. 950 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Sydney
review: Ripe and zesty, with appealing baked raspberry and caramel aromas and jammy flavors of cherry, herb and tobacco. Drink now through 2018. 372 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Tori Vineyard
review: Aromas of smoky, ripe plum and licorice open to dried cherry, caramel and pepper flavors that finish with briary tannins. Drink now through 2013. 361 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Cypress Ridge
review: Plump and ripe, with soft, easygoing berry cobbler and toasted spice notes. Drink now through 2021. 507 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: Zesty and ripe, with cherry pie and roasted anise aromas, featuring raspberry, blueberry and charred oak flavors that finish with herb-tinged tannins. Drink now through 2018. 943 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Alexander Valley Bramble
review: Quite ripe and appealingly briary, with notes of baked cherry, black licorice and toasted sage. Drink now through 2017. 347 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Burly and ripe, with plump notes of baked raspberry and caramel. Drink now through 2019. 400 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Superripe, with aromas of baked black cherry and flavors of lush cassis, licorice and cracked pepper. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Buzz
review: Zesty and ripe, with dried cherry, anise and toasted sage flavors. Drink now through 2018. 347 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Carl's Reserve
review: Ripe and zesty, with berry pie aromas leading to flavors of plush black cherry and cracked pepper. Drink now through 2016. 124 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Carl's Vineyard
review: Ripe but focused, with wild berry and cracked pepper aromas and plum and smoky sage flavors that have tight tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2011. 780 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Ken's Reserve
review: Ripe and brawny, offering smoky plum and cracked pepper aromas, with zesty wild berry, sage and licorice flavors. Tannins turn a bit rustic and drying. Drink now through 2014. 120 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Molly's
review: Bold aromas of cracked black pepper and baked cherry combine with soft, ripe flavors of raspberry and smoky herb. Drink now through 2020. 620 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Molly's Reserve
review: Ripe and zesty, with dried cherry and baked raspberry flavors that finish with smoky pepper notes. Drink now through 2018. 174 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Molly's Reserve
review: Zesty and ripe, with wild berry and smoke aromas and racy baked cherry and cracked pepper flavors. Drink now through 2014. 120 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Reserve
review: Appealing for its briary and ripe wild berry flavors, plus smoky sage, underbrush and white pepper notes. Drink now through 2015. 190 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Sawyer Reserve
review: Ripe and zesty, with cherry and spicy raspberry aromas and concentrated plum, smoky licorice and black pepper flavors. Drink now through 2016. 90 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Tori
review: Ripe raspberry and toasty caramel aromas lead to focused flavors of cherry, mineral and fresh herb. Drink now through 2017. 546 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Tori
review: Big and superripe, with baked cherry pie, smoky sage and spice notes. Drink now through 2016. 521 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Tori's Reserve
review: Gutsy and ripe, featuring huckleberry and loamy pepper aromas, with cooked cherry and licorice flavors. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Cypress Ridge
review: Blends ripe cherry fruit with strong notes of mineral and green herb, plus accents of anise, tobacco and pepper. Drink now through 2017. 496 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Ricci Vineyard
review: Smoky, with toasty oak and firm tannins framing plum, wild berry, anise and chocolate flavors. Drink now through 2005. 350 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Reserve
review: Zesty, with appealing notes of raspberry, cinnamon and spicy cedar. Briary tannins show on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 372 cases made.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Polish Hill River
review: Polished and ripe, with a definite licorice note weaving through the soft texture and the plum and berry flavors. Drink now through 2009. 500 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Dry Creek Valley Ellie's Vineyard
review: Wonderful wild berry and spice flavors are tasty, with elegant cedar and bay leaf aromatics, solid structure and good intensity. The tannins are firm and balanced. Drink now through 2012. 330 cases made.

name: Syrah Dry Creek Valley Dorothy's Vineyard
review: Good intensity to the dark plum and black cherry flavors, with firm tannins, spice, tobacco and cedar notes, and a hint of bittersweet chocolate on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 160 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Buzz
review: Ripe and jammy, with soft flavors of raspberry, smoked pepper and sage. Drink now through 2017. 298 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Diane's Reserve
review: This pushes the ripeness envelope, but that's part of its charm. High-toned blackberry, cracked pepper and walnut aromas lead to rustic cherry and licorice flavors, with dry tannins. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Heartland
review: Big, burly and superripe, with baked and dried cherry notes and accents of licorice, dried herb and white pepper. Drink now through 2018. 273 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Molly's
review: Rustic and briary, with baked cherry and stewed plum notes and flavors of underbrush and anise. Drink now through 2016. 670 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Reserve
review: Focused but lean in structure, showing dried cherry and roasted cedar aromas, with zesty but intensely ripe flavors of plum, licorice and spice, ending with rustic tannins. Drink now through 2010. 439 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Sawyer Reserve
review: Offers smoky black cherry aromas and ripe raspberry and briary sage flavors. Drink now through 2015. 124 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Sawyer Vineyard
review: Ultraripe and a bit untamed, with baked cherry and spice aromas that lead to zesty cassis and cracked pepper beef flavors, ending with briary tannins. Drink now. 571 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Tori Vineyard
review: Ripe and a rather raisiny, with dried cherry and smoky spice aromas and plum, toasty dill and cedar flavors. Drink now through 2012. 1,014 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Tori Vineyard
review: Rich, briary wild berry and spice aromas lead to concentrated, ripe plum, sage and anise flavors that take on dry, chewy tannins on the finish. Best from 2009 through 2011. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley Polish Hill River
review: On the tart side, with red pepper and herb-scented berry flavors that linger on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2009. 400 cases made.

name: Primitivo Alexander Valley McClain
review: Soft and a touch spicy, with notes of cinnamon and herb. Drink now through 2017. 298 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Carl's
review: Ripe dried cherry flavors meet modest notes of herb, mineral and anise. Drink now through 2017. 447 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Carl's
review: Offers ripe and herbal elements, with flavors that show moderate plum and spice accents. Drink now through 2016. 620 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Ellie's New Vine
review: Offers in-your-face ripeness backed by some heat from alcohol, plus notes of dried cherry and toasted anise. Drink now. 347 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Forchini Old Vine
review: Zesty and distinctly ripe, with notes of black cherry jam, caramel and burnt toast. Drink now. 496 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Heartland
review: Ultraripe and soft, with modest raspberry and briary spice notes. Drink now. 372 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Nolan
review: A tasty, juicy quaff, with notes of raspberry and peppery cinnamon. Drink now through 2017. 471 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Nolan
review: Zesty, with flavors of raspberry, herb and spice. Drink now. 223 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Reserve
review: Ripe and fleshy, with muted fruit and accents of raspberry, cedar and herb. Drink now through 2017. 370 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Tori's Reserve
review: Briary and a bit rustic, with modest cherry, sage and cracked pepper flavors. Drink now through 2015. 99 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Ellie's Vineyard Old Vine
review: Offers smoky and spicy aromas and leathery black cherry and licorice flavors that turn lean and earthy on the finish. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Forchini Reserve
review: Intensely ripe, with flavors of prune, pepper and licorice that finish with dry, rustic tannins. Drink now through 2020. 189 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Molly's Reserve
review: Superripe and rather disjointed, with baked cherry and spice notes. Drink now. 124 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Tori
review: Offers zesty but moderate cherry, herb and spice flavors. Drink now. 695 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Buzz
review: Big, ripe and rather overwrought, offering notes of baked berry, dried cherry and spice. A wine that earns its name. Drink now. 496 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Reserve
review: Gobs of macaroon, strawberry jam and vanilla syrup flavors are nearly overwhelming, missing structure. Drink now. 270 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Sydney Reserve
review: Ripe and off-balance, with distinctive prune, herb and spice flavors. Drink now. 99 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Tori Vineyard
review: Smoky and extremely herbal, with sweet and sour cherry fruit. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 540 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Tori's Reserve
review: Zesty, but marred by notes of raisin and herb. Drink now. 124 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley Sydney Vineyard Reserve
review: Aromas of black cherry-menthol cough drops come up short on depth and focus. OK as a red table wine. Drink now. 270 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Ellie's Old Vine
review: Ripe and raisiny, with notes of tar and prune. Drink now. 323 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley The Ranch
review: An over-the-top version, ripe and quite sweet, with baked cherry and spice flavors. Drink now. 298 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Bright and focused, showing a distinct toasty, spicy streak through the supple pear flavors. Drinkable now.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Lean and a bit green, displaying spice, tart pear and apple notes of modest proportions and finishing with light oak shadings.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Solid if unexciting, with a modest core of cherry, wild berry, earth and spice, turning simple on the finish.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Has a bitter edge, with canned pineapple and smoky oak flavors. 8,100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Russian River Valley Trois Voyelles
review: Vibrant and intense, with a lively beam of lemon-lime, honeysuckle, fig and pineapple. Stays on its toes with lingering, tangy acidity. Drink now through 2006. 250 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Red Heads Studio
review: Velvety and round. A generous mouthful of blueberry, plum and spice flavors that linger against refined tannins. Well-formed and nicely focused. Drink now through 2015. 280 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Red Heads Studio Select
review: Broad, juicy and generous with its plum and blackberry flavors, finishing with a touch of gaminess and sharp acidity. Best from 2007 through 2012. 400 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Reserve
review: Chunky, earthy, hard-edged. 500 cases made.

name: Sémillon New South Wales Botrytis
review: Very dark color, sweet but not unctuous, offering straightforward pineapple and apricot flavors that echo hints of spice and fig on the finish. Nice now, but give it until 2000 to see what develops.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Smooth and supple, with clean flavors of spice, ripe peach and honeysuckle. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Niederösterreich
review: A creamy style, with ripe apple and peach flavors, offering hints of cinnamon on the crisp finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Niederösterreich
review: Green peach and fresh-cut apple flavors dominate this crisp white, which finishes with well-defined white pepper notes. Drink now. 13,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Weelfel Alte Reben
review: Quite ripe-tasting, with luscious peach, apricot and hickory smoke flavors. Robust, with a long, spicy finish that features touches of buttercream and toast. Drink now through 2012. 325 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Weelfel Alte Reben
review: This has a bright mix of blood orange and pear flavors, with lots of apple accents. Cream and spice notes mark the fresh finish. Drink now through 2016. 100 cases imported.

name: Roter Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Fels am Wagram
review: Floral notes accent apple, pear and spice flavors. Peach cobbler and nutmeg notes chime in on the ripe finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Traditionell
review: Interesting notes of juniper and cardamom give this light red some lift. Vanilla notes fringe the dried red fruit flavors. Drink now. 150 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Felser Berg Reserve
review: Broad-tasting, medium-bodied, with plenty of smoke, ripe peach and white berry flavors that extend nicely onto the baked apple finish. Drink now. 10 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Weelfel Alte Reben
review: This has good concentration to the apricot, spice, mineral and green peach flavors, which linger on the ripe finish. Drink now. 416 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Weelfel Alte Reben
review: Aromas of petrol and spice, with flavors to match, plus orange peel and lime notes. Moderate finish of pepper, with a touch of garlic.  Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Roter Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Fels am Wagram
review: Medium-bodied, showing some buttery and floral notes the red peach and ripe citrus flavors. Smoke and spice appear on the finish. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Felser Berg Reserve
review: This has a spicy aroma, with some tropical fruits flavors, which turn a tad cloying on the finish. Drink now. 165 cases made.

name: Traminer Qualitätswein Lieblich Donauland Trio Mitterweg
review: On the sweet side, with peach and apple flavors. Plenty of spice and piecrust on the soft finish.  Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Weelfel
review: Straightforward, with peach and Golden Delicious apple flavors, which merge with smoke and butter on the finish.  Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Fumberg
review: This has moderate grapefruit and peach flavors, a bright structure and decent length on the finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Gösinger Freiheit Reserve
review: Pretty peach and apricot flavors, but not much structure. Soft finish. Drink now. 125 cases made.

name: Traminer Qualitätswein Halbtrocken Donauland Trio
review: Buttery and ripe-tasting, with some spice and overripe apple flavors. 166 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Weelfel Alte Reben
review: Modest Grüner, with peach flavors that turn soft. A little tanky on the finish. 375 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Weelfel
review: Off-dry tasting, with ripe peach and apple flavors, with notes of fig and smoke on the short finish. 500 cases made.

name: Cuvee Voisins Paso Robles
review: Ripe, rich and concentrated, with layered blackberry, mineral, dust, caramel, black cherry and earth tones. Toasty oak and ripe fruit flavors carry through on the finish. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2007. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Paso Robles
review: Ripe and well-balanced, with fleshy, complex mineral, black cherry, chocolate malt and black currant flavors. Solid, round tannins highlight the stylish, lingering finish. A new winery in Paso Robles, using a portion of winery-owned vineyards. Fair price. Drink now through 2007. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Coast Griffins Lair
review: Complex flavors of blackberry, wild berry, cedar, spice and chicory are full-bodied and focused, with a minerally edge turning to tar and ending with chewy, gripping tannins that turn cedary as well. Drink now through 2016. 300 cases made.

name: Syrah Russian River Valley Castelli-Knight Ranch
review: A pepper steak-tartare Syrah expression, this is tight, firm and focused, with spicy, firm and dense dried berry flavors that are tight yet persistent, long and engaging. This is too young to drink now, but appears to have a chewy upside. Best from 2011 through 2017. 382 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Coast
review: Displays lots of spicy, peppery, wild berry aromatics, turning firmer, tighter and trimmer on the palate with crushed rock and hot brick wall flavors wrapped in dry tannins. Best from 2013 through 2023. 345 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Paso Robles James Berry Vineyard
review: Offers a tight, cedar-laced mix of white peach, nectarine and honeysuckle. Slow to unfold, but should benefit from some cellar time. Drink now through 2018. 194 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Ripe and full-bodied, with rich apple, pear and melon flavors that are mature and extracted, still a bit raw, ending with spicy, cedary oak. Drink now through 2014. 262 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Gap's Crown Vineyard
review: Dense and complex, well-built around a core of plum and cherry, this shows a loamy earth and dried herb edge, firming on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 138 cases made.

name: Rána California
review: Pale garnet color, with a pronounced pepper and dried berry aroma; dry too on the palate, yet the range of spices keeps expanding, ending savory. Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2018. 141 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast Yuen
review: Features smooth-textured citrus, quince and honeysuckle notes that are direct and intense. Finishes with a floral note. Drink now through 2018. 437 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Chalk Hill Windsor Oaks Vineyard
review: This unusual, salmon-hued Pinot Gris shows lemon zest and strawberry notes that have a healthy dose of acidity and tannins. Intense and powerful, with toasty and nutty notes on the finish. Drink now. 138 cases made.

name: Trousseau Gris Russian River Valley Fanucchi-Wood Road Vineyard
review: Offers a refreshing mix of peach and lemon curd flavors on a smooth body, with appealing spice, herb and floral details on the finish. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Well-balanced in a restrained, modestly flavored style, with an emphasis on structure and delicacy, offering modest dried berry, cedar and fresh loamy earth notes. Drink now through 2018. 976 cases made.

name: Grenache Sonoma County Sceales Vineyard Old-Vine
review: A shade darker than a rosé, but similar in flavor, if more tannic and chewy, with red berry and plum notes. Drink now through 2015. 425 cases made.

name: Mourvèdre Sonoma Valley Bedrock Vineyard
review: Racy and grapey, with wildflower and wild berry aromatics. An easy-drinking style. Drink now. 99 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Coast
review: Offers lots of herb, underbrush and leather notes at the expense of ripe flavors. A style of limited appeal. Drink now through 2016. 576 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Coast
review: Light and uninteresting, with minimal spice and herb nuances, showing a vegetal touch of dill to the red berry flavors. Drink now. 380 cases made.

name: Barbera Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and tangy, supple in texture but marked by zingy acidity to balance the ripe cherry and raspberry flavors, finishing with generosity and deftness. Drink now through 2018. 225 cases made.

name: Bravo Rosso Washington
review: Firm in texture, light on its feet, with fine-grain tannins around a modest core of smoky blueberry and spice flavors. Keeps its poise as the finish lingers. Primitivo, Barbera, Nebbiolo, Dolcetto and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2016. 300 cases made.

name: Bravo Rosso Washington
review: Firm in texture, this is relatively light on its feet, with black cherry and licorice notes riding on lacy acidity. The flavors persist appealingly. Barbera, Dolcetto, Cabernet Sauvignon and Nebbiolo. Drink now through 2015. 120 cases made.

name: Dolcetto Columbia Valley
review: Refreshingly pure, focused and light-footed, with an electric zing of tannins closing in on the plum and roasted meat flavors as they persist on the finish. Best after 2014. 120 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Lucia Highlands Sacramento Vineyard
review: Offers a mix of toasty, cedary oak and ripe fig, apple and melon fruit, showing a smokier profile on the finish, where this picks up a marshmallow note. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Sarmento Vineyard
review: Cherry rhubarb, spice and anise flavors are tight, firm and tannic, with hints of pepper. Concentrated and quite tannic. Best from 2010 through 2015. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Sarmento Vineyard
review: Sour cherry and dill flavors are dull, dry and earthy. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Diamond Mountain
review: Firm and young, offering lots of fruit complexity and all of its parts in balance. Has plenty of cherry, plum and currant flavors and tight tannins on the finish; ready to drink now.

name: Chardonnay Edna Valley MacGregor Vineyard
review: A sophisticated, nicely balanced wine, with earthy aromas, ripe, almost sweet pear and honey flavors and a rich texture. Its long aftertaste signals extra quality.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles Benito Dusi Vineyard
review: Flavors of ripe plum and cherry jam, really showing off its fruitiness, then finishing nicely spicy and peppery, while staying mild with the tannins.

name: Chardonnay Edna Valley MacGregor Vineyard
review: An intense young wine with tart, ripe pear and pineapple flavors that finish with crisp lemony acidity. Ready now. 800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Tart and sharply focused, showing a laser beam of flavor, with ripe cherry, spice and tobacco characteristics shining through a veil of fine tannins. Has a supple feel despite the firm acidity. Drink now. 175 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Edna Valley MacGregor Vineyard
review: Ripe, fat and generous, with more fruit on the palate than on the nose, offering plenty of spice and pear notes that extend into the finish. Drinkable now.

name: Chardonnay Edna Valley MacGregor Vineyard
review: Smooth and flavorful, with lots of apple, spice and almond aromas and flavors and a long, lively finish. Drinkable now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Tart and a bit earthy, with currant and cherry fruit that has a green edge to it. Comes across as disjointed. 150 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Edna Valley MacGregor Vineyard
review: Zingy acidity and bright lemon flavors give this wine pucker-power. A bit meaty and earthy, it finishes with a touch of honey. Struggles for balance. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Edna Valley MacGregor Vineyard
review: Tastes mature and excessively manipulated, with a sour edge to the pineapple and pear flavors. Finally rings in with honey richness on the finish. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Dundee Hills Vineyards
review: Bright, distinctive and tangy, with lime and green pear overtones to the raspberry and spice flavors, coming together with intensity and minerality on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 715 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Winderlea Vineyard
review: Fresh and vibrant, with juicy lime and pear accents to the raspberry and clove flavors, dancing exuberantly against polished tannins through the long and expressive finish. Drink now through 2022. 750 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Meredith Mitchell Vineyard
review: Firm and chewy, with dense tannins around a lithe core of floral-accented plum and blueberry flavors, finishing with lean intensity. Needs time to flesh out. Best from 2017 through 2022. 187 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley
review: Polished, round and generous, with ripe pear and spice flavors balanced with lemony acidity and a touch of mineral. The finish lingers deftly on a medium-weight frame. Drink now through 2019. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Ana Vineyard
review: Very light in color, with pretty cranberry, cherry and green tea flavors on a sleek frame, lingering delicately against lively acidity. Best from 2016 through 2020. 289 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Juliard Vineyard
review: Sleek, vivid and brightly focused, with cherry, raspberry, floral and green tea flavors on a polished frame, finishing with power and deftness. Drink now through 2020. 98 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Murto Vineyard
review: Polished, elegant and focused, with earthy, meaty undertones to the juicy red plum and cranberry flavors, finishing with persistence and lively acidity. Drink now through 2022. 148 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Crawford Beck Vineyard
