review: Crisp and juicy, with vibrant red berry, floral and white pepper aromas and flavors that dance against a light veil of tannins into the long and vivid finish. Drink now through 2017. 180 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Shea Vineyard
review: Lithe, lively, supple and appealing, with tomato leaf-accented cherry and spice flavors, floating serenely over refined tannins as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2022. 396 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Dundee Hills Vineyards
review: Taut, focused and broad enough to let the black cherry, raspberry and savory flavors pop against fine tannins. The finish persists easily. Best from 2018 through 2024. 1,825 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Juliard Vineyard
review: Fresh and lively, boasting cherry, raspberry and sassafras flavors on an open frame with a slightly raw edge, coming together nicely on the taut finish. Drink now through 2018. 113 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Maresh Vineyard
review: Vivid, open-textured, light and distinctive, with tobacco and pine overtones to the lively cherry and floral flavors. Nubby tannins don't get in the way. Best after 2015. 136 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Maresh Vineyard
review: Polished, sleek and expressive, layering its red berry, cranberry and mint flavors into a delicate beam that lingers effortlessly on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 136 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Murto Vineyard
review: Focused and well-built, with dark berry and loamy earth aromas leading to lively yet dense black cherry, tea and spice flavors. Drink now through 2023. 261 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Shea Vineyard
review: Broad and spicy, wrapping crinkly tannins around a lithe core of blackberry and cherry flavors, pushing into a long and generous finish. Best from 2018 through 2024. 420 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: Ripe and soft, with notes of pepper, licorice and raisin. Drink now through 2011. 10,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: Juicy but simple, with notes of boysenberry and sassafras. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Cowra
review: Firm and focused, bright with black pepper and floral notes around a solid core of blackberry and cherry. Finishes with polished texture. Drink now through 2006. 2,400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Cowra
review: Soft and ripe, with pretty pear, mineral and honey notes mingling on a polished texture. Drink now through 2003. 2,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Cowra The Mill
review: Ripe, round and generous with its pear, vanilla and toasty spice flavors, finishing with a tang of lime. Drink now through 2003. 4,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Cowra Platinum Series
review: Ripe and juicy, with pretty pear and spice flavors on a lively frame. Finishes with a refreshing lift. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Cowra The Mill
review: Smooth, polished and lively, with jazzy wild berry and anise flavors that remain juicy through the finish. Drink now through 2005. 2,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Cowra The Mill
review: Soft and fruity, with herb-scented orange and apple flavors. Drink now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Vintage Selection No. 12
review: Cherry, currant and raspberry flavors are supported by caressing tannins. The silky texture lingers on the finish, with Asian spice and licorice notes. Drink now through 2022. 359 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Russian River Valley River West Vineyard
review: Plush and generous, with loads of ripe black cherry, berry, currant and spice flavors seasoned by subtle oak shadings. Finishes with a complex array of herb and olive notes. Not too tannic; drinkable now, or cellar through 1995.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Signature Series
review: A toasty introduction leads to layers of hazelnut, pear, apple and spice, with a clean, moderate finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Russian River Valley Signature Series
review: Smells attractive, with smoky vanilla and oak aromas, but is lean and tight on the palate, with cherry and plum notes that turn supple on the finish. Balanced and ready to drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma County Signature Series
review: Soft, ripe plum notes are wrapped in a coating of pleasantly nutty, toasted oak flavors. Finishes with slightly green tannins. Drink now through 2000. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma County Private Reserve
review: Marked by oak and medium-bodied plum and spice notes, a good if unexciting style that's ready to drink.

name: Sémillon North Coast Private Reserve
review: A lighter style, with a blend of peach and tart apple flavors. Finishes with a crisp mineral edge. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Coast
review: Smooth, almost velvety in texture, with pretty currant, tobacco and spice notes of moderate intensity. Nice. Drink now through 2001.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Signature Series
review: Smooth and velvety, with modest red cherry and spice aromas and flavors. A small-scale wine that offers appealing fruit and finish. Drinkable now.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Winemaster's Private Reserve
review: Smoky tea aromas and flavors on a lean, silky frame. Well balanced.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Old Vines Private Reserve
review: Moderate in body, with nutty orange peel, plum and baked fruit flavors, finishing slightly dry.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Coast Preference Vineyard Private Reserve
review: Soft in texture and modest in flavor, with tobacco and cedar notes ringing louder than the cherry flavor. Aimed for early drinking. Drink now through 1999.

name: Merlot California Private Reserve
review: Pleasant ripe currant and cherry flavors are laid over a soft layer of toasty oak and vanilla notes. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir California Signature Series
review: Well oaked, with toasty, smoky aromas and just enough cherry-laced Pinot Noir fruit to hold your interest.

name: Zinfandel Alexander Valley Signature Series
review: Supported by an oaky frame, the cherry notes can't keep up with the vanilla and charry wood flavors. Finishes with grainy tannins. Drink now through 2000.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino County Private Reserve
review: Firm, showing flavors of earthy raspberry, tea and herb that turn slightly stalky on the finish. Might improve with time.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Russian River Valley
review: Crisp and tangy, showing plenty of punch to the citrus, peach and melon notes. Fresh and balanced. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley
review: Intense, concentrated, full-bodied and still a bit raw, this delivers a complex mix of pear, apple, spice and honeysuckle, ending with a long finish that offers a glimpse of smoky marshmallow. Drink now through 2011. 2,262 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: A briary little red, with black raspberry and fresh sage aromas leading to zesty flavors of plum and pepper. Drink now through 2016. 450 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Supple and juicy, with easygoing raspberry and cinnamon aromas and lively black cherry, white pepper and sage flavors. Drink now through 2014. 807 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
review: Ripe, rich and full-bodied, this is intense and concentrated, with tiers of dried currant, blackberry, herb and sage, firming up on the finish where the tannins flex their muscles. Drink now through 2011. 2,460 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Ripe plum and blackberry fruit is delicate and fragrant, full-bodied and complex, if on a modest scale, ending with fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2011. 2,016 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Offers zesty black raspberry and smoky meat aromas and appealingly rustic cherry, sage and loam flavors that finish with rustic tannins. Drink now through 2013. 1,254 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley
review: Modest spicy apple, pear and light citrus shadings are easy-drinking and medium-weight. Drink now. 3,840 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley
review: Fresh and vibrant, with good intensity to the mix of citrus, green apple and honeysuckle flavors that are pure and focused. Drink now. 1,815 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Russian River Valley
review: Light-bodied, with softly juicy yet pleasant citrus, apple and bell pepper notes. A fragrant whiff of pine gives this some charm. Drink now. 2,940 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc El Dorado
review: An unusual licorice-and-lemon streak courses through this tangy wine. It's firm and bright. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc El Dorado
review: A pleasant lemon, lime and mineral core runs through. Definitely a lightweight, however. 820 cases made.

name: Chardonnay El Dorado
review: Citrus and heavy-handed butterscotch flavors have pleasant focus, but finish abruptly. The finish shows some spice. 910 cases made.

name: Merlot El Dorado
review: Firm, with mineral, charred oak and dried currant flavors. Drying on the finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon El Dorado
review: Some cassis and blackberry flavors struggle to surface from behind a wall of green astringency. 410 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon El Dorado
review: Dry and tannic, with simple fruit and herb flavors. 375 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Paso Robles Monopole
review: Tightly focused, with a core of dried cherry, earthy berry, spice and herb flavors, finishing clean and firm. Best from 2000 through 2004. 1,400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Paso Robles
review: Pleasant enough, with bright strawberry and cherry flavors, streaks of mint and herb. Well balanced, and ready to drink. 1,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Paso Robles Monopole
review: Pleasantly fruity and rather uncomplicated, with ripe plum and berry flavors of moderate depth and concentration. Ready now. 1,150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Paso Robles Monopole Barrel Select Gold Label
review: Light cherry, plum and herb flavors lock in with floral notes and a hint of bitterness at the end. Fairly smooth, however. 67 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Paso Robles Monopole
review: Roasted herb and strawberry flavors hook into the rough, with earth, pronounced leather and metallic tones. 1,400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light and evanescent, with modest red berry and orange aromas on an airy texture, finishing with restraint. Drink now through 2015. 5,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Soft, juicy and easy to sip, with notes of cherry, spice and sassafras. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Offers ripe plum and smoky, meaty aromas, but not enough flesh for its big-boned structure. Flavors of currant and mineral finish with chewy tannins. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Londer Vineyard
review: Firm and chunky, this rustic style boasts a core of intense dark berry and raspberry fruit framed by firm, chewy tannins. Best from 2014 through 2022. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Wentzel Vineyard
review: Marked by fresh, snappy, vibrant raspberry and red berry fruit, this boasts touches of spice and mint, ending with a clean finish and grippy tannins. Drink now through 2020. 50 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mendocino County Oppenlander Vineyard
review: Offers a distinct sage and pennyroyal edge to the dried berry and spice flavors, ending with a drying underbrush edge. Drink now through 2020. 50 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Archer Family Vineyard
review: Tight, with a narrow mix of sour cherry and crushed rock notes. Should improve with cellaring. Drink now through 2020. 50 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Columbia Valley Cheninières The Aromatics Old Vine
review: This tight, crisp, lip-smacking style offers focused quince and citrus flavors on a deftly distributed frame, lingering enticingly on the finish. A stylish version, with the ability to age. Drink now through 2016. 148 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Columbia Valley Chevray The Aromatics Old Vine
review: Fresh, crisp and vital, this is nicely fleshed out with pear, green apple, lemon curd and spice flavors on a sleek structure that finishes gracefully. Combines presence and refinement. Drink now through 2022. 708 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley The Aromatics Old Vine
review: Lightly sweet, fresh and expressive, weaving rich apricot notes through the pear and apple flavors, balancing delicately on the expressively floral finish. Drink now through 2018. 200 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Columbia Valley Cheninières The Aromatics Old Vine
review: Sleek and lively, with polish to the pear and floral flavors, picking up a white grapefruit note as the persistent finish lingers easily. Drink now through 2018. 565 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Columbia Valley Cheninières The Aromatics Old Vine
review: Tautly focused, this dry white is generous in flavor, offering tangerine-accented pear and quince notes that swirl together and persisting on the generous finish. Shows presence and depth. Drink now through 2017. 265 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Columbia Valley Chevray Old Vine
review: Fresh and vibrant, with juicy pear and honeydew melon fruit on a crisply balanced, slightly off-dry frame, persisting impressively on the generous finish. Drink now through 2016. 209 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Columbia Valley Chevray The Aromatics Old Vine
review: Crisp in balance and silky in texture, balancing the pear, tangerine and floral flavors on a thread of refined acidity as the soft finish expands. This has generosity and sleekness. Drink now through 2016. 280 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Old Vine
review: Sleek and silky, with honey-inflected pear and grapefruit flavors that linger on the off-dry finish. Drink now through 2016. 165 cases made.

name: Three Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and vibrant, with tension among the black cherry, mint and spice flavors, mingling effortlessly on the long and deftly balanced finish. Merlot, Malbec and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2016. 297 cases made.

name: Three Red Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, lean and lithe, with pretty cherry and spice flavors that persist expressively on the refined finish. Merlot, Malbec and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2018. 480 cases made.

name: Three White Boushey Vineyard Yakima Valley
review: Soft, generous and distinctive, with orange melon, green pear, Meyer lemon peel and spice flavors that come together on the open-textured finish. Grenache Blanc, Marsanne and Picpoul. Drink now through 2017. 450 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Columbia Valley Cheninières The Aromatics Old Vine
review: Light and refreshing, with pretty pear and apple flavors, plus a hint of green guava on the dry, well-extended finish. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Columbia Valley The Aromatics Old Vine
review: Soft and appealing, featuring almond and apricot flavors, finishing dry, with a hint of melon. Drink now. 210 cases made.

name: Three White Boushey Vineyard Yakima Valley
review: Soft and gentle, with modest pear and petrol flavors on a open-textured frame. Grenache Blanc, Marsanne and Picpoul. Drink now. 523 cases made.

name: Three Red Columbia Valley
review: Firm with tannins, this nubby-textured red delivers meaty dark berry flavors, remaining focused on the earthy finish. Merlot, Malbec and Mourvèdre. Best after 2016. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 471 cases made.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley St. Andrews
review: A gorgeous balance of focused blackberry, black currant, earth and bittersweet chocolate flavors on a supple frame with superfine tannins and enough acidity to give it a little extra pizzazz. Has stunning depth and length, and miles to go. Best from 2006 through 2020. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley The Visionary Exceptional Parcel Release
review: Expressive and richly fragrant, with nutmeg, clove, cigar box and black tea notes and a core of dense huckleberry and plum flavors. The aromas expand on the finish, where a smoky detail gains momentum. Drink now through 2027. 200 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley St. Andrews Single Vineyard Release
review: Crisp and tangy, with juicy green pear, apple and white pepper flavors, coming together tidily on the linear finish. Needs time to soften the edges and gain texture. Best from 2016 through 2023. 250 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley St. Andrews Single Vineyard Release
review: Offers intoxicating aromatics, with toasty cigar box, clove and sandalwood notes, pepper highlights and fresh earthaccented flavors of black cherry. A spicy detail extends through the long finish, with polished tannins. Drink now through 2028. 250 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley St. Andrews Single Vineyard Release
review: Dense and tightly packed, but fleshy enough to let the black cherry, licorice and floral flavors shine through, lingering against a polished finish. Has presence and complexity. Drink now through 2022. 250 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley St. Andrews Single Vineyard Release
review: Spicy, smoky and polished, medium-weight and supple in the mouth, with expressive, beautifully modulated black cherry, currant and roasted pepper flavors. This persists easily on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 250 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley The Pioneer Exceptional Parcel Release
review: Rich, with espresso, chocolate and kirsch details, accented by hints of fresh mint. Offering a supple texture, this is elegant and expressive on the long finish. Drink now through 2030. 200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley The Pioneer Exceptional Parcel Release
review: Dark and deep, with layers of black olive, black cherry, tobacco and pepper flavors on a supple frame, lingering expressively on the generous finish. Best from 2018 through 2022. 100 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley St. Andrews
review: Ripe and racy, with just enough vivid acidity to make the currant and spice flavors really fly. There's a mineral edge that adds more interest. It adds up to a special wine that should grow beautifully in the bottle. Drink now through 2010. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley St. Andrews Single Vineyard Release
review: Firm tannins surround a lean core of ripe currant and blackberry flavors, hinting at licorice as the finish lingers. Shows depth and density without excess weight. Drink now through 2018. 250 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley The Visionary Exceptional Parcel Release
review: An appealing roasted red pepper note adds dimension to the cherry and plum flavors, with a savory edge and spicy tobacco accents. Juicy and velvety on the lingering finish. Drink now through 2030. 100 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Clare Valley St. Andrews Single Vineyard Release
review: Elegant, with pure, crisp lime and pear flavors that are delightfully vivid and refreshing. Finishes with a lovely punctuation point of matcha green tea. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley
review: Silky in texture, with a juicy feel to the pear, apple and floral flavors, dancing deftly through the dry finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley
review: Aromatic and aristocratic, this is dry, steely and mouthwatering in its structure, overflowing with pear, grapefruit, slate and floral flavors that persist on the extensive finish. Drink now through 2018. 448 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley St. Andrews Single Vineyard Release
review: Light and tangy, with an acidic bite to the green apple and lime flavors. A hint of anise enlivens the long finish. Drink now through 2020. 250 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare-Eden Valleys Jaraman
review: Taut and expressive, with invigorating tension as the green apple fruit plays against lime and mineral overtones. Comes together neatly on the refined finish. Drink now through 2023. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley St. Andrews
review: Dark and dense, this boasts a solid mouthful of black cherry, roasted red pepper and grilled meat flavors, lingering on the expressive finish. Drink now through 2016. 250 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley St. Andrews
review: Ripe cherry and gamy flavors compete for attention in this generous, smooth red, finishing with cedary oak as the fruit persists. Has wonderful structure and the flavors last impressively, remaining harmonious. Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley St. Andrews
review: The chocolate-laced cherry and blackberry flavors are rich and thick, with plenty of spice and black tea notes lingering. A dried rosemary detail hangs on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley The Visionary Exceptional Parcel Release
review: Lithe, focused and open-textured, with refined tannins around a sleek core of red berry, guava and floral flavors, weaving in white pepper notes as the finish persists. Drink now through 2020. 100 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley The Visionary Exceptional Parcel Release
review: Offers grippy tannins but remains firmly focused and appealing, with dark berry flavors and a delicate overlay of herbs, lingering pleasantly. Drink now through 2020. 100 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley-Coonawarra Jaraman
review: Fresh and focused, wrapping fresh herbaccented blackberry and currant flavors in fine tannins. Finishes with intensity on a deftly balanced frame. Best from 2015 through 2020. 500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley-Coonawarra Jaraman
review: This vibrant style wraps focused currant and plum flavors with hints of earth and bay leaf, with refined tannins on the lingering finish. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Clare Valley
review: Aromatic and nicely focused, this medium-weight white has warm slate notes on the nose, expanding into pineapple, pear and flan flavors in the mouth. Lingers well on the polished finish. Drink now through 2011. 1,100 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay South Australia
review: Fresh and vibrant, nicely packed with pear, pineapple and grapefruit flavors, sailing easily through the expressive, balanced finish. Drink now through 2013. 328 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley
review: Citrus and floral notes mingle effortlessly on a light and lithe body, with a crescendo of acidity on the finish. Details of white pepper and green apple peel add to the charm. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley
review: Intense and focused, with juicy green apple and lime flavors that are light and bright, with a note of makrut lime and white pepper on the long, lingering finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley
review: Fresh and tangy, offering complex flavors of apricot, green guava, lime and white pepper as the dry, silky finish lingers. Drink now through 2025. 500 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley
review: This lean, taut white is distinctive for the mineral and popcorn overtones to its pear and floral flavors, lingering easily on the tart, dry finish. Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley St. Andrews
review: Fresh and tangy, this is a dry, tart white of modest proportions, but with pretty pear and slate aromas and flavors. Finishes with impressive persistence. Drink now through 2017. 500 cases imported.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley
review: Bright and juicy, offering a lively mouthful of lychee-scented blackberry and spice flavors, turning gentle and silky on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 522 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Central Coast
review: Wild berry flavors are wrapped around drying tannins, with a strong herbal finish. 5,500 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas
review: Rich, well-crafted and full of refinement, this red offers powerful flavors of dried sage, crushed red plum and succulent dark berry, supported by fresh acidity and silky tannins. Long and lush on the rich finish, which is filled with vibrant spicy notes. Best from 2015 through 2025. 457 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 5G
review: Intense, with black sesame, buckwheat, toffee and warmed walnut notes giving this a steady bass line while accents of green tea, dried bergamot and bitter orange add racy elements for contrast. Shows excellent range and length, with a finish that hums like a tuning fork. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Douro Quinta da Manoella Vinhas Velhas
review: This resonates with succulent raspberry and currant flavors, matched with vibrant acidity. Firmly tannic, showing a savory herbal essence, this features a broad, powerful texture, delivering plenty of grip on the slate- and mineral-filled finish. Best from 2015 through 2022. 290 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Pintas
review: Offers a floral nose, with fruity flavors of berry and cherry that are flanked by seductive sandalwood and cedar notes. Well-integrated tannins provide good punch, with rich licorice notes dominating the ripe, chewy finish. Best from 2016 through 2032. 250 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas
review: Plush and powerful, showing a balanced ripeness to the lipsmacking flavors of blueberry, kirsch and dark plum, with notes of cherry tart that are pure-tasting and feature a bracing minerality. Pepper and slate notes extend on the finish, with hints of black licorice. Drink now through 2020. 460 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas Character
review: Sleek and pure, with a zesty edge to the powerful and intense flavors of dried sage, red plum and currant, showing notes of flint. Delivers a fine balance of tannins and acidity, presenting a sinewy texture that exudes bittersweet chocolate accents on the finish. Best from 2016 through 2022. 457 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Pintas
review: Plush, rich and concentrated, with firm minerality to the dark cherry, wild plum and dark chocolate flavors that are crisp and filled with juicy acidity. Shows good grip on the intense finish. Best from 2030 through 2050. 660 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas
review: Powerful and elegant, with flavors of spiced cherry, plum tart and dark currant, accented by generous notes of ginger and nutmeg. The lush finish offers cocoa powder and licorice elements. Drink now through 2020. 40 cases imported.

name: Douro Pintas
review: A strong dark fruit element runs through this deeply colored and inky red. Well-structured, with a powerful acidity behind the savory herb, mocha, plum and dried blackberry flavors, flanked by dense, minerally notes. Shows good grip on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 450 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas
review: This pure-tasting and powerful red is juicy and well-structured, with plenty of iron and brick overtones to the dark fruit flavors. The muscular finish features dark chocolate and mocha, with minerally notes. Drink now through 2020. 458 cases made.

name: Douro Quinta da Manoella Vinhas Velhas
review: Very fresh and intensely juicy, featuring an effusively fruity aroma and concentrated flavors of red plum, cherry and currant. Offers medium-grained tannins, with lavish chocolate, cream and spice notes on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 250 cases made.

name: Douro Quinta da Manoella Vinhas Velhas
review: There's loads of cream and spice in this well-structured and refined red from Portugal, which features flavors of cherry, plum tart and dark currant. Long and juicy on the mineral-infused finish. Drink now through 2020. 0290 cases made.

name: Port 5G Very Old
review: Offers an intense spicy aroma, with thick and concentrated flavors of fig tart, brown sugar, dark cherry and mincemeat that are long, full and sweet. Clove and nutmeg notes linger on the vibrant finish. Distinctive. Drink now.

name: Douro Pintas
review: Dried herb, currant and peppery spice flavors are woven together by a smoky, cedar-lined spine in this elegant, spicy red. Hot stone, pencil shavings and red plum details echo on the long, tannic finish. Drink now through 2025. 500 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas
review: A plush, suave style, with flavors of dried berry, raspberry tart and mocha that are ripe and rich. Elegant midpalate, featuring plenty of minerality and a long finish of baked cherry and spice. Drink now through 2019. 550 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas
review: Pure, bright red cherry and plum flavors fill this concentrated red. Balanced and firm, with plenty of refinement and a long, long finish filled with minerally notes. Drink now through 2014. 455 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas
review: This full-bodied and deeply concentrated red has a heady spicy aroma and powerful flavors of cassis, blackberry, smoke and dark chocolate. Tannins build on the finish, but not out of bounds. Best from 2004 through 2007. 450 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas Character
review: Powerful, rich and lush, with concentrated dark plum, cherry and blackberry flavors, featuring notes of mocha and cream. The firm, well-integrated tannins and fresh acidity provide backup. Drink now through 2022. 450 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas Character
review: This has a perfumed note to the rich, refined and well-crafted flavors of red currant, spiced plum and tart cherry. Displays plenty of minerality and acidity, with a brightness that extends into the fresh-tasting finish. Drink now through 2018. 460 cases made.

name: Douro Quinta da Manoella Vinhas Velhas
review: Fresh, with a tangy edge surrounding the boysenberry and currant fruit. Underbrush, pine and spice notes fuel the minerally finish. Nicely focused and distinct. May need a little time in the cellar to unwind, but shows plenty of potential. Best from 2019 through 2025. 300 cases made.

name: Douro Quinta da Manoella Vinhas Velhas
review: Muscular but refined, with meaty undertones to the blackberry, roasted plum and herb notes, edged with dark chocolate, spice and mineral details. Full, chewy tannins lend structure to the lengthy finish. Decant. Drink now through 2020. 250 cases made.

name: Douro Quinta da Manoella Vinhas Velhas
review: A muscular and powerful red, with intense spice and dried green herbal notes to the snappy dark fruit flavors. The finely textured and moderately tannic finish is filled with chocolate and pepper details. Drink now through 2020. 25 cases imported.

name: Douro Quinta da Manoella Vinhas Velhas
review: Fresh and juicy, with concentrated flavors of red currant, cranberry and dried raspberry. Lively notes of citrus peel extend onto the tannic, chocolate-inflected finish. Drink now through 2018. 200 cases made.

name: Douro White Guru
review: This medium-bodied white is elegantly made, echoing melon, lemon oil and white peach flavors, accented by white pepper, wet stone and white blossom details. Sweet spice and creamy accents linger on the long finish. Drink now through 2022. 500 cases made.

name: Douro White Guru
review: Offers a powerful smoky aroma, with impressive concentration to the baked pear, apple tart and crème brûlée flavors. Reveals pastry and buttery notes on the rich, spicy finish, graced by tons of minerality. Drink now through 2022. 50 cases imported.

name: Douro White Guru
review: A finely sculpted white, with an alluring spicy and creamy aroma, featuring flavors of pear tart, peach cobbler and baked apple that are rich and lush. Minerally and smoky hints power the finish, revealing accents of dried mint. Drink now through 2019. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 550 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 10 Years Old
review: Plush, creamy and smoky-tasting, with vibrant white chocolate, hazelnut and dried apricot and pear flavors. Shows accents of dried mango on the richly spicy finish. Drink now. 0330 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Pintas
review: A bright, juicy, forward style, with lots of blueberry, açai berry and blackberry cobbler flavors, backed by chocolate pudding and black licorice notes. Shows a light woodsy spine, so this should hit its stride sooner than most. Very charming fruit. Best from 2027 through 2035. 250 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas
review: A focused but elegant red, with currant, blackberry and underbrush notes supported by moderate, chewy tannins. Bay leaf, smoke and slate elements linger on the finish. Needs cellaring to unwind.  Best after 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas Character
review: Firm but elegant, with a singed herb aroma weaving through graphite, boysenberry and currant flavors in this supple, full-bodied red. Peppery spice and zesty elements are matched with black tea and underbrush aromas on the long finish. Offers full, integrated tannins. Drink now through 2023. 1,500 cases made.

name: Douro White Guru
review: A creamy undertone lingers through the Meyer lemon, apricot and salted almond flavors in this mouthwatering white. Floral and mineral details add appeal to the spicy, focused finish. Drink now through 2019. 750 cases made.

name: Douro White Guru
review: A rich blend of lemon curd, gooseberry and ripe white cherry flavors, filled with plenty of smoky notes. Displays vibrant acidity, with minerality and an intense spiciness on the powerful finish. Drink now through 2017. 375 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old
review: Birch beer, cinnamon, dried cherry and toasted raisin bread notes mingle here, showing a glimmer of toffee through the finish. Has good focus, with a streamlined feel balancing the sweetness. Drink now. 416 cases made.

name: Douro Manoella
review: Fresh plum and raspberry flavors give this an intensely fruity essence, balanced by firm notes of pepper and slate. The lively finish is zesty, with accents of white pepper. Drink now through 2019. 1,500 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas
review: Very suave, offering loads of rich flavors, including dark plum, blackberry and dark cherry. The midpalate features chocolate mousse and French roast, which extend with Asian spice notes on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 50 cases imported.

name: Douro Pintas
review: Muscular red, with powerful dark fruit flavors, including plum and blackberry, accented by intense bittersweet chocolate notes. Mineral, spice and pipe tobacco linger on the finish.  Drink now through 2013. 290 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas
review: Elegant, with pretty aromas and flavors of rose petal, mineral, red fruits and spice. Lovely balance, with fine, silky tannins and a long, lingering finish of smoke and café au lait. Will be interesting to see how this evolves. Drink now through 2008. 450 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas Character
review: A combination of underbrush, red plum and blackberry notes are marked by a smoky undertone in this crisp, full-bodied red. Savory spice, mineral and dried herb aromas fill the muscular, focused finish. Decant. Drink now through 2020. 1,750 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas Character
review: A juicy and fresh style, with exuberant flavors of red plum and raspberry that feature hints of tangerine. Slate and white pepper notes emerge on the lively finish. Drink now through 2019. 200 cases imported.

name: Douro White Guru
review: A crisp white, with firm, focused flavors of currant, raspberry and honeydew melon, supported by plenty of fresh acidity. Ripe citrus and tangerine flavors fill the zesty finish. Drink now through 2018. 375 cases made.

name: Douro White Guru
review: This well-structured white boasts concentrated ripe pear, apple and fig flavors that are fresh and vibrant, joined by plenty of stone and smoke notes. Powerfully spicy, with hints of peach on the firm finish. Drink now through 2015. 380 cases made.

name: Douro White Guru
review: Concentrated flavors of baked apple, pear and marzipan fill this ripe, full-bodied white. The finish brims with spice and butter notes. Drink now through 2013. 425 cases made.

name: Douro White Guru
review: Very seductive and well-crafted, with rich flavors of ripe pear, apricot and mineral, backed by plenty of acidity. The long finish is filled with spice and smoke.  Drink now through 2010. 95 cases made.

name: Douro Character
review: A rich, mocha-filled aroma leads into dense flavors of dark plum, graphite and iron. Meaty notes linger on the muscular finish. Drink now through 2014. 150 cases imported.

name: Douro Manoella
review: Features an aroma of raspberry, with plenty of snap to the chocolate mousse, dark currant and kirsch flavors, accented by hints of mineral and slate. The dense, muscular finish displays elements of mocha, spice and cream. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas
review: Plush and full-bodied, with dark plum and blackberry flavors and notes of cassis. Well-balanced, with a supple texture and a creamy finish. Drink now through 2010. 475 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas Character
review: Features a silky texture to the luscious dark and red fruit flavors, dominated by dark plum and dried raspberry notes. Offers hints of Asian spice, with a dense, rich, balsamic-accented finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases made.

name: Douro Pintas Character
review: Minerally red, with concentrated kirsch flavors that are backed up by plenty of tannins and acidity. Mocha and dark chocolate fill the muscular finish. Needs some time to settle down. Best from 2010 through 2013. 1,250 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Pintas
review: Fresh and racy in feel, with a streak of violet running through the core of blackberry, plum and açaí berry notes. Light incense and dried anise hints fill in on the finish. Best from 2020 through 2033. 250 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Pintas
review: Fabulous aromas of crushed blackberry and blueberry lead to a full-bodied and very sweet palate, with lovely, silky, dense tannins and a pretty core of ripe fruit. Needs a tiny bit more of tannic grip on the finish to be outstanding. Best after 2014. 250 cases made.

name: Douro Manoella
review: Dried herb notes line the wild blackberry, currant and fresh earth aromas in this burly, concentrated red. Mineral and peppercorn details are matched by moderate tannins on the minerally finish. Drink now through 2020. 2,500 cases made.

name: Douro Manoella
review: There's a peppery snap to this fruity, medium-bodied red. Dark currant flavors dominate, showing notes of dried herb that carry through to the finish. Drink now through 2018. 400 cases imported.

name: Douro Manoella
review: Featuring a spicy nose, this forward-tasting red has plenty of oaky notes to the currant and black fig flavors. The medium-weight finish shows medium-grained tannins. Drink now through 2016. 830 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Pintas
review: Lots of plum and berry aromas. Full-bodied and lightly sweet, with chewy tannins. Medium finish. A pleasant young Port, but needs a bit more concentration. Best after 2010. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Light and bright, juicy with pear, nectarine and delicate spice flavors, lingering on the open-weave finish. Drink now. 2,030 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Bright and tangy, with lively flavors of pear-accented raspberry and spice, lingering gently. Drink now through 2020. 37,561 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light and silky, with pretty plum and spice flavors that dance gently through the refined finish. Drink now through 2015. 12,905 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Bright and juicy, a light and expressive mouthful of raspberry, tobacco, cream and spice flavors that last impressively on the deft finish. Drink now through 2013. 7,642 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Bright and juicy with grapefruit-accented pear flavors, lingering gently. Drink now. 2,262 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Offers crisp and vibrant peach and pear flavors accented by creamy spice notes. Drink now. 11,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Bright and lively, with juicy apple custard, lime and floral flavors coming together harmoniously on the tangy finish. Drink now. 25,091 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Light and polished, with sleek pear, honeydew and floral aromas and flavors that persist on the lively finish. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Bright, vibrant and distinctive, with nectarine overtones to the light core of pear and citrus, lingering delicately on the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon Unoaked
review: This fresh, inviting white balances pear and delicate ginger flavors on an open frame. Drink now. 1,774 cases made.

name: José's Rosé Oregon
review: This fresh, tangy red features pretty pear and watermelon flavors, which linger easily on the dry finish. Pinot Noir, Pinot Blanc, Muscat and Syrah. Drink now. 1,135 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Willamette Valley
review: Polished, refreshing and dry, with a grapefruit note floating through the pear and melon fruit. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Light and tart, with pear and floral flavors, finishing with a lime note. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light and fragrant, with pretty cherry and spice flavors set on a transparent frame, lingering delicately. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Polished in texture, with a candied edge to the tea, orange peel and red berry flavors. Toasty finish. Drink now through 2014. 7,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Oregon
review: Fresh and tangy, with orange peel and pear flavors, lingering on the dry finish. Drink now. 879 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Oregon
review: Ripe and generous, but ultimately open-textured, with a custardy edge to the flavor profile, which centers on apple and toast. Drink now. 2,356 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Light and a bit tangy, with melon and almond flower flavors on a dry frame. Drink now. 4,480 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Spicy, with distinctive cinnamon and clove notes around the wispy core of plum fruit. Finishes a bit short, but what's there is nice. Drink now. 8,596 cases made.

name: Jose's Rosé Oregon
review: A light, tangy, dry style of rosé, offering lime and strawberry flavors. Pinot Blanc, Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris and Syrah. Drink now. 2,148 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: This tangy white shows a candied edge to its citrusy almond flavors. Drink now. 3,130 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light and sleek, with a tang of acidity to the guava and spice flavors. Drink now through 2017. 16,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: This lithe, velvety style has pretty spice and tobacco overtones to the modest cherry and earth flavors, lingering nicely. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: A sour edge mars the otherwise pretty face of this crisp, berry-centered Pinot.   6,018 cases made.

name: Mélange Santa Barbara County
review: Crisp and lively, a spicy wine, lean in structure but showing nicely focused apple, nutmeg and a touch of herb flavors. A distinctive wine, ideal for casual sipping or drinking with fish. A blend of Chenin Blanc and Sauvignon Blanc. 400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County
review: Earthy and a bit sulfury, with ripe pear and spice. A pleasant if awkward young wine that turns coarse on the finish. Drink now through 1995. 200 cases made.

name: Toscana Eureka
review: A thick, rich wine, with a slightly raisiny character. Full-bodied and simple. 60 percent Merlot and 40 percent Sangiovese. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay California
review: A stylish offering, focused on rich fruit, with tropical touches and light oak flavors. Turns spicy and candied, but holds together well, finishing lively and clean. Drink now. 16,850 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Floral and intense, yet supple and fleshy. Notably complex, with a citrus-grapefruit edge to the green apple flavors. Drink now. 42,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz California
review: Spicy herb, red currant, black cherry, plum and cedar give this red a nice focus, supported by smooth tannins. Drink now. 39,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Bright and refreshing, with smooth, mouthwatering Key lime, quince, pepper and passion fruit flavors on a light body, with good intensity. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: Appealing for its juicy core of wild berry, spice and light cedar notes, this loses velocity and depth on the finish. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: Openly fruity and easy to drink, this is on the simple side, with modest dark berry flavors and touches of cedary wood. Firm tannins. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio California
review: Offers refreshing apple and citrus flavors, with peach, floral and orange citrus notes lingering on the finish. Drink now. 6,050 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio California
review: Floral, with honeysuckle and pineapple aromatics, a light body and refreshingly juicy acidity. Shows pretty pear, peach and ripe yellow apple flavors. Drink now. 42,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Solid and direct, with medium-bodied citrus and melon flavors and firm acidity, edged by hints of fresh herbs. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: A simple quaff, with a fruit cocktail flavor. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: Supple and full-bodied, with a cedary oak edge to the herb, currant, anise and mineral, ending with fine-grained tannins. Drink now. 24,000 cases made.

name: Merlot California
review: A simple quaff, with muted notes of candied cherry and herb. Drink now. 5,745 cases made.

name: Merlot California
review: Offers simple cherry and herb flavors, with gritty tannins. 37,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Chihuahua Vineyard
review: A woody style, with flavors of smoked bacon, shoe leather, and dried herb and currant. This medium- to full-bodied red is appealing, yet comes up shy on depth and character. Ends with a cedar-dill aftertaste. Decant. Drink now through 2015. 200 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Forchini Vineyards Old Vine
review: Jammy and juicy, with lively raspberry and licorice aromas and sleek, ripe cherry, licorice and caramel flavors. Drink now through 2016. 240 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Clopton Vineyard
review: Densely structured but still lively, with aromas of boysenberry and sage that lead to layered flavors of blueberry, raspberry and cracked white pepper. Drink now through 2017. 120 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Adel's Vineyard
review: Appealing plum and sage aromas lead to soft, supple flavors of raspberry, caramel and spice. Drink now through 2016. 170 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Conte Vineyard
review: Ripe and jammy up front, with black raspberry and spice accents, followed by a firm core of dry, minerally tannins. Drink now through 2017. 120 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Mounts Vineyard Cypress Block
review: Briary and rustic, with raspberry, underbrush and dried sage accents. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Monte Rosso Vineyard
review: Tightly wound and rather hard, with modest raspberry and mineral flavors. Drink now through 2016. 200 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Krasia May
review: Juicy and full of dark currant, plum and sour cherry flavors, supported by firm acidity and medium-grained tannins. Shows a touch of elegance, with mineral and spice notes on the fresh finish. Drink now through 2016. 48 cases made.

name: Merlot Mendoza Krasia May
review: This ripe red oozes with blackberry, dark plum and boysenberry flavors, offering concentrated notes of dark chocolate and mocha. Hints of mint and green herb dominate the spicy finish. Drink now through 2017. 48 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Grenache South Australia
review: Firm, focused and ripe, this is full-bodied and easy to drink for its blackberry and licorice flavors. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio South Eastern Australia
review: Fresh and appealing, with delicate pear and grapefruit flavors, riding easily on a nubby texture and lingering on the soft finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc South Eastern Australia
review: Light and refreshing, mint and lime taking it halfway to a mojito, finishing with a lilt of acidity. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Australia
review: Light, lean and aromatic, with peach and nutmeg overtones to the citrus flavors, lingering with verve. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Light and crisp, with a strong floral note to the green pear fruit. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio South Eastern Australia
review: Soft and appealing, with lovely pear and citrus flavors, finishing with a touch of sweetness. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Australia
review: Fresh and relatively light, with violet-tinged blackberry and fennel flavors that dance nicely on the finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Light, spicy and plush, with peppery overtones to the berry flavors. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Fresh and spicy, with a dark berry core and peppery overtones. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Australia
review: Bright and lively, with blackberry and spice flavors on a sleek frame. Drink now. 55,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Grenache South Eastern Australia
review: Fresh style has plum fruit, savory undertones and a light finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet South Eastern Australia
review: Earthy flavors are more prominent than the red cherry fruit in this lightweight red. Drink now. 33,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Australia
review: Fresh and inviting, with a fruit-flavored chewing gum note on the soft finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc South Australia
review: Fresh and lively, with a silky texture to the earthy, tangy pineapple and chive flavors. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Australia
review: Supple, with pretty cherry, smoke and floral aromas and flavors, lingering easily. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Moscato South Eastern Australia Wine Ladies Of Gotham
review: Soft, frankly sweet and slightly effervescent, with syrupy pineapple and spice flavors. Drink now. 16,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Horse Heaven Hills Dead Canyon
review: Supple, with a meaty edge to the pretty currant and blackberry fruit, finishing with polish. Drink now. 5,224 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Gone Fishin'
review: Off-dry, with a tangy edge to the lemon and tropical fruit flavors, finishing with pleasant echoes of green guava and banana. Drink now through 2014. 1,704 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles Zinsane
review: Easygoing, with zesty cherry and spice flavors. Drink now through 2016. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Tasmania
review: Bright, supple and lively all at once, this is a vibrant wine with beautiful, white pepper-scented raspberry and plum flavors, hinting at cream. It's balanced, with fresh acidity on the finish. Has distinctive character, depth and length to burn. Drink now through 2006. 450 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Ripe and luscious without losing its elegance and finesse, a mouthful of spicy, toasty berry and chocolate flavors that linger deliciously on the silky finish. Ready now; even better in 1998. 94 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Elerding Vineyard
review: Ripe and exotic, with seductive blackberry, raspberry, cola and coffee flavors that spread across a generous, almost-plush texture. Already appealing. Best from 2000 through 2006. 240 cases made.

name: Rich Harvest Yakima Valley
review: Crisp, with earthy, spicy flavors more prominent than the dark berry and cherry fruit running underneath the firm tannins. Give it time. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best after 2006. 200 cases made.

name: Rich Harvest Yakima Valley
review: Crisp and lively, with ripe currant and delicate herb flavors on a refined frame. The flavors expand and enlarge on the finish, suggesting this will develop with cellaring. Drink now through 2006. 136 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Elerding Vineyard
review: Ripe and generous, a lush mouthful of bright berry, plum and spice flavors, all swirling attractively though the tightly packed finish. Balances freshness and complexity nicely. Best from 1999 through 2002. 170 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Les Vignes De Marcoux
review: A crisp texture lends balance to pretty, bright raspberry and red plum aromas and flavors, which linger on the lively finish. Best from 2009 through 2013. 120 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Ripe and generous, with exotic spice, cedar and tobacco notes weaving through the currant and black cherry flavors. Tannins are well modulated and the flavors echo on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 650 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: Supple and generous, a lively mouthful of blackberry and currant flavors with a tinge of cedar and violet petals echoing on the firm finish. Best from 2002 through 2006. 679 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Elerding Vineyard
review: On the lean side, with earthy, leathery cherry and spice flavors, finishing with a touch of red pepper. Drink now through 2008. 240 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley Reserve
review: Supple and plush, with a lavish layer of spice and toast to complement the fresh plum at the center. An expansive wine, poised for drinking now through 2001. 160 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: This polished red offers appealing mint-scented black currant and cedar flavors on a supple frame. Drink now through 2004. 360 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Elerding Vineyard
review: Smooth and supple, with cedary plum and spice flavors that linger gently on the light finish. Drink now through 2003. 250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley
review: Bright and juicy, lively with acidity against ripe nectarine and grapefruit flavors, finishing with subtle oak character. Drink now through 2006. 400 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Focused and bright, this crisp wine sports jazzy berry and herb flavors that finish with wisps of tea and earth. Nice now, best from 1998 to 1999. 230 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Elerding Vineyard
review: Beneath its fine texture and chewy tannins lurks a taut layer of blackberry and spice flavors struggling to get free. Give it until 2000. 105 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Reserve
review: Tart and ripe at the same time, with dried cherry and blueberry flavors against earthy, cedary oak, finishing lean. Best from 2006 through 2010. 335 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Elerding Vineyard
review: Earthy, chewy style packs a lean core of currant fruit between layers of chunky tannins and cedary notes. Drink now through 2003. 247 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley Reserve
review: Crisp in texture, offering pretty berry and tobacco flavors that remain zingy on the sturdy finish. Tannins want until 1998 to '99. 50 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Deep color and dense flavors, not all of them pretty, with burnt, earthy notes intruding upon the berry flavors. Try in 1999 or 2000 to see how it's resolving. 116 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: Tart, green, earthy and balanced with some ripe berry and currant flavors, even if it comes off as poorly integrated. Best after 2005. 540 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley
review: Odd, chemical aromas and flavors make this taste sour and unpleasant. 266 cases made.

name: Maréchal Foch Minnesota
review: Fresh and grapey, with blueberry fruit and sweet vanilla on the finish. Soft, clean and easy to drink. Drink now. 298 cases made.

name: Riesling Minnesota
review: Pleasant, with light-bodied lime and peach notes and a fresh finish. Drink now. 295 cases made.

name: Riesling Minnesota
review: Peach and floral notes and a bright finish. Not big, but clean and refreshing. Drink now. 270 cases made.

name: Maréchal Foch Minnesota
review: Maturing fast, with raisin aroma and flavor and a slightly sweet finish that fades quickly. 280 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Cs Super Substance Stoneridge Vineyard
review: Ripe and rich, with dried cherry, mint and cardamom flavors that glow brightly against fine-grained tannins, finishing with polish. Drink now through 2020. 619 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley Cs Vineyard Collection Substance Jack's Vineyard
review: Sleek and polished, with medium-bodied but lively blackberry and smoky pepper beef notes that glide easily toward refined tannins. Drink now through 2022. 159 cases made.

name: Bx Super Substance Klein Vineyard Walla Walla Valley
review: Dense and tangy, playing ripe cherry and licorice flavors against hints of tomato leaf and pepper as the finish lingers with firm tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best after 2018. 306 cases made.

name: Cs Substance Columbia Valley
review: Appealing blackberry and espresso aromas lead to modest flavors and chewy tannins. Best after 2018. 100,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Ancient Lakes Of Columbia Valley Sb Super Substance Sunset Vineyard
review: Crisp, with acidity to balance the broad frame and pineapple and pear flavors, picking up herbal notes on the finish. Drink now. 1,045 cases made.

name: Merlot Wahluke Slope Me Super Substance Northridge Vineyard
review: Taut and tangy, with dill and green pepper notes weaving through the root beer flavors, fine tannins wrapping around the finish. Best after 2017. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 502 cases made.

name: Merlot Wahluke Slope Me Vineyard Collection Substance Northridge Vineyard
review: Taut and a bit muddled, with currant, basil and spice flavors. Drink now. 610 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Cs Substance
review: Taut and gripped by tannins, with cherry and smoky herb fruit struggling to push through. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 49,636 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mount Veeder
review: Austere, with trim, tannic wild berry, black cherry and cedar notes. Turns tight and tannic on the finish. Best from 2002 through 2008. 600 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County
review: Tightly wound, but appealing for its black plum, loam and smoky spice aromas and flavors. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Smoky, with exotic notes of gunpowder and sandalwood. Ripe black cherry flavors, leaning toward kirsch notes. Pepper and mineral accents are tasty, supple and balanced. Drink now through 2009. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Tastes dried out, with more tannins and herb flavors than fruit. Drink now. 331 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Nelson
review: Robust plum, black cherry and blackberry flavors come with accents of white pepper, tobacco and spice, showing good persistence on the finish. Drink now through 2025. 1,260 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Nelson
review: Mouthwatering, with tangerine and melon flavors that mingle with the crisp lemon-lime core on a light, tangy body. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Qualitätswein Trocken Südoststeiermark
review: Broad and ripe, it gives an impression of sweetness that is enhanced by a dose of new oak, while maintaining balance and harmony. Ready now.

name: Blauer Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Südoststeiermark Olivin
review: Medium-bodied, concentrated and well balanced. Very fresh, with ripe cherry flavors that carry through on the aftertaste. Well done. Drink now through 2001. 1,660 cases made.

name: Traminer Qualitätswein Trocken Südoststeiermark Kapfenstein Ried Kirchleiten
review: The color is a lurid yellow, but this white displays plenty of spice, rose and grapefruit aromas and flavors, a rich texture and a soft structure. Butter and vanilla accents linger on the finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südoststeiermark Caphenstein Steirische Klassik
review: Floral and citrus aromas yield to a round, easygoing palate showing apple flavors that lack a bit of focus. Drink now.

name: Blauer Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Südoststeiermark
review: A crisp, berry-flavored red for easy quaffing. Simple and direct.

name: Grauburgunder Qualitätswein Trocken Südoststeiermark Kapfensteiner Kogel
review: Lackluster, with only modest peach and spice notes. 580 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Qualitätswein Trocken Südoststeiermark
review: Smells like eggnog, then the butterscotch and vanilla flavors (from new oak) take over. Nowhere in the mix does it say Gewürz. Strange.

name: Proprietor's Barrel Select Rutherford
review: The aromas of herb, olive, cedar and dark berry are mature and refined. Smooth-textured, this offers depth, focus and persistence, with a long finish and touch of loamy earth. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc.2003 California Cabernet blind retrospective (July 2013). Drink now through 2019. 440 cases made.

name: Proprietor's Barrel Select Rutherford
review: Smooth and polished. An elegant style that's supple-textured, with subtle fresh earth, currant, berry, sage and mineral flavors that offer wonderful balance, length and finesse. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2013. 580 cases made.

name: Proprietor's Barrel Select Rutherford
review: Aging gracefully, with supple herb, dried currant, mocha, espresso, tobacco and loamy earth. Full-bodied and well-proportioned, ending with a complex finish and firm yet fine-grained tannins.—2001 California Cabernet blind retrospective (June 2011). Drink now through 2018.

name: Rutherford
review: Smooth, rich and layered, with an elegant mouthfeel to the core of dusty berry, black licorice, savory herb and cedary-cigar box nuances. Ends with chewy tannins and detailed flavors. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Best from 2016 through 2028. 1,170 cases made.

name: Red Wine Frank Family Vineyards Rutherford
review: An elegant style that's ripe, rich and supple, with appealing black cherry, plum and wild berry fruit that turns a bit simpler on the finish. Well-balanced, with ripe tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2015. 670 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: A trim, spicy style reliant on cedary oak for the dominant flavor, this tilts toward dry and edgy on the aftertaste. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2025. 500 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: Features ripe, zesty, dusty wild berry and blackberry notes shaded by cedary oak, losing velocity on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2023. 500 cases made.

name: Rutherford
review: Fading ever so slightly, this features a drying loamy earth edge to the plum and dried currant notes. Tannins are drying too, with a hint of anise and tobacco leaf. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc.—2002 California Cabernet blind retrospective (May 2012). Drink now. 528 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Offers gorgeous fruit, with amazing purity of flavor, delivering rich, concentrated, supple layers of currant, blackberry, black licorice and mocha, with subtle loamy earth. Ends with a long, full and persistent finish. Drink now through 2019. 680 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Firm, ripe, intense and concentrated, focused on a core of earthy currant, dried berry, mineral, sage and herb, which are woven together in an intricate way. Ends with chewy yet polished tannins. Best from 2011 through 2017. 582 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Firm and chunky, a bit rustic, dry and herbal, with mineral, dried currant, sage and cedary oak flavors that finish with a tight yet clipped edge. Drink now through 2013. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Weaves together an enticing mix of herb and currant flavors that are shaded by a touch of mint. Ends with chewy tannins. Drink now through 2012. 300 cases made.

name: Grenache-Shiraz Barossa Valley The Old Barossa Blend
review: Smooth and velvety, with pretty raspberry, guava and dusky spice flavors, lingering well. Drink now through 2010. 700 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley
review: On the tart side, with smoky black cherry flavors on a fine-grained texture, finishing with a lively feel. Drink now through 2014. 800 cases made.

name: Grenache-Shiraz Barossa Valley The Old Barossa Blend
review: Definitely on the earthy side, with a strong gamy note pushing through the ripe cherry and orange peel flavors. Has style and depth, but not everyone will love the flavors. Best from 2006 through 2010. 180 cases made.

name: Grenache-Shiraz Barossa Valley The Old Barossa Blend
review: Has a distinctly gamy character, which grows on the palate against dark, ripe cherry and prune flavors, finishing with fine texture. Drink now through 2008. 170 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley
review: Gamy, smoky flavors wrap around a dense, chewy core of blackberry and pepper flavors, finishing on a cedary note. Best after 2005. 350 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Piercingly vegetal on the nose, with sharp thyme and asparagus notes backed by crisp citrus fruit. A bit too lean in the end.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Watershed
review: Lithe and discreet, with snappy pomegranate and spice flavors. Drink now through 2023. 1,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Grand Reserve
review: Tastes very ripe and fruity, with fresh pear, apple and spice notes. Modest oak shadings peek out from the background. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Grand Reserve
review: Tight, firm and a bit lean, with a spicy core of tart black cherry and currant flavors that are framed by toasty, cedary oak. A young, backward wine that will require cellaring until 1997. A new Napa Valley label. 600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Grand Reserve
review: Soft, silky and spicy, with a nice nutmeg edge to the grapefruit and pear aromas and flavors, finishing with a nice echo of fruit. Drinkable now. 540 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Grand Reserve
review: Tight and earthy, with a leathery edge to the currant and berry flavors, but it should soften a bit. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa County
review: Throws out a lot of flavor, with no pretense at finesse or grace. There's a picklelike edge to the cherry and currant notes, but still a decent everyday red table wine. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa County
review: Soft and velvety, with ripe currant and berry aromas and flavors, a touch of vinegar and sweet oak notes on the finish to wrap it up. Drink soon.

name: Merlot Sonoma County Reserve
review: Earthy, funky, cedary flavors that need more fruit. Finishes with a strange, meaty taste that's not very pleasant. 900 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills
review: Sleek and focused, with fine tannins around a spicy core of red berry, white pepper and violet flavors, gliding easily into a long and expressive finish. Drink now through 2024. 143 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Dundee Hills
review: Fresh and sleek, with pretty melon and lemon curd flavors on a polished frame, lingering easily. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Focused, ripe and generous, with black cherry, plum and tomato leaf flavors, finishing with fine tannins and enough finesse to demand another sip. Drink now through 2017. 1,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills
review: Light and silky, with fragrant raspberry, red cherry, spice and a hint of mint as the finish sails easily. Drink now through 2013. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Dundee Hills Reserve
review: Bright and focused, with pretty nectarine and pear flavors that dance lightly through the finish. Drink now. 151 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Lively, juicy style offers dark plum and blueberry flavors on a racy frame, weaving in pretty spice and oak notes. Drink now through 2004. 295 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Dundee Hills Watershed
review: Crisp and modest in scale, with peach and apricot accents. Drink now. 641 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Watershed
review: Very light and open-textured, with transparency to the modest pomegranate and floral flavors, lingering on the gentle finish. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills
review: Light and tangy, with prominent orange peel and tea notes that linger on the tight finish. Drink now through 2017. 195 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills
review: Firm in texture, with a cooked aspect to the dark berry and candied orange peel flavors, finishing with polish. Drink now through 2016. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Soft and fruity, with modest pear and mineral flavors. Drink now. 325 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Tart and earthy, not pleasant. 600 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Edition Chremisa
review: A ripe, full-bore style, with golden raisin, baked peach, cream and spice. Shows lots of tropical fruit notes as well, including mango and guava. The rich finish features nutmeg and crème fraîche. Drink now through 2015. 1,250 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Pfaffenberg Reserve
review: A light amber color, this offers a rich, creamy essence to the long, lush notes of apple cobbler, pear tart and pastry. Flan hints emerge midpalate, leading to a finish that offers complex, concentrated elements of dried mango and pineapple, graced by smoky hints. Drink now through 2022. 558 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Pfaffenberg Reserve
review: A rich and fruity style, with flavors of ripe pear, baked peach and apple tart, accented by plenty of citrus notes. The plush finish features light smoke hints that lengthen out and add complexity. Drink now through 2020. 558 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Wachtberg Reserve
review: A full-throated, sumptuous version, with concentrated flavors of peach, kiwifruit, and ripe grapefruit, with toothsome notes of lentil in the mix. Apple cobbler, cream and spice details linger on the rich and zesty finish. Drink now through 2017.

name: Riesling Trockenbeerenauslese Niederösterreich
review: An unctuous sweetie, with luscious flavors of apricot, peach and apple pie that show hints of lavender. Very long and spicy midpalate, with plenty of butterscotch and honeyed notes that linger into the pure-tasting finish. Drink now through 2030. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Pfaffenberg
review: Unctuous and rich, with juicy flavors of ripe nectarine, ruby grapefruit, mineral and spice. This is an opulent style that should go well with roasted fish and poultry. Mineral and cream fill the finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,250 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Goldberg Kellermeister Privat
review: A crystalline white, with loads of pippin apple and green peach flavors and a pure, mineral intensity. The clean, powerful finish shows white pepper and smoke. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2014. 4,166 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Kremstal Kremser Wachtberg Reserve
review: This is full of rich minerally notes to the red peach, pippin apple and grapefruit flavors, well-integrated and fleshy. The spicy finish has some savory accents. Drink now through 2020. 400 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Goldberg Kellermeister Privat
review: Concentrated and well-spiced peach cobbler, glazed apricot and apple tart flavors are rich and well-rounded in this medium-bodied white. The finish offers a smoky touch to the dried tropical fruit notes. Drink now through 2022. 5,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Wachtberg
review: There's good power behind the peach, smoke, glazed apricot and spice flavors. Grapefruit, mineral and white pepper season the finish. Drink now through 2013.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Wachtberg
review: Rich and full-bodied, offering an array of fruit and spice flavors, with apricot, ripe peach, mango and nutmeg. The long finish shows red plum, white berries and hints of piecrust. Drink now through 2012. 1,250 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Wachtberg
review: Fresh, rich and intense, with peach, berry and legume flavors weaving throughout. A vivid structure keeps it focused and the peach note keeps on coming, right through the long finish. Drink now through 2015. 1,665 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Wachtberg
review: Ripe, with flavors of quince, mango and pear all wrapped in a blanket of soft butter cream. Plenty of structure, with exotic spice and smoke notes that linger on the finish. Drink now through 2008. 2,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Eiswein Austria Kellermeister Prädikät
review: Lively and fresh, with clean, ripe flavors of peach, smoke and spice. The finish is filled with lanolin and beeswax flavors and nice lemon notes. Try with a fruit tart. Drink now. 40 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Pfaffenberg
review: Redolent of fresh-cut apple and peach, this is very crunchy and fresh-tasting. Turns ripe and creamy on the broad, dense and slightly smoky finish. Drink now through 2013. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kellermeister Privat
review: A blast of pure, unadorned Chardonnay, this delivers ripe apple, fennel, lemon and mineral aromas and flavors in a densely textured, focused presentation. Fine length and harmony. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2005.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Edition Chremisa
review: Crisp apple and peach flavors fill this firm Grüner. Very stony and minerally on the finish, with good snap. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2012. 2,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Wachtberg
review: Aromas and flavors of peach, apricot and melon dominate this very fresh-tasting Grüner. The spicy finish features notes of cream and honeysuckle. Drink now through 2013. 1,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Pfaffenberg
review: This is filled with ruby grapefruit and Bosc pear flavors that are focused and crisp. Firmly structured, with plenty of citrus and spice notes on the finish. Best from 2009 through 2013. 1,250 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Pfaffenberg
review: Shows distinctive mineral scents, picking up more fruit—peach, citrus—and opulence on the palate. Good underlying firmness keeps it focused and persistent through the finish. Drink now through 2008. 2,500 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kellermeister Reserve
review: There's impressive focus and density to the ripe, intense mocha, dark plum and kirschlike flavors. The powerful finish shows spice and dark chocolate. Drink now through 2012. 2,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Ried Sandgrube
review: There's some power and heft behind the well-sculpted flavors of baked apple, mango, peach and ripe pear. Pure-tasting and minerally on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 8,333 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Edition Chremisa
review: Shows a creamy aroma, with flavors of peach, dried savory herb and lime. Finishes with mineral and spice. Try with roast pork. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2012. 583 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Goldberg Kellermeister Privat
review: An open-textured white, with some dried herbal notes to the fresh-cut pippin apple, pear and grapefruit flavors. Offers a straightforward, minerally character. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Goldberg Kellermeister Privat
review: Juicy and fruity, offering peach and white cherry flavors accented by honeysuckle notes, with salted almond accents on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 3,333 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Goldberg Kellermeister Privat
review: Tightly wound, with powerful grapefruit and pippin apple flavors, followed by lots of mineral and spice on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 4,167 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Goldberg Kellermeister Privat
review: Exotic aromas and flavors of passion fruit, apricot and kiwi fruit mark this supple Grüner Veltliner. It's delicate, with a citrusy acidity and moderate length. Drink now through 2012. 4,165 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Ried Sandgrube
review: This has a fresh appeal, showing peach, lentil and slatelike flavors, with bursts of tangerine. Celery and appealing hints of root vegetables fill the finish. Drink now through 2009. 20,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Sandgrube Edition Chremisa
review: Ripe aromas and flavors of peach, apricot and pear give this plenty of richness. Creamy and minerally on the taut finish. Drink now through 2014.

name: Riesling Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kremsleiten Kellermeister Privat
review: A spicy, pungent federspiel/kabinett that shows good depth on an elegant framework. Forward and light, with immediate appeal. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2000. 1,665 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kremsleiten Kellermeister Privat
review: Very crisp and fresh-tasting, with a zesty cast to the citrus and pear flavors. Hints of savory herb on the finish remind me of a Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now. 6,667 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Reserve
review: Blueberry aromas and flavors fill this spicy, vibrant red, which shows licorice, raspberry and cream on the rich finish. Drink now.

name: Blauer Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Edition Chremisa
review: Has a silky texture, with plenty of zip to the cherry, plum and red currant flavors. Raspberry and cream fill the finish. Drink now through 2010. 1,250 cases made.

name: Blauer Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Edition Chremisa
review: Snappy, with plenty of raspberry and blueberry pie flavors. Creamy finish features nutmeg notes. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2009. 500 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Ried Sandgrube
review: Fresh-tasting, with flavors of apple, pear and spice. The crisp finish features plenty of spicy notes. Drink now. 8,333 cases made.
