name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Niederösterreich Kremser Sandgrube
review: White pepper notes season the McIntosh apple flavors in this crunchy white. The juicy finish of citrus zest lends this a snappy character. Drink now. 17,128 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Goldberg Kellermeister Privat
review: Rich and smoky, with firm flavors of baked apple and ripe grapefruit that carry some petrol notes. Finishes dry and spicy. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Wachtberg
review: Ripe and rich, offering legume, grapefruit and white pepper flavors. Though there's acidity and a hint of bitterness shoring up the structure, it's loosely-knit and seems a bit flat. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Kremser Goldberg Kellermeister Privat
review: A creamy aroma leads to ripe, well-rounded flavors of peach, grapefruit and lentil that extend on the firm finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Kremser Sandgrube
review: Fresh and fruity, with notes of savory dried herb to the green apple and Meyer lemon flavors, backed by firm acidity. Dried apricot and grapefruit details linger on the finish. Drink now. 17,128 cases made.

name: Rheinriesling Kabinett Kremstal Kremser Pfaffenberg Hauerinnung Krems-Stein
review: Dry and steely, with an intensity and nervosité that keep the nutty, minerally character lively and persistent. A little severe, it should improve with time or food. Not imported into the U.S. Best from 2001 through 2006. 1,250 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Pfaffenberg
review: Very minerally tasting, with citrus and green peach flavors, and a pure-tasting, crisp finish. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Pfaffenberg
review: Ripe and fragrant, with ample flesh covering the bones, yet lively with floral and spice notes. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2008.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Goldberg Kellermeister Privat
review: An austere style. Ripe yet restrained in its expression of grapefruit, mineral and tobacco and backed by firm acidity, it has the structure for food. Not imported into the U.S. Best from 2000 through 2005. 3,330 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Niederösterreich Ried Sandgrube
review: Green pear, white peach and mineral flavors are fresh and crisp in this medium-bodied white. Hints of anise chime in on the finish. Drink now. 13,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Niederösterreich Ried Sandgrube
review: Firm, with an herbal cast to the apple and citrus flavors, followed by lots of tangy grapefruit notes on the crisp finish. Drink now. 1,700 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Niederösterreich Ried Sandgrube
review: Fresh and crisp, showing good density to the citrus, mineral and ripe white fruit flavors. Finishes with a fennel-like note. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Niederösterreich
review: The green apple and grapefruit flavors are focused and fresh-tasting in this crisp white. Sea salt and hints of green herbs show on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal
review: Crunchy, with lots of peach flavors and lemon zest notes. The crisp, spicy finish is refreshing and lively. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Kremser Pfaffenberg
review: Offers a touch of cream on the nose, with apple, pear and citrus flavors, which linger with spicy notes on the finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Blauer Zweigelt Qualitätswein Kremstal St.-Severin
review: Fresh and juicy, with lively flavors of red plum and berry, followed by hints of tobacco leaf on the finish. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kellermeister Privat
review: Like peaches and cream, this unadorned Chardonnay is thick and rich, gaining structure from a touch of bitter citrus peel at the finish. Drink now. 1,665 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Goldberg Kellermeister Privat
review: Intense and minerally, this white displays grapefruit peel, bitter almond and peach flavors backed by acidity that borders on tartness. Needs food with herbs or root vegetables. Drink now through 2001. 2,500 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Niederösterreich Edition Chremisa
review: This has ripe citrus and tropical fruit flavors that are firm, and filled with lemon verbena notes. Candied ginger accents mark the finish. Drink now. 2,490 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Wachtberg
review: Floral and grapey, more like a Muscat, this white shows a lively structure and juicy texture, with a moderately long finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2005.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Wein Manufaktur
review: This has crisp flavors of grapefruit and mineral, with smoky notes on the juicy finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Weinzierl
review: This has a nice snap to the grapefruit, stone and lightly spiced flavors, with a soft, peachy finish. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich
review: This offers a minerally mix of ripe apple and red peach flavors that carry some smoky notes. Medium-weight, with an open-textured finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kremsleiten Kellermeister Privat
review: Taut like a drum, this white resonates with peach and orange on a racy, focused framework. Try with seafood or lemon chicken. Best from 2001 through 2004. 2,165 cases made.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kellermeister Privat
review: An elegant, light- to medium-bodied red, offering pure cherry flavor, that is densely textured and long. Serve slightly chilled with charcuterie. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2004.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kellermeister Privat
review: Oodles of blackberry and spice along with vibrant acidity and firm tannins add up to a very pleasurable young red. Should develop well over the next few years. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2001. 2,000 cases made.

name: Blauer Zweigelt Qualitätswein Niederösterreich St.-Severin
review: Juicy, with straightforward red berry and dried cherry flavors, and a tannic finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kellermeister Privat
review: Lean and crisp, without a lot of expression or depth of flavor, yet a refreshing quaff for its lemon and apple flavors. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Goldberg Kellermeister Privat
review: Strong almond component marks this white, which starts off rich, then turns firm and coarse on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2003.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Goldberg Kellermeister Privat
review: Racy, this boasts green bean and citrus flavors on a lean, modestly concentrated frame. Ends on a tobacco note. Best with light dishes. Drink now through 2002. 3,330 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Goldberg Kellermeister Privat
review: Dry and spicy. Nicely balanced, with moderate structure for early drinking. Flavors of herbs and minerals. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Sandgrube
review: Succulent. Interesting character of red cherry, almond and lemon. Fresh, with a clean, lingering finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Kremser Weinzierl
review: White pepper and tarragon notes are fresh and juicy in this straightforward white, with notes of orange peel on the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kremsleiten Kellermeister Privat
review: A straightforward white, tasting of apples and almonds. Moderate concentration and finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Pfaffenberg
review: More structure than flavor here, with a firmness but not an equal density and concentration of apple and mineral notes. Compact and short. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Niederösterreich Rosé
review: This offers a mix of dried cherry and herb flavors supported by fresh acidity. Stony notes on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kellermeister Privat
review: Fresh berry and red plum flavors dominate this medium-bodied red. Finishes with notes of sandalwood. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kellermeister Privat
review: Lively red, with medium-bodied flavors of plum, roasted red pepper, and hints of paprika. Peppery finish. Drink now. 6,665 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kellermeister Privat
review: Very pure and straightforward, evoking cherry notes on a moderately concentrated and structured framework. Drink now. 3,333 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Rosé
review: A juicy rosé, with a hint of spritz and flavors of melon and strawberry. The fresh finish turns a touch tart. Drink now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kremsleiten Kellermeister Privat
review: Lean, firm and spicy, with modest apple and peach notes on a vibrant structure. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Weissburgunder Spätlese Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kellermeister Privat
review: Subdued in its apple aromas and flavors, this wine is rich in texture, yet falls short on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 665 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kellermeister Privat
review: Shows a meaty aroma, with tight, tannic flavors of berry and dried cherry, and hints of astringency on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kellermeister Privat
review: Good concentration to the cassis and pepper flavors, but turns a tad bitter on the finish. Drink now. 6,665 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kellermeister Privat
review: Light and one-dimensional, showing a cherry flavor that is backed by firm tannins. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Blauburgunder Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kellermeister Privat
review: Light and fruity, displaying red cherry and black pepper elements with a straightforward, easygoing manner. Enjoy slightly chilled. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kellermeister Privat
review: Rich and round, this up-front style shows pear and gooseberry aromas and flavors. Crisp finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Goldberg Kellermeister Privat
review: Medium-bodied and a touch rustic, with apple, lentil and tobacco notes backed by firm acidity. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kremsleiten Kellermeister Privat
review: Reduced, unappealing aroma, followed by simple citrus flavors. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Sandgrube
review: Broad and a bit blunt, exhibiting cut apple and almond flavors, moderate concentration and ending on a bitter grapefruit note. 6,665 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kellermeister Privat
review: Plenty of structure here, both acidity and tannin, but the cherry and chocolate flavors lacks focus, tasting stewed. 2,500 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Goldberg Kellermeister Privat
review: Light apple and pear flavors mark this dilute, simple white. Not imported into the U.S.

name: Weissburgunder Spätlese Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kellermeister Privat
review: Soft and innocuous. Spicy, but also earthy in aroma, then it takes on an apricot flavor in the mouth. Not imported into the U.S.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kellermeister Privat
review: There are clove and tobacco elements in the aroma, but the cherry and spice flavors are dilute and the finish is curt and tannic. Not imported into the U.S. 1,665 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Trocken Kremstal Kremser Kremsleiten Kellermeister Privat
review: Apricot aromas turn crisp and lean on the palate. Not much flavor or harmony here. Not imported into the U.S.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
review: Delicate but rich in flavor, developing complexity as you sip it. Blends peach, floral and melon flavors in a sweet but well-balanced package. Has charming flavors and a steely backbone.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Michelsberg
review: Aromatic, crisp, flavorful and delicately sweet, but balanced with lively acidity and plenty of peach, pine and apple aromas and flavors. Has enough balance to drink before or during a meal.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Zeltinger Himmelreich
review: Blends the classic Riesling flavors of peach, pine and mineral together in a crisp, straightforward, off-dry package. Charming and true to type. Drink now.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
review: Tart, taut and lemony, an austere wine that goes for structure rather than charm. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: Overtly earthy flavors override the basic peach and apricot component. Simple, but good.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Michelsberg
review: Peachy, grapey and sweet, with a soft texture and light body. Simple and pleasant.

name: Pinot Blanc Beerenauslese Neusiedlersee
review: Delicate, with honey and apricot character and medium sweetness balanced by refreshing acidity, keeping everything lively and pulsing through the finish. Hints of orange add depth to the flavors. Not imported into the U.S. 450 cases made.

name: Blauer Zweigelt Qualitätswein Weinviertel
review: Elegant, showing currant and strawberry flavors. Medium-bodied, with refreshing, vibrant acidity. Should match light meat and poultry dishes. Drink now through 2000. 5,830 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Weinviertel
review: Herbal flavors are prominent, but the overall presentation is a bit blunt, with bitterness on the finish. 16,665 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Burgenland Classic
review: This medium-bodied red is filled with snappy flavors of savory and meat. Offers opulent notes of espresso and dark chocolate that extend on the fresh and lively finish. Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Burgenland
review: Very firm and minerally, with plenty of fresh acidity behind the currant, berry and pomegranate flavors. Mocha-filled finish. Drink now through 2013. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Burgenland
review: Medium-bodied, with red plum and dried berry flavors and a short, cola-infused finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Vine Pruners McLaren Vale-Langhorne Creek
review: Ripe and generous, a lively mouthful of wild red berry, red currant and plum fruit, with earthy, mineral notes sneaking in around the edges, all of it lasting on the lively finish. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best from 2004 through 2010. 300 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Rare
review: A solid red, with pretty blackberry and cherry flavors, shaded with anise and pepper, finishing with suppleness and grace. Drink now through 2008. 300 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc McLaren Vale
review: Bright, focused and spicy, with gentle hints of herb mingling with the pretty nectarine and pear flavors. Delicious now. 300 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Trad
review: Soft and earthy, with gamy notes surrounding the supple core of black cherry and plum, finishing with an exotic feel. Drink now through 2008. 800 cases made.

name: Vine Pruners McLaren Vale-Langhorne Creek
review: An exotic, firm-textured red, with distinct smoky, gamy notes adding character to the basic black cherry and menthol flavors as they linger on the finish. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2007. 800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot McLaren Vale-Langhorne Creek
review: Soft and generous, with pretty blackberry, violet and spice flavors that echo nicely on the supple finish. Drink now through 2006. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Rare
review: Definitely on the gamy side, with a decadent edge to the dried cherry flavors, finishing a bit chunky. Drink now through 2005. 300 cases made.

name: Verdelho McLaren Vale Limited Release
review: Soft, round and fruity, generous with its apple and floral flavors. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale R.S.W.
review: Deep, dark, dense and focused, with masses of plum, cherry, spice and earth flavors exploding in the mouth, and persisting intensely through the chewy finish. Needs time to settle down. Best from 2005 through 2015. 250 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale R.S.W.
review: Deep, dark, dense and complex, this ripe, complex mouthful of plum, prune, exotic spice and cedar flavors spreads exuberantly across the palate, then lingers on the finish. A powerful wine with great style. Best from 2000 through 2010. 1,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale RSW
review: Vibrant, focused and pure in flavor, this supple version offers blackberry and wild blueberry at the core, hinting at espresso and white pepper as the finish lingers expressively. Drink now through 2016. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale Dead Ringer
review: This supple and open-textured red offers a pretty chocolate note weaving through its dark berry and floral flavors, which come together smoothly on the expressive finish. Shows presence and persistence. Drink now through 2020. 150 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Plush and velvety, with plum and blueberry fruit down deep at the core, under layers of spicy oak, coffee and cedar notes that mingle impressively on the long finish. Best from 2005 through 2012. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale R.S.W.
review: Dense, juicy, heady stuff, distinctive for the floral and anise notes weaving through the rich, sharply focused blackberry, plum and black pepper flavors. A muscular, stylish wine that needs time to mellow. Best from 2005 through 2015. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale RSW
review: A meaty edge adds interest to the focused currant and plum fruit, wrapped with a layer of fairly gritty tannins. Finishes with intensity. Needs time to soften the tannins. Best after 2014. 50 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale RSW
review: Supple, round and open-textured, a generous mouthful of dark berry, plum, licorice and toasted bread flavors that lingers easily. Drink now through 2017. 1,150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale Dead Ringer
review: Bright and juicy, with a distinct blueberry note adding charm to the savory, meaty, tarry notes as it all lingers beautifully against refined tannins. Drink now through 2013. 125 cases made.

name: Church Block McLaren Vale
review: Firm and appealing, with generous cherry and pear flavors, finishing with a hint of grapefruit as the finish lingers. Has freshness and depth. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Best from 2016 through 2020. 500 cases imported.

name: Church Block McLaren Vale
review: An open-textured style, this balanced red lets its red berry, currant and warm brick aromatics infuse the medium-weight structure, remaining focused through the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Drink now through 2017. 50,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Catapult
review: Smooth and inviting, this lithe style lets the blackberry, licorice, smoke and cream flavors cascade into a long and deftly balanced finish. Drink now through 2017. 6,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Catapult
review: Distinctly savory and spicy, with licorice, roasted red pepper and grilled meat notes adding to the red berry flavors. Finishes with intensity. Best from 2014 through 2018. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale R.S.W.
review: Very firm and chewy, with dense blackberry and plum flavors shaded with black pepper and licorice as the tannins clamp on the finish. The fruit still prevails. Best from 2008 through 2014. 400 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Woodhenge
review: Firm in texture, with pretty blueberry and currant fruit at the core, finishing with a touch of cream on the medium frame. Best from 2014 through 2018. 6,000 cases made.

name: Church Block McLaren Vale
review: Dense and chewy, with robust blackberry, blueberry and dark chocolate notes. A vibrant, juicy thread keeps the flavors vibrant, finishing on a firming, brewed black tea detail. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Drink now through 2022. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Church Block McLaren Vale
review: Spicy, with a smoky tobacco note weaving through the dark berry flavors, finishing with finesse. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Drink now through 2016. 40,000 cases made.

name: Church Block McLaren Vale
review: Polished, focused and brimming with blueberry, currant and cedar flavors, pointing into the long, lively finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Drink now through 2012. 50,000 cases made.

name: Church Block McLaren Vale
review: Dense, dark, supple and harmonious, juicy enough to support the deep cherry, plum and spice flavors, which echo strongly on the rich finish. Manages to show some refinement, too. Drink now through 2010. 1,200 cases imported.

name: Church Block McLaren Vale
review: Beautifully balanced. Very fruity and generous, yet seriously structured on firm acid and tannins. Has an exotic mint and tamarind aroma, followed by full, complex flavors of plum and cherry and a tart, lingering finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale Rosé
review: Lively, distinctive and generous in flavor, this dry rosé delivers layers of flavor, offering Montmorency cherry, pomegranate and spice aromas and flavors, lingering nicely on the finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Mrs. Wigley Rosé McLaren Vale
review: Light and refined, with a silky texture and lovely watermelon and raspberry flavors, lingering delicately on the soft, dry finish. Grenache. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Riesling South Australia Hand Picked
review: Bright and generous with its nectarine, pear and floral aromas and flavors, finishing with a mineral character that lasts impressively on the dry finish. Drink now through 2015. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Catapult
review: Plush and juicy, with a tangy cranberry accent to the cherry and plum flavors, mint and sage overtones and generous finish. Drink now through 2030. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Woodhenge
review: Dark and dense, but with a zing of acidity to keep it in balance, offering blackberry, tar and bittersweet chocolate flavors that linger nicely. Drink now through 2013. 2,525 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Viognier McLaren Vale Catapult
review: Supple, silky and generous with its blackberry, floral and spice flavors, lingering on the seductive finish. Drink now through 2015. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale Dead Ringer
review: Tightly wound, with dense blackberry flavors that have accents of mineral, sage and black licorice. Shows plenty of concentration and firmness. Drink now through 2027. 360 cases imported.

name: Church Block McLaren Vale
review: Firm and juicy, featuring black cherry and licorice flavors set on a medium body, with firming tannins, floral accents and cedar and white pepper hints that linger on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Drink now through 2028. 500 cases imported.

name: Church Block McLaren Vale
review: Velvety and ripe, this modest version offers plenty of blackberry and floral flavors, cruising past a layer of fine tannins and lingering on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Drink now through 2018. 2,500 cases imported.

name: Church Block McLaren Vale
review: Fresh and vibrant, with a tangy green olive note weaving through the dark berry flavors. Finishes with finesse. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Drink now through 2016. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale The Absconder
review: Balanced between juicy raspberry and wild strawberry flavors, with toast and cream soda accents. Smooth tannins and fresh herb details show on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 60 cases imported.

name: Scrubby Rise Red Fleurieu
review: Firm, velvety, generous with its plum-centered, gently spicy flavors, achieving a lovely balance that lets the fruit sing without losing its fine-grained frame. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2005. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Firm, rich and nicely focused to concentrate its dark berry, pepper and anise flavors into a solid beam that persists on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Catapult Elevated Vineyards
review: Licorice, vanilla bean and eucalyptus notes accent the cherry and berry flavors. Juicy and plush on the finish. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale R.S.W.
review: Dark, dense and spicy, with gritty tannins around a core of blackberry and black pepper flavors, finishing strong, but with just an hint of bitterness. Best from 2003 through 2010. 94 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Adelaide-Coonawarra The Angelus
review: Soft as a pillow, with ripe currant, plum and prune flavors that pick up hints of earth and game on the generous finish. Atypical for Cabernet, but a lovely drink. Drink now through 2005. 275 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay McLaren Vale Scrubby Rise Unoaked
review: Light and sleek, this white brims with fruit, offering pear, caramel and cream flavors that linger easily. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Church Block McLaren Vale
review: Lithe and lively, nicely balanced and appealing for its pure blueberry and currant fruit, nicely framed with a touch of spicy oak. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Best from 2007 through 2011. 1,664 cases imported.

name: Church Block McLaren Vale
review: Dense, smooth and packed with blackberry, cherry and smoky spice flavors, easing up a bit fast on the finish, but it's a generous mouthful. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Drink now through 2008. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Church Block McLaren Vale
review: Bright and pretty. A firm-textured, light-structured red with ripe berry and peppery flavors that linger on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Drink now through 2001. 20,000 cases made.

name: Church Block South Australia
review: Bright and juicy, a lively mouthful of blackberry, cherry and a touch of mushroom as the flavors echo on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Drink now through 2005. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Riesling Fleurieu Hand Picked
review: Light, bright and silky in texture, with pretty nectarine and apricot notes weaving through the citrus and mineral flavors. Drink now through 2007. 400 cases imported.

name: Scrubby Rise White Fleurieu
review: Bright and appealing for its juicy pear, citrus and lavishly floral flavors, weaving in a touch of honeysuckle on the finish. Sémillon, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale-Coonawarra The Angelus
review: Firm and fresh-tasting, with pretty blueberry and currant flavors on a crisp, nicely defined framework. Drink now through 2003. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Australia Scrubby Rise
review: Bright and appealing for its lively pear and citrus flavors, finishing on the light side. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Church Block McLaren Vale
review: Firm in texture, with pretty blueberry and cedar notes weaving through the medium-weight frame. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Drink now through 2011. 53,300 cases made.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale Mrs. Wigley Rosé
review: Neon pink, with sour-candy raspberry flavors on a tart frame. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Original Blend McLaren Vale
review: Supple and generous, though not heavy, with pretty red plum and tarry flavors lingering on the smooth finish. Grenache and Shiraz. Drink now through 2000. 4,000 cases made.

name: Original Blend McLaren Vale-Barossa Valley
review: Firm in texture and generous with its spicy flavors that remind of cherry and beet as they linger on the mildly chewy finish. Best after 2002. 650 cases imported.

name: Scrubby Rise Red Fleurieu
review: On the lighter side, with some jazzy blackberry fruit at the center, ringing nicely on the clean, slick finish. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Scrubby Rise White Adelaide
review: Fresh and inviting, with floral accents to the pear flavors, finishing with a touch of lime. Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Viognier. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Scrubby Rise White Adelaide
review: Light and crisp, with a green pepper edge to the lime flavors. Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Viognier. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Scrubby Rise White South Australia
review: Ripe, bright and appealing for its juicy tropical fruit, pear and slightly herbal flavors, finishing round and soft. Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Viognier. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Catapult
review: Has density, depth and a layer of lavender over a core of black cherry and smoke, finishing with licorice and pepper notes. Best from 2016 through 2019. 400 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale RSW
review: Bright and tangy cherry and raspberry flavors have herbal accents and a note of white pepper, on a lean frame, finishing juicy. Drink now. 60 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale RSW
review: This sturdy style offers meaty, spicy blackberry flavors, coming together on the firm finish. Best after 2015. 170 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale RSW
review: Smooth and round, with ripe plum and berry flavors that linger well. A slight burnt coffee edge intrudes on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 536 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Viognier McLaren Vale Catapult
review: This is on the lighter side, with a polish to the texture, but there's a bitter edge to the wild berry and currant fruit. It all lingers well, but the flavors could be a problem. Best after 2009. 4,500 cases made.

name: Church Block McLaren Vale
review: A bit thick and earthy, with ripe berry and plum flavors to balance. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Drink now through 2006. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale Rosé Mrs. Wigley
review: A lively, dry rosé, with nice lift to its delicate raspberry and floral flavors. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Scrubby Rise Adelaide
review: On the lighter side, with soft, pleasant raspberry and oatmeal flavors. Slightly prickly tannins accent the finish. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Scrubby Rise White McLaren Vale
review: Fresh and distinctive for its herbal, earthy flavors, finishing with a touch of apple and lemon character. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Supple and generous, with a gamy edge to the ripe berry flavors, finishing with a touch of black pepper on the polished finish. Drink now through 2004.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale RSW
review: Lean, with an herbal side and a cranberry and strawberry core. The tannins are a tad coarse, but a floral accent adds some charm. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Australia Scrubby Rise
review: Smooth and appealing for its plum and spice flavors, which persist through the firm finish. Drink now through 2005. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Lots of smoke, tar and tart berry fruit in a rich, slightly tannic style th at's also got some fleshiness. Flavors are delicious now, but it's built fo r another two to five years aging.

name: Scrubby Rise Red Adelaide
review: Taut and focused, with a hard edge to the tobacco-accented red berry and cinnamon flavors, finishing with density. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Best after 2015. 9,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay McLaren Vale
review: Bright and polished, a smooth style that offers modest apple and citrus flavors. Drink now. 165 cases imported.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale
review: Light and chewy, with a green, leafy edge to the raspberry and spice flavors. Drink now through 2005. 500 cases imported.

name: Scrubby Rise White Adelaide
review: Lean and crisp, with modest lime and pear flavors that finish on the refreshing side. Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Viognier. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Earthy, gamy notes weave through the ripe berry and plum flavors, finishing a bit puckery. Drink now through 2009. 400 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale Dead Ringer
review: Soft and ripe, with a cooked cabbage note competing against concentrated cherry and chocolate flavors. Not for all tastes. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Chardonnay McLaren Vale David Paxton's Hillstowe Vineyard
Shiraz Margaret River
review: Firm in texture, with black cherry and black olive flavors prominent, remaining lively and peppery through the finish. Drink now through 2008. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River
review: Distinctive for its aromatic violet and peppery herb accents to the pear and pineapple flavors, finishing soft and generous. Drink now through 2007. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Australia Single Vineyard
review: Bright and lively. A juicy mouthful of white grapefruit, pear and gentle spices that remains vibrant right through the long, generous finish. Drink now through 2011. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Australia Single Vineyard
review: Juicy and refreshing, a lively mouthful of pineapple, grapefruit and delicate wafts of spices, all of which linger on the open-textured finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,374 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Pemberton Reserve
review: Toast and almond aromas and flavors are more prominent than the light fruit character in this mild-mannered Chardonnay, whose flavors linger well. Drink now through 2012. 200 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Western Australia
review: Ripe and round, with pretty pear, caramel and spice notes echoing on the smooth, polished finish. Touched by oak but not overwhelmed by it. Drink now through 2002. 200 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Pemberton Unwooded
review: Crisp and lively, with zingy acidity and citrusy flavors along with the green apple fruit. Drink now through 2009. 3,086 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Australia Aquercus Unwooded
review: Bright and jazzy, a very pretty wine with focused apple, pear and citrus flavors that keep singing on the lively finish. A touch of earthiness cuts through the finish. Drink now through 2002. 300 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Western Australia Single Vineyard
review: Bright and lively, with a nice apricot note adding interest to the green apple and citrus flavors. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Western Australia Single Vineyard
review: Light and tangy, a refreshing style, with pretty citrus and pear flavors, lingering gently. Drink now. 1,108 cases made.

name: Grenache-Shiraz McLaren Vale-Margaret River
review: Ripe and velvety, with pretty blackberry, mint and anise flavors on a supple frame. Drink now through 2002. 400 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Margaret River
review: Firm in texture, with a solid core of blackberry and currant flavors, shaded with hints of green pepper, mint and tomato among the fine-grained tannins on the finish. Best from 2001 through 2005. 300 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River Aquercus Unwooded
review: Pale in color and refreshing for its delicate green apple and lime flavors. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Western Australia Coat Door
review: Ripe and generous, with a nice array of pear and spice flavors. A lovely mouthful of freshness that has more Chardonnay fruit up front than on the finish. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Merlot Western Australia
review: Earthy, gamy notes weave through the modest blackberry character in this hard-edged red, echoing herbal and gamy flavors. Best from 2000 through 2004. 400 cases imported.

name: Old Vines Classic Red Margaret River
review: Light, supple in texture, with a strong minty-herbal note, almost vegetal, running through the plum and berry. Finishes soft. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Grenache-Shiraz McLaren Vale-Margaret River
review: Firm, almost astringent, with earthy, sour notes intruding upon a lingering core of blackberry and spice flavors that come through on the lean finish. Drink now through 2004. 500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Wonderfully fleshy, with peach, apple, nectarine and citrus flavors that are ripe, lush and very refreshing. The details linger on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright, ripe and generous with its lemony pear and quince flavors. Distinctive and lingering on the deftly balanced finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Marlborough
review: Crisp in texture, buttery in flavor, oak aging adding a creamy veneer to the pear and lees flavors, persisting nicely on the long finish. Drink now through 2006. 20,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Marlborough
review: Bright, tangy and creamy all at the same time, with lime-scented pear and honey flavors that keep singing through the round finish. Drink now through 2005. 10,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Wairau Valley
review: Cherry and berry flavors are bright and succulent in this smooth-bodied red. Tobacco, spice and toast notes fill in on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Pear and citrus flavors are juicy and bright, with terrific intensity and aromatic accents of peach blossom lingering on the finish. Drink now. 28,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Wairau Valley
review: Crisp and vibrant, this is lively with grapefruit, lemon and pineapple fruit, lingering on the racy finish. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Bright, tangy cherry and pomegranate flavors are polished and smooth, accented with clove and spice details on the finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Tightly wound, with a solid core of intensity to tangy raspberry, fresh herb and game meat flavors. Spice, cedar and orange skin notes accent a firm finish. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Crisp, jazzy style emphasizes currant and berry flavors on a lean, lively frame, picking up hints of spice and caramel on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Rosé
review: The wild strawberry and cranberry notes are crisp and spicy, with notes of toast and orange zest. Drink now. 970 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Wairau Valley
review: Aromatic, with rose petal and thyme accents to the raspberry and cherry flavors, showing plenty of red licorice notes, a juicy edge and taut tannins. Drink now through 2026. 600 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Round and fruity, supporting its peach, lime and apple flavors with a zing acidity, finishing with appealing intensity. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Rarangi Single Vineyard
review: The lemongrass, lemon and Key lime flavors are juicy and bright, with orange zest and crisp green apple notes at the core. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: A lithe, supple style, offering floral, currant and berry flavors on a polished frame, echoing nicely on the soft finish. Drink now through 2005. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Light-bodied but very intense, with notes of green apple and lime set on a sleek and juicy frame, accented by a touch of lemon verbena. Drink now. 25,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Citrus and herbal notes are enhanced by ripe peach and nectarine flavors, with juicy acidity and a fleshy texture. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Tart and juicy, showing lime, grapefruit, herb and apple flavors that echo on the edgy finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Polished and glassy-smooth, with passion fruit and lime flavors rounded with a nice touch of peach, and not as tart as some Marlborough Sauvignon Blancs. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Wairau Valley
review: Shows good intensity to the juicy melon, ruby grapefruit and orange zest flavors, with a spicy edge and a touch of matcha green tea on the finish. Drink now. 18,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Marlborough
review: Crisp and refreshing, this simple style has green apple and floral flavors. Feels a bit raw, but should settle down quickly. Drink now through 2002. 4,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Grass, mineral, green pear and lime flavors have very good depth, with intense stoniness extending through the finish. Drink now. 150,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Open-textured, with very good intensity to grapefruit, guava and lemon-lime flavors. Stone, grass and mineral accents highlight the finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Wairau Valley
review: The tangy passion fruit, lime and lemon flavors are aromatic and balanced, with a crisp finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Wairau Valley
review: Lemon, lime and apricot flavors have a touch of green tea, a refreshing acidity and lemongrass notes on the finish. Drink now. 7,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Wairau Valley
review: Light-bodied and fresh, with juicy, lemony notes and accents of grapefruit zest. Drink now. 16,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Herbal, minty aromas make this distinctive, and the fresh apple flavors weave through the sweetish finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Cherry and cranberry flavors have a pleasant pluck of tartness, with a mineral and strongly earthy presence. Thick tannins. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Leathery flavors dominate berry, fresh herb and cedar tones. Hard-edged tannins linger. 8,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Lithe, silky and gorgeously proportioned, this plays out its floral and spice-accented cherry, cassis and mineral flavors gracefully. There's harmony and depth to spare. Drink now through 2020. 397 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Rich, supple and complex, a lovely mouthful of apple, pear, hazelnut and spice flavors that keep swirling throughout the finish. Delicious now; will be even better in 1997. 144 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Lithe, supple and generous with its ripe blackberry, currant and smoky, ever so slightly earthy spice flavors that last on the refined, polished finish, giving the wine and elegance and a restraint that makes it all the more compelling. Drink now through 2012. 405 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Sweet Signé Eola Hills
review: Sweet and tangy at the same time, artfully balanced to point up its sweet apple, pineapple and citrus flavors, finishing with a flourish. Drink now through 2010. 119 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Dense and focused, with a distinct minerality to the cherry and cassis flavors, which keep dancing lightly through the refined, harmonious finish. Needs time to soften the edges. Best from 2013 through 2020. 3,189 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Claim No. 51
review: Ripe and lively, a juicy mouthful of black cherry and tangy, slightly green blackberry coming together into a distinctive, appealing finish. Needs time to settle down. Best from 2006 through 2010. 45 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Hanson
review: Dark, ripe and focused, with good density to the blackberry, cola and spice flavors, coming together harmoniously against refined tannins as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2020. 144 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Ripe and generous, spicy with new oak but also concentrated with blueberry, plum and berry fruit, blending nicely on the long finish. Will be better with cellaring. Best from 2006 through 2012. 804 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Rich, ripe and focused, with nicely articulated blueberry, black cherry and toasty spice flavors mingling nicely and echoing on the solid finish. Has a graceful feel despite its fullness and intensity. Best after 2003. 512 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Benchmark
review: Tight, with a mild grip of tannins around a juicy core of light-weight cherry and floral flavors, lingering nicely. Drink now through 2015. 103 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Benchmark
review: Light and silky, this charming wine tempts with creamy, espresso-accented raspberry and red cherry flavors, lingering on the deftly balanced finish. Drink now through 2013. 124 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Benchmark
review: Ripe, round and generous with its cherry and blackberry fruit, nicely shaded with white pepper and sweet spice overtones, fine and long. Drink now through 2010. 89 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Benchmark
review: Rich in flavor, supple in texture, with a solid core of blackberry, plum and spice, beautifully balanced with fine-grained tannins and bright acidity, finishing juicy and fresh. Best from 2002 through 2008. 94 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Hanson
review: Focused, fleshy and nicely transparent, with distinctive spicy cherry and roasted carrot flavors, lingering on the open-weave finish. Drink now through 2016. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Soft, spicy and refined, with pretty mocha and floral overtones to the well-modulated plum flavors, finishing with gentle tannins. Best from 2016 through 2020. 419 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: This lively style brims with raspberry, lime blossom and mint flavors, finishing with polished tannins and a hint of cream. Graceful. Drink now through 2018. 300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Ripe, round and earthy, aromatic with layers of spice, pepper, hazelnut, its pear flavors swirling through the slightly raw finish. Coming together. Drink now through 2006. 216 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Benchmark
review: Firm, with a lovely core of plum and currant fruit shaded with hints of earth, cedar and spice. The tannins rise up on the finish, but the fruit persists impressively. Best from 2006 through 2012. 89 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Benchmark
review: Ripe and plummy, both in color and in flavor, with a veil of fine-grained tannins around a rich layer of nicely articulated fruit, which persists on the refined finish. Drink now through 2003. 49 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Smooth and polished, and generous with its dark cherry, pepper and gamy aromas and flavors, which also echo nicely on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2005. 624 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley
review: Ripe in flavor, crisp in structure, with a definite barrel-fermented character overlaying the pear, melon and honey flavors as they linger through the round finish. Drink now through 2004. 936 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley
review: Deep, rich and smoky, spreading its spicy pear flavor nicely while keeping a crisp, juicy underpinning. Delicious now. 1,028 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Bright and generous, with pretty apricot-scented citrus and pear flavors, finishing with an overlay of oak. Drink now through 2004. 239 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Lithe, elegant and aromatic, with hints of rose petal and white pepper amid the plum and berry character, getting a bit firm on the finish. Drink now through 2011. 4,045 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Juicy and focused, lively, centering around currant and blackberry flavor that lingers on the generous finish. Remains soft and elegant throughout. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley
review: Light and appealing for its nicely focused pear and peach flavors, which finish on a spicy note. Drink now through 2003. 709 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Willamette Valley
review: Taut, spicy and zingy, with green melon, cucumber and clove flavors, coming together with some semblance of harmony on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 214 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Tautly focused, with black cherry and dried berry flavors on a lean frame, playing ripe fruit against smoky, toasty overtones on the sharp finish. Drink now through 2019. 2,186 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Tart and tangy, with mouthwatering acidity lifting the dark berry and roasted meat flavors as they play out on  the lively finish. Drink now through 2017. 1,250 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Bright and open-textured, with juicy raspberry and floral flavors on a firm frame. Best from 2006 through 2010. 4,367 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Bright and fruity, with pretty raspberry and strawberry flavors up front, finishing soft and gentle. Drink now. 2,990 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: On the lighter side, polished and refined, with pretty plum and spice flavors that jump out of the glass, finishing with a slight bite of tannin and acidity on the bright finish. Best after 2002. 2,994 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Claim No. 51
review: Firm in texture, with a light tannic grip to the berry and spice flavors, which poke through on the finish nicely. Needs time to settle. Best from 2010 through 2014. 96 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Hanson
review: Smooth and velvety, with nice ripe cherry and blackberry flavors on a bed of fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2012. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: This is light and supple, yet there's some crisp tannins around a core of spicy, earthy cherry flavors. Needs to settle in. Best from 2010 through 2013. 672 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Chewy in texture, with ripe cherry and earth flavors lurking beneath a layer of fine-grained tannins, echoing lightly on the finish. Best after 2000. 480 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Appealingly fresh, with nicely focused berry flavors and hints of chocolate. Drink now through 1998. 89 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: There's an airy feel to the ripe cherry and spice flavors, echoing softly on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2012. 3,416 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley
review: Firm in texture, fresh in flavor, with spicy accents to the pear flavor. Finishes with more intensity than it starts. 1,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: This spicy style sports a candied edge to the pineapple and apple flavors, finishing with a sour-sweet bite. Drink now. 102 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Light and tangy, modest in scope but lively with green apple and sweet oak flavors. Drink now through 2006. 235 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light-textured, with bright blackberry, vanilla and cherry flavors to balance the fine tannins. Drink now through 1998. 1,277 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Claim No. 51
review: Firm, earthy, cedary, trying hard to be an elegant wine but shows other elements more than fruit, and it remains firm through the moderately chewy finish. Best from 2006 through 2009. 73 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon
review: Crisp, brisk style offers modest apple and spice flavors, with a touch of astringency on the finish. Drink now through 2002. 907 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light and crisp, with pretty blackberry notes under a layer of biting tannins and herbal tones. Needs time. Best after 2000. 2,849 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light in texture, with a rough edge of tannin to the modest berry and tobacco flavors. Best after 1998. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate Bottled
review: Earthy, tannic and a bit rough around the edges, but on the finish it comes together. A rough-and-tumble red now, yet worth drinking. 400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Estate Bottled
review: Smooth, ripe and creamy, with spice, pear and vanilla notes that stay with you from start to finish. Balanced and drinkable now. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Crisp and firm, with plum, cherry and spice notes that fan out on the finish. Not too tannic; drinkable now through 1995.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Has a chalky, slightly astringent texture, but the pretty apple and floral notes echo on the finish. Best after 1999. 209 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Willamette Valley
review: Floral flavors overwhelm the candied fruit.   300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Earthy, a little sweet and unpleasant.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Luna
review: The dark blackberry, clove and espresso flavors are spicy and effusive, with dark chocolate and brambly herb accents. Drink now through 2027. 3,000 cases made.

name: Vermentino McLaren Vale Lopresti Block 10 Vineyard
review: Offers an appealing mix of yellow raisin, lanolin, green apple and toasted macadamia nut flavors. The finish is smooth and crisp. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Vermentino McLaren Vale Lopresti Block 10 Vineyard
review: Tart and tangy, with lemon and green apple flavors. Fresh lemongrass notes on the crisp finish. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Kirchspiel GG
review: Very minerally and powerfully fruity, with impressive cut to the dried apple, lemon-lime and star fruit flavors. Dried herbal notes show midpalate, leading to a finish that lingers with roasted pineapple details and rich, spicy accents. Best from 2019 through 2026. 465 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Morstein
review: Features an aroma of ripe grapefruit, with a complex array of melon, candied ginger, cream and glazed apricot flavors flanked by tropical fruit notes. Hints of white chocolate appear on the finish. A rich and expressive style. Drink now through 2040. 46 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Westhofener Morstein
review: Passion fruit and citrus pâte de fruit aromas and flavors pick up grace notes of honey and spice in this concentrated, intense auslese. There's plenty of structure and it needs a little time to integrate. Fine length. Best from 2012 through 2038. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Westhofener Morstein
review: Exotic, spicy and packed with aromas and flavors, this '01 auslese exudes pineapple, passion fruit, guava and mineral notes in a marriage with bright acidity and a silky texture. Beautifully done. Drink now through 2017. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Brunnenhäuschen GG
review: Crunchy, featuring snappy dried apple, green pear and lemon bar flavors and accents of verbena and thyme, providing an elegant mouthfeel. The powerful and fresh finish is minerally, showing hints of white pepper. Best from 2018 through 2025. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Morstein
review: This succulent Riesling delivers mouthwatering acidity behind the peach, apple and ripe pear flavors. Concentrated mineral and spice notes carry through to the long, silky finish, joined by glazed citrus accents. Drink now through 2040. 83 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Morstein
review: Focused flavors of orange spice cake, apple tart and pear give this plenty of lift. Elegant and fresh-tasting, with fresh spice and citrus zest notes. The luscious finish features peach cobbler. Best from 2014 through 2038. 50 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Westhofener Kirchspiel S
review: Ripe and concentrated, with botrytis, judging from the honey and spice accenting its apricot and citrus flavors. Viscous yet never heavy. Impressive. Fine length. Best from 2007 through 2022.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Westhofener Morstein
review: Pineapple, passion fruit, ruby grapefruit and loads of mineral aromas and flavors mark this expressive auslese. There's fine structure to balance the sweetness and intensity of fruit. Has a long finish. Drink now through 2035. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Westhofener Morstein S
review: Passion fruit and pineapple galore in this opulent, almost racy '03 auslese. Has a very fine structure for the vintage and what tastes like a slight edge of botrytis to the flavors. Drink now through 2025.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Aulerde GG
review: This ripe white bursts with peach and apricot flavors, and though dry, it's fruity and turns drier on the finish. There's fine harmony and texture, showing cut on the aftertaste, with notes of stone. Drink now through 2020. 616 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Brunnenhäuschen GG
review: Full bodied, multidimensional and powerful, this dry white packs in peach, nectarine and spice flavors. It's all balanced in an oversized way, with a lingering aftertaste of orchard fruit and mineral. Drink now through 2022. 152 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Kirchspiel GG
review: A taut, crackling white, with crystalline flavors of Asian pear, white peach and apple, pure and racy. Offers a steely structure, with citrus zest notes. The finely balanced finish has ample minerality. Drink now through 2020. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Morstein GG
review: Very zesty, with rich notes of savory green herb flanking the crisp core of green apple, dried apricot and nectarine flavors. Accents of lanolin give this a rich texture. Finishes with hints of smoke and spice. Best from 2018 through 2024. 1,074 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Morstein GG
review: Peach, apricot and nectarine aromas and flavors weave throughout this rich, supple white, which is dry, but with ample ripeness and flesh to balance its lively structure. Offers a nice peppery undercurrent. Drink now through 2022. 300 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofener
review: Very rich and elegant, with a slightly airy texture to the richly spiced flavors of pastry, dried apple and roasted pineapple. Engaging notes of shiso and dried sage linger into the vibrantly spiced finish. Drink now through 2022. 1,548 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofener S
review: A smooth, peach-infused white, lush and expansive, yet backed by a firm structure. Picks up energy on the long finish, which adds a peppery accent. Drink now through 2020. 2,083 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Westhofen Morstein
review: Pungent, delivering loads of mineral to start the fireworks and plenty of apple, nectarine and grapefruit to back it up. This is really electric midpalate, with a complex, lingering aftertaste. Best from 2012 through 2024. 560 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Brunnenhäuschen
review: Well-honeyed, with a creamy texture and a spicy freshness to the Asian pear, apple and kiwifruit flavors. The juicy finish is long, rich and focused, revealing plenty of allspice and nutmeg nuances. Drink now through 2035. 25 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Morstein
review: Taut yet focused, with smoky notes to the crisp green apple, pear and dried apricot flavors. Quite juicy midpalate, presenting notes of white pepper and sea salt, which linger on the finish. Drink now through 2040. 1,200 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Aulerde GG
review: A fruity style, featuring a mix of peach, Fuji apple and dried pear flavors, supported by fresh acidity. Juicy midpalate, with a finish of dried ginger and spice. Drink now through 2020. 684 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Brunnenhäuschen GG
review: A rich, juicy and powerful white, with lightly creamy flavors of Asian pear, green apple and dried apricot, matched to crisp acidity. The minerally finish features notes of ripe lime and ginger that lengthen out nicely. Drink now through 2021. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Brunnenhäuschen GG
review: A powerful, minerally style, showing vibrant green apple, kiwifruit and gooseberry notes that are full and fresh. Very suave and stylish, with dried tropical flavors on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 25 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Brunnenhäuschen GG
review: Features a ripe texture to the Golden Delicious apple, ripe pear and ruby grapefruit flavors, showing some tropical fruit notes that linger on the spicy finish. A full and rich expression of dry Riesling. Drink now through 2020. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Morstein
review: The spicy aromas and flavors are expressive in this ripe style. The peach cobbler and apple tart notes dominate the fruit spectrum, tapping into a deep well of lushness. Golden raisin and crème brûlée notes show on the rich finish. Drink now through 2016. 835 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofen Aulerde
review: Powerful, ripe and exotic, this dry Riesling features apricot, dried pineapple and mineral flavors, with a hint of pleasant bitterness like an Italian amaro. This is juicy, with a lingering savory aftertaste. Drink now through 2017. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofen Kirchspiel
review: Dry, yet distinctive, combining peach, spice and mineral aromas and flavors matched to a round, succulent and open-textured framework. Forward and delicious now, this won't be a long-term wine. Drink now through 2005. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofen Morstein GG
review: A tangy white, with a strong mineral streak at its core, plus apple and quince flavors. There's intensity, harmony and length, making for a winning combination, with a fine, mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2020. 916 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofener
review: Pure and focused, with crunchy green apple and Asian pear flavors that are accented by lightly spiced notes. Features hints of mineral and sea salt on the finish. Drink now through 2025. 407 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofener
review: A sleek, racy dry Riesling, loaded with grapefruit, apple and white peach flavors, all underscored by mineral. Firm and delineated, with a snappy acidity as the flavors linger on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Westhofener Morstein
review: Peach, vanilla cream, pastry and spice flavors combine with a vibrant structure in this lip-smacking, fruity Riesling. The finish is long and refreshing, leaving you wanting more. Drink now through 2022. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Westhofener Morstein
review: Intense, yet still graceful, this has some dried fruit elements of apricot, passion fruit and pineapple, with vibrant structure keeping it defined. A botrytis element adds concentration. Good length. Drink now through 2028. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Westhofener Morstein
review: A touch cheesy in aroma (not a bad thing in fine, young wines), this is nonetheless full of passion fruit, pineapple and mineral flavors, concentrated by a touch of botrytis. The finish comes back in a wave of tropical fruit and mineral flavors. Drink now through 2017.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Westhofener Morstein
review: Sweet, rich and juicy describes this vivacious '99, whose apricot, lime and mineral notes stay focused thanks to the bracing underlying structure. Great job. Best from 2002 through 2010. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Rheinhessen Dry 100 Hills
review: This has a minerally nose, with hints of ripeness to the powerful peach, apple, grapefruit and dried guava flavors. Offers luscious white chocolate notes, showing some minty accents that echo on the luxuriant finish. Complex and elegant. Drink now through 2018. 150 cases imported.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: Lithe and minerally, with a taut frame powered by intense acidity. Slate and flinty flavors are joined by notes of green apple and grapefruit. The focused finish features iodine accents. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Kirchspiel
review: Savory, pure and focused, with good cut to the dried basil and oregano notes complementing baked apple and pear tart flavors. Offers bracing acidity, with plenty of crunchiness on the orange marmalade-accented finish. Drink now through 2020. 580 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Kirchspiel GG
review: A luscious white, with richly spiced, focused flavors of baked apple, ripe citrus and kiwifruit. Taut midpalate, presenting a surplus of dried mint and honeydew melon flavors. Orange zest details show on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 540 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofen Morstein GG
review: A powerful, dry white, displaying peach, passion fruit, grapefruit and stone flavors. Well-integrated, picking up a firm, chalky feel on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofener
review: Juicy and plump, with a lithe core of red peach, pear and apricot flavors, flanked by lush spicy notes. Lemon curd accents power the ripe finish. Drink now through 2017. 55 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofener
review: Starts with notes of white chocolate, building in intensity with flavors of quince, mincemeat and allspice. Offers plenty of lushness, displaying a ripe, rich finish of crème brûlée and dried apricot. Drink now through 2016. 1,090 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofener S
review: Elegant. Gentle and caressing on the palate, showing balanced elements of passion fruit and peach, lively acidity and intensity. Medium-bodied, with a good lingering finish. Drink now through 2012. 875 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Westhofener Aulerde
review: Deftly made. Here's a beautifully balanced, vibrant Riesling featuring pure flavors of peach, grapefruit and spice on a gossamer structure. Drink now through 2008. 220 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Westhofener Morstein
review: This '97 spätlese notches it up. An added dimension of ripeness, plus concentrated flavors of smoke, mineral and apricot, combine with a racy, vibrant backbone to tantalize the palate. Fine length. Best from 2002 through 2010.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: Offering a custardy aroma and plenty of minerality, this delivers juicy acidity in the midpalate, with a firm structure. Lingering notes of honeysuckle and spice on the finish.   Drink now through 2018. 5,383 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: Very fruity on the nose, with rich, lush, spicy and well-textured flavors of ripe quince, green apple and Bosc pear. Lingering notes of lemon curd emerge on the toasty finish. A very open style. Drink now through 2018. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: Round and effusive, boasting apricot, passion fruit, grapefruit and mineral flavors. Elegant and juicy, with terrific balance in a dry style and fine length. Drink now through 2012. 5,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Aulerde GG
review: Powerfully savory, with concentrated flavors of thyme, lemongrass and green apple, showing accents of anise and curry. The racy finish offers salt, dried mint and white pepper notes. Drink now through 2020. 575 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Morstein GG
review: Concentrated flavors of lemongrass, dried sage, anise and green apple are supported by firm acidity. The long finish features notes of dried ginger and glazed citrus. Drink now through 2019. 1,080 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofen Aularde
review: This has substance underlying its peach, pineapple and grapefruit flavors. The structure cuts a clean swath through the finish. Give this time to integrate. Best from 2009 through 2015. 410 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofen Aulerde
review: Ripe and tropical, showing apricot, passion fruit and grapefruit aromas and flavors on a plump yet well-structured frame. Moderate length on the finish. Drink now through 2007.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofen Aulerde
review: Dry, firm and focused, showing peach, talc and white pepper flavors on a medium-bodied frame. It tightens up on the finish, needing some time to integrate. Drink now through 2006. 195 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen
review: Pure and vivid, with muted peach, apricot and pastry flavors etched onto the glacierlike structure. Subtle, lingering finish. This needs time to open. Best from 2007 through 2015. 210 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Westhofener Morstein
review: Very tangy, with passion fruit, apricot and mineral aromas and flavors mingling with its bright structure and light to medium weight. It teases, rather than bullies, the palate. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Westhofener Morstein
review: A fabulous combination of grapefruit, pineapple and passion fruit mark this sleek, expressive white. Racy acidity keeps it all focused through the finish, where it picks up a salty, mineral note. Drink now through 2012. 150 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Westhofen Morstein
review: Rich and marked by honey, apple tart and bracing acidity, this white is balanced on the acidic side now. Give it some time, but it may always be sharp. Best from 2014 through 2028. 50 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Rheinhessen Dry 100 Hills
review: Very bright and juicy, with well-focused and concentrated flavors of ripe apple, white cherry and lemon curd. Displays generous minerality and spiciness on the fresh finish. Drink now through 2016. 3,330 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: Rich and powerful, but also finely detailed peach, grapefruit and lemon flavors tinged with mineral. Nice persistence and length. Drink now through 2014. 3,700 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen 100 Hills
review: Rich flavors of apricot glaze, dried pineapple and peach run through this slightly off-dry version, followed by a long finish of candied ginger that gives it lift. Drink now through 2013. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Kirchspiel GG
review: There's a snappy twist to the lush flavors of grapefruit, ripe citrus and dried apple. The minerally finish features saline and savory notes. Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Morstein GG
review: A mouthwatering white, with good definition to the ripe apple and lemon curd flavors, accented by savory notes of dried basil and parsley. Delivers fresh acidity on the finish. Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofener
review: A rich and spicy style, featuring flavors of baked apple, ripe melon and glazed citrus, with plenty of custard notes. Hints of dried sage and honey show on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 1,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofener
review: Focused and fresh-tasting, with crisp green apple, melon and lemon curd flavors that offer plenty of savoriness. Delivers a direct finish of sea salt and slate. Drink now through 2017. 1,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofener S
review: Smoke and stone aromas give way to apricot and grapefruit notes in this detailed dry white. Open-knit and approachable, with moderate length. Drink now through 2013. 850 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Gold Cap Rheinhessen Westhofener Morstein
review: There's sweetness here, with botrytis accenting the apricot and pineapple flavors, but it's dominated by a tart structure. No shortage of intensity and electricity, so be patient. Best from 2007 through 2018. 165 cases made.

name: Weisser Riesling Trockenbeerenauslese Rheinhessen Westhofener Aulerde
review: A lively, elegant dessert white with restrained aromas and flavors of orange peel. A firm backbone provides support and it finishes with a slight astringency. Best from 2002 through 2015.

name: Albalonga Beerenauslese Rheinhessen Westhofener Steingrube
review: The essence of pear, augmented by a little honey and citrus. Lush and tangy, with an open-knit structure and lingering finish. Drink now through 2002. 120 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Rheinhessen Westhofener Aulerde
review: Moderately sweet, offering honey and caramel aromas and flavors on a firm structure. Tasty, if not so complex, thick and sweet. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2005.

name: Riesling QbA Rheinhessen Dry 100 Hills
review: Firm and dry, with singing acidity to the mineral, green peach and blood orange flavors. Offers savory notes and candied ginger accents on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 5,850 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Rheinhessen Dry 100 Hills
review: Currant and ripe melon flavors are supported by fresh acidity in this moderately spicy style. Tangerine notes on the snappy finish. Drink now through 2017. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: Vibrant and crisp, with refined flavors of apple, grapefruit and green peach, which linger with plenty of minerally notes on the finish.  Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: Round and just off-dry, with grapefruit and white pepper notes playing off the bright acidity. This ends drier than it begins, with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2015. 5,833 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen 100 Hills
review: The firm structure gives this a lean feel despite ripe pineapple, spice and mineral notes and a lingering finish. Should integrate more fully in a year or two. Best from 2010 through 2016. 1,600 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Rheinhessen Dry 100 Hills
review: Firm, with good snap to the green apple and Bartlett pear flavors, which feature notes of fennel and slate. Short, crisp finish. Drink now through 2018. 3,500 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: Taut, with flinty accents to the dried herb and green apple flavors. Bracing acidity emerges on the fresh finish. Drink now. 5,850 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: Redolent of fresh-cut peaches, with plenty of ripe apple and spice flavors. Tarragon cream and hints of anise show on the fresh finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: Dried citrus, apple and peach flavors here, fighting with the bracing acidity today. It's concentrated and long, so give it some time to sort itself out. Best from 2007 through 2012. 2,900 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: A burst of peach, mineral and white pepper is underscored by bracing acidity in this dry, moderately concentrated white. It finishes a little tart and will improve over the next few years. Drink now through 2005. 2,350 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofen Aulerde
review: Round, exuding peach and apricot flavors accented by spice. It's soft in profile, with enough acidity to keep it fresh on the finish. Drink now. 240 cases made.

name: Weisser Riesling Spätlese Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofener Aulerde
review: Crisp and dry, this has a grapefruit component to its flavor profile, along with hints of peach and mineral. Lovely balance in this style, and cleansing on the finish. Drink now through 2003.

name: Weisser Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: Austere, showing white peach and citrus notes backed by a crisp structure. Needs food. Drink now through 2003. 500 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Rabenkropf
review: Intense, powerful and filled with loads of rich blackberry compote, plum pudding and dark cherry flavors. Plenty of mineral, smoke and graphite notes. Mocha and cream fill the finish. Blaufränkisch and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2012. 665 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Rabenkropf
review: A fruit basket red, with layers of enticing raspberry, strawberry and cream flavors. There's a nice purity to the mineral flavors in this as well. Finishes with pretty hazelnut and vanilla. Blaufränkisch with Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2009. 835 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Steinriegel
review: Hits the mark as a clean, crisp Sauvignon in a Sancerre style. Appealing herbal and mineral notes are supported by green peach and Granny Smith apple flavors, with a spicy finish. Drink now through 2007. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Summus
review: Textbook Pinot Gris, offering smoky, nutty aromas and flavors, with a hint of violets, all displayed on a broad, rich framework. Firms up on the finish. Drink now through 2001. 1,500 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Aristos
