review: Notes of hot brick, iron and spice flow into this robust, flavorful red that also features plenty of gingersnap notes. The robust finish is full of Asian spice. Cabernet Sauvignon and Blaufränkisch. Drink now through 2017. 25 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Rabenkropf
review: Very spicy, with lip-smacking flavors of baked cherry, plum pudding and mocha and hints of cocoa powder. The plush finish is rich and savory. Blaufränkisch. Drink now through 2017. 50 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Mittelburgenland Aristos
review: Luscious and spicy, with plenty of ripe cherry, plum and blackberry flavors and some savory herb and mineral notes. Nutmeg and clove fill the finish. Blaufränkisch and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2010. 1,666 cases made.

name: Traminer Eiswein Südsteiermark Elite
review: Fresh and full of peach, honey and lemon aromas and flavors on a thick, nimble profile. Turns a bit coarse and pinched on the finish, with a smoky aftertaste. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2004.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Hochberg
review: Supple, offering plush flavors of spiced cherry, plum and raspberry. The finish lingers, with bright cranberry and licorice notes. Drink now through 2016. 50 cases imported.

name: Gelber Muskateller Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Steinriegel
review: Spicy, with firm, well-structured flavors of white peach, grapefruit and dried apricot. The spicy finish features ripe melon notes. Drink now through 2017. 50 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Summus
review: Fresh and lively, with rosewater, mango and spice notes on a medium-bodied frame. Good, lingering finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Muskateller Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Summus
review: Very floral in aroma, dry, elegant and succulent in structure, this is a terrific Muskateller. Full of flowers and grapefruit, with a long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2002. 665 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Summus
review: Lovely Pinot Gris, offering juicy apple and pear flavors on a rich yet firmly structured frame. Fine intensity from start to finish. Drink now through 2003. 4,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südoststeiermark Klassik
review: Fresh and fruity, with luscious peach, apricot and ripe pear flavors accented by plenty of ripe, spicy notes. Dried mango lingers on the finish. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark
review: Fruity and fresh, with green peach, blood orange and gooseberry flavors. Good acidity and balanced structure, with a mineral-filled finish. Drink now. 1,665 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Elite
review: Ripe apple, pear and spice are joined by a rich smokiness in this fresh white. Racy notes of mineral and cream on the finish.  Drink now through 2010. 375 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Elite
review: Crunchy, with plenty of crisp apple and green peach flavors. The fresh finish features mineral and nutmeg. Very vibrant. Drink now. 208 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Summus
review: A crisp, clean, classic style of Chardonnay, offering apple and lemon flavors on a firm, light-bodied frame. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Rebenfeld
review: Medium-bodied, with gooseberry notes and hints of lentil. Features unsalted almond and spice notes on the finish. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Gola
review: A crunchy white, with ripe peach, apricot and dried fig flavors. Hints of cream mark the spicy finish. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Gola
review: Crunchy, with plenty of green apple, citrus and spice notes that fill the crisp finish. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Summus
review: New oak dominates the flavor profile, displaying vanilla, nutmg and clove notes and giving an impression of creaminess texturally. Modest finish. Drink now through 2004. 5,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Altenberg
review: Fruity, with mouthfilling flavors of Fuji apple, cinnamon and pear. Ripe notes fill the finish. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südoststeiermark Steinriegel
review: Juicy, with rich and ripe fig, melon and red peach flavors that are framed by zesty acidity. Plush spicy notes linger on the rich finish. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Elite
review: Tasty, bursting with grass and gooseberry flavors on a lively framework. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Klassik
review: Medium-bodied, with peach and apple flavors that feature some ripe, spicy notes. Hints of butter mark the finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Steinriegel
review: This crunchy white is filled with plenty of fresh acidity and well-concentrated citrus, green apple and mineral flavors, with a spicy finish. Drink now. 375 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Elite
review: Medium-bodied and well-marked by buttery oak, this white offers an apple note on a compact frame. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark
review: An oaked version, rich and medium-bodied, with vanilla, smoke and applesauce flavors, picking up cinnamon and clove accents on the finish. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark
review: Shows a spicy aroma, with cherry, raspberry and red plum flavors. The crisp finish offers sandalwood notes. Drink now. 416 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark
review: Juicy, with apricot flavors and savory herb notes followed by touches of richness on the finish. Drink now. 3,750 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Steinriegel
review: Fresh and crunchy-tasting, with plenty of citrus and spice flavors. Medium-bodied, with minerally notes on the clean finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Summus
review: New oak lends a spicy character and rounds out the structure of this medium-bodied, focused white. Apple and freshly cut grass complete the mix. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Hochberg
review: Very spicy up front, with red plum and currant jam flavors. A touch raisiny on the finish. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Elite
review: Clean and crisp, with nutty overtones and a medium-bodied, spare frame. Drink now. 417 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Summus
review: Light on its feet, this Chardonnay packs a lot of apple, almond and nutmeg flavors into its elegant, vibrant frame. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Gelber Muskateller Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Steinriegel
review: Upfront peach and mango flavors provide an assertive fruity appeal. Finishes with soft, herbal notes. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Steinriegel
review: A peachy aroma leads to flavors of lychee and mineral, with notes of nutmeg on the soft finish. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Summus
review: Tasty. Smells and tastes like fresh apples with hints of nutmeg and vanilla, and is creamy in texture. Forward in style and ready. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Rebenfeld
review: On the light side, with grapefruit and green apple flavors, followed by a short finish. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Gola
review: Light, clean-tasting white, with green peach flavors and some mineral notes. Spicy finish. Drink now. 415 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Ried Gola Summus
review: Light- to medium-bodied, with appealing herbal flavors and citrus notes. Peach and stone notes on the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Panther
review: A fragrant mix of flowers, tropical fruit and white pepper in a medium-bodied, crisp style. Good, lingering finish. Sauvignon Blanc, Chardonnay, Muskateller and others. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Altenberg
review: Very peachy tasting, with some stone, mineral and spice notes. Bracing finish of lime. Serve well-chilled. Drink now. 585 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südoststeiermark Edelschuh
review: On the ripe side, with honeydew melon and ginger flavors and some dried papaya notes. Spicy finish. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark
review: A style of Sauvignon Blanc relying on new oak for roundness and melon, with grass and vanilla notes. Well-balanced and harmonious. Drink now.

name: Gewürztraminer Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Steinriegel
review: Ripe green fig, apricot jam and spice flavors end on a soft, cloying note. Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Steinriegel
review: Straightforward white, with ripe apple flavors and plenty of spicy accents. Ripe finish. Drink now. 292 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Steinriegel
review: Ripe apple flavors, with some glazed citrus and smoke on the finish. Drink now. 458 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Elite
review: A rich, smooth, full-bodied white, with moderately-concentrated apple, pear and vanilla flavors.  Drink now.

name: Pinot Gris Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Summus
review: Combines richness and focus, with apple and earth flavors on a foursquare, slightly rustic profile. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Südsteiermark
review: Kosher. Straightforward, with a candied character to the apple note. Finishes short. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Qualitätswein Trocken Südoststeiermark Gola Privat
review: Simple and buttery, with ripe apple flavors and some spice notes. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Altenberg
review: Apple and green peach flavors dominate this simple white. Cloying finish. 250 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Gola
review: Ripe pear and butter flavors fill this medium-bodied white. Awkward finish. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Summus
review: On the austere side, showing modest grass and gooseberry flavors on a firm structure. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Platinum Label
review: A plump Shiraz with tremendous depth and power. It's dark, rich and plush, bursting with spicy black cherry and blackberry flavors that linger effortlessly as the round, focused finish hints at white pepper and exotic spices. A big step up for this producer. Drink now through 2012. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Platinum Label
review: Juicy, flavorsome style has tremendous vigor but a sense of elegance as well, bursting with gorgeous blueberry, blackberry, plum and subtle spice flavors, lingering with a vibrancy that lets the flavors sail on and on. Drink now through 2015. 400 cases imported.

name: Black Label Langhorne Creek-Barossa Valley-Coonawarra
review: Dark and dense, with blackberry, black cherry and licorice flavors working together to power through a fine curtain of tannins, melding harmoniously on the long, vibrant finish. Bordering on plush, this just needs some cellaring. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Malbec. Best from 2010 through 2020. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Platinum Label
review: Dark and brooding, with a meaty character mingling with the dark cherry and licorice flavors that grip well on the long, expressive finish. The tannins need time to soften, and elevated acidity perks things up nicely. Best from 2012 through 2020. 300 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Platinum Label
review: Dark and juicy. A harmonious, complex wine that has a welcome lift of acidity to the blackberry, cherry and licorice flavors, persisting on the fleshy finish against very fine tannins. Drink now through 2014. 415 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Platinum Label
review: Big, rich and generous, a plump mouthful of dead-ripe black cherry, black pepper, plum and spicy cream flavors that persist through the fleshy finish, yet it all holds together with refinement and a modicum of grace. Best from 2004 through 2014. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Platinum Label Medlands Estate
review: Dark and dense, this red brims with violet-tinged blackberry, tobacco and licorice flavors. Deftly balanced, with an elegant finish that lingers enticingly. Drink now through 2019. 50 cases imported.

name: Black Label 36th Vintage Langhorne Creek-Barossa-McLaren Vale
review: Rich and ripe, working smoky notes through the blackberry and floral flavors, picking up tobacco and licorice notes as the finish grows dense and expressive. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Malbec. Drink now through 2018. 100 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Barossa Platinum Label
review: Rich, ripe and distinctive for its mouthfilling cherry, plum and spice flavors, shaded with bay leaf and sage on a surprisingly refined texture. It's a big wine but doesn't feel heavy, instead sparking its flavors with refined acidity and well-modulated tannins. Drink now through 2015. 500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz Barossa Valley-Langhorne Creek Black Label
review: Ripe and welcoming, a smooth, lithe red that offers black cherry, raspberry, mint and licorice flavors. It finishes a tad hot, but a little food will balance that. The flavors linger impressively. Drink now through 2015. 500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz South Australia Black Label
review: A stylish red, smooth and generous, with ripe black cherry, berry, prune and tangy coffee flavors that persist impressively on the fine-grained palate, wrapped in spicy oak. Drink now through 2012. 750 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Adelaide Hills Gold Label
review: A gentle style with flavors that sneak up on the finish and wash over it like an ocean swell, offering rich pear, cream and mineral notes that keep singing on the long, long finish. Beautifully done. Drink now through 2008. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Adelaide Hills White Label Specially Aged Release
review: This savory style focuses on a delicate balance of citrus, lees and delicate minty overtones, coming around to apple and pear notes as the finish glides smoothly and persistently. Shows depth and elegance, and should benefit from cellaring. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Platinum Label
review: Lithe, refined style delivers a generous mouthful of blueberry, blackberry and peppery spice flavors that linger on the open finish against slightly grainy tannins. Has freshness and grace. Best from 2008 through 2015. 400 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon South Australia Black Label
review: Velvety, round and generous with smoky blueberry and currant flavors, beautifully balanced to hold their shape and their flavors as the finish sails on and on. Has extra dimensions and excellent balance. Best from 2007 through 2016. 500 cases imported.

name: Black Label 30th Vintage South Australia
review: Lithe and generous. A juicy mouthful of red berry, cherry and herb flavors that mingle beautifully on the long finish. Echoes with a touch of black olive against very fine-grained tannins. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Best from 2007 through 2014. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Gold Label
review: Taut, focused and expressive, this layers dark berry, toasted wheat berry and mint flavors with mildly gritty tannins, persisting on the deftly balanced finish. Best from 2016 through 2020. 150 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Gold Label
review: Focused, expressive and juicy, with blackberry and black currant fruit, flecked with hints of sage and bay leaf. The finish lingers pleasantly against moderate tannins. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Gold Label
review: Elegant and deftly balanced to play its pretty red berry and raspberry fruit against dusky herbs, white pepper and espresso notes, lingering together as the finish sails on nicely against crisp tannins. Best from 2011 through 2017. 2,500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz South Australia Black Label
review: Smooth and velvety, with a refreshing backbone of acidity and tannins underneath the dark berry, currant, cedar and herb flavors, persisting nicely on the refined finish. Drink now through 2015. 500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz Langhorne Creek Grey Label
review: Fresh and vibrant, balancing dark berry, licorice and black pepper flavors against fine-grained tannins, finishing with intensity on a medium frame. Drink now through 2018. 25 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Adelaide Hills Gold Label
review: Subtle, layered and complex, with hints of wax and honey around a fresh core of peach and pear flavors, coming together seamlessly on the finish. Expressive and deftly balanced. Drink now through 2020. 225 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Adelaide Hills Gold Label
review: Deftly balanced, not a big wine, but nicely focused to show off its pretty pear, grapefruit, hazelnut and spice aromas and flavors, lingering effectively on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 900 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Adelaide Hills Gold Label
review: Sleek and harmonious, this is balanced to show off its hazelnut-tinged pear, white pepper and spice flavors on a medium-weight frame, which wraps the finish smoothly. Drink now through 2017. 900 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Adelaide Hills Gold Label
review: This is round, with a real silkiness to the texture, offering subtle layers of pear, lemon curd and hints of white pepper that fold over themselves as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2012. 900 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Piccadilly Valley White Label
review: Crisp and tangy, with grapefruit overtones to the green apple and white peach flavors, coming together harmoniously on the expressive finish. Should develop with cellaring. Best after 2015. 50 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay South Australia Bilyara Cellars President's Selection
review: Ripe, supple and complex, with caramel and spice overtones to the pear, pineapple and citrus flavors. It extends into a beautifully balanced, polished finish. Drinkable now, but it should improve through 1997. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Australia Presidents Selection
review: Bright, open-textured and remarkably well focused, a lovely mouthful of nectarine, apple and pear flavors that just won't quit, lingering on the finish, picking up touches of honey and lime. Drink now through 2010. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Riesling South Australia Gold Label
review: Wonderfully aromatic Riesling, its glorious noseful of apricot and floral notes segueing into off-dry flavors that center around lime and apple, with mineral and peppery-floral overtones. Tempting now, but should develop more depth and texture with age. Best from 2003 through 2010. 7,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Adelaide Hills Platinum Label
review: Ripe and jazzy, a juicy mouthful of blackberry, cherry and coffee flavors, supported by bristling acidity but generous enough to make it sing through the long, cedar-inflected finish. Best from 2006 through 2015. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Gold Label
review: Fresh and focused, with a layer of grippy tannins enfolding bright boysenberry and red plum flavors, persisting on the long, refined finish. Best from 2015 through 2020. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Gold Label
review: Firm and chewy, offering a supple texture underneath the veneer of tannins, with smoky, wood-accented blackberry and currant flavors that linger on the polished finish. Best from 2011 through 2020. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Gold Label
review: This exhibits generous blackberry and raspberry fruit at the core, shading the edges with pretty white pepper, cream and floral overtones that insinuate themselves beautifully as the finish goes on and on. Drink now through 2016. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Gold Label
review: Polished, round and generous with its creamy blackberry, currant and cedar flavors, lingering on the focused, harmonious finish. Best from 2008 through 2015. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Gold Label
review: Round, velvety and generous with its smoky blackberry and tar flavors, gently balanced with tangy acidity, but the emphasis is on the berry and spice flavors that linger on the finish. Not a typical Barossa Shiraz, but it's a honey. Drink now through 2010. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Platinum Label
review: Firm in texture, with some density to the ripe cherry and peppery spice flavors, finishing slightly gritty. This achieves a certain elegance, and could gain depth with cellaring. Drink now through 2016. 307 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Platinum Label Medlands Vineyard
review: Dense, chewy and focused, offering a formidable mouthful of raspberry-accented plum and cola flavors. Not weighty but shows fine presence. Best from 2016 through 2025. 40 cases imported.

name: Black Label 37th Vintage Barossa Valley-McLaren Vale-Langhorne Creek
review: Crunchy tannins surround a narrow core of ripe, tarry black cherry and pepper flavors. This taut, tightly packed Cabernet should come into its own with rich food. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Malbec. Best from 2015 through 2020. 75 cases imported.

name: Black Label Langhorne Creek-McLaren Vale-Barossa Valley
review: A minty character runs through the blackberry and currant flavors in this ripe, smooth red. The expressive finish is long, dark and silky. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Malbec. Drink now through 2012. 500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Barossa Valley Black Label Jimmy Watson Trophy
review: A distinctive Aussie Cabernet with impressive character. Plump and generous, a round wine with lots of black cherry, mint and root beer notes. Hints at chocolate as the flavors linger on the supple finish. Drink now through 2006. 50,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Langhorne Creek Grey Label
review: Aromatic with red berry and red pepper character, tangy with acidity but nicely polished in the mouth, finishing with a refreshing balance. Drink now through 2009. 500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Australia Presidents Selection
review: Smooth and velvety, round and generous with its raspberry, cherry and red currant flavors, hinting at currant leaf in the background and the fruit pushes on and on through the supple finish. Drink now through 2013. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz-Merlot South Australia Black Label
review: Smooth and ripe, with almost Port-like notes accenting the well-integrated currant, cherry and chocolate aromas and flavors. Glides smoothly across the palate and remains firm on the finish. Drink now through 1997. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Adelaide Hills Gold Label
review: Fresh, expressive and light, showing a savory walnut edge to the citrus and green apple flavors. Finishes deftly and harmoniously. Drink now through 2016. 500 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Adelaide Hills Gold Label
review: Smooth and spicy, with a delicate core of pear and licorice flavors, shaded with hints of white pepper and smoke, lingering gently. Drink now through 2010. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare-Eden Valleys Gold Label
review: Dry, crisp and elegant, a subtle wine with clear citrus, cream and green apple fruit that remains pure and refined through a long finish. Drink now through 2008. 2,600 cases imported.

name: Riesling South Australia Gold Label
review: A dry and flavorful style, offering a marvelous array of citrus, apple, floral and apricot notes that spin smartly through the lively, just off-dry finish. This Aussie Riesling is delicious now, but try to wait until 2000 to 2001 to see what develops. 60,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Gold Label
review: This bright red offers juicy raspberry, pomegranate and cherry flavors, hinting at black tea as the finish lingers effortlessly. Drink now through 2018. 400 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Gold Label
review: Smooth and velvety, with dark berry, tobacco and licorice flavors coming together nicely as the finish rolls on. Offers depth and impeccable balance. Drink now through 2018. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Grey Label
review: Lithe and polished, exuding blackberry and floral flavors on a supple frame, this offers spicy notes as the finish lingers against refined tannins. Drink now through 2020. 25 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Gold Label
review: Ripe and focused, with a solid core of black currant and smoky oak flavors that persist through the firm, fine-grained finish. Best from 2008 through 2013. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Langhorne Creek Grey Label
review: Lithe, ripe and gentle, with a lovely core of cherry, blackberry, a touch of mint and a sense of sweetness on the long finish. Very inviting stuff. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Australia Presidents Selection
review: Refreshing for its pure currant fruit, shaded with savory notes of roasted meat and herbs, all of it showing transparency and held in check by fine tannins. Drink now through 2013. 2,200 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Australia Yellow Label
review: Among the values from Australia is this impressive Cabernet. It's ripe in character, and distinctive for the mint and floral notes running through its jazzy raspberry and currant flavors. All lingers effortlessly on the lithe finish. Best from 2002 through 2008. 23,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz South Australia Bilyara Black Label
review: Rich, ripe, round and warm, with a generous bead of spicy black cherry, chocolate and coffee flavors that swirl beautifully through the supple finish. Drink now through 1999. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Adelaide Hills Gold Label
review: Aims for delicacy and harmony instead of power, achieving a seductive balance of creamy pear and apple flavors with a deft touch of oak as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2007. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay South Australia Presidents Selection
review: Juicy, tangy style has a nice lime and pineapple zing to the apple and spice flavors, the finish lingering enticingly. Drink now through 2010. 2,200 cases imported.

name: Rhine Riesling Eden-Clare Valleys Gold Label
review: Bright and fresh, a juicy mouthful of green apple, citrus and peach flavors that remain elegant and smooth through the finish. Delicious now, and will improve. Drink now through 2010. 2,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Adelaide Gold Label
review: Bright and racy, a jazzy mix of apple, peach and slate aromas and flavors, lingering nicely on the clean, dry finish. Has room to grow. Drink now through 2010. 4,400 cases imported.

name: Riesling Eden-Clare Valleys Gold Label
review: Bright and focused, a big, dry Riesling with aggressive apple, quince and white pepper aromas and flavors, which echo on the round finish. Drink now through 2010. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Gold Label
review: Dark, rich and spicy, with a strong coffee character to the plum and tar flavors, finishing with firm tannins. Best from 2008 through 2014. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Grey Label
review: Lean and chewy, with green peppercorn and savory mirepoix overtones to the dark berry flavors, persisting with integrity on the finish. Best from 2016 through 2019. 30 cases imported.

name: Syrah Adelaide Hills Gold Label
review: This spicy, earthy style favors dill and sesame notes over the blackberry fruit, which swims into focus as the finish lingers. The tannins display mild grip. Cellaring should help. Best from 2016 through 2020. 150 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Gold Label
review: Starts off smooth and ripe, with black currant and blackberry fruit up front, then picks up a strong bay leaf and green olive character on the finish. The tannins have grip. Best from 2010 through 2015. 2,500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Gold Label
review: Supple and appealing for its gentle balance, with fine tannins surrounding ripe currant and dusky, earthy overtones, finishing with just a touch of sweet vanilla from oak. Drink now through 2008. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Australia Grey Label
review: Firm in texture, with a sweetness and a silkiness underneath the tannins that carry the red berry, cherry and subtle herb flavors through a long and refined finish. Best from 2010 through 2013. 400 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Australia Yellow Label
review: This Cabernet is supple, generous and appealing for its ripe blackberry, black cherry and roasted red pepper flavors. Finishes with polish and refinement. Drink now through 2015. 4,500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Australia Yellow Label
review: Dark and juicy, this is focused on its lovely currant and plum fruit, delicately shading the finish with hints of smoke and herbs. Drink now through 2013. 11,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Australia Yellow Label
review: Ripe, rich and smooth, with generous currant and plum aromas and flavors and hints of exotic spices and vanilla on the finish. Has finely integrated tannins that should keep it humming in the cellar. Best from 1995 through 1997.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz Clare-Barossa Valleys Black Label
review: Mature but still lively, with plenty of mint and leather aromas and rich plum, prune, butter and toast flavors, medium- to full-bodied, but it turns softer on the finish.

name: Chardonnay South Australia Yellow Label
review: Fresh and vibrant, showing elements of pear, lemon and cream that mingle seamlessly. The flavors dance on a lithe frame. Drink now through 2016. 600 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay South Australia Yellow Label
review: Fresh and vibrant, refreshing for its pear, peach and floral flavors, which dance lightly on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 3,600 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay South Australia Yellow Label
review: Light and spicy, with clove and pepper overtones to the lime and green apple flavors, persisting on the lively finish. Drink now through 2010. 23,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Lush and loaded with ripe blackberry, violet, black cherry, chocolate, vanilla and mocha flavors. Tiers of fleshy concentration and supple tannins keep unfolding through the lavish finish. Should reward cellaring. Best from 2004 through 2012. 243 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Ripe, intense and concentrated, with a firm tannic wall built around a dense, tasty core of dried currant, spice, hazelnut and fresh earth and pebble notes. Finishes with a compact mix of fruit and tannins. Decant for now. Should age well. Best from 2009 through 2016. 349 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Offers a wonderful sense of harmony and finesse, with ripe, fleshy currant, black cherry, blackberry and spicy, floral scents. Intense and concentrated, with depth to the flavors and ripe, integrated tannins on the long finish. Best from 2006 through 2013. 485 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: Shows off complex ripe currant and blac berry fruit that's plush, intense and concentrated. Well-focused, long and persistent, firming up on the finish. Decant for now. Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2012. 90 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Well-made, supple and balanced, with rich, silky currant, earth and black cherry fruit that picks up a touch of leather and sage on the firm, focused finish. Best from 2004 through 2012. 530 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: Rich and layered, with a bright beam of fresh, roasted herb, floral, currant, cherry and toasty oak flavors. Well-balanced and stylish, with intensity that lingers. Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2008. 120 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: Very ripe, teetering on jammy, with vibrant blackberry, wild berry and currant flavors that are rich and concentrated, finishing with a tight focus and integrated tannins. Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2009. 142 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: Smooth, with a creamy, mocha-flavored texture; the oak dominates a supple band of cherry and currant flavors. Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2006. 165 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A rustic, earthy style, with roasted herb, forest floor, dried currant and minerally, cedary graphite notes that are raw and chewy. Best to decant. Best from 2011 through 2017. 392 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Phaedrus
review: Earthy and savory, with dried herb and currant flavors and a medicinal melted-plastic note. Full-bodied and tight, finishing with a clipped aftertaste. Drink now through 2015. 524 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Firm, with solid tannins and flavors of plum, black currant and coffee that will soften with a year of bottle age. A new brand, offering a good bite for the buck. Drink now through 2005. 3,100 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: Yellow peach, apple cider and white pepper flavors drive this zesty version, along with honey, mango and candle wax notes. Light-weight and silky, but packs a lot of flavor, with a smoky thread weaving through the wine and lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2024. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Rangen
review: Off-dry, with hints of treacle and mushroom mixing with the peach pie, quince and pastry notes. This is silky, with a smoky undertow and a lingering, tangy finish. Drink now through 2017. 1,800 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Cuvée du Schlossherr
review: This peachy Pinot Gris is just off-dry, and shows notes of kumquat, honeyed apricot, candied grapefruit peel, smoke and spice. Mouthwatering acidity balances this, and enlivens the smoky, fruitcake- and caramel-tinged finish. Drink now through 2024. 6,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Cuvée des Seigneurs
review: Aromas and flavors of forest floor, mineral and lanolin are allied to a sleek, steel-plated structure in this impressive Alsace Riesling. Dry, rich and intense, the wine combines freshness and some mature elements that should develop nicely. Drink now through 2005. 4,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Rangen
review: A rich and aromatic Riesling, with candied peach and orange sorbet flavors accented by rose petal, cream and spice notes. Dry, tangy and medium-bodied, with a lingering finish of honeysuckle and jasmine. Drink now through 2014. 400 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace
review: Light-bodied and creamy, this bright Gewürztraminer layers a zesty underpinning with flavors of green melon, pink grapefruit sorbet and lime blossom. Drink now through 2020. 6,200 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace
review: A lithe version, dry and balanced, with a floral overtone and flavors of blood orange granita, melon, cream and candied pink grapefruit zest. Drink now through 2019. 6,800 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Eichberg
review: A light-bodied Gewürztraminer, with hints of candied orange peel, honeycomb, apple pie filling and smoke. This is just balanced by modest acidity, and shows a touch of caramel on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 500 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg
review: Tangy acidity drives this light white, accenting flavors of candied orange and grapefruit as well as floral and honey notes. It's pretty, with a moderate finish. Drink now through 2011. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace
review: Well-balanced and lightly juicy, with notes of white peach, apple blossom, marmalade and spice. Light-bodied, yet shows good concentration and intensity. Drink now through 2016. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg
review: This modest Pinot Gris is just off-dry, with honeyed flavors of peach, papaya, clementine and candied grapefruit peel. This is balanced by juicy acidity, and hints of wax and smoke show on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg
review: An exuberant white, with ripe guava and papaya laced by candied orange, vanilla and spice notes. Tangy acidity keeps it in check and leads to a smoky finish. Drink now through 2012. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace
review: Crisp and clean, with flavors of persimmon, green pear, melon and spice. A hint of fleur de sel shows on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Eichberg
review: A light-bodied Riesling, with fresh acidity and flavors of lemon zest, apple and star fruit. A pretty acacia-blossom note runs throughout, particularly on the modest finish. Drink now through 2012. 350 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Hengst
review: A pretty, light-bodied Riesling, displaying a floral note that runs through the lightly honeyed flavors of Gala apple, star fruit, tarragon and green melon. Creamy, with juicy acidity throughout. Drink now through 2014. 500 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Edna Valley
review: For fans of dense Petites, this is full of rustic, chewy tannins, with full-bodied, zesty wild berry, spice, leather, cedar and loam flavors. Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Edna Valley
review: Lean and a hint leathery, but still appealing for its cherry and dried raspberry fruit. A touch of anise and fresh herbs on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 300 cases made.

name: Domaine Reserve Lake Wisconsin
review: Smoky, with plum and bacon flavors, and a tobacco leaf note coming in on the slightly tart finish. Maréchal Foch and Millot. Drink now. 585 cases made.

name: Domaine du Sac Wisconsin
review: Round and polished, with ripe black cherry and blackberry flavors. Sturdy, flavorful, not too tannic and easy to drink. Maréchal Foch. Drink now.

name: Ice Wine Lake Wisconsin
review: Round and frankly sweet, with slightly cloying Midori and plantain notes. St.-Pepin. 57 cases made.

name: Seyval Blanc America Prairie Fumé
review: Light celery flavor, crisp finish. Just a hint of sweetness. 19,000 cases made.

name: Seyval Blanc American Prairie Fumé
review: Round and off-dry, with pleasant melon and spice flavors. Not complex, but has enough acidity to balance the sweetness.

name: Pinot Noir Wisconsin Sugarloaf Hill
review: Light and smooth, with vague flavors reminiscent of sour- cherry candy. Simple and drinkable.

name: Domaine Reserve Wisconsin
review: A modest wine, with light cherry and cinnamon flavors. Quite acidic and finishes short.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Western Cape
review: Supple, with a toasty frame to the herb, currant and cherry notes that glide softly through the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Fresh and open, with white asparagus and chive hints and a clean, crisp finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Campbell's Vineyard
review: This exhibits a rich, plush core of blackberry, blueberry and raspberry. A big wine, with a compelling amount of density and depth, ending with a long, full, persistent finish and tannins laced with crushed rock details. Drink now through 2021. 232 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Russian River Valley Bacigalupi Vineyard
review: Robust, delivering thick blackberry and huckleberry flavors that are ripe and lush, with gingerbread, chicory and espresso details that finish with a lingering spicy note. Drink now through 2030. 155 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Dutton - Campbell Vineyard
review: Offers a bold, well-proportioned expression of fruit and wood, from spicy, toasty oak to delicate plum and raspberry, all folding together gracefully, with a persistent aftertaste. Drink now through 2022. 261 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lake County Burton Ranch Vineyard Old Vine
review: Zesty and jammy, with appealing aromas of pepper and raspberry pie, and ripe, layered flavors of cherry, licorice and toasty spice that linger. Drink now through 2022. 269 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Rockpile
review: Plush and ripe, but with a solid backbone of acidity and tannins. Aromas of smoky, briary black raspberry lead to supple flavors of wild berry, sage and subtle mineral. Drink now through 2021. 119 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lake County Burton Ranch Vineyard Old Vine
review: Appealing aromas of ripe cherry and bay leaf open to rich, plump raspberry, red clay and cinnamon spice flavors. Drink now through 2023. 258 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Bacigalupi Vineyard Old Vine
review: Ripe and plush, with raspberry and spiced cinnamon aromas and jammy flavors of boysenberry, licorice and toast. Appealing for the style. Drink now through 2020. 115 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Dutton - Campbell Vineyard
review: Appealing for the delicate, understated mix of dusty earth, black cherry and subtle raspberry notes. Drinks clean and easy. Drink now. 264 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Bacigalupi Vineyard Old Vine
review: Burly and ripe, with dark notes of blueberry and blackberry, plus accents of licorice and toasty sage. Drink now through 2021. 127 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Rockpile Pritchett Peaks Vineyard
review: Floral raspberry and sassafras aromas lead to ripe, tautly wound flavors of dried cherry and white pepper. Drink now through 2020. 138 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lake County Burton Ranch Vineyard Old Vine
review: Ripe and slightly muddled, with notes of dried and baked cherry, pepper and herb. Drink now through 2019. 201 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Rockpile Pritchett Peaks Vineyard
review: Concentrated and tightly wound, with modest notes of dried cherry and spicy licorice framing the firm core of tannin. Best from 2017 through 2024. 107 cases made.

name: Syrah San Luis Obispo County Gina's Vineyard
review: Distracted by herbal and spicy leather flavors, with modest fruit and balsamic notes. 800 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet Victoria W
review: Earthy, gamy notes take the forefront over the ripe cherry and berry flavors lurking underneath in this supple red. Drink now through 2007.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz King Valley
review: Ripe and generous, a rich mouthful of blackberry, currant, plum and anise flavors that linger on the juicy finish. Picks up a hint of char at the end. Best from 2003 through 2008. 300 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz King Valley
review: Earthy, gamy flavors protrude into the soft blackberry flavors in this sturdy red, finishing with a tarry note as well. Drink now through 2005. 408 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Victoria Meadow Creek
review: Earthy, woodsy flavors permeate this wine, which barely sneaks in some fruity notes on the oaky finish. 500 cases made.

name: Port Lodi Portocinco Limited Edition
review: Ripe, sweet and complex, with layers of prune, black cherry and plum flavors that stand up straight with a backbone of firm tannins and acidity. Tempting now, but should improve for decades. Only available in restaurants. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Lodi Red Dirt Ridge Select Vineyard Series
review: Starts with plenty of vanilla and cedar from oak, picking up blackberry, earth and green olive character in the modest tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2007.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Crisp and fruity, with grassy pear, herb and lemon notes that are complex and delicate. This is the best Mondavi Woodbridge release in several years and a great value at this price. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California Barrel Aged
review: Smooth and appealing, with generous pineapple, passion fruit and citrus flavors that persist on the lively finish. Contains 9 percent Sémillon. Drink now. 800,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel California
review: A pleasant blend of plum, cherry and herb notes couched in a somewhat silky texture. Won't knock your socks off, but won't disappoint, either. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: Starts off with a pronounced licorice quality, framed in smoky oak. The wine shows moderate body, with currant and spice fanning out on an herbal finish. Best from 2000 through 2006.

name: Pinot Grigio California
review: Pretty but zesty, with nutty and spicy citrus aromas and crisp yet luscious flavors. A hint sweet. Drink now. 287,795 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Tangy and bright, with good depth to floral, fig, straw and melon tones that gain momentum. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: This deft, light-styled Sauvignon Blanc offers juicy citrus, green apple and herb aromas and flavors. A subtle wine, with appealing flavors. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California Lot No. 396
review: A mildly herbal, grassy style, finishing with hints of lime and grapefruit. A lighter-bodied wine, quite refreshing. Drink now.

name: Zinfandel California
review: A complex and enjoyable style of Zin that combines ripe raspberry and cherry-scented flavors with a hint of buttery oak. Elegant and balanced; perfect for everyday drinking or special occasions. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: Marked by vegetal notes, with hints of turnip and asparagus, you finally find enough dark cherry and berry flavors to hold your interest. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California Barrel Aged
review: Simple but pleasant, with ripe cherry and strawberry jam notes, picking up a spicy edge. Drink now. 900,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: A blend of lemon-lime and mineral flavors. Finishes on a bitter note. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Made in a grassy, herbal style, although it finishes with hints of ripe melon. Light-textured, with moderate body. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: A pleasant-enough wine, with a floral edge and some nice, melonlike flavors. A bit hollow on the midpalate. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Crisp and refreshing, with a nice core of citrus, pear, spice and melon flavors. An elegant, refined wine that is drinkable now.

name: Viognier California Winemaker's Selection
review: Vanilla, peach, apricot and floral tones have good intensity, with tangy citrus character on the finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: An herbal style, with spicy currant and berry notes. Simple but appealing. Drink now. 500,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Straightforward citrus, spice and oak notes are simple and refreshing. Drink now.

name: Merlot California Twin Oaks
review: Light and appealing, with plum and toasty spice notes. Drink now.

name: Zinfandel California Barrel Aged
review: A touch earthy, with a green-tealike edge, but the wild berry and cherry flavors rise up and make it palatable. Drink now. 80,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Fish Net Creek Old Vine Select Vineyard Series
review: A bit vegetal, with tar, leaf, sage and dried berry flavors that veer toward dryness. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: Soft and simple, with herb, cherry and berry flavors that seem sweet on the finish. Drinkable, but not interesting. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: Has modest but true varietal character, with depth and concentration, presenting pure currant, plum, spice and oak flavors in a ready-to-drink style. A solid choice for everyday drinking.

name: Chardonnay California Barrel Aged
review: Ripe with a fruity, earthy edge to the pear and cedary notes. Drink now. 1000000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey County Lot No. 196
review: Tropical notes, melon and citrus lead the way. The texture remains thin, however, and the finish is a bit short. Drink now.

name: Johannisberg Riesling California
review: Soft, sweet and fairly simple, but still appealing for its creamy pear and spice fruit. Drink now. 17,965 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Round and lively, with vanilla, ripe melon, grass and lemon notes. Drink now.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Select Vineyard Series Fish Net Creek Old Vine
review: Lean and simple, with dried cherry and licorice notes. Drink now. 6,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: Herbal and oaky with weedy currant flavors that turn earthy and bitter on the finish. Drink now. 450,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California Twin Oaks
review: Smooth, silky texture frames a wine that doesn't quite meet the same flavor standard. Some blackberry and mint, but overall leans more toward coffee and stems. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Light and toasty, with apple and pear notes finishing slightly bitter. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Pleasant but simple, with tangerine and toast flavors. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Crisp and simple, a light wine with bright citrusy flavor. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Light and simple, with modest apple and cream aromas and flavors. Pleasing, but not very assertive. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay California Select Vineyard Series Ghost Oak
review: One-dimensional and slightly sweet, with lemon and tropical fruit and a hint of herbs. Drink now.

name: Merlot Lodi Clay Hollow Select Vineyard Series
review: Austere, with a green, earthy edge to the faint cherry and cola flavors. Finishes with a twinge of bitterness. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Tart, with citrus rind, apple and herb flavors. Drink now. 653,210 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California Lot No. 295
review: On the tart side, with a chewy layer of tannin over the modest strawberry and currant flavors.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Citrusy grapefruit and spice flavors have a twinge of bitterness. Lacks varietal character. 2600000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Crisp, clean and lean in flavor. Mostly appley, with good acidity but not much depth. Fine for a simple, everyday wine.

name: Merlot Lodi Select Vineyard Series Clay Hollow
review: Simple cherry and rhubarb aromas and flavors, finishing with somewhat hard and chalky tannins.

name: Zinfandel California
review: A modestly fruity, medium-bodied, lightly tannic Zinfandel. A bit earthy on the aftertaste.

name: Zinfandel California Lot No. 496
review: Fairly vegetal, with a slightly sour quality.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: Curious, with plum, herb and fish notes offset by oak and firm, slightly green tannin.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Tart, with unripe apple flavors.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Sulphury onion skin notes never quite blow off, giving the citrus flavors a funky, vegetal edge. 445,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel California
review: Light and diluted, with simple cherry and strawberry notes. 25,000 cases made.

name: White Zinfandel California
review: If you like drinking cherry candy, this wine is for you.

name: Zinfandel California
review: Weedy, talcy notes dominate the faint fruit flavors.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: An odd assortment of flavors: smoke, black currant, burnt rubber and herbs. A certain firmness and tannic edge seems to hold it together, however.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: Leathery, herbal and ripe in equal measure, generous but rough and basic.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Simple and modestly varietal, with crisp apple, pear and honey flavors, but they don't stay with you very long.

name: Zinfandel California
review: Ordinary, with tart strawberry flavors and a tannic edge.

name: Chardonnay New York
review: Spicy, buttery, toasty notes dominate the modest pear and fig flavors in this easy-drinking, medium-bodied Chardonnay. Shows plenty of stylish oak flavors and keeps everything in balance. 3,000 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs New York
review: An interesting, flavorful brut with ripe pear and fig flavors, and a touch of earthiness that makes it stand out. Rich, ripe and assertive in style.

name: Riesling New York Dry
review: Fruity and dry, with a round texture and lemony flavors that remain lively through the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Riesling New York
review: Crisp and lemony, this off-dry, neutral wine offers hints of peach and earthiness on the finish. Ultimately simple and straightforward. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Wiley Vineyard Unfined & Unfiltered
review: Begins openly juicy, with spicy blackberry and wild berry flavors, firming midpalate and taking on a crushed rock and forest floor earthiness that's pleasing. Drink now through 2020. 250 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino Ridge Mariah Vineyard
review: Features ample jammy black cherry fruit, making this a pleasure to drink. Shows good focus and structure, with accents of wild berry, grilled anise and toasty, spicy cinnamon. Drink now through 2022. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Ritchie Vineyard Cinder Cone
review: The initial notes of plum, dark berry and black licorice are alluring, though this turns dry and tannic on the finish. Best from 2014 through 2022. 124 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Bertoli Vineyard Leras Ranches Unfined & Unfiltered
review: Aromas of blueberry and fresh pine lead to modest but zesty boysenberry and mineral flavors. Drink now through 2018. 172 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Martinelli Road Vineyard Old Vine
review: A big bruiser, with blueberry and licorice aromas and full-bodied red currant and peppered beef flavors that finish with muscular tannins. Best from 2010 through 2014. 715 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino County Guido Venturi Vineyard
review: Ripe and compact, with notes of black cherry, spicy caramel and herb. Drink now through 2018. 200 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Alexander Valley Braccialini Vineyard
review: Quite ripe and briary, with blackberry, herb and smoky earth flavors. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Viognier Columbia Valley Hudson Shah
review: Effusive, spicy and disarmingly generous with its clove-scented pineapple and coconut flavors, finishing with pizzazz. Drink now. 130 cases made.

name: Viognier Columbia Valley Hudson Shah
review: Light and silky, featuring lots of spice to the pear and grapefruit flavors. Finishes with polish. Drink now. 241 cases made.

name: Merlot Rattlesnake Hills Maghee
review: Soft, almost plush, with distinctive blueberry, roasted red pepper and smoke flavors mingling effectively through the polished finish. Drink now through 2010. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rattlesnake Hills Kennedy Shah BLT Barrel Select
review: Firm in texture, this is generous with its blackberry, floral and fresh orange peel character, persisting on the slightly aggressive finish. Needs cellaring. Best after 2008. 600 cases made.

name: Daríghe Columbia Valley
review: A strong minty character distinguishes this firm, tight red. Deft grip on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Best after 2008. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah Columbia Valley Double Vision
review: Fresh and expansive, with inviting tangerine peel and black tea overtones around a supple core of black cherry and roasted meat flavors, lingering on the polished finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2018. 100 cases made.

name: Indomitable Columbia Valley
review: Offers crisp tannins, with fresh, vibrant currant and blackberry flavors rising smoothly from below and extending onto an expressive finish. Should come together with cellaring. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2014 through 2019. 290 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: This is polished, with a spicy layer wrapping itself around the generous, ripe blackberry, blueberry and plum fruit, working in wafts of black pepper and licorice as the tangy finish persists. Drink now through 2016. 225 cases made.

name: Ausonius Columbia Valley
review: Ripe and polished, this juicy mouthful of currant, plum and spicy herbal flavors remains open and inviting through the long, refined finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Drink now through 2015. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Firm in texture, but smoothing out with additional sips, this red exhibits generous ripe currant, cherry and cocoa flavors, framed with polished tannins and finishing harmoniously. Drink now through 2017. 140 cases made.

name: Indomitable Columbia Valley
review: This firm, focused red is not a heavy-weight, but deep with cardamom and espresso nuances to the ripe blackberry and black currant flavors, persisting on the refined finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2012 through 2018. 220 cases made.

name: Indomitable Columbia Valley
review: Polished and generous with its vivid blackberry, currant and plum fruit, balancing deftly against lively acidity and fine tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2013. 195 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: Supple, velvety and blooming with fresh plum and currant flavors that play against a swarm of refined tannins as the finish sails on smoothly. Best from 2018 through 2023. 150 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: Explosively ripe, bursting with dark berry, fresh currant, plum, spice and black olive flavors, riding easily over a bed of refined tannins into the long, expressive finish. Drink now through 2018. 167 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: Bright, vivid flavors bore through dense tannins, coming out the other side with a meaty edge to the dark berry and black olive notes. The finish remains lively and picks up a mineral tone. Best from 2011 through 2017. 250 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: Juicy, broad and generous with its blueberry, plum and nutmeg flavors, beautifully knit with refined tannins on a velvety background. Stylish, with real depth. Best from 2008 through 2014. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Columbia Valley
review: Fresh, focused and lively, with blackberry, fresh red pepper and spice flavors lightly wrapped in fine tannins, lingering well. Drink now through 2016. 95 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Supple, round and generous, with root beeraccented blackberry and licorice flavors. The finish lingers against a light veil of tannins. Shows presence and persistence. Drink now through 2022. 120 cases made.

name: Indomitable Columbia Valley
review: Sleek and refined, this offers guava-tinged boysenberry fruit that's centered on a lithe frame, hinting at floral and peppery notes as the finish lingers against fine tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Drink now through 2018. 225 cases made.

name: Little Bear Creek Columbia Valley
review: Plush and juicy, offering a lively mouthful of currant and plum, with hints of herb and spice as the finish lingers. Shows a racy charm. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Malbec. Drink now through 2017. 600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River 'Chloe' Woodlands Vineyard Wilyabrup Valley
review: Lithe, supple and expressive, layering pear, cream, wax and spice flavors on a polished frame. Remains deft and complex as the finish persists. Drink now through 2022. 360 cases made.

name: Margaret Margaret River
review: Powerful and savory, with bay leaf and eucalyptus details to the sleek currant and cassis notes at the core. Spice, tobacco and black tea accents echo on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec. Drink now through 2026. 1,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River Wilyabrup Valley
review: Elegant and juicy, with a mix of citrus and stone fruit flavors accented by toast and floral notes, and a juicy, peachy finish. Drink now through 2026. 1,400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River Wilyabrup Valley
review: Fresh and inviting, deftly balanced and appealing, with pear, tropical fruit and citrus flavors, lingering easily. Drink now. 470 cases made.

name: Margaret Woodlands Vineyard Wilyabrup Valley Margaret River
review: Firm tannins overlay a lively core of mint-accented cherry flavors, pushing into a lithe finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec. Best after 2015. 575 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Margaret River Heather Jean Woodlands Vineyard Wilyabrup Valley
review: Firm and chewy, with plushness to the ripe cherry and spice flavors, layered with resinous, minty overtones, coming together on the focused finish. Best from 2016 through 2020. 300 cases made.

name: Margaret Woodlands Vineyard Wilyabrup Valley Margaret River
review: Fresh herb flavors provide a brambly background to cassis and plum notes, with rustic tannins on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec. Drink now through 2026. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc-Merlot Margaret River Wilyabrup Valley
review: Distinctly herbal, offering sage and rosemary notes up front and lean, crisp red berry flavors at the core, with gritty tannins. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Margaret Woodlands Vineyard Wilyabrup Valley Margaret River
review: Mint and thyme overtones cut through the green berry flavors, finishing against chewy tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2016. 1,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc-Merlot Margaret River Wilyabrup Valley
review: Firm and chewy, with grippy tannins around a savory core, offering more oversteeped tea character than fruit. Best after 2016. 600 cases made.

name: Tawny Port South Australia Queen Adelaide
review: Lean in structure, with rich spice and cigar flavors that cut through the sweetness. Has asense of elegance and impressive length. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet South Eastern Australia Queen Adelaide
review: Ripe in flavor, crisp in texture and tighly wound; should be at its best in 1997. 60,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet South Eastern Australia Queen Adelaide
review: A simple, tart red, with pleasant plum and lime aromas and flavors. An unusual style, but should be fine with food. Drinkable now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Queen Adelaide
review: Pear and pineapple flavors take on a slightly tinny edge in this simple, direct wine. Doesn't have much finesse, but it's drinkable.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Queen Adelaide
review: Plenty of ripe pineapple and pear fruit up front with a touch of lemon and herb. A fruity style that's simple but attractive.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Queen Adelaide
review: Lean and austere, with little generosity of fruit, offering mostly earthy mineral notes and finishing short. 100,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet South Eastern Australia Queen Adelaide
review: Light and definitely herbal, with more beet and tobacco flavors than fruit. Drinkable now.

name: Chardonnay Santa Cruz Mountains Estate Reserve
review: Simple and pleasant, with hints of apple, citrus and toasty oak. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Awkward, with a bitterness to the simple apple and butter flavors. 374 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Lean and tart, with green pineapple and floral aromas and flavors. 357 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Santa Cruz Mountains Vineyard Hill Vineyards
review: Very ripe and minty, with jammy, tannic fruit that shows its heat. Not for the faint-of-heart. 191 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Lean, tart and vegetal with odd turnip, burlap and weedy black currant flavors that turn earthy and funky on the finish. Not our style, but drinkable. Perhaps with bottle time it will taste more together. 153 cases made.

name: Shiraz Margaret River Bonnefoy
review: Supple, ripe and generous with its plum and blackberry fruit, hitting some black pepper and licorice notes as the plush finish settles in. Best from 2008 through 2014. 240 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River Le Bas
review: Polished and appealing for its spicy green apple and quince flavors. Finishes with a touch of lime as the spicy oak joins the party. Drink now through 2010. 435 cases made.

name: Shiraz Margaret River Bonnefoy
review: Ripe, dense and focused, with a gamy edge to the black cherry and white pepper flavors that persist on the firm-textured finish. Best from 2007 through 2011. 252 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: Supple in texture, with vibrant huckleberry and blackberry flavors, hinting at coffee and spice on the refined finish. Drink now through 2015. 1,050 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Pilot's View
review: Fresh and vital, with a certain plushness to the pure blackberry and green tea flavors, lingering with pizzazz. The firm tannins may soften with cellaring. Drink now through 2019. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Firm in texture, with peppery overtones to the dark berry and spice flavors, long and expressive. Has presence and length. Drink now through 2020. 8,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale The Stocks
review: Ripe and polished, with a touch of earthy, gamy character adding a little extra oomph to the nicely proportioned black cherry, blackberry and licorice flavors, echoing on the relatively refined finish. Drink now through 2010. 2,100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Polished and smooth, with cassis, spice, dark chocolate and tobacco accents that have a juicy finish and plenty of focus. Drink now through 2026. 8,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Tangy berry and cranberry flavors are tight and trim, with accents of fresh earth, herb, spice and black tea that linger on the finish. Drink now through 2028. 15,000 cases made.

name: The Octogenarian McLaren Vale
review: Fresh and vital, with dark berry and black cherry flavors on a sleek frame, lingering against polished tannins on the lively finish. Grenache and Tempranillo. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sémillon-Sauvignon Blanc McLaren Vale
review: Bright and tangy, a lively mouthful of juicy pear, pepper and herb flavors, which pick up nice citrusy hints on the lengthy finish. Drink now through 2004. 200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Pilot's View
review: Accents of fresh herb and earth lend an austere character to the airy wild berry core, with the tannins lending a firm finish. Drink now through 2029. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Firm, with pretty currant and black cherry fruit on a lean frame, finishing with fine tannins. Drink now through 2008. 2,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay McLaren Vale
review: Supple, subtle and appealing for its pretty nectarine, cream and delicately minerally flavors, which echo on the gentle finish. Drink now through 2005. 200 cases imported.

name: Grenache-Tempranillo McLaren Vale The Octogenarian
review: Cola, wild berry and herb flavors have dense, chewy tannins and a fresh juicy note that lingers. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Firm and chewy, with tangy acidity to underline the blackberry and herb flavors. Best from 2017 through 2020. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sémillon Australia
review: A wine with personality and style. Soft and fragrant, with lots of sage, vanilla and fig aromas and flavors. A little short on intensity, but pleasant. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Sémillon McLaren Vale
review: Gentle in texture, with modest citrus, pear and herbal flavors. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Australia
review: An earthy, smoky character runs through this lean, spicy red. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Deliciously fruity, rich, supple and complex, with tiers of black currant, cherry, plum and anise flavors, finishing with a toasty, earthy aftertaste that adds dimension to the fruit. Drink now.

name: Charbonneau Red Walla Walla County
review: Tight and firm, seductive and elegant, with sharply focused black cherry and toasty currant flavors that are enticing and beautifully integrated. Plenty of fine tannins bode well for cellaring. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 1994.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Deep, dark, rich and intense, this is jam-packed with flavors. Tiers of currant, exotic spices and herb and floral notes, finishing with a rich, buttery oak aftertaste that keeps drawing out the flavors. Tempting now—so try a bottle—but hold a few for down the road. 2,191 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Firm and tight, a beautifully proportioned wine, with rich, ripe plum, black cherry and anise flavors that fan out on the finish. Drinking well now but needs until 1995 for the tannins to soften.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Silky, complex and very Burgundian in style. Smells very toasty and buttery, with rich, almost unctuous pear, butterscotch and spice flavors accented by hazelnut, honey and cream notes. The flavors linger a long time on the finish.  1,553 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Dense, dark, chewy and delicious, overflowing with ripe berry, vanilla, floral and herbal flavors that meander for a long finish. A serious wine with distinctive character, it needs cellaring until 2001 to 2003 to settle down. 2,691 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Bold, ripe and intense, with layers of plum, cedar, spice, anise and currant flavors that are rich, deep and concentrated. Has firm but polished tannins and a long, lingering aftertaste that keeps repeating the fruit themes. 1,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Artist Series #23
review: Well-built, with a firm backbone wrapped in rich and expressive notes of blackberry, green olive and clove, lingering toward big but refined tannins. Drink now through 2025. 3,250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Old Vines
review: Rich, ripe and generous, beautifully layered with blackberry, black cherry and plum, plus spice, chocolate and almost peachlike overtones, it all lingers on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2007. 1,265 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Old Vines
review: Rich, ripe and impressively deep, with layers of currant, cherry and gentle, smoky chocolate notes echoing on the long finish. Has a sense of elegance that prevents it getting heavy. Tannins are in bounds, making this a great cellar candidate. Best from 2003 through 2010. 1,163 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
review: Powerful, distinctive style turns up the volume on its delicious plum, currant and exotic spice flavors, weaving hints of cedar and herbs into the mix, all the while retaining a lively balance that lets the flavors echo effortlessly. Drink now through 2010. 247 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington 20th Anniversary Artist Series
review: This has tremendous presence, offering a sturdy package of black currant, plum, clove and mocha flavors that linger expressively against polished tannins. Drink now through 2019. 1,930 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Canoe Ridge Vineyard Artist Series #4
review: A smooth and silky Washington Cab, its dark plum, blackberry and vanilla flavors tumbling over the palate, finishing with sweet ripeness wrapped in polished, fine-grained tannins. Folds some pretty oak into the mix on the aftertaste. Delicious now. Best from 1999 through 2005. 2,340 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Bright, vibrant, exciting stuff, a lush mouthful of spicy pear, honey and apricot flavors that pick up hints of honey and orange peel on the racy finish. It's all of a piece, and has depth, richness and enough acidity to keep everything lively. Drink now through 2009. 899 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Walla Walla Valley
review: A ripe, rich and silky-smooth Washington Chard, layered with distinctively spicy, honey-scented pear, apricot and citrus flavors that linger enticingly on the harmonious finish. Tempting now, even better in 1998 to 2000. 2,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington
review: Vibrant, with flickers of lemon curd and guava glistening around the core of pear and pineapple fruit, coming together seamlessly on the expressive finish. Drink now through 2020. 650 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington Reserve
review: Lean and concentrated, with a pretty band of pear, toast and nutmeg flavors that unfold on a long finish. Shows a good winemaker's hand for Chardonnay. Drinkable now. 655 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Beautifully focused, generous with its ripe currant and blackberry flavors, shaded nicely with sage and spice notes, finishing with a deceptively full complement of fine-grained tannins. Best from 2000 through 2006. 1,265 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Artist Series #14
review: Earth and tobacco flavors weave through the chunky cherry and black tea character, making this more savory than most. Yet has the structure to age. Definitely worth cellaring. Best after 2010. 2,866 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Artist Series #22
review: Firm in texture, with a roasted red pepper edge to the dark berry and herb flavors, coming together on the harmonious finish. Has presence and length. Best from 2018 through 2023. 3,773 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Dedication Series #10
review: Supple, rich and elegant, this is impressive for its toasty, buttery oak notes and pretty core of cherry and currant flavors. Adds up to a complex, engaging young wine that seduces you with flavor, yet has the depth and intensity to keep your interest. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Artist Series #15
review: This soft, open-textured Cabernet brims with black cherry and currant flavors that linger impressively, with a sweet coffee note adding interest. Drink now through 2016. 2,821 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Artist Series #17
review: Rich and ripe, with a green edge to the ripe plum and cherry flavors, lingering with deft balance on the firm-textured finish. Best after 2013. 2,573 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Artist Series #8
review: Dark, dense and rich with blackberry, black currant and cherry flavors, shaded with hints of spice and cedar as the flavors sink gently into a plush texture. Drink now through 2008. 3,151 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Canoe Ridge Vineyard Artist Series #5
review: Ripe and generous, this soft-textured mouthful has currant, blackberry and black cherry flavors that linger enticingly and share mouth-space with a spicy oak note that becomes stronger on the polished finish. Drink now through 2005. 2,239 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Old Vines
review: Fine-grained tannins underlie a sleek core of blackberry, loamy earth and spice flavors, finishing with gentle assurance. A graceful wine that needs cellaring to soften the edges. Best from 2017 through 2022. 533 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Walla Walla Valley Estate
review: Golden, vibrant color and frankly spicy-oaky aromas mark this as a serious wine, and the intense pineapple, pear and quince flavors come through impressively. Ultimately, the balance is impeccable, and the fruit lingers on the creamy finish. Delicious already. Drink now through 2008. 143 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington
review: Fresh and lively, with juicy pear and grapefruit flavors that are shaded with a hint of spice as the finish lingers intently. Drink now through 2015. 733 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington Celilo Vineyard
review: Bright, flavorful and elegant, weaving some lovely nutmeg and pepper flavors through the silky pear and vanilla core. Echoes the flavors on the long finish, too. 240 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington Reserve
review: Ripe, focused and elegant, swirling its pear, spice and honey flavors in a finish that fans out appealingly. Approachable now, but best from 1997. 642 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington Reserve
review: Smooth and elegant, fanning out its pear, spice and apple flavors with a nice touch of citrus on the lively finish. Harmonious, graceful and appealing. Ready now. 490 cases made.

name: Estate Walla Walla Valley
review: Smooth, focused and generous with its coffee- and tobacco-accented cherry, blackberry and savory meat flavors. The finish just sails, remaining poised and expressive. Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2014. 253 cases made.

name: Estate Walla Walla Valley
review: Has density and intensity without extra weight, a beautifully proportioned wine that oozes with black cherry, currant, plum and cocoa flavors, picking up exotic spice notes on the long, focused finish. Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2005 through 2015. 270 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Broad and spicy, transparent at the core, with a woodsy note wafting through the crisp black cherry and clove flavors that linger on the vivid finish. Best from 2014 through 2019. 301 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: An elegant wine with a lovely core of floral currant flavors, shaded with hints of meat and smoke, with the fruit piercing a veil of firm tannins well, delivering more than you expect on the long, driving finish. Best from 2006 through 2012. 2,131 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Dark, dense and chewy up front, with a soft core that glows with cherry, berry and smoky spice flavors that are spread on the velvety finish. Drink now through 2005. 2,072 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Chewy texture and vivid, ripe, violet-scented currant and berry flavors make this a good cellar candidate—or drink it with a juicy steak. It's impressive for its intensity and length. Drink now through 2007. 2,479 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Rich, almost exotic, with distinctive raspberry, dark cherry and floral aromas and flavors on a supple frame, finishing with remarkable focus and length. Has the depth and intensity to develop in the cellar. Best from 2001 through 2008. 1,685 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
