review: This Washington red offers a solid mouthful of ripe berry, tar and sweet anise flavors that linger on the chewy finish. Artfully balanced to show the lovely fruit character and length. Try now or hold into 1998. 1,467 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Walla Walla Valley Estate
review: Fresh and vibrant, with juicy Meyer lemon, grapefruit, apple and apricot flavors that come together harmoniously, finishing sleek. Drink now through 2015. 355 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Dedication Series #12
review: This Washington Cab is firm and chunky in texture, with ripe blackberry, anise and herbal flavors poking through the tannins on the long finish. Richly flavorful. Try in 1998. 2,448 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Klipsun Vineyard
review: On the crisp side, nicely layered with black cherry, tar and herb aromas and flavors that echo beautifully on the harmonious finish. Drink now through 2006. 94 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Old Vines
review: Supple and generous with its spicy, oak-tinged berry and currant flavors, which linger nicely on the fine-grained finish. Best from 2005 through 2015. 1,398 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
review: Supple, velvety and broad, with tarry, peppery black cherry and licorice flavors that linger on the smooth finish. Drink now through 2016. 588 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Artist Series #18
review: Fresh and zesty, with a dark cast to the cherry flavors that show licorice and tar notes. Finishes with intensity against a mild grip of tannins. Drink now through 2015. 2,688 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Artist Series #21
review: Open-textured and inviting, with a pop of dark berry and sassafras flavors on a supple frame, finishing with firm tannins. This one sneaks up on you. Drink now through 2017. 4,319 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Artist Series #7
review: Firm and round, with black cherry and herb flavors galore, which echo nicely on the finish, picking up hints of cedar and spice. Drink now through 2006. 3,428 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Artist Series #9
review: Firm in texture, generous with its currant and plum flavors, which emerge nicely from a layer of fine-grained tannins, picking up hints of bay leaf and olive. Best from 2004 through 2010. 3,180 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Canoe Ridge Vineyard
review: Marked by toasty, buttery oak up front and complex currant and berry flavors following up, turning smooth and supple. 304 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Canoe Ridge Vineyard Artist Series #2
review: Smooth and inviting for its spicy currant and black cherry flavors that jump right up and show from the first sip, then remain lively through the supple finish. 297 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Old Vines
review: Firm in texture, with tightly packed cherry and black olive flavors on a focused beam, lingering on the deftly balanced finish. Drink now through 2018. 456 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Cabernet Franc Washington Special Selection
review: Still fresh after five years, with its supple core of currant and blueberry flavor and hints of cedar and herb all wrapped in a veil of fine tannins. Persists nicely on the finish. Best from 1999 through 2004. 204 cases made.

name: Charbonneau Red Walla Walla County
review: Crisp in texture, a bit earthy but ultimately nicely packed with cherry and herb flavors, this is an elegant red that pick up hints of dark chocolate on the long, beautifully formed finish. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2008. 424 cases made.

name: Charbonneau Red Walla Walla County
review: Lithe, with generous, ripe blackberry, plum and tobacco flavors, and a swirl of exotic orange blossom and spice notes on the lingering finish. Ripe, sweet and focused. Approachable now. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 1998. 291 cases made.

name: Charbonneau White Walla Walla County
review: Rich, round and spicy, a generous mouthful of fig, date, vanilla and cream flavors that finish dry and enticing, the flavors lingering delicately for such a substantial wine. Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now through 2004. 91 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Lithe, harmonious style offers pretty pear, floral and cream aromas and flavors on a sleek frame. The finish remains elegant and refined as the flavors linger. Drink now through 2005. 805 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Crisp, and distinctive for its layers of spice and earth notes around a fine core of pear and citrus flavors. Light on its feet, but offers plenty of Chardonnay fruit that lasts impressively on the elegant finish before a hint of oak flavor sneaks in. Drink now through 2003. 2,239 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Ripe, generous, harmonious and complex, spreading out its citrus, pineapple, mineral and toast character on a rich, supple frame. 1,820 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Showing more fruit up front than the Reserve bottling, it delivers complex pear, toast, honey and spicy nutmeg flavors and a long, lingering finish. Try now. 1,641 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Idaho Arena Valley Vineyard
review: A fresh and open-textured wine, its rich mouthful of spicy pear and apricot flavors hinting at earth and floral notes on the vanilla-tinged finish. Has impressive length, too. Drink now through 2000. 434 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington
review: Polished and vibrant, with floral tropical fruit and spice aromas and sleek, complex flavors of pear and citrus. Drink now through 2019. 613 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington
review: Gentle, lithe and appealing, featuring pineapple-accented pear and citrus flavors, finishing smooth. This has restraint, but keep singing on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 873 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington Celilo Vineyard
review: Bright and vibrant, with lovely spicy overtones to the juicy pear and citrus flavors, finishing with lots of character and finesse. The flavors echo persistently. Drink now through 2005. 338 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington Celilo Vineyard
review: Beautifully focused wine, bright in flavor, with ripe nectarine and pear notes ringing through the polished, generous, remarkably harmonious finish. Drink now through 2004. 212 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington Celilo Vineyard
review: Juicy nectarine and fresh prune flavors slide across a lean, lively frame. Packs a lot of character into its compact structure, and finishes with notes of spice and toast. Ready to drink. 415 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington Conner Lee Vineyard
review: Ripe and generous, this rich, round Chardonnay has spicy pear and toasty, gently honeyed flavors that linger on the beautifully balanced finish. Drink now through 2003. 713 cases made.

name: Estate Reserve Walla Walla Valley
review: Precise and well-structured, with blackberry, pepper and espresso flavors that lead to sturdy but refined tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2024. 367 cases made.

name: Estate Reserve Walla Walla Valley
review: Very firm and chewy, with mouthcoating tannins around a core of red berry-accented blackberry and roasted pepper flavors. Finishes with presence. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Best from 2018 through 2022. 214 cases made.

name: Estate Walla Walla Valley
review: Firm in texture, focused in flavor, with enticing aromatics of smoke and roasted cherry, delivering a concentrated mouthful of spicy cherry and dried tomato flavors that manage to persist without being heavy. Tannins are well-integrated. Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Best from 2008 through 2013. 497 cases made.

name: Estate Walla Walla Valley
review: Firm in texture, with a distinct minty note running through the rich berry and currant fruit flavors, hinting at sage as it persists nicely on the chewy finish. Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2007 through 2012. 628 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Trim and focused, with elegantly layered notes of red currant, tobacco and spice that linger toward refined tannins. Drink now through 2022. 433 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Mouthcoating tannins underlie a core of tobacco-accented blackberry and mint flavors, pushing through into a long and expressive finish. Best from 2018 through 2021. 203 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Ripe and peppery, with a smoky edge to the meaty flavors that border on dried currant. A distinctive wine that persists nicely and finishes with a gentle flourish of spicy oak. Drink now through 2010. 834 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Tannic, chewy style has a dense core of berry and tar flavors that get more oomph as the finish lingers, echoing herb and spice notes. Needs time to sort out the tannins. Best from 2007 through 2012. 1,535 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Artist Series #11
review: Dense and chewy, with ripe cherry and currant flavors, finishing with a smoky note. A big wine with richness and tannins that need to soften. Drink now through 2012. 3,157 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Old Vines
review: Firm in texture, focused in flavor. Distinctive for its cinnamon-spicy black raspberry and cherry character that lingers on the finish. A stylish red, with length and elegance. Drink now through 2005. 1,508 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Old Vines
review: Ripe and succulent, complex, with chocolate, earth and woodsy overtones to the slender beam of plum and berry at the center. A nicely balanced wine that seems to have reached its best. Drink now through 2001. 1,190 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
review: Firm in texture, with a crisp edge to the generous herbal cherry flavors, finishing on a spicy note. Finishes with a good lift to the structure. Drink now through 2012. 424 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Artist Series #6
review: Supple, generous and nicely focused to show off its raspberry, red cherry and herb flavors, hinting at cream and vanilla on the polished finish. Delicious now. Best from 2001 through 2007. 2,636 cases made.

name: Charbonneau Red Walla Walla County
review: Dark, dense and a bit drying, with a cereallike note cutting through the ripe cherry and berry flavors. The flavors emerge boldly on the round finish, adding a dusty edge. Give it time to sort itself out. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2005. 257 cases made.

name: Charbonneau Red Walla Walla County
review: Lavishly oaked, with exotic herb and spice notes complementing the ripe cranberry and cherry flavors. The texture is smooth, and the finish echoes chocolate and herbs. Fans of this style will love it. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 1995.

name: Charbonneau Walla Walla County
review: Fresh and expressive, medium-weight and present, with red and black cherry, coffee and cocoa notes that come together smoothly against nicely moderated tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2019. 349 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Distinctly spicy and floral, with a peppery edge to the sweet pea, iris, grapefruit and pear flavors, finishing with a toasty oak note. Drink now through 2008. 536 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Crisp, lithe and appealing for the spicy, dusky herb grace notes around a nice core of pear and grapefruit flavors, lingering gently. Drink now through 2007. 1,079 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Reserve
review: A layer of distinctly earthy flavor runs through this firm Chardonnay, but enough citrusy pear peeks through to make this worth holding onto. Best after 1999. 713 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Walla Walla Valley
review: This beautifully balanced, elegant expression of Chardonnay holds a lot back but shows layers of spicy pear, orange, citrus and mineral flavors lurking beneath the surface. Drink now through 2005. 712 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington
review: Silky, focused and appealing for its pear and citrus flavors, finishing with refinement. Shows elegance and a light frame. Drink now through 2013. 454 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington
review: On the lighter side, this is polished and toasty, mixing butterscotch and melon flavors that linger appealingly on the expressive finish. Drink now. 509 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington
review: Supple and spicy, with a pretty core of apple and grapefruit flavor, lingering on the jazzy finish. Turns crisp with succeeding sips. A good Chardonnay for delicate food. Drink now through 2000. 1,868 cases made.

name: Estate Reserve Walla Walla Valley
review: A firm grip of tannins surrounds a taut layer of black cherry and rose petal flavors. Needs time to soften the grip. Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Best after 2016. 308 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, with a sassafras note adding interest to the cherry and herb aromas and flavors, finishing with thrust against a burr of tannin. Best from 2012 through 2015. 941 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Firm, tight and sharply focused, with ripe cherry, currant and floral character packed into a taut frame, persisting nicely on the finish. Best from 2011 through 2016. 623 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, with pepper and blackberry notes poking through a layer of fine tannins. Finish persists, suggesting this just needs time. Best from 2001 through 2005. 1,135 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Lean, nicely focused, showing currant and berry flavors and a touch of toast, spice and tannin on the finish. Has depth and elegance. At its best now through 1997. 1,211 cases made.

name: Merlot Walla Walla Valley
review: Rich in flavor and jazzy in structure, with racy acidity to balance the generous currant and cherry flavors, which echo on the lively finish. Best from 2003 through 2006. 899 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Dry
review: Light and crisp, with bright lemony pear fruit at the core, lingering delicately. Drink now through 2019. 191 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Deep, dark color, ripe and sturdy, with firm, concentrated currant, plum, spice and anise notes. Complex and aging well, but still tannic. Ready now, but should hold through 1997.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Artist Series #10
review: Firm, with lively black cherry and currant flavors against juicy acidity, finishing with an inviting balance. Needs time to flesh out. Best from 2006 through 2012. 2,981 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Dedication Series #13
review: On the crisp side, but nicely packed with spicy plum and coffee flavors. Remains lean and balanced toward spicy oak on the finish. Should be best in 1998. 2,447 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Old Vines
review: Tannins are gritty, but the flavors are ripe and forward, with cherry and currant at the core and smoky, roasted pepper character lingering on the chewy finish. Best after 2008. 992 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Old Vines
review: Firm in texture, with a solid core of cherry and herb flavors, hitting a smoky-earthy note as the finish persists. Best after 2007. 954 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Old Vines
review: Dense, tight and focused, with a strong streak of green flavor running through the otherwise ripe currant and blackberry fruit, finishing long and firm. Those who don't mind the green character will warm up to this. Best from 2006 through 2012. 1,209 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
review: Ripe and focused, with a smoke note hanging over the modulated currant and tomato-leaf flavors, lingering softly. Drink now through 2013. 599 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Artist Series #16
review: Medium-weight and approachable, despite the chewy tannins exerting a grip on the smoky cherry and licorice flavors. Drink now through 2013. 2,327 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Artist Series #19
review: Lean, focused and distinctive, with toast, bay leaf and blueberry flavors on a tight frame, finishing firm. Needs cellaring. Best after 2015. 2,967 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Old Vines
review: Firm and compact, with complex black cherry, olive and licorice flavors, framed by persistent tannins. Best from 2019 through 2023. 600 cases made.

name: Charbonneau Red Walla Walla County
review: Very tight, compact and austere, with hints of plum, cherry, anise and cedar. Deeply concentrated, but youthful and unevolved. A nice core of prune and currant flavor emerges on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 1994. 418 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Bright and charming, round in structure, offering quince and pineapple flavors that linger with a touch of cream on the finish. Drink now. 1,186 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Bright and flavorful, a little astringent around the edges but shining with pear, apple and vanilla flavors. Best from late 1996. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington
review: Rich and spicy, with polish to the creamy texture, pear and grapefruit flavors coming through as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2019. 1,114 cases made.

name: Columbia Valley
review: Aims for elegance and achieves a lithe balance of spicy tobacco notes and sweet berry flavor that holds through the fine-grained tannins on the finish. A blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 1999. 1,236 cases made.

name: Estate Reserve Walla Walla Valley
review: Swarms of prickly tannins surround a dark core of licorice-bathed blackberry flavors, finishing on a peppery note. Needs cellaring to soften the edges. Merlot, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2015. 173 cases made.

name: Estate Walla Walla Valley
review: Firm, round and nicely fleshed out with currant and spice flavors, hinting at roasted green peppers as the finish persists. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2009. 317 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Ripe and chewy, with pretty cherry, spice, chocolate and leather notes weaving through a firm-textured, artfully balanced frame. Tempting already. Drink now through 2002. 2,428 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: A crisp style, but with enough juicy prune, tobacco and exotic spice flavors swirling through it to make it appealing. Ready now, better in 1998. 1,467 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Toasty, buttery oak shows through the currant and black cherry flavors. Tannins are also a bit smoother. Complex and elegant in style. Drink now through 1998.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Artist Series #12
review: Firm, with chunky tannins around a straightforward burst of berry and toast flavors. Best after 2006. 3,275 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Old Vines
review: Firm and focused, centered on licorice-accented dark berry and pepper flavors, persisting against chewy tannins on the finish. Best after 2018. 768 cases made.

name: Charbonneau White Walla Walla County
review: Supple and appealing for its spicy fig and tobacco flavors, finishing with a touch of vanilla. Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now. 175 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, turning fleshy and broad with spicy black cherry and plum flavors. Finishes with a flourish, if a bit raw. Best from 2006 through 2010. 233 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Spicy, with intense, focused currant, berry and cherry notes. Crisp acidity carries the flavors. Firm but not overpowering tannins. Drink after 1994.

name: Charbonneau Red Walla Walla County
review: Complex, with firm, deep currant, anise and cedar flavors and hard tannins. Lacks the finesse and polish of later bottlings, but still offers plenty of flavor. Has room to grow. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 1996.

name: Charbonneau Walla Walla County
review: Round and generous, with a vegetal edge to the ripe currant and smoke flavors. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2012. 409 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Leans toward the herb and bell pepper spectrum of Merlot, but hangs in there, picking up currant and cedary notes on the finish. Drink now through 1997. 1,171 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Dark, with weedy herbal and black currant flavors that are hard-edged. Firmly tannic, it picks up a coffee- tobacco note on the finish. Still a few years from peaking. Drink after 1994.

name: Chardonnay Washington Celilo Vineyard
review: Misses the vibrant freshness and crispness of the vineyard, but it's still smooth and has nice apple and tobacco flavors, folding in a touch of earthiness on the finish. Drink now through 1999. 369 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington
review: Tart and a bit metallic, with enough grapefruit and apple flavor on the finish to keep it in bounds. Drink now. 736 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Firm, chewy tannins wrap around a modest level of berry and toast flavors, finishing earthy. Best after 2010. 1,022 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Ripe and spicy, with herb and tobacco flavors adding dimension to the currant and berry notes. Smooth and polished for a 1991, but finishes with length and finesse. Well balanced and easy to drink now. 650 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Herbal, chocolate and currant notes are firm and blunt, with coarse tannins. Drink now to 1997.

name: Chardonnay Washington Celilo Vineyard
review: Crisp, almost tart, with a metallic edge to the earthy apple flavors. Drink now. 429 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: From a weak vintage in Washington, this wine is lean and herbal, with firm tannins; lacks depth and richness. It's still a good wine, but it's missing the flair of Small's best. Drink now to 1995.

name: White Riesling Walla Walla County
review: Sweet, with flavors that seem more decadent and sour than fresh. Simple finish. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Margaret River Gallagher's Choice
review: Broad textured, with a nice zing of acidity to balance the layers of cherry, mint and bell pepper that echo nicely on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2005. 522 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: The fresh plum and black cherry flavors are fleshy, with licorice and clove accents, showing plenty of intensity on the spicy finish. Drink now through 2020. 2,132 cases made.

name: Viognier Rogue Valley JF Guerrero
review: Silky in texture, and aromatic, offering a lush mouthful of pear, exotic fruit and spice flavors, not too heavy, hinting at almond on the finish. Drink now. 282 cases made.

name: Viognier Rogue Valley JF Guerrero
review: Rich and oily in texture, glowing with spicy pear, melon and tropical fruit flavors, finishing dry. Drink now. 312 cases made.

name: Syrah Rogue Valley Donna Devine
review: Firm and flavorful, with more earthy-gamy character than fruit. 306 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Nelson
review: Light and smooth, with lime and green papaya aromas and flavors on a tight frame. Drink now. 2,759 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Nelson
review: Shows good intensity to the peppery, earthy notes of black cherry and wild strawberry, balanced on a firm, juicy frame. Drink now through 2023. 800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Nelson
review: The ripe pear, Meyer lemon and melon flavors feature a tangy kick of grapefruit. Remains balanced and fresh throughout, with good acidity. Drink now. 4,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Nelson
review: This offers peppery overtones to the restrained pear, apple and citrus flavors, joined by plenty of acidity and a pretty, floral finish. Drink now. 3,050 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Nelson Morgan Leigh
review: Fleshy and bright, with very good intensity to guava, pink grapefruit and lime juice flavors. Crushed-stone nuances highlight a sweet-sour finish. Drink now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon Nelson
review: Light and tart, with a figgy edge to the lemon and herb flavors. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Polished, focused and generous with its cherry, black currant, black olive and spice flavors, lingering enticingly. Drink now through 2016. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Australia
review: On the lighter side, with a savory edge to the currant fruit, finishing with fine tannins. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay South Australia
review: Lacks freshness, but the light pear and almond flavors are pleasant. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia
review: Ripe and generous, a lively mouthful of currant and sassafras flavors, finishing with fine tannins. Drink now through 2007. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Reliant on herb, fresh earth and peppery notes, with wild berry and huckleberry flavors, toast accents and firm tannins. Drink now through 2030. 30,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Light and ingratiating, with pretty red berry and floral flavors, finishing with refinement. Drink now through 2015. 45,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: This is polished, with a cola edge to the berry flavors, finishing with some density. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Verdelho South Eastern Australia
review: Bright and juicy, with tropical fruit and citrus flavors in modest proportions, lingering nicely. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Verdelho South Eastern Australia
review: Fresh and vibrant, delivering a lively mouthful of green pear, lime and floral aromas and flavors that linger on the open-textured finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet South Eastern Australia
review: Fresh and crisp, with fine tannins wound around a focused core of currant, followed by a gentle finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet South Eastern Australia
review: Ripe and inviting, with dark berry notes and a touch of bay leaf on a fine-grained frame, echoing nicely. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet South Eastern Australia
review: Bright and jazzy, with pretty blackberry and currant fruit, lingering lightly. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Fresh and light, with pretty pear and floral flavors, lingering gently with a hint of toast. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Ripe and generous with its peach and apple flavors. Finishes dry. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Firm with tannins, displaying modest cherry and toast flavors that push through the medium-weight finish. Drink now. 45,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Soft, round and polished, with nicely focused blueberry and plum fruit, shaded with an earthy tone. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Smooth and spicy, a distinctive red with a strong licorice note running through the dark berry flavors. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia
review: Smooth and toasty, with cedar and spice notes and plum flavors that linger. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Light and lively, focusing its pretty pear and lime flavors on a crisp frame. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Light in texture, with melon and pineapple custard flavors sitting in the middle. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Light, bright and appealing for its resiny apple flavors. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Light and refreshing, with pretty raspberry and white chocolate flavors, lingering gently. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: On the lighter side, with almond overtones to the modest berry flavors. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Light in texture, with pretty blueberry and mint flavors. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia
review: Fresh, with an herbal edge to the straightforward currant flavors. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet South Eastern Australia
review: Crisp, firmly tannic and modest on the flavor scale, but blackberry and wet earth flavors come through on the firm finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Light and restrained, with modest tropical fruit and almond flavors, finishing clean. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Verdelho South Eastern Australia
review: Crisp, this tastes like sour apple candy. Love it or hate it. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Smooth and round, with blackberry and licorice flavors on a modest scale. Drink now. 45,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Crisp and bitey with tannin, not a friendly red but has some pleasant red fruit flavors. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Washington Cascade Collection
review: A satiny, expansive wine, generous with its nutmeg-scented, ripe blackberry, currant, anise and cedar flavors, and beautifully focused to show them off. Long and harmonious. 63 percent Cabernet Sauvignon, 37 percent Merlot. Best after 1997. 808 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Cascade Crest Winemakers Reserve
review: Lighter and more supple than most Cabernets, this features ripe plum and spice flavors amidst the fine-grained tannins. Drink now. 203 cases made.

name: Cascade Claret Washington
review: Light and brightly fruity, nicely balanced and immensely appealing, echoing berry and spice on the long finish. Just delicious for drinking now. Lemberger (Blaufränkisch), Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. 400 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Washington Cascade Collection
review: Bright and vibrant, offering a generous mouthful of peach, apple and spicy floral flavors that linger on the off-dry finish. 201 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Washington
review: Ripe and concentrated, but wrapped in a cloak of thick tannins. Has plenty of dark cherry and currant flavors at the core, with hints of cranberry on the finish. Best after 1995.

name: Chenin Blanc Washington
review: Silky-smooth, oozing with melon and pear flavors, a generously fruity Chenin that finishes light and deftly balanced with a touch of sweetness. 1,206 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Washington
review: A lovely mouthful of effusive fruit, offering litchi, pear and a touch of rose petal through the dry, full-bodied finish. Drink soon. 248 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Washington Cascade Collection
review: Light and barely sweet, with pretty apple and peach flavors shaded by nice hints of sweet pea and pine. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Merlot Washington Crawford Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve
review: Light in texture, with pretty strawberry and spice flavors that linger gently as the low-tannin finish picks up a hint of chocolate. Nice to drink already. Drink now through 2000. 150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Washington
review: Harmony and elegance on a lean frame, with its spicy berry flavors swirling around on the finish. Best from 1997 or '98. 827 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Washington
review: Soft, almost plush, with straightforward black cherry and smoky flavors winding through the generous finish. Drink now through 1999. 460 cases made.

name: Riesling Washington Cascade Crest
review: Soft and fragrant, with subtle, pretty apple, floral and pear flavors that linger enticingly. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Washington
review: Firm and focused, striving for elegance and achieving a nice balance of black cherry and spicy oak. Finishes quietly. Drinkable now. 800 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Washington
review: Definitely on the spicy-herbal side, a chewy red with a meaty streak running through the basic cherry flavor. 584 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Washington Late Harvest
review: Sweet and pleasantly floral, with a slightly bitter edge to the apricot and pear flavors; finishes sweet and snappy. Drinkable now. 117 cases made.

name: Oyster White Washington
review: Light and simple, a little spicy, a little toasty, finishing with an almond and peach character. Drink now. 225 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Washington Cascade Collection
review: On the sweet side, with leafy apple and honey flavors that fade on the light finish. 378 cases made.

name: Claret Washington
review: Has the light, fruity aromas and flavors of Lemberger up front, fading a bit on the finish. Lemberger (Blaufränkisch) and Cabernet Sauvignon. 804 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Washington
review: Light and fruity, with a slightly spicy edge to the apple flavors. Drinkable now. 1,900 cases made.

name: Lemberger Washington Crawford Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve
review: Very light in color, with a spicy, leathery edge to the modest raspberry flavors. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Merlot Washington
review: Light, lean and spicy raspberry and watermelon flavors dance across the finish. Ready now. 1,300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington
review: Smooth and flavorful, on the earthy side, but balanced with a touch of peach on the finish. Ready now.

name: Claret Washington
review: Edgy and lean, a metallic component taking some charm from the modest berry flavors. Lemberger (Blaufränkisch), Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. 675 cases made.

name: Merlot Washington
review: This red has a spritzy, medicinal edge to the currant and wild berry flavors. It's drinkable now. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Washington
review: Muddy, earthy flavors stand in the way of the modest berry notes, and a juniper edge distracts from the finish.  700 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Washington
review: Muddled flavors of rose petal and citrus peel come up against a hard edge of metallic acidity. Not pleasant. 600 cases made.

name: Johannisberg Riesling Washington
review: Lean and a little acrid, sour enough to cut down the modest fruit. 800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Vibrant and fragrant, with excellent intensity to passion fruit, grapefruit, green apple and grass flavors. The wealth of flavors lingers, with a hint of cedar and tart citrus tanginess that invites food. Drink now through 2005. 730 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Good concentration to the orange- and tangerine-infused citrus flavors, with pleasant spice, tobacco and mineral notes and refreshing acidity. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Intense and flinty, with grassy citrus, lemon and herb scents that are fresh and lively, accented by light toasty oak. Drink now. 1,155 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Melon and citrus notes have a vibrant juiciness, with grassy and herbal shadings. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Howell Mountain
review: Tightly wound, with black currant, bay leaf and pepper aromas leading to firm dried cherry, mineral and sage flavors that finish with chewy tannins. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. Drink now through 2012. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Diamond Mountain District Reserve
review: Appealing for its upfront black cherry and red currant fruit. Full-bodied, it turns leaner and drying on the finish, where the tannins dominate. Drink now through 2013. 240 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Cedary, with citrus and yellow apple flavors that turn a bit pasty. Drink now. 325 cases made.

name: Ipso Facto Central Coast
review: The spicy peach cobbler and apricot flavors are creamy and pure, with details of orange zest, piecrust and honeysuckle. A refreshing acidity weaves in and out. Viognier. Drink now through 2019. 50 cases made.

name: De Facto Central Coast
review: Dense, rich and layered, offering roasted herb and scorched earth notes, with touches of dark berry, spice, cedar and crushed rock. Gains depth, holding a tight focus. Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Drink now through 2024. 75 cases made.

name: Ipso Facto Central Coast
review: Opens with a pretty floral accent, giving way to a smooth and lush core of peach, pear and citrus flavors. Spice and honeysuckle notes linger on the finish. Viognier. Drink now. 133 cases made.

name: Ipso Facto Central Coast
review: Light and juicy up front, with complex flavors of bright melon, stone fruit and apple that creep up on you, imparting a pretty floral component and a long, lingering finish that turns spicy. Drink now. 90 cases made.

name: De Facto Central Coast
review: Sleek and ripe, with appealing flavors of raspberry, caramel and spice. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2020. 90 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville Good Times, Bad Times Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard
review: Rustic and rough-hewn, with savory dried herb, cedar, blackberry and black licorice flavors that are intense and persistent, more complex and interesting on the finish, where the flavors fan out. Drink now through 2020. 350 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Napa Valley Against the Wind Reserve
review: This is rich, intense, dense, savory and tannic, with ripe currant, tobacco, mineral and sage notes. Gains depth and tannic strength on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,275 cases made.

name: Wavelength Sugarloaf Mountain Vineyard Napa Valley
review: This is intense without being weighty, showing a gravelly edge to the dried dark berry, graphite and cedar notes. Ends with firm tannins. Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2022. 275 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville Crossfire Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Vineyard
review: An earthy, rustic style, with chewy tannins wrapped around loamy earth, dried berry, blackberry and herbal notes. Full-bodied, ending with chewy tannins and a tart berry aftertaste. Best from 2012 through 2019. 500 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Little Sister Reserve
review: Sleek and lean, with notes of cherry, cedar and herb. Drink now through 2018. 565 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Little Sister Reserve
review: Aromas of black cherry and tomato leaf lead to dense flavors of dried currant and fresh herbs. Finishes with firm tannins. Drink now through 2016. 1,450 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville Crossfire Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Vineyard
review: Tough and drying, with extracted dark berry, cedary oak and dried herb notes that give this a heavy-handed, raw feel. Drink now through 2024. 640 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville Good Times, Bad Times Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard
review: Rustic, chewy, dense and extracted, this ends with an edgy metallic flavor. Somehow manages to make a clumsy wine out of To Kalon grapes. Drink now through 2024. 350 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley If Six was Nine Reserve
review: Modestly appealing ripe plum-berry fruit turns dry and tannic. Drink now. 1,850 cases made.

name: Wavelength Sugarloaf Mountain Vineyard Napa Valley
review: Firm, intense and rustic, this is full-bodied, featuring dry, savory herb, currant, mineral and cedar flavors. In this mix of Syrah and Cabernet Franc, neither grape shines and the whole is less than the sum of its parts. Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2015. 350 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Sophia's Cuvee
review: Appealing for its exuberant display of ripe, fleshy blackberry and wild berry fruit. It adds a pretty touch of floral and cedar nuances before revealing its depth, richness and concentration on a long, persistent, impressive finish that keeps the flavors lively and flowing. Drink now through 2012. 1,375 cases made.

name: Sophia's Cuvee Napa Valley
review: Supple and harmonious, this smooth Cabernet offers ripe currant, black cherry and taut, earthy mineral and sage, with a cedary edge. Finishes with firm, ripe tannins. Not quite on par with the excellent 2001, but well done. Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2006 through 2012. 4,200 cases made.

name: Sophia's Cuvee Napa Valley
review: Taut and firm, with aromas of cedar, currant, mocha and mineral. On the palate it's tight and tannic, well-balanced and veering toward dryness, ending with a metallic lead pencil edge. Best showing of three tastings. Decant. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2009. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sophia's Cuvee Napa Valley
review: Superripe, a touch pruny. Dry, tannic and leathery on the palate. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 9,500 cases made.

name: Sophia's Cuvee Napa Valley
review: Overwhelmingly earthy, bitter, leathery and metallic. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Two bottles tasted, with consistent notes. 4,800 cases made.

name: Columbia Valley
review: Light and silky, with toast and berry flavors. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 1,456 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey San Saba Vineyard
review: Combines density with structure, depth and finesse, built around tiers of wild berry, blueberry, cola and loamy earth, ending with a long, layered finish. The most complex and complete of the 2009 Wraths. Drink now through 2018. 308 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands McIntyre Vineyard
review: Rich-textured, deep and firm, with complex boysenberry, blackberry and wild berry fruit that's tight, focused, structured and persistent, gaining nicely on the finish, where the berry flavors are persistent. Drink now through 2020. 140 cases made.

name: Syrah Monterey San Saba Vineyard
review: A New World style with an Old World edge. Expressive smoky pepper beef and blackberry aromas open to polished and layered flavors of dark plum, bitter chocolate and licorice that linger. Drink now through 2027. 175 cases made.

name: Syrah Monterey San Saba Vineyard
review: Pure, rich and generous, displaying savory herb, blackberry, wild berry, tar and black licorice flavors that extend into Bolognese sauce accents, ending with a neatly tapered finish. Drink now through 2022. 150 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey Fermata
review: Buttery and rich, featuring concentrated flavors of pear, apple compote and baked peach, with tropical notes. A full-bore style that is filled with spiciness. The finish lingers with cream and toasted coconut accents. Drink now through 2022. 446 cases made.

name: Syrah Monterey Ex Anima
review: Dense and layered, with a rich orchestration of flavors centered on exotic plum, blackberry, savory herb, game meat and fig. Long and deep on the finish, ending with chewy tannins. Drink now through 2022. 151 cases made.

name: Syrah Monterey San Saba Vineyard
review: A great structure and a plush texture combine in this powerful yet sleek red. Aromas of wild game and raspberry open to flavors of plum, fig and roasted herbs. The tannins are firm but ripe. Drink now through 2025. 145 cases made.

name: Syrah Monterey San Saba Vineyard
review: Offers an exotic range of rich flavors, with red berry, game meat, rhubarb, smoke, tobacco leaf, roasted herb and hot brick notes. Reminiscent of a Southern Rhône red. Drink now through 2022. 170 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey San Saba Vineyard
review: Superrich and concentrated, ripe and fleshy, delivering a medley of honeydew melon, hazelnut, fig and apricot. Full-bodied, gaining depth and richness, ending with a honeyed aftertaste. Drink now through 2014. 216 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey Pommard 4/777
review: A firmer, tighter expression of Pinot, with an emphasis on Pommard clones, this nonetheless delivers a complex mix of savory herb, berry, cola and light oak shadings, with the fruit gradually working through the tannins and gaining the upper hand. Drink now through 2018. 211 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Boekenoogen Vineyard
review: This displays a charming red candy mix of cherry and berry fruit that's supple and well-focused. Easygoing on the tannins, this is a sheer joy to drink. Drink now. 280 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Boekenoogen Vineyard
review: Subtle and vibrant, with a gentle intensity that builds around the fine-grained tannins. Features mineral, wild berry, cranberry and raspberry notes, gaining depth and persistence on the long, fruity finish. Drink now through 2022. 143 cases made.

name: Syrah Monterey Ex Anima
review: Plush and savory, with boysenberry and smoky sage aromas, balanced by rich, layered flavors of blueberry, espresso and roasted herb. The long finish leads to big and ripe tannins. Drink now through 2022. 168 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Lucia Highlands Doctor's Vineyard
review: Big and stylish but backed by fine structure. Raspberry, cinnamon and sassafras aromas lead to rich flavors of ripe cherry, smoky beef and cracked pepper. Drink now through 2026. 244 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Lucia Highlands Doctor's Vineyard
review: A dense, chewy, rustic and potent youngster, exhibiting firm pepper, spice, wild berry and dried berry flavors that are full-bodied and complex, ending with drying tannins that string out the flavors. Best from 2012 through 2020. 165 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Lucia Highlands KW Ranch
review: Combines richness with tiers of spice, blackberry , black pepper, anise and sage. Very complete, gliding along on the finish. Drink now through 2021. 143 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey 3 Clone
review: Rich and layered, with fig, apricot, honeydew melon, apple pie and spice flavors delivered in a clean, precise, focused manner. Smoky, buttery oak is evident on the finish. Drink now. 189 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey 3 Clone
review: Rich yet elegant, with understated pear, peach and apple scents and a good dose of spicy, toasty oak. Everything is pleasantly in proportion. Drink now. 168 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey 3 Clone
review: Exhibits intense citrus and tropical fruit flavors, with notes of guava, pineapple, peach and tangerine. Intense and persistent, echoing vanilla on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 234 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey San Saba Vineyard
review: Combines density with nuance, offering rich fig, pear and apricot flavors, with shadings of citrus and light oak. Ends clean and elegant. Drink now. 144 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey San Saba Vineyard
review: A bold, rich, exotic style, with intense fig, tropical fruit, pineapple and honeydew flavors. Tapers off midpalate and glides along effortlessly on the finish. Drink now. 116 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey 115/667
review: Sleek and well-structured, with a dash of cola joining the ripe cherry and berry fruit, this fans out nicely and gains complexity and depth without weight. Drink now through 2018. 290 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Tondré Grapefield
review: A savory style, offering a mix of dried herb, leafy, underbrush and dried berry flavors, with hints of anise, red candy and red licorice, backed by mild tannins. Most impressive for the length on the finish. Drink now through 2021. 283 cases made.

name: Syrah Monterey Ex Anima
review: Floral black raspberry and licorice aromas lead to a burst of jammy huckleberry flavors and accents of white pepper. The texture is plush and soft, with enough complexity for this to keep gliding. Drink now through 2022. 196 cases made.

name: Syrah Monterey San Saba Vineyard
review: A big, plump Syrah that delivers lots of flavor, from ripe black raspberry and licorice to smoke and white pepper. The core of solid acidity keeps this moving at a bouncy clip. Drink now through 2022. 147 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Lucia Highlands Doctor's Vineyard
review: Rich and layered, with spicy, beefy, peppery scents accented by fresh earth, new leather and cedary touches, ending with subtle minerality. Drink now through 2022. 211 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Lucia Highlands KW Ranch
review: A lively, zesty style, with a full range of spice, cherry, plum and tobacco notes, displaying graceful elegance and understated nuance. Drink now through 2021. 130 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey Fermata
review: Firm, intense and complex, displaying spicy pineapple, melon, pear and floral scents. Full-bodied and elegant, with a persistent finish. Drink now through 2014. 146 cases made.

name: Grenache Arroyo Seco Destruction Level
review: Supple and firm, focused on ripe cherry and wild berry flavors, with black licorice, chicory and celery seed notes that glide along pleasantly on the tannic finish. Drink now through 2021. 65 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey San Saba Vineyard
review: A meaty, smoky edge adds complexity and dimension to the core of zesty wild berry and raspberry flavors. Shows plenty of spice, earth and herb nuances, folding together gracefully. Drink now through 2022. 342 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey San Saba Vineyard
review: A bit rustic, chewy and extracted, ripe, featuring full-bodied currant, stewed plum, mineral and red licorice. Firms up on the finish, where the tannins are firm but ripe. Drink now through 2015. 182 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Boekenoogen Vineyard
review: A bold, potent Pinot, with lots of complexity, showing a cola-sassafras richness and density that's striking, with layers of black cherry, blueberry, licorice, dried herb and cedar. Drink now through 2022. 282 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Tondré Grapefield
review: This red shows off a rich stew of cherry rhubarb, black tea, licorice and loamy earth, holding a tight focus through the expansive finish, with solid tannins. Drink now through 2022. 283 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Lucia Highlands Fairview Vineyard
review: Notably peppery, with a jalapeño edge, this offers rich, plummy wild berry fruit that's full-bodied, focused and persistent, ending with a graceful finish. Drink now through 2018. 168 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey Ex Unoaked
review: Fresh and zesty, offering a spicy, Muscat-like vibe amid Sauvignon-like herbal notes. A refreshing, easy-to-drink sipper, with no oak. Drink now. 638 cases made.

name: Falanghina Monterey Ex Dolio
review: Floral and fragrant, oozing with peach blossom and orange water aromatics, the citrus sherbet and apricot flavors are generous, finishing crisp. Drink now. 93 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey Ex Anima
review: Plump, juicy and spicy, with red berry, raspberry and plummy notes that are elegant and detailed, ending with earth-scented tannins. Drink now through 2021. 372 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey San Saba Vineyard
review: Presents a firm mix of rhubarb, plum and red berry flavors. This is firmly tannic midpalate on, ending a bit clipped. Drink now through 2022. 334 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey San Saba Vineyard
review: Offers a mix of ripe cherry, rhubarb and strawberry notes, showing supple texture and ending on a delicate and spicy floral note. Drink now through 2022. 237 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Boekenoogen Vineyard
review: There's plenty to admire here, notwithstanding the telltale signs of dryness and firm, gritty tannins from a challenging vintage, with an appealing core of plum and raspberry flavors. Best to ignore the earthy tannins. Drink now through 2020. 255 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands McIntyre Vineyard
review: Big and tightly focused, with a core of dusty berry, fresh-turned earth and savory herb. The flavors fade ever so slightly on the persistent finish. Drink now through 2021. 257 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands McIntyre Vineyard
review: Subtle, with understated flavors of loamy earth, cedar, dried berry, underbrush and anise that build slowly, ending with firm, gripping tannins. Needs time. Best from 2014 through 2022. 88 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Tondré Grapefield
review: A rich, intense effort, with cola, dark berry, spice and floral scents. Quite tannic, but avoids the excessive dryness of many 2011s. Drink now through 2020. 215 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Tondré Grapefield
review: Weaving together a complex mix of raspberry, blueberry, rhubarb and gravelly rock, this version is well-proportioned, supple and focused. Drink now through 2020. 225 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Tondré Grapefield
review: Richly flavored, deep and intense, at points rustic and chewy, but shows promise. The core flavors are built around cola, blueberry and sassafras, ending with firm tannins. Best from 2013 through 2022. 268 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Monterey Ex Anima
review: Offers grassy, peppery overtones to the light, crisp, refreshing lemon, lime and grapefruit flavors, with a juicy finish. Drink now. 880 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Lucia Highlands Doctor's Vineyard
review: A bit chunky, but with good power and lots of fruit, featuring notes of blackberry, roasted herb and smoky pepper. Drink now through . 188 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Lucia Highlands KW Ranch
review: Distinctive, featuring ripe and zesty flavors of mint and anise, with raspberry and pepper notes. Drink now through 2022. 146 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey Ex Anima
review: A fresh, distinctive style, featuring zesty citrus, green apple, floral and spice notes, with the flavors accented by the lemon-grapefruit touches. Nice length. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey San Saba Vineyard
review: Rich and vibrant, with spicy cola, raspberry and wild berry flavors that gain depth and intensity and linger on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 280 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey San Saba Vineyard
review: This is intense, with spicy mint, dried currant and red raspberry rhubarb, but also supple, ending with drying tannins. Drink now through 2012. 143 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands KW Ranch
review: Tight, structured tannins and minerality join loamy, earthy, savory dried berry flavors that become muddled in dusty, earthy tannins, ending with a feel of dry coffee grounds. Drink now. 140 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Monterey Ex Anima
review: A peppery, grassy style, with crisp acidity and lemon-lime, green apple and grapefruit notes, followed by a juicy finish. Drink now. 575 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Lucia Highlands Doctor's Vineyard
review: Struggles to find focus, presenting a muddled fruit profile of dried herb, rhubarb and mushy dark berry flavors, ending with dominant tannins. Drink now through 2017. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Lucia Highlands KW Ranch
review: A solid Syrah, if a bit ordinary, offering appealing notes of boysenberry, mineral and pepper. Drink now through 2023. 98 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey Ex Anima
review: Clean, pure and refreshing, with simple green apple, citrus and pineapple flavors. Drink now through 2016. 550 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Monterey Ex Anima
review: A light-bodied and appealing white, with crisp acidity and fresh grass notes accenting the citrus flavors. Finishes with a lemon verbena profile. Drink now. 1,035 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Monterey Ex
review: Opens with strong herbal overtones of pepper and grass, showing lemon-lime and green apple flavors on a lean body. Drink now. 823 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Monterey San Saba Vineyard
review: A zingy, aggressive style, offering fresh-cut grass, jalapeño and gooseberry flavors that are vibrant and extremely juicy. Mineral and white pepper notes pop in on the finish. Drink now. 328 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey Saignée
review: Soft, slightly sweet and perfumed, with notes of watermelon and spice. Drink now. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey Saignée
review: Supple, but the fruit is so soft and modest that it doesn't inspire a second sip. Drink now. 90 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Architects & Saboteurs
review: Brimming with layers of rich, juicy dark berry, this offers plum, wild berry, raspberry and boysenberry flavors, featuring touches of black licorice, anise and subtle earth. Delivers firm, fine-grained tannins, ending with a dash of mocha. Drink now. 160 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Green Valley of Russian River Valley Demigods & Demons
review: Shows off spicy, creamy, mocha-laced oak, with intense, vibrant blueberry and raspberry notes, shaded by anise and black licorice accents. Persistent finish. Drink now through 2022. 204 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Royalty in Exile
review: Rich, earthy blackberry and raspberry flavors are enticing, fanning out with touches of jam preserves and smoky oak. Ends with firm, ripe tannins that keep the flavors intact. Drink now through 2022. 214 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley War & Peace
review: A rich, expressive style that captures a broad range of flavors, from anise and road tar to blackberry, licorice, savory herb and smoky, cedary oak. Ends long and complex. Drink now through 2023. 148 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Daughters of Earth
review: A rich, plump and generous red, with a deep, persistent mix of blackberry, wild berry, blueberry and light floral and spice notes, ending with firm, ripe tannins and hints of black licorice and dusty, cedary oak. Lingers delicately. Drink now through 2021. 208 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Siren's Lure
review: Pure and rich, with ripe blackberry and wild berry fruit that's spicy and refined, picking up a pleasant smoky edge on the long and fruity finish. Shows more fleshy texture than the Omens & Prophecy bottling. Drink now through 2022. 212 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Green Valley of Russian River Valley Witch's Ladder
review: Very rich and potent, with tiers of extracted blackberry, anise and licorice flavors, complemented by gutsy tannins. Far from the mainstream, this represents a style that edges closer to full-blown Cabernet or Syrah than delicate Pinot. Should be worth the wait to see how this eases past its tannic youth. Drink now through 2020. 288 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Hustle & Flow
review: Rich, plump and generous, with fleshy plum, blackberry and black licorice, veering toward a hint of road tar and ending with firm, chewy tannins. Drink now through 2023. 225 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Oracle's Whisper
review: Rich to the edge of syrupy, with uncommon extraction and ripeness. Offers a core of blueberry, wild berry, currant, plum and mocha flavors. Finishes with a strong, persistent aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 332 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Mortal Coil
review: A big, ripe, full-bodied effort, offering rich, expansive blackberry, wild berry and jam notes. Black licorice and dusty, loamy earth accents show on the finish. Drink now. 258 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Needle's Eye
review: Shows good intensity and concentration, with earth- and citrus-laced pear and apple flavors. The texture is edgy but time will resolve that. Drink now. 183 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Omens & Prophecy
review: Firm, rich and layered, with black cherry, berry jam and spice flavors, at points supple yet also firm and tannic, so best to cellar or decant. Best from 2012 through 2018. 193 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Shipwreck Savior
review: Perfumed floral scents offer a white peach and green apple edge. Clean and pure, ending with a nectarine note. Drink now through 2018. 202 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Druid's Metaphor
review: Ripe and zesty, with savory underbrush amid cherry and raspberry, showing a spicy floral touch. Drink now through 2020. 216 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lake County
review: Juicy and vibrant, with raspberry and spicy vanilla aromas and supple, easygoing cherry, licorice and cedar notes. Drink now through 2014. 2,000 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Lake County
review: Smooth and plush, with juicy dark plum, blackberry and spice flavors, showing a floral hint on the finish. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Roussanne Lake County
review: Crisp and lively, with pineapple, apricot and baked apple flavors. Appealing for the balance between acidity and ripeness, with grace notes of cedar and spice that linger. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Lake County
review: There's a jammy quality to the wild berry flavors in this medium-bodied version, with cedar accents, a touch of spice and firm tannins. Drink now through 2025. 800 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Lake County
review: Strikes a good balance between the rustic, chewy tannins, wild red berry flavors and a toasty, cedary note. Drink now through 2025. 1,000 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Lake County
review: A fragrant floral note runs through this smooth, full-bodied wine, with cedary berry and spice flavors. Cherry, plum and cassis flavors are ripe, and the tannins are chewy on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Lake County
review: Aromatic violet notes give the grapey, jammy berry notes some flair, in an easy-drinking format framed by firm tannins. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Roussanne Lake County
review: Pear, peach and apricot notes have floral highlights and refreshing acidity, with yellow apple notes on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Counoise Lake County
review: Offers distinctive dried berry and minty herb notes on a light body, with smooth, easy-drinking tannins. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Grenache Lake County
review: Strawberry and cranberry flavors take on a slightly candied edge, with smooth tannins and tasty root beer notes. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lake County
review: Offers appealing cherry, herb and spice notes and easygoing flavors. Drink now through 2016. 1,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Lake County
review: Shows dried plum, prune and berry flavors, with spice, toast and herbs. There's a slight medicinal note and drying tannins on the finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Syrah Lake County
review: Lean, with clipped berry flavors and herbal tones. Has firm tannins, with a spicy cola finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lake County
review: Young and rather herbal, but still appealing for its soft plum and spice flavors. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Counoise Lake County
review: Muddled cola and herb flavors get in the way of strawberry notes. 100 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Steingrubler Collection
review: Aromatic, with expressive notes of fresh-chopped herb, ground spice and floral, this well-cut white offers poached quince, white peach and orange zest flavors, accented by hints of smoke and beeswax that echo on the finish. An atypical but interesting version. Drink now through 2018. 567 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Roi Clovis Particulière Reserve
review: Soft yet balanced, with a creamy note of marzipan lacing the flavors of apple pastry, smoke, lemon preserves and crystallized honey. Moderate finish. Drink now. 1,219 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace
review: A hint of candy corn underscores the flavors of baked apple tart and almond extract in this round white. Drink now. 2,135 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Columbia Gorge-Oregon Blue Chip
review: Light and crisp, this offers a juicy core of blackberry and raspberry fruit against lively balance on the finish, extending nicely. Drink now through 2014. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Refreshing and concentrated, with an intense band of grapefruit, lemon-lime, green pear and nicely integrated oak flavors. Spice and refreshing citrus notes harmonize on the finish. Drink now. 3,400 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz Hunter Valley
review: Finely concentrated blackberry and boysenberry aromas and flavors make this wine appealing now, but it has the structure and early complexity to mark it as a cellar candidate. A stylish wine with a great future. Drink now.

name: Shiraz Hunter Valley Black Cluster
review: Distinctive, with depth and mouthwatering balance to showcase the earthy, meaty cherry and beet flavors, hinting at licorice on the long, expressive finish. Best from 2012 through 2017. 200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Australia George Wyndham Founder's Reserve
review: Polished and lively, with rhubarb and pomegranate notes that weave through plum and spice as this heads for the finish. The tannins are well-buffed. Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek George Wyndham Founder's Reserve
review: Dark, ripe and juicy, with plum, blackberry jam and spice flavors, persisting nicely on the extended finish. Best from 2013 through 2017. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia Bin 444
review: Big, chewy and bursting with brilliant flavors. A cascade of currant, blackberry, sage and spice character extends into a long, elegant finish. Tannins are beautifully integrated. Has the goods to develop through 2005 and beyond.

name: Chardonnay Hunter Valley Oak Cask
review: This graceful Chardonnay from Australia is ripe in flavor and crisp in texture, with a creamy feel to the pretty pear, citrus and floral character. Finishes long and elegant. A great buy at this price. Drink now through 2000. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin 222
review: Light and refreshing, this is expressive with pear and nectarine fruit that keeps singing through the open-weave finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Oak Cask
review: Smooth and buttery, rich with pear, caramel and vanilla flavors that are balanced beautifully on the finish. Drinkable now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bin 555
review: Smooth, round and generous with its savory blueberry and dark plum flavors, lingering enticingly as the finish becomes more expressive. Drink now through 2010. 45,000 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port South Eastern Australia George Wyndham Old
review: It's hard to believe how affordable is the price for this sweet and silky tawny, with pretty coffee and toffee accents around a black cherry core, hinting at tar on the finish. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz Hunter Valley
review: A walloping big wine with deep color, a ripe, smoky flavor and a smoky fini sh. Try it with smoked crocodile. Value priced.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz Hunter Valley
review: A deliciously concentrated red. Jammy and buttery on the nose like one of the best Beaujolais, and alive with fruit and pepper flavors on the palate. Deep and youthful in color, very intense in flavor, tempered with firm, chewy tannins. Drinkable now, but needs time to mature.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin 222
review: Ripe and smooth, balancing the green apple and leesy flavors with a touch of spice and vanilla that lurks behind the scenes on the finish. Drinkable now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Oak Cask
review: Ripe and spicy, with honey, pear, toast and nutmeg flavors that are generous and round. Drinkable now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir South Eastern Australia Bin 333
review: A lithe, silky Pinot Noir with lovely cherry and spice aromas and flavors, lingering on the polished finish. Who knew Australia could make good Pinot at such an attractive price? Drink now through 2010. 228,000 cases made.

name: Reserve Bin TR2 Medium Dry White South Eastern Australia
review: Has the floral and spicy flavors and broad, generous structure of Viognier; round and polished with lots of personality. Drink now.

name: Brut Australia Cuvée
review: Smooth, round and toasty, the spicy notes radiating through this deftly balanced sparkling wine. Excellent value. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hunter Valley Oak Cask
review: Soft and round. A fat wine with ripe pear and orange-peel flavors, finishing with more than a hint of toasty oak. Drink now through 2004. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin 222
review: Light, bright and spicy, with a nutmeg tinge to the pear and apple flavors. Drink now. 21,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin 222
review: Ripe and smooth, with opulent pear, apricot and pineapple flavors jockeying for position, shaded nicely by oak without being overwhelming. The flavors persist on the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir South Eastern Australia Bin 333
review: Pleasantly light and fragrant, with pretty plum and pomegranate flavors that echo gently on the finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir South Eastern Australia Bin 333
review: Bright and jazzy, with raspberry and cherry flavors on a light, lithe frame. Drink now. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Sémillon Hunter Valley Bin 777
review: Fresh and lively with ripe peach and honeyed flavors, a smooth silky texture and spicy oak and cedary nuances on the finish. Very delicate on the finish.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bin 555
review: This fresh and open-textured red has licorice and blackberry flavors on an easy-drinking frame. Drink now. 20,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bin 555
review: Ripe and generous, offering pretty blueberry, licorice and pepper flavors that linger on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2008. 664,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bin 555
review: Bright and generous, a lively mouthful of blackberry, licorice and floral aromas and flavors, which last nicely on the clear finish. Drink now. 100,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia Bin 444
review: Here's an Aussie red of real value. It's firm in texture, with fruit concentration at the center and enticing echoes of pure plum and currant on the finish. The fine-grained tannins don't get in the way. Drink now through 2000. 60,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hunter Valley
review: Smooth, ripe and honeyed, with nice vanilla and nutmeg overtones to the core of fig and pear flavors. An attractive wine to drink soon for all its fruit and spice.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin 222
review: Here's a not-to-be-missed deal in Chardonnay. It's crisp and lemony in character, with pretty tropical overtones to the citrusy flavors at the core. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Hunter Valley
review: A deep and vibrant wine, from the first glimpse of the color to the last echoes of berries, chocolate and mint on the finish. Soft and round, with generous fruit and supple texture. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir South Eastern Australia Bin 333
review: Starts off with lovely plum and berry fruit, picking up a bass note of earthy, barnyardy flavor on the smooth finish. A distinctive style. Drink now through 1997. 15,000 cases made.

name: Sémillon-Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin 777
review: A smooth-textured and pretty white, with a buttery edge adding dimension to the lemony pear and fig flavors. At so reasonable a price, chill a few bottles for current drinking, while it's fresh. 26,000 cases made.

name: Sémillon-Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin 777
review: A rich, spicy and fragrant white that keeps its floral, citrus and green apple flavors bouncing brightly on the finish. A lot of character for only a few bucks. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Sémillon-Sauvignon Blanc South Eastern Australia Bin 777
review: Bright, lively and appealing for its fig and citrus flavors. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Hunter Valley Bin 555
review: Bright and fruity, almost like a Beaujolais, smooth in texture and crisp in structure. A solid drink for now, given its floral and berry aromas and flavors.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bin 555
review: Lithe and juicy, with dark berry flavors riding on a firm frame. Drink now. 15,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bin 555
review: Ripe, generous and smooth in texture, with appealing strawberry, blackberry and spice aromas and flavors. Not as broad and heavy as some Syrahs. Finishes lively and generous. Drink now through 1996. 20,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia Bin 444
review: Firm and chewy, but the ripe currant and spice flavors come through on the lively finish. Drink now.

name: Merlot South Eastern Australia Bin 999
review: Soft and fruity, with appealing currant and slightly chalky aromas and flavors, finishing with an open texture. Drink now. 598,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bin 555
review: On the lighter side, with pretty plum and floral flavors, finishing soft. Drink now. 7,500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bin 555
review: Soft and grainy, with pretty oak-spice overtones to the polished berry flavors. Drink now. 100,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bin 555
review: Soft in texture, with earthy black cherry and spice flavors on an open frame. Drink now through 2003. 100,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia Bin 444
review: A bit firm with minty cherry flavors that last. Drink now. 22,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia Bin 444
review: Lean and velvety, a modest level of black cherry and smoke flavors persisting into the finish. Drinkable now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hunter Valley Bin 222
review: An oaky style, but there's plenty of fresh, ripe, flavor to stand up to it. The fig, lemon and pear flavors play off each other.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin 222
review: Light and fruity, with a nice grapefruit note at the center. Drink now. 161,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin 222
review: Light and fruity, with pretty melon and pear aromas and flavors, which echo nicely. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin 222
review: Clean, sharply focused and lively, with apple and apricot flavors that linger on the finish. Drinkable now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir South Eastern Australia Bin 333
review: Light and crisp, with an iodine edge to the black fruit. Drink now. 26,000 cases made.

name: Sémillon South Eastern Australia Bin 777
review: Soft and pleasant, with fig and olive flavors. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bin 555
review: Soft and ready to drink, with smooth, rounded tannins and moderate plum and orange flavors. Graceful and well balanced. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Hunter Valley Bin 444
review: Complex mix of cherry and plum fruit with a touch of oak and tannin. Has depth and character with a sikly texture.

name: Chardonnay Hunter Valley Oak Cask
review: Broad and spicy. A soft wine with a bitter edge to the otherwise pretty floral and pear flavors. Drink soon. 12,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin 222
review: Light and peppery, with a citrusy tang to the apple and pepper flavors. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin 222
review: Bright and appealing for its simple and crisp lemon flavors. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin 222
review: Soft and appealing, with pretty apple and vanilla flavors. Drink now. 60,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir South Eastern Australia Bin 333
review: Simple and refreshing, with fine tannins and bright strawberry and spice flavors. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bin 555
review: Tight, with a tobacco edge to the modest berry flavors. Drink now. 30,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bin 555
review: Light, smooth and appealing for its smoky strawberry flavors. Not a classically styled Shiraz, but makes a pretty red for immediate enjoyment. 75,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia Bin 444
review: Light and crisp, with simple berry and leafy flavors, finishing with a hint of chocolate and a rasp of tannin. Drink now. 20,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bin 555
review: Light in texture and flavor, with a slightly gamy edge to the soft raspberry flavors. Drinkable now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Hunter Valley Bin 444
review: Earthy, cedary flavors mark this as a rustic, hearty red, but the lingering finish is a good sign. Medium-bodied and soft enough in tannins to drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hunter Valley Show Reserve
review: Dark and spicy, with more toasty-woody notes than fruit showing on the palate. Has some character, but lacks charm. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Hunter Valley Show Reserve
review: Light, but very gamy. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bin 555
review: Light, slightly chewy, with ripe berry notes echoing. Drink now. 65,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia Bin 444
review: Smooth and supple, avoiding any apparent tannins to show off only modest cherryish flavor. Ready now. 22,000 cases made.

name: Merlot South Eastern Australia Bin 999
review: Raw and fruity, with berry and floral flavors, finishing with a green, earthy note. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin 222
review: An unusual melange of tutti-frutti flavors and toasty, smoky notes make this difficult to assess. Seems to lack the balance and harmony we look for, although it is flavorful. 35,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir South Eastern Australia Bin 333
review: Simple and light, with little Pinot Noir character. Offers subdued cherry and plum flavors, a soft texture and mild tannins. Priced right to drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Hunter Valley Bin 888
review: At first whiff it smells like bleach, but after that passes it just seems herbal and light.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Show Reserve
review: Soft, a bit metallic, not fresh or lively.   1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Hunter Valley Show Reserve
review: Excessively gamy. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Soft and very earthy, with barnyardy aromas and gamy flavors that don't seem too fresh. It's palatable, though. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin 222
review: Soft and earthy, with a slightly oily texture and a lot of ripe nectarine, earth and spice flavors. Soft enough that some might find it dull. 10,000 cases made.

name: TR2 Vintage Reserve South Eastern Australia
Chardonnay Hunter Valley
review: Deep yellow-gold, extremely toasty and buttery with a leesy flavor that may appeal to others more than us.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra John Riddoch Limited Release
