review: Layers of bay leaf and dried herb flavors weave through a focused core of juicy currant fruit, melding smoothly and ramping up intensity on the finish. Best from 2015 through 2020. 75 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Black Label
review: Dense but plush tannins frame rich, ripe black cherry, plum compote and gingerbread flavors, with bittersweet chocolate and dried sage notes and a whiff of spearmint. The focus carries through on the long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2030. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra John Riddoch Limited Release
review: Chewy, focused and impressively deep in flavor. It's plush and pours out blackberry, currant and spicy-herbal flavors. Finishes with an echo of the minty notes that also sneak in on the aromas; this has style and great potential. Tempting now, but best from 1998. 3,900 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Black Label
review: Refined, showing finesse, this plays its black currant and blackberry fruit against hints of mineral and herb. The finish is wrapped in fine tannins. Best from 2015 through 2020. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra John Riddoch
review: Richly tannic, a wine of consummate depth and distinction, adding fresh floral-herbal tones to the powerful currant, plum and vanilla flavors. Has plenty of personality and depth. Best to wait until 2003 to 2005.

name: Chardonnay Coonawarra
review: Ripe and distinctive, expanding and accelerating to the finish. It elevates its spicy, smoky pear and apricot flavors onto another plane on the long finish. Terrific. Drink now through 1997.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: A unique wine, big and brawny, with sweet fruit down the middle and smoky, almost tarry aromas and flavors wrapped around it, mature, spicy, herbal, b alanced with firm acidity and a ripe, plummy finish.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Black Label
review: Fresh, expressive and medium-weight, with nubby tannins around a taut core of black fruit, licorice and floral flavors that come together with intensity on the finish. Drink now through 2021. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Black Label
review: Grippy tannins frame a bright beam of raspberry and spice flavors as this cuts through to a long and zippy finish. Shows appealing clarity. Best from 2016 through 2020. 2,900 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Coonawarra
review: Smooth, silky and spicy, an elegant mouthful of toasty pear and caramel notes on the finish. Has character and style and should be at its best in 1997. 26,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra Michael
review: Brawny and flavorful, lavishly oaked but generous with its blackberry and dried cherry flavors, which persist right through the long, solid finish. Give it time. Best after 2005. 700 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra Michael Limited Release
review: Supple in texture, distinctive in flavor, with appealing raspberry and plum character at the core, picking up floral and peppery notes on the refined finish. Drink now through 2007. 634 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra Michael Limited Release
review: Crisp in texture, with spicy berry and prune flavors that expand and gain a touch of anise on the finish. Has impressive length; needs until 1999 to 2000 to soften. 4,693 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: Earthy, meaty notes add unexpected dimensions to the blackberry and currant fruit at the core. Finishes with a savory edge that lets the fruit sing. Drink now through 2014. 8,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra John Riddoch
review: Ripe, round and generous with its mineral-laced, currant, cherry and earthy aromas and flavors, echoing solidly on the firm-textured finish. Best from 2005 through 2012. 850 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Coonawarra
review: Sleek and polished, a beautifully smooth-textured Chardonnay, with pretty nectarine, cream and spice flavors that linger generously. Drink now through 2005. 8,331 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Coonawarra
review: Ripe and pure in character, with lovely pear, quince and cream aromas and flavors, its fruit echoing on the open-textured finish. Really nice bottle for the price. Drink now through 2004. 25,981 cases made.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra
review: Distinctly peppery, with cracked black pepper character in a lithe red, brimming with currant and blackberry right through the polished finish. Drink now through 2014. 7,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra
review: Polished and nicely focused to show off its blueberry and currant fruit, shaded with spicy oak on a plush, round finish. Without overripe character, this has a purity and harmony that sets it apart. Drink now through 2008. 8,500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: Dark in color, tart in structure, with tangy mint and herbal character overlaying the sharp core of blackberry and currant fruit. Needs to soften. Best after 2005. 12,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra John Riddoch
review: Firm and chewy, this serious mouthful of herb-scented dark cherry and cedar flavors has depth, presence and style. Just needs time. Best after 2001.

name: Chardonnay Coonawarra
review: Bright and vibrant, with spicy apple and pear flavors hinting at resin on the lively finish. Drink now through 2000.

name: Chardonnay Coonawarra
review: Ripe and rich--a little sweet perhaps--but it rolls out the toasty vanilla, raisin and pear flavors. Polished and flavorful.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra
review: Distinctively spicy, with an anise and poppy seed shading to the dark cherry and blackberry lurking in the crisp background. Nicely balanced so all sorts of nuances come through. Best from 2000 through 2008.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra Michael Limited Release
review: Firm in texture, lithe and expressive, offering green peppercorn and spice notes to the blackberry fruit, lingering against lively acidity on the juicy finish. Drink now through 2018. 60 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: Tight, jazzy and distinctive for its mint and rosemary nuances. Offers berry and roasted red pepper flavors that linger through the finish. Drink now through 2012. 7,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Coonawarra
review: Soft and ripe, with pretty peach and apple aromas and flavors that linger attractively on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 3,700 cases imported.

name: Riesling Coonawarra
review: Dry, taut style has lively green apple, lime and floral aromas and flavors, finishing tart and refreshing. Drink now through 2009. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Riesling Coonawarra
review: Round and fruity, a lively mouthful of pear and lemon aromas and flavors, finishing with refreshing balance. Drink now through 2005. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra
review: Firm, chewy and focused, with blackberry and white pepper flavors on a crisp, slightly tart frame. Dark and intense on the finish. Best from 2004 through 2009. 14,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra
review: On the firm side, but plump with earthy plum flavors, which echo nicely on the focused finish. Needs time to settle down. Best from 2004 through 2008. 68,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra
review: Crisp, zingy style centers around bright plum and berry flavors, supported by lively acidity. All remains harmonious through the finish. Drink now through 2005. 10,060 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra
review: Crisp and juicy, delivering a nice mouthful of ripe berry flavor, with a citrus accent. Needs to be cellared to develop some richness, so try in 2000 or 2002.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: Firm, chewy, with a core of herbal berry and cherry flavors, finishing with some grace. Best after 2005. 17,500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: Firm and chewy, with earthy currant and plum flavors sneaking past the fine-grained tannins. Best from 2001 through 2005.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: A very crisp, hard-edged style with emphasis on mint character on the back palate. Chunky tannins will require until 2002 or 2004 to settle down, but the flavors feel like they can hold until then, too.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Estate
review: Focused, rich and fruity, with ample black cherry, currant and blackberry flavors accented by hints of vanilla, chocolate and spice. Deep in color and full-bodied, but not too tannic. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Coonawarra
review: Light, smooth and appealing for its nectarine, melon and vanilla flavors, which echo nicely on the tangy finish. Drink now through 2005. 5,700 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Coonawarra
review: Smooth and polished, the toasty oak giving the pear and pineapple flavors a pretty, smoky dimension. Drinks well now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Coonawarra
review: Light, dry, easygoing style offers pretty peach, apple and floral aromas and flavors, lingering gently. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra Michael Limited Release
review: Aromatically generous, with spicy berry notes, bit it seems airy and light on the palate despite some firm tannins on the finish. Might flesh out with time. Best after 2001. 400 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: Firm tannins make for a chewy wine, but buried in the core is a nub of juicy plum and currant fruit that needs a little time to surface. Best after 2003. 44,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: Ripe in flavor, with solid currant and herb flavors on a frame festooned with fine-grained tannins. Approachable already. Drink now through 2005. 93,151 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: Earthy, barnyardy notes run through the plum and berry flavors in this round, generous red;distinctive, but not for everyone. Drinkable now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra John Riddoch Limited
review: Firm and flavorful, a bit muddled but has blackberry, herb, earth and currant flavors. Tannins wrap around the finish. Needs cellaring. Best from 2002 through 2010. 725 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra John Riddoch Limited Release
review: Dark, dense and supple, soft enough to be almost watery, with odd mint and vegetal overtones to the ripe Cabernet fruit. Drink now through 2007. 8,532 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz-Merlot Coonawarra
review: Firm, with generous berry and herb flavors, finishing with fine if chewy tannins. Best after 2006. 10,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz-Merlot Coonawarra
review: Lean and chewy, with earthy berry flavors up front, but they take some time to reappear on the finish. Has a distinctive range of leathery notes around the fruit. Best after 2001. 1,976 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Coonawarra
review: Light and pleasant, smelling and tasting like canned fruit cocktail, finishing with some length. Drink now. 12,400 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra John Riddoch Limited Release
review: Smooth, ripe and generous; a velvety wine, with spicy, vanilla-scented black cherry and currant aromas and flavors and hints of smoke and caramel on the finish. Smoothly elegant on the finish. Drinkable now through 1996.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz-Merlot Coonawarra
review: On the lean side, decidedly tart in balance, with juicy cherry and mineral flavors. Finish is tight and sharp. Best after 2003. 2,658 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Coonawarra
review: Lots of toasty oak at the beginning, honey on the finish, and in between a rich, smooth, flavorful glass of wine. Not elegant, but very likeable. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Coonawarra Estate
review: Lean and tight, with subtle citrus, lemon, pear and spice flavors framed by toasty, buttery oak. You have to hunt for the flavors, but they're pleasing once you find them. Drink now.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra
review: Bright, fruity and sturdy; appealing berry and spice flavors last on the finish. Drinkable now. 48,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra
review: Clean, with tart berry, spice and cherry notes, finishing with a lingering fruit edge. Drinks well now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz Coonawarra
review: Dark in color with ripe plum and cherry flavor, but it also has an earthy leathery edge. Firmly tannic; drinks well now or it can be cellared. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz-Merlot Coonawarra
review: Tart and tarry, with lots of anise and black pepper running through the chewy black cherry flavors. Best after 1999.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: Firm and grapey, with a wild berry edge to the leathery tannins. Drinks well now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: Like a walk through the herb garden, with earthy mineral flavors, plenty of herbal notes and not much fruit. Tannins clamp down on the finish. Best after 2002. 8,383 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Hermitage Coonawarra
review: A decent red with that has leathery, smoky, pruny and herbal flavors, firm structure and a fruity finish.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz-Merlot Coonawarra
review: Earthy, gamy flavors prevail in this crisp red, offering a hint of plum as the finish lingers. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 7,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Washington Reserve
review: Distinctly spicy, a bright, generous white with exotic pepper and spice notes weaving through the tangy citrus and apple fruit. Drink now through 2004. 148 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: On the light side for a Cabernet, but shows pretty blackberry and spice flavors on a polished frame. Drink now. 117 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Firm in texture, with a modest core of berry and charred oak flavors that echo on the grainy finish. Drink now through 2005. 115 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and appealing for its pure berry and anise-herb aromas and flavors, which echo on the lightish finish. Drink now. 193 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Washington
review: Soft and polished in texture, with pretty black cherry and herbal flavors on a medium frame. Drink now. 307 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Washington
review: Soft and sweet, covering a layer of bitterness that doesn't quit on the finish. 450 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Hawkes Bay
review: Floral and fresh-cracked black pepper accents are aromatic and intense, with lively acidity to the wild strawberry and cherry flavors. The tannins provide gentle grip on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 3,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Lean and juicy, with lemongrass overtones to the lemon, lime and tangerine flavors. Mouthwatering on the finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: A grassy mix of lemon and lime flavors, set on a light body, with a crisp edge and a juicy finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Vigneti delle Dolomiti Cuvée Cantante
review: Shows freshly cut apple on the nose, with honey and peach. Full-bodied, with crisp acidity and a clean finish. Sauvignon Blanc, Pinot Blanc and Riesling. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 315 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley
review: Appealing for its elegant balance and pretty flavors, with a mix of floral, ripe apple, pear and waxy vanilla notes with touches of spice and cedar. Drink now. 237 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Janice
review: Mouthcoating tannins quickly soften against rich, ripe currant, black cherry and floral flavors that pick up momentum as the finish adds licorice and savory notes, persisting well. Best from 2018 through 2022. 146 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Frank
review: Supple, generous and deftly balanced to play its blackberry and wild blueberry fruit against earthy notes, finishing with drive and finesse. Drink now through 2015. 265 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Caroline
review: Broad, with a tangy edge and mild grip of tannins around ripe plum and spice flavors, lingering easily on the finish. Best from 2013 through 2016. 239 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Verlynn
review: Light and tangy, this is refreshing for its peach and apple flavors, finishing with a hint of lime and enough acidity to lean toward the dry side. Drink now through 2015. 531 cases made.

name: Riesling Walla Walla Valley Teri & The German
review: Sweet, but balanced with lively acidity to show the tang of mandarin orange around a beam of pear and apricot flavors. Drink now. 294 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla
review: Fresh and vital, with a creamy note and a sense of transparency to the licorice-accented plum and black currant fruit, coming together with restraint on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 195 cases made.

name: Rick & Debbie Fusion Red Walla Walla Valley
review: A strong herbal tone teams with black olive notes to shoulder past a supple core of dark berry and licorice flavors, lingering on the warm finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Syrah. Drink now through 2015. 595 cases made.

name: Merlot Walla Walla
review: Firm in texture, offering modest earth and plum flavors on a taut frame, finishing with a hint of green. Best after 2016. 214 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Columbia Valley
review: Soft and appealing, with classic aromas of spice and rose petal, tasting of grapefruit. Drink now. 124 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley Vineyard Select
review: Ripe, rich, seductive style brims with mocha-scented blackberry, currant and cherry flavors. Extra long and distinctive for its extraordinary balance of fruit and coffee-scented oak, hinting at marzipan as it all persists. Drink now through 2015. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Sagemoor Vineyard
review: Focused, generous and expressive, offering currant and blueberry fruit, with shadings of graphite, cedar and sage as the finish lingers against refined tannins. Drink now through 2019. 318 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
review: Rich, mouthfilling style brims with dense cherry, blackberry, chocolate and espresso flavors, lingering enticingly on the polished, elegant finish. A stylish wine, tempting now, but should develop well with cellaring. Drink now through 2012. 693 cases made.

name: Malbec Walla Walla Valley
review: This serious style focuses blackberry, plum and spice box flavors into a deftly balanced, finely tannic frame. Possesses all the pieces, but needs some time to bring the elements together in the bottle. Best from 2015 through 2020. 121 cases made.

name: Merlot Walla Walla Valley
review: Polished, smooth and velvety, this red plays out its smoky, licorice-accented berry flavors beautifully, lingering easily and expressively. Best from 2014 through 2020. 657 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Unfolding impressively, this silky-smooth wine emphasizes berry, black cherry and currant flavors up front, then folds in harmonious touches of pretty oak and sweet spices. Appealing now, but give it until 1999 to 2000 to settle down. 165 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
review: Fresh and focused, this is nicely finessed to deliver intense currant, red berry and goji berry flavors against hints of white pepper and clove. Gently slides its tannins into the finish. Drink now through 2019. 966 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
review: Dark and supple, brimming with black cherry, mint and spice flavors, lingering on the refined finish. Shows intensity and charm. Drink now through 2018. 757 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
review: This one has a lot of pizzazz, registering layers of raspberry, red cherry and sweet spice notes, which linger on the fine-grained finish. Packed with flavor, it should mellow with time. Drink now through 2008. 800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley Vineyard Select
review: Fresh and taut, offering focused blackberry, guava and cream flavors, with a thin veil of prickly tannins wrapping the finish. Drink now through 2017. 110 cases made.

name: Cuvée Washington
review: Ripe and peppery, displaying a rich core of blackberry and cherry that plays against layers of roasted meat and savory black pepper notes. Comes together on the finish, where the tannins back off to let the flavors shine. Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Carmenère. Best from 2014 through 2020. 969 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Rich, bordering on opulent, with chocolate, cream and olive grace notes to the core of black currant and blackberry. Has elegance and style to go along with its significant power. Drink now through 2010. 979 cases made.

name: Merlot Walla Walla Valley
review: Supple, ripe and generous with its gorgeous cherry and currant fruit, boldly framed with sweet, spicy oak. The finish lasts very nicely. Drink now through 2007. 946 cases made.

name: Merlot Walla Walla Valley
review: A stylish wine, dense, plush and generous with its black cherry, currant, chocolate and sweet spice flavors, which last and last on the rich finish. Drink now through 2008. 815 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Columbia Valley
review: Smooth and round, aromatic with floral plum and berry flavors, blossoming nicely as the wine streams over the tongue, finishing with the mocha notes of sweet oak. Drink now through 2011. 801 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Walla Walla Valley
review: Smooth, ripe and generous, with cherry, currant and exotic spice flavors, finishing with refinement and persistence. Drink now through 2005. 532 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Smooth, velvety and charming for its floral, blackberry, currant and delicate mocha notes swirling through the long, refined finish. Tannins have just enough grip to want cellaring. Best from 2007 through 2012. 560 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Ripe and generous, well-wrapped in mocha and caramel tones of new oak, with cherry and currant flavors persisting through it all, lingering nicely on the polished finish. Drink now through 2010. 695 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla County Windrow Vineyard
review: Ripe, supple and generous with its black cherry, currant and spicy oak flavors, smoothly integrated on the long, fine-textured finish. Has the stuff to age well. Drink now through 2009. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
review: There's a note of dried tomato weaving through the ripe currant and blueberry fruit in this smooth and velvety red, mingling seamlessly with hints of nutmeg and balsamic as the finish rolls alond easily. Best from 2012 through 2017. 630 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
review: Firm up front, with fine tannins around a glowing, expressive core of plum, currant and coffee aromas and flavors, lingering on the open-textured finish. Best from 2010 through 2015. 731 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley Vineyard Select
review: This is dense with currant and spice flavors, offering grippy tannins around a lively core of fruit that persists into the focused finish. Not a big wine, but with some grip to loosen. Best from 2011 through 2015. 240 cases made.

name: Cuvée Walla Walla Valley
review: A graceful red, firmly framed with fine tannins but generous at the core with black cherry and black olive flavors, lingering on the fine-grained finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2006 through 2012. 813 cases made.

name: Cuvée Washington
review: Juicy and vibrant, with pretty currant and floral aromas and flavors on a lively frame that melds into the polished texture. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Syrah, Carmenère, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2013. 720 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: A subtler style, bright and appealing for its chocolate-scented berry and spice flavors on a silky texture, remaining lively through the creamy finish. Drink now through 2007. 785 cases made.

name: Merlot Walla Walla Valley
review: Firm and chewy, with a strong tobacco note weaving through the dark berry and cherry fruit. Finishes with intensity. Best from 2014 through 2019. 778 cases made.

name: Merlot Walla Walla Valley
review: Focused, refined and distinctive for the wet earth and mineral overtones weaving through the cherry and plum fruit, hovering over fine tannins on the long finish. Drink now through 2016. 803 cases made.

name: Merlot Walla Walla Valley
review: Smooth and dark, with spice-inflected blackberry and currant flavors that glide easily through a veil of soft tannins, echoing enticingly on the finish. Drink now through 2013. 670 cases made.

name: Merlot Walla Walla Valley
review: Firm, chewy and densely packed with red berry, black currant and spice flavors, echoing nicely on the solid, moderately tannic finish. Best after 2003. 1,022 cases made.

name: Merlot Washington
review: Rich in flavor, noble in stature, with spicy, tobacco-scented black cherry and dark plum flavors that linger on the generous finish, which picks up a distinct floral note. Delicious now, but promises to keep developing from 1999 to 2000 at least. 168 cases made.

name: Washington State Cuvée Washington
review: Generous, supple and spicy, with a sweet streak of coffee and leather wending its way through the rich mouthful of blueberry, plum and red currant. Artfully balanced. Lovely now. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 1999 through 2004. 820 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Columbia Valley
review: Smooth and supple, generous with its plum, black currant and lavishly spicy, creamy coffee notes on the finish. Shows plenty of fruit up front, becoming spicy and toasty on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 425 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Firm and nicely focused, shining its blackberry and currant flavors through a broad frame, echoing with hints of pepper and dark chocolate on the round finish. Drink now through 2006. 724 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley Cut Bank Vineyard
review: Maturing nicely, with refined black cherry and tobacco flavors that finish with sleek tannins. Drink now through 2020. 154 cases made.

name: Cuvée Washington
review: Polished, focused and vibrant, with cherry, tar and dark chocolate flavors, finishing with a hint of peppermint. This has grace and intensity. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and others. Drink now through 2016. 783 cases made.

name: Sagemoor Vineyard Cuvée Columbia Valley
review: Spicy, velvety style has a green olive note weaving through the ripe cherry and pepper flavors, finishing with impressive generosity. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2010. 448 cases made.

name: Washington State Cuvée Washington
review: Refined style has pretty tobacco-scented, peppery blackberry and currant flavors, lingering effectively on the fine-grained finish, spicy notes hovering nicely over it all. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2010. 700 cases made.

name: Washington State Cuvée Washington
review: Smooth and spicy. Ripe plum and currant flavors are the core, shaded with spicy oak. Finishes polished and vibrant. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2005. 625 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Columbia Valley
review: Smooth, open-textured and appealing for its meaty currant and floral flavors, remaining accessible and refined through the finish. Drink now through 2011. 794 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Walla Walla Valley
review: Soft in texture, with lovely blueberry-laced currant at the core, shaded with cedar and spice notes as the fruit lingers beautifully on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2005. 584 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Yakima Valley
review: Light, silky and appealing for its gentle blackberry and currant flavors, hinting at spice and tobacco on the finish. Ready now. 170 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Sagemoor Vineyard
review: Polished and focused, with ripe cherry and mint flavors competing for attention on the racy palate. A mild bite of tannins and acidity mark the finish. Best from 2012 through 2015. 513 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley Vineyard Select
review: Smooth and ripe, if a bit subdued, with an herbal edge to the sweet boysenberry and currant fruit, finishing on a note of fresh bay leaf. Drink now through 2014. 345 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Ripe and rich, with a solid core of bright raspberry and cherry notes surrounded by blankets of spicy oak and tobacco flavors. Finishes with silky, pretty fruit. Nice now, better in 1999. 165 cases made.

name: Merlot Walla Walla Valley Spring Valley Vineyard
review: Earthy, gamy, tobacco-scented flavors permeate this firm-textured wine. At the core, focused currant and black cherry flavors prevail, with a minty note on the finish. Needs cellaring. Best after 2000. 450 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Columbia Valley
review: Rich and spicy, a powerful mouthful of bay leaf and exotic herb-scented blackberry and spice flavors. Strongly marked by oak, but rich and firm through the solid finish. Drink now through 2002. 417 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Walla Walla Valley Spring Valley Vineyard
review: A firm, focused red, with solid blackberry and black pepper flavors and a nice floral edge to the finish. Not a rough wine. Drink now through 2002. 330 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Bright and juicy, a well-made Cabernet with focused currant and cedar flavors, finishing with a firm bite of tannin. Best from 2003 through 2006. 612 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Sagemoor Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, with chewy tannins around a nice core of currant and earthy-herbal flavors, lingering easily. Best from 2011 through 2014. 613 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Walla Walla Valley
review: Firm and focused, with flavors reminiscent of sun-dried tomatoes and raspberry vinaigrette. Not what you might expect, but oddly appealing. Drink now. 541 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley Pleasant Vineyard
review: Light in color, with pretty strawberry and currant flavors that linger on the velvety finish, suggesting this could deepen with age. Drink now through 2002. 400 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Columbia Valley
review: Plush in texture, with spicy, oaky flavors at the forefront, finishing with just enough blueberry and blackberry fruit to keep it honest. Drink now through 2005. 577 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley
review: Fresh, vivid and light, centering on black currant and tobacco flavors, winding down slowly on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 148 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley Vineyard Select
review: Ripe and generous, but not too dense, with a firm texture and a spicy edge that turns earthy on the finish. Best after 2007. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 504 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Columbia Valley
review: Extremely light in color, with round texture and spicy tobacco flavors mingling with the strawberry notes at the core. Drink now. 576 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
review: Gamy, earthy flavors get in the way, but there is some nice ripe fruit lurking in the background. Drink now through 2009. 784 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Bright in flavor, with ripe apple, spice and cream flavors mingling through the light but refined finish. Drink now. 200,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Light and refreshing, with simple berry and green bean flavors. 20,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi
review: Big, ripe and pruny, with bold aromas and concentrated flavors of stewed fruit and spice. Drink now through 2013. 120 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light and fragrant, brimming with gorgeous raspberry, strawberry, lingonberry and cream flavors, lingering enticingly on the delicate finish. Drink now through 2014. 1,818 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Very light in color and weight, with earthy orange peel and berry flavors that get a bit sharp on the finish. 4,403 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Tart, earthy, difficult to like. 1,045 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Cowra Nyrang Creek Vineyard
review: A streak of bracing, citrusy acidity cuts through this otherwise round and generous white that offers pretty pear and hazelnut flavors. Needs food to balance the crispness. Drink now through 2003. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Diamond Mountain District Seraphim
review: A massive Cabernet that shows finesse, this is a powerful, bare-fisted effort, with extracted currant, blackberry, licorice, dusty, cedary oak and black licorice flavors. The finish gains momentum, leading to a long, sustained aftertaste. Drink now through 2030. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Diamond Mountain District
review: Firm and dense, this is well-focused on a tight core of mineral-laced dark berry, vanilla bean, licorice and espresso notes. Chewy and elegant, supported by fine-grain tannins, this wine will best be served by short-term cellaring. Best from 2016 through 2028. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Diamond Mountain District Little Sister
review: Focused on a pure, rich core of blackberry, licorice, cigar box, mocha and cookie dough, this is very rich and dense, yet with a measure of finesse and polish. Glides along on the finish, ending with a minerally edge. Drink now through 2030. 150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Diamond Mountain District Seraphim
review: Judicious and delicious oak defines this now, offering a seductive toasty, mocha-laced core, joined by dusty currant, blackberry and blueberry fruit notes. Ends with oak-laced tannins and nice length. Drink now through 2028. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Diamond Mountain District
review: Rich without being weighty, this red features a firm mix of loamy earth, dried berry, licorice and dried herb notes. Finely detailed flavors mark the complex finish. Drink now through 2018. 200 cases made.

name: Little Sister Diamond Mountain District
review: Both ripe and generous, with dark berry and red and black licorice flavors that show a pleasant chewy tannic earthiness. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Diamond Mountain District Little Sister
review: Shows pronounced herbal, dill and celery flavors, with little ripe fruit, ending with an edge of road tar, cedar and cranberry. Drink now through 2021. 650 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Diamond Mountain District Seraphim
review: Roughhewn, with creamy oak attempting to round off the edges, but the core of graphite and crushed rock prevails as the blackberry and licorice notes seek ways to bypass the gravel pit. Best from 2020 through 2032. 265 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Reserve
review: On the meaty, gamy side, with touches of elegance. Beef bouillon, compote and vanilla flavors give this an up-front appeal. Touches of mint chocolate on the finish. Drink now through 2008. 200 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland
review: Red currant and spiced cherry flavors dominate this smoky red. The taut finish features graphite and iron accents. Drink now. 56 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Kentaur
review: This has a creamy aroma, with tart berry and red cherry flavors, which carry onto the finish with nutmeg notes. Firm and balanced. Blaufränkisch, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Reserve
review: Fresh, fruity style, with plenty of up-front raspberry and red plum flavors. Vanilla, with hints of coffee on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 583 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Deutsch Schützen
review: Sandalwood aroma and flavor in this supple red. Blackberry and raspberry dominate and carry through to the fresh finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Smooth, round and generous with berry and cherry fruit, finishing with a touch of cedar. Drink now. 1,571 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Light, with bright, jammy blackberry and cherry flavors, echoing gently. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Light and tangy, with a red pepper edge to the pretty plum and vanilla flavors. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Blicks Lane
review: Very fragrant and complex, with fine intensity to crushed stone, black currant, lemon blossom and lime flavors. Coconut, lead pencil and lively citrus acidity persist through the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Collectables
review: Ripe and vibrant, with an open texture to the raspberry and strawberry fruit, hinting at peppermint on the airy finish. Drink now through 2011. 1,400 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Collectables
review: Bright and refreshing, with passion fruit, pineapple and lime flavors that linger on the dry finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Collectables
review: A mouthwatering mix of kiwifruit, lime and ruby grapefruit flavors on a sleek and juicy frame. Drink now. 5,300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Pretty spice and strawberry flavors have lively acidity and tannins, with dried sage tones and persistent mineral notes. Drink now through 2011. 600 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Collectables
review: Lemon, lime and grapefruit flavors create a chorus of crisp and refreshing flavors, with notes of green tea on the finish. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Collectables
review: The vibrant lime, grapefruit and passion fruit flavors are refreshing, showing a touch of fresh herb and green apple peel on the finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Collectables
review: Crisp and vivid, with lime zest and grapefruit flavors. Fresh thyme notes peek through on the long finish. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Tart lime, grapefruit and grass flavors are streamlined, with very good intensity. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Collectables
review: Refreshing and straightforward, with a fragrant honeysuckle note giving way to lime, melon and tangy grapefruit flavors. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Collectables
review: A bit raw in texture, with lively lime, pear and lilac aromas and flavors, lingering on the solid finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Single Vineyard
review: Broad and medium-bodied, with tangy citrus notes that have a spicy edge. Soft acidity. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Collectables
review: Direct strawberry and cherry flavors have a green-tinged herbal note, on a lightly crisp frame, with the tannins becoming slightly astringent and chalky on the finish. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Grass, white grapefruit and jalapeño pepper flavors finish with a bitter note. 800 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Reserve
review: Tight, vibrant and refreshing, with citrus-accented red berry and toasted coconut flavors, featuring gentle aromatics that carry through from start to finish. Best from 2015 through 2018. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon La Cantera Vineyard Reserve
review: Sleek and polished, with nicely delineated black cherry and smoky spice flavors that glide over a light burr of tannin on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Reserve
review: Floral strawberry and cherry aromas open to snappy, easygoing flavors, accented by green tea and spice notes. Drink now through 2021. 333 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: This red is light on its feet, with spicy overtones to the delicate cherry and sassafras flavors, narrowing to a thread on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 4,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley
review: Bright and tangy, with jazzy flavors of lime and spice that persist on the lively finish. Drink now through 2015. 220 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Z'ivo Vineyard Reserve
review: Light in color, this is sleek, with pretty orange-cream accents to the mulberry and spice flavors, lingering on the deft open-weave finish. Drink now through 2017. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light and soft, with modest cherry and spice flavors lurking under the polished surface. Drink now. 3,400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Sierra Mar
review: Though ultrarich and loaded with deep, dark flavors, this maintains a graceful balance and delicate presence, with detailed blackberry, raspberry, mocha, black licorice, smoke, nutmeg and cedar notes, ending with a long, persistent aftertaste that keeps reverberating. Drink now through 2022. 1,243 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Sanford and Benedict
review: Pure, rich and complex, with vivid blueberry and blackberry fruit that's well-centered, gaining depth and breadth and ending where this started, with a wonderful purity of flavor. Drink now through 2022. 206 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast
review: A charming mouthful of rich, layered Chardonnay, with fig, honeydew and apricot notes amid flavors of green tree fruits and citrus. Ends long, smoky and detailed. Drink now through 2022. 3,078 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Savoy Vineyards
review: Features a solid core of rich, smoky dark berry, raspberry, mocha, wild berry and fresh-cut flowers. This is well-focused, long, deep and persistent on the finish, with rich, fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2022. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley The Corners
review: Impressive, with a rich core of savory berry, dried herb, fresh earth, cedar and black licorice flavors. Harmonious throughout, ending with firm, ripe tannins and a burst of fruity mocha. Drink now through 2021. 675 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley The Corners
review: Exhibits lots of depth and dimension, with a fascinating range of detailed flavors, extending from dark and red berry to anise, mocha-scented oak and pennyroyal. Remains focused through the long, persistent finish. Drink now through 2022. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley The Corners
review: Attractive floral, ripe plum, blueberry and blackberry aromas are complex on the palate. Fleshy on entry, this firms midpalate on, ending with ripe tannins and a mahogany edge that gives the flavors traction. Drink now through 2020. 198 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Gap's Crown Vineyard
review: Firm, dense and focused, this is slow to unfold but does so gracefully, with a medley of blueberry, cherry and wild berry flavors that are expansive and supple, firming on the finish. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2023. 2,230 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Gap's Crown Vineyard
review: Pure and vibrant, with snappy blueberry, plum and raspberry notes that are firm and well-proportioned, ending with tight, minerally accents of crushed rock and anise. Drink now through 2022. 330 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Gap's Crown Vineyard
review: Bold, rich and layered, with plush boysenberry and wild berry flavors that are intense and supple, gaining depth and persistence on the finish, where the tannins add backbone. Drink now through 2022. 190 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Clos Pepe
review: Broad, rich and expansive, with a deep core of wild berry, blueberry, spice, pepper and bergamot orange, showing subtle earthy shadings. Tightens on the finish but is easy to drink now and sure to gain. Drink now. 682 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Clos Pepe
review: Aromas of ripe plum, raspberry and blueberry turn dry and savory, rich and structured, ending with a mix of dry, earthy tannins and extracted berry flavors. Drink now through 2020. 330 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Shea Vineyard
review: Light and velvety, with a nubby feel to the delicate plum and rhubarb pie flavors, persisting on the finely etched, very long finish. Drink now through 2021. 475 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Shea Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, with a peppery edge to the black fruit and licorice flavors, finishing smooth and sturdy. Shows presence and persistence. Best from 2016 through 2020. 312 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley The Corners
review: The ripe, vibrant dark berry fruit picks up anise and cedar notes. Very complete and deftly balanced, ending with a long, smooth, lingering aftertaste that keeps the berry flavors at the forefront. Drink now through 2022. 470 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Clos Pepe
review: Exhibits a rich, savory core of dark berry, mocha and roasted coffee notes, with subtle violet and wilted rose accents. Gains depth, length and traction on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 1,120 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Clos Pepe
review: Offers a mix of ripe plum, raspberry, blueberry and wild berry, with a dash of cedar and anise, gaining depth and persistence on the finish, where a pleasing earthiness folds in. Drink now through 2021. 309 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Rita's Crown
review: Rich and layered, with an expansive core of zesty wild berry, blueberry, anise, black tea, violet and rose flavors. Ends with a long, graceful finish. Drink now. 1,366 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Shea Vineyard
review: Expressive lavender and raspberry aromas open to supple and layered cherry and licorice flavors that glide along the finish. Drink now through 2022. 995 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Shea Vineyard
review: Highly perfumed, with strong notes of jasmine and lavender riding over the dark berry flavors, finishing with polish and intensity on a light frame. Drink now through 2018. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Shea Vineyard
review: Light and velvety, offering dark berry and cola flavors with a hint of verbena as the finish lingers with refinement and a delicate plushness. Drink now through 2017. 209 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Braughton Vineyard
review: Rich and creamy, with layers of ripe fig, honeydew melon, creamy oak and subtle earth notes that are pure, focused and persistent. Drink now through 2018. 240 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County La Brisa
review: Well-proportioned, offering a mix of ripe pear, light fig and honeydew flavors, with light oak notes. Nothing stands out except the completeness. Drink now. 1,629 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Blue Jay
review: There's lots to admire in this rich, vibrant offering, from the zesty, earth-laced raspberry and wild berry to the snappy, penetrating acidity and tannins. On the finish this pulls back a bit in focus, but the flavors charge ahead. Should be better in a year. Best from 2017 through 2023. 2,800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley Carneros Brown Ranch
review: Notably rich and layered, with tiers of blackberry, wild berry, black licorice, crushed rock, cedar and nutmeg notes. This maintains a rich core and fruity profile, turning tannic and chewy. The flavors push through on the aftertaste. Drink now through 2021. 222 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma County Gap's Crown Vineyard
review: Strikes a nice balance between rich, fleshy plum and cherry flavors and touches of anise, cedar, sage and licorice. Ends with a long, supple, graceful finish. Drink now. 975 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma County La Brisa
review: A seamless effort, offering a smooth, silky texture and pure, ripe dark berry fruit that's focused, persistent and graceful. Drink now through 2022. 2,590 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Rita's Crown
review: Notably rich and creamy, with cedary oak notes behind the vivid red berry, raspberry and black licorice flavors. Ends with a supple, layered finish and firm tannins. Drink now through 2022. 825 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Rita's Crown
review: Intense, with a smoked meat edge to the dried berry, cedar and fresh earth notes. Needs time to come together and for the tannins to subside. Best from 2014 through 2022. 309 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Rita's Crown
review: Weaves together a mix of dried berry, spice, cedar, black licorice and loamy earth flavors, gaining depth and dimension on the long, persistent finish. Drink now through 2020. 68 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Dutton Ranch
review: Rich and expansive, with a mix of peach, nectarine and green apple flavors, shaded by light spicy oak notes. The texture and finish have a pithy feel. Drink now. 520 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County La Brisa
review: Presents a broad range of ripe tropical fruit and pineapple flavors, complemented by notes of guava and mango, with a dash of nectarine. Juicy finish. Drink now through 2017. 182 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County La Brisa
review: This clean, pure white features notes of ripe white peach, citrus, light cedary oak and cooking spices. Full-bodied and intense, this is a touch raw, complex and persistent. Drink now through 2018. 1,293 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Blue Jay
review: Charming, offering an elegant mix of blueberry and wild berry flavors. More simple and pleasing than layered, but with satisfying complexity. Drink now. 3,300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Sierra Mar Vineyard
review: Combines rich, fleshy plum and blueberry flavors with structured, earth-laced tannins, allowing the flavors to linger on the finish, where they become a little less focused. Drink now. 428 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Sierra Mar Vineyard
review: Well done in a taut, structured style, with loamy, gravelly earth notes woven amid ripe plum and raspberry fruit. The tannins on the finish suggest short-term cellaring and the flavors appear to have room to grow. Drink now through 2022. 168 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Bob's Ranch
review: Pure, clean and ultimately simple, with direct pear, melon, light oak, spice and citrus notes. Has room to grow. Drink now. 204 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Dutton Ranch
review: Intense and a bit raw in texture, with firm apple, melon, spice and citrus notes, gaining depth and nuance while offering a pithy texture. Drink now through 2019. 442 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Sangiacomo Vineyard
review: Pure and rich, with subtle notes of butterscotch, honeydew, spice and floral notes, ending with a delicate aftertaste. Drink now. 658 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Blue Jay
review: Centered on rich dark berry, plum and raspberry flavors, with depth and persistence, showing chewy tannins. Drink now through 2024. 1,656 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Blue Jay
review: Very dense and extracted, with dried herb and pure, juicy berry flavors. The tannins are dry and gripping, offering a touch of underbrush and savory. Drink now through 2022. 3,600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Blue Jay
review: Pleasantly uncomplicated, with aromas of fresh strawberry and blueberry. Delicate and easy to drink. Drink now through 2017. 1,875 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Savoy Vineyard
review: Weaves together a complex array of ripe smoky plum and wild berry notes that is texturally alluring and refined, gaining depth and length. Drink now. 99 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Savoy Vineyard
review: Pushes forward, with edgy red plum and blackberry flavors. Firmly tannic and chewy, ending with savory, dried herb and tobacco notes. Drink now through 2020. 336 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley The Corners
review: Starts out intense and rich and builds from there, adding to the blackberry and black licorice core with hints of dried herb and sage, and cedary oak. Persistent finish. Drink now. 1,170 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley Carneros Brown Ranch
review: Intense, with deep flavors of dark berry, licorice, mocha and anise that fan out on the palate, maintaining richness and ending with a long, full, persistent finish. Drink now through 2023. 663 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Clos Pepe
review: A ripe red that's full of blueberry and blackberry flavors that are intensely spicy. A full-bore style, lingering with rich plum pudding notes on the spicy finish. Drink now. 867 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Rita's Crown
review: Juicy and ripe, with concentrated dark plum, blackberry and cherry tart flavors that are filled with cedar and Asian spice notes. Dark chocolate and mocha accents flood the creamy finish. Drink now through 2022. 735 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley The Corners
review: Rich and elegant, with an alluring mix of blackberry, wild berry, spice and licorice flavors, finishing with fine-grained tannins and a layered aftertaste. Drink now through 2022. 756 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley C'est Syrah Magnifique
review: This plush red is packed with flavors of raspberry and blackberry, cherry and chai tea, wrapped in refined tannins and persisting into the long, vivid finish. Best from 2012 through 2017. 240 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley C'est Syrah Beaux
review: Smoky, meaty notes add interest to the billowing cherry and red plum fruit, all of it coming together harmoniously on the finish. Lively acidity keeps it feeling fresh and vibrant. Drink now through 2015. 300 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley C'est Syrah Beaux
review: This Syrah is refreshing, deftly balanced and lively, featuring plum, blackberry and spice flavors, which dance lightly through fine tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 205 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley C'est Syrah Beaux
review: Chewy in texture and round in structure, this has just the right balance to show off the cherry and plum flavors, shaded with hints of roasted meat and dark spices as the finish lingers. Best from 2008 through 2012. 206 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley C'est Syrah Magnifique
review: Rich, focused and generous with its blackberry, tobacco, black olive and spice flavors, lingering easily against a burr of tannins on the polished finish. Best from 2013 through 2016. 317 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley C'est Syrah Magnifique
review: Bright, fruit-forward style offers layers of blueberry and plum flavors, shaded with welcome hints of nutmeg, caramel and chocolate as the finish lingers well. Has all the pieces to develop into something special. Drink now through 2013. 195 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Appanage Boushey Vineyards
review: Bursting with fruit, this has juicy acidity to balance its ripe plum and cherry flavors, hinting at sage and rose petal as the finish sails on harmoniously. Drink now through 2015. 120 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Boushey Vineyards Appanage
review: This taut, focused red brims with black olive-scented blackberry and spice flavors on a supple frame, lingering on the expressive finish. Drink now through 2016. 134 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley C'est Syrah Belle
review: Smooth and velvety, nicely packed with cherry and spice flavors that hint at coffee and smoke as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2013. 450 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley C'est Syrah Belle
review: Soft and open-textured, with sharp acidity to balance the ripe blackberry and plum flavors, shifting toward white pepper and green olive as the finish persists. Best from 2010 through 2015. 450 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley C'est Syrah Magnifique
review: Smooth and appealing for its velvety texture against lively acidity, with pretty plum and currant fruit, hinting at cream and spice on the generous finish. Drink now through 2013. 294 cases made.

name: Viognier Yakima Valley
review: Smooth and soft. The plush texture lets the tangy grapefruit and pear flavors sink into the persistent finish. Drink now through 2009. 125 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Red Mountain
review: Bright and juicy, glowing with raspberry, strawberry and floral aromas and flavors. Tannins have a light nip, and the finish rolls on nicely. Drink now through 2015. 208 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley C'est Syrah Belle
review: Smooth, round and open-textured, allowing the black cherry and sweet spice aromas and flavors to emerge in a stately fashion as the finish lingers enticingly. Drink now through 2011. 291 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley C'est Syrah Belle
review: Polished, focused and aromatic with floral overtones to the core of blueberry and currant fruit, framed with fine tannins and a refreshing balance of refined acidity. Drink now through 2010. 301 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley C'est Syrah Magnifique
review: A crisp, peppery style, with distinctive spicy notes to the raspberry fruit. The open texture lets the flavors ring smoothly through the finish. Drink now through 2011. 237 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley C'est Syrah Beaux
review: Polished texture and spacious structure give the plum, berry and dusky spice flavors room to spread, but this is not a heavy wine. It remains lithe through the refined finish. Drink now through 2010. 172 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Boushey Vineyards Appanage
review: Bright and lively, with a tart edge to the plum and green olive flavors, persisting on the finish. Drink now through 2011. 100 cases made.

name: Viognier Yakima Valley
review: Exotic, spicy and distinctive for its citrus and melon flavors, lingering on the open-textured finish. Drink now. 217 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley C'est Syrah Beaux
review: Dark, crisp and peppery, with a black olive character as prominent as the dark fruit. Drink now through 2012. 300 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley C'est Syrah Belle
review: On the lighter side, with a gamy edge to the blackberry and wet earth flavors. Slightly crisp finish. Best after 2013. 450 cases made.

name: Picolit Colli Orientali del Friuli Riserva
review: Wonderfully sweet. Captivating aromas of dried fruits and blanched almonds follow through to full body with sweet, spicy fruit and a creamy aftertaste. Drink now. 50 cases made.

name: Colli Orientali del Friuli Ronco degli Agostiniani
review: Lots of character, with passion fruit and apple aromas. Full-bodied, with lime and gooseberry flavors. Long, zingy finish. Chardonnay and Tocai Friulano. Drink now through 2004. 800 cases made.

name: Pignolo Colli Orientali del Friuli
review: Well-crafted red that still needs some time. Lots of berry, vanilla and currant aromas follow through to a medium-bodied palate, with well-integrated tannins and a medium finish. Best after 2001. 350 cases made.

name: Merlot Colli Orientali del Friuli Ronco dei Benedettini '906
review: Slightly rustic but plenty of ripe fruit and chewy tannins. Full-bodied. Long tobacco and cherry finish. Slightly austere. Best after 2002. 700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Colli Orientali del Friuli Ronco dei Domenicani
review: Pleasant, with tobacco and cherry character. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a fresh finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay-Pinot Bianco Colli Orientali del Friuli Poiesis
review: Fresh and fruity, with apple and pear aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with good acidity and a clean finish. Drink now. 1,300 cases made.

name: Pignolo Colli Orientali del Friuli Riserva
review: Rather leathery, with hints of pepper and fruit. Medium-bodied, with firm acidity and a chewy finish. A bit lean. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Colli Orientali del Friuli Ronco dei Domenicani
review: A light and simple Cabernet Sauvignon, with currant character, medium body and a medium finish. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Colli Orientali del Friuli Poiesis
review: Broad and waxy, with a dash of honey and almond, this is round and balanced on the soft side. Pleasant, if not very complex. Tocai Friulano and Pinot Bianco. Drink now.

name: Colli Orientali del Friuli Ronco degli Agostiniani
review: Interesting, but underwhelming in the end. Aromas of ripe pineapple, peaches and honey, with hints of cream. Full-bodied, with lots of good fruit, but a short and milky aftertaste. Chardonnay, Pinot Bianco and Tocai Friulano. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Ribolla Gialla Colli Orientali del Friuli
review: A fresh, crisp white, with peach and apple flavors that combine with a moderate richness midpalate, ending on a citrus note. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Colli Orientali del Friuli
review: A mature Sauvignon, this has aromas and flavors of baked apples and marzipan, with a hint of cherry, on a lean, firm structure. Curt finish. Drink now.

name: Pinot Grigio
review: Begins with soft, rich apple and herb flavors but turns a little tart on the finish. Try with food. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Venezia-Giulia
review: Plenty of melon and apple character, with medium body, fresh acidity and a simple finish. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Ribolla Gialla
review: A crisp white, whose subtle fig and apple notes are accented by a hint of almond. 2,000 cases made.

name: Ribolla Gialla Colli Orientali del Friuli
review: Aromas of white pepper and persimmon. Medium-bodied, with simple fruit and a crisp finish. A bit dull, really. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon
review: Aromas of peaches and apricots are followed by almond flavors in this moderately rich white. It ends up firm and crisp. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Venezia-Giulia
review: Bright and appealing, but light, with modest apple and almond notes that finish short.

name: Chardonnay-Pinot Bianco Colli Orientali del Friuli Poiesis
review: Rather dull and candied, with fruit character, but not very interesting. Pinot Bianco and Chardonnay. 1,800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Colli Orientali del Friuli Suvignis
review: Pleasant lime and mineral character, but comes across as slightly oxidized, with marzipan character. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Hansel Family Vineyards
review: Ultrarich and smoky, with broad layers of ripe fig, melon, pear and butterscotch. Finishes with mineral, anise, light oak and melon. Drink now through 2003. 454 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley The North Slope Vineyard
review: Pure and juicy, with vivid, silk-textured blackberry and wild berry flavors, featuring fine-grained tannins that grip the flavors. Drink now through 2022.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Hansel Family Vineyards
review: Rich and layered, with aromas of smoky oak, ripe fig, melon and apricot, this smooth-textured white is long and silky on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 1,030 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Hansel Family Vineyards
review: Firm and focused, with layers of pear and melon backed by tangy citrus, mineral and sweet oak notes. A hint of earthiness adds interest, while bright acidity keeps the finish long and clean. Drink now through 2003. 450 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley The North Slope Vineyard
review: Complex and well-built, with tight red berry, plum and savory herb notes. Full-bodied, with ripe tannins and a long, pure finish, ending with crushed rock. Drink now through 2022. 1,087 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Cuvée Alyce
review: A well-oaked and well-done version, this offers a smoky vanilla edge to the ripe, creamy fig and toasted marshmallow flavors. Elegant and stylish, this is still a touch woody. Drink now through 2018. 1,544 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Hansel Family Vineyards
review: A complex and compelling style, with an overlay of toasty oak shading an elegant band of ripe pear, hazelnut, cedar and floral notes. Drink now through 2006. 1,084 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley The Estate Vineyards
review: Shows a pleasant earthy streak amid the dried dark berry, herb and nutmeg notes. Firm and well-balanced, this can hold up to short-term cellaring. Drink now through 2021. 952 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley The North Slope Vineyard
review: Very complete, with a racy sweet-and-sour touch to the red and dark berry fruit. Earthy, presenting firm drying tannins on the finish, this will best be enjoyed sooner than later. Drink now through 2020. 1,064 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley The South Slope Vineyard
review: Rich, with a strawberry, raspberry and rhubarb profile. Intense and focused on the core flavors, ending on the tannic side. Drink now through 2019. 1,085 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Cahill Lane Vineyard
review: An edgy style, with a salted peanut shell accent that leads to richer fig and apricot notes. Drink now. 1,260 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Cuvée Alyce
review: Dense, with crushed rock, mineral and graphite woven among dried blackberry and forest floor notes. Drying tannins. Tastes tired and rustic. Drink now through 2018. 536 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Hansel Family Vineyards
review: Aromas of mint and black cherry are followed up by modest blackberry and toasty oak, finishing with moderate delicacy and length. Drink now. 76 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Seven Springs
review: Taut, focused and layered with red berry, cherry, cinnamon, wet stone and mineral notes that come together harmoniously on the impressively long and expressive finish. Best from 2018 through 2024. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Cuvée Ruth
review: Bright and lively, offering a cascade of pretty strawberry, raspberry, rose petal and white pepper flavors that come together harmoniously against powdery tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2024. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Cuvée Ruth
review: Lithe, with firm tannins underlying cherry and savory flavors on a medium-weight frame, expanding on the finish and lingering with gentle insistence. Best from 2018 through 2023. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley La Combe Verte
review: Bright and expressive, with firm tannins around a glowing core of raspberry, pomegranate and cherry flavors, shading the finish with hints of savory spices. Has presence and persistence on a sleek frame. Best from 2018 through 2025. 850 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Temperance Hill
review: Lithe, lively and supple, with pretty raspberry and strawberry flavors that retain their freshness. The finish dances against lightly nubby tannins. Best from 2018 through 2024. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Sojourner
review: Focused and expressive, with pomegranate, tea and spiced cinnamon flavors that build tension and tannins toward the firm finish. Best after 2018. 300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Cuvée Anne
review: Lithe, taut and vibrant, with pear, grapefruit and floral flavors, dancing deftly into a long finish. Drink now through 2019. 250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Cuvee Anne
review: A snappy white, with lively notes of nectarine and grapefruit that sail toward a crisp finish. Drink now. 490 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Clos des Oiseaux
review: Rather brooding, this is laced with earthy and savory accents, combined with dark plum and mineral notes that finish with firm tannins. Best after 2018. 275 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley La Combe Verte
review: Light and zippy, with pretty green pear and floral flavors on a lively frame. Drink now through 2019. 490 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Firm and chewy, smoky and steely, with taut blackberry and licorice flavors pushing against the texture and finishing with intensity. A pretty good red trapped under formidable tannins. Best after 2018. 650 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Freedom Hill
review: Opens with a burst of floral raspberry fruit, then tightens up and turns rather taut and earthy. Drink now through 2019. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Freedom Hill
review: Firm and chewy, featuring taut tannins and earthy flavors that push aside the narrow beam of dark berry flavor, finishing with deftness. Best after 2018. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Royal
review: Exotic and smoky, with plenty of richness. Upfront with its ripe peach and apple flavors, backed up by lots of pepper and spice.  Drink now through 2010. 110 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark
review: A ripe, powerful white, integrating melon, grass and grapefruit notes with a rich texture and a solid backbone of acidity. Not overtly oaky, yet there's an attractive smoky, toasty component. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2001.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Classique
review: A rich, ripe and robust version, featuring flavors of melon, dried apricot and quince, with plenty of smoky notes. The spicy finish shows some creamy accents. Drink now through 2017. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Hochsulz
review: A crunchy, vibrant layer of red peach flavors overlays a firm foundation of mineral and spice. Try as an aperitif. Drink now. 375 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Kranachberg
review: Shows plenty of fresh herbal notes to the green apple, melon and peach flavors, with a luscious mouthfeel and a lively spiciness on the crunchy finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Trockenbeerenauslese Südsteiermark
review: Fresh sweetie, with interesting flavors of candied citrus, mulled spice and grapefruit. Lacks a bit of focus in the end but still enjoyable. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2010. 105 cases made.

name: Morillon Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark
review: An unadorned treatment of Chardonnay, showing apple, quince and lemon flavors supported by a juicy structure and minerally finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Muskateller Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark
review: Perfumed aromas, with peach and gooseberry flavors. Plenty of spice on the finish. Drink well-chilled as an aperitif. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Classique
review: Tangy white, with kiwi and gooseberry flavors, flanked by fennel and spice. Finishes with tangerine notes. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Royal
review: Ripe, with good melon and mineral notes. Smooth, with vanilla pastry notes on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Grauburgunder Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark
review: Spicy, with pineapple and tropical fruit flavors, and buttery notes on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 416 cases made.

name: Muskateller Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark
review: A lively burst of floral and grape flavors renders this medium-bodied white fresh and attractive. Perfect for summer picnics. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Muskateller Südsteiermark
review: Fragrant and elegant, this Muscat matches the pretty side of the varietal with a light, fresh structure and lovely balance, finishing with a grapefruit peel aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Classique
review: Stone, green peach and mineral flavors dominate, with creamy, spicy touches on the finish.  Drink now. 6,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Edition
review: Meringue, lime and stone flavors mix well in this medium-bodied white.  Drink now. 2,100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Hochsulz
review: Flavors of peach, stone and mineral notes dominate, with tropical flavors on the spicy finish.  Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Weissburgunder Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark
review: Compact and unevolved, the aromas and flavors are a touch blunt today, with fine structure, smooth texture and good density of flavor. Clean and refreshing finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2001.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Classique
review: Very appley-tasting, with some cider notes and a spicy finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Muskateller Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark
review: Medium-bodied, with a floral aroma and herb and mineral flavors.  Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Obegg
review: Shows smoky and chalky accents to the white fruit flavors. Cloying finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Obegg
review: Quite ripe, with candied tropical fruit flavors. Buttery notes on the finish.  Drink now. 10 cases imported.

name: Morillon Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Grassnitzberg
review: This has a ripe, buttery cast to it, with modest pear and ripe apple flavors and a soft finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 416 cases made.

name: Weissburgunder Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark
review: Dilute, with simple herbal and green peach flavors. Drink now.

name: Weissburgunder Qualitätswein Trocken Südsteiermark Grassnitzberg
review: Mature aromas and candied flavors dominate this awkward white. 585 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Solomon Hills Vineyard
review: Complex, with a rich mix of savory berry, cherry, fresh earth, anise and floral leathery scents that are very compelling, ending with a long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2011. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Garys' Vineyard
review: Spicy floral, wild berry and black cherry fruit has an earthy mineral edge and soft, fine-grained tannins, making this enjoyable now. Drink now through 2012. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Rancho Ontiveros Vineyard
review: Fragrant, with delicate, spicy, fresh earth, herb and sassafras notes that are complex, if on a modest scale. Drink now through 2010. 75 cases made.

name: Viognier Paso Robles Dreaming In The Moonlight
review: Tangy citrus and peach flavors are on a modest scale, but this has zingy acidity and a refreshing light body. Drink now. 110 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County Cargasacchi Jalama Vineyard
review: Marked by taut dill, sour cherry, mineral and sage notes that come up dry and tannic. Drink now through 2011. 400 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Paso Robles Bud
review: A candied quality to the red fruit flavors doesn't mingle well with the bitter, herbal, green-tinged note that dominates this tannic wine. 125 cases made.

name: Shiraz Wellington La Cave
review: Mature, but still has guts, with dark currant, coffee, prune and cocoa notes that rumble through the muscular finish. For fans of the style. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Pinotage Wellington La Cave
review: Shows a heavy layer of toast, along with thick plum sauce and cough syrup notes. A bit clumsy in the end. 1,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Clos Pepe Vineyard
review: Fresh clay and earth notes mingle with tangy cherry and berry flavors, with crisp tannins and an herbal, drying finish. Drink now. 50 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Fresh and appealing for its pure pear, quince and spice flavors. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Muscat Hunter Valley-Rutherglen
review: Sweet and spicy, with cherry and prune to balance the deep, rich, exotic spice flavors, finishing fresh and lively despite the sweetness and alcoholic grip. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Verdelho Hunter Valley
review: Tangy with fresh lime and orange peel flavors, finishing bright. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Malbec Columbia Valley
review: Bright and jazzy, with a distinct floral and cedar quality to the juicy currant fruit, finishing soft but with a prickle of tannins as the flavors linger. Drink now through 2012. 198 cases made.
